review_body: the rooms are dirty and not maintained. The Common areas & Meeting space is under renovation and they will be lovely when done but the rooms are sub-par. pricey for what you get. be sure to ask about all the extra fees they tack on to published room rate. Staff is not always friendly. Alleged ocean view is a long way away thru the other buildings and not worth additional charge. Kona rooms are the worst. Noisy, small, sometimes smelly, poorly maintained. Feels like a Motel 6. the only thing missing is the sani strip on the toilet. it is conveniently located near Ala Moana Shopping center. I used to stay there for business because it was so convenient but after the last visit, it is time to move on.

The rooms are very small, with only a double bed. Rooms were dirty, and couldn’t even fit an open suitcase on the floor. The pool is terrible, don’t be fooled by the photos on the website, it looks bigger and nicer online. We asked if we could pay for an upgraded room because the one we were given was horrible, and we had just got engaged, however they wouldn’t let us change rooms. Long walk to Waikiki, with nil access to free shuttles. For the same price/ cheaper you can stay at Ohana East on wakikki, which is in a better location, bigger and nicer rooms and beds and includes free shuttles to Ala Moana.If you are a young couple or family (especially from Australia) please do not stay here.

I and my husband simply enjoyed staying at this hotel. It is next to the Ala Moana Shopping mall which made it very convenience for us to get out of the hotel. Also, the hotel is next to Waikiki, literally right across the bridge. The staff at the Ala Moana were very helpful. There's even a scuba diving shop, a car rental, starbucks, and convenience store inside of the hotel. I an my husband did some scuba diving with ODA Scuba Store there. I think the scuba store really adds a nice touch to the hotel's image. We are looking forward to coming back again next year and staying at the Ala Moana Hotel. I highly recommend this hotel.

We cannot thank the team enough for an amazing stay! The reception team are fantastic. The team were able to get us a room after a long early flight from las vegas. Its a true pleasure to have stayed! 5 star service on check in. Our room was amazing and the view breathtaking Thank you again!

The entire staff was very welcoming! In spite of all the renovations in progress our stay was undisturbed and very convenient as normal. We would not hesitate to return as usual every year. We would recommend your hotel to everyone.

I stayed in here many times in the past when it was under different management and now I am shocked beyond shocked that such a rotten to the core poorly managed hotel could even continue operating. When I got here they told me for the first time ever that my room was subcontracted so I could not ask for amenities. They gave me a 24 hours service number. Fine, but the service number is not 24 hours. It is closed and if you contact them they take 72 hours to respond. I need a blanket right now. This room has no blanket and because of the pandemic all the stores nearby are closed and I can't even go out and buy one. Another thing is that the so-called concierge told me the beach ACROSS THE STREET was closed only to cars but not individuals. How could he not know what the main attraction of the hotel was? I went there and of course it was closed to individuals. The security kicked me out right away. Why did this hotel concierge not know such a basic thing?  I just checked in so who knows what other weird things I will encounter.

We stayed the last 2 nights at this hotel during our 10 night stay in Hawaii.The hotel was chosen due to its close proximitely to Ala Moana Center for last minute shopping. From the second floor its a short walk across the car park and into the mall. You will find a supermarket Foodland Farms as well as many bars restaurants and mostly high end retail stores. This is the largest open air mall in the world.A 15 minute walk away is Wards Villiage where we had a fantastic Vietnamese Fusion meal at Piggy Smalls.We chose a room with a partial ocean view which was located on the 21st floor of the newer Waikiki Tower. There is a small balcony with a table and two chairs.Bed, pillows and room was comfortable. I thought that the tea and coffee supplies were light on and could have been more generous.Room was modern and clean.Bathroom is small but quite functional.There is some pool maintenance and lobby renovations occuring which didn't impact us at all. I heard no noise and didnt plan on using the pool. We were advised by email in advance of this maintenance work.On the top floor of this building is the excellent restaurant Prime Steak and Seafood with excellent views of the area including the ocean. Do get up there for happy hour where food and drinks are discounted from 4:30pm. It gets very busy so do up early.Overall a very good experience.

Staff was very pleasant, room was clean and neat. Minor inconveniences due to remodeling construction in the lobby, but well planned to minimize inconveniences. I wish they would offer Hawaiian Miles like before.

My wife and I stayed at the hotel on our last trip to Honolulu. It was a nice hotel with a decent location and price. The rooms were a bit dated, but clean. I would recommend this hotel to anyone interested in a quality hotel at a fair price.

Hotel is in a great location near Walmart an awesome mall and the beach and Marina... But the hotel was under construction no pool access had to get towels from the lobby. Giving it a 3 because I'm not sure what it really looks like everything was behind a board.. rooms are kinda small but some has a great view

We stayed for our daughters prom awsome stay. I was doing all the centerpieces for the prom and had alot of baggage they were more then helpful getting it to the ballroom and back upstairs then to the car when we check out

Rooms are little on small side, but I didn't mind it. The Hotel staff is amazing and quick to help if you need it. The (included in my rate) breakfast with fresh custom made eggs in the morning is nice.Walking distance to many restaurants and beach area. It is very next to Ala Moana mall.

Loved our stay at ala moana. The location is great next to shopping mall and other family activities. Their customer service was amazing as well. Easy check in and check out, we arrived later in evening so slot of the restaurants were closed but their store was open so we got snacks for the room and it was reasonably priced.

From the beginning of our stay to the end it was great! The staff were very professional. They worked in a quick timely matter. They always had a smile on their face and just seemed happy. We really enjoyed our stay and plan on going back!!!

It's always challenging performing renovations while remaining in operation. It was my experience that this was handled very well by the hotel even if at sometimes the contractors may have not paid attention to the unnecessary noise they were generating.

I really like the Ala Moana and have stayed their several times mostly for business. That being said the hotel is lovely and the location is perfect. You have great access to the mall which I love. It's roughly a mile from the action of Wakiki. It is currently under renovations which was a bit distracting but the employees really did their best to accommodate their guests during the construction. I always like staying there.

Short break to recharge and relax. Enjoyed the shopping, restaurants, activities golf and spas. Shopping expensive due to dollar but all items purchased were those styles and brands not available at home.

It is always a disappointment. I have reviewed this hotel before and I think I was too generous. I am always put in the Kona tower. My boss is always upgraded to the Waikiki tower. Same type of reservation made at the same time. The rooms are small. The shower is only good for 5 foot or shorter people. Starbucks is a plus, so is the little store. That is the 2 rating. The rest of the hotel is a zero. Renovations to lobby started this week, but the rooms are what really need the work.

This location is convenient to everything and the staff is top notch. You can walk to the mall for a variety of food or souvenirs. You could also catch the trolley into town for a low price. Can't wait to return.

Easy check-in, great location and security, easy check-out. Location being the top reason for staying here, close enough to Waikiki, close to ala moana shopping, very easy to self-park. When we did use Uber the pick-up was at the front entrance.

Great location, comfortable, clean rooms. Will continue to return and stay at the Ala Moana Hotel. Customer service is excellent. Staff friendly and ready to help you. Starbucks in the lobby is a great addition.

We always enjoy our stay at the Ala Moana. Friendly staff always willing to help out...close to everything....great Buffett breakfast at the Plantation Cafe...they also have a star bucks now which is great for early morning coffee.

We had a room on the 22nd floor. It was spacious and clean and the service was great. We had a nice view of the ocean although it was obstructed with other high buildings. The Ala Moana Mall being attached is a nice plus if you like to shop. And the rates were about $100 a night lower than a lot of the hotels on the Waikiki Beach strip. And downtown Honolulu and Waikiki Beach are only a short drive/bus ride/taxi/Uber, away.

Shopping center conveniently located next door. The beach is just across the street and plenty of restaurants to choose from a few steps away. Starbucks is in the lobby. We always make this hotel our first choice when visiting Honolulu!

The hotel is OK. Room was small and dated. Amenities in the lobby were nice, and the proximity to the convention center were great. It was convenient being next to the mall which provided multiple restaurants and fast food type establishments for a quick bite.

Hotel is great location, good front desk service, and nice view. Cleanliness of room is poor. There were crumbs and someone's retainer on the floor, hairs in the shower and smell in the bathroom. I had to spray sanitizer while there. Stayed in 2 rooms and both had the issues with the bathroom. Noise from room above can be bothersome too.

Hotel is clean as well as the room we were in. Balcony door was sealed so no fresh air possible. Could be to prevent jumpers as this has happened before in Honolulu, but this is just a guess. Staff was courteous and friendly. Check in was quick and was easy to park when checking in. Parking is expensive ($30/night), but it’s expensive everywhere in Honolulu. Breakfast buffet was also expensive at $22/person, so we skipped that.Hotel is right next to the Ala Moana mall which was convenient for us since we could walk to a huge selection of restaurants there.One big peeve was the bed pillows proved were much smaller than a standard bed pillow. It made sleeping difficult since if you turn over in your sleep, your head rolls off. Then you have to reposition the pillow, by then, you’re awake. Since quality of sleep is important to us, the pillows were not pleasant. If you plan to book this hotel, you should consider bringing your own pillows. This one thing is why I rated overall at four stars.

Rooms need to be Renovated/Updated along with Linens and Doors and the Static Pressure of Elevators going up and down you feel the hum/rumble in the Room. Also the door slamming and hearing water running between walls.

I stayed here for a conference. The "group rate" was advertised with their breakfast buffet, but when I went in the morning the staff announced that it was going to be $25 per person. I figured this may be a mistake, so I asked the front desk. They informed me that the buffet would be $18 per person. While waiting in line to speak with the desk, I saw that on Hotels.com, the same room with breakfast was the same price I had paid. Upon speaking with the manager, he refused to honor the lower price, and told me I must book the room right there and then on my app. I started doing this, and he sent me to the back of the line. upon speaking with him again, he said he would call me in a few hours, and there would be no need to change rooms. After lunch they called me demanding I march down to the front desk to "check in and check out" I didnt have time to do this, so I will be disputing with my credit card.See ya

My partner and I stopped at the Mantra Ala Moana for 1 night in feb 2020 as a stop over. Being an Accor member- the hotel staff went above and beyond to ensure we had a comfortable stay including an early check in at 8am with no fees attached. Next door to a large shopping centre and only a short walk to Waikiki central. Would highly recommend.

Great hotel! Beautiful rooms excellent staff who were very helpful. Well appointed rooms. The location is close to Wikiki and downtown attractions.The hotel is close to the harbor and the Ala Moana shopping center.

Well located and convenient for everything.The room was very clean and everyone was extremely professional and friendly except some of Bell desk staffs and need to some improvement. The checkin wait was too long and we did not impressed with standing more than 5 minutes.

This is one of the most convenient convention center hotels I've stayed at. The proximity to the Ala Moana Center makes it easy to grab dinner after convention close, without an added rideshare or taxi cost, the nearby Target makes it easy to stock up your room, and the well appointed room including fridge and microwave make DIY meals easy. If that's not your thing, the onside restaurants and shops are convenient and tasty.

Great bellman services and check in, with a surprise upgrade to a higher floor suite with awesome views. The Signature Restaurant on the 36th Floor had a fabulous happy hour menu, with great service, sunset views, entertainment and food.

When I say "on a budget," everything's relative. It's not the cheapest, but you do get good value, relatively speaking. Shout out to Iwalani at the front desk - she is the best!! Talk about genuine warmth and excellent customer service. I recommend the Waikiki Tower. Also recommend getting into their rewards program, Mantra Plus.The key advantages of this hotel is location and convenience: easy walk (maybe 10 min.) to the Ala Moana beach - I prefer it to Waikiki Beach, which is much more crowded; easy walk across a walkway to the Ala Moana Center - a huge mall that has everything, including 3 amazing food courts and various restaurants/eateries; a restaurant for breakfast on the ground floor; a nice steak restaurant - which has other options besides steak - on the 36th floor; Starbucks, souvenir shop, and mini-mart; its own parking garage that is easy to access.The rooms are nice, beds are comfortable, mini-fridge AND microwave in my room, the AC was effective, everything worked well. I got a corner room this time, which was a bit on the smaller side, but I didn't mind since it was still nice. My only complaint is they need to get rid of some of their older sheets. The bedsheet had a lipstick stain on one side (eww), so I slept on the other side of the king bed.Finally, this hotel does NOT have paper thin walls, as some of the larger chain hotels do. I slept well in this hotel, and I was here during a very busy time of year - Chinese New Year Day AND the Hula Bowl!!

This hotel was in an incredible location - staff were friendly and very professional, just like you would expect from such a lovely hotel. The only thing missing is a pool bar.We would definitely try to book a larger room in the future for a family of 4, but would absolutely stay here again!

It was my second long-term stay here, so I had an idea of what to expect. It's a very busy place with tour groups and airline crews and conventions, and the reception staff are a bit jaded, so don't expect a warm aloha welcome whenever you have an inquiry for them. I learned to avoid them. Happily, the hotel doesn't charge a "resort fee," as many others in Hawaii do.The Ala Moana shopping center is a few minutes' walk away for your browsing/strolling/window shopping needs. During the holidays there are music & dance performance by local schools and groups in the atrium. The food court is outstanding, with an international selection to choose from. For self-catering, there is a big Foodland supermarket as well with a big deli section a la Whole Foods. There is a trolley bus that can take you to Waikiki beach for $2, exact change needed. Besides the mall, the appeal for me is the proximity to Ala Moana beach park across the street. A nice place for a morning jog or a stroll to see the sunset.The hotel itself is a bit dated, with inefficient elevators and parking garage equipment. The garage is dingy and spaces are scarce if you arrive too late in the evening. The gym is well-equipped, with wet and dry saunas, if they're working.

Clean room, easy parking, and well located. Having Ala Moana Shopping Center next door is a plus. Convenient for shopping and myriad of dining options with local flair. Easy walk to beach, park, and boat harbor.

The Ala Moana Hotel was great! We arrived & were surprised to find we had been upgraded to a suite! Staff was outstanding, service could not have been better, room was clean and the Signature Steak House on the 36th floor is not to be missed! In the heart of Waikiki, across the street from the the beautiful Ala Moana Park & Beach and next door to all the shopping you could imagine. Perfect place to stay!!

Great location next to shopping and restaurants. Very clean rooms, well maintained. This is my go-to hotel for inter island travel at a reasonable cost. I prefer the Waikiki tower with its regular lanais.
user_name:
Frank G
Kailua Kona, United States

review_body: The bed is not very comfortable. I've stayed at different hotels and softness of the bed as well as extra pillows makes a comfortable stay. Bell boys are just standing outside but not really very helpful. None ask if they can help with our luggage or anything. We tried the breakfast buffet once and that was it.I expected the food to be a bit hotter but it wasn't so we went to find breakfast elsewhere for the rest of our stay. Staff forgot to even give us washcloths one day. Sofa bed was set up even when we didn't need to which cramped the room for space.I like the location of the hotel which is an easy walk to the Ala MOana Center for shopping, food court and the Trolley which we access daily to go around the island. Its also close to community transportation.

The room was incredibly small, for an incredibly large price. It was pretty clean, and the staff was friendly, and the location was good, right next to an immense mall and near a bus line, which was good since we didn't rent a car (parking is $30 per day there). Check in and check out were quick and smooth. Besides the value, the thing I was most disappointed in was the concierge service. We had several hours free in the middle of the day and I asked what she recommended we do. She literally said "this time of day, nothing. There is nothing you can do." I guess because there were no Expedia tours available, she was unable or unwilling to think past that. She didn't even mention the mall right next door, or the Honolulu Zoo (that's what we did, plenty of time for that), or the Waikiki Aquarium, or any one of several other smaller trips - there is a ton to do there. I was shocked, I don't feel that a concierge should ever tell you there is nothing you can do.

So I booked thru Hawaii airlines, so our room is not run by the Mantra but LSI.Hotel has great eateries, good facilities & very good general store.The reception area is super busy all the time with all the airline hostesses and pilots staying here.Our view was divine, the room a good size as was the balcony.Here’s my negatives: The pillows where so awful, it was like squares of foam covered in a pillow case. I suffered terribly. I think it was packing foam seriously!The toilet sounded like I was sitting on a china plate, I kept waiting for the smash. The toilet roll on a little stand that was just stupid. Not attached to anything. Toilet didn’t flush properly The shower is for short people. Prehistoric taps that where just plain ridiculous. They leaked water constantly. Room 2315The LSI team don’t clean daily we where there 3 days never saw a cleaner, bins overflowing. The transfer bus must park on the street. So had to drag our luggage our to the street while bellboys stood around waiting on mercedes and Tesla drivers. Using the driveway as a bragging station of expensive cars. Not for practical reasons like ohhhh paying customers who use transfer services!!!Reception staff not fussed about helping. Good points. Nice view, great location for the shopper I am. Lots of transport options about a $10 Lyft ride to down town Waikiki. Busses in a easy walk.The shopping centre is the draw card for me. Would I stay again, yeah as it was nice just not maintained well and find the showcase driveway rude and unprofessional.

Great location, a short walk from Ala Moana Beach which is our favorite beach for relaxing!! Just a mile and a half walk to Waikiki Beach. Starbucks in the hotel with a friendly staff. A nice pool. Convenient store located in hotel for snacks and food. Great steakhouse on the 36th floor.

We booked a Junior Suite with Oceanview for stay from 28Dec'19 to 02Jan'20 for girls getaway holiday. I am giving this an average rating as this property was below my expectations. The room had 2 doublebeds and barely any space to turn around or place your suitcases. The partial oceanview was blocked by 2 tall high rise buildings and had a side view of the ocean if you peered down the right side of the balcony.The bathroom shower was mouldy and the drain was always clogging up. The cleaning lady was elderly and looked extremely unhappy. She would not even greet us or respond to an Aloha. Overall the rooms were below average for the prices they charge.This hotel has access to the mall and Waikiki beach is a good walk of 15-20 mins. There is a Starbucks in the lobby and a Signature steakhouse on the 36th floor. No other restaurants around. They serve a daily buffet breakfast at the Plantation cafe in the same hotel which is quite good. The servers were friendly and pleasant ( especially Deb, Ariel & Heavenly ). For Tours & Activities, there is a Expedia travel agent by the frontdesk. Please book directly with the Tour operators. The charges for the activities here are slightly higher and this is the first time I was pressured to pay the Travel agent a tip for just booking Tour activities. This is unheard of, so it did not sit well with me and my friend even though we tipped. If and when I go back to Oahu, I will not be picking this property again. The front desk were friendly.

Stayed there this Dec, was my second stay at the Ala Moana. This time i was disappointed with my room. The room was in need of maintenance and a overall update. Honestly, the old tub and plumbing was long past due. The tub couldn't hold the water in. Tub itself was barely wide enough and I'm not big. Carpet was frayed. Pillows not comfortable and a couple of sheets and thin blanket was poor. Coffee was terrible, couldn't drink it. Staff as usual very accommodating. Public area are well kept up. My room felt like a prison cell, instead of a welcoming vacation room.

December 2019.On day #4 out of our 5 night stay, my wife and myself entered our room to find all our personal belongings were removed and we entered into a fully turned room without our personal property.We expressed this feedback with Guest Relations Manager Lawrence that evening.  He apologized and offered us food and drinks as a gesture.  When we returned to our room we asked to take him up on some water and food, and his reply was “I’m sorry everything is closed...”My wife and I knew we would arrive to the hotel at a late hour and our food/drinks were strategically laid out for us to eat that evening since we knew all concessions were closed. We were staying at this property under a medical emergency that involved our newborn. Disappointed that the manager offered to help and didn’t deliver, we decided the best thing to do was go back to the Hospital so my wife can pump and continue to provide breastmilk for our sick baby.On 12/14/19 Front Office Manager Joe had reached out to confirm that our room was mistakenly “checked out” around 2pm the day before.  This was confirmed through room lock audit. Joe mentioned that the assistance of the Director of Front Office Rena would need to be involved to make a decision on how this would be fixed. Director of Front Office mentioned that.“With the situation being as sensitive as it is, we wouldn’t extend/accommodate you for further disappointment... You are in a personal situation that our hotel staff is not making any easier for you and your situation.  At the rate of disappointment, we wouldn’t want to frustrate you further...” this conversation has been legally recorded. I would be more understanding if any damages, altercations, or any rule breaking were acted from our behalf. Never once did we raise our voice, cause a disruption or disrespected the staff when this all occurred. I’m understanding that service breaks happen, however my understanding is because of the negligence of a house keeper, it led to the loss of our personal items, then the hotel did not have a strategy to fix it and decided it was in their best interest to dismiss and inform us we were no longer welcome as their guests. Although the Director did approve a refund and delivered a breast pump to us at the hospital the next day, the thought process and execution in resolving is uncaring and flat out wrong as the burden and entirety of all service breaks were at fault from the staff at Ala Moana Hotel. A poorly written email was sent to me as an apology and gesture to replace our items from General Manager Glen Erickson. I returned his email taking him up on the gesture yet after 2 weeks he has ignored my response. Please beware in staying at this property. From my personal experience, if the staff makes a mistake (which I understand happens sometimes) they lack the capacity to help and will ask you to not be their guest and ignore you. It’s unfortunate that they can treat anyone this way, during the holidays, and while going through a medical emergency. A very cruel experience and just plain wrong on how to treat people.

Great location next to a major shopping centre. Open most days 9-9 so teenage daughter shopped throughout the day whenever we were home. Beach close by and a marina to. Took about 20-25 mins walk to Waikiki or $5.50 adults and $2.75USD up to 17 yo for all day bus til 3am the following morning. Felt very comfortable with kids going off together and very safe during the day. Happy hour on the top floor for the parents as no kid over 21 so was only beneficial to us. Took a room with 1 bedroom so separate room to sofa bed and kitchenette bit we had a bar fridge and microwave so sufficient to have our own space. Well worth the money. Beds super comfy and pool was fantastic also.

We stay at the Ala Moana every New Years Eve as we live on the Leeward shore of Oahu and don’t wish to drive home after our friends’ annual party in the city. We have NEVER had a problem checking in to the Ala Moana quickly and easily. This year was different - a 45 minute wait to get to the head of the very long line and then a 20 minute check in! We were told that the hotel has changed ownership to an Australian company (Mantra) and they have lengthy check in procedures and slow computer software. Clearly, the Australians don’t understand “Aloha”. Sadly, we have referred friends to stay at the Ala Moana but can no longer recommend it.

Enjoyed the beautiful weather & walking distance to great shopping & the beach! Went through a third party to book the hotel room - Delta Airlines. Will never do that again!! Room service was NOT included. Received a poor quality room. Guess it’s important to read the fine print. Lesson learned. Overall a fantastic vacation with wonderful site seeing tours! Recommend the Polynesian Culture Center as a must see!

Got this hotel as a last minute booking. It's a typical business hotel with limited stuff for families. It's a mile from Waikiki where is all the activities area and beaches. There is a daily parking fee. So if you are going for family vacation book early and try to get in Waikiki area.

I stayed here with my family over Christmas. It was great to have access to Ala Moana Shopping Centre via 2nd floor. The water and ice machine was also a bonus as we had been quite dehydrated with all the travelling. Rooms are cosy, would have preferred Queen-sized beds rather than double but there was no option for that. There was a microwave in the room. Some of the things to improve on:- to include some cutlery in the room & dishwashing liquid- quite a few dryers on Level 13 don't seem to be working which has caused a backlog and long waiting lineSome tips for travellers, apart from the shopping centre you could also venture out to Walmart, Ross for Less and Don Quijote (large supermarket where locals go to & has some eateries and is opened 24/7 including Christmas Day). They are all located quite close to the hotel.

Had to wait until 3.40 for check in even thought at 10 am they said it was possible to check in at 1pmWe had 3 rooms to check into and had arrived at 9 am so a waste of a day and an inconvenienceThe fourth room we had booked 10 months earlier for 3 adults and confirmed 3 adults and one week before leaving for Hawaii we phone to confirm all 4 room bookings with requirements of one with baby and one for 3 adults and on arrival we double checked but the father had to go and get the baby cot himself after waiting and waiting and the baby wanting to sleep. We confirmed the room for 3 adults 3 times at the reception -morning of our arrival next morning of their arrival 9 am and finally again at the check in of 3 pm for 3 adults but when we saw the room only 2 beds. I was not satisfied with the Manager’s explanation the that room with 2 beds can have 3 0r even 4 adults. Again waste of time and we did not get what we booked for 10 months earlier. At no time was there an explanation that the room was for 2 adults with 2 beds. Totally disappointed.

Had a very wonder stay and will be back in a few months.Only problem was the microwave oven wasn't working, but engineering did come and replace it. Very fast respond so I really appreciate the fast service.

The staff is extremely friendly and eager to make sure that you are happy with your stay. The room was clean and well stocked and you could not ask for a more convenient location. Very short walk to Ala Moana shopping center and restaurants.

It was a great stay, the staff were very accommodating and professional. They upgraded us to an ocean view room. We had ordered our daughter a birthday basket and it was in our room waiting for her in the room when we arrived. Thank you!

I made a mistake in booking dates when i made my initial reservations. The person at the Mantra check-in made it a non-issue. She went beyond the call to correct my errors and jokingly told my husband not to scold me for my error. She was so kind, funny and professional. She really made our stay a wonderful experience. I know customer service can be a thing of the past in the fast, online life we lead. But, its nice to know that the human touch is still alive and well at the Ala Moana hotel. I will definitely be back.

Stayed here whilst travelling alone to Hawaii. They hotel was very accommodating for that. Location was ideal right next to the Ala Moana Shopping centre, across the road from the Ala Moana Beach Park and within walking distance to Waikiki. Good facilities and friendly staff.

I checked in friendly staff. Gave me a room that's ready with was cool but room was not vacuumed well shower head was moldy. The staff could not clean or change the shower head so they gave me a different room. The room was fair the showerhead was still kinda moldy so I clean it my self. But the location is grate cause it's close to the mall that's the only up side.

When come here our stays are always comfortable, clean and courteous, only hotel for me and my family. Keep up the good work and let’s try to get a little more variety when it comes to breakfast, we usually stay for at least 3 nights and the breakfast was basically the same, other then that I love this place

Staff are amazing the facility is very clean and well maintained. The steak house has a great view and the food is fantastic. The bartenders take extremely good care of you. Valet was quick and painless longest wait was five minutes for my car.

seasonal rates are higher than usual. we booked during the xmas season and the honolulu marathon weekend. location is excellent, no hassle with traffic or parking, like in waikiki areas. close to shopping and food outlets.

Christmas shopping at the Ala Moana Mall, largest in the state. Good restaurants, a social scene, wonderful shopping. Hotel was clean, convenient, room was excellent. Service was all very friendly. Some issue with homeless in lobby. Hard to control in such a public and busy place.
user_name:
Gunner M
Kamuela, Hawaii, United States

review_body: Small but nice modern rooms (Kona Tower)...comfortable and close to the mall and many eateries...short ride (by bus, taxi, Lyft, etc) to the center of Waikiki...excellent staff and service...Full-service Starbucks in lobby area...also serve beer/wine...

At first I was a little disapointed when I heard I did not have 2 queen beds. but once a got to the room it was awesome!! My family kept asking me how did I pull this off? I told them I had nothing to do with it; it was all on the hotel and if I would have known I would have booked a longer stay. Hosekeeping was on it any time we needed something. All future trips to Oahu we will be staying at Ala Monana Hotel!

Everything at the hotel went smoothly except when we tried to take a bath about 9 p.m., the water was cold. The longer I ran the water the colder it got. We ended up taking cold showers. The funny thing is that on Sunday afternoon there was plenty of hot water. It seems that no one turned on the fire to heat up the water. It appears the company that runs the hotel cannot provide enough hot water for its guests.

I started staying at the Ala Moana in the mid 1970's, so the place is very familiar and comfortable to me. It is nice to see the hotel keep up with the times, Front desk staff very pleasant. Junior Suite exceeded our expectations. Room was clean and well appointed. Very convenient location and with out the hassle of Waikiki. Plenty to see and do at Ala Moana Shopping Center next door.

Location can't be beat. Rooms okay. Refrigerator and microwave come in handy. Expensive but convenient little store for snacks, souvenirs, etc in lobby is great. Free newspaper at bell desk every day. Parking is very expensive, but car not really needed for too many days.

The hotel room I stayed in was definitely dated compared to other hotels I have stayed at but the price was not too bad for staying in Waikiki. Smaller room than what is normally able to fit 4 people but when you are in Hawaii you're not going to be spending much time in the hotel room! I found it convenient to be located right next to the Shopping Center as it was easy to walk to and from when getting lunch or dinner. The bathroom was an OK size but the shower head was very low. I did not have any issues with it as being only 5'3" but I can't imagine it would be easy to shower if you are taller than 5'6".

Our room was on the 17th floor. The room smelled like sweat and feet when we first entered. Just smelled musty. The walls are thin and we could hear our neighbors. Its okay during the day but just annoying when you wake up from your sleep to the moaning and groaning from the next room. The bathroom could use some deep cleaning. Maybe scrub off all the black stuff off the shower (see pictures). It’s a convenient hotel due to proximity to shopping and dining (Ala Moana Shopping Center).

You will enjoy this hotel being right next to shopping, Ala Moana Beach and downtown Waikiki! The Signature Steak House has a wonderful Happy Hour overlooking the the yacht club and you can see outriggers and beach from atop the high rise(36 floors up!)Check it out and if you are local they do offer kamaaina rates.

This hotel was such a delight to stay at! I was at this hotel for a conference, and the service here was really great. Overall, I had no issues with my room and I really enjoyed the hotel’s proximity to the beach, the conference center as well as the various shops and restaurants around town. The location made the hotel such a great place to be. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the area.

No ka oi,always recommend. Dis has always been da choice once da OHANA had more ez time Fa come n go at anytime tru da day or da night Fa anyting u like do eat shop sight see go beach visit da OHANA or jus Fa hangout wherever or whateva!!!!

If you have the chance, try the Ala Moana Hotel just outside Waikiki. It is restful and convenient without the constant hassle of Waikiki. You'll have your private beach, a shopping center with plenty of restaurants right next door and Waikiki still within walking distance. The hotel staff is the old fashion kind that ooze courtesy and knowledge. If you need anything or want information about anything, they are there to help. All of the hotel managers have the same concern for their guests and their employees. Everyone there work as a single entity, the satisfaction of their guests. Thank you for a very pleasant stay.

Flight Cancelled by Airline due to maintenance issue and rescheduled for the following morning. Airline provided voucher for this hotel. 1,000 room hotel close to Ala Moana park, beach and major shopping mall right next door. Basic room a bit on the small side but well furnished. Bathroom small. Views of the city toward Waikiki and partial park and ocean . Small balcony with two chairs. Standard microwave and dorm sized frig. A bit pricey at $194 per night for the basic room but it's Honolulu! Staff - friendly.

We would not recommend to stay at this hotel. It is right next to a huge mall and has an extreme turnover of guests.We booked a room with city view and ended in a handicapped accessible room with a view on the backyard. The room was clean beside a trace of toothpaste on a towel from the previous guests, but other that that it was just a bold room and the bathroom fittings were loose and one was even falling off. Really bad considering a prize of over 200$ a night!

Stayed a weekend, everything was so clean and organized and a really good value for a Kamaaina special. The free breakfast buffet was literally amazing- w Starbucks coffee! The staff was stellar and the rooms spotless. A deep bathtub for soaking, a sunset view. And that was the cheap room! Drawback: parking garage was old and smelly, and the cable tv was minimal... recommend valet parking for $5 more a day and don’t stay inside and watch tv!!! Aloha!

Hotel is in a great location, close to dining, beach, shopping, and with easy access. Parking is underground, and compared to many other Waikiki hotels, it has spacious parking stalls and driveway. Personnel were friendly, courteous, and accomodating. Our room in the Waikiki Tower was spacious, clean, and had a nice view.

The hotel entrance is impressive and sets the tone for your stay. We were early for check in so placed our bags with the porters and found one of the many comfy couches. We had a couple of hours wait but then were able to get into our room early. Staff at the hotel in the main were very helpful and friendly, especially in the breakfast restaurant. The concierge desk sadly wasn't as helpful, giving us inaccurate information for a booking he made which meant we missed our tour. We were rebooked at no charge for another day. The rooms are comfortable but not large; they were clean and neat. The pool area is a great way to spend a day, and staff were very pleasant on each occasion. Proximity to the lagoon, Ala Moana park, restaurants, public transport, and the Ala Moana Centre make this an excellent place to stay.

Upon arrival to this property we were very impressed by the grand lobby. Very grand. However, our room was an opposite picture. The state of the room was very outdated. The television was crooked on the stand and could not be corrected. One area of the ceiling showed signs of old water damage. The paint and ceiling material was buckled up and raised as well as showing a black substance in the corner areas of this space. Then there was the mattress. Quite literally the worst we have ever slept on. We both woke up with major body aches that lasted all day from the poor quality mattress. Having said that, the staff was very friendly and helpful and check in was easy. We arrived late after a very long day therefore we did not ask to change rooms as we just needed to sit and relax. We only were staying in Honolulu for one night. If we had booked additional nights at this property we would have canceled them a made reservation elsewhere.

This is my forth time staying here. I had hoped it would have gotten better but it gets worse every time. Beds are in need of new mattress, the two pillows are flat and towels are flimsy. I wasn't allowed to use a luggage cart but could use bell service if I wished! They're a tourist hotel, so they don't really care about you. There are 1000s of other people to stay there.

Very dated property. Needs to be upgraded/remodeled. Felt more like an old Holiday Inn/Motel 6. The towels were flimsy and didn't look clean. The pillows were marginal. There was no patio in my room, and the sliding glass door couldn't be opened.

Stayed here for just two nights and was happy with the hotel. Rooms are clean and a good size for myself. They provide a 2 in 1 shampoo/conditioner, body lotion and a soap bar. There was no water provided in the room. Elevators are a bit slow. Staff are nice and helpful. Great Starbucks in the lobby and a few shops. Also walking distance to the Ala Moana shopping mall with huge selection of stores! You walk through the car park on the second level and enter via the back of Macy’s. I think it’s a good option for a solo or business traveller. Didn’t see a lot of families there. Would stay again!

We stayed one night prior to boarding our cruise ship. The room was comfortable with a view of the city through to the coast. The hotel adjoins a large up market shopping centre and is within a short drive to the main area of Waikiki.

Ala Moana Hotel is always a fun place to stay. Located right in the heart of downtown and connected to the Ala Moana Shopping Center. A short walk over to the mall via the pedestrian bridge. They have a great buffet breakfast in the Plantation Cafe located in their lobby.

I stayed at the Ala Moana Hotel on a corporate rate. I wasn't expecting a resort experience, given the rate and given the location that is sort of urban grungy (try walking the Atkinson-Kapiolani area beyond Ala Moana mall, especially at night). My low expectations weren't even met. Parking for a few minutes in front to check-in, I got attitude from the valet staff (I opted for self-park, not valet). The self park lot was a grimy labyrinth with poor signage, rutted pavement and sewer smells near the exit. The elevator to the lobby from the parking garage was filthy and smelly. My room keys failed in the tower elevators repeatedly, requiring multiple replacements. My room in the "Kona Tower" was comically small - the smallest hotel room I've ever stayed in on four continents. It abounded in examples of underinvestment and neglect. Rusted fire sprinklers. A floor lamp with no working knob. An ice receptacle with grime/rust on the bottom. Dirt spots under the glass covering the multiple table tops. Dust on and rips in a lamp shade. Wall lamps hanging very visibly out of plumb. A lamp held together with tape. A shower control with no indication of hot or cold. A shower head covered with soap scum and grime. The one blanket on the bed was hardly any thicker than the sheet, and there were no additional linens provided. There was a big yellow stain on the blanket (urine?). The mattress was tired and unsupportive. The closet had those old school hotel-only hangers that are such a pain to use. And so on. It's amazing to me how many points of failure there were in just the room. It's like nobody *ever* does quality inspection on the rooms, or at least the lower price rooms. Or perhaps the management just doesn't care how run down and dirty the rooms are. As I said initially, I stayed on a low corporate rate and wasn't expecting a resort experience. However, I do take resort vacations and have stayed at properties run by Four Seasons, Pan Pacific, Waldorf Astoria, Hyatt, Marriott, InterContinental, Starwood, MGM, etc. This experience at Ala Moana Hotel ensures that I'll never consider the property for vacation travel. It is definitely below the bigger names in terms of quality and experience.

Stayed here because we were attending a conference held in a separate section of the Hotel. The lobby is very nice. There is a Starbucks, few shopping stores as well as a mini mart. There are plenty of cabs also that stay outside if you don’t want to use the bus or Uber. Room was small for two people, like stated in other reviews there wasn’t much room to sort our luggage. House keeping - we kept having issues with not replenishing the towels or leaving wash clothes. I really think all she did was make the beds, nothing else. Overall staff were okay, they always seem busy and rushed. This is a convenient area to stay in - there is a large mall connected to it with over 300 stores and a huge food court. The trolly/bus is also close by. The beach is a street over.

This hotel could not accommodate a family of four in a bed-room including luggage. It was bordering on a joke the way it unfolded. Rooms were not ready at the time of check in, and being cleaned even as we were checking in. Preference was given to business clients. "Mountain views" is a complete farce: The view we had was of another building including people's living arrangements -literally and figuratively-, but if you went into the far corner of the balcony you could just see the mountain. We were a large family group and none of the rooms were ready on arrival with preference given to late check out business clients - at 1pm and thereafter, well after check out of 11am and cleaning staff were doing their damn best to keep up. On the whole - it was like sleeping in an expensive tent. I love my family - but I do not enjoy having a roll-away bed jammed between two beds and no room for bags at all - treading, tripping over and just being sardined into a broom closet with no consideration for an appropriate size of room for a family. Customer service was bordering on ambivalent, trying to just put a band-aid on an arterial bleed and shove us in any room. At no time did I feel like a valued customer, more just duck shoved into any hole they could find. For a mantra - I am sorely disappointed. I have stayed at many Manta hotels' over the years and this one takes the cake for just abysmal.

Next to Ala Moana shopping center and city bus transportation hub. Clean, bright and comfortable rooms. Walk to Waikiki. Easy walk to the beach park. I always stay here when I visit Honolulu. Very convenient.

Interesting older Honolulu hotel. The room we had felt like a boutique hotel room - small and quaint. Really could not complain since Southwest covered the cost after their plane left, then returned to Honolulu. Nice location at the edge of Ala Moana Mall. Staff was surprisingly pleasant and professional during the stressful situation of a full airplane load of passengers arriving without ANY reservations. Big thumbs up from me.

The hotel is conveniently located. There is a bridge on the second floor which connects directly to Ala Mona Shopping Center (take the escalator up from the lobby). The hotel is not too far from the airport as well and within walking distance of Ala Moana beach park.Room was small, but very clean. And even though it was small there was LOTS of storage. We did a kama’aina special (we live in Hawai’i, just on a different island) and they waved the resort fee and parking was free which made our 3 night stay MUCH cheaper. The front desk staff was very friendly. One day we came back from a hectic day of things while a member of the housekeeping staff was cleaning our room and she allowed us to come in while she finished up and she was very pleasant too.There’s a small store on the lobby floor which might be open 24 hours. I never asked but they were opened very late when I needed to run down and grab toothpaste and open very early one morning when I passed it on my way to Starbucks (also conveniently located in the lobby).I would definitely stay again.

We were a family of 7 requiring 3 rooms. Booked, back in February 2019, thru Australian based Travel Agent and also sent personal e-mails to them requesting we all be located together ( same floor ) and advising one of our party was autistic so we asked for quiet rooms. We got email ack from them re requests being noted. We arrive 27 October to find 2 rms assigned on 34th Floor and 1 rm on the 22nd. When we mention our requests to be together advised by Lawrence Lum nothing noted on their system and perhaps we had only told Agent of our request. So it is our problem. Upon returning home sought out e-mails and want to thank ( not ) "Joyce " who in here e-mail of 5 October to us confirmed all "noted. Subsequently all located on lower ( noisy floor 14 ). All in all a shambles. 10th trip to Hawaii for us but first as family. First time we have stayed here and the last.

We stayed on a lower floor facing the parking lot of the shopping center. Cars parked on the upper deck would play their bass-pounding audio systems late at night, and the sound comes into the rooms. Also, there is lots of traffic noise. If you are a light sleeper, this place might not be for you.It is very convenient to bars, restaurants and area shopping, but parking is expensive and tight.

We arrived on the 29/9 from Sydney as we were boarding Ovation of the Seas the following day. On our arrival the clerk informed us we had been upgraded to a suite (Very exciting after a long trip) On entering the room we noticed it had 2 entry doors suggesting it had been two rooms at one time.The sofa bed and carpet in the living area was stained.There was no jug to boil water so we had to call housekeeping. We made a cup of coffee.There was no milk. We looked for teaspoons there were none. The pillows on the bed had seen better days as they were mishapen and lumpy.Later in the evening we stood on the balcony that overlooked a car park that was very busy with prostitutes coming and going.We settled down but I had to go to the bathroom during the night and when I turned on the light I was greeted with several cockroaches running over the bathroom sink. We went down for breakfast the next morning and after an average breakfast we were charged $36 USD. The foyer is very tired looking and grubby with the few shops in the foyer closing down. All in all very very disappointed.

We arrived from San Diego, after booking by Airbnb. The room was not reserved and no connection with the property owner. The reception took care about everything, managing the case, and taking care about us. In my opinion it’s something to thank them.At the same time Airbnb try to solve the problem, and gave us full refund.Thanks to Airbnb and to Ala Moana hotel.Very close to the hotel there is a very nice park, recommend !

So the day we were set to check in to the Ala Moana Hotel (for the first time) I read a review from a very unhappy traveler that said there was mold at the front desk air vent, on the carpet in front of his room and in his room. I was so nervous as we travel to Hawaii a lot and this was the first time staying at Ala Moana. When we checked in I really scrutinized the front desk area and did not see any mold. We were given a suite on the 17th floor and all the way down the long hallway to the end I checked the carpet for signs of mold...none. I gave the whole room a good once over and still no mold. I feel bad for the traveler that had this experience but I am happy to say that we are thrilled with the hotel. First off, our room is great. We love the living room/kitchen/dining room area with the huge sliding glass doors and the bedroom down the hall offers a very large bathroom, another refrigerator and microwave, a comfortable king sized bed and a large balcony with a table and chairs. Second, you are a skybridge walk away from world class shopping (and eating) at Ala Moana - ooo, aaah, oh wow! Ala Moana (if you've ever lived in Hawaii you know what that is). And Third, Magic Island is right across the street. A great park that has been cleaned up quite a bit. Waikiki beach is an easy walk, maybe half a mile. If that's too far for you there are bikes, uber, taxi's, trolley's and busses that can get you there very easily. And, just in case the reviewer with the mold issue is reading this, we flew in from Japan so we understand how it feels after a long flight. Our flight landed at 7am and we were not able to check in early. We left our luggage with the folks in the lobby and I have to say, they were friendly and helpful. Hopefully you will give this hotel another chance because it really is delightful.

Got a room with Ocean view and loved waking up every morning to the sunrise! Staff are very friendly and helpful! Central to all our needs, loved everything about it, especially the fact that its right next to Ala Moana Centre! Starbucks downstairs, buffet breakfast and a corner store for your needs. Will be staying here again on our next visit.

I love staying here because the hotel staff is always very helpful and friendly. I have stayed here for work and for vacation. The hotel is located next to a great location to shop. Everything is close by! I will be back! Mahalo!

How can people be oblivious to mold in plain site. I checked in after a long day of flights, and waking up I immediately saw mold in my bathroom and reported it. But the new room I was assigned had an even worse mold issue right outside the door in the public hallway in plain site to everyone and anyone. Why doesn't Matt, the GM, do anything about it? He says he does weekly inspections of the hotel. How do you miss mold in plain site and do nothing to mediate it? Didn't see it? How about look at the air vent directly above front desk where every guest checks in? What is that discoloration by the vents? Gee....didn't notice that either? I zoomed out so you can see that was indeed taken at the front desk. Got my money back from the hotel and was left to find another hotel in the middle of Waikiki so ended up having to spend more money. Have received no communication from Mantra Hotels about the issue I already raised to them privately on social media. Now maybe they will do something about it.

This lady staff named Cynthia shouldn't be assigned in this task. RUDE. Was simply asking how much the taxi rate was to the airport. She replied by saying that theres no flat rate and I need to call the cab company, with no courtesy attitude at all. She should not work as a customer service.

If you don't need to be exactly on the Waikiki beach, then this is perhaps the best hotel in order to find all kind of services as the Ala Moana mall is connected to the hotel. Still short distance to the beach and Waikiki. And the Hawaii convention Centre is just around the corner. The hotel is goos quality and clean, and in Hawaiian price level good value for money. The room was nice and well equipped, everything worked fine and the bed was comfortable. Breakfast was slightly boring, but good enough.

That is what you get a convention hotel. It’s big. Spread out. Some rooms have nice views. Good meeting rooms. Does not feel like hawaii. Food options are close to nothing. But they are connected to the mall so you can walk across the bridge to plenty of dining. I recommend staying five minutes away in Waikiki and taking an Uber to convention meetings. Have fun @nickellfamilytravel

Enjoyed two nights here on the way to Mexico.We were able to have a good nights rest with very comfortable beds in a nicely decorated and clean room. We were really pleased with accessibility to shops, eating places and the beach. A very enjoyable swim and stroll along the beach assisted us in recovering from jet lag.

If you want your choice of places to eat and shop without jumping into the car - this is the place to stay. The ala Moana mall is connected and it has easy in and out ways without the Waikiki traffic. Would recommend if you don’t want the resort hustle but still be close to activities.

The Ala Moana Hotel is the ideal spot for shopping in the area. It is also relatively easy to get to Waikiki and surrounding parks. The rooms are adequate and clean. However, the customer service was horrible on multiple visits. We live in Hawaii and needed to travel to Oahu from an outer island for multiple medical procedures; however, the staff at the hotel were not understanding or caring of our situation. Overall, the hotel is adequate but if you are looking for customer orientated stay then I would recommend staying some place else.

I haven’t stayed at this hotel for over a year. We arrived half an hour before check in time and the line was wrapped around the lobby like a Disneyland ride line. It was crazy long...it took over an hour to check in. The room itself was the wrong room requested, but it was quickly changed thankfully. The accommodations were ok. The bed was very hard and they give you small square pillows instead of standard pillows for a king size bed. It wasn’t a comfortable stay. Not sure I’d come back.

Very disappointed with our stay. Room clean but very dated. Bed hard and pillows smallest I have ever seen. They are more like sofa cushions and very hard. Spares were exactly the same. Hot water in shower could only be achieved by turning faucet on full bore. Safe had flat battery so unable to be used. Noise from Shopping Centre car park very loud as appears to be meeting place for youths overnight. Staff very courteous although long line for check in. Location good next to Ala Moana Shopping Centre.I think the owners of this Hotel should randomly book into their own hotel for two nights and see first hand how ordinary the hotel is for the price.

I stay in Honolulu 5-8 times a year for business/pleasure. I think the Ala Moana is an incredible bargain. The ideal location for restaurants and nightlife and across the street from the beach and Waikiki. The rooms are always great, comfortable beds, fitness center, courteous staff and a reasonable rate. A rate commodity in Honolulu

This past January we stayed at the Ala moana hotel this was our first time in Oahu and wanted to stay in a nice place that didn't cost a fortune since we knew we wouldn't be in the hotel most of our trip. This hotel was so convenient to the Ala Moana Mall that if we wanted to grab something quick it wasn't a problem including the Hidden Gem on the top level of the hotel is a beautiful steakhouse with a view of the isle and the food was absolutely delicious. I highly recommend staying at this hotel the next time you are visiting Oahu the continental breakfast was great and there was a Starbucks in the lobby what more do you need!! Also everyone was so nice to us and made our trip one to remember I cant wait to go return!!!

Love staying here for just about any occasion or just to have a little staycation. Majority all the staff here are really helpful and friendly and comes off with that welcoming spirit. The views are beautiful and comforting.

Front desk was able to upgrade reservation for separate beds thankfully, but will definitely book directly with hotel next time. Property was very comfortable and well located for our purposes.Breakfast buffet very satisfactory.

Great place to stay away from the madness of Waikiki. Fantastic restaurant, Signature Prime, on the top floor. Desk staff was great as well as the maids. Starbucks downstairs actually serves beer and wine.

Great hotel, great location, great view. In the hotel you can find lot's of opportunitie for breakfest. Rooms are very clean. Ice cubs available on the floors. On the 1st floor minimarket , shops , and Starbucks coffee available.

I had the junior suite and I was so very happy with it . It was clean and the housekeeping staff were great and ready to accommodate our needs. We went there for our annual 4th of July celebration and I was so very happy we did choose this hotel as it was comfortable. We sat on the beach to watch the fireworks and we were so thrilled we got to see this. This hotel could play up the 4th of July just a bit more I know they are busy but offering food for the event could be a plus for them like other hotels in Waikiki does. (Prince) there is a store that you can buy the things that you want to snack and the Starbucks down stairs was a hit for us. The shopping center was just great I really enjoyed the time there. I hope they keep their rates at the same price because it was very affordable. My only disappointment was finding out that the stores downstairs were closing its so sad to see them go I remember whenever I would go to this hotel to meet someone I would go into those stores and buy something. The pool left something to be desired please upgrade it there was a pump in the water i don't know why but it made me afraid . that was the draw back and I understand about the leaving the towels back or they charge the room 20 dollars .

The Ala Moana Hotel was very clean, updated and the staff was very friendly. The location right next to the Ala Moana Mall was convenient for shopping and dining. Short walk over the bridge to the Mall and eat at many many dining places. I would come back again. Aloha Oi!

So disappointing, our family booked this hotel in February this year and all was confirmed. We were advised by our airline Jetstar today the hotel could no longer accommodate us meaning we have to find somewhere else to stay with just 12 days before we fly. Disgraceful

My wife and I only stayed here for 1 night prior to flying to the Big Island.We were upgraded to a larger room which was still not particularly large. The room had a lanai which looked over a very large car park but also had a very limited ocean view.No bottled water was provided and what amenities were provided were limited.We took advantage of the nice pool and gym on the third floor and the Starbucks adjacent to the foyer.The most disappointing part of our stay was that our room(particularly the bathroom) smelt musty and one of the cupboard doors was sticking and difficult to open. Not what you would expect from a newish hotel!

Great location for Ala Moana Centre (walkway through car park straight into the centre from level 2) & Ala Moana Beach Park. The view from our room was fine, of a car park, some buildings & mountains. I found it noisy in the morning around 5:30. The room could do with an update & cleanliness could do with a little work, although, not horrible. Staff were very friendly & helpful with information. The gym had a good range of both cardio & weight machines. Didn't use the pool or the restaurants so cannot comment. Starbucks in the lobby was handy! Good to be away from the craziness of Waikiki but close enough. Jump on the trolley (pink line) for $2 (cash only) to get you into Waikiki.
user_name:
lizzy309
City of Greater Geelong, Australia

review_body: This is very affordable and nice hotel and very conveniently located to the outletMall. If you want walk access close to the beach then this is perfect. I very much appreciated their housekeeping. Very quick and thorough.

We stayed for 6 nights here. We are family of 4 (2 adults and 2 kids). Pros:Rooms are clean. Good location near beaches and restaurants.Access to Ala Moana city centre. Swimming pool access.Good breakfast spread.Staff is friendly.Cons:Its on the expensive side.Rooms are on the tiny side. Not spacious. No microwave in the hotel which makes it difficult to do a quick Tea or Coffee.The view from hotel is not that good as its tucked away from the shore.The restaurant hotel which is open in the night is very expensive. Choices of restaurants in the hotel is very limited.

How do you make a cup of tea with a microwave?How do you heat food in the microwave without plates?My request for a kettle was met.But my request to Front Desk & Housekeeping - for plates to heat food in microwave - negative. No service provided.The hotel does not supply & refuses to offer plates to rooms on request.I was advised to buy paper plates from shop in lobby.“All services and facilities have been designed for your comfort and convenience.We encourage you to take full advantage of them.We hope to exceed your expectations”A kettle & some plates alongside the microwave - basic guest facilities not being met.Mahalo!

Very disappointed with this hotel. The room was soooooo tiny. We could not store all our large carry-on luggage in closet. Could not close bathroom door with standard floor mat/towel at base of bathtub??? Had to close bathroom door to have full use of shower. Room safe at bottom of closet..... very inconvenient(and painful) to get that low to use at my age [easy fix move to top shelf]. At $175 pd better accommodations are expected. Simply needed more room overall to enjoy space. ROOMS too SMALL!

Was abit let down going from Hilton Village to Ala Moana but then it is cheaper, front line staff not overly friendly and rooms tiny! Paid for ocean view and you could see the ocean but over top of a huge parking building but clean and tidy. Only given 2 pillows for 2 of us which were small and uncomfortable had to use cushions under pillows for some support. Unfortunately wouldn’t stay again.

We booked 3 nights at the Ala Moana Hotel on a special deal and opted for the bed and breakfast rate. Best idea ever. We did not have to rush to breakfast and we could drink all the coffee we wanted. Great way to start off each day.

This is the second time I’ve experienced MOLD in the room!!! When I reported it to the front desk, it appeared they took it lightly and brushed it off! I even had pictures to show them! Terrible! I have stayed at this hotel many times and it saddens me to be treated this way

We stayed for a week and decided against staying in Waikiki, as we were here mainly to shop. The location of the hotel is perfect for that. Direct access from the hotel to the mall enabled us to come and go as we pleased. We had a room on the 9th floor of the Kona tower, with a view of the neighbouring buildings. The room itself was spotless, and had everything we needed. The bed was comfortable enough, there was a chair, an ottoman, and a single sofa bed. The room also has a small fridge, and microwave. The aircon worked very effeciently throughout the hotel.The room was very quite, and we never heard noise from the family with small children next door or anyone else the whole week. I never saw our room attendant, but they kept our room made up and replenished all the supplies daily.The pool on the 4th floor is small but suitable. The pool deck is extreemly windy, so things often blew off the tables and chairs unless weighted down. The beach park is also a 5 mins walk away, and is very clean and patrolled by life savers.The large size of this hotel makes it impersonal, but we did recieve excellent service from Koa in Valet. He always greeted us by name, and asked about our day.I enjoyed the large Starbucks on the ground floor, and liked that it was open early in the mornings. The coin laundry is also a welcome amenity, as it makes it easier to pack lightly when you can wash.Overall we enjoyed our stay here, and would happily stay again should we return on a shopping trip in the future.

We stayed only I night on stopover . I chose because it we arrived early and I want to do something other than hang out in a lobby . We grabbed coffee from the lobby Starbucks and then headed to Ala Moana shopping centre - for some fresh air shopping . Ate in the food hall and headed back to hotel . Room was available at 1pm ( they initially said 3pm ) .The room was daggy but comfortable , and reasonably soundproofed .

The lobby is attractive and the fitness centre has good cardio equipment & weight machines (although too few free weights). The rooms are very clean and the beds are reasonably comfortable, but the rooms need some repair (mine had a broken lamp, cracked light switch and some peeling paint), and the amenities are not branded. I was also somewhat surprised that neither the front desk nor housekeeping has a stash of things that travellers frequently forget, like ear plugs to deaden the noise from the floor above. The rooms have microwaves, in addition to the usual fridge and coffee maker, and there are suites available. This is handy given the proximity to the mall with a Foodland Farms. The staff are friendly and for late flights out the hotel conveniently offers a half day rate or access to a room on a first come first served basis to clean up after a day at the beach or exploring,

Every time I go there is something wrong with the room. It runs the gamut. Recently the air conditioner took over 30 min to repair, the TV was inoperable, and there were scratching noises inside the wall by the head of the bed.

I have stay at this hotel for work and vacation numerous times a year. I love the location of the hotel to the Ala Moana mall especially since there is not much eating options within the hotel itself. I only wish the pool was bigger especially for the size of the hotel. Get croweded real fast.

The Ala Moana hotel was next door to the Ala Moana shopping precinct and had an easily accessible ramp directly into the car park. It was also close to the beach, around a 5 minute walk which was really convenient. There is a Starbucks within the hotel, as well as a steak restaurant up top and the Plantation Cafe downstairs which does at $18 buffet breakfast which was pretty good value. Rooms were clean and had good facilities - bar fridge, microwave, hairdryer etc.

All the convenience that I needed. Close to the Ala Moana Shopping center, the Convention Center. The room had a refrigerator, microwave and coffee pot! I was on the floor that also had an ice machine and laundry room.

Clean hotel from the minute I arrived to the minute I left. Desk staff very welcoming and accommodating, they never said "NO" to any of my requests. The hotel is the perfect distance from Downtown and Waikiki and being attached to the Ala Moana Mall was a home run. I had access to a Longs Drugs, Dry Cleaners, Supermarket and dozens of places to eat. Room was clean and simple but the internet was sketchy. I would stay again.....
user_name:
Anthony R
New York, United States

review_body: I stayed here for 5 night for business and meetings. Very convenient from HNL using Lyft. Check in (at 10PM) was fast an efficient. I was in a room in the Kona tower, which I learned is the older part of the hotel. Rooms are basic and clean, but nothing special. Beds are showing their age, and definitely would not want to sleep on them more than 5 nights, especially if you have back issues. All of the staff, from the front desk to housekeeping and catering are absolutely the best with wonderful Hawaiian hospitality. Great Starbucks in the lobby. Internet was mostly ok, but a few times in the evening, horrendously slow making getting some evening work done, a challenge. Also, nice fitness room.

Aloha, American delayed our flight and they put us here. The check in was slow but not their fault as they had a full 757 of passengers descend on them at once. Was in the Kona tower which is the old one. Low ceilings. Got to room and it looked like a crew room. fine for 1 person but not for 2 and bags. Smelled musty with a touch of old smoke. The window could not be opened. furniture was worn. Got in the shower and the handle fell off in the tub. I was able to reattach it. Just crashed for the night. Got up in the morning to find our flight further delayed for another day! Checked out and went back to our original hotel in Waikiki. They did have a Starbucks in the lobby which was the only plus

Good check in process but I loved the ease of checking out. Breakfast buffet was awesome. Room A/C was nice and cold. Parking staff showed urgency, check-in staff were quick and efficient, and Plantation Café staff were very friendly.

This hotel feels like brand new because the rooms are clean, modern and are in very good condition. There is a very nice pool area which has lots of seating. The pool is a bit basic but the size is more than adequate. This hotel is directly above one of the best (and biggest) shopping centres in Hawaii. There is also a good part and beach directly across the road.

We made reservations on July 4. Check-in was at 1500. Our flight landed 1500 and got to the hotel at 1600. There were lines and lines of cars parked infront of the hotel to the street. It took us 45 minutes to get to front of the hotel from the street and we were told that all parking was full to include valet. I had them talk to the manager but management didn't care. Guests should always be a priority but in this case the hotel just wanted to make money from people that came just fr the fireworks. The crew doing valet service were very nice and they all worked hard. I felt bad that they had to deal with angry hotel guests. Management you should think about parking especially on big events. You should satisfy customers and protect your employees. Because of this experience, I did not see the value of the hotel in a different way.

the rooms are comparable to motel 6. the beds are very uncomfortable, and the furnishings are old, cheap, and uncomfortable. the light switches and electrical outlets are poorly placed and hard to reach.

Everything is so convenient and close by. Shopping, dining and entertainment are all in walking distance. Staff is always friendly and helpful. I always stay here for those reasons mentioned. I wouldn't consider staying anywhere else. Join Mantra+ for added benefits! It's a must!

My room was comfortable and clean, but it was a bit tight in the bathroom. It was not stocked with any washcloths. I felt the price was a bit high for kama'aina rate. I would probably still stay here again though.

One of the most convient hotel to stay in, with its llocation next to Ala Moana Shopping Center, Ala Moana Beach Park . Its a place where 'Locals" like t o stay at because of its location, hospitality and value for your money. Any ocean view rooms are great. BUt mountain views are also worthwhile

I had to request towels twice before receiving them. I was also told I would receive my receipt via email. I didn't receive it. I followed up with an email requesting it again, I still don't have it!!!

We stay here about four times per year. I was mortified at how much the room was deteriorated and by the price. You used to be able to stay for around $100 per night but now $ 220?? Everyday something was missing like washcloths one day, soap another, etc. The bathroom door was falling apart. They charge a ridiculous amount for parking and the poor valets are not getting tipped enough due to this. They are pricing like a Hilton for thread bare sheets and towels, stained, worn out furniture, and horrible room cleaning. Not staying there any more, and if I must I’m using Uber

I enjoyed staying at this hotel especially JJ's Shop, Starbucks, Restaurants and small grocery store within the hotel, as well as the located of mall it was great exercise. Be prepared to walk a lot and bring comfortable shoes.

We booked the Ala Moana Hotel by Airpads, which is separate to Mantra, it surprised me there are several rooms in the hotel owned by someone other than Mantra so please be careful whilst booking. The whole booking process was awful as it was supposed to be a 50% deposit through Booking.com, however I was charged 100%, and even worse this was done twice. So my credit card maxed out and I missed several Direct Debits at home due to Airpads mistake, which I might add was over $5,000 AUD. I received would sounded more like and excuse than an apology and was given no compensation. So long before we had even left we had feared we made a massive mistake. We arrived at the hotel and around 10pm and I have to say first impressions were mixed, it was a lovely big hotel in a great location, however the air conditioner was broken in the lobby and they had portable units doing the job, so it had a slightly musty smell. The front desk staff were fantastic, check-in was easy, they sorted daily room cleaning (Not included in some airpads rooms) and had us up to our rooms in no time. The rooms were very nice, nice simple decor, clean and spacious, and the view from the balcony was pretty good. The bed was comfortable and big, the TV was a good size and easy to use, and the bar fridge was very handy. The aircon worked well but was very noisy, I complained and a technician was sent up to inspect the problem, he did make it a bit quieter but didn't eliminate the noise completely. It was a slight annoyance but not enough that we couldn't sleep through it or watch TV etc.The pool was nice and big and the pool staff were very friendly and helpful, the staff in the lobby were very helpful with tour and transport information as well. The starbucks and convenience store in the lobby were also very nice to have. The hotel is in great location, very close to the Ala Moana shopping centre, across the road from a nice beach and getting a taxi or uber from the hotel is easy.Despite my fears and initial disappointment in the smell the Ala Moana was a great hotel with lovely staff and pleasent rooms. I would stay here again I just wouldn't book through Airpads, and I hope the Air Conditioner in the Lobby is fixed.

We had the ocean view room which was fantastic. Rooms were clean and spacious, Lobby renovations underway which look amazing. Did not sample the restaurant so cannot give advice on that. Location was central,

I loved the location of this hotel. Right next door to a nice huge shopping mall. Only a 5 minute walk to the beach and 15 minute walk to Wiki Beaches. I was happy with the microwave and mini frig., and the mall next door had a nice grocery store. The bathtub was huge and deep. My room had a cute little balcony with partial ocean view. The room was a nice size. We ate at the restaurant at the top of the hotel and there were some amazing sunset views there.The pool, sauna, work out room and steam room, were ok, but nothing spectacular. I wasn't impressed with the cleanliness or the staff, but it wasn't so bad it ruined our stay there. I would defiantly recommend this hotel, I loved the location.
