Pros: breakfast buffet and free self-park as part of package, no resort fee, free welcome drinks with Mantra+ loyalty membership, nice valet and restaurant staffCons: not being allowed to pay difference to upgrade to valet parking services, room (1141) let all outside noise and hallway noise in (awoken by multiple dumpsters on ground level being emptied at 5 am each morning, room doors slamming shut in early morning and night)

Older hotel, next to the Ala Moana Shopping Mall. Loads of places to eat in area. Not on Waikiki, but you can walk a few blocks and you are there. Very friendly personnel. Cafe breakfast good and you can get it included, if you search for deals. Was close to tour pick-up areas and some were at the hotel(Polynesian Cultural Center. This was my granddaughter's graduation trip. She had a great time.

This hotel is close to all the beach, shopping and restaurants in Honolulu. The staff is warm and accommodating and the rooms are clean and well appointed. We discovered the inner elevators and saved lots of waiting time and took the 2nd floor exit to the mall ramp for easy access to the beach. Ala Moana Park and Paradise Island are just across the street, and downtown Honolulu is just a short hike away. For the price and location, this hotel is a winner. The parking fee was high though and it is in a busy area.

Perfectly placed just yards from the Ala Moana Center and very close to the Ala Moana Beach Park. The rooms are a good size with just about all you need as standard and ours had a great view(23rd floor) but to say it was a full sea view is a bit optimistic as there were 3 tower blocks in the way. The room was spotless and the housekeeping was spot on. The breakfast offering was huge and a fairly good standard for a 1000 room hotel. A huge opportunity is being missed by the hotel by not having a decent bar for guests, the only one we could find was the cocktail bar on the 36th floor beside the incredible Signature restaurant. The pool area is OK but hqad no pool side bar but did supply all the towels one could want.Overall a decent property but could be better with some improvements.Just a real negative, we spent well over an hour at the "tourist" desk trying to make a booking for 4 that cost over $700, the poor guy was on his own and this was not good enough.

Parking here is atrocious! There's only 1 level to their self parking and it's a maze. Parking attendants weren't very helpful or friendly.If you check-in prior to 12pm there's an "Early Check-in" fee of $50. Even if your room is ready.They do offer late/extended check-out option for 1/2 of your nightly rate which extends your check-out to 6pm.Starbucks in the lobby serves alcohol too. The only one on the island. Didn't have a chance to try out the Plantation Restaurant near the lobby. Stayed here to attend a tournament at the convention center. It was convenient and free self-parking if you're local. But, the rooms are small and our room still had trash in the bins and even under the desk.

It was great, great customer service and the accommodations of the room made it relaxing. Liked that it was next to the Ala Moana shopping center and to everything else. Rooms were clean. Staff was great, always smiling.

Didnt know the 24hr parking i paid for ends at the time stamped on the ticket and not when I left the hotel. Had to pay extra on top of the $50. Wifi in the room was off and on and virtually non existing.

I used to stay at the Ala Moana Hotel during my work visits in the 1980s and Honolulu was always one of the favorite destinations aside from London and Amsterdam. I would have never imagined that a large Convention Centre would be built right across and up the street from here which was why I ended up staying here yet again; to attend a conference with my boss. The hotel does not seem to have changed much all these years other than being even more crowded. The rooms look pretty much the same, but with new aqua blue and green tones (carpet, bedding, cushions) added to the wooden furniture to give it a more tropical feel since its refurbishment in 2016. It is strange that I had actually remembered the rooms to be bigger; perceptions of dimensions seem to alter with age and perspective. I did feel though that the decor was rather plain and that more could have been done to make the look and feel more upbeat and classy. I was also a tad disappointed with the bathroom as it seemed still rather old-school and I had some issues with the hot water in the shower. I was thankful that the front desk offered me a courtesy room to use to freshen up after my long flight, since the hotel was running at peak and we could not check in any time before 2 pm. I was offered an ocean view room with a balcony in the Waikiki Tower, similar to the type of room we were allocated under contract with my former company. I always loved the gorgeous views out to the ocean on the right and with the mountains on the back left. Sitting out in the balcony with such amazing views and watching the sunset was a real treat. With the close-to-perfect Hawaiian weather, late evenings out on the balcony in a dream destination was truly a delight for a teen/young adult. On this trip however, we stayed at the Kona Tower, which although had partial views of the ocean, lacked a balcony. The Plantation Cafe where the daily buffet breakfast is served has shrunk from its original size and no longer offers full day dining but is only open for breakfast. The access to it is now from the outside of the hotel lobby. I remembered that we used to get the best ever corned beef hash here which was disappointingly no longer available. But I did still get to enjoy the fragrantly delicious Hawaiian papaya which remains as the most popular offering in the buffet spread. The most interesting discovery here was 'The Signature Prime Steak & Seafood' restaurant on the 36th floor, where the views are spectacular, with excellent food choices. There are also a few nice gift shops on the ground floor and a convenience store along with Starbucks. There is a little shop that sells original Hawaiian-designed and Hawaiian-made shirts and blouses; quite the real deal with a very friendly owner. The hotel is ideally located and conveniently linked by a ‘Skybridge’ on the second floor to the Ala Moana Center, the world’s largest open-air shopping center, through the car park area. It has far more upmarket stores and restaurants than before with the supermarket shifted right to the far end of the mall. There are a slew of restaurants to choose from and daily Hawaiian performances at the Centerstage. The artificially created Magic Island and Lagoon along with Ala Moana Beach Park are a short walk away. This is a good spot to watch surfers with an excellent view of Diamond Head, Kahanamoku Lagoon and Ala Wai Boat Harbor.

Stayed in the 1 bedroom suite, very spacious with a bed and pull out couch. There was a dishwasher in there too! Along with a hot plate, microwave, fridge, and a sink. Also came with a daily breakfast buffet. Great value for the price that we paid.

Very convenient, close to the shopping mall, a lot of food options near by. Breakfast is also good.Room is clean and with some view.No resort fee. Very well worth the price.Internet speed sometimes slow when streaming video. And there was once the front desk hang up our call before we finish all of our questions.

Alamoana Hotel is totally awesome, first of all Starbuck's in the hotel lobby and having great staff that provided very hospitable service. The other factor is location, location, location as it is literally connected to the Alamoana Mall with many stores and restaurants just a skywalk away. Walmart, Sam's & Ross were also just a block away.Just a fantastic place to be when in Honolulu.

Great overall experience. Great location convenient to downtown and airport. Great amenities on-site and in immediate area. Rooms are comfortable and sufficient. Well worth the money. Only negative is that the gym is not 24 hours to accommodate busy travelers.

Excellent service. Overall friendly staff. Great discounts can be received at the front desk. Walkable distance to Ala Moana mall and other businesses. Awesome view from my hotel room and the beach was located about 2 blocks away.

All good. Ladies that cleaned our room was very pleasant. they did an excellent job cleaning our room. Valet service was excellent. The guys were very helpful with directions to places we wanted to see.

Great location. Ala Moana Shopping Center was right next door & accessable via a ramp on the 2nd Floor. Exceptional hotel service from check in to housekeeping. The views were spectacular along with the people.

Enjoyed the entire experience; service, cleanliness, comfort and convenience. Haven't stayed at this property in years. Not because it was bad, just overall have not vactioned on Oahu in almost 7 years. But very satisfied with this experience and would recommend this property to all.

The location is great! Dont really even need a car if you dont have To be anywhere (like work). Dining in the hotel, and at Ala Moana Mall. The beds are decent and the rooms are very clean. The soaking tub is a nice bonus. Wifi in my room didnt work, and when I called, they just patched me through to Spectrum, which didnt help me at all. That was the only complaint I have, and it's truly a minor one. Who needs wifi when you can get outside and explore!?!

We arrived in Oahu at 6am and check in was at 3pm, we had emailed seeking early check in and were able to leave our bags with the bell boy and come back at 1.00 o-clock. At check in we were given free drink vouchers and $50 USD worth of gift cards for Starbucks by a friendly welcoming lady at reception. Our room was cosy, clean and big enough for two with all the usual supplies. Daily Housekeeping was great, even when we spent the day lounging around and sleeping off celebrations one of the ladies would clean and refresh when we went out. Room WiFi was pretty good as was the view over the sea. Whilst in Oahu my wife celebrated a birthday and friends from Australia were able to organise a gift to be delivered locally to the hotel through the concierge and they were full of praise for him.Be advised that the Ala Moana is not a resort, there is no room service, no poolside bar and limited dining options in the hotel. Signatures restaurant on floor 36 is nice, and happy hour is pretty good but it has no affiliation with the hotel with no charge back facility. Starbucks in the lobby is a good place to sit and have coffee with great Wi Fi but it is not a restaurant. The gym and sauna were well equipped and modern and the pool was clean with plenty of loungers and friendly towel staff (we could take towels from the pool to the beach). Buffet breakfast at the cafe was good with a nice selection of hot and cold food and friendly staff.Having said that the location of the hotel is great! The Ala Moana center next door has many and varied bar and dining options and numerous shopping opportunities. It is also a transport hub for public and tour buses. We walked and cycled to Waikiki a few times but there was a beautiful beach, marina and lagoon area across the road from the hotel which we actually thought was less crowded and less commercialised.When we return to Oahu we will return to the Ala Moana Hotel.

Perfect location centrally located and staff terrific and friendly. Michael and Taylor at desk very helpful. The buffet breakfast was also fabulous with a wide array of choices. Right next to the amazing Ala Moana Center and nearby medical facilities.

We started on the mountain side of the building, views not as spectacular but lovely all the same. 2 adults and 2 children in a 2 bed room and worked well. Not the biggest room but we were out most of the time. Contained microwave, small fridge and coffee making facilities. Small balcony with two chairs and table. Lobby has a couple of well appointed gift and convenience shops and a Starbucks which we frequented daily before our adventures.Level 2 has a short cut to Ala Moana Shopping Centre Awesome pool area which my kids loved.

Very convenient, just a 5 minute walk across to Waikiki beach, shops and restaurants. Shopping center is 2 mins walk away. Room was clean and very comfortable with fantastic views! And there is a starbucks in the foyer!

We live on the Big Island and have stayed here many times over the past ten years and our last 2 stays have not been good. Since Mantra took over, the quality of service has dropped, rooms are not completely refreshed and require many calls to housekeeping to bring up things like coffee cups, etc. The coffee in the room is undrinkable and housekeepers don't know what a plastic bag liner for the ice bucket is! Also be aware that the sliding doors in the Kona Tower no longer open so forget about getting fresh air in those rooms. They want you to pay $20 - $40 more for the other tower so you can have some fresh air. WiFi is also spotty. Find another hotel to stay at.

very good except that there were only 2 small pillows (seems like the size is half of a regular pillow) for 2 guests. For the price at Kona Tower, it was good. Location is next to the Ala Moana Center where there's a food court. Walking distance to Don Quixote and Foodland. Walking distance to the Catholic Church. The trolley zone is next door at the Ala Moana Center.

graduation weekend and the grown up kids came in and out of the room at various times for various things. very easy, very conveient. the breakfast was meh.the location is great. staff is very freindsly. parking is tight late at night.

On Friday evening, we asked the front desk staff to help us with the key to our room.He flatly refused to assist us even though we told him that we needed the help due to religious reasons. Furthermore, he mentioned that this was the hotel policy.We were extremely disappointed with his attitude.

Very convenient in a great location near the beach and next to a huge mall. Very clean and comfy rooms. Delicious breakfast buffet in hotel restaurant. Excursions tours pick you up in the hotel to go to so many attractions.

Centered in the heart of Ala Moana. Near shopping, beaches, eateries. Great place to stay and relax.Wasn't too far away from NBC for graduation and reception was near the hotel. So we could walk. Always stay here when on island.

Two weeks before our trip in May (we booked January of that same year), the hotel chose not to honor our reservations. We never got to stay here, but have a general bad taste in our mouths because of the negative experience.

I appreciate the accessibility to the mall from the hotel. I attended a graduation at the Convention center and was able to walk to the graduation and back to my room. My brother was joining me and utilized the hotel pool while we were there, he did say that it would have been nice to have a pool bar. Otherwise the rooms are decent, our view of the harbor and downtown was great and the hotel staff are very professional, kind, and accommodating. Parking isn't too bad either.

Contiue to keep up the great work.I can't thank you enough on making my stay amazing.I can alway count on this hotel and I have never had a bad experience here.Your valet team is awesome.They continue to give great customer service.

I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights when I was recently on a trip for work. Now I realize why it was one of the few available for the government per diem rate. I wouldn’t stay here again. Most of the staff at the front reception desk are rude, have a bad attitude and could care less about providing quality service. I was told when I checked in that they would charge my credit card upfront for all 4 nights. I was staying one day at my own expense so I had them charge that night to a different credit card. When I told them I was not staying that 4th night they issued the refund to the wrong credit card. I told them on two occasions to make sure and apply the credit to the Am Ex, but needless to say they messed that up. Clearly they didn’t listen. After I returned it took me 2 phone calls and 3 emails to get it corrected. Thankfully Beatrice in billing did care about providing good service even though the manager Chris did not. Seriously, what is wrong that it took that much of my time to correct their error which could’ve been avoided in the first place if the people at the front desk cared more about providing quality customer service. For the night I stayed on my own I checked into a different, nicer hotel. There was no way I was paying to stay at this hotel another night. The difference between this hotel and the other one I stayed at was night and day. The other things I didn’t like is the rooms don’t have balconies. It looked like it in the photo, but it’s bars over a sliding glass door that only opens about 5 inches. Ridiculous not to have a balcony when in a tropical climate. It also looks closer to the ocean than it is. Normally the rooms have information about where the fitness center and pool are located, ice machines etc. None of that information was in my room so I was always calling down to the desk to get that information. When I called from my room to ask the location of the fitness center I was told it was on a particular floor but that floor didn’t exist and wasn’t an option on the elevator. I had to go all the way to lobby to ask someone. Again, poor service from the front desk. When I asked the bell boy about shuttles to Waikiki he clearly had an I don’t care attitude and said “outside the shopping center”. That’s a pretty broad statement if you know Ala Moana center. It’s huge. If in Hawaii I will NOT ever stay at this hotel again. Grant it, the room was clean but there’s more to a hotel than a clean room. The fact that it didn’t have a balcony was a deal breaker. When you combine that with very poor customer service in every aspect it makes it pretty poor.

If you have a convention at the Convention Center or expect to spend a lot of time shopping, this is the hotel for you. I stay at the Ala Moana whenever I am in Honolulu for business. On this trip, my convention was next door and I needed to do some serious shopping.

I stayed at Ala Moana hotel in May for a week. I was attending a conference at the Holoulu convention center and the usual official hotel assigned by the conference was sold out so I booked at A la Moana hotel last minute.This is an apartment hotel which means the suites are owned by someone but they rent them either privately or through the hotel organization. I arrived at 5:30am and the checkin was at 4pm and there were no rooms available. There was a $50 extra charge for early checkin but there were simply no rooms available even for early checkin. I found some reception staff very friendly and accommodating and some other ones very dry and not so friendly. It helps to talk to the manager. I left my luggage with the concierge until my room became available. I had booked a room with ocean view. This hotel has 36 floors. The first room I got was on the 8th floor and even though it did look towards the ocean,the view was that of the mall's parking lot. I complained and the next day got a room on the 18th floor. This time, the view was quite lovely so try to get a room on higher floors. The suite has a small bedroom and a good size living room/kitchenette/dining area. The kitchen has basic dishes and cutlery for 4 people, dishwasher, 2 fridges, cook top and microwave. The decor is pretty basic, boring and dated but the view makes up for it. The sliding doors in the sitting room open completely and you feel like you are sitting at the beach.The wifi speed is good in the room and free. The bathroom has a bathtub and good water pressure. The water is safe to drink and has no smell. Bed was comfortable and room was clean. There's a Starbox in the lobby that comes in handy. There's also a direct bridge from second floor of the hotel to the adjacent huge shopping mall. The elevators work with room keys when going up and it can sometimes get tricky as the key may not be read properly and it can be frustrating.There's a cafe that serves breakfast. It's average breakfast with a wide variety of choices.The best part of this hotel is its proximity to the convention center if you are staying for business. It's literally down the street and 2 minutes walk. It's also right by the A la Moana shopping center and a 5 minute walk to the beach. I took the airport shuttle bus to the hotel that cost only $15 on the way in. On the way back, I took a cab that cost $40 for the same distance to the airport. He charged me 60c ents for each bag!Overall a good stay, nothing fancy but the view is breathtaking and it's practical and close to several amenities.

Our stay was extremely disappointing. From our check in to our check out. Starting with our check in, Terrence at the front desk did not smile once during our conversation. He tells us that we can check in early for a extra $50 fee which is understandable. Then, tells us that the only room available is a wheelchair access room. He could have at least told us that we could check back in later to see if any rooms were available to switch to. He did not give us any options but the wheelchair access room so we took it. He did not give us ANY information about the hotel or the amenities that they offer. We had to figure everything out on our own. Then, we ended up checking out with Terrence, go figure. He, once again, did not smile at all during our conversation or thank us for staying with your hotel. Not worth the money at all. We will not be going back.

Although we are well-travelled and understand a room was not guaranteed until 3pm, we arrived at 7.30am off a cruise from Australia. No attempt was made to find a room until the fifth enquiry at 1.20pm when I was told the room rate we had booked was not available. We were requested to pay another tariff which, frustrated and tired, we agreed. A room was found in minutes at the higher room rate. From then we used the hotel a bed only as the café was less than average and then principally open for breakfast. Starbucks situated on the premises was unusual but saved the day providing a drink on occasion and at least a snack with pleasant staff. The main problem was the noise each vehicle makes as it enters the carpark directly under the room windows - such that to sleep with the door open with even the narrowest of slots open, was impossible. A very minor repair to the covers to the drains in the carpark would solve the problem. When I reported the noise problem, I was told that the hotel was attending to the problem. The cab driver said it had been occurring for months without resolution. I would have to be almost given a room before I stayed at the hotel again even though the brand is relatively good in places like Australia.However I have to add that the rooftop restaurant was excellent in every respect, for particularly an early dinner or a few drinks.

Found the mountain view room to have no view of the mountain as advertised, also found a plastic tag from a previous guest on the ground which my infant son almost placed in his mouth. Can't fault the check in service staff but can say the overall cleanliness of the room was poor, the one upside is the vicinity to the ala moana shopping centre.

We chose this hotel for its location - less than 10 minute walk to HI Convention Center, for an annual conference. Average accommodations. As a kama’aina resident of Honolulu, but choosing to stay at this hotel to avoid transportation problems, I expected more aloha spirit from the front desk personnel. Seemed that tourists were treated in a friendlier manner.

If you don't need to stay in the middle of Waikiki this is a nice alternative right on the edge and alongside the Ala Moana shopping center. This alone offers many dining options although the steakhouse in the hotel was very good with a great view at the top of the hotel and reasonably priced. Can't beat the location if you are attending events at the convention center. Room was a little small with dated looking decor and color scheme but it was clean and the bed was comfortable. Note it does not have USB charging in the room so bring your outlet charger. High step into the tub/shower as well. There is a Starbucks in the lobby which always seemed busy. Friendly staff and easy hotel to navigate. If you do want to go to the beach Ala Moana beach park would be about a half mile walk. It is closer but to reach beach is a half mile.

The hotel is dated, but very clean. The rooms are rather small, and the bed was somewhat uncomfortable. It was very close to the shopping centre, and close to Waikiki Beach. We enjoy walking, so walked the length of Waikiki and took in various sights there. The hotel could probably use some renovations, including new beds and thicker walls. Our first night there was terrible, as the people next door kept us awake until well after 4 a.m. with their chatting, laughing, and other things.

I always stay at the property when in Honolulu...it is centrally located, has all the amenities I desire...staff is always friendly...check in/out is fast...nice Starbucks in-house...a short bus ride or LYFT ride to most locations...great bar at the top with good happy hour...

A great hotel with great location if you don't want to be in the hustle & bustle of Waikiki. (Still within walking distance) Great tour desk and most tours this is the first Hotel pickup but also first drop off. Easy access to Ala Moana Shopping Centre via the level 2 skybridge. The Ala Moana Beach which is in front of the hotel is magneficent and not crowded compared to Waikiki and has a lifeguard station. Starbucks and other shop's in foyer Restaurant on top floor. We had a ocean view suite which was a great room with views although you could not see Hilton's Friday night fire works show from balcony. Nice pool although the hours of operation should be longer with pool opening from 8am to sunset. Pool should be open till at least 10pm

We always stay at Ala Moana Hotel for shopping & dining at the mall and then a comfortable and convenient overnight (or 2 or 3 nights) stay. I should have skipped the ocean view, since we were looking at it from an angle and with another high rise in the middle of the view. Nonetheless, I love this hotel. The rooms are not big, but adequate and very clean and comfortable.

Hotel was convenient to the beach and had nice shops and close places to eat. Handy to the mall.Wish the Bar would have stayed open past 10:00 PM as it has a great view, but we could not enjoy. Quick 10 minute walk to the beach. Rooms are very small but were clean and housekeeping service was great.

Best hotel in Ala Moan area of Honolulu, within a 5 minute walk to Ala Moana Center and the beach. Excellent services, ocean side rooms have heavenly views of the ocean, sunset, the city, and even Diamond Head crater (peeking through between some of the buildings)

Ala Moana hotel was convenient for shopping at the Mall next door but there was no room service available for travellers after 10.00 am.Had to make an effort to either eat at Starbucks in Lobby or walk to the mall for a breakfast or other meals.

So handy to be right at the mall. Easy for meals and shopping. The pool has no shaded areas for reading or relaxing but nice for swim or family. Starbuck's in the lobby. We got breakfast included making it a great bargain.

Booked a mountain view room and only saw an alley and a car park. Room was really small and a small version of a queen bed. The bar fridge was extremely noisy at night. The only saving grace was breakfast was good.

We always prefer to stay here when we come to Honolulu. Our needs are always met.The breakfast is always good, with a nice variety of foods to enjoy. The servers are always friendly.We enjoy the pool and gym also.

Spent five nights at the hotel, chose mainly for the location. Well located and good facilities. We had a one bedroom suite for a family of four which worked well. However, even though booked for four, room not made up for four people and had to regularly ask for housekeeping throughout stay. Room has kitchenette but not plates, glasses or cutlery (not even a couple of wine glasses). When you asked for things though they were provided, I just would have expected to not have to request such basic things. Service was ok, staff were fine but really did not go out of their way, a number of staff quite disinterested in assisting or going out of their way, when you asked though people were responsive, just didn’t feel customer service was a strong focus. OK overall. I probably wouldn’t return though.

Great Deal! Free breakfast buffet and on-site parking! Location is next door to the largest shopping mall in Hawaii. Ala Moana Beach Park, a favorite of locals is only a block away! Easy access to Waikiki.

Everyone and everything about this place was amazing. I so recommend staying at ala Moana hotel. From valet, to checking in, to housekeeping, to breakfast staffs, to pool staffs. Everyone was nothing but all smiles all around.

I absolutely do NOT like staying in Waikiki, but sometimes work has us nearby or there - and we always stay at the Ala Moana.Its not on the beach, but that can be good - the location is not in Waikiki, so getting in and out is fairly easy and efficient. The mall next door is also a good perk, so food and shopping is literally just across the drive.I always get a room in the Waikiki Tower - the Kona Tower is shorter and behind the main tower; but my friends rooms are only slightly different. Views have always been fine for Honolulu, and all the furnishings nice.Check-in was fine, rooms have normally been available. Thankfully we haven't had issues with elevators like others - but when you are staying in a 40 story hotel, ANYWHERE, you can expect to stop a few times or wait a few minutes.Valet at the hotel has always been fast & efficient - definitely worth the spend.

Great staff, they upgraded me due to a problem in my room. Nice service, easily accessible to many places. Staying at this hotel makes it easy to understand the meaning of the words "Mahalo and Aloha"

I am suffering from terminal Prostate Cancer and have less than a year left to live. My treatment medication and narcotics require a refrigerator cooling below45 degrees. The digital thermometer I bought showed my refrigerator never went below 68 degrees. The handiman told me I had a new unit and it was better than all the others. Disappeared when I asked for his boss' name. It cost me over $6,000 dollars to get new drugs-BUT THEY WOULD NOT REPLACE 4 DAYS NARCOTICS.

Only stayed one night in this hotel but enjoyed it. The view from the 34th floor was awesome and the beds were comfortable. The room was clean and tidy. Ideally located next to the Ala Moana shopping centre. My wife was in shopping heaven.

I was here for a few days of business. As such, I was less interested in location (closer to my site and further from Waikiki was better). It’s a bit of a walk to Waikiki but you can make much of it along the beach, once you get over the canal.The room was small but clean. Water pressure in the shower was good. Elevators were fast and plenty. Top floor steak house was excellent. Lobby attendants were courteous and helpful. The view wasn’t bad - I was looking toward the mountains, but it was as much buildings as it was mountains. That being said, on business it didn’t bother me.To be blunt, if I was on vacation I’d spend the extra cash to stay closer to the beach and in a hotel with a nicer touch of amenities. But for business, this did just fine.

purchased a room with a Mountain View. It was just apartment buildings and no visible mountains.Went to sort it out. Troy a large guy in reception was extremely rude did not care and just argued that the view is behind the building. He lied about a manager saying I can upgrade for $40 a night or a get a refund. So very very rude. I will never recommend this place.

My husband and I stayed here during our last few days in Honolulu and we received excellent customer service from Justin at the front desk. He gave us a very spacious, comfortable room with views of the ocean, city and mountains and most of the mornings we stayed there, we had breakfast on the balcony while enjoying the views.One of the main reasons we chose this hotel was its location - right next door to the Ala Moana Center, and we were pleased to learn we could self-park our rental car without needing to use their valet service that came at an extra cost. This gave us the freedom to come and go as we pleased during our stay which was very convenient for us. The hotel has a variety of shops in the lobby that came in quite handy during our stay. The free wifi turned out to be a bit spotty from time to time, but when it worked, it was very good. The only thing we didn't care for was the expensive buffet breakfast. In the other hotels we stayed in, they offered a generous, free continental breakfast, but at Ala Moana, you're expected to pay upwards of $18. We ended up going elsewhere to eat or buying yogurts and muffins from the shop in the lobby, a much less expensive option. Overall, we had a very pleasant stay at Ala Moana and would highly recommend it.

Had a week staying here for an Easter break. Took a chance arriving early for check in but no room available unless you paid extra for an early check in, which is unfortunate but we understood most other hotels we have stayed in have attempted to accommodate us early if possible.The room was a standard US hotel room nothing fancy they had a strange set up in that there was a microwave, fridge etc. But no cutlery or basic items which rendered it redundant unless you were warming up items from the store that had plastic cutlery with the items. The staff at the Starbucks were very friendly and helpful with a cheery smile each day we went there. The hotel is a good location for transport including local buses to take you around the island and also the pink line trolley around the corner too. There is also a great beach area across the street that is way less busy than Waikiki beach.

There were cockroaches in the room, and bathroom. The toilet was plugged almost everyday. It was cold and there was no heater. The carpet and floor were dirty. There was noises outside so I couldn't sleep at night... I want my money back.

Great staff. Nice facility and rooms clean. Its a great place to stay with the Ala Moana shopping center just steps away. The Signature restaurant at the top of the hotel is an experience with a breathtaking view and excellent dinner choices. the bar also serves an excellent choice of spirits to enjoy.

Nice hotel. Self-parking is limited. Free buffet breakfast was excellent. Staff was very courteous and helpful. Special room rate seemed to be a good deal, but there was an unsightly, wet spot that covered half of the sofa bed. Rather than being a comfy spot to sit, it was a place to be avoided in the otherwise, spotless room.

Check-in service was excellent and the check-out person was more polite than friendly. Rooms starting to show their age and beginning to look run-down in various areas of the room. We had a late check-in at 10 pm and called housekeeping for linens for the sofa bed. After waiting 45 minutes, we had to call again. Finally after an additional 15 minutes someone finally showed. He did not smile, did not say one word, did not say thank you. Very poor service.

We stayed at the ala Moana as an extended family group. The hotel was close to the major shopping centre and public transport, but a bit of a walk to the beach. The pool is pretty small for the size of the hotel but that is likely due to it being a ten minute bus trip to Waikiki beach. The folks at the Starbucks in the foyer were lovely too. We stayed in an apartment and it had great views and everything that you could need.

Convenient locationShopping a Plus next to Ala Moana Center...a short walkValet Servicce the BestHousekeeper very personable and was so accommodating.Coffee service in the lobby convenient and hours of operation a plusLittle store has a good selection of necessary items and snacks for the roomAppreciate the reservation clerk who recommended a special spring promotion that included breakfastEnjoyed the breakfast the mornings I was there!

Location is perfect. You have the mall next door and the walk down to Waikiki is perfect. Or you can catch the trolley for a couple of bucks which takes you from Ala Moana mall down and around Waikiki.

Calling back to front desk was impossible. No one answered the phone & I actually had to call reservations to make another completely new reservation. The reservation clerk was so helpful & even went out of her way to rebook my same room. That person was the saving grace to this hotel.

Clean, comfortable room at a hotel that is easy to get in and out of during a brief, business stay in Honolulu. Had a lanai with a view and enough room amenities to make the overnight pleasant. The double bed and room furnishings were perfect to share for the overnight. There were enough chairs in the room and on the lanai.

Stayed at the Ala Moana last Fall. Amazing hotel in a great location, right next to the Ala Moana Center with countless stores and restaurants. The stay included breakfast buffet at the Plantation Cafe on the first floor - excellent way to start the morning. Staff was friendly and ready to help. Highly recommended hotel!

If you are planning on staying at this hotel try to get a room with an Ocean View, they are magnificent views of the ocean and Ala Moana Park! I loved my room 2408! The balcony was a perfect place to de-stress from a day of work but Hawaii is a place in itself to destress. The room was well kept, the help in the lobby was excellent, I especially appreciated the guys who park your car, they were personal, friendly, on top of things and had my car ready for me to go to work every day, sometimes without me even asking! The included breakfast was always good, loved the waffles, they need more waffle machines though, haha! Everyone from the people at registration to the parking guys were quality and caring individuals, I wouldnt hesitate to stay here again!

Hotel is conveniently located to the shopping mall, and eating establishments within walking distance. Other than the busy traffic in the area, it's a nicely located hotel. The staff are friendly and efficient.

Great location. I know this review is a little late in coming. Stayed 1 week for business at Hickam AFB 2016. There were no hotels available for short notice for large groups. Came in from Guam very tired and hungry. The front end made check in painless. The sales staff at this hotel made things happen! We got the whole unit rooms for a week. Super clean, quiet and up to date. Walking distance to the beach and the Ala Moana mall(which is also top notch). The rooms are clean, and the views are amazing. The staff is on point and always helpful. The amenities in the hotel(Starbucks, and the restaurant + shops) are super expensive, but given the location, it stands to reason. If you can't find another restaurant or shop that fits your needs/desires, then you're not trying hard enough. I would definitely stay again for my travels to Hawaii, Guam and beyond. If you want to be away from the noise and crowds of Waikiki, and you don't have to be right on the beach, I would suggest this hotel for you.

What a nice staff! The hotel is walking distance & so convenient to the mall & restaurants, clean & comfy room. We received free bottled water, complimentary parking & breakfast at no extra charge. Great kama’aina deal.

Average hotel but I love the location and friendly staff. The room size is ideal for one person which is okay cause I was alone. Bathroom is tiny too looks clean but smells no robes no sleepers available 1packet of ground coffee the other powdered creamer was old and hard lol

It has nice balconies overlooking the city and ocean views. Air conditioning is very cold and employees are super nice. The location is near an outdoor mall with the plenty of restaurants and coffee venues.

ここ数年、ハワイでの常宿になっています。ワイキキからは少し離れますが、トロリーもすぐ近くに乗り場がありますし、不便に思うことは、一切ありません。室内には電子レンジもあり、よく活用させて頂いています。今回は、3/25が母の誕生日ということで、チェックインの際に担当してくださったIwalaniさんにいろいろお願いしたところ、笑顔で快く対応してくださったり、本当に感謝しています。また近々行く予定にしているので、お会い出来るのが楽しみです！I have a new reservation,so I looking forward to seeing you,Iwa-san!!!

visited a friend staying there, ate on floor that overlooks city and ocean. Good location can walk close to big shopping mall. Huge lobby with a starbucks and many places in lobby and at Starbucks to sit. My friend is a flight attendant and stays there often.

The parking should’ve been included, also the pool was in an alleyway, about the size of a refrigerated truck. Nice hot tub though... the view from the tenth floor was just a bunch of high rises and the bath was tiny. Otherwise, staff was friendly and location was close to shopping but not the beach.

Great location convenient to all restaurants, shops and businesses in Ala Moana and Waikiki area. Freeway access good except during traffic times...travel outside of heavy traffic times and you'll be fine. Ala Moana hotel needs to apply pest control more frequently--saw a roach in my room during the 2 times I visited over a 2 week period.
user_name:
Cynthia J. C
Lahaina, United States

review_body: I enjoyed staying at Ala Moana Hotel. Check in was super fast. The lobby is nice and there is a Starbucks and shops. It’s also connected to Ala Moana mall from the second floor which is convenient. Our floor also had ice and water machine so we could fill up our bottles everyday. Washrooms are clean but room felt a little old. Overall I was happy with the hotel!

This hotel has an amazing location. You have everything you need within walking distance. The mall, the beach, liquor store, and restaurants. I also see many tour companies picking up outside in the morning. I love the balconies and beds are pretty comfortable. You don’t get as many pillows as a typical hotel but I’m sure they would bring you more. There is a decent size refrigerator and a microwave in the room which is really nice. They design is dated but it is clean and comfortable.

The room had roaches and ants. The ground of the shower was dirty and water went everywhere. Unfortunately we were by the elevators and you can hear it going up and down from the room. The location is good but I wish we stayed somewhere else.

The room that I booked was standard mountain view. Just a bit disappointed on the view as the mountains were far and you will see it in between buildings on a nice clear day. The clearest view was the car park outside my verandah. The room itself is on the small side especially there was 4 of us in the room. On the plus side, location is great. It’s central to everything, right next door is the Ala Moana Center, being shopaholics we absolutely loved this. Walking distance also to Ala Moana Park which is a better option than Waikiki Beach.

We spent 10 night in Honolulu at the Ala Moana hotel. The facilities were great. It's located right next to a massive shopping centre and across a road from the shore front. Our departure was delayed by our airline and that's when this hotel showed it's quality. We were offered a late checkout and the use of a suite to shower and change before we left. It's this kind of great customer service that really means a lot to some people. Thanks so much to the crew at Ala Moana hotel.

I stayed at the hotel for 5 nights and the staff are lovely. The rooms are so small and dated that it looks dirty. Marks and stains on the bathroom vanity, bedside table and bathroom floor. Had to upgrade to the tower as the hotel does not offer twin beds. The hotel offered breakfast for 1 person only - this was very disappointing.Staff are great and location handy - but would not recommend this hotel.

Rooms are pleasant/clean with ocean views, micros and small refrigerators, and the staff is very friendly and helpful. It is not the most convenient hotel to Waikiki Beach (others are right ON the beach), but for us, this was a bonus. The beach hotels are overrun with people. Very convenient to the adjacent mall, which has very good eating establishments on the upper levels of the mall. It is about a 15 minute walk to Ala Moana Park & lagoon or slightly longer to reach Waikiki Beach. You can’t send your young teens by themselves, in my opinion, as the walk to Waikiki is along a VERY busy street. The valets are professional, friendly and offer fast service. They will answer questions about local places if asked. Pool is located on the roof at floor #3, with large towels and plenty of lounge chairs (though they could use a cleaning). We enjoyed our stay. PS WiFi was not working in our room for the entire 7 day stay, so we used up our data lickety split :(

We always enjoy the Ala Moana Hotel when we stay. Our accommodations are usually the one bedroom suite which is perfect for our little family. Despite our roach encounter we are pleased with the hotel and the location.

Great staff, room and free breakfast and parking. Room was quiet, very clean, and comfortable. Breakfast was great. Short walk to Ala Moana Shopping Center. I will recommend this hotel to all of my friends and family.

We always get great customer service from the check in staff, to the person who made out reservations, and the housekeeping staff. when we stay at the hotel the make sure our needs are met every time. And the deal we got was THE BEST. We plan on staying there next year again.

Hotel was very convenient to mall and convention center. This helped our budget by not having to rent a vehicle. Our youth could go to the mall without supervision and me worrying while I relaxed at the hotel! It was great!

Hotel was very busy throughout our weekend stay, but as always, hotel staff were cordial and polite...central location of the property make this hotel a must stay. Only recommendation is to improve the valet desk; key storage box too small to house all the keys making it difficult to locate guest car keys.

Ala Moana was so awesome to stay at while on our vacation. We love the Starbucks and huge shopping mall. We could see the beach and watched fireworks from our balcony in our room. We loved that all the tours we went on, the tour bus came to that hotel. Very convenient!

We liked the room which was very cozy and quiet, but we were not satisfied with room temperature. It was little chilly. The temperature controler didn’t work to raise up more than 70 digrees F. “All the hotels in Honolulu are same because Hawaian climate is warm,” they said. But I have not comfirmed it and am not sure. But, I will make reservation again Ala Moana Hotel If I visit again Honolulu. The breakfast buffet was very good. Taegill Ryu

Writing this review while we are still here. Staying for a week and so far it has been just an average hotel. The location is nice plenty of parking within the hotel. Service has been a bit lacking but the staff is very friendly. Was not advised on internet access. Was not given information on where the amenities were, i.e. laundry, pool, fitness center etc. Had to remind staff about room request on check in, it was not busy. Pool deck area was dirty, could be from construction in the area but then clean the deck area more often. Pool is not heated so it is quite chilly right now. Fitness center was okay. Easy and quick access to the mall. The Plantation Cafe breakfast buffet is not worth the $37 for two. They did not have a large selection at the buffet. A sign at the table states you can order omelets and such but there is no cook station at the buffet.The room was clean but the fixtures looked dated. Had a good view of the city/mountains. The price was not not too bad considering it included taxes and parking. I would stay here again.

Ala Moana is something extraordinary beautiful, I had a room with a stunning sight, I could saw the Pacific Ocean and the town just looking out the window. It’s a luxury hotel and I spent great time in there! Awesome ✌

The location is ideally close to Ala Moana Center, Ala Moana Beach Park, convention center, and Neal Blaisdell Center. The rooms are very nice with comfortable beds. The insulation from outside noise could improve as we were woken very early by dumpsters being emptied.

we have stayed here before and it was quite good. this time we couldn't even get a wifi signal, when we asked reception we were told to keep trying other rooms until one worked!!! Of Course none of them worked most of the time.... the property is in need of a revamp. will be looking for somewhere else next time

Wasted day waiting around to check in after very early morning arrival, was given misleading map how to get to room which led me to nowhere, had to ask two security guards before one showed me total different direction in "old block" with no ocean views but could look out at other buildings! was offered early check in or sea views for another $60 odd dollars per day even though it was requested on my booking for both.On day prior to checkout i went to reception and asked for wake up call at 4.15am to get ride to airport, just as well i was a light sleeper because the wake up call didn't eventuate missed out on shower to get down to awaiting driver, so thanks for no help with what i wanted with room etc and no wake up call, only friendly staff member was concierge. Wont be staying here again.

We enjoyed our three day stay at the hotel. Being close the the mall was great. We did not realize there was no room service available from the hotel as it is more condo-tel. Buffet breakfast in the lobby cafe each morning. Very nice and reasonably priced for Honolulu. The Starbucks in the lobby was good to have. Also the Kama'aina rate we got included free parking which was a good value for parking rates in Honolulu. See picture below about a problem with the entry door. Not a big deal and would not stop us from staying here again. Just a maintenance issue to address.

Beautiful lobby and friendly staff -- walking distance to nearby beach and 20 min walk to Waikiki Beach. Love close proximity to mall - with lots of entertainment, restaurants and great theme bars. Signature restaurant had wonderful views!!

1. In our room, 3132, in the Waikiki Tower, the following did not work properly: microwave, fridge, and radio. A/C could not be adjusted. TV remote was only partially operational.2. No maid service was offered for five days, Monday through Friday. None offered during our stay. Complicated process to obtain a roll of toilet paper, involving a not-very-enthusiastic staffer.3. Staff not enthusiastic about helping. Said our room was “private,” and, therefore, not eligible for service.4. We found on our own that a portion of rooms are operated by Luxury Resorts International. No contact information for this company could be obtained. But it seems to be a sort of a hotel within a hotel.5. Breakfast server told us that, because we are senior citizens, the meal was “comped.” We were, however, charged $16.32 each at the register, where the cashier offered us an argument about the issue. In fact, the overall staff attitude did not reflect the “aloha” spirit in which Hawaiians seem to take great pride. Rather, staff appeared to believe quite the opposite: that the burden for issue solutions rests with the customers.

Property is located next to the Ala Moana Shopping Center - convenient. Would recommend valet, since parking is tight in the basement. Service at the front desk was ok, for the level of the property. Valets were ok, some were great and others were ok, I had to ask them to load my suitcases.

This Hotel is very clean, very big and is in an excellent position near the shopping Centre andalso th the airport, but still in the area to get down to the beach and shopping strip. We onlyStayed a night but it was very good, friendly staff and plenty of amenities.

Some lovely staff My only complaint would be a lack of service. We couldn’t post our postcards and we were not able to get a driver booked from a company they didn’t recommend. Being from overseas we couldn’t use our mobiles. Room was ok, the view was of a car park,though so lucky we didn’t spend too much time in the room.

Got the discount rate and saved big and got a free breakfast buffet too. I really loved the pool, the buffet, and also the huge and deep bathtub. The proximity to the mall with good, cheap eats was a plus. I also loved the staff- who were kind and efficient. The room was also spic and span, and had all that one expects in a good hotel. The TV did go in and out, but Wi-Fi was excellent. The lobby has oodles of shops, and places to sit- a Starbucks. The 2nd floor connects to the Ala Moana Shopping center- so go there for meals, and needs. There is a trolley bus and regular bus to Waikiik, or take a nice walk. So happy with cleanliness, service, accommodations. Some rooms do not have a balcony so choose for it if you want.

Pretty good. Bed wasn't the greatest and the cards to get upstairs and the room didn't work so it made it difficult to get around with luggage but once it was fixed it was a good experience especially for a work trip.

Didn't like the area that much, we should have stayed on the North Shore. However, the hotel was fine... no issues there. Room was spacious and were able to park without issue. Just too busy and congested around this area.

We had a stopover in Hawaii so only stayed a night. Perfect for getting over jetlag and a spot of shopping. Staffs were friendly. Clean hotel. However I must point out.We were on floor 7 of the Kona tower and when you got out of elevator it smelt like a bad rubbish smell. Overall would recommend for a night or two. Good value for money

I always stay at the Ala Moana since it's so close to the mall, the Convention Center, and right at the beginning of Waikiki. It is just the right amount of comfort away from home. We stay here when we want to try out a new place or event and don't want to drive all the way back home, a mini staycation.

Shopping, dining and views. What else could you ask for? Every amenity is within walking distance. A great place to stay! This was my second stay here in 3 months and the customer service is excellent. From hotel staff to security officers, everyone is so nice! Keep up the great work Ala Moana Hotel! Mahalo!

Enjoyed convenient location next to shopping center. Room was small but okay. Bed was small for heavy person, so had to use sofa-sleeper. Request for late room check-out could only be made during day of check-out, still housekeeper came by early to clean the room. Have had better service in past years.

A couple weeks ago we stay in one of the junior suites, it was the best staycation ever! We had the best service everyone was so nice and accommodating. The room we stayed in was gorgeous! In the living area you could open the huge sliding door and enjoy your meals with an amazing view while enjoying the comfort of the room. On our last day there my boyfriend proposed to me in front of the gorgeous view! I will forever love the Alomoana hotel!

Ala Moana Hotel has a great location, a 3 minute walk to Ala Moana Shopping Center (down the back door ramp) makes it a very convenient place to stay. Kona Towel rooms are VERY small, but Waikiki Tower rooms are ok.

To celebrate our Wedding Anniversary we planned this "stay-cation". Upon arriving we found a plate of Chocolate dipped Strawberries along with a personal handwritten note of congratulations from the hotel manager! That was a nice touch! The room was clean and comfortable.The check-in and check- out staff were friendly, We really enjoyed our stay.

We had to keep extending our stay and the front desk staff got it done. The hotel public areas are nice and the lobby Starbucks makes morning coffee an easy task. The ocean view with lanai was great with added fireworks on Friday night. The room was a bit small, but worked. Housekeeping was great. Easy access to Ala Moana shopping Center with numerous restaurants.

I have stayed at the Ala Moana many times, usually when business or shopping needs take us to Oahu. I vaguely remember when the hotel underwent renovation, maybe a decade ago. It does not look too bad, though the tubs are too tall for anyone with disabilities. But as far as decor, you can do much worse in Waikiki.The matresses, however, have decayed over many years of constant use to the point that the have no resilience. A week later, my back is still screwed up.

Ala Moana Hotel is a nice hotel, located next to the Ala Moana Mall. Buses and trolleys pick up and drop off at the mall, making it very easy to get around the island. There is shopping attached to the hotel, including a Starbucks and convenience type store. Each room has a balcony, or maybe it’s a lanai here. There is a table and 2 chairs on the lanai. The room also has a small fridge, microwave and coffee maker.

The hotel is large and clean with a Starbucks and a convenience store in the lobby. Malia at the Tours Desk was fabulous! The room I had was clean and tidy but had a view of a parking lot. The buffet leaves a bit to be desired with cold food and rather expensive for those that have to pay. Location is brilliant with the Ala Moana Centre being right next door, which is on a major bus route, and Ala Moana Beach park just across the road, which in my opinion is way nicer than Waikiki Beach. Nice gym ans sauna facilities too. I will definitely stay here again.

While Ala Moana Hotel is a solid value/ middle of the road hotel for Oahu, there are others that offer a nicer front desk experience and better quality rooms for comparable and even better prices. We first stayed here (in the Waikiki Tower) in November 2016 and were impressed enough with our experience that we have been waiting to book here again- our family set us up in different hotels on subsequent visits.Because we were treated so well in our previous visit, and the room was so nice, when we had the opportunity to choose Ala Moana we booked our 10 day stay here once again, figuring that our second stay would be as nice as our previous stay, especially since we were spending more money for the same level of quality. In fact I was so happy with our previous treatment, that I brought a gift package I put together in Maine along for the person who set us up so well and was so kind to me on the phone while I booked this special yearly trip!When we arrived after our 13+ hour trip, there was no "Thank you for staying with us again" (as with other hotels in the area) and we were given a much lower quality room- right in front of elevators ( one of the first things I ask to avoid), with a much smaller - bathroom and multiple dings and dents in the walls - very obvious wear and tear. I was stunned, and not in a good way.After flying for over 13 hours, this was a huge let-down. I asked for a nicer room, one comparable to the one we had last time, and we were again given a room close to elevators, one floor up from the original dumpy room, but thankfully in much better condition, with less (apparent) wear and tear. I need to add that we were spending much more at this point for a less nice room than before. We settled for this room and were told it had been upgraded to an "ocean view". Let me just refer the reader at this point to my Nov. 2016 last review and photos of the Partial Ocean View - it was re-classified, not upgraded as we had way less of an ocean view than before. Same floor, much further away from the ocean, definitely a partial not a full. This was no upgrade. In the sunlight you could see multiple, "slapdash" and uneven paint brush strokes, and smudges on the ceiling and over the doors. For a cheaper room, this could be over looked, but some of us save and budget for a nice experience and when it falls short, we feel cheated.The front desk was only kind early on when I asked to change rooms, but when checking out the man could not have been colder or more disinterested. No customary "How was your stay", or 'Thank you for staying with us". I waited a moment for him to at least say "Thanks or have a nice trip home" ...He just gave me a blank stare and said exactly: " Do you want a printed receipt, or what?" Not what I expected after spending US$3000.00 on a NON-beach front, mid-range three star hotel.Also not once was there an acknowledgement of the gift bag from Maine I brought - so I'm not even certain it made it to the right person.What a disappointment. I spent a lot of time choosing fun goodies from Maine that I thought she would like. I was so bothered by this whole lackluster experience that when we were waiting for the valets to bring our car, I popped back in and mentioned how disappointed I was with my experiences here to the concierge. She apologized, took my name and room number, and I expected a call or an email from management to ask me more, but none came in 4 days --hence this review. I always give a business the chance to make things better before leaving a negative review, and again, Ala Moana fell very short.The lobby and especially the second floor where it opens to the shopping center had a strong sour, odd moldy/bathroom smell. The pool looked sketchy, with black mold stains on the surrounding floor.Lastly, the elevators are in serious need of repair, there was one that kept breaking and stalling during our stay and they would get so crowded that it was an ordeal coming and going.Sadly I would have to recommend that if you travel 5000+ miles for a treasured, special vacation, that you definitely consider other hotels.This is a very poor value, overpriced for the level of service and quality of rooms.The positives: Excellent housekeeping serviceExcellent valet serviceProximity to shopping and downtown amenitiesStarbucks in the lobbyPartial Ocean View ( but please do NOT call it a full ocean view when partially blocked by two or more buildings)

Itʻs our honor to stay at the Ala Moana hotel with the excellent service provided by itʻs staff. Excellent location, close to where our events were held, the girls state basketball tournament. Thank you as always for allowing us to enjoy our mini vacation. Take care!

My husband and I stayed here for business and leisure- very convenient location for the convention center. Staff were friendly, but the best part was the room and the view! We were on the 28th floor and had a corner room so were able to look out over practically the entire city and the absolutely stunning mountains. We loved watching the sunrises and sunsets from the balcony. The room was spacious with enough storage and a large bathroom. Walking distance to Ala Moana Beach Park which we really enjoyed because it is much quieter than Waikiki Beach. Close to many great restaurants as well as right next door to the incredible mall with high end stores and places to eat- amazing! We would absolutely stay again. Thank you!!

Clean and nicely modeled. comfortable with great staff.This hotel is in a great location for the conference center and shopping. Is also within walking distance of Waikiki /Beach. We will return one day.

We arrived at noon on 2/06/2019 room was ready but it was a doble bed we booked a king room. we were switch to a king with a view to the ocean. We were helped by Jasmin and Justin both of them have great customer skills please nominate them for the employee of the month. Their were alway smile and ready to attend our needs.

My flight arrived about 6.30am so when I tried to check in at the hotel at about 7.30am, they said the room wasn't ready and to check back again at 12 noon. The official check in time is 3pm. I did check back just after 12 and they were able to check me in.The room was clean and comfortable, a little small but most hotel rooms are in Honolulu. I notice the carpet was a little torn in the front of the room.The best thing I liked about the Ala Moana Hotel was it's location just next to the Ala Moana Shopping Mall and across the road from the Ala Moana park. There's a handy Star Bucks and Convenience Shop in the hotel. Security and the Bell service is very good.A good hotel to stay in if you don't want the hustle and bustle of Waikiki.
user_name:
Chrissy B
Auckland Region, New Zealand

review_body: We stayed at Ala Moana Hotel for a week. The room was cleaned daily with fresh toiletteries and linen. The best part was that the Ala Moana mall was just a sky walk away. Excellent stay. Highly recommended.

Good location for conference centre but not near Waikiki beach. Hotel pool is good and exercise centre are good. Hotel is tired (needs renovation and updating) and lack of own bar and restaurant are negatives.

Hosted a large conference at Hawaii convention center, this hotel provided the convenience via proximity to meetings, restaurants, and a Starbucks in the hotel. Not far from the beach, good 11 minute walk. I needed to better business walking shoes, the hotel has a walkway to the mall parking lot (literally it’s the hotel’s backyard).The room is no frills pretty standard but it does include a microwave, and mini fridge. I requested for a higher floor, was surprised with a wonderful ocean view upgrade (photo). The hotel is surrounded with building so ocean view is at a distance. Overall nice and clean hotel for your business traveler

Positives: Great Location - Hotel is right next to Ala Moana Shopping Center, nice size fridge and a microwave, room was clean Negatives: Very small room with even smaller bathroom, beds did not come with comforters, very thin walls - you can easily hear people in the hallway and neighboring rooms, self parking very confusing and in much need of a renovation, check in line very long and lobby filled with luggage.

I usually travel to Hawaii all by myself and comfortably stay at Ala Moana Hotel. I took my family with me for the first time in three years. Ala Moana Hotel is in perfect location. I do not have to drive into Waikiki area. My family can walk to Ala Moana Center, DonQuijote and Walmart. Room rate is reasonable.

Will not visit Hawaii, next year. Wrote review in the previous page. Warm and friendly feeling gone. Very noisy Chinese family, children running around screaming at night. No progress after calling Front Desk for help.

I reserved an ocean view room in the Waikiki Tower. I could see the ocean when I went out to the balcony but couldn't from my room, which was a bit disappointing. Otherwise, I was very satisfied with my recent stay. The location was great for attending an event at the Hawaii Convention Center!

We had so much fun and the front desk gentleman was so kind and helpful. The luggage checkers were not as kind and helpful and were a little grouchy. But, it was ok because everyone else was so nice. We will be back.

Room was great, nice firm king size bed, AND THERE WAS A BATHTUB!!! Coffee pot was appreciated, micro & fridge a plus. The complimentary water bottles and bag for Mantra members AND free parking for kama'aina will definitely make the difference when I look for accommodations again. Mahalo, Mantra Ala Moana!

1) It took too long time to check in, probably because it was the most busy time, but I think, you can increase the number of staff at the reception depenging on the number of waiting guests.2) The temperature of my room was a little too cold and it was unable to increase it. Fortunately, however, I could get an additional blanket after asking the housekeeping department.3) The restaurant was fairly good, either food or reception.

We stayed on the 29th floor and we had an awesome view. The staff was great and the bed was very comfortable. The pool was nice but really cold. Checkin went quickly was disappointed with the cost of parking, there should be a better discount if staying at the hotel. The Plantation resturant was a rip off for the selection and price.

Stayed for 4 days and was super comfortable. Room was spacious. Elevators were quick and parking garage was below. Parking will cost about 25 to 30 dollars per day, but it is convenient since you will not have to search for street parking.

Awesome service for our staycation. Staff was excellent great member service. Hotel room was nice n clean. We had a Great view. This is Must stay again. I Will definitely refer friends and family to Staying here.

You do not have to use the key card on the elevator on the way down. Had a nice view of the ocean between the buildings. Starbucks was great! Pick-up for excursions were right at the hotel and the concierges were excellent

Great location and great staff. The bell staff and concerige were friendly and very helpful. We love the Eco Friendly clothing store in the hotel. We will definitely stay there again and recommend it to friends and relatives.

The Ala Moana hotel is a well kept resort in a great location with friendly staff. They have a good Kama'aina rate and if you join the Mantra club, you get nice perks like water, Starbucks and free late check out.

Good location, good value, older tower needs update. Staying for business, so location and value are important. Would like a full service dining spot in hotel other then a high end restaurant for a quick dinner. Starbucks doesn't replace a meal. Mall next door with lots of options, if you have time or are not exhausted after a long business day.

location is great. easy to access. however, plantation cafe for breakfast which include my deal, won't go back there ever. terrible terrible service I ever got. too old mattress makes very uncomfortable sleep.

We’re from Maui & we have time share at Hilton but for the last year we’ve been staying at Ala Moana Hotel for the convenience & shopping & playground at the Mall and especially for the Plantation Cafe where the kids enjoy the breakfast buffet .

The location and facility is great. Service still has a big room to improve. We had a poor sleeping experience during cold winter night with only a thin blanket. Housekeeping staff was not friendly nor helpful.Check in and check out is good

I arrived at this hotel (LSI Resorts by Ala Moana) yesterday to stay for a conference. Upon arrival, the room's door was open! As soon as I entered the room, there was a strong smell of urination on the beds, the bathroom had signs of black mold, and it was evident that it had not been cleaned since the previous guest. I called them to clean the room, but they said there is no maintenance scheduled for my entire stay. I asked them for a refund, but they refused. I deeply regret my decision to book a room with this hotel. I spent $1000 on it, and it went straight to the trash. I captured an insect on my clothes this morning, which resembles a lot like a bed bug. I am not sure at the moment 100% if it is indeed a bed bug. I am contacting some lawyers at the moment to inquire about the feasibility of a lawsuit against the Luxury Resorts of Ala Moana.

Room was small and did not realize it was an “economy” room before hand. Queen sized bed should just be non existent in hotel rooms. Third party booking made it difficult to know exactly what we were booking. Good hotel, but I’ve been in better rooms.

Check-in staff at reception were rude and not welcoming at all. They are not wanting to got the extra mile to ensure you have a great stay. The hotel bell desk could have been better and not one staff memeber ever said Aloha during my stay. The pool is always crowded and the rooms are dated and could be better looked after. Airpads who manages some of the rooms like the one I stayed in could have better cleaned the room and put more amenities in the room prior to arrival. This hotel is falsely advertised on some online booking sites. I will not be staying here again as the staff let me down. Check-in processing was so long because not everyone was on the computers!! I expected more from this Mantra branded hotel as I have stayed at other Mantra properties and they are much better!Location is good though and is close to Ala Moana Shopping Centre and is a short 40min walk from Waikiki.
user_name:
Luke R
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: Beware to customers reserving at Ala Moana Resorts via priceline because it is not honored! We reserved at Ala Moana Hotel on 1/31/19 via priceline because the deal was good deal with 3 stars. But upon arrival, the receptionist did not have our reservation and charged us an additional $200 on top of what we paid on Priceline! The additional charges ere $19.40 accommodations, $95 cleaning fee, tourist tax $16.49, and a random $65.44. Meanwhile Priceline charged us $114.40 for the room and $35 hotel fee. If Ala Moana does not want to work with Priceline, then they shouldn't list themselves with them! We are disatisfied. We were planning to stay there for during the SACNAS Oct 2019 conference but we will not stay there. We will stay at the other host hotel which is Hilton Waikiki Beach. No thanks Ala Moana, this is false advertising!

We make our once-a-year trek to Ala Moana Hotel during the Super Bowl weekend (while the husbands take over the house to watch the game). Ala Moana Hotel is the best place to stay. Always a "no hassle" place to stay ... can't ask for more. Housekeepers are so polite - always! (Rooms are always clean and ready for the guests.) Front desk are friendly and accommodating! Valets are quick to respond!

With 2 towers this hotel obviously can handle many guests. Corridors are long as there are so many rooms. Maintenance of fixtures and fitting is kept to high standard. Pool area seemed nice, and well the gym although not tried beyond looking in, seemed big and well equiped for a hotel. Having Starbucks inside on ground floor was a bonus I enjoyed. But hotel has visual areas of wasted space and opportunity. It is aging slightly in terms of retail and dining offerings. The Plantation breakfast was only so-so. Rooms were big and included a mini fridge and microwave. Microwave to me seemed overkill for a room without a full kitchenette. But perhaps that's standard for Hawaii and needs of mainland visitors. Staff were very good whenever i needed assistance.

Arrived early after a long international flight and was able to check bags in until 3.00pm check in. Whilst waiting for check we went on a Pink Trolley bus aroud Waikiki. Back at Ala Moana 1.00pm and were able to get checked in early. Room was originally views of Kona Mountains or city but was given a ocean view room on the 8th floor room 853.Small room but all amenities for a 2 night stay.This location was very good if you want to see the Ala Moana shopping centre, 300+ shops, can get totally lost.The cost from the airport for a taxi was $35.00 each way whilst a return shuttle bus was $64.00.The Kona Tower has 13 floors, the Waikiki Tower up to 36 floors.Great service, clean, friendly and nice accommodation.

The hotel is conveniently located and the rooms were nice and clean. Service by room cleaners was terrific. As a kamaaina it was just too expensive for our family. We can find a place that is more reasonable next time. Air BnBs are also much more cost effective these days. Everything about the hotel was great. It’s just the price that would prevent me from returning b

Though the room size was smaller than those advertised on the website, the room rates were decent and the guest services were very friendly. However, when I got in the shower the first night there was hair on the wall from another guest and it made me doubt the cleanliness of the entire room! Additionally the smoke detector was set off by steam from the shower (annoying). Otherwise the stay was fine, location was good.

The stay was entirely pleasant in all ways except for the initial registration when the clerk led me to believe a room with 2 beds might not be available because it was only 2:30pm but grudgedly there was. There was no smile, no aloha of any kind and only when we were leaving the parking for the last time did we learn the parking was free which was terrific news. I had asked the clerk about paying for parking and he said the parking people took care of that ?????

I traveled from Kauai for a business meeting downtown and stayed the weekend to attend the University of Hawaii volleyball match. The location was very central to both events and conveniently adjacent to the Mall so I didn't have to drive and deal with parking. Having the sundries store and Starbucks in the hotel was also nice. Great customer service too...very efficient check in and check out.

My room was clean. The hotel is right next to the largest open air mall (literally right across the street). Also walking distance to the beach. There is no hotel pool, but again, the beach is close. There’s a Starbucks in the lobby. Parking was kind of expensive at $25/day for self parking and $30 for valet.

Like i said, overall everything was very good, every staff member we passed said Hello, Aloha, or at lease Hi and smile. All was good except the 10 extra guest in the bathroom in the morning.We will be back.

The key didn’t work most of the time and it was frustrating having to get stuck in the elevator with other guest and missed my room. Room wasn’t clean in the morning where I was out and only cleaned late when business is done.

Rooms were clean, friendly staff, has self parking (or valet if you choose), and is right next to the mall. The bathroom had a tub/shower for the kids. Exactly what we needed. It’s not a resort though, so just know that when booking.

The team members are always friendly and provides great service. All the amenities of the resort are great. The location for me is very convenient being near shopping and restaurants. It's very Kama'aina friendly and enjoy the Kama'aina deals.

Stayed for 1 week in January 2019. Easy walk to the Ala Moana Shopping Center, next door. Another easy walk across the street to the park and beach.Want to see Honolulu? The tour buses all stop at Ala Moana Center. There are also city bus stops right outside the front door. Easy to navigate to Diamond Head or other tourist stops.DO book the delicious breakfast buffet with your room. It is convenient, and a very good buffet: fruit, breads, eggs, bacon and sausage, rice, potatoes, cereals, yogurt, and sweets.

Good location, nice rooms, acceptable amenities. Great access to the shopping center. Rooms could be cleaner. Elevators can be very busy depending on the time of day. Friendly staff. Good A/C. Nice towels. Showers are OK. Amenities included are minimal. Difficult to get soap out of its packaging.

Our room was great. My only complaint was that the bed was much too soft. The front desk clerk was very accommodating and was able to find us another room since ours wasn't ready when we check in. Check out was fast too.

The hotel was older, but very neat and clean and the beds were super comfortable. We really liked the location and proximity to shopping, local beaches and public transport. Away from the tourist strip but within 15 minutes walk of both Waikiki and Honolulu CBD it was great for us as we like to do lots of walking and sightseeing, not just lying on the beach.

I've been to Honolulu before and stayed at places that weren't as nice and twice the price. We got a great deal and really loved being off the beaten path but able to walk to everything quite easily - parks, beach, convention center, shopping, restaurants, etc. Also, it was easy to get a taxi or Uber as well as a tour bus.
