The staff was amazing. The only *minor* complaint is that the Starbucks in the lobby was fairly slow... very friendly but sometimes you just need to grab some coffee and go.

The mini refrigerator was leaking water...i guess it was defrosting???..but awesome service.They moved us right away and because i really wanted a single bed instead of 2 beds.I put it in my notes and so right away they switched our rooms.Awesome service again thank Ala Moana Hotel

the Ala Moana Hotel is very conveniently located in Honolulu. A quick cab ride in THE CAB gets you anywhere you want to visit. Or a nice walk. the Staff are all helpful and quick to get what you need. I'll be back.

Ala Moana Hotel is always my first pick if I need to stay in Honolulu for work or for play. The location is convenient. The valet guys are always so awesome! I practically lived at the hotel for 2 weeks a couple of years ago while going through training and I have seen the hotel transform into what it is now. The Starbucks is convenient and the store carries almost anything you might need. The only thing I wish is that they take care of the regular Kamaainas that stay with you. After the two weeks, I stayed with you every month for 2 years and never once had an upgrade to ocean view or any other perks.

perfect for a small families, my boys wore out the pool. However, invest in a bar at the pool area, this is a great spot to visit with people and watch the kids at the same time. Our families on Oahu came to visit but not able to have a few drinks and stay close enough to watch the kids.

Our purpose was an event at Ala Moana Beach Park. We look forward to stay at Ala Moana Hotel not only the convenience location but we're always treated as family there. Team & Staffs are Awesome. A hui Ho.

Experience at check-in not great, rude guest service agent Terrence. The room was clean, comfortable and for an overnight stay perfect. Location great and walking distance to Ala Moana Shopping Center.

Loved this hotel. Heidi at check in made us feel so welcome and our room was huge with a great city view that sparkled beautifully at night. Saldy cleaned our room immaculately each morning, asking us what time was convenient for us. Once, I asked for an extra glass and he noticed some dust on it and washed it before giving it to me. Water vending machines by the lifts ensured we weren't buying and throwing away endless plastic water bottles.  There were also recycling bins by the lifts. The only reason I haven't given it 5 stars is because unfortunately not all the reception staff were as warm and friendly as Heidi. Same for the bell desk: Cynthia at the bell desk seemed like smiling or giving a warm greeting was the hardest thing in the world. Would be nice to have more consistency with the staff.

Room 1161 was very small and only had a double bed. The floors were not mopped and clean when we arrived, but we thought it would be taken care of the next day- it was not. Your parking attendants for the Valet were AWESOME. They had my vehicle ready each of the mornings I had to head out for work.

I had some amazing time at this hotel With my friends,, Very posh and well kept. I would never forget the views.. the comfort and the nearby shopping mall and beaches.. location is ideal and staff was great.. pools were marvellous..

a little too far away from the main city of Waikiki, spent a lot of time walking quite far and catching buses everywhere. Rooms a little too small also, as there was 3 of us. You can hear a lot of noise also coming from the floors above, difficult to sleep at night

Decent for the price paid, but the customer service wasn't that great. We had to call 3 times for an extra blanket, and there were none so housekeeping gave us 5 sheets. It was rather heavy and didn't do much.

This was my first trip to Honolulu, the island is beautiful but Ala Moana has seen better days. The corridor leading to our room had a weird sewer smell. The room was clean but tremendously dated. I kept waiting for a critter to come out at any minute. The mattress was horrible as well. On the plus side, I did have a very small balcony and a partial ocean view. The Lobby is very nice and there is a great Starbucks on-site. Despite, those positive aspects, they were not enough for me to ever recommend this hotel.

We love staying at the Ala Moana Hotel in Waikiki. It offers a perfect location, great customer service, parking, restaurants on site and also offers great Kama`aina rates. We never worry about cleanliness, or parking on side streets or Wi Fi..We love it!

If you want or need sleep, this is not the hotel for you. We were in Honolulu for the HURT 100 race and had a runner with us. There was so much noise from floors above and the hallway none of us could sleep and there is no ice machine in the area of the hotel were our room was located

Ok service, clean room and Starbucks that opens at 5am. Do not come here if you want excellent service, the staff were not bad & were friendly but I had a lot of waiting around when I was trying to check in and not much help. Bag holding available if you arrive early and excellent location for shopping, right round the corner from ala Moana mall. About 10-15 mins by car to Waikiki beach. Shopping mall has plenty of food places and a supermarket, go to California pizza kitchen if you are gluten free and want an easy dinner! Bathroom had good water pressure too. Overall not too shabby.

I would recommend not staying in the Kona tower if you like fresh air and a Lanai. We had a false emergency alarm at 1am and never received a phone call explaining what was going on. Other than that it is a nice location and close to the mall. Restaurants are good.

We stayed here for during the Transpacific AAU Volleyball Tournament which was held down the street at the Hawaii Convention Center. Everything was so convenient to walk to. Parking garage was easy to get in and out of lots of parking we didn’t need to worry about parking at the events parking and paying $10 a day there. Starbucks in the lobby area a plus. 2nd floor had access to the Alamoana Mall where we went one night for dinner and did some shopping. The pool hours could of been longer closed at 5pm so not much swim time when we got back every day from the Tournament. Our room was a little small but the view was beautiful. Breakfast buffet was awesome. Entire staff super friendly and helpful ❤️

Great location. Would have been great to have been advised on check in about hotel facilities and their location. Pleased that breakfast was included in my room rate. Plantation serving staff were great and extremely hard working.

We had to extend our stay in Hawaii due to snow storm Harper. Our flights were cancelled and we were recommended the Ala Moana by a friend. She was spot on. Right across from a beach park with lots of places to sun and swim along with public restrooms and showers. The view was spectacular. The staff was super helpful when I called and explained our situation and need for last minute reservations. If you have to be stuck might as well be in paradise.

I made a reservation through Amex Travel on 1.14.19 for the week. Since it was the 14th they could only make my reservation from the 15th through the 18th. So I went onto Ala Moana's site and made a reservation for the one night of the 14th.I checked in around 11:30 to midnight on the 14th. I explained my two reservations and the front desk person said my reservations were separate and they were made in two different towers. I asked if they had room if they could just give me the same room so I would not need to check out and check back in. They said no unless I wanted to pay an extra $80 for the night. They then said that I could just come down in the morning and they would give me my new room and let me check in early to the next room. So I went down early am and they checked me out and checked me back in and let me go to the new room early that morning.Take a step back, this could have been handled a very different way.

This hotel offers consistent value. For all business meetings, I like to stay here because of its close proximity to shopping and meeting locations. Restaurants are within walking distance. Staff is always friendly. Starbucks inside the hotel offers a happy hour with wine and appetizers. Airport trips take under 30 minutes.

One night stay and very happy about it. I was here on business and needed a decent room. The price looked good as well as the pictures of the property. It is up to date with a Starbucks and ample lobby/reception areas. The bell services and parking personnel were very accommodating and kind. I am very disappointed in the noise level. Late or early around 1:00 am I could here very loud laughing and party noise from the street. It woke me up and stayed for about an hour. This disrupted sleep that I was needing after a very busy day. The same morning between 4-5 am woke up again to trash and delivery trucks picking up. I was ten floors up near the mall side. Maybe a bad location/room but not what you want if you tired.

Really enjoyed my stay and looking forward to returning. The only problems I faced was one of the two room keys didn't work properly but was easily fixed in a matter of seconds. The Bellhop was very friendly. And ultimately having Starbucks on site is the best thing happening for Ala Moana Hotel.

Great but wish rate was lower for kamaainas. The LOCALSONLY deal was still close to $200/day which is expensive. Your property is not ocean front so the ocean view rooms are more like partial ocean view. Would like to stay more often and longer if rates were more affordable for the local people.

Room 1608 has a great view of the ocean! It’s location gives a nice peep of Waikiki beach and the MOUNTAINS, too. The room size is enough for two! I hope that owners provide hair blower, coffee, sugar and creamer, some utensils, enough toiletries, like soap, shampoo and conditioner! Downside of this room is its adjacent to rooms with doors that close really loud! Therefore, hearing all the loud bangs isn’t fun at all!!!I suggest if you book here, that you bring your toiletries!

Can't beat the location. If you want to shop, Ala Moana Shopping Center is a few minutes away and you don't have to drive. If you want to eat different varieties of food, again Ala Moana SC is there or right around the corner from the hotel are many other restaurants. The sand and ocean is across the street, and again no driving necessary. Just a great place to unwind. I found that the air conditioner was too cold. I even cranked it up to 78 and I still was cold.

Great location, comfortable, clean, and safe area. I had a 4 day stay with my spouse while I had a medical procedure done at a local hospital, common for outer islanders. This hotel is my go to choice for business trips involving Honolulu. My wife will not drive in crazy Honolulu traffic, thus ideal location while she waited for the day my procedure took, and for the couple of days after while I rested before enduring the flight back home. That worked well, as easy walk to many shops at the largest shopping center in Hawaii.

It took us 45 minutes in line to get checked in. The room was small and the pillows too.But the breakfast that came with the room charge was excellent. Its proximity to the shopping center and the reasonableness of the room rate are positives.
user_name:
Hilton U
Wailuku Heights, Hawaii, United States

review_body: As a freezing compartment of refrigerator wasn't work, the Ice Cream melted down. rooom cleaning wasn't enough. I could stay here with reasonable price with breakfast. It is very convenient to go shopping for Ala Moana Shoppomg cemter.

Picked this hotel based on price and location for a five night stopover en route from Australia back to Canada.They gave us an early check in, around 11:30am, which was great after the flight from Australia and the room was spotless and very comfortable. Fridge, coffee maker and microwave are provided. Daily room cleaning was excellent and the staff at all levels were very good and competent.Location is good, a short walk to the ocean or the Ala Moana Center Mall if you want shopping. Actually the mall has a good food court in the center and a completely Asian food court at the far end, called The Japanese Village. Food prices are reasonable and the quality is good.A $2 per person trolley ride from the mall will take you to Waikiki, or you can just go the full circular route to get your bearings. City buses are $2.75 per person (includes one transfer) and will get you anywhere in Honolulu.On our departure day the flight wasn't until 11:30pm and checkout at the hotel is by 11:00am, but the hotel stored our luggage which allowed us to spend a complete day exploring downtown Honolulu. Pre-book a shuttle ride to the airport for about $15 per person, they pick you up at the side entrance and are an inexpensive efficient way to depart.A good hotel and my wife and I would definitely stay there if we return to Honolulu

The hotel is a half-hour hike from Waikiki, and don't count on driving to Waikiki and easily finding parking there. But there's a $2 shuttle bus from Ala Moana shopping center to Waikiki. And it's the proximity next door to the shopping center and its food court, as well as to Ala Moana beach park across the street, that is the main appeal of the hotel.The hotel has been refurbished over the years, but what it calls "partial ocean view" in the high-rise Waikiki Tower is an overly generous term for a sliver of a view of the water in the distance, with a view mostly that of the rooftops of surrounding parking garages. There is also a low-rise wing with no view. As for the furnishings, it's puzzling how the designers could choose desk chairs that are heavy and difficult to position at the desk -- they can't slide over the carpet, so are almost useless. In stark contrast to the modern lobby above it, the underground parking garage does not appear to have ever been refurbished and is poorly lit and dark and feels unsafe at night, particularly since anyone, even non-guests, can enter the garage through the lobby. in addition, the garage floor is oddly inclined and unevenly surfaced. It's a big, busy hotel, and woe unto anyone who arrives at the same time as the tourist buses or airline crews, with long lines stretching through the lobby -- the longest lines I've ever seen in a hotel. The crowds might help to explain the impersonal, unhelpful, and sometimes unfriendly attitude of the reception staff, a far cry from the "aloha" spirit experienced in other hotels in Hawaii.Dining options are very limited, with a ground floor cafe open only in the mornings for a pricey breakfast and a Starbucks in the lobby, plus a high-end steakhouse on a top floor. The pool area is a bare, unlandscaped concrete feature, while the gym is nicely equipped. Upon checkout, the hotel e-mails a questionnaire to guests, but a guest's uncomplimentary remarks, however constructive and well-intentioned, can result in a snarky reply from the hotel. Better to save your feedback for Trip Advisor.

The room was excellent to accommodate our business trip. Having had this great experience, we would definitely consider it again whenever we are on Oahu. You Hotel's location in close proximity to Ala Moana Shopping Center was also very convenient and allowed for walking and the necessity of having an automobile.

As I stated before the rooms lack cleanliness . I had to move rooms due to bathroom reeking of strong urine smell. Oh...the new room, well the new room had BLOOD on the bathroom floor! The carpet looks and smells like it has never been shampooed. The great thing about the hotel is it connected to a great shopping mall.

It is clean and wonderful hotel. The location was good and it was convenient for restaurants and shopping. The staff were kind, too. I want to use it again.I think that it is even better if the shower is movable. Waikiki is also close so I could walk.

Decent standard of hotel. I liked the location as it was not on the main strip so it wasn’t as touristy. They kindly sent up a kettle so that I could boil water for my own tea.Housekeeping did a great job.

Centrally located next to everything downtown! Right next to Ala Moana Shopping Plaza and across the street from the beach! We were there during the holidays and it was decorated beautifully, check in was seemless, the staff very pleasant. We were in the Kona Tower and the room was smaller than expected, but we did have an ocean view which was priceless! Great value!

The staff are very helpful when organizing off-Island field trips. Able to pay with purchase order (many hotels do not allow this option for schools). Adjacent mall is very convenient for my students to purchase their meals. Rooms are clean and all basic amenities provided. Free WiFi is appreciated, especially when you are traveling with a lot of teenagers.

Our room was in Kona Tower; quiet, good views, and comfortable bed. Staff were always friendly and helpful. We were centrally located for the business part of our trip; Ala Moana Beach was great, just across the street and la bit further, Waikiki beach.

The room temperatures at night are around 72 C in January and there are no heaters in the hotel. But, the staff will provide extra blankets as needed. Remember to plan ahead. There is easy access to the Ala Moana shopping mall from the 2nd floor. The mall is very large and has a huge selection of fast foods in the basement. The main city buss transfer points are located at the mall and make it very easy to get most anywhere on the island at an affordable price. The buses run frequently and the drivers are very helpful with getting on the correct bus. You can pay $2.75 a ride or $5.50 a day or weekly and monthly passes. There is a large park across from the mall and a beach that is very child friendly as there are no waves due to a reef just off shore. Very good views of Diamondhead and the city from the park.

Ala Moana Hotel is adjacent to the shopping mall of the same name. Our room was teenyweeny but frankly that's all we needed. The similarly named beach park is a block away across (guess what) Ala Moana Boulevard. This hotel is right on the airport-side edge of Waikiki Beach and all the more notable hotels. No problem finding a restaurant. There are get-on-get-off buses to take you around, but walking is safe and good for you, too. Uber is the best way to get from the airport to this hotel, and several other ground operations can take you there too. There's a pool on the property, cafe and "disco" plus the everpresent Starbucks. The penthouse restaurant has a beautiful view of Waikiki and the city beyond, with decent happy hour bar menu. A must.

The stay was a last minute, unscheduled stay however the food at The Signature will probably warrant another return to the property. I was not so happy about the parking lot being full and ended up valet parking. Which turned out okay considering the day I had. Loved the idea of the Starbucks being in the lobby as it was very convenient for the early morning starters. The gal at the front desk was okay however pleasantry is always a great seller for guest. I did however forget how to use the elevator with the room key, so it did take me a few times before I got it. Overall the experience was okay being it was a quick stay

I stayed in a hotel room rather than as a vacation stay. Loved the helpful desk staff. Loved the self parking and helpful gate staff. The convenient access fromfLevel 2 Ty O walkwtgrough AlaAlaMiana centreccar park to Macy's and Target was great. Really nice pool and a choice of sauna or steam room. I will definitely stay here again in Hawaii.

staff and facilities were great. Location was convenient. room was nice and clean. Please don't require a minimum number of characters when asking for feedback. Allow guests t write as little or as much as they would like. Thanks

Very clean and convenient place to stay, especially with my family. All staff was very helpful as well. We find it very hard to stay anywhere else. The location is perfect & parking is a fair price compared to everything else around town.

Hotel and Staff were excellent. Location of hotel is not ideal for beach vacationers. Hotel is attached to a very large and terrific mall. Hotel is near (a very short walk) a city type beach. It is not very near the resort style beaches. Also, the pool is not open during the evening hours. There are no refreshments served at the pool either.

Always enjoy my stay here, I come at least once a month and stay here. Excellent service at the front desk and overall I love it there. Rooms are always clean and up to par. And if I need anything staff is always helpful

Arrived here and checked in promptly. Room was fab 2 comfortable queen beds with view of Ocean. Right next door to Ala Moana shop centre and wakiki trolleys terminus in the Centre. On checking out we discovered we had breakfast included. Receptionist never advised us as they usually do for breakfast times. I emailed hotel later and the Hotel refunded the breakfast charge. Was very pleased with this offer as we should have been aware the breakfast was included in our booking. 10/10 for customer service. Would return here. Approx 15 minutes walk to lagoon and beach.

Room was on 13th flooring (kono tower) as wanted easy access to laundry (saves taking too many cloths with you also laundry on 6th floor)...only downside was our room didn’t have a balcony, those rooms cost more, Honolulu rooms are very very expensive all year round more so at Xmas, the pool area was basic and the chairs party uncomfortable but pool staff very attentive, it’s a great position for shopping centre and for all the trolley stops outside centre, in fact perfect for any tours from there as well as airport, it’s only about a 20 minute walk into Waikiki, you can walk along beach front to save walking along busy main road, Ala Moana beach is right across the road and is much quieter and a safe beach for children, there are great food courts in the Ala Moana centre 3 in total, the signature restaurant in the hotel is very nice, but very very expensive, only go if it’s a special occasion ....all in all a good hotel and I’d definitely use it again if I return to Honolulu

Right next to Ala Moana Shopping Center....Great Staff and also great and cleaned rooms....very convenient to everything you want to do...also there’s a restaurant on property has a buffet breakfast for a small fee and also a Starbucks located in the lobby...

The hotel eas beautiful and grand. Very well situated. Across from Ala Moana Mall, Marina and park. My husband and I were pleasantly surprised. The room was just right. Not big nor small. Beautiful lobby. Wish could have stayed longer to visit the restaurant. The buffet at the cafe has very tasty food.

We enjoyed the first part of our vacation staying at the Ala Moana that we returned for our final 2 days on Hawaii and were pleased to receive a room upgrade to a suite.This hotel met our particular needs very well on both stays.

We were visiting from an outer island and my family opted to stay at a cheaper hotel close to Ala Moana. The central location made it easy to meet up (they often picked usup) and the friendly bell staff were understanding and let my parents idle for a short time in the front of the hotel while I ran up to the room to drop various bags from shopping. The rooms were a little worn but always clean, and all the staff we met were very friendly. Would highly recommend!
user_name:
Pioneer39728796227
New York City, New York

review_body: Satisfied although it would’ve been nice to have a more affordable rate for kama aina. Will definitely recommend to family and friends, visiting and residents here. Great location and nice people in the front desk.

we enjoyed our stay.Food options were limiting-breakfast was excellent, however starbucks is a poor food choice.The signature restaurant is also limited in food choices with meat and seafood the focus and one chicken dish available.There was no room service.Pricing was at the top end tat the signature restaurant therefore hotel food choices are limited and forces many occupants to eat out of the hotel which is not always convenient.Certainly endless choices next door at the shopping centre.

I enjoyed just spending a night in a quiet clean hotel. Thank you, for the excellent front desk service; being prompt and efficient with customers. Breakfast brunch was included with an overnight stay was a very nice treat.

We were very impressed with the hospitality with the check in process, and friendliness of the staff. However, there were loud noises outside the hotel all night (I'm a deep sleeper too), the pillows and bed were uncomfortable. The 2-room suite didn't offer any privacy because our kids had to share the bathroom right outside our room, which didn't have a door. We actually booked this hotel over others, specifically because we wanted a 2-room suite. The breakfast package we purchased with the room was fantastic. One of the best breakfast buffets I've had at a hotel. Overall, we probably wouldn't come back.

We had the Kona Tower view aka Ala Moana Shopping Center parking lot view. Our room was quite small and there was not enough room for two people to walk by eachother without having to squeeze up. The bathroom is also quite small and you must stand in the bath tub to have a shower.All in all, if you're not willing to fork out a few hundred dollars more for a nicer hotel, this does the job.PS- if you have a rental car, DO NOT park it in the hotel as they will charge $20 per day. You can park it in Ala Moana Shopping Center (which is connected to the hotel) free of charge 24/7. There are no boom gates and therefore the parking lot will not close. The hotel conveniently leaves that point out.

This accomodation is great for those wanting to go to the Ala Moana Shopping centre - full of shops and restaurants. Central to Wakiki and easy to get transport around. Good wifi, and we were upgraded to a bigger room for our honeymoon. Would stay at Ala Moana Hotel again!

Highly recommend! The friendly staff, awesome valet service, convenience, affordability and great location all makes for a great hotel. The rooms were clean and spacious and very welcoming. Will definitely stay here again.

Once we got to our room ac wasn't working. It took 3 calls to the front desk and over an hour until I finally asked if we could change rooms. Would have been nice to upgrade our room since we waited that long. Housekeeping took more than 45 minutes and 2 phone calls just to get toilet tissue.

This hotel gave me the farthest room from elevator (room *49) and has no wifi connection of its own... I have to use wifi connected to other rooms (like *50, *51) and got disconnected every 15 mins. Also, I can hear noises from cars since my room was "almost next" to the mall parking.The only good thing in this hotel is the location and has a coffee shop in the lobby.

This place would be fine for one or two nights but other than that not recommended.A plus is Starbucks in the lobby.Everything is cheap - Kleenex, soap, coffee etc.Not on beach.Doormen do nothing - don’t even greet you.

We had a very comfortable and pleasant stay for six nights. We had a suite with kitchen that was very convenient for eating in at breakfast. It would be better if the available dishes, flatware, etc...did not entail an additional charge. The exercise facilities were good, with a wide variety of equipment. We had a vehicle and utilized the valet services on a daily basis. This was always a quick and efficient process. Overall, this is a great location, with clean and comfortable accommodations. Would definitely stay there again in the future.

Nice choice with excellent corner unit as requested, high floor, splendid views from balcony, overall quite pleased.A few housekeeping issues but staff very nice and helpful. Would recommend to be slightly away from touristy Waikiki,

they don't change the sheets vacuum and they don't clean in a timely manner they'll be there to clean at 4 pm or 2 pm...they don't take the trash smh....I wish people who don't love to work for alamoana would quit

Ala Moana is a well kept hotel that is conveniently close to Waikiki and also a short walk from a beach front park and the Alan Moana shopping center (which has multiple large food courts and shopping) The concierges (specifically Daren and Malia) went out of their way to accommodate us, help us book excursions and make sure we had a great time.Good location. Near airport. Has fancy restaurant on one of the top floors.

There was a problem with another guest smoking pot on his lani. Complaints were made over several days and by other guests too. The hotel did nothing. I had major surgery and was staying a few days prior to flying home. We paid extra for the lani which we were unable to use and instead had to stay closed up in the room. It made for an unhappy stay in a room with a hard bed and shabby linens.

Great location and well air conditioned rooms meant a good sleep. Right next to the Ala Moana shopping centre and a 10min walk to the beach. I walked to Waikiki, took 30 minutes or you can take the shuttle located at Ala Moana Centre.

For the past 3 years, we've stayed at the Ala Moana Hotel for the New Year. Thomas & Tim the doormen always welcomes us with the Aloha Spirit! Will be back from Washington State to stay at the Ala Moana Jan 9 - 15, 2019 for a birthday party in Honolulu. Great service & great location! Thank you Thomas & Tim!
user_name:
Ann R
Rio de Janeiro, RJ

review_body: NYE would have been my 4th stay at this property during the month of December 2018, and this experience in room 533 was so bad that my ladyfriend told me to download the Yelp app just to complain about the stay. I don’t like complaining on the internet, and that’s simply not my style. Therefore, instead of penning a scathing complaint on Yelp, which ultimately does little or nothing to fix your problem that I left very unsatisfied, I took the time to dig through my e-mails in order to find this survey and file my complaint using the proper channel.FYI, I was initially offered free breakfast to alleviate my complaints, but since I already purchased breakfast, the night manager authorized a $50 refund. I would like to clarify that this is not about the money: this is about providing proper customer service to a loyal client that left the property feeling like his needs were ignored, even after receiving a refund. Your refund was a solemn gesture at best. The following were the complaints stated to the night manager.1. Reception at 7 pm did not recognize mantra+ membership nor online promotional code until after I insisted they were undoubtably part of my booking.2. 2nd room key programmed incorrectly, requiring going back down to lobby to reprogram. Receptionist stated that static from clothes and phones tends to foul keys, but this explanation makes little sense. The elevator worked fine. This is the first issue with keycards in 4 stays in the same month, with multiple keys being next to my phone (iPhone X) and wearing similar clothes. The attempt to shift blame on user error with a weak excuse was not cool, and should not be protocol at your hotel. 3. Tub clogged, water instantly backed up upon start of shower. 4. Wi-Fi Internet out of operation. Upon 430 am call to guest services, operator informed me that a technician would need to be sent to the room to troubleshoot the issue. I informed her that this was impossible, since my ladyfriend was trying to sleep and was getting progressively irritated that i was trying to troubleshoot the internet. I told operator that I was familiar with the correct steps to reset a cable internet modem, and would attempt to do so, and thanks. Unfortunately, doing that did not resolve the problem. The internet was not available until after 9 am. These are things that should have been taken care of during routine maintenance. All of these issues should have been resolved for this room regardless if there was an occupant or not. I hope you will use this message to place more efforts into doing better. Providing shoddy service with NYE up-charge was wrong. Please feel free to email me or contact me using my phone number on file. Thank you for your time.-Jeff

We enjoyed our 5 day stay on the 34th floor which gave us great views of the New Years fireworks display over Honolulu.Service is professional and responses rapid and reliable.Breakfast was excellent but at some times the waiting line was lengthy.The Expedia tour booking desk in the foyer served by Malia was most helpful in arranging our program.Wiakiki shops and beach are a 5 minute ride.Proximity to the Ala Moana Centre is another good feature. We have already booked to stay again.

Stay-cation - we live on O’ahu and decided to stay here to celebrate New Year’s Eve. Our room in the Kona Tower was small and felt cramped. The mattress was old and soft. After three nights, both of our backs hurt. We choose this hotel because of the location - it’s right next to Ala Moana, but I am sorry we didn’t just stay at a Hilton Hotel closer to Waikiki.

The hotel has good location to the beach and other establishments. Easy access to the mall. Front desk reps were very nice and accomodating. The rooms were clean and comfortable. I would recommend The Ala Moana Hotel.

I highly recommend Ala Moana Hotel for business or pleasure accommodations. The location is excellent. Food is excellent, Rooms are clean. Security is very good. In house parking needs improvement, upgrade parking facilities.

The staff is friendly, our room was clean and the hotel is in an excellent location (adjacent to the upscale Ala Moana Shopping Mall). Love the in-house Starbucks!! Reasonable valet parking of $25/day which is inexpensive in Honolulu!!! Good overall value.

Celebrating our late anniversary and New Year's eve staycation. Starbucks was great to have mini breakfast and coffee. Late check out instead of 11am , have it 12noon or 1pm . Disappointed of the hotel room and toiletries to bath towels sets .

From the time I called to make a reservation until the time we left, customer service was exemplary. Booking was quick and easy. Parking was easy to access/egress. Housekeeping were on it. The hotel is located adjacent to the Ala Moana Shopping Center and within walking distance of Ala Moana Beach and tons of eateries. The amenities were great...I personally loved the fitness facility (weights, steam room, sauna) which is 3-4 times the size of what I'm used to seeing, and overlooked the pool. The equipment was modern and up to date. Our room was clean, comfortable, and equipped with everything you need as if you were right at home. We absolutely loved our stay and would highly recommend to anyone! MAHALO Ala Moana Hotel!

It's an average hotel - you can probably find a better bang for your buck elsewhere. We felt we were treated a bit badly on the last day because when we tried to take the shuttle to the airport we were told to wait in the wrong area and then found later that the shuttle had left without us because we were in the wrong area. We also found that the rooms didn't have enough towels - we had to keep going to the front desk to exchange our old towels for new ones. The rooms should at least have four towels as folks usually want a towel for going to the swimming pool or the beach and a separate one for showering.

Location is great if you want to be away from the business of Waikiki. Next to the Ala Moana shopping centre - for night time shopping. Our rooms were much smaller than the pictures suggested which was disappointing.

I appreciated the convenience of location very much. It’s right next to the Ala Moana Shopping Center.We had to move our rooms, as plumbing clogged in the bathtub (easily overflows), and toilet (we called for facility management to bring plungers a few tomes during our stay).The long line at check-in was unpleasant, and insufficient information was provided regarding the location of facilities (gym, swimming pools, stores, etc.) . In-room information is not sufficient to understand much about the hotel facilities and services, so we went back to the front desk (again waited on the queue), to ask about the location and operation hours of the gym and swimming pool. Only at this point, we were provided with a print out on the description of the hotel services and facilities. Starbucks in the lobby was a nice place to be within the hotel.The price was moderate compared to other hotels in Waikiki. Would recommend for a family with a limited budget.

We stayed overnight because we were at a Christmas party in the Hotel and didn't want to drive after. The Hotel is close to shops and walking distance to the Beach. I would recommend going to Shirokiya Japan Village Walk at Ala Moana Shopping Center. It is located at the Ewa end of the shopping center at ground level.

Stayed here for a few days between flights. Buffet breakfast was very nice and always fresh. Location to the mall was very convenient. I was a to spend my time relaxing instead of driving around in a new city.

By that i mean it could easily be a lot better. We are not offended but there are part that are dated and don’t really represent the tropical island holiday (like the pool area). When we were greeted for check in we felt a bit like second class citizens because we didn’t book direct (a fair % of people don’t anymore), check in took far to long and the adjoining rooms we requested were separated by another room (how hard is it??). Apart from that no complaints, the rooms we stayed in were modern enough and staff were polite.

I'm relieved I only stayed here for one night, at the end of my trip. The hotel is dated, the service is poor, the decor is in need of an update. I waited for 25 minutes to check in, and was greeted by an unfriendly, disinterested staff member at reception. The room was small, but clean, again in need of an update. Breakfast was awful, poor quality food, although the service was fairly pleasant.I paid $280 for one night (expensive I assume because it was between Christmas and New Year). A depressing experience.

I accompanied my husband here on business in October 2018. If we had planned a pleasure only vacation-I’m sure we would have chosen a higher end hotel, but the Ala Moana Hotel was way better than expected! It also isn’t a “budget buster”!The staff was friendly and very efficient. The hotel is in a great location-adjacent (almost connected) to the Ala Moana Center that has many shops, restaurants, and coffee places. Very convenient and less expensive than the shops in the Waikiki Beach area. The hotel is also in walking distance of ala Moana beach park. Great place to go swimming, jogging, catch rays, or just walk on its many paths. Walking to Waikiki Beach is also very doable. About 20 minutes to walk. Very quick if by bus or Uber.The hotel also had a very expansive breakfast buffet that changed every morning. The room was clean, the beds were very comfortable and upper floors have great views. We had a partial water/mountain/city view - nice little balcony with a table and chairs to enjoy a glass of wine on at the end of the day. The decor is in a little need of updating, but it was fine.The pool was basic, and at first I thought it lacked character. However, after walking around the extremely busy Waikiki hotel area where their beautiful hotel pools are right in the middle of the hustle and bustle-(which would make me feel too exposed)- I happily retreated to the quiet Ala Moana Hotel pool at the end of the day.I definitely recommend the Ala Moana Hotel.

Company XMAS party, traveled from Big Island to Oahu. Accommodations were great, friendly staff, close proximity to everything....Room was nice and quiet with an city view....Had dinner at Signature restaurant, very nice dinning experience, food was excellent, staff very attentive to our needs....Thumbs up all around!

Awesome service Ala Moana ! We will definitely be back again! Bryson , the front desk employee serviced is with such a warm and welcoming Aloha spirit. Our room was beautiful and we were able to relax.

It was very convenient and near to the Shopping Center, Food Court and The Convention Center.Great price, but the daily parking at the hotel was just TOO MUCH. It was like adding a 2nd Car Rental to the expense.

My favorite place to stay while visiting Oahu ... a bit costly, but worth it. The location is ideal. The hotel is in a central area ... near the beach, shopping mall and restaurants. The room is exceptionally clean and the bed very comfortable.

The rooms are always clean and if you happen to see staff working, they greet you. The room we had this time was way up and the view was awesome. My mom tells her friends (she works at the high school) about it.

Ala Moana Hotel is sometimes confused with the Moana Hotel onthe beach. This Hotel is across the street from the park and ocean and connected to the Alamoana Shopping Mall which is lovely and has a wide variety of Shopping and restaurants. There is close public transportation near the hotel and a Uber ride to Waikiki if you don’t want toWalk is very reasonable. From the airport it was about $35. Rooms are spacious & nice. Check in was nice but it had times when they were very busy.

A good location that is centralized. Staff professional and helpful. I recommend the stay, but the room was dusty. I suspect they didn't have time to vacuum the room this time around. I've stayed here before so I hadn't had the problem before so I must have lucked out this time around. Anyway great place to stay besides that one thing.

The hotel has a great location. Provides a comfortable stay. Services were good. The restaurant provided good breakfast. Hotel staff were friendly and treated customers great. Will select Ala Mona Hotel again next time we visit Honolulu.

Having lived on Kauai for MANY YEARS, Ala Moana Hotel was always our go to place to stay. We were there this time for my Daughters graduation from UH and we rented the 1 bedroom suite for my husband and I. LOVED the view and the additional room, HOWEVER, the kitchenette was severely lacking. Nothing but a coffee pot, 2 glasses and 2 coffee pots. There was a nice 2 burner stove, convection / microwave oven, however not (!) single thing to be able to not only eat a meal or make a meal. Such a disappointment for such an expensive unit.

Service was awesome.Will come back for my next trip.Keep up the good work.Staff was very attentive and our room was alway so clean..The breakfast buffet was also awesome.Valet was in point and not a long wait.

It has been years since I have been back to the Ala Moana Hotel. It was a lovely return to a place that I used to be so familiar with. Besides one employee (front desk), all others I encountered were pleasant and professional. The room cleaners were especially warm and welcoming and we were met w smiles and greetings each and every time. I was there for a shopping trip before Christmas, so for me it was the perfect location. I plan to return to Oahu in late January and would be happy to stay here again.

Everything was pretty good, but courtesy and friendliness of the staff was on the low side. Management needs to train staff in "service". This seems to be slipping over time in the industry in an entirety

Our room was on the 18th floor the wind howled into the room as the glass was not sealed or something was wrong with it and it banged all night long. We stayed with your hotel in hopes of a peaceful night sleep and didn't get any sleep at all. Worst night ever!

Needed an airport stopover hotel with quick shopping opportunity. Excellent location, service & quality. Much better than the VERY average HNL airport adjacent hotels I have stayed in but you have to pay for taxi transfers. Would be better value if they had a hotel shuttle. It’s a huge hotel so could support a shuttle.

Found mold in shower. Refrigerator and ac was not cold. Front desk manager did not follow through with my requests. Very disappointed. Very noisy floor. Woke up to commotion with guest room across the hall

We stayed in a 2 Bedroom Suite in the Ala Moana Tower (33rd floor) that showed signs of age. The suite needs some TLC before being put back into service. Unfortunately, if no one has already recognized this, I’m not so sure it will be given the attention it needs.

Our overall stay was great the only complaint I have is that when we asked for extra bedding sheets, blankets, and pillows they acted as if we were inconveniencing them and was really ride on the phone. It was just that 1 person so thats why I say overall great experience.

Convenient location. Pool is not great. Noisey in the tower closest to the mall. Clean but small rooms.Buffet in the hotel for breakfast is just ok. No information is given regarding the use of room keys to use the elevator. Starbucks in the hotel had long waits. Coffee maker in the room did not work.

Upon arrival, my reservation could not be found. Then was mixed up with someone with the same last name. Check in took too long. Finally got that resolved. Reservation was made for a queen bed. Got a tiny room with full size bed. Very uncomfortable and my spouse has to sleep with a large wedge pillow, so not big enough...bed was too small. Room was in the farthest tower in the farthest corner. Safe did not work.

Hotel was clean, staff friendly ice machines with cold water dispenser (which is a plus for anyone carries around a water bottle) and most important the bed was comfortable with enough pillows. Convenient to shopping and restaurants.

Not bad but not so good, so I would like to say this is just good. Clean normal, breakfast normal, hotel staff normal. Close to Ala Moana shopping center and a beach but you need to walk 30min or more to centre to WAIKIKI

The bath tubs are deeper than average, so climbing in over the tub is a bit risky for the elderly with stuff joints. There should be handles on request for easier gripping even for those who are not so stiff. Our only accessible tool was a shower chair.The accessible shower rooms were sold out, although they only come with one bed and we needed two, in a party of three. Small. tiny soap bars are an inconvenience for those with arthritic fingers. This hotel should re-think their amenities and services tor their elderly guests.

I've stayed at Ala Moana several times in the past and it's always been great, so it pains me to write this review.This time, as before, the room was fine, but the difference was the awful check-in.I was in Honolulu to run the marathon on December 9th. Arriving on the 8th December, I was turned away - as expected - for trying to check in early. That's fine. But, returning at 3pm as requested, I found a long queue. By the time I got to the head of the queue, 50 minutes had passed. And, looking at the queue behind me, it had grown to twice the length that it was when I joined.No extra check-in staff had been drafted in. No seating or water was offered to those queueing, nor any apologies form the check-in staff. Many people in that queue would have been running the marathon the next day. As one of those runners, I can tell you that I’d rather have spent that time resting than standing idle - having to do so was extremely aggravating. The only member of staff to clothe herself in any glory was the kindly security lady who routinely walked the line thanking people for their patience while ensuring the queue didn’t snake in any unwanted direction.Ala Moana is the most desirable accommodation in Honolulu at the time of the marathon due to its proximity to the race start line. The hotel should not rest on these laurels. The marathon is a well-publicised event that the hotel’s management is aware of. Extra check-in staff should have been scheduled to work the day before the marathon (and probably two or three days prior to that), and check-in times should have been staggered throughout the day to ease the process.

The "hotel" is comprised of independently owned rooms, managed by the staff. Each room may vary. I booked an "ocean view" and from the balcony, I could see the ocean and marina from the 22nd floor. The room was generally clean. Being in Hawaii, I spent little time in the room. I slept and showered there; otherwise, I was out enjoying the island. I used the valet service - quick and easy, I tipped $5 when they delivered my rental car. Self parking still had a fee, so no great advantage for walking yourself. Parking in Honolulu is difficult. Starbucks in the lobby was normal prices, but the shops were expensive, and the Steakhouse on top was quite expensive - eat elsewhere.

Walk to Ala Moana Beach Park and Magic Island. Walk to all kinds of shopping. Walk to a professional offices. Walk to restaurants. Rooms are small but clean. Water pressure was great. Always had hot water. Pillows could be larger. Staff is excellent and helpful. Parking is under the building (card reader is a bit if a challenge - had to always open door to put parking ticket in). Free breakfast had tonnes of bacon. We live on the Big Island. This our place to stay on Oahu.

Employees are very helpful, courteous and friendly. the hotel is ideally located in walking distance to the shopping center which for someone like me who does not drive is great! I would recommend the hotel to anyone who is visiting or on business on Oahu.

Service agents, from Valet, to Bellmen, to Check-In agents were excellent, friendly, courteous, the true Aloha Spirit. Your other service staff, custodians, vendors all greeted you while walking thru the hotel property.

Overnight stay for a Christmas party. Stay was very pleasant. Staff was very accommodating. One comment was when having a big event like Honolulu Marathon, should have more front desk workers during check in. Line was very long and it took over half an hour wait in line.

As a kama'aina, this hotel is in a convenient location (walking) to shopping and variety of different food selections. Hotel staff were friendly and accommodating to our request and needs. We would definitely stay here again.

1. Booking online w/Mantra does not guarantee bed size.2. Beds are not dressed with a comforter or duvet - you may need to call for a blanket if you need additional warmth.3. You may need to call in for additional pillows as pillows seem to be under-sized for even a double bed.4. You may need to call in for additional bath towels if there is more than one guest in the room.

Ala Moana is the preferred hotel for my organization; therefore, I stay here for my business trips. Considering the price point for this hotel, I would expect something more refined and resort like. Instead, the rooms are outdated, the customer service at the concierge and valet are below average, the pool and fitness center look uncleanly. This would not be my preferred place to stay if I was on vacation and/or had a choice in where I lodge.

Old-ish hotel from 80s, well- sanitized and good enough for me. It is close to everything I need (shopping mall, walmart, walgreens, mini-beach to sunbathe) . i tend to spend only couple of days in honolulu for long weekend or convention etc, so i dont need a fancy over-priced hotel. if you are on honeymoon or once-in-a-life -time -kind of occasion, you should go some other options.

I was pleasantly surprised by this Hotel. It was next door to the Ala Moana Mall which made it convenient. Walking distance to the harbor, beaches and waikiki boutique stores.  It was very clean and the customer service was great.

Ala Moana is the perfect hotel! We only stay at ala Moana because it’s everything we need from location to excellent service and friendly staff, and convenient! The rooms are clean and comfortable...we love this hotel!

It’s great that you have an access point to AlaMoana. We were there all day. We had no idea what time the second floor doors were closing, or that they closed at all. Luckily we came back just as the doors were closing. The mall was still open. Maybe a sign can be posted at the door with closing info

Wow! I used to live on Oahu. Only 18 years ago Honolulu was a beautiful city. My ten year old daughter said it best: Honolulu is no different than NYC or Boston. It was filthy, noisy, overbuilt and stupidly insufficient infrastructure. I hold hotels like this one which is almost 50 years old partially accountable. Where are the gardens, tree lined walkways, peaceful, beautiful places that allow visitors to enjoy being here. All the big money investments, Like hotels should be accountable for keeping Hawaii and Honolulu from becoming nasty sinkholes for money grabbing.

The location is perfect for shopping and get public buses to almost of all interesting points to be visited. The room is quiet, good and fair price, but the internet connection is slow sometimes and most of the time it is connected under the neighbor room wifi.

This hotel is great for the shopping center with a minimal walk to reach this.Pool area is a fail as there is little cover if you want some respite from the sun. If you want to know anything about the area you need to ask - information is not freely available or given, Conchita our room cleaner was very good and very helpful.

Nice place to stay, that's why I've stayed here a number of times previously. Not the most opulent property but more then made up by its location access to Ala Moana Shopping Center with numerous restaurants and great shopping.

Had to fly to Oahu for surgery. Was close to hospitals but cost off prime travel was still quite high. Room was small but that was fine. We did need more pillows. Room was clean and couldn’t figure out tv very well. Also needed more clean available amenities but couldn’t figure that out either. Nice stay. Only 1 night. Close to shopping was convenient.

Very cozy and comfortable. Friendly staff and great location and its close to most landmarks. I would highly recommend to single business travellers. The price is abit expensive to those travelling on a small budget.

Our stay at the Ala Moana Hotel was very pleasant. It is a convenient place to stay in Honolulu. Our request for a room near the elevator was granted and we were able to check in early. The room was clean and nice.

Very good location with easy access to Ala Moana shopping center as well as Waikiki by trolley. Convention center half block away. Starbucks and breakfast cafe available in the lobby. Rooms are on the small size but adequate.

Location is so convenient. Right next to the shopping center. Breakfast was included in package. Also got $5 a day to spend at Starbucks. Staff always helpful and friendly. Rooms are old, but you're paying for location.

Service was fast checked in within 5 minutes. Room was ready and clean. Location was great do to my visit for helping my girlfriend with surgery I was still able to get some Christmas shopping done and food.

Clean rooms, helpful front desk personnel and overall great vibes. Did not get to visit the fitness center during this trip but hope to do so on my next visit. The sauna and steam room are a great way to relax after a day of meetings or shopping! lol

the service is awesome....friendly from beginning to the end of stay. Rooms are spacious and clean.. Had a room with roll in shower...only thing it needs is slip resistance strips. Floor is tiles and it does get slippery when wet. Handicaps may fall even with railing to hold on.... I almost did. Need bigger shower heads in that shower too.

Convenient location but the rooms were small. For two people it would have been very tight. Some of the furnishings were a bit outdated. Having USB outlets to charge electronic devices would have been helpful. The internet seemed to drop in and out as well

A great place to stay and shop. Everything needed is close by and the prices are fair. I went for business and it was well worth the price. I will bring my family to stay here in the near future. The staff was excellent.

Great Service and location for business users!Away from Wikiki (less traffic), close to Farm Land super market, and Don Quixote. Enough restaurant around to eat out. Maybe the hardware could be better. (HVAC, Plumbing, Wifi, Washing machine, etc.)Rooms are too cold as A/C can't shut off completely. Wifi gets weak time to time.

The location is ideal for shopping, dining and beaching it! Staff was very friendly and love that their Starbucks is open late and they serve select wines, beer and small pupu plate items. We love staying here when we have functions in Waikiki.

Booked 3 stays using black Friday Kama’aina. This package came with 2 breakfasts per day per room. I inquired about it by calling front desk, they said my room did not come with it. I visited front desk and they acknowledged the breakfast package. When I gave hostess my name, they said there was only one breakfast. The hostess had to call the front desk for the sencond breakfast. It was such a headache, my party from the 2 rooms did not eat breakfast the next day.

We always consider he location of the place where we stay every time we spend time in Honolulu. The one that’s close to shopping, airport, our favorite places to eat and hang out. It cannot be denied that Ala Moana Hotel is that one. In addition, the service is great.

I enjoy staying at Ala Moana whenever attending work related functions because of the convenience of it being next to the shopping center. I don't have to rent a car because it's in walking distance and saves time from driving

There was some confusion on the package deal I booked with reservations. It was unfortunate for my family and the breakfast meals included, however a text message was sent apologizing (albeit too late).

Great ocean view suite! Great Price! Great location across the street from magic island beach. We even got lucky and had fireworks off of our balcony. I will surely return to this hotel. Thank you for making by birthday a real treat!

For the reviews it has, I was extremely disappointed by the hotel. The windows are thin to the point that we could hear construction below us all morning, the buffet was only barely worth it because it was free for us, and the biggest issue was our check in. We arrived and wanted to head out, but were stuck at the front desk for 30 minutes because my mantra confirmation wasn't bringing up its barcode. I offered to give back the 2 drink coupons and the bag of water, but the front desk folks (though nice) said they needed the program to work. It was a huge waste of such little time we had, and I'm really disappointed with our stay. By the end of it, both my fiancee and I agreed that we'd rather pay resort fees, more for parking, and more each night to have a nicer experience.

I picked this hotel due to its proximity to the convention center and the convention rate was the best deal out of all the hotels that were listed. They offer valet and self park. Self parking is $20/day and worth it given the difficulty in finding parking in Honolulu, and also worth it if you want to explore more of Oahu than where the buses can take you.The line to check in was looooong but I'm sure it was because this was the most popular hotel to stay at for the convention we were going to. It was also really warm on the ground level and there were portable A/C units running which I thought was weird. No central A/C for such a large hotel? What's up with that? I later found out from one of the merchants that they are renovating the entire A/C system on the ground floor but the actual rooms do have central A/C. What a relief!Our room in the Kona tower was compact but comfortable. Our queen bed room had a microwave, safe, refrigerator, full size ironing board + iron, and hair dryer. Wifi is free which is another perk, and they also allow you to print out your boarding passes for free, otherwise they charge by the minute and by page if you use the business center. The A/C in the room worked really well and was easily adjustable to your own comfort level.Noise level in the room was good. I didn't hear anything from my neighbors or from anyone in the hallways.Service was always friendly here from housekeeping to the front desk staff.The shower head and knob seemed a bit antiquated but I had no problems using it.I would definitely stay here again if I were to attend another event at the Hawaii Convention Center due to the good service, location and reasonable rates.

One suggestion is offer more meals in addition to breakfast, especially if you are not a StarBuck person. The sign on the door could have on the other side of the do not disturb, that it is OK to clean the room.

The hotel is next to/on the Ala Moana Shopping Center property so it is very convenient. And it is also very close to Waikiki, Blaisdell Center, and other attractions within town. While we did not have any problems with parking, the hotel parking is relatively small and can fill quickly; however, there is valet parking albeit a little more expensive than self parking.

This was my first time to Honolulu and this is a great hotel. Even though its not in Waikiki, its only a 10-15 mins walk. The hotel is located right next to a huge mall where you can find anything and everything. There is even a sky bridge attached to the hotel that takes you straight to the mall. The rooms are very clean and every room has a balcony. So you can watch the sunrise or sunset from your room. The staff is very friendly. This is a huge property and when we asked for some help there was always someone there to help you out.
user_name:
vkb1009
New York City, New York

review_body: Stayed there for 3 days. Very nice location. Not too far to get to Ala Moana Mall and the beach. Starbucks in hotel is nice. Under hotel parking is fairly easy to get to via hotel elevator. During one of the hurricane warnings, the hotel staff brought in the balcony furniture as a precaution. Had daily postings of storm track on the video monitors in the lobby area. Great staff.

The hotel is nice and good location but 2 false alarm evacuations were a terrible nuisance and went without explanation from the staff. This was an unpleasant and disturbing interruption and obviously a terrible nuisance.

Enjoyed my stay. Generally quiet, however, walls are very thin because when toilets are flushed or shower is run, it is very loud. Access to Ala Moana Shopping Center is very convenient and majority of employees are courteous and helpful. I would imagine that working in the customer service industry can be trying at times, however, maybe employees can be diplomatically reminded on a regular basis that customers are paying for services and if the roles were reversed, how would they like to be treated.

Room was clean, Hotel is an excellent location but with a deceiving room view description as it was not CITY and MOUNTAIN VIEW all what I can see is a ROOF TOP CAR PARK!!!! also the Hallway cleanliness level was a disgrace never vacuumed for the whole week.

I had paid extra for my ocean view room, but it was so dissapointed one because of fifth floor. Nice staff, clean room, and great location, so it was unblievable about view. I wont recomend to pay extra for ocean view!!!

Become a Lucky Strike member for the best benefits. Hotel has a friendly staff; Front Desk is helpful and Valet staff is helpful. Daily buffet breakfast is okay but it could use some upgrades. Also, an upgraded smoking section as well as an optional smoking section would be helpful.

Enjoyed our short stay. Small room but cozy and comfortable. Ocean was visible. Bathroom was very clean. Liked that Starbucks had morning beverages as well as night-time nightcaps. Five stars for that.Will be back.

The convenient location, nice accommodations, no resort fee, and reasonable guest parking rates were all incentives for me to book a room at Ala Moana. Having the connecting ramp to the shopping center is also an added plus!

Small rooms but nice and clean with good facilities, Staff were really helpful especially the concierge with booking our trips etc. Down side was no bar and even though there was a shop which sold alcohol you were not allowed to drink it while lying at the pool, even though there sign reads No food or beverages allowed people were eating and drinking but when we took out a can of lager were told No alcohol allowed which is most annoying when your on holiday and you just want a wine while you’re enjoying the sunshine. There are loads of bars and restaurants in the adjoining shopping centre but not the same!! There was a small cafe attached to the hotel where breakfast was good and a good price but is often queued and a bit chaotic. Take a stroll along the harbour area and there is a couple of nice bars and restaurants,

Excellent being next to Ala Moana Center, and just outside of Waikiki. Features a very good restaurant at top, with great views. Get there for sunset. Love the coffee kiosk in lobby, that serves great food, not your normal coffee with a muffin place.

This hotel is adjacent to the Ala Moana shopping mall and only a couple blocks from the Catholic church, the Convention Center and Don Quijote store where you can find almost anything you need including prepared food.. Parking is available on site, and you can pay for unlimited valet service, which we find convenient. Rooms are always clean and comfortable.

The Ala Moana Hotel is located in a perfect place where everything you need is close by.The employees are all welcoming and friendly.The rooms are spacious and clean.The best part is that they have Starbuck's in there hotel.

It was convenient for aramoanaBeach, Waikiki Beach in a range on foot.The room was comfortable, and the bedmaking was appropriate, too. The buffet of the breakfast was delicious, too.I forget it, and the smartphone takeoff from the sofa-bed gap, a password of the safety are satisfied with the service of hotelcrew including the correspondence

We got there a hour early and they easily accommodate us and even upgraded us to a one bedroom suite. The location is quite convenient for what we had planned. We only stayed one night, but would love the opportunity to stay again!

Convenient location and good overall place to stay ... wasn't cognizant of parking facilities initially but was corrected and re-directed upon checking in --- it was convenient too! Room was great though had minor issue with hardware falling off - just needs to be re-secured.

Overall there’s nothing more that I can say other than that I enjoyed my stay from the very first time I had stayed back in March of 2011 to my most recent trip of November 2018!every single visit year after year has only gotten better and I can’t wait to come again in April of 2019.

I would definitely recommend staying at the Ala Moana for anyone who is looking to stay in Honolulu and wants to minimize their taxi/car travel expenses. I will be staying at the Ala Moana for future trips to Oahu.

We had close to COLD water when we went to take bathes at 1:30am on Sunday 11/18!!! Very very uncomfortable and disappointing. Forgot to let you folks know #1 it was early morning and we wanted to get to bed. I don’t know if you folks care but we were shocked!!

The hotel is as great as always! We usually ride the bus but this time I really noticed the valet staff. There were so few workers but they were kind and patient to all. For some reason, there seemed to be only 2 or 3 workers at a time and it was always busy.

We booked there because of an event we attended. The upside it was easy to get to the event. Downsides was no kitchen cookwear/ utensils or trash bags for any if the trash bins in the suite. I was perplexed. Were paying alot and most hotels have cookwear/utensils/trash bags automatically in the suites. We had to call maid service twice told front desk and they came. We needed them to pick up our rubbish at least if they couldnt clean our room. I was looking for a trash shoot somewhere. When they came they gave us fresh towels and took our rubbish and thats it. I was told we had to call for them to clean our room. It wasnt automatic. Went to the pool. Pool guy was nice but pool needs to be updated. Ladder going into pool was shakey and a bit scary. Sad no rumors dance club and the hula hut. The restaurant in the front only served breakfast. It would be great if they did lunch and dinner.

This is the best place to stay for neighbor islanders. Clean comfortable rooms in a beautiful hotel with a great breakfast included daily. Walking convenience to the Ala Moana Shopping Center and Waikiki made it the perfect location for us to enjoy. We also had the best dining experience at Signature’s Restaurant on the top floor. It’s now our favorite restaurant on Oahu.

Always a good experience. For us is the convenience of walking to Ala Moana. We do miss the Rumors Nightclub as it was very convenient for us to just go downstairs to enjoy some of our generation of music and fun.

Room was great we had a 1 bedroom suite partial ocean / mountain view . No dishes was in the room on the kitchen side . great there is a starbucks on property for morning coffee.Lobby area is very clean.

We came for a concert... Once we got checked in we were able to take advantage of the mall and all if the wonderful shopping. We then had the time of our lives and were able to come back to the hotel and park easily.

An excellent hotel with moderate accommodations and central to eating and shopping. Good hotel for families. Easy access in and out of the area. It was nice to have a Starbuck's in the hotel. Our request for rooms next to one another were accommodated.

Who wouldn’t want to stay 3 minutes from the worlds largest outdoor shopping center. Room was clean and had everything you would need, bed was a little small for a couple used to King size but ok for 2 nights.

For the most part, we enjoyed our stay. Seemed like there was issues with the AC in lobby because it was really warm. Great location for what we were staying there for. Convenient to the mall, shops and restaurants. We would book there again.

Visit and stay was fun :)Convenience was a plus close to shopping mall.Front desk was very friendly and helpful especially Jean.She made our stay even more pleasant.Hosekeeping was very nice to check if everything was o.k. and if we needed a touch up in our room. We will definitely be back.5 stars Ala Moana ;)

Stayed at this hotel based on Crew from American Airlines recommendation. This was a great choice. Connected to the Aloha Moana Center Mall offered many options for food and shopping. Rooms were spacious and updated. Hotel Lobby was nice and inviting. Staff was courteous and helpful. Location was great as you could catch Trolley or Bus for reasonable price. Restaurant at hotel was pricey but Starbucks inside was nice. I would stay here again!

The rooms are clean. Really like the Plantation buffet, the hotel is close to everything, You can walk to the shopping center. The people at the hotel starting with check in to check out are very friendly. I have stayed at this hotel numerous times and really like it so I keep coming back.

Ala Moana Hotel is located perfectly...close to Ala Moana Center, Don Quijote, various restaurants, and within walking distance to Walmart & Sam's Club. The Waikiki Tower rooms are very nice and roomy and clean. The hotel offers senior rates and if lucky, free upgrades!

rm 726. enjoyable stay. helpful staff. nice amenities and access to shopping and restaurants. please don't force my review to be certain length, it takes away from what was a great experience. Thank you.

Our stay was on a holiday weekend so it was busy which is expected. Housekeeping is the only issue we had because one of the beds had a sheet that looked like it was dirty. But the rooms were overall nice.

Everything was great. Staff, cleanliness of our room, the great breakfast we received each morning, the view of the ocean, and the ease of getting around that area. There is nothing slightly negative to say about this property.

Parking spaces could be bigger and the attendant (female) could help because Asians have short arms and it was difficult to put and pull ticket in and out of machine. Pillows were too small and uncomfortable. Housekeeping could improve - did not have bag for ice bucket.

The Ala Moana is ideal if your a shopaholic - There is a skywalk via the second floor onto the carpark of the Ala Moana Shopping Centre (HUGE) - Enter via the Macy's entrance and your shopping experience will begin.The hotel room we stayed in was on the KONA side of the hotel and as such no balconies. Starbucks in foyer, ATM near reception, Tour desk (Expedia) onsite and pretty reasonable. We booked the 7 day Waikiki Trolley Pass and there is a stop for the trolley outside the food court on Ala Moana Boulevard.

This field should not be manditory to fill out with 200 characters to complete the survey. It was an very good stay. Wait to check in was a bit long due to Bruno Mars attendees. Everything else was fine

We stay at your hotel quite often and we usually stay in the suite because we have 2 toddlers when we travel but this time it was my husband and myself and we were upgraded to the suite. We absolutely love Ala Moana Hotel.

Excellent front desk.Excellent room. (Sooo CLEAN)Excellent valet service.Perfect location with Robert's Hawaii transportation to concert.Justin at the front desk is a built in concierge! I hope to see him when I return. Thank you for not being on strike!

Right next to Ala Moana Shopping Center and 20-25 minutes walk from wikiki. Room is not great but clean and was luckily able to check in early. The only thing that bothered me was the noise from next door room and corridor.

As I mentioned in my previous comment, I am more likely to return and stay at the Ala Moana hotel than any other hotel in Waikiki. It is conveniently located, next to the beach, the mall, 24HR Fitness and Ward. The Signature Restaurant Happy Hour is the best! My cousins who were visiting from San Francisco were staying at the Waikiki Marriot will be staying here during the next visit to Hawaii! Mahalo for a wonderful experience.

Great people...moderate facility for convenience. Ice only every other floor.Business stations way overpriced.Great staff, very nice.Beautiful pool....but no jacuzzi? How air conditioning be out in lobby for entire 6 day stay?

We came to attend a special occasion for our niece wedding at the convention center. We were disappointed because our room was the last room at the end of the floor. We also didn’t have any view or balcony. To top it off we were awakened by construction workers at night pounding and doing their thing. We had a restless night. Is it because I booked this reservation early enough to get a special rate and is that why we had an awful room? We’ve stayed there in the past with no problems. Was quite disappointed this time around.

I travelled on Business to Honolulu and Hilo during the week of October 28th. My stay at the Ala Moana Hotel was for 2 different time periods. Front desk services, parking services and Accounting treated us with disdain and ignored our needs. It was only by asking for the General Manager's office assistance that we were able to resolve front desk abuse.

This hotel is conveniently located nearby the Hawaii Convention Center, Ala Moana Beach Park and the Ala Moana Shopping Center - perfect location for my business stay. Excellent services, highly recommendable!

Overall good hotel for price you pay. Walking distance from main strip of Waikiki is a bit far but manageable. Workers are amazing and greet every time. Starbucks and convenient stores are there and has great hours.

This was our first trip to Hawaii and our first experience with Ala Moana Hotel. The staff, including the security staff, was a pleasant surprise. The staff, including the security team, was not only helpful, but seemed to remember us and greet us and show an interest in our day, every day. How nice! The overall experience of Oahu and the Ala Moana Hotel were worth the trip!

The hotel is positioned slightly out of the main tourist areas and is attached to the Ala Moana shopping centre. The rooms are clean and tidy with good servicing, staff are extremely helpful and facilities are excellent, gym/sauna/steam room and nice pool area. Good value for money

Grandson wanted to go to Hawaii and buddies bailed on him so I had time and love coming to the islands so crashed his trip. Room was very nice and room was old with furniture but all was in good shape and the fold out bed was one of the best I have ever crashed on a trip. Check in was fast and lobby and hotel was very nice and again staff here was very helpful and knew the area very well so ask for best places, tours, etc they know! Ate breakfast at the cafe in lobby was very good buffet at reasonable prices for Hawaii. Gift shops and Starbucks also in lobby to grab a snack or drinks to go. Area is shopping and food places to walk to and the mall area has lots of good chain restaurants as well. Best thing is the location for tours, you will be last picked up and first ones dropped off so consider this when booking. Great time and my grandson is a walker so got to walk and see a lot the area on foot even walked to Waikiki everyday. If you are fit walk it.

Great service from all staff. From front desk to car park attendant and including the friendly maid services. Room spotlessly clean - Only slight issue was getting connected to Wifi as our room # was not coming up automatically and we had to connect using a different room #

Beautiful views and clean room made our stay wonderful. Also all the smiles from the employees, they were happy to help. We will be returning to this hotel for all future stays in Honolulu and we hope to get our same room!

The Ala Moana Hotel has easy access to the nearby shopping center and restaurants. There are various kinds of transportation available to explore the Waikiki area. The Plantation Cafe in the hotel offers a wide variety of food choices in the breakfast buffet.

My trip to Oahu was last minute and when I called Ala Moana Hotel, Justin was very helpful and informative about my options. I'm glad he was able to get us a room for 2 nights! The weekend was a huge success with family and friends and Justin and Ala Moana Hotel played a part in making it all happen. Mahalo Justin!

Stayed for 5 nights with a group of friends in late October. I arrived from Ko Olina which took around half an hour by car.The first thing you’ll notice on entering the lobby is the heat. There’s something wrong with the A/C so there are a dozen portable units and industrial sized fans throughout. It isn’t terribly uncomfortable but you will notice it.Check in was pretty fast and easy and although I was well ahead of check in time, my room was available. As a Mantra Plus member I was also given a couple of bottles of water.The ‘Mountain/City’ view room in the Kona Tower met the expectations I had based on how much I paid. Small, dated and view of an adjacent office block and car park. The bed was small, with only two pillows and a thin comforter. The bathroom is much the same although it had been retiled in the last few years. The shower is over the bath and has adequate pressure. A/C works well and is quiet.The room comes with an empty mini fridge, microwave, coffee machine and safe in the wardrobe.The pool area on the 4th floor is a little sad.
