The pool itself is small and the whole area seems very under utilised. It was never very busy during my stay. There is no food or beverage service at the pool either, but the towel attendants were always friendly and helpful. Despite the area being marked as smoke free the area was littered with cigarette butts. It’s a shame Mantra haven’t tried to make this area more inviting. It could easily be as great as a Vegas resort pool with a little investment. The gym is adjacent to the pool, open from 5AM. There are a dozen or so cardio machines, weight machines and free weights. Though dated, the equipment was in good condition. During my stay it was only busy first thing in the morning but relatively quiet otherwise. My rate included breakfast at the Plantation Cafe. A standard hotel buffet breakfast setup. I never waited for a table early in the morning and the staff were friendly and helpful. There is no bar. Whilst this is by no means a problem, it is unusual and I think goes to explain a lack of atmosphere. My overall impression of the Ala Moana Hotel is that it needs investment. With office printed signage and leaflets the place seems rather amateur. If you like to shop, it could be a good option given its direct access to the Ala Moana Shopping Centre.Waikiki is about a 20-30 minute walk or 5 minute ride.If I was on a budget I’d consider staying again, but generally this isn’t a hotel I’d rush back to.

The 1 bedroom suite was very comfortable, also the amenities. Location of hotel made shopping very convenient at Ala Moana Center. The complimentary services via the Mantra Club are very much appreciated.

The room satisfied us for our just 1 night stay to catch next flight. Our room was high enough to have a VIEW. I enjoyed drinking coffee in the morning at the balcony. There was a big road access from the 2nd floor to Alamoana shopping center. It was as though made it for the shopping trip.The surrounding environment didn't have any sorts local shops to make us feel like explore neighborhood. All were in the mall. There was a city bus terminal and could be convenient. Alamoana park was right in front of it, if we were staying longer, we would rented a bicycle to go Waikiki area and the other tourist sites.

Enjoyed our stay, friendly staff, great location, great flash special. we would definitely recommend to family and friends. Been years since we stayed at this property and were very happy with the improvements that have been made by Mantra

Having been to Honolulu several times, I never even knew that there was a hotel at the Ala Moana complex, but this latest trip found us staying there and it was indeed a pleasure. The hotel's location is perfect, and while it's not a "beach" hotel in the traditional sense, it is an excellent "city" hotel--central to virtually all of the major attractions within the heart of Honolulu. Our room, while not ocean facing, did have an ocean view on a high floor which was better than expected. The room itself was quite spacious, clean, comfortable and very functional. We were in and out a lot and so didn't have too much interaction with the staff, but those that we did deal with were great: helpful, friendly and courteous. And of course if you either need or want to shop, the hotel being immediately adjacent to the Ala Moana mall is ideal. The mall is massive and features just about everything imaginable from amazing restaurants to high-end designer shops. We didn't have a car this time, so I cannot comment on the hotel parking, but we took lyft everywhere and the hotel had super easy access for pickups and drop offs. Overall, the Ala Moana made our stay in paradise even better. I highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

The servics is awesome my 3rd time with Alamoana. Breakfast easy you get Starbucks and Plantation Cafe. If you are on the go Starbucks. Do:Awesome service. complimentary breakfast w/Plantation is great. Easy access to shops. Love it.Donts:BOOK THE KONA TOWER IF YOU ARE ON WHEELCHAIR.

Great location, friendly staff and comfy rooms. Starbuck's in the lobby made grabbing coffee (or in my case tea), made was super convenient. Adjacency to the Ala Moana Mall is a great plus. I've stayed here many times and it's a great hotel and value.

pool not open long enough being next to mall is good not have to pay parking but if you leave the to walk to mall you're still paying 20 a day for parking and your morning breakfast is not the best needs a lot improvement cooks and foods
user_name:
Joseph K
santa rosa, United States

review_body: Good night stay. Rooms very clean cant hear outside noises. Close to everything. Front desk is really friendly very convenient parking. Cant wait to stay there again going to try stay in the kona tower next visit

Several thing to improve, towel in the bathroom somewhat smell out of the ordinary. Water service in the gym would be great addition. Hotel slip on would be nice to include as well. Friendly staff and easy heck in and check out. What I love the most is the honesty. There are no additional surcharges or extra hidden charges just like other hotel such as Hilton.

We live on the Big Island and our family came up for the weekend. The room was clean and well stocked. The saff was friendly and helpful. The hotel is in a perfect location... near the beach, shopping and tons of places to eat.

Very warm in lobby no air conditioning working for the entire stay. Close proximity to Ala Moana Mall.. walking distance. . Great shopping and food choices. Also easy to catch a city bus from the mall into Waikiki.

We were really happy with our stay at Ala Moana Hotel. The location with it being next to the Ala Moana Shopping and other shops and eatery made it an easy access to everywhere we were planning on going too. Thank you to All who work at Ala Moana Hotel in making our stay a joyous one.

What an amazing location to have a hotel, as this was my husband and I’s first trip to Hawaii, the staff were very accommodating and our room was throughly cleaned daily. Would recommend this hotel to anyone on their visit to Hawaii.

This classic hotel is situated between the Ala Moana Center and downtown Waikiki. Rooms are efficient and the views from the upper floors offer either ocean or mountain vistas. There are several shops on site, and they have a restaurant.

All accommadations were excellent. the room is clean . The breakfast is very pleasant with a nise atmostphere to enjoy your meal. I would definetely recommend the Ala Moana Hotel to my family and friends.

Family vacations are fun at Ala Moana. Close to fancy Ala Moana center with so many shopping and restaurant choices. Close to Don Quijote which I love for omiyage and fresh food for your room. Great place for kids and adults.

Location of hotel is excellent. Near shopping ,beach and restaurants. Staff is friendly. Sasharey at front dest was exceptionally professional and knowledgeable. Area in front of stairs coming from parking lot smelled like urine. Fans were blowing but smell remained

We are from Hilo and make it a point to stay here whenever we come to Oahu. Very convenient and especially having Starbucks is a treat. Sometimes the air conditioner is quite loud, not really a problem and the fridge might be quite old as it hums as well. Beds are always comfortable be it double or king size.

Very easy to book tours and site see. Shopping and beaches near hotel were excellent. Hotel was clean and housekeeping was good. Restaurants at hotel were good. Would recommend to others. Staff was pleasant and very helpful.

Preferred to vacate our unit during part of the re-piping work on the condo and enjoyed our five-day "staycation" at the Ala Moana Hotel. Wish we could have been guests for the entire 13 days. Minor sticking point was the closet doors which needed to be put back on track once or twice a day.

Bell boys not kind, concierge don't know customer service, lobby is hot, lady guards smiles & greets & met 2 room cleaners and they are nice specially the Filipino. The side door has no notification what time it closes and we were trying to get in after a very tiring day and it was frustrating. The room was small.

We stayed at the Ala Moana for a convention and we found the location extremely convenient for the convention center, the staff was super friendly and helpful, hotel was clean and we'll maintained and the breakfast buffet was excellent and a good deal. We knew that as condo guests we would not get daily housekeeping which was fine for us. We were paying about half what our colleagues in another very nice hotel were paying so for 4 nights it was a great deal. Our only complaints are we were given one roll of toilet paper for the entire stay and check in took forever. The former was easily resolved by purchasing some more supplies at the well stocked general store on the first floor. The latter is probably a software problem. It was taking about 12 minutes per booking to check guests in when we arrived at 2:45 for our not earlier than 3 pm condo check in. Fortunately they had nearly all stations open though one was flight crew only. We thought it might make sense to check in regular guests when no flight crews were present but the guy at the desk just pretended to be busy until another crew showed up. We had almost an hour to watch the process before we were able to check in. We were warmly greeted and given a detailed and personal explanation of the hotel, amenities and surrounding area plus the numerous exclusions for condo guests. Certainly that takes some time. Still, it sure seemed to take a lot longer than necessary. Definitely check out the very classy restaurant and lounge on the top floor. Stunning views and the best lava flow I've had since the Shipwreck Bar at Kona Village.

The front desk folks are very friendly, professional and compassionate. The hotel is clean. Easy to access as it is in the entrance to Waikiki. Valet service is quick and easy to get in and out of hotel. Easy access to Ala Moana Mall.

Great stay. Friendly staff & spacious roomsNext door to a large shopping centre with plenty of shopping and dining options. Well worth considering when visiting Honolulu. Would definitely stay again and happy to recommend. Do yourself a favour and join Mantra+ for added benefits. Free to join.

I chose to stay here because of the convenient access to the Ala Moana shopping center. The room was clean, quiet, and had a refrigerator and microwave, which was was useful. the front desk staff was very courteous.

Great service. Convenient. Friendly. Clean. This is the only hotel we want to stay at when we come inter island. Our original plans were to travel a couple weeks ago and they had a convention and were sold out so we changed our plans rather than change our hotel.

Originally, I was next to the laundry room and it was loud at night so I asked to move to another room and the front desk was very accommodating. A worker came to my room and dropped off the key immediately. Great customer service. My only complaint is the lobby area, the air-conditioned is broken so it was a little warmer than usual but I was comfortable. I love Starbucks so there’s a Starbucks on the lobby floor with lots of seating. I like the rooms...no complaints. I had an awesome view of the city. I would definitely stay here again.

House keeping is bad I had used towels it looked like a booty stain.I was turned off immediately. Also for 185 a night breakfast should be included. Beautiful location though it’s a shame. Close to the beach and the stores.

Excellent customer service. Check in and out process went very well. Front desk staff was attentive, courteous, and helpful. Greatly appreciated the welcome gifts of water and one free drink at Starbucks for myself and my family.

Great stay the location of the hotel was great it was in walking distance of everything, hospitality was great room was a lil small great complimentary buffet breakfast....will stay again on my next visit

stayed at KONA tower 6 nights. staffs were friendly and the view was beautiful especially 　in the very early morning. The location is excellent. The Queen bed room is large enough to stay alone. But, as to housecleaning, the worst ever. They left hairs and wipes in the bathroom almost everyday and they never clean the desk and the table.

We needed a clean room with bathroom facilities. My brother had to take showers with a special soap the night before and in the morning before the procedure at Queens Hospital. Comparing the rooms in Downtown Las Vegas, this was Bright, clean and so much roomier.

The hotel is very nice, but in the Kona room, the rooms are small and, especially on the mountain side, quite noisy, especially when the seedy lounges on Kalakaua Ave. close down in the early morning hours. The website advertises amenities, including a pool, spa, and fitness center. However, in my room, the guest information binder had no information at all on these features, making me wonder if they are available to guests in the lower-rent district. Overall, though, it's a good place to stay, with ready access to buses that go directly to the airport, a Starbucks in the lobby, and a five-minute walk to beaches. And, for shopping, there's no better place in the state than the Ala Moana center, immediately adjacent to the hotel.

near shoping center and troley stop and beach across the streetnot far away from waikiki but enough to be quiet easy access with troley or buseasy walk of 2km from hotspot of waikikishuttle service for airport at low cost

This hotel was in a great central location, it wasn't over run with tourists and traffic. Great service, great price. I appreciate that the hotel was mindful to keep any riff raff out, which eased my mind.

Excellent hotel. Was in a great location near the beach and the shopping mall and it's food courts. The rooms were great too. The staff were friendly too and provided good service. We would definitely stay again.

From when we arrived all of the staff we encountered were friendly, pleasant and helpful. The rooms are always clean and we love the location. We would recommend this hotel to family and friends. We have stayed here many times and always have a great experience.

Great location and plenty of transport and activity options nearby. However, when we attempted to check in we were told to come back at 3pm as we were in a "condominium". The accommodation turned out to be a normal room but was privately owned by a company in Las Vegas and we were advised that the only cleaning to be done would be at the end of our stay. As we were there for 10 nights it was totally unacceptable to be expected to use the same towels and sheets the whole time, we were not even allowed extra toilet rolls. After making s fuss with the owners we got 1 cleaning during our stay. Be aware when booking that you do so with the hotel and not a 3rd party. We didn't find the staff particularly friendly and there was no place to "socialise". We were a party of 6 and wanted to meet in the evenings but there was no place to do that. The hotel does not have a bar (coffee shop in reception will serve a beer after 4.30pm) so we had to make do with the pool area after it closed. This is very much a business hotel and a good one at that, but not ideal for us tourists.

The Ala Moana Hotel is ideally located just out the highly congested area and hotels by Waikiki beach but is still just a 5 minute ride by car,bus,Uber or taxi . Approxiametely 20 minute walk at a leisurely pace.It offers clean, well kept, rooms with a staff that replies quickly to requests. You only have to go to the second floor and pass through a walkway that willput you at the Ala Moana Mall, the number #1 shopping area on he island!! No need for the hustle and bustle of trying to park your car or trying to remember where you left it when you are done shoppling. Hotel also offers a full breakfast restaurant with both 'a la carte or buffet options. And if you need your Starbucks fix there is one in the lobby too!

This is a good hotel, located near a great park and shopping center. Easy to get around to the center of Waikiki. Staff was friendly. There were some construction issues, closet doors didn't work. They only offer a high priced restaurant for dinner.

Conveniently located, clean, quite and free wi-fi make the Ala Moana a great choice for business travelers. I have stayed here many times and have never been disappointed. I also appreciate the Starbucks in the lobby.

This hotel has a great location, located right next to the Ala Moana shopping mall. The rooms were decent and the staff were really friendly. The room also came with a microwave and refrigerator. I would stay at this hotel again and recommend this hotel to others.

I stayed here with my cousin who was getting married at this hotel. They had a suite that was beautiful, the view was pretty epic. The hsking service was terrible, I called to ask for an extra pillow and was basically told to share with the rest of the hotel guests, and that hskpg was already closed, mind you I work for 2 hotel properties here in Oahu and other than asking to have your room cleaned at 11pm-12am at night hskpg isn't really closed, they have housemens. I was just asking for extra pillows. She insisted that we already had an extra pillow, which we did but it was a queen pull out I just wanted one more extra pillow. When I checked out, I did receive excellent service from one of the Front Desk Host named Jean. She was really nice.

Offer the same Kama`aina discounts for the Waikiki Tower as you offer for the Kona Tower. Consider renovating the Kona tower and better insulating the rooms as everything in the rooms are clearly heard in the hallways. There is no sense of privacy.

Like my previous visit here three years ago, we came for dinner before heading out to the airport. This time I had my spouse in tow.  FOOD:Caesar Salad - $6.50Regardless of the chunky-cut romaine (I prefer smaller cuts) and visually low amount of creamy-tangy dressing, it was really good. This was a side portion that’s cheaper and smaller than the regular size. Steak Frites - $28.00My spouse’s dish. The steak was a good size, cooked perfectly medium rare, tasty, juicy and came with a generous amount of garlic butter on top. Fries were crispy and plentiful. Grilled Peppercorn Swordfish - $18.50I’m 99% sure this was my first time eating swordfish, and I liked it! The filet’s texture and flavor were similar to ahi but a little softer. It was seasoned and cooked nicely though I found a few large bones in it, no big deal but beware. It came topped with some lomi salmon and over a bed of mashed potatoes, carrots and green beans. Highly recommended. SERVICE:We were greeted and seated immediately by a friendly host. Our server was also friendly, professional and checked on us often. OVERALL:There’s just something wonderful about enjoying a delicious meal with views of the harbor. Prices are reasonable, service is good. A new favorite spot of ours!

Business and Pleasure. Very nice place to stay. The cost is up there, but comparable with others in the area. The staff was always friendly, courteous and pleasant. The public transportation is readily available, but more information on the different options would be helpful.

I also loved the drawer in the bathroom. First time i have seen a drawer in the bathroom. Great amenities with the Safe, the Microwave and the refrigerator. The hotel was very convenient since my business meeting was in the hotel and since the Ala Moana Shopping Center was right next door and a short walk over.

Convenient location next to Ala Moana - tons of shopping and dining options (love the restaurant in Nordstrom's - delicious, whole food at a good price point). Keep your parking ticket even after you get parking pass at desk - they'll ask for your parking ticket when you leave the garage.

Great hotel, convenient and close to everything esp alamoana shopping center, close to Hawaii convention center, great shops in the hotel, great restaurants too.Rooms are clean, towels smell good, beds are okay, promos are great - got free parking, $10 for each guest for starbucks. on another booking, we got free breakfast buffet for 3 and 3 coupon for starbucks drinks (not including latte).

The Ala Moana Hotel is really nice. The lobby is great, and the shopping options are good too. The rooms are little small for my liking; however, the condition of the room was great.The hotel is conveniently located, with everything in walking distance.

Recommended to us by a NZ travel agent as close to the mall and reasonable price.Great breakfast and very friendly concierge staff. Had an overnight break to our trip to NZ to better handle jet lag etc.

Hotel need TLC, Elevators key cards don't work and also to entry your Room, Beds not comfy, very soft on both King & Queen. The great thing is close to Mall and trolley bus. The sad thing is there is lots of homeless in areas of Hawaii. Especially in China town.

Walking distance not only to Ala Moana Shopping Center but to other shops, restaurants, businesses and other services. If you want to go to the beach or park it's right across the street. Most convenient hotel that I know of on Oahu, centrally located and easy access to both East and West freeways.

Was disappointed about the whole stay, after a lot of corresponding with the hotel they still got things wrong, were rude and not hospitable at all!!Best staff was Housekeeping hardest working and so humble and helpful

We enjoyed the accommodations. The rooms were comfortable and the service friendly. Two suggestions: longer pool and breakfast buffet hours. Having the Star Bucks and convenience store with extended hour was really a plus that we took full advantage of.

The hotel was very nice. Location was not, if interested in beach, there are closer. If shopping is your thing, then it's a great location, next to the mall. I felt the rooms were a bit small, but I don't know how they compare to other nearby hotels. We did have breakfast on site, a buffet, for the price ($16 pp), should have had an omelet station. Did not utilize the restaurant for dinner.

During a buisness trip to Oahu the hotel did everything to make my stay enjoyable. The Mantra plus ammenities were outstanding and the personal service from the special front desk experience to the valet parkers that got my car ready to go with a smile on their face. The servers in the dining room anticipated your needs and followed through to make the experience memorable. I will suggest to my fellow faculty that this is the place to stay. I did not have time but the Alomoana center is right next door and the Convention 'center accross the streat.

The hotel was in a great location, close to the hospital. Upon arrival Tony the receptionist was very friendly especially when we check in really late. The security guards always greeted us and valet guys got our vehicle in a timely manner

Great, friendly, clean and convenient place to stay, especially if visiting from outer islands.Easy access to shopping and restaurants. Loved the complementary Starbuck gift card. My husband and I stay there every time we visit Oahu.

Wife and I on a weekend getaway. Ala Moana hotel is located right on the edge of Waikiki. Within walking distance of everything. Quiet. Room is a little small but comfortable and clean. Had a view of the ocean but sliding glass door only opens enough to let fresh air in. Opted for the breakfast buffet which is great. Enjoying our stay here. Stayed here many times and always enjoyed it.

Clean room, adequate service, but nothing outstanding. It seemed that they are cutting back on maintenance as the ice machine near the room was missing, just a stubbed out pipe, and one wall sconce in the room was loose and coming off the wall.

NEVER STAYING AT THIS HOTEL AGAIN!!!! Worst customer service I’ve ever received. The so called front office manager on duty, Polly Wong, was so annoyed when we were making our complaint to her on the phone and straight up said “oh my god” and didn’t do anything to help us. In fact, she even HUNG UP on us!!! Extremely rude staff and the hotel manager, Matthew McGuigan, tried to relieve the situation after we checked out but it was the worst service recovery I’ve ever received. Spend your money at another hotel unless you want to be treated like garbage

There's a reason I keep coming back: good and clean accommodations, away from the crowdedness of Waikiki, convenient to Kakaako, downtown, Chinatown and elsewhere. Good value for the price. I'm pretty easy when it comes to these kinds of things. You'd have to be horrible or obviously not up to par for me to downvote.

I stayed at the Ala Moana for a business conference. It was convenient since I could walk to the conference. I was on a time crunch but the friendly staff at the Ala Moana made it possible for me to be at the conference on time. I definitely want to return again.

The hotel is conveniently located a few blocks’ walk over the river from Waikiki Beach, restaurants and shopping, and right next door to a very nicely designed outdoor shopping mall with some good restaurant choices. The Signature restaurant on the 36th floor of the hotel has an amazing view - try the bar menu at Happy Hour and watch the lights come on over Honolulu. Rooms are comfortable, each with a balcony. The pool on the 3rd floor is open until sunset. There’s a Starbucks in the lobby and a gift shop where you can get snacks, drinks and souvenirs. Valet service is available for those who park at the hotel.Cons: No airport shuttle service, and the construction site next door is generating a lot of noise for rooms at the back of the hotel. The indifferent attitude of the staff at the desk by the front doors was an exception to the excellent and friendly service elsewhere in the hotel. The Plantation Cafe is buffet only.

Our first time staying @ Ala Moana Hotel. We were impressed by the service shown to us from check-in to checkout. Would like to recognize the hospitality & courteous service of the Housekeeping staff. And, thank you for not charging resort fees.

The rooms were perfect for taking care of business in terms of re-energizing for a business trip, and the location was ideal, being so close to so many eating and shopping places. The staff was very friendly and even had goodies to offer. Each time I visit the Ala Moana Hotel I am always so pleased with the cleanliness and modernization of the bathrooms. It seems to be improving each time. The Starbucks in the lobby makes for a very easy morning before jumping into the Honolulu freeway traffic.

Wife had three day conference at UH at Mānoa. so did a staycation with our 3 yo. 15 minute drive to UH, so drop offs and pick ups were easy. Self park for $20/day was reasonable and easy to go to/from car to room. Able to walk to beach and playground at the mall. Staff at pool were friendly. Multitude of food options at Center and area. Many of my co-workers will stay here because of price and avoiding the congestion of Waikiki. Booked a smaller room in Kona tower facing Ala Moana Center. Seemed like this was the quiet side of the building. Probably get a lot more street noise facing Ala Moana or Atkinson. Room I booked was on the smaller side but it came with a chair that converts to a single bed that was perfect for our 3 yo. Also, wasn’t the best mattress we’ve slept on, but adequate. A/C was quiet. Water running through plumbing was noticeable at times but did not reach annoying. Note, I searched for AirBnB place near Ala Moana Center, but after ridiculous cleaning fees, it wasn’t a value. With a 3 yo going to beach everyday, Ala Moana Hotel was the better option.

This is the best place to stay on Oahu, It is located right next to the Mall, Ross's, Target, & Walmart. The location is one of the best perks, however don't forget to enjoy breakfast at their on-site buffet. This is the best buffet ever, the food is delicious and the service is excellent. Overall great place to stay, I am always satisfied when I stay here.

Its our favorite hotel to stay at. Very convenient for my family and I. location is great. I don't like going deep into Waikiki so their location is perfect for me. I wish the pool hours were longer tho. And gym is 24 hours.

I had a nice stay and will be coming back next year. It was great not having to think about stuff and the service was awesome. Great staff and nice room. Like I said before I will coming back again next year and possibly extending my stay.

I stayed at the Ala Moana hotel for two nights and although it is an older hotel it is a perfect location for events at the Hawaii Convention Center and for shopping within walking distance of the iconic Ala Moana Enter. While staying there saw people from all nationalities and there for different reasons. My room was perfectly laid out and very clean and comfortable. It had everything I needed. All the employees that I came in contact with were very pleasant, helpful and caring. Although this is a large hotel with over 1000 rooms it doesn't feel like you are treated like a number. You are treated with care and compassion. It has a large Starbucks in the lobby and they are busy however have plenty of seating to accommodate everyone. I would recommend the Ala Moana Hotel for any type of travel business. pleasure, convention or shopping. They can accommodate and take care of you.

Valet service was quick and friendly. Checked in during peak hour and although there were 8 guests in front of me, the front desk staff was very efficient and made the wait short. Will stay here again.

Accomodations in the room were pretty good and applicable. Towels are of high quality and A/C unit was cool and quiet. The only thing I did not like was the pillows provided by the hotel. They need to have at least one pillow that is thin and flat. I had to sleep without a pillow because the pillows provided are much too thick and my neck was placed in a 45 degree angle every time I tried to lay my head down on the bed with them. That is the only qualm I have with Ala Moana Hotel. Otherwise, enjoyed the relatively easy and quick check-in and certainly enjoyed the speedy check out. I definitely enjoyed my brief stay and I will be coming back again......I'll just bring my own pillow.

Fabulous, from front desk to the rooms, and the buffet!!! The room was clean,bed comfortable, and everyone nice. A airport shuttle provided by the hotel would have been an added touch!! I was a restaurant manager at Mauna Lani Bay Hotel 14 years, and Hyatt Waikoloa, 8 years, and I love my short stay at your hotel!!! I hope to return again. Mahalo

This is a wonderful place to stay since it is across from the Hawaii Convention Center. I had a conference across the street. It was so convenient. However, it would be nice if the Plantation Café would be open for lunch. It would be nice to have a lunch place in the hotel or a coffee shop type of restaurant.

Outstanding accommodations. Quality service, professional, friendly staff. Self-parking and Ala Moana Mall nearby - outstanding for travelers. Quiet, clean, and excellent for business and pleasure. Highly recommend this hotel.

Sink would not drain unless drain-plug was pulled out and left in sink. Shower wall was streaked with dried soap. There were open, half-eaten containers of food, plus utensils, in the refrigerator. We were late checking in and very tired, so I didn’t check the entire room, which I usually do.

Sleep quality would have been better if there was a way to make room more sound proof. Woke up to early morning service trucks and an alarm clock going off next door.Having a Starbucks was very nice and knowing the convenience store prices were reasonable for drinks and snacks versus going to the mall and carrying it back.

Enjoyed my stay, as usual. Stay here every year ! So convenient to go shopping at Ala Moana Center.The breakfast buffet at the Plantation Café is excellent ! The Starbucks in the lobby is also a plus. I always look forward to my staycation at the Ala Moana Hotel !

I’ve been staying at the Ala Moana Hotel for over 30 years. Ala Moana Beach Park, my favorite place to swim on Oahu, is just across the street and the Ala Moana Shopping Center, world class shopping, is less than a 5 minute walk away.

If you can choose elsewhere, do it. The hotel is happy to take your money, but you are on your own if anything is needed or anything goes wrong. Rooms are average. Location is okay - next to the Ala Moana shopping mall. Luxury Suites International is anything but. Think twice about staying here, especially through LSI.

I like the friendliness of the staff who are very helpful. I think that's what stands out. The facilities are also great. When you enter the room you feel it is clean and neat. Unquestionably one of the best hotels that have been in the business for many years. They know their business.

Nice place to park for the night within walking distance of Ala Moana shopping centre. Staff very helpful. The rooms were of good size, well serviced and quiet, with a nice King size bed. Only down size is that is well back from the beach and other side of Waikiki if you are looking for a beach type stay, though they do have a pool and gym. If staying over next couple of months be mindful of building works being carried on behind/side of Hotel, that can get quite noisy if trying to sleep during the day.

Nice clean room, convenient to Ala Moana Shopping Center, Ala Moana Park, the bus system, and the Hawaii Convention Center. You don't need to rent a car. The entrance to the hotel is in a relatively quiet street. Checking in and out was a breeze and the staff was very friendly. The prices have been creeping up but not so wild as in Waikiki. I've always found this to be the most convenient and descent hotel on Oahu. The rooms have all you need to look professional on a business trip.

Overall stay here was great. Room was clean, staff was friendly. The only little problem I experienced was asking to stay in the same room for the next nigh as my reservations were separate. Twice I was told by 2 different people that I must check out and check in again because the room was not available. So, my sister and I packed all our stuff and took them down to the lobby, just to be told by another staff that we can stay in the same room. So, we had to drag all our belongings again up to the same room.

Highly would refer to others. Ala Moana Hotel is a great location that is central to not only Ala Moana, but also the Hawaii Convention Center. The room is modern, and has new amenities that will be added such as a Spa. Look forward to visiting next year to the 2019 Global Tourism Summit.

Stayed here per requirement of my company. A spacious room but worn out furniture/bed. Gym equipment very nice and cafe for breakfast had fresh items. Would not consider a luxury site based on my experience. Valet service quick and helpful. Overall decent but would likely choose elsewhere if not required by my company to use.

Enjoyed our stay, disappointed in the lack of facilities, there was no area around the pool where you could sit and enjoy a cocktail and beer with friends or family..no real holiday feel. When booking it says there was a night club..you may need to update your website.

We (4 adults) stayed in a 1br oceanview suite for a week. We arrived late evening and we were put in room on the 6th flr with a view of the Mall parking lot but management graciously moved us to the 20th floor when a room became available. It had expansive views of Ala Moana beach and we could see the Friday fireworks from the lanai. Great location with lots of food options in the mall, easy $2 shuttle service to Waikiki and other sites from the mall. Good and affordable breakfast buffet in hotel with seniors’ discount, though we used our kitchen most days. Groceries nearby. Easy walk to beach. Good fitness centre. Request a higher floor when you book if wanting an ocean view. Will definitely stay here again.

The hotel is in the middle of everything with decent pricing. I particulary appreciate how close it is to the Pearson Testing Center, which is less than a 10 minute walk from the hotel. Staff are friendly.

Very convenient hotel on the edge of Waikiki and adjacent to the shopping mall. Excellent staff and service. Very good bed. It does the trick especially for the price. Rooms good a bit of an upgrade but it did not bother me at all.
user_name:
FNANY
New York City, New York

review_body: We are very pleased with your staff, they made our stay feel very welcoming and pleasurable. We wish that the Starbucks would've stayed open later but totally understand. When we play tourist, We usually always choose this hotel to stay at, we try to stay here at least once a year. Mahalo for your time and service in making our stay a memorable one.

Nice room, great staff and very convenient. I would stay there again. Love that it was walking distance to beach and the the heart of Waikiki. You can go anywhere by bus, terminal is downstairs. Surrounded by restaurants, night life and the convention center is right down the street.

The one thing I didn't like is that you couldn't smoke on the balcony. You had to go all the way downstairs in sleeping clothes to smoke. It was a big inconvenience. The elevator key cards was humbug.

Keep up the service, kamaaina price and quality. Front counter personnel are very personable and helpful. Cleaning service are very helpful and keep the rooms clean and tidy. The breakfast buffet is great and convenient. Starbucks makes it easy in the morning & evening to get refreshments

駅近・買い物便利・最高の眺望これは自分達が望む条件ですが、まさにピッタリのホテルです。今回で４度目ですが益々Ala Moana Hotelが好きになりました、21/01/2019～03/02/2019滞在の予定です、その節は宜しくお願いします。最後に質問が有ります。Is there a discount for staying several days?ちなみに、この夏はRoom №3209にstayしました。I'm very pleased about №3209 room.next time もこの部屋にしたいと思います。以上です。

First time stay at Ala Moana Hotel and it was wonderful! From the beautiful room with partial ocean view to the awesome customer service! It was also convenient to be on the same property as Ala Moana shopping center where we enjoyed wonderful food and shopping.

I used it from Sapporo-shi of Hokkaido after the earthquake disaster. Anyway, I wanted to take the fatigue by having been tired from work and a meal and sleep to go to the satisfaction. I used it for the first time, but the room was kept clean, and a blue floor and the white bed which harked back to the sky were able to spend it comfortably. There was a parking lot underground and was able to leave a car very usefully and in peace. In addition, I want to use it. You're very kind.

We always enjoy staying at the Ala Moana Hotel because it is very convenient and the employees are all friendly. Enjoy having breakfast at the restaurant by the lobby. Thank you! Cannot wait to visit again.

Service of the staff was excellent. Check-in process was quick and easy. The complimentary upgrade was appreciated. My room was clean with a great view of the ocean as well as Diamond Head. High floor is the way to go!

The hotel is nice to be close to Ala Moana Center, but there are many complaints.Discontent· There is no toilet shower· The water pressure of the shower is very weak· There is a lack of amenities such as a toothbrush and a system to hang a swimsuit· The wall is thin. I can hear the next voice

We had a nice styaing and tahnks for your hospitality.The hotel locaton is so convinience that we can have a shopping ARAMOANA CENTER nearly and go to WAIKIKI soon.We want to stay in this hotel next our tour.

I'd avoid this property. The rooms small, close to a noisy construction space, and the staff rather unfriendly. The bathroom had probably the most antiquated plumbing on the island. The lobby is well laid-out and conducive to meeting and conversation. The restaurant terrible. Not close to the beach.

My wife and I are celebrating our 20th year wedding anniversary this weekend. We usually have dinner at Hy’s steakhouse in Waikiki which is a short jaunt from this hotel. Our AC also broke down this past week during a very humid week in Hawaii. Therefore, we decided to spend a night in the Honolulu area to be closer to Waikiki and enjoy a night in AC. Our Kamaaina (resident) room rate was in line with other hotels. Pros: next to Oahu’s largest mall (Ala Moana Center)Close to Ala Moana Beach parkClose to Waikiki Clean propertyKitchenette Starbucks in lobbyCons: although close to Waikiki, a little far to walk to Royal Hawaiian shopping enter and International Marketplace. Self Parking dark and a little under maintained I.e lines fading. Traffic noise

Ala Moana Hotel is very easy to find. It is close to a safe swimming beach. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The room was clean and tidy. It had good views of the ocean. The bed was very comfortable and the shower was great.

Very noisy rooms, even being 8 floors up from the street. rooms were small, poor shower, Service was poor. We asked for pillows but didn't get them until requesting a second time. Hotel lobby was very hot. Very poor Wi-Fi internet access. I would not recommend this hotel.

It was the second time we stay.We spent a pleasant Hawaii vacation everytime.The location of Ala Moana is great!In the twin room we stayed, it's a bit disappointing that one is a sofa bed.I hope a toothbrush will installed.The correspondence of the stuff was perfect.

The check in process was slow and extraordinaryly painful. Five people in line in front of me and it took 45 minutes to check in. The entire lobby area was hot, the employees sat with fans blowing on them...they said “we got new AC but it doesn’t work”. The room was also disappointing...when I pulled the sheets back I noticed that the bottom sheet was about 12inches to short so the lower part of the mattress was exposed. GROSS! When I told the housekeeper she told me that it was the appropriate size, and that the actual size varies depending on the country the sheet was made??? I’m pretty sure my jaw was on the ground when she said that. The shower curtain had mildew all over the lower half and had a foul urine smell when it got wet. Definitely will not stay there again!

This Hotel is located just outside of downtown Waikiki. Our room had a ocean view with a small balcony and overlooked a harbor. Included in the room rate is breakfast that has many choices catering to different cultures. Our king bed was very comfortable and our room had a small refrigerator, microwave, and coffee maker. Our room was a decent size and included free WiFi and a flat screen TV. There is access to the Ala Moana shopping center via the 2nd floor. Many mall type shops and fair selection of restaurants are there.

Excellent location, close to shopping and the beach. Room was nice and clean. Good view of the mountains. Nice to have Starbucks in the lobby. Plantation café served a great breakfast buffet. had a little trouble with the room key in the elevator to get to your floor but not a big deal.

It's a perfect location because it's close to shopping center and to other stores. It's a walking distance. I just wish that the side entrance of the hotel is accessible after hours from the shopping mall.

Very good room. Lacked map and locations of ice machines, pool, and other amenities. Small problem with clean housekeeping. Very long line to check in. Having to make this review a certain length is not user-friendly.

The wing where I was located had fake balconies. The sauna and hot tub were out of service. The beds were not comfortable. When checking in, I was able to secure a room with the agent who called me forward. Someone in my group was serviced by another agent who failed to even look to see if there were rooms available. The agent who assisted me was nice enough to check and immediately found a room.

After checking into room. There was exactly 2 towels for the both of us. There were no additional pillows, sheets or blankets for the sofa bed either. Upon making a phone call to housekeeping I was told, it would NOT be allowed to deliver additional towels due to the number of people in my party. It finally took some convincing and a bit of frustration to get the bedding and a couple of more towels delivered.

Ala Moana Hotel is Conveniently located, Clean, and Comfortable for us! It’s just a step out to get to the biggest shopping center. There are many eateries nearby to treat your taste buds. And the beach is right around the corner! A perfect place to stay!

Hotel Staff and Services were excellant. Location is great. Could have more restaurant services internally but having the mall next door helps. Parking was convenient but the attendants could be a little more pleasant.

Hotel was fine, good location, and friendly staff.This review is for Airpads which is one of 5 companies that manage 10% of the rooms at the hotel. We booked it before reading the reviews and it was listed at least $20 a night less than the hotel. If you read the reviews, its all true! We had trouble the minute we got there to check in! The front desk did not have our reservation. They called Airpads while I waited and couldn't figure it out. After 3 hours, Airpads stated it was a system error and they booked the wrong name... their booking agent's name! Not how I wanted to start my vacation. Then more bad news. I learned they are 1/5 companies that contracts 10% of the rooms and rents them out like an AIRBNB. But they are the ONLY company that puts all the charges on their customers!!! That means they charged us $25 resort fees per night and $50 booking fee which the hotel charges them. The only company that does that!!! Shady! in the end I paid hundreds more than if I booked through the hotel. Take my word for it, you have so many options out there, why would you even consider Airpads?Hopefully the hotel sees this which is hurting their reviews and get rid of Airpads!!!

terribly uncomfortable bed...check in took very long, the front desk person next to ours waited on three people and we were still waiting...people at front desk were not pleasant at all toilet paper holder was falling off the walljackhammering at 7:00am right outside our window construction men all over the place could see right in our window

will be staying again to have surgery on Oahu. the location is close to the hospital. the room was comfortable. like having valet parking. staff was helpful. bed comfortable enough. traffic was a little loud

This is a great hotel. Convenient location. I enjoy staying close to the mall for the terrific shopping and restaurant selection. The staff is friendly and helpful. Love the shops inside the hotel as well as the Starbucks!! Stay here. You will love it.

it was a good stay. the room was clean. No kleenex that i could find in the room though. I could not seem to adjust the temperature in the room. It was too cold for me as i had a bad cough to begin with.

I've always liked this hotel (as kamaaina) for my convenience as I take my R&R. Housekeeping Lead might have to take periodic inspection of rooms after cleaning and ready for visitors and kamaaina alike.

Always a pleasure staying at this hotel. An added bonus is having a Starbucks in the Lobby. Love how the mall is connected to the hotel and is all walking distance. It's so convenient to shop and then drop and then continue to shop again! It's really your one sop for everything and anything. And then if your needing to venture outside of the hotel, everything again just surrounds all angles of the hotel/mall. The rooms are just a bit dated, but it's still clean and enjoyable.

We love the location and room size, perfect for just 2 people. We love that your folks offer Kama'aina rates and other incentives. We finally tried the restaurant on the 36th floor. It is absolutely amazing. The view, the food and the hosts were the best we ever had.

Good Hotel, 5 minutes from a few of the other hotels in Waikiki and directly opposite Convention center, part of shopping center complex, without being in the center. My only gripe was with sauna/steam room. Pool attendant tried telling me - not necessary to shower before use of these areas!! Then on second use of sauna, temperature not hot in sauna and when I told attendant, his response was to put more water on rocks- it was on and stone cold. We also had to use a plastic 'sani tise' bottle to pour water over rocks!

Location Location Location! Close to shopping center, no need to drive. Eateries and shops next door Rooms very cleans and staff warm and friendly. Best value with restaurant attached to hotel and Starbucks indoors.

Staff was very helpful! Located right next to Ala Moana Shopping Center (the best). Near Waikiki, the convention center and other attractions. Beautiful ocean & canal views. We have stayed many times for business, a conference, pleasure and will stay there again. Clean, convenient, friendly and reasonable price = things I look for.

It is commonly accepted that breakfast ticket of a hotel is provided as soon as the customer checks in. However, the hotel not just didn't provide the breakfast ticket at the right time, but also gave it when we check out. Giving it when we check out seems nothing but trying to irritate us. A reasonable reformation of hotel's weak management should be made for future customers.

Stayed here for 2 nights and would never stay again.Upon arrival (with a taxi full of suitcases), three bellmen were just standing around talking and laughing. Not one greeted us or offered assistance.The lady on check in was not overly friendly and when I asked for a king bed for my husband and I, she said there were none available. She sent us to the Kona lifts even though our room was right by the Waikiki lifts.The room was terrible. Tiny, hot, dated, uncomfortable beds and tiny pillows. We had booked a partial ocean view and had to crane our necks to get any glimpse of it. The bathroom is tiny too.I went back to the front desk to tell them how disappointed we were and miraculously there were king rooms available even though we’d been denied one 10 minutes earlier. We moved to a king room and whilst we were happier with that, the room itself was still small and old.The hotel is not overly cheap and for what you get I would definitely stay somewhere else next time.

This was our first time in Hawaii, and it was definitely a great trip. We were looking into several hotels but choose Ala Moana not only for the affordability but the quality. A special thanks to Jonelle, whose customer service exceeded all expectations from our trip. I arrived to check in early because I was suffering from illness due to the heat, and she was more than helpful to us. She not only found another room for us to check in early, but she made sure it was a suitable room to help me recover quickly and provided recommendations on what items to get to feel better. In terms of the hotel itself, the building and facilities are beyond extraordinary. It feels like a top notch quality hotel for the budget of an average holiday spender. Our room was clean, modern, and had a great view. The location was not too far from central city and the beach, and is located right next door to a large shopping mall with everything you need. Overall, this was a great trip for us and we will definitely be back soon!

We stay at Ala Moana once a month and have gotten to know the staff well. Management should be aware that a happy staff makes for a busier establishment. The valet and bell service crew have been very welcoming and are the first to greet guests and are to be credited for doing their jobs well.

Great friendly hotel, well located. with lots of shopping and a food court in the shopping complex next door. Arrived after cruise at 9.30am and a room was available on arrival which was great .The staff were helpful. Would stay there again

Rooms are clean and hotel is in a good location, Easy access to get around especially to Ala Moana Center next to the Hotel. Our reserved room however was not available. Hotel did upgrade to a larger room but came with a view of the parking lot next door. Original reservation was an Ocean View room. Very busy hotel so if you book make sure they actually have available what you reserve. Other than the room issue everything else was fine and they have a good breakfast. Parking not included there is an additional fee.

My family and I stay at this hotel for the comfort and convenience. Close to all our visiting needs. Staff is very helpful especially during last minute bookings. Parking gets a little tight after 9 o’clock but they will help you find a parking. Highly recommend.

Almost on top of Ala Moana Shopping Center. Away from the busyness of Waikiki. Great staff, always helpful and friendly. Well maintained. Very convenient. OK value for a city like Honolulu. I would prefer a smaller hotel. Nevertheless I will be back.

I chose Ala Moana because my previous stays were wonderful and location is excellent. Staffs at front desk, housekeeping, and guards are nice and friendly. Rooms were kept clean everyday. I will definitely choose Ala Moana for my next trip.

I regularly stay at Ala Moana Hotel when visiting O'ahu. It's a safe bet. Convenient location, clean, good value. Being right next to Ala Moana Center there are amazing shopping and dining experiences in easy walking distance.

We stayed as we were tenting our house and had a great weekend. Enjoyed being close to the mall and swimming in the pool. Would have liked to have more tv channels but only because we were hanging out in the room.

Had an amazing time from the time we arrived to the time we left. The staff were very helpful and very courteous. When we return we will definitely be staying in your hotel. Well done everybody. Would recommend your hotel.

Very nice stay. Room was not ready upon check in. Very nice woman at front desk upgraded to another room at no extra charge. Very professional. The $10 dollar Starbucks card was also great. Thank you for an awesome stay.

It is directly connected to the shopping center and is very convenient. Cleaning was also thorough and I was able to spend comfortably.If there is opportunity, I would like to stay again.Thank you for a wonderful stay.

We rescheduled our travel, have left Maui one day earlier due to the hurricane Olivia. We were so relieved to be able to make a reservation at Ala Moana Hotel, thank you. The location is very convenient to go shopping in Alamoana shopping center.

The Room was clean and the air conditioner worked perfectly Exactly what we expected ! The coffee shop being there was a nice extra. Checking in was a little slow but probably because lots of people enjoy your hotel!

Your valet attendants are super friendly. Front desk welcome us local with open arms. Only flaws I see is your the bathroom tub is to high to go in and out. Do you have any of your rooms have a easy show access?

We came to Honolulu from Kona for my husband's medical procedure at Queens Hospital. The hotel was centrally located and parking was accessible for our rental car. We also loved going to the Ala Moana Food Court for great food choices. We enjoyed our stay tremendously. Thank you.

This hotel does everything well. Very friendly staff, nicely equipped rooms (there's an actual drip coffee maker, which arguably makes coffee that's superior to Keurig), comfy beds, well-designed, fast elevators (in many high-rise hotels, you have to wait for one to stop), very good complimentary breakfast in an actual restaurant.

The check in process was indicative of the stay, it was a really long line. I felt like we spent time waiting, for elevators, for the valet, for our key card to get fixed. Too many issues to happen in one short trip.

Great kamaaina hotel. Close to the shopping mall - Ala Moana Center and the Convention Center. Convenience store and other shops in the lobby and a Starbucks. Great hotel to escape from the humdrum of work.

The hotel is beautiful and convenient, the staff are friendly and helpful. The only thing is the front desk will not take future reservations, it has to be done on-line. This does not make sense to me.

Great Hotel. Could use more food options. Service everywhere, even at the little sundry shop was fantastic. The view from our room was an Ocean View and was unreal! I will return again for our next little stay-cation.

Don't get me wrong it was a beautiful hotel. I really enjoyed my stay but at about 10pm on my first night my room was flooded by a broken toilet. There was about 15cms of water through the whole room I had luggage soaked and Got my room changed and rest of stay was great! I wouldn't suggest to book a contiki here thought otherwise youd be the only person on contiki tour and the staff would have no clue what a contiki tour is. (Not to their fault)

Hi we stayed in this spectacular Penthouse recently and would definitely recommend. There were 4 couples and the Penthouse accommodated us all very comfortably for a week. Even though we had booked this through a separate agent the hotel staff were very helpful with check in and any further queries we had. The situation of the hotel is ideal being so close to the Ala Moana shopping complex and also handy to a lovely beach which will s not crowded like Waikiki beach. The room had incredible views, was spacious, well equipped and clean. Certainly recommend for a group of friends getting together or family get together.

It's a bit of a walk to the beach, but the mall is next door. The service was excellent as was the breakfast. The room itself was a little dated, but I didn't spend too many waking hours there anyway. I'd stay here again, hopefully with my family and without a tropical storm in the forecast!

Clean & reasonable price with great staff. Next to Ala Moana shopping centre including many restaurants. Good breakfast buffet. Good little shop behind lobby for everything. Front desk very helpful too.

We spent several days at the Ala Moana. Everything about it was great - service, rooms, view, location. We used it as our base to explore the island. Much better than the Airbnb location we had for part of the trip. We will definitely be back!

Convenient location. Friendly helpful staff. Room was small but comfortable and adequate. Clean facility. Didn't like having to pay daily for parking but no resort fee was charged so okay. Spent 2 nights at hotel then moved to an airbnb with no parking fee. But nice hotel.

Awesome ServiceAwesome RoomAwesome FoodAwesome EverythingHeidi at reservations is awesome. She helped with my room which there was a problem. She fixed everything on a timely manner and I am super grateful she was there.

All is good except need room service so that people can order food in their rooms. The rooms were clean and when we called for more towels housekeeping was very prompt. Loved the elevators as they went fast and didn't make you wait long. The pool was awesome as well.

Room was pretty small but clean. The pull out sofa bed was a single. Bumped this up to 4 stars because the hotel has direct access to the shopping mall and has a pretty nice bar/restaurant on the 36th floor.

The hotel was nice and staff were friendly. The rooms were ok. The pool was a bit sad and cocktails are hard to get in certain areas. I didn't have a desk in my room so it was hard to work. The location is perfect.

Ala Mona is not the most expensive or best hotel on the strip but is is in the best location. It is at the beginning of all of them. You can then walk along The man street at night and take in all of the sight and sounds. Pick out your favorite eating spot and then find your entertainment goal for this evening. Too much to do and so little time.Back to the hotel: It is very nice with great views and you do get what you pay for. If you're going to stay there a lot, pay a little more for a better room or suite. Myself, I'm gone most of the time and this is just a place to sleep. I do like the pool and it is a good place to take photos from. You see everything..

We thoruough enjoyed our stay. The front desk was exceptional in their service and our room was just enough to be very comfortable since it was just an over night excursion! So very happy that Starbucks is now downstairs in the Lobby!!!

Although beds needed updating, the room was neat clean. Was on the 10th floor and the view was decent. Housekeeping never cleaned obvious trash in the room but it was always made with fresh towels. The morale was high among the staff. They went above and beyond when we needed toothpaste and brushes...even scotch tape. The hotel has a great location beside a high-end mall. It's 2 miles from Waikiki beach. We biked there with biki bikes that are around the corner at the park. Nightclub was by the mall; walking distance. High class eating was 2 miles away (53 by the sea) Great experience overall. Clean and presentable hotel.

If you love to shop then this is a good location in Honolulu, especially for high end brand names. The hotel has a link bridge on Floor 2 to the Ala Moana Center. It is not close to Waikiki so expect a long walk or you could catch the trolley. The rooms are small and the furnishings are showing their many years of service, but it is clean. It is a huge hotel so prepare to get lost. The first hurdle is "Am I in the Waikiki or Kona Tower?". Then you need to learn the maze of corridors. Adds to the adventure. It has an internal Starbucks and an external, but attached cafe called the Plantation Cafe, for breakfasts. Note: if you are over 55years you get a discount in the Plantation Cafe. Reception staff are wonderfully helpful.

Easy place to stay at. Lots of amenities. The pool is a bit small and not for laps. The shopping center is close by. Has a Starbucks. Only type of breakfast is a buffet. I was not able to order off a menu.

This hotel needs to live up to its promises. needs alot of upgrades. People that are on vacation want the tropical drinks and the experience. Our room was suppose to be a room with two queen beds. we had a small room with barely a full bed. We were very disappointed and check out a day early. and went somewhere to try to save our trip.

This is a comfortable hotel that offers a great value. Breakfast buffet was varied and all choices were kept filled. Hotel store had everything we wanted during our stay and Starbuck's in the hotel was convenient.

We stayed for the weekend. Ala Moana is very convenient, easy access to shops and restaurants. The bed could have been better but it is clean and a good deal for the area. We will stay here again and again.

Broke travelling college student following my favorite band on tour, needed something affordable without wasting quality. Had a room with a gorgeous view&very affordable and convenient location! Stayed for 6 days and still had a ton of money left over on my card for shopping and travel expenses, which is normally super rare for me. Conveniently located 10 minutes away from the venue I was going to, and 10 min walking distance from the beach. Literally surrounded by stores, never ran out of stuff to do. Will def book again next time I come to hawaii!

Close to the supermarket, shopping center, restaurant, everywhere.Clean room, nice staff.But we had to spent at least 30 minutes to start checkiing in/out, everybody was waiting.Parking was also convenient.

Stayed in a suite and had the requested kichen set delivered promptly. Toilet trouble also immediately dealt with. Hand-held showerheads would be appreciated (shower head drips while using lower faucet). Room service would be nice. Have stayed many times in the past and plan to stay again during any future visits to Honolulu!

The trolley train is close by. There is construction underway on the Eastern side of the hotel beware of daytime noise that can start very early. We ordered a kettle and that was promptly delivered. They would us to use their trolleys for our bags so we self delivered. We didn’t eat at any of the restaurants so no comment there.

Location to Convention Center is great. Self parking a bit small, but, good to have the valet parking that made it easier. The Plantation Café breakfast buffet was a great value and appreciated that they were open at 0630.

Near Ala Moana Shopping Center, great location! The front desk associate was very courteous upon our arrival and check-in. Housekeeping was also prompt when needed. Our room was a bit small for the pricing but it was accommodating. Parking was a little hassle w/valet being full. Would definitely consider staying there in the future but in a bigger room.

Good location and safe. Clean and reasonably up-to-date with decor. Walking to Ala Moana Shopping Center, bus, beach, and shopping other than Ala Moana such as Kaka`ako and Ward Center where there is a megaplex of cinemas.

Self Parking is always very difficult here. Service is always very good. Rooms were nice and clean. Close proximity to Ala Moana Shopping Center, the Convention Center and other hotels/restaurants is a huge plus.

Party next door to my room, right side, at least 8 people int he room, arguments etc. until 2am in the morning, finally the all left. Problem you can hear everything form wall to wall and the front door to the room is poorly insulated for noises.Seems to be a good hotel, great location, etc. for business pour, if you need a good night sleep.

The checking very smooth and our stay vary pleasant.Room clean, shopping and beaches near by.Service very good and pleasant.Parking easy to go in and outThe view is very nice and we could get the sunsetThe people are helpfull

The room location was perfect 612, but the mattress need changing was soft and feeling springs. we were in a handicapped room. For some reason was not good. please advise. Znext time i book online i will specifically say not handicap

No room service at times r a problem. Especially traveling solo.Location is a big plus.Housecleaning avg. I would prefer it done on a more timely basis. If I need to call housecleaning I should have been advised.Mini refrigerator is very noisy n can b irritating at times.

Hotel was very relaxing but I just picked the wrong time to go for a staycation! The Okinawan festival was on at the convention center so parking even at the hotel was HORRIBLE! Parking attendant was no help and at check in Guest agent was not helpful at all either nor was she understanding of the situation! It seemed she was a total policy by the book person! No flexibility!

Ala Moana is a great hotel for anyone looking for a quality room at a reasonable price. Book directly for Ala Moana by Mantra, though, and NOT Ala Moana by Airpads which is a separate condo rental company and has nothing in common with the main hotel except the address. The Ala Moana staff was very courteous and helpful, and quick to respond when we needed assistance.

Good hotel, nice people, excellent access to shopping after business meetings. King mattress was very uncomfortable. Have had better luck using two double/queen instead. We come to Oahu from Maui frequently and usually stay at the Ala Moana and will continue to do so.

Very convenient to Convention Center. Living room rather small. Information on the kitchen packet needs to be updated and the contents were sufficient, but needs to be clean. We did not use them. Bathroom tub needs a grab bar to get in and out.Disposal needs to be fixed. Living room lamps did not turn on from wall switch. Needs a hotel directory in the room. Ice machines only on even floors was a hassle. Room was clean and housekeeping was pleasant and met our needs.

Stayed here for a festival we went to this past weekend at the Hawaii Convention Center so it was super convenient and mall access to ala moana is awesome. However it took 45 min to check in because there was a lot of people there for the festival and I think that is very long to wait. Room was clean and comfortable, we had a small kitchenette which was good so you can refrigerage left overs and heat them up in the micro. You do have to request a kitchen pack which include dishes, utensils, pans, cutting board, knife, etc. The first day they were out but I managed to get one from the second day. I think those things should already be in the room but then to run out is disappointing. I also wondered why they only have towel sets for 3 people (and not 4 like the norm) especially because we had a suite and we said there was 4 people when we booked. So I ended up having to call for towels for 3 days. Other than that, staff was friendly, wi-fi was good and no major issues. Would stay again next year for the same festival. Also, there was a convenience store downstairs which was great and had almost everything you need and there's a big Starbucks in the lobby as well.

Please place more pillows on bed please. 2 standard pillows on a queen size bed are not enough.The air conditioner was set too cold. That's about it. I don't have 200 minimum characters. I am just filling in stuff.

rooms are neat, clean and newly renovated. Front desk personnel very friendly and helpful. Extremely convenient location if you plan shopping at Ala Moana or attending a conference at the Hawaii Convention Center.

Accommodations were great, staff very efficient and helpful. This hotel is clean and I was happy there was a Starbucks in the lobby! Valet parking was excellent. The traffic in my wing of the hotel was very quiet. I enjoyed the Lanai outside of my floor. The location to Ala Moana Shopping Center is a great seller for the hotel because it has everything near by for your guests.

Very happy with the service right from the beginning when I made the booking via your hotel. The hotel was clean, great location and very friendly and helpful staff. Overall, a great place to stay and I would highly recommend to friends.

Location, location, location. Right next to Ala Moana Shopping Center. Nice accommodations. Plan to wait for their archaic check-in methodology. (Come on guys, you can do better than this But it's not the front desk people's fault. They are very nice. It's just the system has to be updated. It's probably the same as the way they checked in to hotels in the 1920's.

As previously stated they require updating. Also unfortunately you are able to hear if the guests next door are having a shower or using the bathroom which we found annoying especially early hours of the morning.

Customer service excellent. Room comfy except the ants and roaches. I felt itchy on the bed, I thought it could have been my allergies. Then I seen the tiny and bug thing. Small roaches in bathroom and on dresser.

The biggest asset of this hotel was its convenience. It is close to the Hawaii Convention Center where the Okinawan Festival was being held, close to Ala Moana Center for shopping, and close to the beach. The room was perfectly adequate as a place to shower and sleep. The employees were friendly. Only two complaints: The room keys were difficult to operate and the room was not as clean as we would have anticipated.

To check in was soooo long....we came in at 4:30 pm thinking that they check in time at 3:00pm would die down....no!!! You folks have to improve on that. And the parking...you folks also have to monitor how much cars coming in and out...hotel members pay for parking, should have no problem finding parking.

The hotel location is prime, right next to the mall, a block away from the convention center and across the street from the beach. Starbucks coffee and bar is located in the lobby. The self park is great with wider parking stalls than most Hawaii hotels.

Good location and good service. By the way these surveys don't post if you rate low. Interesting how they only want positive things posted. Rigged but my stay was good. convenient to restaurants and shops, convention center. All within walking distance.
user_name:
Cynthia J. C
Lahaina, United States

review_body: Second stay this year. Friendly and helpful staff. Clean and comfortable room. Very close to shopping. The breakfast buffet was OK food-wise, but the service and convenience make it well worth it. Will stay again in the future.

Great Location, Next to the Ala Moana Outdoor mall. If you want to shop this is the place to be. Its also located near the Oahu convention center. The restaurant next to the hotel took very good care of us while Lane was passing thru. They opened for dinner because all the other eateries were closed.

Started stay w/impending "hurricane." Hotel did awesome job taking care of guests. Amount of time spent @ check-in too long. Loved that there's Starbucks in lobby. Need to repair laundry supply vending machines because took money.

Awful. Paper thin walls...could hear couple above us in a super bad fight, our ocean view room was a partial view of the ocean behind a giant parking garage of the mall, no parking available...we were told to park at the mall (and risk being towed overnight) or park hourly on the street, no valet parking available as the cars were double parked already inside the dark parking garage under hotel, plumbing is awful, rooms are so tiny my husband and I couldn’t move past each other between the bed and the dresser/tv table, and the bed was uncomfortable. We checked out next day and went to the Hilton Hawaiian Village. I have no idea how this hotel got a 4/5 star rating.

Centrally located, near Waikiki! Ala Moana Mall is within walking distance, with ample places to eat, beach across the street. Rooms are very nice and clean, décor is up to date. Lobby is ambient with Starbucks to boot!

Terrible computers, very slow, not user friendly. Can't print boarding pass ticket unless date and time are modified by authorized user, other than that it was just a waste of time and just as frustrating as at the airport kiosks.

Stayed here on a business trip and it was excellent. Location, access, proximity to Ala Moana Center and park were all pluses. Public spaces are comfortable and accommodating. Good breakfast buffet. Rooms are a bit on the spartan side.
user_name:
Richard B
San Anselmo, United States

review_body: Good location, nice services and hospitality, and reasonable fare.I would probably come back to this hotel on the next occasion in Honolulu.Hopefully the numbers of washing machines and dryers in the laundy rooms should be more increased.

Wonderful stay! No room service but definitely a great room and I was also given a discounted rate when I extended my stay due to Hurricane Lane. I would definitely stay here again if I ever needed it/wanted to.

Great location easy to get around. Good pool area along with gym etc yummy breakfast. Could not fault our stay here. Would stay at ala moana again. Good communication though out the hurricane lane warnings

We had stayed at the hotel before and had no reason not to stay there again. Help staff and professional. Comfortable bed, nice view. Close to Ala Moana mall for shopping. Will stay here again in the near future.

Our entire experience was amazing! We first contacted the front desk and spoke to Heide Kila to inquire about reservations (we live on Island on a boat and wanted to get a room to ride out Hurricane Lane). Heide was so pleasant, kind, patient and helpful. It was Heide who made a remarkable best first impression for us. Everyone from the front desk, to bell hops, to valet, to housekeeping were so friendly and welcoming. We were so impressed with every one of your staff with whom we had interaction. I state this with sincerity and emphasize the welcoming hospitality at your hotel because there are so many other hotels that just do not provide this inviting experience. We were also delightfully surprised with our room - clean and up kept well. Check-in and check-out was smooth breeze. We live here on island and from time to time have stay-cations. We will never again stay anywhere other than the Ala Moana Hotel! I already have shared our experience with friends and co-workers. A huge shout out to all of you at the Ala Moana Hotel - you all rock! Mahalo nui loa to all of you for making us feel so comfortably welcome.

Would love to visit you again soon. Location is right in the spot and we could have been very happy with it. Weather was a little difficult and the last day was superb it was a real day of Hawaii which is inviting us strongly!!

Great location to airport and Ala moana Shopping centre. Star bucks and a restaurant on site. Room small , but clean, comfortable bed, quiet, overall great value. Wi-Fi in lobby before early check in was available.

My review is the same as I typed on the previous page forgot to mention the valet parking guys where great, I had to find a hotel with restaurant, gym, pool as my husband on a walker, it made everything easy for him in your hotel.

Honestly I can't think of a better hotel. The staff are some of the most helpful and kind people I've ever met.The location couldn't be better the best food and shopping all within walking distance, and the rooms restful and relaxing Ala Moana is the only place to stay.

greatvery nice, good location , good brackfast, resonable price to stay, good condition as I expectedIf going there again, I think I will stay here again. the space of the parking lot is lager than i expected

Great place to stay. Staff were warm & welcoming; always eager to assist. Rooms were spacious & always kept clean. Great location; nestled next to the Ala Moana Mall. Definitely well worth it; & would be a place for me to return to.

Extended our vacation at the last minute and got this hotel very late. We had drove by it from the Trolley and realized it was a great location. Check in was pleasant. The hotel is beautiful and has walkway to the Ala Moana Mall which has everything. Wish we could have enjoyed the hotel longer and used the facilities. Staff was nice . Bell Man held our bags while we walked around the Mall and had lunch before going to the airport.

Scores, and scores of restaurants and shopping next door. Their main restaurant at the top is great. The view and food is exceptional!Each room in the hotel is owned by individuals; but managed collectively. The ineriors are clean, but beginning to show it's age.

Really great hotel, the rooms are really nice, has free WiFi, has a pool, lots of stores in the lobby aswell and they have a Starbucks down stairs. Even one of the levels has access to the Shopping Centre. The hotel is also located about a 15 minute walk from the beach aswell which is also really good and isn’t too expensive to stay :)

We stayed at the Ala Moana during hurricane Lane as a precaution. What a great experience! The staff was amazing- so kind and helpful, and very conscientious of everyone’s nerves. They went above and beyond to provide us with everything we needed, and did not take advantage of our situation being stuck inside for a few days. I know some of the staff were sleeping there when I’m sure they wanted to be home with their own families preparing for the storm, and you could tell that upper-level management were pitching in to give workers a break; I saw the hotel GM bussing tables and cleaning in the restaurant. Parking was free because we had to move cars out of a potential flood area, and we even got a special “distressed” rate on a room when we had to extend one day and the only thing available was an upgrade - less expensive than our original room rate!
