They opened the restaurant so everyone could eat when nothing else in the area was open, provided free movies with juice and popcorn for the kids, set up a game room, and scheduled some hula performances to keep us occupied. The communication was excellent- information was posted everywhere and announcements were made regularly to keep us informed about the status of this freak storm. I’m so thankful we stayed here to weather Lane, and highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Honolulu!

My room was clean and neat each day. It was bug free. The staff were very accommodating and I really did appreciate all they did for me while I was there. I was by myself and at 69 years old some things can be nerve wracking (like someone pounding on the door at 2 am saying let me in. I called the front desk but a person in the room across the hall called and they were there at the time I was on the phone. The poor soul had a few too many drinks and was on the wrong floor. I appreciated how quickly they responded to this situation.. They also were very informative about the safe places to eat in the Ala Moana Center. I loved coming in from work each evening and finding my room looking as fresh as the day i came. The plantation restaurant served the best breakfasts ever and the staff there went above and beyond to make it an enjoyable experience every day. They always sat me at a table which was close to the food and I did not have to climb steps as I have a problem walking. I will be going back there in November.

Good place to stay. Connecting bridge to the Ala Moana Mall was great. Starbucks and stores in the mall, fabulous. Walking distance to Walmart and grocery store. Parking is a nightmare because they oversell the spaces

Having been a guest at the Ala Moana since 1970, the hotel has managed to retain its excellent customer service to both as a kamaaina and a mainland returnee.The location is excellent, the mall is close, access to the H1, Waikiki, the beach and downtown offices are harf for other resort/hotels to match.

Since the Mantra Hotel Group has taken over the Ala Moana Hotel from Outrigger there has been a progression of positive changes for guest comforts and services. During the hurricane Lane crisis they hosted First Responders, provided free entertainment for guests when regular businesses were closed due to the storm. Had the Ala Moana Shopping center open up secured parking, while the mall was closed. Provided verbal and posted updates on the storm and facility resources.
user_name:
Harvey E
New York City, New York

review_body: Everything excellent in service, except noticed the rooms are getting worn -- need makeover in the future. I realize with the heavy flow of guests, things will get beat up, but bathrooms are ready forre-model.

Pretty clean hotel speedy check in.... valet wasn't being used due to hurricane lane but hotel has everything you need in it (Starbucks, massage area, about 3 to 4 stores etc) the dinner at the restuarant for a buffet should of had more options but breakfast buffet made up for the terrible dinner

This is a good place, lively, great staff and breakfast but the room was outdated in need of a makeover, pool also closes way to early (7pm) the location could be better, it's a good 20mins walk to the main area in Waikiki

Had to come to Honolulu for business during the Hurricane / Tropical Storm Lane and the company put me up in The Ala Moana. Situated about 15 min from HNL Intl Airport this hotel is moderately upscale with a friendly staff and a very comfortable room and mattress. This is a family friendly location so the kiddos are welcome. The amenities were a bit tight due to the storm but once everything got back to normal all was well. The Plantation Cafe is the hotel restaurant/Buffett. Could be better in my eyes but serves its purpose. Its Hawaii. There's no such thing as a bad review right? Its paradise....

Front desk clerks were very accommodating. Nice Pool and nice sundry store just wished checkout was 12 oclock. Close to major shopping center and public bus terminal. I liked that it was close to Macys and very convenient to find places to eat. Nice clean rooms had a beautiful veiw of the swimming pool.

My brother and I gave my father a stay at the Ala Moana Hotel as a 90th birthday gift. The hotel knew this and upgraded him from a standard room to a suite. A very kind gesture that made his trip memorable. He liked the whole hotel and loved the location. A very easy walk for him to the shopping center where he could get reasonably priced and tasty meals at the huge food court and bus stop just outside the hotel.

Stayed in this Hotel for 2 nights, Rooms were ok but looked a little be tied, but I could say that about all of Honolulu. Staff that we encountered were friendly and helpful. Parking was $20 per night for self-park or $25 for valet, the valet parking was a bit slow at times, specially at night. Found a cockroach in the room one night, but not surprised by this as you are going to find them on all tropical islands. Breakfast is an extra $16 per day, per person, didn’t try it as there were plenty of other places to eat not to far from the HotelPros• Comfortable beds and pillows• Shops close by• Friendly staff• Star Bucks in the lobby• Close to Waikiki Cons• Long queues for Valet at night

We had a great time. The Ala Moana has the best location for us kamaainas (old timers). We could see friends and family conveniently, many great restaurants in the adjacent center, walk to the beach across the street, the Ala Moana beach park is not crowded like Waikiki beach. The service is outstanding, the front desk, housekeeping, café, all working hard to please us.

Spent Admissions Day weekend on Oahu & booked a room at Ala Moana. Not much has changed since the last time I stayed there about 2 years ago. While the room was clean, the mattresses could probably be replaced. They weren’t very comfortable. Valet parked as self-parking was limited & inconvenient. Valets were quick & friendly.

Everything was great about this hotel from the customer service to the ammenities. The only issue we had was the plumbing sounds. If someone was to flush the toilet or take shower you would hear it through the walls. My wife and I was awaken from a deep sleep around 1:30 am because the sounds of the plumbing through the walls were so loud. This wasn't a one time thing either. It was almost every night for our week stay. Although it was a bit of a nuisance it didn't ruin our stay. It was 5 min walk to the Ala Moana Center (Mall) which was great for my wife because her shopping needs were fulfilled from a short distance. Waikiki beach was about a 10 to 15 min walk from the hotel and most of the restaurants were within a mile to two mile radius from the Ala Moana hotel. We rented a vehicle for a week and even though the hotel provides parking, it was $20 per day and some nights it was almost impossible to find parking cause it would fill up fast. If I had to do it all over I would not rent a vehicle instead I would use uber or lyft. You'll save a lot money from rental and parking fees. Only rent on days you feel like traveling around the island. As for the hotel, the staff was very curtious and friendly, the rooms were comfy, and the location was perfect for us because most places we visited were within walking distance. I have no problem coming back to this hotel. I would recommend this place to my friends and family.

Interior upgrades are sorely needed. Pluming is noisy, in-room fridge is noisy, noise from hallway, thin walls ... Old furniture and carpeting, bare-bone essentials ... feels cheap and out-of-date. Room feels dusty, failing keycards, inadequate parking, very dirty parking garage ...

We booked online and checked-in same day when we decided to complete change our vacation plans from Molokai to Honolulu. The Ala Moana hotel was able to accommodate us and even upgraded us to a larger room than we booked. I’m not gonna ask why, I’m just gonna say “thank you!” The rooms are nice and current enough. The gym is great and convenient. They even have a sauna. After I went to the 24 Hr Fitness across the street and realized they didn’t have a sauna there, I frequented the hotel gym which was actually nicer to work out in than the full 24 Hr Fitness facility across the way. The pool area is also nice.Their staff was courteous, friendly and informative. They rent out beach towels for free so you don’t have to buy your own.Try the steakhouse there too! Their service was great and the food was delicious! I highly recommend the filet and the guava cheesecake (I ordered the cheesecake twice). The best part is it’s walking distance to many things—restaurants, the beach, movies. There’s a great sushi restaurant nearby called Odoriko. We walked to Xtreme Parasail for jet skiing and parasailing. I definitely would recommend this hotel.

So satisfied with our mini vacation in Honolulu. Convenient to shopping mall and other great eating places. Hotel staff is super friendly and helpful. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Didn’t expect a view but we did have a partial view of the ocean.

The checkout was much faster and room was great! Definitely do valet parking so you don't have to self park. Hotel seems newly renovated so that is a plus and location is excellent. Directions to get to the mall by foots would be helpful

Beautiful clean.hotel.near everything ,friendly staff good healthty huge breakfast Hotel hat his.own mall and park in.der lobby Starbucks.I will definitely recommend your hotel to family, relatives.and.friends of mine.Thank u. Aloha.and Mahalo

The location was good since the hotel was walking distance to Ala Moana Shopping center. However, the hotel would be better if it provided more necessary amenities. I wish there were slippers, toobrush, toothpaste, hair conditioner, and bottle opener. Also, the floor of the bathroom could be cleaner.

Well maintained hotel close to everything. Just park your car and don't use it until you leave. My room was very comfortable. All hotel personnel were friendly and helpful, especially Jean at the front desk.

Every person in your hotel was so kind, and I really enjoyed the time in your hotel. And the locatoin of the hotel was really good, so I and my family enjoyed every day.The meal.. actually I only had breakfast in your hotel...It tasted good, but wish it could be more varioussThank you.

Hotel was nicely decorated and made you feel comfortable. Cleanliness was also a plus. We requested a lower floor and loved the accommodations. The gift store was very convenient being open till 11:30 p.m. The Starbucks could use a little late close time for the late arrivals.

The valet Team used my name when welcoming me back as well as when retrieving my vehicle.I did not use housekeeping but when we first arrive the room was clean.Checking in and checking out went smooth.

All of employees from front desk, porters, bellmen are great! Great customer service. The hotel is ideally located adjacent to the shopping center which is definitely a plus for me as I do not drive on Oahu. So I'm able to shop and have access to eating places as well.

Reserve through the Hotel if your booking agent uses Air Pads (rental agents). Do not reserve a room owned by a private owner or check to see if the unit is scheduled to be cleaned prior to your arrival, because the hotel will NOT do it.

I had a last minute trip and check in. The front desk was helpful and accommodating. My room in the Waikiki Tower was clean, lots of room, nice bed and bathroom. Request or pay the extra for Waikiki Tower. Kona tower is ready for a remodel.

Great location, pleasant hotel with many amenities. Close to Ala moana shopping center and central bus stations. Many shops and restaurants to choose from. Waikiki is only a few minutes walk away to beautiful sandy beaches.

Checking in time took over 20 minutes because of the waiting line of people. We're not certain if all of the elevators were functioning, because it seems we waited quite long. The workers were very friendly and helpful. The location is ideal because of the proximity to Ala Moana Shopping Center. And, the eateries in the hotel building were very good! We hope to use the hotel again.

Had a great stay. Maid service was excellent! We loved Grace! You also have great valet people. Always friendly. The only thing with our room is that the dishwasher was broken & filled with water. I'd also suggest better quality lotion & shampoo/conditioner. They didn't seem to smell too good.

The linen could be better and i would suggest giving 4 pillows for 2 guests instead of just 3. The view and location was great. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We enjoyed our stay very much, definitely recommend!

Be sure to reserve your room w/ Ala Moana Mantra, not the time share group Ala Moana LSI; LSI don't clean your rooms, or give you toilet paper!!! Reserved on the phone w/ a very helpful staff person; bettter than online to answer all my questions. Very friendly hotel staff: front desk, security, bell boys, valet & self-parking personel, & house keeping. Great loction next to the big mall. Clean rooms. Parking on the weekends was rough & fills up after 8PM, so the helpful staff let us park in improvised parking spaces in the garage. Too bad the old disco in the lobby closed down.

Don’t try and check in on a Friday at 3pm -huge question at the lobby.There is no pool bar, so having a mai tai by the pool is not an option; also the restaurant is very posh, with no casual diining option, so everyone has to go to mall next door to bring food back to rooms. We had a room with two double beds, which can barely accommodate two people, so not a good nights sleep. Apart from expensive mall shops, feels like a sterile area with busy roads around. 15 minute walk to beach. Fine if you want the convention centre, big disappointment for last day of otherwise great holiday in the islands.

Very good and helpful service at check-in and check- out. Room was very clean. Air conditioner worked very well. Property located next to major shopping center with lots of stores and eating places. Staff was very friendly.

Convenient location, affordable kamaaina rate, easy self-parking, most times handi-cap parking stalls were avail which was most accomodating since my dad was in a wheelchair. We did not need an ADA room but it was nice to see the safety bars in the shower.

Comfortable Beds, Friendly Staff and excellent location. The different stores in the hotel were cinvienenent and stayed open late. The staff was extremely helpful with all questions. Safe area and is close to beach and mall.

We had a great time at the 70's nightclub reunion. Saw a lot of old friends and heard a lot of great music from yesteryear. The breakfast buffet was nice. It's too bad Rumours closed down. Plenty memories of that place. At least we got to see Darryl, Nick, and Kia. Mahalo to the staff for a wonderful time.

Rooms are a bit small and the fitout is dated. Overall, service was good and property was clean. Don't get too excited about the breakfast, it's not extravagant. Ice machine only on the even floors...

My family, my parents, and my brother's family (with two children), all from japan, stayed together for a family reunion during summer vacation. The location of the hotel, service provided, and friendly staff, made us all satisfied.

Over many years, approximately thirteen I have had the pleasure of staying at the Ala Moana Hotel dozens of times, mostly for business but more frequently than I would like for medical reasons. We have tried other hotels in the area but have found that the Ala Moana Hotel is better suited by location and convenience not to mentions the available amenities but still not truly happy with the parking situation.

We really enjoyed our stay at this location. The proximity to the ocean and the view were amazing. The staff was always warm and welcoming and the breakfast each morning was great. It also really helped to be so close to the mall and various bus stops.

The pool closes far too early. The pillows are absolutely terrible. I paid extra for some beach view; I guess the hotel's definition of that is "slim to none." The hotel staff was nice and the location to the convention Center is great. The breakfast buffet was very good.

Hotel rooms in Honolulu are really expensive so it's hard to feel enthusiastic when you are paying top dollar for average hotels. The Ala Moana Hotel isn't located as conveniently close to Waikiki as some of its competitors but being next to the Ala Moana mall was good.

This hotel is a standard international hotel, providing better than average service. The rooms were clean, staff friendly, and the location is very good for access to the Ala Moana shopping precinct and other nearby shops such as the Ward Center. In-house dining options were a little limited (but there are lots of options just next door in Ala Moana) and instructions on how to use the TV and other room facilities were not provided.

The sofa and chairs in our room were uncomfortable. Bed was OK though. The glass on the dining table in our room was loose; kept moving. May be a hazard when small children are present.Check in and check out were done expeditiously by friendly employees. Valets were courteous and prompt.

Thank you to all the great staff, everyone did a great job....I will be back as soon as possible. A clean, bright and cheerful place.Check in and out was smooth, room was clean, food was good, my complements and Aloha to you all..

Everything was excellent we enjoy our stay at the hotel. Although it was a short visit due to being pre occupied with our church conference at the NBC Arena. Thanks for the opportunity to be able to stay at this hotel.

Location was perfect. Walking distance to the mall, convention center & beach. Hotel was able to assist with tour packages to visit other parts of the island. Had a great time while visiting Oahu. Will hopefully be back again. If we do make it back, we know where we'll be staying if rooms are available.

Not for the shopping faint hearted! Next to the worlds biggest open air mall... Ala Moana is a perfectly situated hotel, with the very beautiful Ala Moana beach and Magic Island across the street.Very kind, warm and hospitable staff from reception to housekeeping. Special mention to Thomas serving at poolside who went the extra mile to care for me as I used the shower facilities before my night flight after having checked out earlier that day. Nothing was too much trouble for him... toiletries towels... and even a plastic bag for my wet clothes!Pink trolley stop is just 5 minutes away and that takes you to the heart of Waikiki in about 10 minutes, for just $2.Delighted I chose this hotel... on a very high floor and incredible sea views.

The staff gave excellent service considering the Hotel was 100% full. The hotel is conveniently located at the Waikiki end of Ala Moana Shopping Center. It has a wide variety of places to eat.The pool staff was very accomitdating to our little children by offering them water wings.

The hotel room was nice. The TV was a nice size for the room, however, I did find rubbish on the floor under the night stand on the side of the bed. I guess the cleaning staff don't bend down and look under the furniture. I like the fact that the refrigerator was a nice size and there is also a microwave. Very convenient location also. You can walk back and forth to Ala Moana Shopping Center.

The best thing about this hotel is the location. The rooms are okay, nothing fancy and no bells and whistles. We weren't given a bath rug and the mirror in the bathroom was not cleaned well. The wine glasses that were brought to our room had lipstick stains on the rims.

Everything about this hotel is very good, especially the location with a walking bridge right into the Ala Moana Shopping Center where there are many restaurants, a food court and lots of shops. My only complaint is I could hear the loud guests in neighboring rooms all night long. Bed was super comfortable, but the walls are thin so I could hear others as well as every flush of a toilet and shower through out the night and early hours of the morning.

Great place to have a get away! We came over for the 70s night club reunion from Kona. This is the 3rd year in a row. We love to stay here and love to enjoy the happy hour at the Signature! Can't wait until next year!

Excellent stay with clean rooms. Quiet. Convenient to shopping. Goodvalue. Friendly staff. Excellent service. Love the Starbucks downstairs. Lots if seating in the lobby. Valet service is well run. Would stay again

I was pleasantly surprised with the hotel and room. It was my first stay at this location and love the convenience of getting to the mall and surrounding areas on foot. In the past I’ve stayed in Waikiki but decided to change location and am happy that I did. The Kona Tower room I stayed in faces the ocean so I had a partial ocean view. The mall is connected to a walkway by taking the elevator to the 2nd floor where the Executive Offices are located. I think I’ll be staying at this hotel every time I’m in town. Having a Starbucks in the lobby is a plus.
user_name:
patricianF2969KY
New York City, New York

review_body: We were booked to stay one night at ALA MONA. We were visiting our son and dtr in law and children. They live in Ewa Beach, HI. Both are in army- Lt Colonels . Our flight was early and it was my birthday, so we picked this hotel. To make long story short, our plans changed at the last minute. According to clerk at hotel, almost sold out. But because I booked through Booking. com. requests had to come from mgr at both places. To be fair, they have three day cancellation policy. But if it is Sunday and hotel almost full, why not try to sell room. At one point when talking to hotel mgr., booking .com agent said they may give credit to use at a future date. Some time a little kindness goes a long way by word of mouth. We were just going to let our son use credit. But I guess nobody could be bothered.

We have stayed at many hotels in Honolulu but Ala Moana is our favorite location for stopovers. Proximity to Ala Moana Center is a real benefit. Many rooms have been upgraded recently. The pool is good, breakfast buffet is more than adequate, and the Signature Restaurant offers very high quality dining.

The staff was friendly. The place needs a deep clean something serous the carpets are dirty overall the entire establishment is dirty. Also not having room service was a big inconvenience it would have been nice to be able to order for room service.

I'm not certain as to what it meant by my review, requiring 200 hundred words, I view excellent is excellent. Don't need to embellish it. O K, 200, I liked my stay at the Ala Moana Hotel, which includes, Wed, Thurs, Fri, Sat, Sun, Mon. Tue, Wed. Hope this meets the demand of 200.

Whenever we are on Oahu we stay at the Ala Moana Hotel. The rooms are well appointed and the location, just outside of Waikiki yet walking distance to Ala Moana Shopping Center, can't be beat. We would recommend this resort for singles, couples and families with children.

The room although small was great for the our constant in and out vacation. The staff seemed friendly and was always willing to help us. The hotel had a fitness center, pool, and even washers for us to use at are leisure. I would definitely book again for similar trips.

Convenient location, walking distance to mall, Waikiki, Convention Center, grocery stores. The staff are always friendly and helpful. The front desk staff is efficient (but, through no fault of the staff, the computer system slows them down).

Worth the money - clean and great breakfast. Room and bathroom a little small but not an issue. Great location for shopping and eateries. Pool and gym spacious and convenient for families. Staff always easy to talk to and friendly.

Was awesome to be there . Rooms was nice and clean and ac was cold. Easy to get to mall and go shopping.. your new look of hotel looks great love the Starbucks inside. And your breakfast was really great !

Hotel staff and facilities where great. Was quieter than being in the heart of Waikiki. We used to stay at the Modern but it has become too expensive. This trip we only wanted three nights so we could just do some shopping so long location was great. Room size was fine note we stayed in the Waikiki tower as the rooms are more up to date and have balconies to sit out on. Also we were able to checkin at midday earlier than normal which was great.Only down side was that when we checked into the room we found half eaten cake in the fridge.

Unfriendly check in and poor supervisor skill. I was yelled by supervisor when tried to switched a king sized bed room from queen sized one. We are over 15 years of Ala Moana Hotel patrons but no more after this stay.

I was in Hawaii fro June 2018 to Aug 2018 on business. This review has been based solely on this stay and not my previous stays. Room was quite expensive for a few nights, small, and was located on backside of hotel facing a construction zone which made it extremely difficult to sleep in the mornings when trucks and cranes started moving. Overall on my previous three stays it was completely fine but this time around not so much.

AC difficult to adjust. Commendable cleanliness. Taxi readily accessible. Good location to shopping center. Would be nice if you had a family type dining room that serves 3 meals instead of fine dining. Plantation Cafe is expensive and serves mediocre buffet/continental breakfast.

I booked one nights accommodation thru the Expedia web site. The web site put the wrong date , two weeks in the future, when I arrived at the hotel on the same day as the booking, they could not find the reservation, so I had to pay again at the desk as they couldn't use the incorrect booking date. Then I cancelled the Expedia booking. EXPEDIA have refused to refund the money that was taken out the same day. I have paid $320 For nothing. DO NOT trust Expedia.

We truly enjoyed our stay at Ala Moana Hotel! The hotel met our expectation; the staff were very professional, courteous, and provided excellent service. Having the mall and the beach right next door was very convenient and we loved it. We look forward to our next trip and will definitely recommend your hotel to family members and friends. Thank You!

Nice and clean room. Easy check in and check out.Uber and lyft are very quick to pick you up. Three block walk to the convention center.Located right next to the Ala Moana shopping center.A nice large Starbucks in the lobby.

This is a great place to stay on Oahu - close enough to the action of Waikiki, on the doorstep of the Ala Moana shopping Mecca. The adjacent Ala Moana park and beach is underrated, nice swimming beach with plenty of parking if you have small children and lots of stuff to take to the beach. For families, I recommend the rooms with kitchenettes - everything you need to dine in if you wish.Friendly fellow named Thomas who works at the pool had lots of good local tips and enjoys sharing thr Aloha with guests. We will return soon.

I rented the room for a night because we were having dinner at the Signature Steak & Seafood. I was pleasantly surprise how many different restaurants were in walking distance. Not to mention how close Don Q and 24 hour fitness was. I really loved the location and how many different options we had to choose from. Our time at the Signature Restaurant was one to remember and we will be visiting more often. The staff at the front desk was very helpful when i asked about any open stores at 5 am in the morning. There was a directory sheet with all the common locations that was very helpful. Breakfast at the Plantation Restaurant was pleasant and very peaceful.

Great access to mall and downtown. Nice amenities and wonderful staff. I stayed 2 weeks, and have stayed here before. The 36th floor happy hour is great, and I heard the dinner there was amazing too! Convenient starbucks, opens early. The shops have great gifts at nice prices.

As always, staying at Ala Moana was a the right choice. Friendly and professional staff, great service, and ideal location. Did have a slight problem with the internet service, but that was resolved quickly.

We had a wonderful weekend get-a-way for my husband's birthday. Thank you Ala Moana Hotel for the free parking and Starbucks $10 GC. We just wish the self-parking had more parking. Beds were comfortable. The pictures are true to sight. Spacious. Appreciated the microwave. A/C worked well.

Great location for shopping. Adjoins Ala Moana centre.It is a Lovely Hotel.The rooms were immaculate we had a partial ocean view and the view was absolutely gorgeous.Would definitely recommend staying here.

Our stay at the Hotel was pleasant from the Resevation Desk personnel to the friendly & efficient Valet Service. The size of the hotel room was small & felt cramped. Otherwise, I would consider making future resevations with your Hotel.

Enjoyable stay at the Ala Moana Hotel. Staff were friendly. Good location, easy walk to Ala Moana Shopping Center. Nice views of surrounding city/mountain/ocean. Bathroom layout was a little difficult for two parents and two children.

The location is great right off of Ala Moana mall which has some great food options, the hotel has a Starbucks which was nice for our early morning excursions. The rooms are decent we had a water facing lanai which made for lovely mornings, since I'm an early riser I watched the sun come up and maybe a movie with my a.m. redbull. The staff was nice, the rooms were decent. The only drawback was the laundry facilities are waaaaaaaay too limited for the size of the property. the 13th floor has only 4 washing machines and 5 dryers and the other one is small but the hotel has over 30+floors on the property.
user_name:
Lynda L C
San Francisco, California

review_body: My reservation was for a queen but I ended up with a full size. Not a big deal because I was by myself so I didn't bother saying anything at the time. I had to unplug the noisy mini fridge in the room too.

Over the last six years, we family of six members meet for a week or so in January, and most of us stay at this hotel. We did not find any problems with this hotel in the past, and it was always enjoyable and comfortable. The location is excellent for shopping, dining, swimming and other activities. Only a minor problem was tight space for parking.

This hotel is conveniently located to Ala Moana Mall, Walmart, Sam’s Club, Shirokiya, etc. Parking can be somewhat challenging but it depends on the time of year you go. My family & I have stayed at this hotel many times & we have yet to be disappointed.

Location is great. Didn't sleep well, because of the music, and other noises could hear from below. Housekeeping service could better respond to our request. This must have been the 3rd or 4th time our keys did not work the first time.

My trip was an over nighter stay-cation, so the location is central and convenient. Employees were very friendly and helpful, helped to make you feel welcomed. Hoping I will be back in the near future.

I’ve stayed in hotels all over the country and this one by far was the worst. The toilet wouldn’t flush, the refrigerator made noise all night and the room had a musty smell. The lobby was nice but the room was quite dated. Never staying there again.

Close to Ala Moana Shopping Center many food selection there.This is just a short walk on the ramp on the second floor from the lobby. The breakfast at the Plantation cafe down stair near the lobby the food and service was awesome.

Clean room, pleasant staff, great views at the Signature Restaurant. Housekeeping actually left towels on the rack and did not just replace them. So unusual in hotels for the staff to actually be eco conscious.

Excellent location with top-notch hotel services and employees. Hotel has a great location with shopping, dining and other activities all within walking distance of the hotel. Room needs a little maintenance as the shower head was leaking water from the shower head. Very comfortable bed and pillows.

Not nearly enough parking stalls so the poor valet have no choice but to park cars behind one another and block everyone in. We’ve only been here a few days but a couple down the hall that we chatted with said it’s been this way for the past month. Apparently there’s a convention going on, something that clearly wasn’t taken into consideration.Our stay was paid for us because it was one of the cheapest options on island but I would gladly pay triple out of my own pocket to stay literally anywhere else.

This is our go-to hotel when we stay in town because it’s a very easy and short walk to Ala Moana Center. All the staff members are friendly and helpful and we enjoyed breakfast at the Plantation Cafe (on location) both mornings of our stay. I’ve never had an issue staying here and will definitely be back! The only reason I didn’t give it 5 stars is because sometimes the shower can be a bit cleaner. It’s not a huge deal, but it could be better.

I have nothing negative to say. Everyone treated us well. Was able to get a great deal for our one night stay. Rooms were very clean. Valet was quick. View was awesome. This will be our go to staycation spot.

This hotel has a foot bridge that connects it into the hotel which is really handy for going in and getting shopping done without the hassle of dealing with the parking lot. Our room was clean & simple. Front desk & bell desk service was friendly and helpful in getting us checked in & out quickly. I’m a light sleeper so at times if there was a loud group in the halls I could hear it in my room. Perhaps a seal strip on the door may help with that? Other than the one noise issue we were happy with our stay. We chose this hotel for the convenience of it and it met our needs for relaxing and shopping easily.

The staffs are unfriendly Location is convenience City closer to the construction of nearby building is loud early morning Busy environment Good for short stay Good for business meetings and locations

Stayed at the hotel for one night for closeness of the Ala Moana shopping center to do last minute shopping before returning home from our holiday. Lovely hotel for staying close to the shopping center. Our room was clean, quiet and bed was comfortable.

Not worth $450 for 2 nights. Only a pull out and 1 bed. After I booked 2 beds. Was told it would be another $30 a night for 2 beds. I would have shopped more had I known that. I picked this hotel because we have stayed here several times, my son had surgery at Straub. The hotel is in need of some cleaning, and updates again.

The view from our room was not good, but not a problem since we were not there much! It would be nice if you could upgrade the bedding to lightweight comforters. Also, provide space for the luggage racks & more hangers.

Location is great for downtown and not far from freeways. Only thing is the rooms are small. Also, need more pillows on the bed. Great amenities for the morning. Glad I didn't get room with breakfast rate because one time I did go there was almost no food left!

Our stay was awesome. The location is great being attached to the shopping mall. Allbthe staff that we interacted with were helpful and cordial. Its been nearly 20 years since my last stay at the hotel, I will be returning.

Good location close to the mall and the Hawaii convention center, rooms were impeccable, very clean and I was upgraded which was even better. The hotel staff were curteous. the only problem I had was I had only two days to there, wish I had planned a longer trip.

Our room was clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. It is a great place to stay if you want to be in the heart of Waikiki. There is plenty of shopping and places to eat at the mall. You are also just a few minutes from walking to and from the famous beach of Waikiki.

Excellent Waikiki tower one bedroom suite. Very convenient location. Breakfast included. Rent a car from DriveHui.com. It's half price as compared to other rental car companies and the parking station is next to the hotel and Ala Moana mall.

Great hotel for Kamaaina guests from outer islands. Perfect location to shop til you drop without even having to leave in a vehicle. Cute pool for kids to swim in.We had a leaky toilet in our room. Maintenance came by to check it out quick, but still woke up to a small puddle in the a.m. Other than that, Very nice hotel. Great for kids.

Overall my stay was very good. My main complaint would be lack of parking space. It is always a challenge to look for parking. Also I cannot believe that this hotel charge you for local calls and calling the mainland is considered overseas calls. The staff is always there to help you out. The cleaning staff is polite and helpful.

Pros: Rooms were clean, beds comfortable, check-in was fast, all staff were friendly and on top of it, great convenient location to Ala Moana Mall. Great bang for the buck. Cons: A bit of a walk from Waikiki; pool area is ok and could use some love-maybe add some large ceramic planters around the pool area, and upgrade and add pool furniture and create more hang and cozy zones as it is just concrete, sparse and uninviting. No hot tub.

Trip was strictly for business. Room was excellent.Lobby was excellent especially with Starbucks. Breakfast hit the spot. Overall hotel was pleasant. Staffing excellent. I will recommend this hotel to friends, family and colleagues.

I recently stayed at Ala Moana hotel with my adult son for a week. He had a conference in Honolulu and he asked me to join him a few days prior to the conference starting so that we could sightsee together. Overall the hotel was just what we needed - reasonably priced, clean, and the staff was very helpful. We were very pleased with stay overall - check in was easy and the gentleman who checked us in was very friendly and helpful. The housekeeping staff was also very nice and very friendly. We appreciated the fact that there was both a restaurant on site as well as a Starbucks where we could have breakfast. The Starbucks also serves alcohol which was an added plus. The stores at the hotel had a nice offering of items to purchase if you are looking for souvenirs. We were disappointed that the pool closed so early in the evening. We had wanted to go swimming one evening around 9 PM and it was already closed. Interestingly I met another family in the elevator who had the same disappointment. We liked that there was both a refrigerator and microwave available in the room. There was some construction right outside of our balcony which was somewhat noisy in the morning. The hotel is right next to a very large mall which is nice if you want to go shopping. We found Uber to be beneficial in getting to a variety of restaurants.

If you want to shop at high end shops, this is the hotel to select. Ala Moana Shopping Center has everything from Chanel to Tesla; the food court has so many options you don't need to venture far to find something to eat. Places like Target, Walmart, and 24 Hour Fitness are within walking distance as well. Sts. Peter and Paul Church is a five minute walk away too.

One of the hotel experiences I've had. From the moment I entered to the moment I left, every member of staff was courteous and made my visit more pleasant. The hotel provided me what I needed to include great maid service, outstanding breakfast buffet, a gym and pool, and of course the room was excellent. The only thing this hotel could use is a hot tub.

Ala Moana has all the amenities necessary for the purpose of my trip. The location is convenient as it’s attached to the mall but it’s a bit out of the way for heading into Waikiki as it’s down for the main strip and not on the beach. Location has a pool and gym. Parking is a bit tight but definitely if you have a vehicle make sure you just pay for the parking. All the staff was friendly and helpful and happy to assist in choosing a daily excursion.

This hotel is good for the people who want to go shopping to Ala Moana Center. You can get any kind of food in there. In hotel, there are also some shops such as Starbacks. So very convenience hotel this is.

This was a short staycation for 2 days and we had a nice time. The room was clean and quiet. the bed was comfortable. It was great to be close to the shopping center and within driving distance to other eating spots.

I was in Honolulu for a business trip. The location was extremely convenient with access to the Ala Moana Mall, Ala Moana Park and Beach Front. The hotel decor needs to be updated. It seems like the hotel gets a lot of traffic. That said, the staff was courteous and everything was nice and clean.

The Ala Moana is adjacent to the massive mall, so there is anything I would ever need within walking distance. Ubers are plentiful to take me out a bit farther; I Ubered out to Duke’s for dinner and only waited 3 minutes for a 7 minute ride. Hotel has a Starbucks in the lobby, and the wait time there is reasonable. I’ve stayed here repeatedly over the years for business, and the always enjoy my time. The rooms are quiet (mostly). Just now the the view to the beach will most likely be obstructed by other buildings...this hotel is not directly on the beach. But the walk to the marina is 5 minutes.

Gave it a second chance after staying there two weeks prior. Exactly the same, well located and clean but a staff that completely lacks any emotion. Not one smile or thank you the entire visit. Valet's don't speak to you or say anything to you when they give you your car or you give them a tip

Love the location. Close to everything. Bed was uneven, had to sleep with feet towards head board. Pool closes too early. Starbucks should be open a little later for the late arrivals especially since there’s a lot of military and flight crew there.

I had to lay-over and needed a room quick. This room worked out just fine. If I wanted to have full hotel experience with exciting pool area and places for the kids to play, I would have expected to get more (and to pay more). But this took care of my needs economically.

This is the place you want to be for great service, great shopping and convenient access to the beaches without the hustle and bustle of beachside properties. The service is the best in Honolulu from the Valet to the Registration Desk to the Room Attendants. However, the breakfast service in the restaurant provided for that purpose on the lobby level floor is not very good and probably should be avoided. The nighttime restaurant on the 36th floor is OUTSTANDING.

Our family thoroughly enjoyed our 4 night stay at the Ala Moana! The staff was extremely friendly and accommodating. We look forward to our next visit to your fine hotel in December. Thank you for providing us a wonderful memory of our family vacation!
user_name:
Nancy T
Captain Cook, HI, United States

review_body: lovely clean hotel, good staff, right next door to major shopping centre but a bit too far from the main area of Waikiki beach front, but that is what happens when you choose price over location. still a very lovely hotel to stay in.

Excellent location, I love the refridge and microwave in the room. Your parking situation sucks. I can't believe you have no towing policy for cars illegally parked and blocking other cars. Otherwise, all else was great.

No convenience shop in hotel if there is one i missed it. No room snacks or beverages in Refrigerator.. Suggest a complementary chocolate on beds for setting of night. How about some room slippers. Just my thoughts. L Cravlaho

Epic Location. Nice Hotel. Great Staff clean room. Harbor noises annoying during day. Some kind of foghorn going off constantly.Night fairly quiet for busy intersection location. Right next to Ala Moana Shopping Center and close to several Clubs! Walk back after the show!

This hotel is an excellent place to stay while in Honolulu. It is literally steps away from the Ala Moana shopping center with its world class shopping and restaurants. Trolleys are available at the shopping center for quick and inexpensive trips into Waikiki for shopping or swimming at the world famous Waikiki Beach.. The hotel has a pool for swimming and laying out in the sun, but it is also only a 10 minute walk to one of the best and most popular beaches on this side of the island, The Ala Moana Beach Park. The Ala Moana Hotel also has an excellent restaurant, The Signature. It is a fine-dining steak & seafood experience you won't want to miss. My wife loves sea food, but I'm more into steak. We were both very satisfied. The Ala Moana Hotel also has a very special Starbucks. It serves alcohol. Check it out.

We stayed here during a convention my husband was attending. It's conveniently located to the convention center, has a great breakfast option, an awesome Starbucks and a great little convenience store near the hotel lobby. The staff was super helpful anytime we interacted with them. However, this hotel is in need of serious upgrades and cleanliness. We had three adults and a baby staying in a room with two "Queen" beds. They ended up being full size beds that do not accommodate two adults very well. The bathroom is functional but had a significant amount of mold and mildew. Specifically in the grout of the shower, seals of the bathroom counter top, bathroom walls, shower head and the rim of the toilet. Not great for people with mold and mildew allergies. We appreciated the microwave and refrigerator in the room and the balcony was great. Given the option again though we would opt for a more upgraded and cleaner hotel.

This property was quite convenient and delivered beyond my expectation. There are some areas of improvement, but overall, my staff was enjoyable. Booking a rate that includes breakfast is recommended as the offerings were filling and with multiple options for all dietary needs.

Room very small. Poor pillow and bed. Staff is cold and distant. Not a good value. ( Partial Ocen view room was low 4th floor overlooking a roof top and the Macy’s parking lot. Luckily moved to another hotel and was able to enjoy our Business/vacation days in a wonderful location.

Ala Moana Shopping Mall is very close, a nice beach as well. Walking distance to congress center. Small but sufficient fitness center, relaxed pool. We missed a bar for the evening. Breakfast was good, lot of fresh fruits and good tea.

I had to stay a week on Oahu, traveling from Maui, while my father in law was in the hospital. It was easy and convenient. It's a walk to great food, great shopping, and I could walk to the hospital. The taco truck across from the hotel is open from Monday to Friday at night and I went back 2x. Front desk service was great, and I like the quiet air conditioning. I liked being able to do my own laundry on the 13th floor. I'll be back again. This was my 3rd stay at this hotel and I look forward to coming back.

This hotel is conveniently located next to the Ala Moana shopping mall and one block from Ala Moana park, which is a really nice place to stroll alongside the ocean and a small marina. Although there are restaurants inside the mall, the rest of the adjacent area offers no shopping or dining options. The hotel is well maintained and the staff are pleasant and helpful. However, if you are sensitive to noise at night, be aware you will be able to hear water running from other guests' bathrooms and may hear noisy sleepers in the adjacent room, through the wall. The business center charges for printing copies and Internet access, although internet access is free from your room.

Another great stay at your hotel! Great service, clean room -- we couldn't ask for more! Staff is always friendly and accommodating. We love the close proximity to shopping and restaurants. We will return. Thank you!

We booked this hotel through our credit card. Once we arrived we were told that we had booked a privately managed unit and would have to pay a check in fee of $50 and a resort fee of $25 per day. Additionally, we would have no housekeeping but could put our trash outside the room if needed. Valet parking is $25 per day additional.Overall, the hotel is nice. The rooms are small but adequate. We had a nice view but the sliding door doesn't open all the way. We were in room 1349 which is at the end of the hall and very quiet. There is laundry on this floor, however, no ice machine. Ice is located on even number floors. Our room was very close to the stairs, but furthest from the laundry and ice machines. The lighting in the bathroom is very dim, making it difficult to put on make-up. There is a small refrigerator and microwave. There is a coffee maker but no coffee or filters. We had 4 towels and hand towels for a 3 night stay.The staff was very pleasant and helpful. At check-in it was obvious that the additional charges were not something they were comfortable with as he presented it very awkwardly. We visited the Starbucks in the lobby but none of the other amenities. The pool was spacious and not very crowded when we were there, there was plenty of seating available and the fitness room was empty.For the price, I expected more. Basics like coffee & housekeeping would be expected at this price.

Stayed a few days in this hotel because of a scientific congress.Walkable to the beach but not within 15 minutes. In some ways this is an old building but it is convenient for getting to the shopping mall with 2 food courts, supermarket and plenty of shopping options. It is within walking distance of the convention center.

Excellent location right next to Ala Moana Shopping center. Room was great. Easy check in and staff very friendly. Easy to walk to Waikiki if needed to. Close to the beach and lots of eating places. Will definitely stay again.

Solid place to stay for a couple of nights in Honolulu, but there are 'old hotel' issues. Check-in process is generally quite slow, and did not even get our hotels.com reservation correctly. Bathroom ventilation is non-existent, Wi-Fi is a bit weak, and our sofa bed had no pillows or blankets in the room. This all being said, service put out a good effort, the amenities and location are very good, and the price was a bit more affordable than other places in its class. Good, but needs some real work to keep up.

We normally stay here because its convenient for us and not so busy like Waikiki. Great hotel and no complaints except the employees at check-in need to smile more or need to be more welcoming. We got to our room and was greeted by a very large flying cockroach that my children had to catch and get rid of. Blow dryer wasn't working so I had to call at 11pm at night to get another one. Other than that, check out was easy and the bellmen were super nice and friendly!

Im a born and raised local from the island of Kauai. Brought my family over to Oahu for some shopping and to visit family on the West side of Oahu. Staying at Ala Moana Hotel makes it easy for shopping and dining especially if you have small children.

Nice and relaxing place and my family really enjoyed them self wish could stay longer for them to enjoy them self. They really wanted to go in the pool but really love the bathroom because it has a tub not just a stand up shower

The buffet breakfast needs improvements. The fruits were junk, the pastry was rock hard. they ran out of fried rice. There was a roach on the serving counter, 2 women were informed and the person bring out the food were informed. The person bring out the food smashed the roach and continued to fill the food. He did not wash his hand before proceeding.

For the local price I was so surprised it was over 300 after all the usual hidden fees and taxes. We had a horrible view of the mall parking lot. There was a line for the elevator and it took me 10 minutes to get back up to my room . I understand that it was a holiday so Im sure thats not the case there every day. They did have a microwave which was unexpected, and it was so neat to be so close to the mall. The woman at the front desk were very accommodating.

Hotel is close to everything - nice beach, shopping and good restaurants. Room was clean and good size. Construction noise in the am was annoying but not horrible. Pool is ok but a bit small, steam room was excellent!

Great customer service from check in to check out. I will be back soon. Hotel was very welcoming I just love the lobby and it did not hurt having a Starbucks located in the lobby. All in all a great trip and Ala Moana hotel was a big reason why.

This was a quick overnight trip to avoid the nightmare of traffic after the fireworks. We spent the day at Ala Moana Beach Park and stayed for the fireworks. The location is amazing. It was easy to carry all our beach gear because the walk was so short. The staff was friendly and welcoming. The only hitch was that our breakfast coupons were delivered late at night and we had already made other plans. The room and amenities were fine, freshly painted and perfectly clean.

My husband and I live on the Big Island and stayed here for our anniversary. Since there aren't really many places to shop and eat on our island, the main objective for us was the food and shopping at Ala Moana. Staying here was very convenient for us, though it was a bit pricey for the room quality. Clean and quaint but not what I thought it would be from the hotel's outer appearance. The website also stated I would get my mantra member perks but upon check-in the worker told me this was not the case. Sad to see that Rumours was gone since I went there often for dances in high school. Overall though a nice stay and great for if your main goal is to enjoy Ala Moana Mall.

Stayed at the Ala Monana hotel from June 24th till July 5th, unfortunately I find this hotel appalling, the whole time we were there not once did any odd the staff spend the time to say hello,or even bother to ask if we needed anything ,they don’t even have room service,I find this astounding as I presumed being an American hotel all staff rely on tips to substitute their wages I thought they would be bending over backwards to be a friendly as possible ......also and I know I’m a minority but I smoke, Smoking area was outside across from hotels entrance but still within the hotel grounds and was frequently visited by homeless people harassing hotel guests for smokes and money, being a lone female and being harassed by these people every time I went out for a smoke was incredibly upsetting I didn’t feel safe at all. I feel that if the hotel makes smokers smoke in a specific area we should at least feel safe in that area and there should be some sort of security in that area Did not like this hotel at all and would definitely NOT Recommend to anyone

We've stayed with you before. Love the location and easy access to the area. Would nice to have a golf cart for handicap and respiratory guests to go to and from the shopping center. A lounge bar would be nice for guests waiting to meet someone or a ride to the airport.

Overall great stay. Some front desk staff not friendly but most staff very accomodating. The catering staff, garryene and Manny very helpful in regards to managing our wedding event especially with the change in venue

This is the second time my husband and I have stayed here. The hotel is renovated but the rooms are very small, especially in the Kona Tower. We were greeted by two cockroaches in our room. We live in Hawaii and know roaches are common, but we don’t have them in our home and were surprised to find them in our room on the 7th floor. We brought our own raid roach spray which didn’t seem to help. After finding live roaches in our room, we will not be staying here again. Just because roaches are in Hawaii does not mean it is acceptable for them to be in our hotel room, especially with how expensive it costs to stay here each night. I would recommend the Ko Olina hotels or the Hampton Inn or Embassy Suites in Kapolei.

First time to Hawaii, we wanted to get away feel relaxed and experience the polynesian culture. What happen throughout are experience was unfortunate. Especially, after a long flight. We believe first impressions, respect and politeness are essential in human interactions and wouldn't dear treat others less than. We spent 3 nights at Ala Moana and went to another hotel. Throughout those 3 nights the bed situation wasn't rectified.

I used to stay in Waikiki when I visited Honolulu but this time I stayed at Ala Moana Hotel. I love the location because of the convenience of everything. First, Ala Moana Shopping Center is connected by a bridge. I went there every day. Second, many public buses (The Bus) start and terminate at Ala Moana Shopping Center. If you ride the Bus, pay for the round trip fare which costs $5.50 for an all day pass. And if you are senior, don’t forget to show your Medicare card. It’s only $2.00 for seniors. You can spend all day at the Center. Don’t forget to visit Shirokiya Village food court and have a $1 Primo and have a snack at Yoshida’s minced beef and pork cutlet called MENCHI-KATSU.

I submitted it in the first paragraph to the manager. not a good review....Felt like any other mainland hotel in an industrial area, no Kama'aina feel, grouchy valets, no late check out, didn't feel like we got any value, just a place to sleep. won't stay again. get better deals online. pls cancel our kama'aina membership....

I live on the Big Island and this was my first stay at your hotel.. We didn't get the best Kamaaina rate but booked anyway. We loved the location so close to shopping and restaurants/ We were with our stay. The front desk, Jay was awesome! I will look to book for future stays. Mahalo!

We will be back July 27 on doctors visit We had a chance to check in early Which is convenient for my son who wasn’t feeling well after doctors visits Love ala Moana hotel but just a little complaints Nobody is perfect

I stay here every time I fly to Oahu, which is twice a month. Last two times I have had the unfortunate situation with the bathroom toilet. Both times it was clogged and didn’t know till I used it since I check in almost at midnight and then who wants someone coming over to fix it when your tired and all you want to do is sleep. This last time there was a yellow/brown sticky substance on the inside shower curtain which tells me they didn’t clean it. I don’t know what has changed recently but I’m really going to start looking for another hotel.

Great location and service. Parking is expensive so I often opt for Uber. If you like to use a lanai make sure to stay in Waikiki Tower. Chinese restaurant disappeared but still great food within walking distance.
user_name:
Frank G
Kailua Kona, United States

review_body: From the moment I arrived the manager went out of his way to make sure I was well taken care of. He and the other staff were all lovely. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here and will definitely be back again.

Convenient to bus transit, various restaurants and other activities on Oahu. Hotel service from check-in to check-out and everything in between was great. 10 day trip )with 6 days in an Airbnb to 4 days finishing our stay in the hotel was such a huge difference) - should've paid the extra $$ and just stayed in the hotel.

Unremarkable and you get what you pay for. Room is very clean, location is excellent but staff is a little less than welcoming or friendly. Valets who are less than enthused to get your car and a front desk staff more interested in talking to one another than to the guest at hand. Sat in the lobby at 11;30 in the evening waiting for a friend and easily heard the front desk people talking and swearing as it carried across the quiet night time lobby.

Living on Maui we always have occasions to fly to Oahu and we always stay here because besides the great location w walkway to Ala Moana shopping ctr, the price is reasonable (esp w our Kamaaina discount) and love their morning breakfast buffet rt outside the door--which btw, I advise anyone staying there to upgrade ($20) for the breakfast for 2 because it includes taxes and gratuities and it's a bargain!!! Service at the hotel is always great and their rooms are always clean and this last trip (last wk) we had a nice room located right out from the elevator and even a partial ocean view!! Nice!!!

Fun, relaxing and the shopping was convenient with the mall so close! We enjoyed our breakfast buffet and the pool was nice. The hotel gift shop was open after 11:00 we could get a late night snack. Our next visit we'll bring the family!!

Great place to stay. So close to the Hawaii Convention Center and to Ala Moana. Love it! Staying these again in August. We also got complimentary self parking which saved us $20 a day. Glad we could get that offer.

Ala Moana exceeded our expectation and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay! Walking distance to Ala Moana mall, the gym was spacious and clean, café for breakfast had a variety to choose and the staff were always so pleasant. Cheers!

I’ve never had any problems at your hotel before until my most recent stay. I was a little disappointed on my recent stay at your hotel on Friday, June 22, 2018. I arrived at 9:15 pm went to check in only to be told my room wasn’t ready? Someone was still in there, scheduled to check out at 9:50 pm and would still have to be cleaned. I was told they would rush the cleaning and room would be ready at 10:30 pm? So I left and came back at 10:30 pm and room was ready. Let me say that the clerk helping me was very nice but do to the situation he could only do so much. I also didn’t know this room was had a fully handicap bathroom, could have been my fault when I made reservations? Anyway the shower area water leaks all the way to the toilet, basically the whole bathroom get wet. Your kamaina rates are really that cheap but maybe it’s because it summer time? I’m traveling to Honolulu agian on July, 12, 2018 but haven’t made up my mind if I’m going to stay there agian because of my last experience. I would like to because your location is the best and most convenient. Thank you

I can always count on the Ala Moana Hotel being a great place to stay. I know my room will be very clean. The staff is always friendly and helpful. And most important I know I will have a good night's sleep. I give this hotel 5 Thumbs up!!!

Being next to Ala Moana Shopping Center made it so convenient! We didn't even rent a car on this trip! But we got a less expensive Kona Tower room, so our view was mainly the top of a building and the parking lot next door!

room was a little pricey, but all in all ok. Valet service was exceptional very quick and efficient workers. Same goes for the bell hop. Front Desk clerks friendly but could use more help to get the line down quicker.

We loved our visit to Ala Moana hotel, close to the shopping center, great staff, thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Front desk was accommodating, very friendly, housekeeping was efficient, but very quiet you would never know they were around.

Hotel is clean, staff is friendly. Close to Convention Center. Starbucks is located in the lobby, lots of seats to relax and enjoy coffee check emails. We visited pool, area is clean, quiet.Rooms were very nice, towels smelled fresh. Wastebasket in every room, very convenient. I recommend this hotel.

I love being able to walk to Ala Moana. It's so convenient. The breakfast buffet is convenient too. Our room had a great view. The staff was nice. Only downside was the bath water did not get as hot as I like it. I like a hot bath.

Excellent - Also, your staff was very professional and friendly. Our room faced the Ala Moana Shoppig Center which was great because we came to shop and enjoy the near by restaurants. It is a family friendly resort. Best - location

The room was clean,nothing special. They need to fix water pressure and temperature in shower of room 553,Kona tower.Very convienent location and mostly friendly staff. I liked the plantation cafe for breakfast in the morning,good food but they need to have better art.sweetners for coffee available. Not Sacharrin or equal( known to be carcinogenic) but maybe truvia or Stevia/monk fruit sweettmers.I didn’t use pools or fitness Ctr. But nice that they’re available. AC was freezing- I had to turn iturn it off a few times

See previous comments. An extra blanket to put on the bed would have been good as I kept waking up feeling cold during the night, even though the aircon was set to 70 Fahrenheit. The Plantation restaurant was very poor - they had no

Non disclosure of construction noise. All city-facing units will be woken up at 7 am. Told at check-in, that it would be 8am. No true. Parking lot was full on Wednesday night, not only guest parking, so beware.

Always enjoying staying at the Alamoana. From quick check in even though there is a line, courteous staff from front desk, housekeeping and bellman. The facility is always welcoming and the Ohana spirt is evident.

Front desk service is always fast and friendly. We stay at least once a month. It would be nice to have an incentive/rewards program for frequent guests. Overall we enjoy staying at the Ala Moana Hotel!

i brought the staff cream puffs from Liliha Bakery. That's how much I appreciate them. Present and attentive when you need them. thata all I have to say but they want 220 characters to complete the review.

This is a very convenient hotel. It is right next to Ala Moana Shopping Center. We used the room so that friends wouldn’t drive home drunk. We were able to just walk over to the hotel after eating dinner at the mall. The front desk staff were very friendly. The room was nice.

Service was excellent from the front desk check-in to the breakfast buffet and valet parking. The room was spectacular with it's ocean-view lanai, and was very clean and well-appointed. Everything needed was available in the shops on-site.

Check in was pleasant. Check out was easy. Room was beautiful-- Size, view, pleasantries. Still gives shower cap. May seem simple to many but busy ladies understand. I will be definitely staying again. Actually, tried to book again recently but was sold out.

Connected to a shopping center and 7-11 convenient store is at the corner. Their Buffet breakfast is very inexpensive less than $20. What attracted me more to the hotel was not just its rate but daily parking rate is only $20 compared to most fees in Waikiki which exceeds $30.Great staff and housekeeping! Beach an park is across the street. Just a real great location.

Need to order new blankets the ones I was given need to be donated to the Salvation Army...raggedy thin I had to ask for 4 pillows to makeup for the xs pillow size and too softThese 2 things need to be upgraded- check out the Hilton brand or Hyatt excellent bedding!

The location is just next to the mall. Good for shopping. Went to Target and Ross daily. There's a foodcourt there and many restaurants. However it is not extremely close to the beach. So not so good for surfing.

for the most part staff is very helpful and courteous. Conveniently located and clean rooms. Had a problem with our shower and maintenance came and resolved the problem quickly. Having a mini refrigerator and micro wave oven is a big plus

We liked that it was walking distance to the Ala Moana Shopping Center, access to alot of eating places to choose from and the helpfulness of the hotel staff. We would surely stay at this hotel again.

Staff were friendly at arrival, pool side, and housekeeping. Sundries shop staff not approachable. Location is very convenient. Rooms are average, and rates are overpriced for few amenities. Had a few mishaps during our stay. AC was leaking, not able to work sauna in fitness center because instructions were not visible to operate. Coffee maker had left over coffee grinds from a previous guests stay.

Excellent introduction at check in by Joseph Room a little dated and could do with attention to hygiene (dirty corners on grouting)Street noise at nightBusy hotel but located well if shopping was a priority Thank you Michael

We enjoyed our short one night stay at the Ala Moana Hotel. It was centrally located for our purpose. My only feedback is we checked in at 3:00pm which was the checkin time and we were 1 of 20+ people in line to check in with 2 staff members working behind the check in desk. It took FOREVER! After flying for 5.5 hours to get to the hotel and have to stand and wait for over 30 minutes to get our room is unacceptable. The rest of the room was fine and the hotel was nice.

It took way too long to check in for the room... a 45 minute wait in line to check in at 3:30 p.m. The clerk was courteous and there was water available, but it still was too long. The location is convenient for shopping at the Ala Moana Center.

I've stayed here many times over the years for work and pleasure. I've searched for other options but always seem to find my way back here. The location and facilities are wonderful and the service superb.

it's so good for its location that very near to the big shopping mall. but if you wanna go to the beach, it takes 25 min walking distance. a bit disappointed with the bathroom amenities, no shower gel and also they so-called 2 in 1 which is combining shampoo and conditioner together but it made my hair so dry......it is not a budget hotel but it's so budget for its amenities.

Great location for the Conference Center, Blaisdell Center and the Ala Moana Mall. Front Desk Staff could be trained a bit more in hospitality. Initial room was wrong but was quickly rectified. Mahalo!

OK, first thing's first, I went to Hawaii wanting to discover the downtown more, and not the beaches in Waikiki, so I thought of staying at a hotel near the downtown.Ala Moana Hotel was recommended to my by a friend, and I had no regrets booking with Ala Moana Hotel!!Pros:- Friendly accommodating staff- Location is good - if you are not too interested in Waikiki. BUT if you are interested in Waikiki, it is between the downtown area and Waikiki, so it has the best of both worlds.- Right beside Ala Moana Mall, in case you need to do some shopping or if you want to have dinner. (There is a walkway at the second level parking lot outside Macy's that connects the mall to the second level of Ala Moana Hotel)- Has a Starbucks inside, a reasonably-priced convenience store, and some souvenir stores - Has a very good travel desk. Our travel agenct Malia made it a breeze for us to book day trips to Pearl Harbor and the Polynesian Cultural Center even before setting foot in Hawaii!!- There are always taxis lined up outside the hotel in case you don't have a car or did not rent a car, or if you don't want to use travel apps. (Taxis are hard to find in Hawaii.)- Very near bus stops and trolley stops - Easy to get deals for cheap but good rooms (like my family did!!) - Has full amenities including free wifi.Cons:- If you really really want the Waikiki beach scene then this hotel might not be for you.- The hotel is a bit dated, but I personally think that it's kept up to date. It was well-kept and clean when we stayed.- Not really a "con" but more like a reminder: the travel desk opens from 7am-6pm if I'm not mistaken, so if you wish to talk to someone before or after these hours, you won't find anyone. But I also understand that these are the times when people are usually outdoors. So in case you're interested, it's probably best to e-mail or call the travel desk for concerns beforehand, or just make sure that you're at the travel desk between these hours so you can talk to someone.****Overall my family and I had a pleasant stay. I would definitely stay here again if given the chance, since I loved everything about the hotel especially its location.

Perfect place to stay if your planing a trip to Hawaii. Location is also a plus cause it’s in the middle of everything, so it’s not too far for you to travel to get to your other destination.. love it !!!

I usually always stay here due to good pricing and location. This most recent stay was uncomfortable. The room seemed a bit smaller than what we usually get. Too small for 2 people in my opinion. The pool was ok, no hot tub.

Most of the stay was great! The housekeepers, bellmen, valet, security and front desk were nice and helpful. I didn't like the fee for the use of pots and pans and of the like. If I may suggest a deposit for the use of the aforementioned instead, and then if there's anything missing or damaged, then the hotel may keep the deposit. If you're gonna charge for the use of the kitchenware, it should solely be reflected in the room rental and not be a separate charge. Mahalo.

I enjoyed my stay at the Ala Moana; the room was large and comfortable, clean & quiet. Service was very good; all the staff were helpful and friendly. I didn't realise that my original booking came with breakfast coupons included, so that was a nice surprise on check-in. Good variety of items in the breakfast buffet to suit all tastes.

First of all the front desk staff, I did not get their names, when we checked in and out were most pleasant and helpful. they are excellent ambassadors for your hotel.The rooms were very comfortable and very very clean.However I wish you had a better coffee selection. the sanka was dreadful.

Stayed here as part of a work trip – it’s one of the cheaper options near the convention center, but not one of the best. I would not return and stay was pretty miserable. Our room faced significant construction and the crew started at 6:30 am; six days a week. To his credit, our desk clerk tried hard to get is an upgraded the other side of the hotel, as we were staying for over a week, but no dice. I got ill and ended up with significant, daily migraines, made intensely worse by the construction. Tried again to change rooms two thirds of the way through stay. This time the front desk supervisor came out and said no. He said “check back tomorrow,” but of course we had other plans for the few hours he was willing to entertain our request. We truly should have checked out then, but we didn’t trust them too refund the unused days. Room was tiny and not equipped for work; there is no task chair at the desk. Terrible internet. We were there to work, so we had to go somewhere else to do so.Bathroom smelled like sewage for the first four days of our stay. It got a little better but it’s also an outdated bathroom and the toilet ran too much.Wait to check in was over an hour. Upon checkout, she didn’t bother to ask if we enjoyed our stay. Elevator was a tiresome wait. It was always packed and confusing to users. It does have some pros – staff was nice other than the supervisor. Housekeeping staff was lovely. There is a Starbucks in the lobby. Hotel is close to some amenities considering it’s not on Waikiki.

I was there just for a week and I would say that the hotel is very comfortable with an excellent service. The breakfast was also delicious. Having a StarBucks inside it's a good idea. Totally recommended!

Room overlooking construction site which started at 6.30am, large crane outside our window GREAT VIEW! Reception Staff didn't seem to care. Double bed thought we were getting queen . Had to ask for tea coffee and sugar. Great 43rd Anniversary!

Hotel is nice and in a great location. Staff is very friendly. Highly recommend this hotel and look forward to returning here next vacation. Starbuck's in the lobby and connected to the shopping mall with great restaurants and stores.

There is nothing special at this hotel except it’s right next door to one of the world’s best malls. Service is fine, decor is ok, rooms are ok, there is a decent pool and Ala Moana Beach Park is also across the street. There are no faults here, but if you want wow or that special vacation feel look elsewhere. There is a great Starbucks downstairs, though it’s a franchise so you may not get all the extra discounts you are used to, if you want that just take a quick walk to the mall they have “real” Starbucks and other great food. Again only stay here if you wanna be by the GREAT Ala Moana Shopping Center. BTW the mall is where you can catch The Bus to anywhere, that’s also a plus!!

Staying at the Ala Moana Hotel is always a great place to stay. Away from the crowd of Waikiki and right next to Ala Moana center and the beach. What more to ask for. The staff is great, parking is not a problem.

My husband and I were on our honeymoon. Our first time staying at Ala Moana. It was a great location because the area wasn't too busy and still get into Waikiki by taking transit and walking distance to the Ala Moana mall. The staff are very friendly! Thank you Ala Moana for your service and kindness! :)

Great location for business travel...happy that you now have a Starbucks there...but need more dinner options...our go-to property for business travel to Oahu as we have meetings at the Hawaii Conventon Center

Hotel is convenient. The staff was friendly, helpful, and accommodating. Rooms were clean and comfortable. I would recommend the valet service. The service was prompt and the attendants were very helpful.

I was greeted by Joe. He was polite and great at checking me in. He has that great aloha spirit. The was not like a full size room but we managed. Great location to do shopping. And to have Starbucks down stairs made the stay greater.

A very nice, clean and reasonably priced hotel located close to shopping in addition to the beautiful Waikiki beaches. My only criticism is the initial smell/odor of smoke when you walk into the lobby area. Perhaps by replacing the carpets, it will help alleviate this odor.

Ala Moana is not a glamorous hotel with lots of amenities, but it is cute and the package I got which included one night stay along with shuttle to and from Sea Life Park for the Makapuu Twilight Concert and breakfast buffet for my family of four was a good deal! It is a little dated and could use a good cleaning makeover, I would stay again given the bang for my buck.

The showers could be a little better .. Beds could be a little bigger.but its a very clean hotel close to everything. very convenient to go to Ala Moana Center and nice mountain and ocean views. .....

I needed a hotel that was easy to get to without the hassle of Waikiki traffic. The Ala Moana was a nice option, clean, comfortable, quiet. Close to the mall. I would definitely stay there again when visiting Oahu.

Beautiful place to stay. Awesome sight of the water from your room.Beautiful sunrise from the baloney. Check out the restaurant on the 36th floor for a awesome steak. Check out the restaurant on main floor for a delicious breakfast.

Great value, and excellent location! Staff was friendly. The hotel had everything we needed. Very convenient and did not need to rent a car because everything I needed was within walking distance. We even got 50% coupons for breakfast!

I stayed here while working the Honolulu Marathon. The only reason I would rate less than five stars is because the room was small. It was clean and the location is very convenient to the Ala Moana mall and the Convention Center. I was even able to walk to the start line of the Merrie Mile and the Marathon itself. I would definitely stay here again as the experience was great.

I have stayed at the Ala Moana a few times, though many years apart and with every stay it's always been comfortable.
