Although, our most recent stay (travelled with family) was a little disappointing as there was loud construction work across the street, which started very early each morning. Apart from that however, the hotel is conveniently located right next to the Ala Moana shopping mall and is a short walking distant to the famed Waikiki area. It's even got a Starbucks located in the lobby, which is great. The staff are friendly and the service is great as well.

This is a very convenient location that makes it easier for locals and visitors to enjoy the shopping and easy in and out to and from the hotel. Also, fairly priced for locals. This lo cation has a Starbucks and general store for your needs.

I enjoyed a great weekend with my family at your hotel! Despite being very crowed, we had a great time at the hotel and enjoyed all its amenities. Having Starbucks in the hotel is an excellent breakfast option!

This hotel is a favorite of mine for many years. It has been well maintained and updated to keep its amenities and finishes fresh and functional. The staff is warm, attentive, and efficient. It goes without saying its central location is ideal for shopping, leisure activities, and dining.

Average hotel. Our bed was not comfortable. Highly disappointing in how they replace your dirty glasses and coffee mugs, You do not get new ones. The maids clean them in your bathroom sink. I did complain to hotel on thier process of replacing glasses and coffee mugs with no response. We also called the local sanitation branch with the City of Honolulu. Hopefully they could do something.

It was a good experience staying at the hotel great location employees was friendly and kind. Rooms and everything was great as soon as we got to the room. One thing was check we waited long time in line about 1 hour. Need more employees helping customers.

We were in Honolulu visiting family and friends. Having stayed at the Ala Moana before, it was an easy choice to stay there. Close to the mall, nice beaches, what's not to like? Checked in, and found that the air conditioning was not working...not a great way to start. Called down to the front desk and they quickly sent someone up to check it out...just needed a new battery for the wireless thermostat. We had a mountain view and also a view of the construction going on next door. Couldn't hear the construction noise unless the sliding glass door was open. Room was nice, had a microwave, mini-refrigerator, coffee maker. Ice machine/vending machine down the hall by the elevator Housekeeping forgot to leave the hotel info book/times the pool/gym was open...had to pick one up at the front desk the next day. Room service promptly put one in the next day. Beds were made daily, and room was left clean. Worked out at the nice gym (on the 3rd floor) next to the pool. Not too crowded, but not enough towels out. Nice equipment. Pool was nice and clean!Starbucks in the lobby, what's not to like? Lots of airline crew stay here. The Ala Moana Shopping Center is just across the street. If you love to shop/eat, allow time, the mall is huge! There is also a nice beach across from the mall...just a short walk away. Not crowded. I would stay again. It's on the edge of Waikiki...so you don't get the crowds & traffic...but if you need to get over there...you are very close.

There should be more receptionist to check in guest. There was 2 conventions at the same time. I did like the early check in. But the long lines at check in surprised me and at Starbucks. The toliet paper should have at least 4 rolls.

We visit Honolulu about three times a year. We like to stay at the Ala Moana, always clean, friendly staff and great location. The Signature restaurant is great for Happy hour, and in the am you can visit Starbucks. Great little store on site for picking up those things you forgot.

The housekeeping did not give enough towels on some of the days. They also started cleaning the room on our check-out day even though we were not yet checked out and had just stepped out for breakfast. There were also 5 local calls billed to our room (which we are contesting) that were made while we weren't in the room and were probably made by the housekeeping.Overall though, this is a great location and the suite was roomy. The sofa bed was surprisingly comfortable. There are a lot of noises at night from the street, but that is expected in such a central location.

Great location to everything. Signature restaurant is one of the bests. This Hotel has always been consistent in service and quality. The rates are decent and the location to Ala Moana shopping is perfect to walk down the ramp on the second floor to Macys.

Hotel is located next to the Ala Moana Shopping Center which makes it so convenient. Staff is helpful, courteous and friendly. I've had a very good experience with the front desk and valet staff. Rooms are clean and the a/c is very cold.

the staff did a great job and the room was clean staff was saying hi all the time and ask if they can help find something and parking was good I fly a lot to Hawaii for business and it is nice to have a clean place to go to at the end of the day and can walk to go get some thing to eat and shop

Everything else about the hotel is very good. We had a banquet to go to and was a little late because of long registration line. Enjoyed our stay otherwise. Love the location of hotel and I will stay there again. We aren't frequent travelers but always stay at the Ala Moana.

Friendly staff and great location close to shopping and restaurants. Outside the hustle and bustle of central Waikiki. (which is a good thing for me). lol. Ala Moana Shopping center is a stone throw away well maybe not that close but very close.

This was a nice place bc the staff was nice and the location was ideal for me. The room was very small and the restaurant was dirty, when I walked my feet stuck to the floor. The food was good and the staff worked hard and were very nice. The homeless situation a little outside of the hotel was not great in the fact when you walk outside the smells were upsetting. Great Location for the convention center. The walk was short but was a little unsafe at night.

The location was not the closest to the beach, but everything else about the hotel was perfect . The staff were so friendly and the rooms were very clean. Beds were very comfy too !! Loved my stay and would definitely return

Unknown to us, not the entire hotel is owned and managed by Mantra. Thus, visitors beware when you make a booking that is labelled “Ala Moana hotel by Gaia” or any other management. Although all the rooms are very much the same configuration, design and furnishing, the treatment of these rooms not by Mantra is where it all go wrong. First they double book your room and it took ages for front desk to rectify. Then, shockingly, your rooms are not serviced for however long you are staying.We actually got so disgusted with the dirty room by Gaia that we have to ask to check out and then check back into one that is by Mantra.And if your room have any faults, front desk won’t help you as they keep repeating that it is not under their management to do so. In which case, we wish you all the best in trying to get hold of anyone on the phone of these management - they never answer. For the price that is relatively the same as the Mantra rooms, we are beyond disgusted that we may be put off in coming back to this hotel ever again.

Joe H at front desk asked if we would prefer an ADA room when he saw the wheel chair. We failed to think of this but his assistance made our stay much more pleasant. This is the type of Aloha service all employees should reflect. How to WOW the guest!

Ala Moana offers a reliable place to stay, where the staff are pleasant and rooms are clean and comfortable. A great benefit is that there is no daily hotel fee! The hotel location is great for business and shopping at the Ala Moana mall. It is a good walk to get in the heart of Waikiki, or take a taxi.

I will definitely return to Oahu and use the Ala Moana as our hotel. We are from Oklahoma and found that they were very friendly and helpful. My daughter enjoyed the Starbucks in the hotel. It was also a very convenient location for the beach, shopping, and beautiful views!!! They did not have a King bed and the room was a bit small, but overall it was a great stay!

Awesome customer service from beginning to end. Convenient short walk to the Convention Center. Starbucks located on property. Ala Moana Shopping Center right next door. Would highly recommend to anyone.

From check-in to every day valet service, we couldn't ask for more! Everyone is always doing their job with Aloha! Great service, always friendly smile and enthusiasm, sharing a great experience! Thank you to all involved.

Room was very clean will repeat again . The front desk personal was very nice and friendly. Please don't send me emails or letters my wife might read it..Enjoy my stay there very private.thank you Roy.

We were told by the maid that herself and security would handle the situation but they didn’t! The loud noises and music continued our entire stay and it was not relaxing at all. Waisted about 400$ when I could have stayed somewhere else. Lost a lot of sleep definately would not recommend here after this stay. Not enjoyable at all. Next time you guys say it will be handled I hope it will be.

Best value for money,modern rooms,great AC.Clean,excellent bedding,Fast elevators.Ala Moana mall world class!Kona Tower is cheaper but is less noisy than ocean view rooms.Short drive from the airport,not entering the Waikiki slow traffic.FF

This property is located in a great place for shopping and business. We had a function at the Convention Center and it is so close. It’s walkable to Ala Moana Center for great shopping. I definitely recommend staying here.

Receptionist was so terrible !She was kidding me !! She didn't ask me about hotel room.She was just muted.I don't know why she working in service job fields.Ala Moana hotel is just good locations in honolulu.
user_name:
jiwonkim509
New York City, New York

review_body: Great Hotel for the value, ease of location, and access to the mall.They don't rip you on fees which adds to our activities budget.Easy to get in or out without long waits. Clean and friendly property with short rides to Waikiki.

Great relaxing stay at the Ala Moana Hotel.Workers were great. Just let them know if there is any special needs for your room and they will try to help you with it. They have a bridge from the hotel to get to Ala Moana center.

Valet guys are so attentive and welcoming, including to the lady working at the reception. She checked us in and informed us that we got a room upgrade for the 22nd floor! We had the view of the ocean, and sat on the lanai every morning - it was such a beautiful scenery. The cool thing is that the hotel's second floor has a walk way connecter to the Ala Moana Mall parking garage. It was quick and easy access to visit the mall and eat there. Lastly, our service maid was sweet. She fixed our bed and brought us fresh towels everyday. Overall, we enjoyed our stay at this hotel! It's worth the buck.

Good location and value. Customer Service is excellent. Highly recommend this property for your Oahu visit. Very convenient for shopping and dining. Note that the Waikiki Tower has a better view and a larger room size than the Kona Tower.

Nice place to stay close to Ala Moana and the boat harbor. Bed was comfortable but the pillows were hard and small. Good restaurant upstairs with a view. Excellent though expensive food. I’d go there again.

Whenever I do the Honolulu Triathlon I always stay at the Ala Moana Hotel. The Bell Hop staff allows me to set up and store my race bike until the room is ready. The hotel is next to the Ala Moana Shopping Center. You can shop till you drop or just browse at all the eye candy. Magic Island is 1/4 mile away. You can walk to the beach to swim and enjoy the sunshine.

Nothing too special compared to other hotels. You have the shopping center right next door, which is a plus, but hotel amenities are low. No restaurants for lunch, no bar - except Starbucks sells beer and wine, but only until 8:30pm. Store in the hotel is overpriced - but thatʻs like every other hotel. Service is always good though

Flight was diverted to Honolulu from Hilo. This was a "courtesy hotel" provided by United.Arrived at 2AM fell asleep by 3AM and awoken at 7AM by loud construction. Sleep deprivation = torture. We were on the 15th floor overlooking a full scale construction project.
user_name:
CatsGalore999
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Because or place of residence is over the Koolaus we used this hotel as a place to lodge while attending two separate nearby events. First event was held on Saturday and due to the long line for check in we arrived at the event later than what we planned.
user_name:
Raymond K
San Francisco, United States

review_body: This was a very nice hotel! We loved the location and the people working were very friendly. We had a delicious dinner at the restaurant on the top floor. Would love to come back again sometime! Wish we could have stayed longer.

Overall my stay was very pleasant and convenient.Breakfast menu should have more options other buffetExterior side of property needs attention {painting, debris, landscaping}Travel excursions and tour desk were very helpful

My friends and I stayed here for 4 nights and it was great. Ala Moana Shopping Center is right next to this hotel and it was easy for shopping. Also you can catch most buses near this hotel so the location is perfect for tourists who enjoy hanging around in Oahu by bus. We're making a plan for next trip and we'll definitely book a room in this hotel again.

My stay at the Ala Moana was excellent. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean comfortable and quiet. the Hotel has a convient location to various locations in honolulu. It is ajacent to the Ala Moana mall, and acroos the street from the Ala Moana beach park. My room had a nice view of the park and beach. The hotel is also close to all of the Waikiki beach area attractions. the hotel also has a nice pool, work out room with plenty of equipment with a nice steam room and sauna. I highly emjoyed my stay here and plan on staying here again the next time I am in Honolulu.

Great layover. I stayed in Honolulu as a layover from Japan to San Francisco.The Ala Moana is a great location with good value.Excellent location.The Starbucks in the lobby is very covenient, too.I will be back in the near future.Thanks

Excellent hotel beautifully appointed rooms,dangerously close to Ala Moana shopping centre for those shopaholics(like my wife).Plenty of options for eating within Hotel and around the local area.Staff at check in very friendly and the process was quick and easy..

We were visiting for the Honolulu Triathlon, and the Ala Moana is conveniently close to the race site. Unless you are going for the triathlon or to shop at the adjacent Ala Moana Center, I would recommend staying somewhere else. It's farther from the beach, dining & entertainment than other Waikiki hotels. The rooms are a little shabby (some mold on the shower tiles, for example). What really disappointed me was the bored/lazy/unfriendly attitude of pretty much every employee. Even when we were asking for something simple, such as getting a towel at the pool kiosk, the staff members could not have been less interested in being efficient or pleasant.Don't bother getting a balcony with a city or mountain view room. There is horrendously loud construction on two separate skyscrapers right next door, and you need earplugs to sit outside. Fortunately, the rooms have good sound insulation, so sleeping is no problem.

For business or pleasure, Ala Moana Hotel has all the right stuff. Location amenities, parking, surroundings. No hotel is more convenient. Easy access to Ala Moana Shopping Center, Waikiki, downtown. Friendly staff, good restaurants, easy parking, great pool. Ala Moana Beach an easy walk.

need to ensure the steam room works all the time...The last 3 occasions that I stayed at your hotel this was not the case. A main reason to stay here is to enjoy your steam room and pool area. Seems to be a consistent issue.

I never have surprises when I visit the Ala Moana. Which is a plus and a minus. If you're looking for a delightful experience, well, I wouldn't say you'll find that at this hotel. On the other hand, if you want no surprises, which is preferable from a business travel perspective, this is a good place to stay.

I love the Ala Moana Hotel! 38 years ago I went there after my senior prom, and three days ago I hosted an incredibly successful writers workshop, all with the help of caring staffers at a brilliant location. You can't beat the fact that it is right next door to Ala Moana Shopping Center which has everything you can think of AND thinks you didn't think of. Ala Moana Beach Park is a quick walk, and before you know it you are dipping your feet in the ocean and leaving your cares behind. After our workshop day was over, we would all come together at the bar at the Signature and carry on and enjoy each other's company. You couldn't ask for better.

Great customer service and accommodations. Parking garage however could new paint and made brighter. The location was very convenient to shopping and Waikiki. I stayed overnight for the marathon relay and it worked out well.
user_name:
Renee K
Ewa Beach, United States

review_body: The location is good. Good places to shop and eat nearby. Starbucks in the lobby is nice. They serve beer! Good place to refresh!Microwave in the room is convenient.The staff was nice.I'll choose this hotel again.

We went to our condo rental and it was covered in dead roaches and bugs. Was able to get last min reservations here and was able to find a great deal on the web with my AAA card. Clean, well kept, and friendly/helpful staff. Housekeeping was so prompt every time we called for assistance. Parking was a steal compared to other hotels who can charge up to $42/day for parking! Quick uber Ride to the main drag at night for dinner and drinks or eat at the shirokiya in the mall.

Located at the entrance to Waikiki with world class shopping center Ala Moana St your back door. Beautiful Magic Island in front, there is no better place to stay. Fine dining all around within walking distance this is a hotel for locals and tourists to enjoy. We will come again.

It's been about 20 years since rooming at the Ala Moana Hotel but wow! They have renovated and changed a lot of things. It looks like a brand new hotel. I really enjoyed my stay here, the ocean view was great and my hotel room was spacious, beautiful, and comfortable to be in

The hotel's location was walking distance to the mall which was good for shopping; and that's it. The bathrooms are extremely outdated, dirty and cramped; there was rust on the doors, floors and shower. The room I stayed in was small, though I appreciated the view and the housekeeping. There was a lack of entertainment and food in the hotel, if we wanted decent food we had to walk to the Ala Moana Mall. When I'm on vacation, I like to take advantage of room service, which this hotel doesn't offer. Overall, I personally will not be staying at this hotel again, nor would I refer this hotel to any family or friends.

Very Good Hotel overall. Hotel should warn guest when events such as Graduation at the Convention center will take up all the hotel parking. Very inconvenient and inconsiderate to guest who also are paying for parking.

The hotel was clean as well as our room. A little dated but a great location to the mall and the nearby park which has a beautiful beach and park grounds. The in room coffee maker makes terrible coffe however but their is a Starbucks in the lobby :)

Trip for medical emergency and you were able to accompany my needs in a short notice. Everyone was helpful and and. very polite. Thanks for making a difficult situation bearable. We might need help in the future and look forward to staying here again

Low key but strikingly good feeling of the soul of Hawaii! Great service all around, from the front desk to room housekeeping to the parking. Someone always answers the phone even though always busy. Great location for walking to Ala Moana center, beach, or the Waikiki Yacht Club, and easy Kapiolani Blvd or Atkinson or Nimitz driving access.

Disappointed in this hotel. The location is good being right in town but the room wasn’t the best. Found a hair in the tub, a live roach in the bathroom, the parking garage is horrible to navigate. Plus there is a gate there that’s always open so anyone can just walk in mess with your car. Honestly I was quite disappointed.

Hotel nice and clean, front desk staff friendly and efficient, as well as other staff. Only complaint: parking structure staff. Part of it was my fault - attempting to go in thru the exit. Tone of voice of the parking attendant was not pleasant, I apologized, and his attitude changed. Perhaps he realized that I was an elderly, kamaaina, that just was a little lost.

The convenience of Ala Moana Hotel is tough to beat. No getting into Waikiki traffic. Easy to walk to really good restaurants. Room was clean. Elevator was reasonable. Lots of high school kids in the hotel.

This hotel was very nice, with a mini supermarket and a Starbucks in the lobby. Easy to get to the beach by walking or uber. There was a slught hiccup with the room. I was given a room right next to a maintenance room which had someone entering n exiting loudly every so often, but they changed my room to a different one without a fuss after I explained the situation. It would have been impossible to get any sleep otherwise. The room was spacious, clean and had everything I needed. Only downside was having to swap rooms late at night due to the noise, but otherwise, a perfectly satisfying stay.

Overall a pleasant stay, close to everything we wanted, good parking. You are close to Ala Moana Mall which made eating super easy. Recommend going to Foodland to get their hot bar, plus you can eat in side as well.

Stayed here when flight stopped due to electrical fault. Staff friendly and helpful. Room good though view from balcony was of a building site. Beds comfortable and big. Coffee and tea available and a microwave.

Excellent and very accomodating location for families.....(do not require more than 200 characters for a survey. If not, don't ask for any feedback. When I'm unable to end this survey and submit my comments, I'm not able to. That's just creates frustration!

Location can't is the best. Shower head pressure and drainage could be better in some rooms. Of course wish the Kamaina rate would be set or more consistent. Sometimes it is $149 per night and other times it can be over $200 per night. Great to have a Starbucks and Signature restaurant offers a great place to have a drink and/or dinner. Excellent without leaving the property. Just a short walk to the shopping center which offers you everything.

Very small room. Dirty part of town. They make the shuttles dump you on corner and then you have to walk up the hill. They couldn't stop under the awning at the front door. Room was tiny! Check in staff rude. Across from a run down YMCA. A lot of rif raf in area. Just not an enjoyable place. Could not check in until 3 pm. Shower curtain mildewed on bottom. Difficult to get to ocean. They said it was a 5 minute walk. Forget that, it was a good 15-20 min. Was so glad to get out of that place.

Always, a fair value and pleasant stay. We do business in Oahu on a regular bases. The hotel is centrally located and offers many options, when we are there. There are restaurants and shopping stores, plus you are in walking distance of Waikiki. Our, number one recommendation !

My young son and I arrived at 4.30am to a welcoming and attentive group of staff members. Efficient service allowed us a quick transition to a very clean and comfortable room. All amenities were great and the on-site retail stores offered us convenient options for snacks, coffee and small gifts. The shopping centre was easily accessed via a skywalk and having the added presence of security personnel moving through the accommodation floors during the quiet hours, made me feel very comfortable.The buffet breakfast in the Cafe provided a good range of dining options for us and our staff were courteous and friendly. There is no in-room dining, however there are a great many options at the shopping mall adjacent to the hotel, which stay open until quite late.We are looking forward to returning later in the year.
user_name:
levans503547
Pohnpei, Federated States of Micronesia

review_body: The Ala Moana Hotel is conveniently located with shopping and restaurants in walking distance. The valet, front desk personnel, housekeeping personnel are friendly and helpful. The rooms are excellent.

We had a wonderful stay by the Ala Moana park and mall. The check in and out went smoothly. If we needed anything extra, the staff made sure we taken care of. The breakfast on site was very good and the wait staff were very accommodating.

The hotel is a five minute walk to the Convention Center and the Ala Moana Mall. Easy access to transportation to get around the island. It is centrally located and convenient. Its a ten minutes walk to the water. The Starbucks at the main hotel lobby gives it a lively buzz filled with activities and people. The staff are friendly and rooms are clean. I will definitely stay here again. Great value for your money.

Service was great, I just wished that the sliding door opened all the way and they provided extra blankets. The Ac was so cold it was freezing in the room. All the staff there was really friendly. It was really easy to finds and central ,ala Moana was right next door.

I enjoyed my stay at the hotel. Staff was very helpful and polite. Rooms are clean, and spacious. Great location made shopping and dinning easy cause they are right next to the mall. I would highly recommend this hotel to family and friends.

Charges $20 per night for self parking, no valet, and if you return late, there is no parking to be found. The valet double parks cars and you need to call them to get out. Do not recommend. As it stands, self parking should be free or at the very least, a $5 per day charge. Why pay $20 for self parking if you can't get a parking space! Also got stuck in a handicapped room next to the elevators. We are not handicapped, heard the elevators all night!

Did not receive 3 days complimentary breakfast. Only for one day breakfast which was not mentioned on the sale promotion. So I felt I was cheated. I booked this hotel because it is close to the mall.The bathroom shower head was no good. The water came out with a little of shower water.

The rooms were clean. Be sure to request a two bed room as they have a balcony. A very nice hotel. I would stay there again if I'm ever in Honolulu. It is conveniently located near a large shopping mall that has many restaurants and there is a sky walk from the hotel to the mall so you don't have to contend with the heavy traffic.

A nice place to stay in and they have a good service. I will recommend to my friends and families. The location is very convenient to all the restaurant and mall. Easier to locate whatever you want, like banks, gas station, especially going to UH Manoa.

Enjoyed our stay, nice Hotel, plenty of amenities including a Starbucks! Loved being walking distance to the mall. There was a mix up with my husbands name but we got an upgrade, will stay there again.

I love Ala Moana Hotel. It is centrally located and the hotel staff is wonderful. Check in was easy and fast. The valet staff was so friendly, helpfu, and welcomingl. They took care or us coming in and departing and always with a smile.

Will stay again. Staff is friendly and check in and out were easy. Love that their is a Starbucks right in the lobby. Valet was fast to retrieve car. Restaurant had good service. Food was okay for a buffet style.

Rooms are nice and clean quick walk to Ala Moana Shopping Mall. Great for Business travelers and vacationers. Beds are comfortable and clean rooms. Staff are very helpful. Convenient to many restaurants.

Clean, comfortable, great location, Starbucks, staff are friendly and inviting. Nice relaxing atmosphere. Having a microwave in the room was a nice touch, you don't normally get that. It's next to Ala Moana Shopping Center and across the street from Ala Moana Park if you wanted to get in a workout outdoors.

Love the hotel, the amenities and the staff are super helpful. Hot water available all the time, which is not always the case in hotels I hav stayed in, even 4 star hotels. And a Starbucks in the lobby, as well as a well stocked store.
user_name:
stephenmr2017
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Not the nicest but it's comfortable. Theirs a Starbuck conveniently located in the lobby. The convenience of the Ala Moana Hotel next door was nice. The room was a little noisy with the refrigerator making a lot of noise at night. Room was pretty small and we had a partial Ocean View. Maids to clean the room come pretty late like around 2 or 3 in the afternoon. Overall was pretty average and the price was a little more affordable than some hotels. On the last day we found signatures upstairs with happy hour 430-630 which was the best deal there.

Great location (next to the Ala Moana Mall) and very convenient to the Honolulu convention center and Waikiki beach. The service is good and the rooms are clean. In addition, here's a nice little night club off the lobby if you want to sneak in a little dancing and an onsite Starbuck's with plenty of seating.

The hotel itself is nice. Beware, some rooms are privately owned & managed by a property mgmt company that screwed me. I booked a room for 3 guests, 2 beds. Only 1 bed in room. Had to book 1 more room

Ala Moana hotel is conveniently located and just beside this hotel is the biggest Ala Moana shopping mall. They are connected thru a foot bridge so it's easy to just walk whenever you feel like shopping or if you need to grab a bite then go back to the hotel. There's the bus stop near the hotel that goes around the city (the pink one).

The Ala Moana was a great choice for our stay in Hololulu. It is centrally located and it's easy to navigate to popular tourist destinations. The staff were very welcoming and accommodating during all points of our stay. We will definitely be back!

Great hotel, close to everything you will need for a great vacation. The room was very clean, bed very comfortable, a great room with a microwave and a refrigerator. I had a great stay over in Honolulu because of the ala moana hotel! I would like to make ala moana the best I like to stay at when visiting Oahu.

As stated earlier in the survey, I enjoy staying at this particular hotel. I for some odd reason tend to stay here because it is closer to the mall than other hotels. I rather walk to the mall instead of driving or riding in an Uber vehicle.

We go to Honolulu on business and the Ala Moana Hotel is the perfect place. The rooms are spacious and have all the amenities. The main shopping center of Honolulu is next door and has 2 food courts for a quick, cheap lunch or dinner. I recommend the Japanese Village food court. Some many choices of tasty Asian food.We book with AirPads for a cheaper rate. Since we only go there for 3 or 4 nights we don't mind if there is no housekeeping (that's why it's cheaper with Airpads). They leave for you all you need and extra. Even a new pair of sheets.You can go for a stroll on Waikiki beach which is 10 minutes away on foot. We see many airline crews checking in.

Located adjacent to the Ala Moana shopping center, this quiet, friendly hotel is one of my favorite hotels in the Honolulu area. It has a nice bar and fine dining on an upper floor plus a Starbucks adjoining the Lobby. The staff is efficient. Room décor and quality of the rooms vary somewhat. And, many rooms are on the small side. If you're staying more than a night or two be sure to reserve one of the larger rooms. Prices are usually reasonable given the location. It doesn't have a

Our stay was excellent. Staff is great. Housekeeper didn't clean the room or make bed at all. We needed to call for extra toilet paper, but the delivery was quick. Minor issue, we'll be back. If price is affordable

Terrible customer service - Room reservation cancelled because hotel was overbooked, even though room was booked and paid for 3 months earlier. Will never book with Booking.com again. Incredibly disappointing!

The room was fit for purpose, a short stay while my partner could go shopping at the shopping centre next door on our last days in Hawaii. It was very small and had no views except for a drab roof and a construction site. Minimal interaction with any staff but the reception was friendly though it was very crowded and a bit chaotic. I was amazed she knew exactly who was waiting next in line to be served.

Nothing over the top..lil overpriced for what we experienced...disappointed our room wasnt cleaned and done before we returned back to our room...we on a time constraint so we jus got fresh towels....

The room was a little small with a queen bed. Nice little refrigerator and microwave. Parking was good. Being next to the shopping center is a big plus. All in all it was pretty good. I would stay there again.

Valet and Housekeeping very good, rooms a little pricey, location excellent, could hear next room playing music which interrupted our sleep a little. Signature Restaurant great food but ran out of steak during Happy Hour. Would stay at hotel again because of location.

Great place to stay if you want a friendly experience by a local staff full of aloha from Valet to Bar tenders.We attended a school function and wanted to relax on a Friday before the event at the pool, and have a place to stay after the event verses driving to the West side and found it to be very comfortable!

Ala Moana is always my choice--it is not in Waikiki so you don't have the crazy traffic, it is adjacent to Ala Moana center, the rooms are modern, simple, clean, comfortable--staff is friendly--i just count on Ala Moana to be my home away from home.

I loved the location - close to the conference I was attending but it's also a short walk to Waikiki shops and bars. There's also a big shopping mall next to the hotel, so you can get all your shopping sorted easily. Staff was really friendly and buffet breakfast on site was quite decent - not the best I've ever had but you won't leave hungry - there's a lot of fruits but also danishes, muffins, sausages, scrambled eggs etc.

Great room, friendly professional employees, Great location. I was travelling on business, but this hotel is perfect for a couple too. Very convenient to Ala Moana Center which offers many choices for dining.

Their idea of a partial view is that you lean way over the balcony and catch a glimpse of water. Staff is rushed and impolite. Elevators are slow and crowded. Rooms feel old and dirty. Beds are small and rather uncomfortable.

I have stayed here before because of its great location. I loved my room with a view and balcony. I would definitely recommend your hotel to my friends. Great that Starbucks is in the lobby. I will return.

Always an easy check-in process. The rooms are comfortable and the hotel is in a great location. The men at the front are always helpful, along with other staff members. I appreciate being provided the kamaaina rate as a Big Island resident.Mahalo

Staff, Service, Convenience, Everything was most acceptable and made my stay effortless. I really like a quiet sleep and room 3432 provided this for my brief stay with you. Haven't stayed with Ala Moana for several years as my last visit was a noisy night with Asian visitors occupying the adjacent room and their late-night TV viewing keeping me awake, wasn't appreciated. This visit was nice and quiet, Mahalo

Ala Moana is a great central location for a stay on Oahu. Next door to the Ala Moana Mall, it offers quick shopping opportunities as well as lots of restaurants. The hotel can be loud both internally with slamming doors that echo on the hallways as well as the traffic noise from busy Honolulu. I use a white noise app and earplugs. The check-in process is very slow and wait times can be extensive. Parking is available ($20-25/nt) and it is a good jump off location for the other parts of the island. There is a self-serve laundry but they do not provide dishes/pans/flatware for the kitchens. Nice pool area and many rooms have a view of the marina at Ala Moana Park across the street.

Negative Aspects:- Breakfast was good but overpriced!- Parking a car in Ala Moana Hotel or any other hotel in Honolulu is almost more expensive than the actual car rental.Positive Aspects:- The proximity to Ala Moana Center is is undoubtedly an added value;- The room was clean and comfortable;- In walking distance to Ala Moana Beach Park;

Hotel staff were very friendly and courteous from Front Desk, Valet, and housekeeping personnel. Rooms were kept clean and orderly. Walking distance to eating and shopping places. Easy access to Hotel and close to Waikiki.

I stayed at the Ala Moana Hotel for 4 nights. And I enjoyed it. I had an ocean view room and it was very nice. The balcony view was good and the room was clean. Expensive, but hey.... it’s Hawaii. Decent location.

We love staying at the Ala Moana Hotel for the location. My son surfs contests at Ala Moana Bowls so location is great. However, when we booked a room for 2 adults and 2 kids, we had no idea they expected us to share

Great hotel. Quiet, loved having a microwave and frig in the room. Room was somewhat small, but that comes with trying not to spend too much money in Hawaii! :-) The guy at the Expedia desk was helpful in planning the tour to the Arizona and The Missouri Ship memorial. All in all, a good hotel. Would stay there again

The Ala Moana was everything we needed and we plan on staying there again. It was a very pleasant experience and we will definitely recommend it to anyone we know headed to Hawaii. It’s obvious that the staff cares about the hotel.

The perfect hotel to stay for business trips or neighbor island shopping excursions. Stayed in the Waikiki Tower and seems recently renovated. Friendly housekeeping staff. Conveniently located hotel fairly near airport and on the edge of Waikiki.

The staff here are friendly. Check-in and checkout out was a simple, efficienct process. Rooms are nice enough, has all the amenities you would expect. Though the jewel is being next door to a shopping centre. For lovers of shopping you really can't beat the location.

Booked the 33rd Floor Executive Suite via an external agent for the 3rd time. Have stayed here every 2 years the last 4 years. The suite is excellent and hard to beat for us as family of 5. The hotel itself is also great! Location is excellent next to Ala Moano shopping center. Staff is very friendly. Parking garage is big enough so can always park the rental car. Swimming pool is basic but good. Towels are supplied against a fee and you can also take them to the beach. Ala Moana park and beach is within walking distance. Great beach for kids, almost no waves. Kailua Lanikai beach is a 30 minutes drive from the hotel and also recommended. Waikiki is walkable so nice after a couple of drinks there. Hope to be back again 2 years later.

We love staying at Ala Moana hotel. It’s in a great location and we feel comfortable and safe staying there. The rooms are clean and gym very nice. The restaurant on the top floor is wonderful and i love having a Starbucks in the hotel! A great stay place!

Got checked in quickly and everything looked good. Price was nice as well compared to other hotels and location was great. Had a suite, but they don't provide pillows/blankets for the pullout. We didn't ask for those though, but I assumed some would be provided in the room.

Awesome stay. I like the location and the staff were very helpful. The hotel is near Waikiki and have many restaurants around it. The check in process was pretty easy and convenient. I would definitely recommend this hotel

I was able to book my reservations online within a day. The price was set right. Check-in was quick; the room was available. I was able to call service to get some extra pillows and other items for the room. This is the perfect place to stay. The hotel is right next to the Ala Moana Mall. The convenience of walking across to the mall is perfect. I did not need to drive to the mall.

I love it. Alamoana hotel.very good location . but, Parking is expensive.The reason is that the parking lot at the Ala Moana Center is free.If you stay at the hotel, you should give a discount on parking.

Hotel staff is rude. The checkin/checkout receptionists did not care that you wanted to stay at their hotel. Although towels are supplied to be able to go to the beach, you had to return them to the hotel at 6pm which shortens your time at the beach. The rooms are small, like really small. The pillows provided were a joke and the covers are horrible. If you want to shop and be away from the tourists the location is great, but it is far from the hotel strip/ tourist location.

Very thankful the manager approved a late check out for us. My daughter's medical procedure was at 6:30 am and it was comforting to know we could go back to the hotel for her to sleep for a few hours before catching the plane back to Maui.

Everything and everyone were great! The service we received and helpfulness of the staff was super great. When we had a questions, the staff was knowledgeable and quick to respond, no hesitation, I really like that. Although, the breakfast buffet and staff there needs improvement, not that great.

We had a great time. I got a great rate and everything worked fine except the bathroom door was hard to open. The kids got stuck in it so we didn't let them close it. I left a note to let you know to check it. Other than that we will probably be back soon especially if we can great room rates.

The room was clean and spacious. The hotel was in a great location for the tasks that I needed to do. Wish hotel had room service. There is a pizza delivery service that delivers to the lobby, but no actual room service.

I always stay at your hotel......close to the shopping center, places to eat, we feel comfortable in the hotel and surroundings, we like the amenities in the hotel, people are accommodating and friendly.

We had a nice quick overnight stay - checked in about 6pm and checked out the next day at 11am. We chose the Ala Moana for our quick stay because of the great access to Ala Moana Center. There were lots of parking spots open now that Rumours is no longer open, especially on a Saturday night. We were checked in quickly as there was no one else checking in at the time. Our room was fine, although we had to unplug our fridge overnight because it was making a clicking sound (not the usual fridge sounds). We also had to get one of our room keys rekeyed because it stopped working after the first room entry. We grabbed breakfast from Starbucks downstairs and spent a few hours at Ala Moana Center before checking out. The checkout line was really long at 11am so we did the express checkout and put our key cards into the box next to the front desk. We'll be back for any quick overnight trips.

My wife and I stayed here in an ocean view suite with great views of Ala Moana Park and the ocean. The hotel is the closest hotel to the Convention Center, where we were attending a conference. It’s an easy short walk to and from. There are swankier hotels in Waikiki for sure but they’re also much more expensive. Ala Moana Hotel is a great place to stay with a good value. In addition, the Signature Restaurant on the 36th floor is excellent.

This hotel was very nice, comfortable, clean and centrally located. The staff, including the valet, bellman, front desk, housekeeping and restaurant were all helpful and friendly. Heide at the front desk made us feel right at home during check-in. The valet were very willing to assist in loading and unloading our vehicle. Looking forward to staying here on our next visit to O'ahu.

Great front desk, nice amenities, room was clean and well appointed. A short but very nice sty. Highly recommended. Location is very convenient to Ala Moana shopping center. Want a great meal? Go to the Signature on 36th floor. Fantastic, with happy hour specials.

Very accommodating with check-in, which was a HUGE plus for me as I had been up since 2 a.m. that morning. Was a little disappointed with only 1 bag of coffee. I had a view of the neighboring construction site:( I always enjoy staying at the Ala Moana. It is my first choice when traveling interisland!

The bottom of the bathroom door it's been getting wet, consequently, the top layer is coming apart.To save on replacing the door, just cut off some of the bottom off, so when you open or close the door and there's a towel on the floor, you don't have to drag it. This was in room #1356.Also, wished you had a late check out, specially when you're there due to medial reasons. The Hyatt has a 2pm, late check out; which makes it a lot better. Thanks for your time!!

Staff were helpful at check in/check out and with arranging tours and a shuttle back to the airport. Room was clean and the bed very comfortable. Beautiful (although pricey) restaurant on top floor with lovely views and delicious food.

All in all was great except for two small roaches that we had in the room.Staff was friendlyParking was some what good. Had some issues with the gate card key to go in and out. Had to get new card twice cause the card failed

Staff and location was very convenient.. However the bed was way to soft for us and would have appreciated a much firmer pillows that didn't seem to flatten when you rest your head. love the wifi service..Mahalo

My stay here was absolutely amazing. Awesome location and Excellent Service. I loved the convenience of being close to the mall as well as many restaurants. The Staff was beyond helpful and very friendly. I definitely will be back!!

Had a horrible time which sucks because i always stay at ala moana hotel. No more. Sorry. Me and my wife tried to have a weekend stay cation away from our 3kids. Service at front desk was horrible, first 2rooms they put us in was horrible.

This hotel is very nice and close to the Waikiki beach where I enjoyed a walk towards Diamond Head. The beach is amazing, with many activities to do from walking, running or biking by the gorgeous sand of Wailkiki, or to swim, surf or relax suntanning. The hotel is right beside the shopping mall Ala Moana Center which has all the shops you can imagine and close to Don Quijote Honolulu which is a convenient store where you can find better prices. The location of the hotel is great and the breakfast buffet offered is delicious! The view from my balcony was very nice and I enjoyed my stay. During the weekends the hotel is busy but well staff even with fun activities. I really enjoyed my stay

Ala Moana was clean, comfortable and conveniently located. We visited the Starbucks in the lobby at all hours of the day. My only issue was with their internet - it was terrible. It cut-out all of the time.

25th floor, but still noisy. music late at night coming from ala moana center parking lot. emergency vechile, a lease 5 a night going by. need a place to eat after breakfast restaurant close. other wise everything else was great.
user_name:
Brian K
san mateo, United States

review_body: Ala Moana Hotel is really convenient and confortable.Location is also nice.Especially easy to go shopping and go to the beach.You can enjoy view from your room.STARBUCKS opens early in the morning.I will choose again.

Very good location, which is conviently near to large shopping center. Hotel was very clean, and staff always courteous when I came in contact with them. Valet staff was very quick and professional in their service.

Long lines to check in, they messed up on my room. They gave me one King bed instead if the two double beds. Elevators were malfunctioning. Parking lot elevator was down on the last day I stayed there. Not to mention, one of the parking lot attendents was very rude. Pool area needs massive work.

Location of the hotel is convenient. Valet staff gave us good recommendations for places to visit and were were really nice and helpful, however there was a dead roach found on our sheets therefore the not so good review

Ideally located right next to Ala Moana shopping center and closeby to Waikiki. This is a great property to stay as it is so convenient even w/o the use of a car, you can still get around just fine. Great for local residents as well.

As soon as I got into the room, a cockroach was on the bed then flew onto the floor. The front desk staff told me it is "normal" to have cockroaches in the room since Hawaii is tropical seriously? I wanted to show her a photo of the cockroach I took but she rejected me. Unfriendly staff, dirty hotel. If you care of your own mental and physical health, don't risk yourself here.

This place was great! The staff were friendly and knowledgeable, it's close to everything and I've already told a friend to change her reservation and stay here instead of another hotel. I would return.

Very noisy; could hear person in the next room at midnight speaking on her cell phone and the trash trucks started at 4:30 am and never stopped; we finally just got up at 6:00 am. This is the first time EVER i have been charged ($5.00) to get boarding passes printed. I have no idea why anyone would ever stay at this hotel. Even after telling the desk clerk when checking out she never offered to reimburse us.

Arriving at 6 am from Australia , departing at 11 pm for Canada the same dayRequired us to find day lodging with early check in . None of the other hotels I hadInquired with were able to guarantee us anything . Maybe it was good luck but my callTo them at 6 30 AM from the airport got me a ready room by 730 . Nothing fancy, but I was only looking for a place to lay my head . It was an easy walk to the beach, followed by an hour by their nice pool, and a half hour cab ride back to the airport . I saw a lot of airline staff, so maybe because it's a little outside the hotel zone of Walkiki and a rather large hotel it might cater more to a clientele with similar needs to mine

Stayed here thru a Hawaiian Airlines package deal. READ the fine print! $25/day for “resort fee”. Resort??? I don’t think so!!! Also a $50 one time “hotel fee”! Then again it is in the fine print but still deceptive as it adds onto the price advertised. I stayed here for a medical appt at Queens and wanted a clean, quiet place. I was put in a nicely decorated room but with construction starting at 4:00 am next door, it really sucked! Had to use my noise cancelling headphones to sleep. Also the carpet and tile had not been cleaned. A chunk of woman’s hair in the bathroom floor, hair pins on the carpet and hair on the bathroom counter. I Never bother for room service as you have to call a separate company and room cleaning is 25/day!!!! Room which I stayed in is managed by Airpads. It is also privately owned..... Don’t think the owner would be happy with the way their room is kept up. I’m local and I will NEVER stay here again after this experience and would not recommend it to my friends. Stay elsewhere! The only positive was the front desk people were nice....

Ala Moana Hotel offers a great value through location, pricing and staff. We always stay at the Ala Moana as the rooms are clean, comfortable, amenities are sufficent and the staff is professional and making sure our stay is appreciated.

Living in Kauai I come to the Big City of Honolulu infrequently. However this hotel gets my vote every time.It is quiet, clean, and convenient for downtown activities as well as Mall shopping at the Ala Moana Mall which is down a ramp and through Macy’s. I especially appreciated the front desk clerk Joe who checked me in and gave me lots of tips for my stay. He gets most of the stars.The a/c worked, the bed was comfortable, the WiFi included. Only complaint was the dimness of the bathroom lights which made it hard to apply makeup. But a minor issue for one night.

Very nice accommodations. The location is excellent, within walking distance of a major mall, the beach and park,as well as restaurants and several convenient stores. The hotel employees are welcoming and friendly. I would stay at the Ala Moana again and recommend it to others.

The hotel was situated next to the Ala Moana Hotel and there is a walkway that connects both. The rooms were extremely clean and the maid service kept everything stocked daily. The hotel staff was accommodating and we have a very enjoyable and peaceful stay and would stay here again.

It was okay. Rude front desk lady, AC kept turning on & off and it was too long of it being off but due to rude hospitality we didn’t want to ask about the AC. Lady on phone was rude when asked for an extra pillow

amazing stay and wonderful experience Koa the valet attendant was amazing made us feel right at home always helpful. From the moment we checked in everyone was so awesome assistance with our luggage and we booked at a time when they had a special to receive a gift card to starbucks which was a nice treat. We were notified upon arrival of a helicopter landing and this was no issue or challenge. Overall experience was top notch. We have stayed here several times and will continue to come back. Mahalo for your aloha

I usually find some type of stain on the bedding or hair in the shower, this time however, I only found small blonde hairs in the shower. They're improving. The front desk staff are usually very friendly.

Terrific location with pluses and minuses; however overall good stay. The 2-bedroom suite could have been appointed better; furniture a bit dated for the $. Starbucks and sitting area downstairs very convenient and inviting.Nice having Ala Moana shopping center and Beach nearby.

From the moment I walked in the service at the front desk they greeted you with a smile made you feel important , Rooms are spacious and well kept view are great , Walking distance for food shopping and some nite life fun

Turned out to be an excellent choice for us as the location is not in Waikiki but really more convenient. Clean spacious rooms and best of all connected to a fabulous mall we frequented several times as lots of clothing and restaurant choices.

Worst hotel I've ever been! Very small room and bathroom,not worth it to pay $200/day. Very rude male parking security. I wanted to kick his *** .bit hpisekeepers,front desk excellent service. I just don't expect to have a room like that.

Best location for shopping. Great that they have a coffee shop in the hotel. Most of the staff were lovely. The room walls were a bit thin though. We were woken up 2/3 nights by our partying neighbors at 3 am :(

There was mold or something black splashed on the ceiling of the bath. Shampoo was the only toiletry offered -- seriously? The air conditioner never went off all night long, running just to keep the room cool. It never got cool enough, just barely bearable. Definitely needs updating! If tried to open door, it only opened inches so you couldn't go out. Felt very claustrophobic!

The rooms are super clean and everything looks new regardless of the high traffic the hotel receives. I stay in a lot of hotels downtown for events, but the Ala Moana is my favorite. The staff is nice, the rooms are clean top to bottom (which includes the carpet), and it's right next to the mall.

Signature restaurant was brilliant. Location was perfect. Complimentary WiFi was very helpful. Views were gorgeous. Room was like any other hotel room I have been in, nice, clean, but not super fancy. Staff were friendly and helpful.

Rooms are very clean but lack a table and chair at which to sit. Service was wonderful and Jay at the front desk was very friendly and helpful! Wish the pool area was more upgraded :-( Would also like the Plantation Room to be open for lunch since there is no other restaurant in the hotel for lunch.

The room was nice. Everything was clean except for the bathroom. The bathroom floor was still wet and smelled like pee & we didnt even use it yet. The shower head was broken. It was spraying out water from where you twist it on. The plantation cafe was okay. Not worth the $16 per person. You could definitely go to eat somewhere better. Service was okay. I dont know if id go back.

I stayed in the one bedroom suite. It was perfect. I cant wait to book my next stay. Great hotel, great people. Easy access to Ala Moana Mall. The front desk are an awesome group of people - they made check-in easy and answered a lot of questions we had professionally.

Good price and not far from city center/Waikiki beach. Ala Moana shopping center is at next door, so very convenient. Room is clean and comfortable.Breakfast does not have much variety of foods, quite average in taste, not worth $30.

Arriving they held my bags until my room was ready. The room was clean upon arrival. Plenty of towels which was nice. The AC unit worked amazing expeciously because it was humid. Would highly recommend to everyone!

Great location, friendly, helpful staff, gym is very good, comfortable beds. Would recommend & would definitely stay there again. Cleaning was good & having the convenience shop & Starbucks in the building was a plus.

The hotel room was ok, but because we did not went through the hotel, but through airbnb or vrbo, we did not get the room we wanted. We requested a King bed and got two doubles, the room was in much need of maintenance. The hotel could not help with changing us to another room as they indicated, this is an owner property that is managed elsewhere. The location is very central and the rest of the hotel was quite lovely.

The room only had one queen bed and a pull out thing. Otherwise quite small. There was construction of a new hotel high rise behind the building which faced our room, making it impossible to sleep after 7:30 am or so. The hotel has a nice Sauna but no showers at night, rendering the Sauna kind of useless if you wish to return to your room on the elevator. The gym was amazing and at night totally underutilized. The air conditioning in the Gym was set too cold, so maybe it feels good if you are doing cardio work.

The Ala Moana Hotel is a great stay. When you enter into the hotel lobby, you know you are on vacation. The rooms were well appointed, bright & fresh. The front desk staff were excellent. On the same floor is the Plantation cafe which serves breakfast & Starbucks at the other end. The pool area on the third floor was very nice also. There is a walkway connecting the hotel with the Ala Moana Shopping centre where one can shop, eat & get great exercise. This centre has 350 stores available for you. Approximently three blocks away is the ocean.

Upon arrival, I was given a complimentary upgrade to the Waikiki Tower with an ocean view on the top floor. Room was immaculate; housekeepers on the floor all acknowledge you when passing by! Prime location for shopping, dining!

Front desk staff needs customer service training. Upon checking in, the front desk was rude with simple and logical questions. Bell and room attendants were phenomenal. The rooms are quite small for a double bed. But can’t beat the price for the location.

This hotel is well positioned in location for those who love ala moana shopping center. We love the Kona tower because of it's private elevator location out of the crowded location of the ala moana tower.

Lots of elevators, 6 main ones and 3 at the Kona Tower. Checking in and checking out was easy. A wheel chair was available every time we needed one. The shop is open till 11:30 at night which is great and it has a lot of items, almost like an ABC store.

This was a staycation for me. The staff was really helpful and showed a lot of Aloha. Facilities were clean. The self-park was a little confusing to navigate, but valet was very fast. The only problem was that the room keys didn't always work, which became inconvenient when needing to get a new one from the front desk during check-in hours. Otherwise, great stay and price. I would definitely recommend to others.

The location is ideal if one does not have a vehicle. The staff always exhibit great customer service and are helpful. The rooms are clean and quiet with all the necessary amenities. Thank you again...I will be back.

Noisy helicopter woke us up at 8 a.m. on Sunday. Loud guests next door and shouting in the hallway during the wee hours of the morning. Parking garage was beyond full and cars were double parking in front of other cars. We had to call the Valet to move one so we could leave.

We stayed at the ala Moana hotel for 9 nights. Within 24 hours of our stay on the tenth floor, our toilet over flowed & flooded our room!! Fortunately minimal belongings were on the floor & contaminated with bio hazardous materials. The maintenance guys were fantastic & at our room mopping up with their bare hands with 10 minutes. The second in charge of the hotel, Jason was very good & assisted with relocation & control over the situation. The hotel manager, polly, who had poor English, was terrible to deal with. She had no idea of what to do, how to deal with a distressed & hysterical guest in such a situation & asked me, 'what do you want me to do about it'. She sat me crying in the foyer late on a Friday afternoon with hundreds of other hotel guests watching on! It was so unprofessional & disgraceful management of the situation to say the least!The hotel staff & management had NO idea about OHS, WHS or anything to do with biohazard contamination. I had to beg for latex gloves & shower caps for shoe covering for protection to enter our room safely & pack everything up! The manager just said to me, 'just start packing your room up, we will relocate you'. The only positive outcome of the situation was the hotel upgraded us to the 23rd floor with balcony & king bed. Our $25 a day US dollar valet parking was waived & we got a complementary breakfast. Upon making a travel insurance claim, we were informed we weren't covered & were advised to seek further compensation from the hotel. This was not forthcoming. Upon requesting a report of the incident from the motel, polly declined & requested I make a statement to security who were summonsed. They failed to give me a report number. Upon making this statement in the foyer of the hotel, the men's toilet next to the restaurant we had breakfast flooded with toilet water & faecal matter. My partner nearly vomited seeing the entire toilet floor flooded & people running out!! When speaking with staff further about the issues with the hotel toilets flooding, we were informed an incident of this nature would occur on a fortnightly basis & was certainly a common occurrence. The explanation as to the cause was rusted old hotel plumbing systems. Upon our return to Australia, our issues were directed back to flight centre agency directly. After some discussions back & forth between the Mantra Group, flight centre & Ala Moana Hotel, nothing further was forthcoming & everyone seemed to just pass the buck & throw it in the 'too hard' basket. Of note, my partner proposed to me on day four of our holiday which was unforgettable & so very special. The hotel had no idea or gave any concern & signatures restaurant management staff treated us as poorly as polly. It was such a disappointment having celebratory drinks from the top of the building on sunset only to be put on a piano as a table shared with 3 other guests & the pianist. Thank god our celebrations were continued elsewhere as the service was again disgraceful for such a special occasion. I'm giving the hotel 1/5 stars only for views from the restaurant on top of the building, room views we were upgraded to on the 23rd floor & customer service of the maintenance, cleaning & valet staff who worked so hard & were always friendly. I feel sorry that they have to work for such a poor employer. Invest in your own personal protection kit of gloves & shower caps so you don't get gastroenteritis!!

i have been coming here at least once a year for work, but no more. The view is a construction site and hanging laundry, I guess that's how they treat repeat customers. The room is not as clean as it could be and there were stains on the couch and bathroom floor. There was a nasty dirty diaper smell near the elevator on the 10th floor. Even though the internet is sketchy I was able to get this review out after several attempts. This is definitely a 1 star hotel. If that is what you want, this is for you, otherwise enjoy your vacation or work stay elsewhere.

Wonderful and excellent stay at the Ala Moana Hotel. Friendly staff, clean rooms, and great atmosphere. Staff very friendly and courteous. Comfortable rooms and nice and pleasant atmosphere. Great location!

We enjoyed our room. The bed was very comfortable. It was very clean and always tidy when we returned from our day. The only complaint that I had was we had a room without a balcony so that meant that the door didn't open been a few inches. It was very hot unless the air-conditioning was on.

The room was very basic, but you need to like a hard bed! I did not like walking through the car park to get to & fro from Ala Moana shopping centre & as there are several strip clubs & many abandoned shops it felt unsafe walking around in the evening as a single woman.

Was a great place to stay and will definitely return again if I go back to Honolulu as there was great service,location and quality. Even Starbucks is right in the lobby. The hotel is also very well maintained and clean.

my stay was effortless, the staff were very helpful and polite, the room was immaculate and the amenities/facilities were easy to use. would recommend to anyone who would prefer everything in the one location. Close to all the shops, beach and public transport

If it wasn’t for being woken up twice for things I did not order or ask for it mighthave been a great stay. The wake up call at 3 am was bad but then the supposed work order at 8 am on Sunday morning was ridiculous.

We stayed here because of it's location. Short distance to beach and Mall. The rooms were clean and had a gorgeous ocean view. The staff was friendly and helpful. However, the Expedia excursion attendant was not very knowledgeable when I asked about the different tours. I booked online through Expedia website while I was there, it was much cheaper.

Everything was great! The service-very friendly & accommodating, location-right next to a huge mall in walking distance (live music at Mai Tai),perks-complimentary breakfast , Starbucks IN the hotel. Great for families, work trips, or just a stay cation.

There was a loud buzzing noise that kept me from sleeping, which I thought was from the room being located near the hallway ice machine. By 3am, I had enough and got up & got dressed to check on the problem. As I headed toward the hall, I realized it was the in-room efrigerator. I had to pull it from the wall & unplug it and got very little sleep. The next morning, I got up and slippe (but thankly didn't fall) in a big puddle of water. I then realized the refrigerator had a freezer and the ice melted. My check-in process also took about an hour (at 10pm), however this was because a Delta flight was cancelled and they had many last minute guests to accommodate. But, it would have been nice to have had one employee addressing the already confirmed guests so we were not caught in the long wait.

The hotel was mediocre. The staff was rude when I asked to be moved away from construction they acted like I was inconveniencing them for being put in a room that had extreme construction noise. The price was that of a much nicer Hotel without all of the amenities.

We chose to stay at Ala Moana Hotel due to location being right next to the mall and not having to fight Waikiki traffic. We’ve stayed here many times and glad that the new owner/management company up keeps the property. I’m saddened that they closed the nightclub Rumors. Requested for a shower chair which was already placed in the room upon check in. The ONLY thing about the room was that I couldn’t control the room temperature - it was warmer than I wanted it to be - plus it was muggy during the time of our travel. All in all it was a fantastic stay!

Excellent!!! Would likely be a returning customer to this hotel! Location is very convenient. Your staffs are very friendly, efficient and knowledgeable!! Hotel is clean and would definitely recommend this establishment to others!

Upon arrival, all hotel employees were helpful, kind, and attentive to my grandson who had to have surgery. We had a nice ocean view room and when we needed anything, we got it right away. The hotel was located close to our destination. Very convenient.

My family and I have been Ala Moana customers for several years. We like the close proximity to Ala Moana Center. This stay, we requested an ADA compliant room. With three adults traveling, all three of us could not be accommodated in one room. The hotel staff went above and beyond to ensure all three of us were comfortable and had compliant accommodations.

Good place to stay at reasonable price. registration desk efficient and friendly. Great location and walking distance to Ala Moana Mall stores and businesses. Hotel has great chinese restaurant with dim sum at lunch and also well priced and delicious food.
user_name:
Cynthia J. C
Lahaina, United States

review_body: As a Kamaaina, the cost was a little high but the location was excellent....it was clean and everyone was pleasant and helpful. The breakfast at the Plantation was just right and started our day well.

Location is the best feature of this hotel as it's connected to Ala Moana shopping center. It's also easy to get in and out of as it's not in Waikiki. However, we stayed in the Kona tower and rooms are average.

Enjoyed the service I received. Very accommodating and loved having Starbucks in the lobby. I also enjoyed being able to walk over to ala Moana hotel and enjoy the great shops there. Check out was fast

Exceptional service from all departments. Valet service: remembering me from past visits; Bell service: delivering my luggage's and storage luggage for me at check out; Service counter: checking me in when there was 2 different reservations under my name; Reservation: last minute changes to my reservation; House Keeping: coming to my room after hours to fix the spare bed, providing towels, and bathroom supplies; Operator: for having a friendly voice at all times.

Room was very clean. i missed having an ice machine on my floor. Reception very courteous and pleasant. Location is excellent. Good breakfast. Enjoyed happy hour at Signature along with dinner and the 10% discount card received at check in. Also appreciate the 2PM Check in time.

We stayed here as my partner was attending a conference at the convention centre. We used a local holiday rental company to secure an amazing rate on a 2 bedroom apartment on a high floor - and i have to say that it could not have been a more amazing place to stay.The views were amazing - if you are facing the Hilton as we were, then you can even see the weekend fireworks from your Lanai (balcony). Otherwise - you have generally unobstructed views of the marinas, ocean, diamond head, and other mountain ranges to the north - it really does offer diverse views which will please most people.In terms of the Hotel itself - it offers everything that families require to ensure a safe, secure and relaxing visit. There are laundries available in the building (coin operated, but lets be fair, some hotels and resorts will charge you 18 dollars for 1 shirt....so a few bucks for a full load is great - and can be done at your own leisure (takes about 1 hour)The lobby has its own starbucks and adjoining restaurant, and only a few metres behind the check in desk, you will find a convenience store on site, offering fresh produce, packaged goods, a large variety of cold beverages, alcohol and specialty items. They also provide postal services, which is helpful for those from abroad.In terms of geography - you can gain access to the large Ala Moana shopping centre directly from the hotels grounds, or you can trek around the back streets to get to the carpark. In addition - the hotel is only a 200 or so metre walk to the Honolulu Convention Centre, and about a mile walk to the Central Waikiki area. If you arent keen on walking everywhere (Honolulu is PERFECT for walking however) - then you could head to the Ala Moana shopping centre and catch the Trolley to pretty much anywhere along the south coast, from Pearl Harbour to Diamond HeadLets be honest - you are staying here if you want a great bed to sleep in, a nice location central to pretty much everything, and easy public transport to attractions across the island. If you want the 'resort' experience, then head to Ko'olina and spend huge amounts of money on it - if you want to just stay in Honolulu and let the breeze carry you on your adventures, then stay here. You wont regret it.

The score would have been higher if the tile floor was clean. A wet mopping in the bathroom and hall area would have helped. The dried spots where visible from an angle and not from directly above it.

The hotel is a nice and won't break the bank. It is next to Ala Moana Center which makes it convenient for shopping, finding food close by, or buying the item you forgot to pack. The staff are friendly and helpful in answering the couple of questions I had. The rooms are clean, not huge but enough space to unpack and sleep and not feel cramped. I would stay here again.
user_name:
Jayson C
New York City, New York

review_body: It's near the ala moana mall and the Honolulu convention center and a Starbucks coffee shop. I Had my 3 day and 2 night stay and I could say that the service was very good, my room was clean spot on and had a really nice view. A stronger wifi needed is all

From the minute you pull up to the Porte Cochere until checkout, the staff at the Ala Moana Hotel greets you with Aloha and makes sure your stay will be enjoyable, relaxing and memorable. Well kept grounds, inviting pool, delicious food and very clean rooms along with their Aloha Spirit will keep you coming back

Not at all satisfied with the non-solution of a bad room assignment. xxxxxxxxxxThe couple I was traveling with had to sleep totogethaer in a queen bed which was very small and not at all what was expected; xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

Wouldn't go back again paid for a suite and kept getting locked out because the keys kept deactivating. They would tell me it's the phone. But all four keys wouldn't work especially since I had just got them. And even before check out I was locked out of my room at 9am their excuse was that it's the phones which doesn't make sense we had 4 keys and all four keys weren't working and they were no where near phones. Also we had 3 people in our suite I stated in the reservations that there were to be 3 to 4 of us there weren't extra pillows or blankets. Had to go down to the front desk and ask for them. As well as new keys for the room. Not worth paying 660. For a suite if you keep getting locked out.

I come to visit my family every year but I stay in a hotel so that at the end of the day I still get to relax. My room was located at the Kona Tower and it was very noisy outside the building and the room next door

It’s farther from the beach but closer to access for other parts of Honolulu. It’s trade off. We always stay for family visits but when grandkids are in tow we stay on Waikiki Beach. The parking was sketchy on the weekend but became manageable on Monday.

The Ala Moana Hotel is located in a very centralized and convenient location adjacent to the Ala Moana mall and Hawaii Convention Center. My room was kept neat, clean, and welcoming. The lobby and other common areas of the hotel were as well. I used a promotional rate I had found and felt I had very good value for what I paid. The pillows were small and would have preferred larger pillows. I did have an issue when going back after checking out because I left my phone charger in my room. The gentleman I spoke with at the front desk called housekeeping to see if they found it which they said they did not, but he was not willing to make any other efforts to help me retrieve my charger.

I've been going to the Ala Moana Hotel at least once and maybe twice a year. I always enjoy my stay and I feel very comfortable. The price for it is just right, considering I have the Kamaaina discount. I will definitely be back again next year!

We stayed at the Ala Moana Hotel by Mantra February 14th to the 21st. When we checked in - I thought we were in trouble because the front desk gentleman was not friendly or nice, at all. I thought, oh boy, what have we done. That was the first and only misconception about the Ala Moana. We were dog tired and the room was located on the 25th floor with an extraordinary view of the city, marina, Ala Moana Beach Park and I believe, even Magic Island. It was panoramic and immediately drew me into the room. The room was nicely appointed and not small or large. The bed was extremely comfortable; but the best part of this hotel was the staff and Plantation Cafe/staff. Everyone was very pleasant, helpful and kudos to Gregory up at the restaurant who made our arrival tremendously welcoming. The shopping center next to the hotel is a must-visit as it has an extensive food court and there are restaurants located on the top level - Mai Tai Bar which played the best reggae music on that Saturday night. Jazz Minds is located around the corner - some of the best jazz in Honolulu. Thank you so much to the Ala Moana for making our visit a well remembered memory. Mahalo nui loa ia'oe. PS: if there is one suggestion that the hotel could work on is the rooftop pool; if they could modernize the actual pool and do something with the rooftop - it would definitely be a draw. Just saying!

Please see review on previous screen. Not much more to add here. Very convenient location at ala moana shopping center. Would recommend this hotel to friends and family. Am looking forward to my next stay.

Nice hotel but the bed was uncomfortable. Good breakfast and nice having a Starbucks in the hotel. The staff was very freindly. The parking garage can be challenging and I would recommend valet and let them wory about where to park your vehicle.

The ala moana an iconic location and an above average hotel. A year or so ago it changed hands from the Outrigger chain to Mantra an Aussie hotel chain. Although the changes are subtle they are changed and the website is no longer as user friendly. Overall it still offers mostly the same caliber of hospitality just at a bit higher rates.

The front desk gentlemen greeted us with exceptional service upon check-in. Didn't get his name but he's truly an asset! We have been coming to Ala Moana hotel either for pleasure or business. Loved it far...
