Well maintained, convenient, friendly, comfortable. Easy in-out parking. Have stayed at Ala Moana Hotel probably 40-50 times (100 nights?) and am never disappointed. Whether for business or pleasure, it's ideally located.

Have someone follow up with us to make sure AC problem was taken cared of. Would have appreciated if someone would have called us personally to see if the AC was fixed or satisfactory. Room was warm all weekend.

Nice hotel right next to Ala Moana Shopping Mall. Check in is 3pm dont expect to get in before then. Rooms nice & clean, We had plenty of cupbooards to use and bathroom also had plenty of space to put our things. Cleaning staff very friendly & did an excellent job everyday. Loved the lady at the tour desk very friendly & helpful, even if we just asked a question. 5 minute walk to pick up pink trolley to get to Waikiki taking about 15 minutes. Shopping & restaurants in Ala Moana Mall about 5 minute walk. Close to Magic Island. Great location if you like to shop.

The staff here are super welcoming & friendly . However, being able to sleep at night was the hard part. The icebox kept making this loud noise throughout the night. The sheets weren’t that comfy. But other than that the hotel location , friendliness of the staff & convince of everything made it worth every penny.

Laura, in reservations, is an exceptional member of the Ala Moana Hotel team! For the price, location and type of accommodation that was received, this is no doubt one of the most recommended places to stay when visiting O'ahu, for business or for pleasure.

Front desk staff Iwalani greeted us with Aloha. She went above and beyond to accommodate our needs. Her hospitality really epitomized the Aloha Spirit! Valet attendants were also very friendly and showed the Aloha Spirit as well. We are originally from Hawaii and was back home for our daughters wedding. So to have that kind of customer service is so refreshing.

a big hotel near Waikiki beach, and also close to the Moana shopping mall, there are lot of choices for dinner. Room and service are very good, a little expensive, but you know it's always expensive in Honulolo.

Facility, location, parking, food areas, and customer service was great. Was great to be able to walk to the Ala Moana Mall with ease. Prefer a thicker, fluffy bed comforter similar to Hampton Inn bed comforter.

Front desk staff was very friendly, to upgrade my room was easy. Customer service was awesome. Clean, simple, and convenient. Live staying at this hote when I work in Honolulu. Sad that Rumors is no longer there tho.

We have stayed in Waikiki many times. This was a great place to stay, clean, comfortable and many places to eat meals and shop in the hotel itself. Location to Ala Moana shopping center was a plus! Will definitely visit again.

Have stayed at the Ala Moana several times and have always been happy. It does seem that since Mantra has taken over they have cut some corners. Supplies in the rooms are not as generous as they once were and I would not recommend the Plantation Cafe for breakfast, it is subpar at best. Very understaffed and the food was not replenished and seemed very generic and almost prepackaged. The buffet that the Ala Moana used to have where the Starbucks is now located was excellent. Very disappointed that it is gone.

Always a great service to local government workers. Centralized location makes it easy for all who stay there. Recent renovations to hotel makes it seems like your staying a a very high class resort yet amenities are simple and cater to all clientele.

The location was convenient next to the Ala Moana Shopping Mall as well as downtown Honolulu businesses. The buffet breakfast was also nice to have. The only down side I've encountered was both toasters at the breakfast buffet was not working. The Hotel was clean, the employees were polite and helpful. I appreciated having the Kona and Waikiki Towers now having and adjoining hallway; unlike in the past you would have to go all the way downstairs and walk around to the far side and catch the elevator up.

Good location. Quick friendly service from front desk. This survey is a bit of a pain to fill out. It is not allowing me to submit unless certain items are filled. I feel that most people would not want to submit because of this tedious work.

early afternoon check upon request is great! you should accommodate this request upon reservation if check in is after 1pm. thank you. the front desk folks are very accommodating. thank you. is it possible to open an account with you and will this facilitate early check in after 1pm?

Nice hotel, but a large keiki soccer tournament was going on and I was put in a room near them. Didn't sleep till 1am. I recommend that if you are in Oahu for work, maybe trying a different hotel. We waited at least 10 minutes to get on an elevator.

Had a nice relaxing weekend at the hotel. Conveniently located on the edge of the Ala Moana Shopping Center complex. Shopping center adjacent, and Waikiki and the Ala Moana beach in close proximity. Didn't use the car, and as a local resident, was very relaxing.

Stayed at this hotel for The Great Aloha Run. Clean room at a good location. Almost anything you would want to eat or drink is at the Ala Moana Mall at an affordable price. If you want to eat like a local, try Foodland. Poke bowl is highly recommended.

Came in very early on a flight from Lihue. Room was not ready so spent some time wondering around. Desk said the room would be ready by noon, perhaps. Came back at noon and it was ready. Great. Took a quick nap, showered, and got picked up for the Lang Lang concert. Next morning, checked out with no trouble then caught the city bus back to HNL for quick flight home. What a great concert evening and a great stay at Ala Moana Hotel. Will do it again in June 2018 for another concert.

The website claims that club members receive late check-out, I was still not granted this because as the receptionist said "this is a newer thing". I feel that if your website claims this is an incentive for joining, then it should be honored. Also I have stayed at numerous hotels and this is the first time I have checked in where I didn't feel welcome- the receptionists were always very cold and unfriendly. Also at every hotel I've stayed at, valet/door people have a habit of welcoming guests. Every single time I walked in through the doors, I was hardly ever greeted by the doormen, there wasn't even a smile. I will point out that the housekeepers I would run into in the hallways were always smiling and friendly but everyone downstairs provided customer service that overall seemed "cold". I would not stay here again.

This hotel was beautiful and clean! The only things that went wrong was the speed of the basement parking lot elevator being a bit slow and it gets very difficult to find a parking stall when you return to the hotel in the night time. Please expand parking lot space!

This hotel is perfect because I go to Hawaii to visit family. If I was there to go to the beach and for the nightlife, I would probably stay at a hotel in the heart of Waikiki. If you’re a shopper, this is your hotel! It’s connected to Ala Moana shopping center vyba skywalk.

Clean room, caring staff, convenient access to Ala Moana Center next door. We had wifi access both in our room and in the conference area. The food was excellent. I would definitely recommend this facility both for an event and as a place to stay in town.

Good customer service from Tony at front desk. No notice at check in about helicopter noise on Sunday and closed pool. Higher prices for kaamaaina and parking. Have always stayed here while staycationing and recently been disappointed.

We were sad that the bedroom didn't have a door on it because our daughter was sleeping on the living room pull out bed, we didn't get our private time together. Other than that the room was nice and had a very nice view.

When the hotel is full, sometimes locating a vacant parking spot is difficult. The Starbucks shop in the lobby was very convenient and even turned into a great spot for the evening with wine and beer.

It would have been nice while checking in that there would be helicopter operations over head for a good portion of the morning and that it would close your restaurant and portions of the street fronting the hotel. Other than that all was okay.

The only reason for the poor sleep rating was the helicopter lift that occurred on Sunday morning at 7:00 a.m. until about noon to replace the air conditioning equipment on the roof. Normally this isn't a problem. We are frequent guests, and are usually quite pleased, but this past time was problematic.

The property is convenient and well maintained. Unfortunately, the check in process is time consuming and awkward. If you are unfortunate to arrive behind a tour of package travel group, you'll wait over 30 minutes to check in. The Ala Moana does not seem to have modern check in options, like online check in or virtual key.

We travel for Cheering competition every year and stay at Alamoana Hotel every year. We would like to get continental breakfast for our group for the convenient before we head to the Convention Center!

Shabby pool area, room was the same. Good walk to Waikiki beach. Buffet breakfast needs some work. Eggs cold & choices were few. What more can I say. You want me to go. I think enough has been said on the subject

Stay here a couple of times a year, and the service is always excellent. I always use the valet to park my car, and their service is friendly and efficient. The front desk staff greets you with a smile when you check in, and are helpful with questions about the hotel and surrounding area. The room I had was clean & comfortable.

This hotel has nice, basic, comfortable, no frills accommodations. If one wants something more luxurious... expect to pay a lot more. I particularly like the housekeeping department and the valet at the main entrance. They are always friendly and willing to help out. The doormen are gentlemen with aloha.

At 5 am, security came to my mom’s room telling her that tge water is leaking to the room below hers. My mom, who does not speak much English, was forced to sign this blank document (later we found out that security guy filled the rest of this document, AFTER making my mom sign, saying that the leakage was my mother’s fault), forced her to sign and write her name and address. She had no idea what she was signing for, but it was so intimidating that she ended up signing it. Next day at the check out, we found out about this and talked one of the shift mgr, and she was extremely rude. She basically told us that we can’t see the document that my mom signed, unless we have a search warrant (LOL). Cause of the water leakage was their poor construction (bathroom tile had a huge crack etc..). Good thing my husband who is in construction mgmt, was there to help us.Long story short, they lack professionalism, and they will NOT treat you like a hotel guest. It’s basically a low class business hotel with really bad breakfast and uneducated staff.

This is my “go-to” hotel as a short stay hotel in Honolulu. It’s so close to all the shopping around the Ala Moana area as well as reasonable walking distance to the Ward centre (Nordstrom Rack and TJ Maxx as well as other stores) as well. While it is not a 5 star hotel, it is certainly very comfortable and the staff are all extremely personable. The rooms are fairly compact, but offer everything needed for a short stay.

This is a nice hotel. If you love shopping, you are right across the shopping mall-- walk out the back door of the hotel, across the parking lot and you are there. Walk to Waikiki beach is possible, but not all that pleasant. It's along roads with lots of traffic. But doable. Room out front have a nice view of the ocean. The rooms are clean and nice, but when we asked for extra coffee (we were 2 people), we were told, no, we could not get more than the 2 coffee pods per day provided. This was unfortunate, because we had to run out and buy coffee. The most annoying aspect about the hotel was the long line to check in or to deal with anything at the reception. The wait was 20 min. at the reception. In the business center the printer did not work, so I had to wait 20 min to reach the front desk to ask for getting something printed. Then had to come back after half an hour to pick it up, again waiting in line for a considerable amount of time. There simply is not enough staff. While none were unfriendly, none seem particularly into the Aloha. It's basic down to business, get on with it already. For a hotel at this price and location, I would have expect better service-- and certainly an extra little coffee pod.

Over all, things look nice but closer inspection in rooms show bad quality repairs and fixes.Pillows were cotton balls.Lobby was comfortable and having a full Starbucks in house was great.Decent place to stay in a pinch.

I always prefer to stay here when I attend a conference across the street even if there is a different host hotel (such as last year) as it’s a no brainer. Friendly, attentive workers and no resort fee with complimentary WiFi. You can’t find that at the other Waikiki hotels. I’ve stayed here the past 6 years to avoid having to wake up early in the morning to avoid driving in heavy traffic and it’s a godsend for me. Connected next door to Ala Moana shopping center and it doesn’t get any better than that! Plus, I can have my morning coffee downstairs in the lobby at Starbucks which also serves beer and wine in the early evenings.

Upon arrival this hotel feels luxurious, nice lobby and great staff. Rooms are a bit outdated, fairly clean and a little small. Views are pretty amazing. No room service, sauna and steam room broken. Lots of noise at night down on the street as you are right downtown. Recommend this hotel for a night or two but maybe not a long term stay.

I stayed this hotel for shopping but I couldn't because of sunday. shops are closed earlier than usual.High school students are staying higher level room but it's a lower level room for me. It was dissapointed for me without up grade the room. I'll choose waikiki area for the next.

Convenient location close to major shopping outlets and the Hawaii Convention Center. The rooms are always clean and comfortable. Staff is courteous and very helpful. The Starbucks in the lobby is great.

I love your hotel.☺️..did not care for the room this time around. Next time I will ask fora description of the room. Service was great.. There was a noise coming from the miniRefrigerator that kept me up till I figured out what was going on.

No frills, clean, friendly hotel. Check-in was easy and receptionist was very friendly and welcoming. A little confused on how to use the elevator, but staff were quick to help and explain. Great location!

I am using Ala Moana Hotel for its convenience to the shopping center, pleasant atmosphere and am familiar with it for decades. I like the fact that I don’t have to go into the heart of Waikiki and confront more traffic and congestion than necessary. Walking across to the shopping center is very convenient as it eliminates the time and bother of jockeying for a parking spot especially during the Christmas season.

We had reservations for one night, standard room. When we arrived only an upgraded room with a lanai was available and they gave it to us no additional charge. The woman who checked us in was very friendly and informative.The room was just large enough for a king bed, a small sleep sofa and a comfortable easy chair, along with a dresser. Almost immaculately clean and very inviting. The elevators were clean and fast and the common areas were bright and comfortable with lots of seating.We used all three restaurants and reviewed hem separately.

You should offer a VIP program for frequent visitors and a point program .I love the location and the large lobby although the rooms in Kono Tower are too small with no veranda come all the way to Hawaii should have a balcony . It is my 15 th stay and no VIP or point system all the local friends say your hotel should have one and there is so much price fluctuations booking online.

This is my second stay at the hotel. The first stay was excellent as I had a clean room with newer carpet, furniture, and fixtures. This time around the room seemed dated, the carpet was old and fraying, and the room smelled a little musty. The location is great but there was limited garage parking so you have to get back to the hotel to park before everyone does to find a spot. I love the fact that Starbucks is in the hotel. That helps make up for the room issues.

Overall fine stay. Would be great to get a teacher discount. Breakfast in plantation cafe was subpar for the price. Generally a fine stay, will be back for more school business and would be great if HI DOE employees got a discount.

room was excellent wheelchair service from your bell desk was fast and used it several times. Have stayed there many times . My only complaint is lack of room service and no meal service of any kind except for breakfast.

Handicap room has very good accessible bathroom. Getting into room from corridor is a little difficult. Carpeted area by elevator makes pushing wheelchair a little difficult. The valet service is excellent, very helpful in assisting with wheelchair. Front desk staff very friendly.

Location for shopping, across the car park for the Ala Moana mall and entry to Macy’s is fabulous! Rooms are small, but clean and tidy. Staff are friendly and helpful. Beds should be improved, too soft and bouncy.

Very nice hotel. Friendly staff. Wifi leaves a bit to be desired. Kept having to connect to different rooms. Decently cleaned. Booked an extra night due to our red eye flight and was given a credit. Very nice!

Great location. The rooms need a little upgrade. I didn't have bath towels when I first got there - had to call for them. Only one package of coffee. Should be at least two. Breakfast was nice. Walkable to park was great.

Great stay, I will be back soon. Quiet room, clean, and well kept. Very convient location and accessible to the Ala Moana Mall, there is a Starbucks in the lobby which is a plus too. The self parking is easy in and out and priced fairly. Lots to do nearby, central location.

Honestly couldn’t fault anything as the whole experience from check in to check out was brilliant. Room was small, but that suited me just fine. Highly recommended and I’ll definitely be booking them next time I’m back and for even longer!

Fantastic and very helpful staff. Allowed us to check in very early after a long flight which was great. Lovely view from the balcony. A large selection of breakfast options so you can't go hungry. Would stay again.

Signature Steak House has a great HH until 7 pm. But no place on site for lunch. Can walk across the parking lot to the mall but something inside the hotel would be convenient-even just a deli for salads and sandwiches.

checking in was quick and painless. the front desk agent friendly and efficient.valet service was excellent, quick and friendly.wish the breakfast buffet could start at least 1/2 hour earlier to accommodate those who have to be on the road early to fight the morning traffic.

Access to shopping as well as mobility to reach other parts of the island when visiting family and friends is my reason for choosing this hotel for overnight trips or three day weekends. Access to routes to reach all parts of the island is easy.

We stayed in a 2bd room suite which was wonderful and very roomy. We did have paranormal activity in our room... front door opening, sounds and a shadow (up to you if you want to believe me or not. Both my friend and I saw and heard the same things).

This was a very short stay but overall very nice. Pleased with everything overall except the restaurant was so busy we could not get in for breakfast. Wanted to try it but maybe next time. Hopefully we can come back soon.

From the time I valet my vehicle to when I checked into the Ocean View Suite, service from staff was excellent and on point. The only thing I was a little disappointed with was the actual size of the suite. The pictures of the suite online made the room appeared more spacious than seeing it in person. If you’re able to see the room before renting it out, I highly suggest doing that first.

Room was small but adequate. Noisy too but it was over the mall parking lot so what could really be done. Thought it would be tight for 2 people. check out was easy - over the phone. front desk did not explain that I needed the key card for the elevator. another guest told me why i couldn't get the elevator to work.

Hotel was clean, and the atmosphere was relaxing. Room was a nice size I liked the large extra chair that doubled as a bed if needed. It was nice returning to a clean room after being out all day. Loved the partial view of the ocean. Next time will try to get a room with a balcony. Staff friendly and smiling. The location was great 2 blocks from Ala Moana Beach Park and right across from the Ala Moana Mall. We did not eat at the hotel chose to eat local, love the print out of local places to eat.

On arrival valet and front desk performed great customer service. The room we stayed was very clean and safe condition. Overall it was a great memorable experience of Aloha. Mahalo Evangeline, Don Kane

i stay here when i am in town for business. was not happy with my room location (or cleanliness) on this trip. i had requested a room on a higher floor but was placed on the 5th floor in the Kona Tower. there must have been some sort of water breach - as there was a high-powered blower in the carpet in the hallway about 30 feet from my room. my room was fine, but there was hair in the tub and the ceiling above the sink was dirty...

There was a mix up with our room. Someone’s things were still in there when we entered and it took them 2 hours to figure it our and get us another room. We were late to a wedding because we had no room to get ready in!

would be nice if there was bottle water in the room or on the floor, like a vending machine.and I'm not sure if there was room service and menu of some kind.First time staying in Ala Moana Hotel and must say just the sleep was good.

Beautiful clean hotel, conveniently located in the heart of town. One can easily walk to the beach or Ala Moana Shopping Center or take a cab or trolley anywhere. The staff is friendly and helpful. Dining is a pleasure from wallet-pleasing breakfast to delicious cuisine and snacks and Starbucks in between. I highly recommend the Ala Moana Hotel.

Great hotel with wonderful Amengor! All major tours are picked up from this hotel and it a short walk next door to the largest mall on island!On site is a Starbucks, shops and reasonable price grocery store!The staff was awesome and catered to my every need!

Don't Stay in Ala Moana Hotel by Mantra, the room small and was infested with Bed Bugs, Management did not care or seem apologetic about circumstances. Spoke to Management after the incident and all that was done was file a report and then they hung up the phone.

Great customer service. Staff very friendly and helpful. Room is Clean and comfortable everything you need is provided. Location is great, could walk to shopping and restaurants. Will definitely stay there again.

My family enjoyed there stay even though it was for a couple of nights. Area is convenient, we walked to Ala Moana to do some shopping. My family came down for my Grandfathers funeral, we were thankful for an early check in.

Everything is always great there . It’s the Hotel I choose when I need to come to Honolulu. Just wished The Plantation Cafe served lunch and /or there was room service due to medical reasons I usually am there for and can’t always go to Ala Moana shopping Center

The lobby is big, the front desk staff is atypically cold not your usual waikiki hotel type of friendly. Rooms are of average size but can be noisy in the corridor. The only big plus for this hotel is its location next to the Ala Moana Mall. The airconditioning unit in 1001 was noisy and erratic in temperature. Bathroom had a strange smell and is small.

Enjoyed the stay overnight. I especially liked the location of the hotel. The room was very nice with a great view. Did not eat at any of the restaurants since it was an overnight stay. I am sure there are good restaurants in the hotel. I will definitely use this hotel in the future.

Overall your hotel rooms are cleaned well, however, the room need to be updated for a fresher and brighter appearance. The bathroom fixtures could use some upgrading. Your employees are excellent with customer service. Location is very centralized and convenient for my shopping needs.

Climate control in my two rooms was almost non-existent. Would have been more comfortable sleeping by the pool. Rooms were too hot and too humid to make sleeping comfortable. If you can't adjust the temperature and/or humidity, get some fans.

Love this place and hope to return soon. Staff so friendly and helpful. Despite being in a wheelchair, my wife was treated with so much aloha that she was able to enjoy our short stay and talks about returning soon.

This suite was perfect for my purposes. I came to Oahu to have Cataract Surgery, and had to have a companion. We needed our own Bedroom and Bath. The view from the 33rd floor was beautiful, I hope I can get back under different circumstances so that i can stay longer and enjoy the suite all the amenities of the Ala Moana.

Great location/comfortable rooms/great staff! Great proximity to the mall/shops/restaurants/ ala moana park. I do the Honolulu triathlon every year & this my go to hotel for accommodations. Look forward to my next visit!

The staff was very friendly, our room was upgraded to a spacious room with a view, and it was very convenient to Ala Moana Shopping Center. We have stayed here several times and find the rates reasonable for Kama'ainas.

Friendly & helpful staff. Close to everything. Starbucks in the lobby and an easy walk to the Ala Moana Shopping Center; what more do you need? Already booked my next stay for March 9th - the Truck Fest is coming to town!

very good location because of Chabad and very convenient to so much of what we did on the island/ great location for trip pick ups and close to mall for shopping. near Target for food chopping andstaff was helpful. thank you for your good service.

We always enjoy the Ala Moana Hotel. And with the Kama’aina special of free parking, even better! The only thing is that the parking lot gets overcrowded when events happen at Rumours.Location is perfect close to restaurants and shopping.

Despite the mishap that happened to get to the room, we've had a great experience where we simply liked the amount of space there was, the amount of beds and bathrooms, and the view was nice on the outside.

When I called to make the reservation, the operator or receptionist kept transferring me to someone who could make the reservation, but no one was answering. I had to call back a few times. Also, the lady who made my reservation sounded annoyed on the phone and hung up after I said thank you. The air condition wasn't getting cold in our room(HUGE DISSAPOINTMENT), we were sweating just sitting in there during the day and at night we didn't need a blanket. I have stayed at this hotel only a handful of times, but this is probably the last stay for me and my family at this hotel. We live here in Hawaii and expected to have a better experience for our weekend staycation.

The location was close to everything, shopping, beach, nightlife. First thing I notice when I walked in the room was it was so clean and shiny. I guess the hotel is very popular there was actually a line to check in. The front desk was fast and friendly, just a lot of people checking in.

Check in and the room was ok although the male that checked me in had NO PERSONALITY which I could deal with being it was only for a few mins... My husband and I went to bed after our party at Rumours everything was ok. I woke up early to call the front desk to ask if we would be able to get a late check out which we did but was RUDELY awaken by housekeeping! I was VERY UPSET as we were sleeping and wanted late checkout so we could sleep in for a bit longer

awsom stay, beautiful views, terrific people, terrific rooms. and terrific club (rumors wish it wasn't closing) perfect location , beautiful beach right next to the alamoana shopping center, and close to Waikiki,

This hotel is affordable and a great place to stay. It is not right on the beach, but it is one block from the beach. It is also connected to the Ala Moana Mall with great shopping and places to eat. It is at the gateway to Waikiki if you want more night life activities. It is the only place I stay when I visit O`ahu.

Not happy that rumours was closing. Too crowded for us to get it. Room was small. Ac was not cold, it was cool but never cold. A guest made rude comments to us in the restaurant. Requested a king bed and got 2 full instead.

Service and staff were good or great. Location is the key to your Hotel that we appreciate.I ended up needing to stay an extra day and appreciate that I was accommodated. I just wish that the price was better as times are hard for us living here in Hawaii but still need to do things in Honolulu with out commuting back and forth every day when family comes to visit us. Locals need a break !!!

Perfect location - very close to everything - airport , Waikiki, Ala Moana mall . Great service from your front desk personnel who gave us option even on late night. Very friendly parking attendants as well

The air conditioner in our room did not reflect the setting on the thermostat. Upon returning during the day the room did not feel cool. Even in the evening, my children slept without the blanket on. Thank you

The staff were very kind and timely in responding to any request we made. The facility had a Starbucks, shops, and restaurants within the building. I enjoyed the easy-access pedestrian ramp to the mall near the hotel.

I received impeccable customer service at the front desk each time I went and spoke to someone. My room was equipped with all the necessities and it was very nice. The only comment I have is that the A.C. was not cold. Although the thermostat displayed that the room was 65 degrees, as someone who lives in the mountains, I know that it was incorrect. The room was warm and it made it uncomfortable to sleep in.

Reception as always was very good, the room was clean when we arrived,which I like the most because I don’t like house keeping during our stay. The only thing that disappoint me was we saw the housekeeping person twice at the floor alley but she never greeted nor smiled to us,leaving us the feeling of being unwelcome. Unlike our stay last year housekeepers always greeted us..I hope next time will be like the first time. I see again soon

I have been to Hawaii 6 times and each time have visited the mall for some retail therapy - best mall ever as it is open to the sky, has a range of shops and attractions and good food possibilities. The hotel is attached to one end of it and accessible from a walkway over the car park to Macy's. It you are wanting close proximity to the mall then there is no better place to be. Personally, I prefer Waikiki itself and then uber to the mall but this is also close to the Ala Moana beach which is great although it doesn't have loungers/umbrellas to rent. It is the place the real Hawaiians go on a Sunday. The hotel is a large hotel that does the job, if the job is to be near the mall and not pay an arm and a leg to do it. My only criticism is the pool which could be so easily upgraded for easy and safe access ie it is like my school pool was with no steps into the pool for children or older/less active people - only the metal ladder type steps that are quite difficult for those pre-mentioned swimmers to use, especially in the 9' deep end where one descends into the depths. It would not be a difficult fix to put in concrete steps for easy access and for little children there is no real swimming area. It was clean and well appointed although i am not sure that I was in Hawaii - could have been anywhere in a big hotel. However would stay again under the circumstances.

Great place to stay! Very convenient to great places to eat and shopping. Close to meeting locations for business in Honolulu. Not quite in Waikiki but close enough without spending too much time in traffic.

My room was small, like an efficiency apartment/unit. It was comfortable. Bathroom very small, hard to move around in. There was no ice machine on my floor. I was there when the Missle Alert went off and when I called the Front Desk there were unsure of what Guests should do. Told me they think I should go to the parking garage.... Room was quite expensive even with a Kamaina discount, 2 nites for a total of $375.....

The service was great. The front desk clerks were nice and helpful. They were quick and efficient. They explained it quickly and precise. The room was clean and neat. The bed was comfortable.. Thank you.

I rated the sleep quality average due to the night I stayed the winds were horrendous and it created a lot of noise all night long so I didn't get any sleep. Not sure what can be done about this but it was really sad that I couldn't enjoy the nice suite.

The Ala Moana Hotel is right in the middle of the best shopping mall around. The hotel is very nice and clean with comfortable beds. This hotel is our go to when travelling to Honolulu. Be sure to try the breakfast buffet at the Plantation Cafe.

Great location, friendly staff and great food at Plantation and Signature. Sad to see the Chinese Restaurant is gone.Improvements need to be done on Credit Card Authorization for group reservations. Hope to stay there soon

We always stay here when we come to shop! It’s close to shopping which we love. Rooms are always clean, service is friendly and helpful, and we love that we can just walk to Ala Moana! Would like to get a better deal as kama’aina, but regardless we’ll always come to this place. It’s comfortable, clean and convenient.

The morning was crazy due to the false missile threat. The hotel was prepared to get rooms cleaned for the arriving check-ins. My room was ready and in time for my friends to attend a fundraiser at Rumours. Sad to see Rumours leaving. Hope a similar nightclub replaces this area. Good location with the shopping center next door. Room met my expectations. Encourage others to checkout this hotel. Need more info on Mantra membership around the hotel.

Uncomfortable bedOutdated roomsRequested King and got queenQueen to small for wife and IWould recommend better mattress and updating roomsRooms seemed very old and datedThe location is great with the mall right there and the value used to be better for Kamaina local rate but with the increase rate can stay Waikiki for same if not lower

Front Desk was helpful and Friendly. Lobby was clean and spacious. Room service was very good Location was great with ala moana shopping center and food court. Good walking distance to ala moana beach park.

The check-in queue was so horrendously long that I had 2 milk shakes from Starbucks. It was even longer when I finally joined the queue.In a stroke of brilliance, at this peak period, 2 of the 6 clerks at reception rostered off.When I finally received my room card, some 75 minutes later, I entered my assigned room only to find a darkened room with a sleeping woman inside! SO much for security!!! I had been given access to an already occupied room.The upside is that the hotel is handy to the Ala Moana Shopping Centre.The added bonus is The check-in queue was so horrendously long that I had 2 milk shakes from Starbucks. It was even longer when I finally joined the queue.In a stroke of brilliance, at this peak period, 2 of the 6 clerks at reception rostered off.When I finally received my room card, some 75 minutes later, I entered my assigned room only to find a darkened room with a sleeping woman inside! SO much for security!!! I had been given access to an already occupied room.The upside is the pool supervisor. From memory, his name is Thomas and he was an absolute gem. He was friendly, personable, extremely knowledgeable about the islands and her beaches. Possibly the nicest local who I have met over my years of regular and prolonged trips to Hawai'i and Kaua'i.

Great location bridge from hotel connects to shopping center making it an easy walk to the shopping center. Your hotel key card was is needed for elevator access as well as gym and pool which was a very nice added security. Make sure your hotel key card does not come into contact with your cellphone and credit cards for it will void out your key card. I suggest the hotel staff warn customers when checking in. I had to get a new key card and that was then that I was told about not placing it next to my cellphone or credit cards.

Loved the hotel and the customer service was great, asked for late check out but they told us to call back the next day, didn't call back and we didn't end up needing it. A little pricey for a small room that we got.

Spacious room, comfortable beds. Loved the fitness center; equipment, steam, sauna, and nice outdoor pool. Staff is friendly and great. Had a minor plumbing issue that was taken care of immediately. Excellent Maid and Valet Service. Great shopping and food at the Ala Moana Shopping Center on level 2.

We come to your hotel about 4 times a year, taking at least 2 rooms or more. The service we receive from your staff is always excellent! Everyone, from bell hops, check-in, check-out, luggage......everyone is always greeting us with a smile.

Always my first choice in Honolulu...clean/modern rooms, convenient location...staff always nice...Starbucks and the happy hour at Signature Steakhouse are really good...my regular stays will alway be at this property...

Can't beat Ala Moana for the friendliest and most accommodating hotel for locals on O'ahu.They understand that we want value for our money. It's centrally located next to the largest mall in the State. There are many opportunities to enjoy within walking distance.

Outstanding customer service received by Joe at the front desk. Excellent hotel accommodations and very convenient to the shopping mall. Kamaaina room specials are good. Easy online booking. Would recommend to family and friends. Definitely booking again in the next month. Thank you Ala Moana Hotel by Mantra.

We booked this for our son's robotics team. The rooms had everything we needed from a frig, to coffee maker. Also the property has a Starbucks right in the lobby. The parking is good if the hotel is slow, but if there's a wedding or major function going on in the ballrooms or Rumors, then PARKING SUCKS! It was also chaotic getting through the lobby because folks are standing in line for Rumors and another line of folks for hotel check in. We had a great corporate rate through my husband's company and it came with 50% off for breakfast so we had a full buffet breakfast for $9/adult. That is awesome.

Check in time should be improved, the wait time was almost 1 hour and not sure if this is normal time for checkin. We were disappointed that the plantation coffee shop was closed early. There is not much place to eat in the hotel.

Great hotel, nice staff. Clean rooms, mostly quiet except nearby construction which is not their fault. The lobby starbucks is fantastic, wonderful staff and unusual choices (wine and dinner options). I highly recommend the location based upon my stay.

We felt we got good value for our stay. We liked the location near Ala Moana Mall. We were staying after my wife’s surgery. It would have helped a lot to have room service available as she could not leave the room.

The hotel room was clean (room service a little inconsistent), staff was welcoming (although the concierge was too busy to answer a question), easy walk to beaches, restaurants and shops. The hotel is nice, a very good choice if on a budget.

Perfect location for the hotel. Walking distance to Ala Moana Shopping Center, restaurants, etc.Staff is exceptional and the hotel is spotless. The restaurant offers a excellent buffet breakfast and the The Signature Prime Steak & Seafood is located on the 36th floor of the hotel with its panoramic views. The food is rated 5 stars in my opinion.What more can one ask?

Room was very modern and it was an easy 5 minute walk across the parking lot to the Ala Moana shopping center. Room was very modern and spacious and had the nice comforts of a refrigerator and microwave. There was a $25/day valet fee, $20/day self park, which is pretty much the standard for hotels in Honolulu. If you need a room with two beds, you need to stay in the Waikiki tower. The Kona tower only has one bed. We were on the 30th floor in the Waikiki tower with an ocean view. The view of the city and ocean were amazing!

This hotel is within walking distance to Ala Moana Beach Park. The water is just as beautiful as in the Waikiki Area. My husband and I don't care much about the nightlife so this was the perfect spot. However, it was a nice walk to Waikiki. Make sure to stop at the river park next to the hotel on your way to or back from Waikiki beach. The hotel is also next to the island's largest mall so it was nice walking around there and also for quick bites at the mall's food court. They have a Jollibee there!! (Only Filipinos would understand my excitement for Jollibee haha). The room was neat and tidy. Bed was comfortable, pillows were soft and nice. Bathroom was a good size, very clean too. The hotel has a roof top pool that we didn't get to use but we did go up there to watch the sunset. It also has its own fitness center. There is a Chinese restaurant in it as well as a club (I think), entrance by the lobby. Staff was very friendly especially the ladies at the concierge desk. We would totally stay here again and we recommend to all family and friends.

Well located, bright hotel with friendly staff excellent views of waterfront, close to beach, nice work-out room, rooms are clean, basic size withe bar fridge, microwave and free easily accessible wireless internet

Overall just an average hotel, very friendly staff, not bad on cleanliness, but barely basic quality and supply of bathroom accessories. Liked the location of this hotel, close to Ala Moana beach which is a lot quieter than overcrowded Waikiki.

I stayed here with family and friends for 4 nights. Upon arrival we were quite shocked at the age and fit out of the rooms. Having just come from a lush hotel in Las Vegas this was most definitely a downgrade. The rooms do have everything you need but they are aging and dated. We had a small problem with our toilet but the reception did get it fixed for us. The view from our room was really depressing, a concrete car park.Ultimately if you want to be right next to the huge shopping Centre next door this is where you want to be. The shop is huge and has lots of choice for food so it’s not a bad place to be. If I came back I wouldn’t stay here again, I would be near the beach. The one thing that was AMAZING was the restaurant on the 36th floor. The food was Devine!

The hotel is within walking distance of the Ala Moana shopping center and many other shopping attractions as well as the beach. There is a full breakfast included in the price, not just a continental breakfast—very good, but that was a special offer. Valet parking is available at a reasonable rate. One downside is noisy construction currently going on early in the morning.

Air conditioner in my room didn't properly cool room, took over 3 hours for it to get a little cool. Shower filled up while bathing. Booked bed & breakfast unfortunately we were unable to eat. We were turned away for being a few minutes late. Asked if we could make a plate with was left on the line and was told no we're closed last seating is 10:00 am and workers were just staring yo remove items off if the buffet. Worst first experience at this hotel and I was with family to celebrate my birthday.

I wish I would have taken pictures of the room, but you will just have to take my word for it. The hotel is older, but overall the room was great. Starbucks in the lobby has a happy hour starting at 2pm. (YES THEY SELL BEER!!!!) the 36th floor has this amazing restaurant with an AMAZING view. They also have a happy hour. The hotel also has a night club. I didn't go but that's because my stay was short and I had my kids. You are right next door to the Ala Moana Mall and let me tell you ITS BIGGGGGG!!! I think you need 3 days to see everything in that mall. The walk to the beach is like 10 mins if that and the hotel will give you towels to take to the beach. Overall I have to say that my stay was nice. The hotel was within my price range and when I go back I will look for a room here.

Ala Moana Hotel is the perfect hotel to stay at on Oahu for all purposes. The hotel has excellent customer service, the staff is friendly, the rooms are great, the gym and fitness center is perfect with a great variety of cardio and strength equipment, the hotel easy to find, and close to Ala Moana Center.

Well appointed, spacious and clean rooms. Decor was dated, but well maintained. Sofa bed is excellent quality. Starbucks in lobby which can be convenient. Well located to shopping, restaurants and beach. Would return.

It’s a beautiful hotel, clean and beautiful. The room is very comfortable and the cleanliness was great. Also, the breakfast was worth it. They have many options to choose from and they are all delicious! Great service overall. Thank you.

Typical below average mantra. Not sure why anyone would stay here, not close to the beach, average food and beverage and conveniences. Out of the way. Average rooms. No body wash have to use a cheap bar of soap.

.It has been great. I have stayed at Ala Moana Hotel 5 times since September of 2017 and every time I have been there. Your staff has been very courteous and friendly. I will certainly recommend Ala Moana to all my friends and coworkers. Thank You

Stayed over night. celebrated my birthday at rumors. Wish kamaaina rates where a little less and also wish had late check outs like some other hotels that i always rent at. Other then that staff where very nice. Sad to see and hear that rumors is closing. i will be back. Thank You.

Everything was perfect. The only thing I didn’t like was the parking,which you have to pay 20$/day. But the cleanliness,working staff and food is amazing over there. The location is great. I’ll recommend it to another people,definitely.

I stayed here for two days. The breakfast buffet was massive and fresh. Lots of lovely fruit for me and piles of bacon and eggs for my boyfriend. The rooms/hallways smelled nice. It may seem odd but so often hotels in the tropics smell a bit like mold. I stayed in 3 different hotels on this trip and this was the only one that didn’t smell like mold.

Left my review on the first page. To long to write again. But overall my stay was miserable. Paid for my room and I felt like we had to walk on egg shells. When we weren't that loud. Our neighbors kept complaining and security kept coming then threatened us that we would have to leave. AC wasn't working good and toilet was wobbly. You guys should look into heated pools. Who can enjoy a swim in a freezing cold pool.

Took my bags early so I could begin looking for an apartment that day. Easily picked up the bags without an issue. Did the same when I had to go to work and watched my bags till I returned (once again with ease). Only draw back was how busy the elevators were during the holiday, which I understand the congestion, just wish they had some stairs I would of gladly taken.

This hotel is near the Convention Centre that's why it is there. 15 minutes from the main Beach, but next door to the large Ala Moana Shopping Centre that's its feature.The shopping centre is large but not that well priced, the out let centre in Hawaii 25minutes away is well priced. Hotel was OK, clean and respectable .

bed's were to small for a family of four. room was small for traveling with luggage, no utensils at all in rooms. Staff were accommodating.however phone in room didn't work and room service failed to deliver due to motel not corresponding.

Large hotel with Starbucks below and Ala Moana shops next door. Rooms are clean but small and average condition. Large well equiped gym and pool area. Staff are friendly and helpful. Reasonably priced for quality.

We found hair in the bath tub and ceiling of the bathroom, one of our pillowcase was stained. However, the housekeeper came to our room quick enough. The person who helped us at the front desk was very friendly and helpful. Overall, the experience was good.

Rooms were very clean. Pool area was clean. Staff were all super friendly and helpful. Proximity to Ala Moana Centre and public transportation was very convenient. Restaurant on property was too expensive for regular meals, but the restaurants and food court at Ala Moana were close enough. Line ups for the elevator were excessive at times (20 min) which was frustrating. Line ups for the concierge were also Excessive and given the holiday season, there should have been extra staff. We ended up using a concierge from another hotel!Overall, the cleanliness of rooms, friendliness of staff and convenience to public transportation (no need for a car), I would certainly recommend this hotel.

Everything you need is within walking distance and the staff was courteous and helpful. It really is a highly recommendable family hotel. My only concern is not being able to reserve the exact rooms I want in advance since they are subject to availability when you check in. Big families like mine are given different floor assignments which is quite annoying when visiting the other rooms and waiting for the elevators especially during New Year's eve when there long lines and elevators were slow to arrive. Aside from that, our stay was most enjoyable and we'll be back this 2018!

My car was parked in valet upon bringing me my car the glovebox was opened and the paperwork all over front seat only the loose change taken. No apparent break in so either they left car unlocked or someone with key access went into car.

We had asked for an interconnecting room or a room beside my other family members, the room to have a balcony and the room to have 2 single beds and I did not receive any of these. I had contacted staff quite a few times before we arrived in Hawaii to ensure that we would get a room with these features and then when my family came to the desk after waiting in a huge line they said unfortunately we couldn't receive any of these even after we paid and was told we would get these things. I ended up having to sleep on the 'couch' which was extremely hard, small and uncomfortable where my feet were hanging off the end. I only received a single thin blanket and no extra pillows for the couch. Then we also had toilet issues where on one occasion it had completely flooded the bathroom and rest of the room and despite being told that a plumber would come and fix the problem, it was never fixed and the water in the toilet kept rising to the top every time we used it and it did not flush properly, and after asking for the room to be mopped up and cleaned my family was told by staff that it happens quite frequently and is worse because they recently changed some piping. The carpet was wet for quite a while and also smelled. I did like the theme and the colours of the room, the location is fantastic, the Starbucks is great however the other café is not that good and overpriced (same as the restaurant on the top floor). One of the security staff was also quite rude and felt like he was being slightly racist. It was obvious because one night we were coming back and I saw he let in many of the Asian people staying at the hotel without checking their room cards or questioning them, but as soon as my family walked through to the lifts he angrily persisted to check our room cards. It made us feel very discriminated and was very embarrassing. The lines for checking in are shocking, not sure if that is because not enough staff are on. The pool closes way too early, could not enjoy going for a swim late at night after coming back from shopping. The pictures make the rooms look much bigger than they are. The rooms are actually quite small. Thank gosh they have free wifi because that was the only good thing. I think they could have had more Christmas decorations, they had a beautiful tree in the middle but that was it, and the rooms were clean. The biggest bonus and reason why I would stay again is only because the hotel is right beside one of the best shopping centre in Oahu and it is easy to grab dinner from the amazing restaurants at the top of the centre. It is not close to the beach or water but it only cost about 10-12$ for a taxi ride down to Waikiki Beach. They also have good bus services that can take you to the outlet mall and tours etc. They do not have a good variety of activities thou (example to see 4 museums at pearl harbour it cost about 200$+ per person) and so they did seem overpriced, so I recommend you book and find activities and tours online and then check if they can pick you up from the hotel.

DO NOT STAY HERE!! DO NOT VALET or even park a car here!! Cost me an EXTRA $458! No self parking was open and I was forced to valet my rental car. I was called at 8am the following morning by security telling me that my back window was broken out in the valet lot. I called PD and filed a report since there was “no video surveillance” and the hotel HR told me they were sorry and would take care of it. The rental car company took down all the hotels information and a month later I got a bill for $458! I told the rental company the hotel assumed responsibility since they told me verbally they would use their insurance and i literally had to give them my vehicle regardless of a choice for the night. The hotel NEVER responded. The rental company and I left over 15 messages for a manager on duty and emails with ZERO RESPONSE!! I have had to pay the EXTRA $458 to my stay and there’s not even anyone willing to apologize or offer any help or compensation after they ASSURED me it would be taken care of since it was their fault. I have NEVER had such a terrible experience with a hotel or lack of guest consideration in all the places I’ve traveled! ABSOLUTELY unbelievably terrible guest service and inconsiderate management that won’t even contact me after months. I followed everything I was told to do to ensure I wouldn’t be responsible for the $500 of damage that was out of my control and they told me it would be taken care of.

Our stay was very brief and very worth the price. Everything made available to us was easily accessable and being right next to the Ala Moana Center made going to the store easy. The staff was very attentive and helpful if we had any questions or concerns. Would definitely recommend if you’re looking for a high quality hotel in the perfect spot!

My husband had surgery, they accommodated us through out our stay. Very easy to get food from store down stairs as well as access to Ala Moana Center and Don Quijote..Will be back in 2018 for another surgery procedure.Thank you so much.

The hotel is in a good place, right across Ala Moana Beach and Ala Moana Center (shopping mall). It‘s quite close to Waikiki (walking distance). The room was a little small, but except that very nice and clean. Sometimes it took quite a while for the elevator to arrive, but I think they said that one of the six was broken and needed repair.

rent a car and use hotel as waikiki base. i do not have more to say other that it worked for us. we used ala moana as a base for other activities we planned. registration lines were not overwhelming.!

Nice location with comfy and clean room pretty much central to all the attractions of Honolulu. Definitely recommend to all. How ever please be aware of the room type call hotel and make sure. The picture doesn’t tell the real thing about the area inside the room. Average breakfast and poor front desk service.
user_name:
A M Asif I
Sydney, Australia

review_body: The AC stopped working at 10pm. I notified the front desk and a technician came up in 10 minutes. He fixed the problem temporarily. In the middle of the night, the AC stopped working again. I managed to make it run again. Somehow, I think the bearings inside were grinding something. It was so noisy that I had a hard time falling asleep.

There was friendly staff, behind counter and at the bell. They offered excellent service. Room service was also good. Best of all is the location. It is easy to stroll to the beach, to the shopping centre and to catch the bus anywhere.

There are two reasons we come to Honolulu. Sun, beaches and warm weather. The location of your hotel is the best solution to our needs. Shopping for groceries at the mall, access to Ala Moana Park beaches and the beaches at Hilton Hawaiian Village. You have it all.

Our stay at the Ala Moana was at the end of our Hawaii holiday. The Hotel could not be faulted for cleanliness and staff assistance. Access to the Ala Moana shops is from 2nd floor, so very convenient. The 6 lifts however were a nightmare with queues to go up and down. Not a lot of walk along bars, restaurants at this end, but still a nice spot close to the beach. We had ocean views, but you can hear the traffic from the room. Cost wise for what we got, we did better at our other hotel and condo in Hawaii.

Only the second review I have ever written. Part of the hotel is owned by some company called LSI. They charge for an extra bar of soap and then you don’t get it anyway. Be forewarned this is a 100% scam. If you read this and stay here anyway it’s on you.

The hotel is nice, prices are reasonable and the service is good. The rooms could use a bit of a more modern touch to them and central lighting but the overall features are fine. The best about the hotel is the location close to Waikiki beach.

Close to Ala Moana Centre + easy access to activities. Great value. Rooms are clean and staff were friendly + helpful. We were able to get an early check-in after long flight which was appreciated. Highly recommended.

For the second time in two years I have been treated with rudeness by hotel staff. On Christmas Day while waiting for the Signature restaurant to open, I attempted to report no TP in the lobby rest room. I was rudely told by desk staff to go stand in line. Incident #2: In July of last year while attending a convention, I was told by staff that I could not sit outside one of the rooms because I wasn’t staying in the hotel! When I tried to report this to a manager, HE was rude to me and took no action to correct. Would NOT recommend this hotel for friends or any conventions

A restful few days shopping, restaurants and movies on the island. Hotel is close to all facilities. Security is very good and easy to take Uber or taxi anywhere you’d like. Hotel rooms are small but clean and comfortable.

The front desk is out right rude. The best test of customer service is how you treat the guests during the busiest times. The representatives are loud and rude and need to be taught how to be polite. We were a party of 10 with three rooms and the desk was pretty rude in answering our basic questions. Given we had arrived late the front desk was unwilling to give even an hour of late check out. Clearly they know that Hawaii is not about repeat business and customers may not show up often. Why treat a customer nicely if you are never going to see them again.

Over all good stay. It is my go to hotel when in Honolulu. But, urine all over the toilet seat upon check in is not right. Service was a little disappointing. Front desk did put us in a better room, however first impression is everything. Kind of put a sour feeling in my stomach.

Convenient for access to the Ala Moana Center. The rooms are clean and comfortable.Staff's correspondence at check-in was very good.　I would like to stay at Ala Moana Hotel next time as well. This time it was a mountain view room, but I would like to stay at the ocean view room next time.

I place to relax and unwind.. Too bad Rumours closing.. That’s where I met my wife.. we celebrated our Anniversary.. After we rented a room to recover from partying.. Also to go shopping at Ala Moana Center..

Everything was perfect except we had issue with the breakfast voucher on our first day. We booked through Click Frenzy and we were told the breakfast was included but we were told it was not right when we checked in. The staff are very friendly and the location is perfect. The view is great too. So overall we are very happy.

Housekeeping staff very helpful, as were all except one cafe hostess who just did not get it that my husband was trying to buy a takeout meal for me as i was very ill in our room. Another hostess "got it" and was very helpful.. Plantation Cafe standards going down. Cracked serving pieces (not safe to use), improperly cleaned plates. Had to really look through the plates to find a clean plate the mornings we ate there. They may not be part of the hotel, but they reflect on it as that is where people who stay at Ala Moana generally eat breakfast. We were disappointed with them this trip as we have stayed at Ala Moana and eaten breakfast there almost every trip for years.

Room was adequate. Bed could have been larger but for a single person it was fine. Room was clean, with clean linens. Having Starbucks in the lobby is a convenience. Lobby was clean as well. Stayed at hotel to do some Christmas shopping at the mall and attend a party.

This is a very good hotel for the location and price. It's right next to a big shopping mall and within walking distance to Waikiki beach. The Starbucks on the 1st floor was an added bonus for me. The staff were very friendly and helpful. I never had any problem finding a parking spot in their parking garage (for $20/day).

Clean, within walking distance of everything, and no fuss check-out system. The only thing I would recommend is that the pillows provided are a little too thick. I would like at least one pillow that is extremely thin so that I have options.

nice hotel, no free parking, but valet service, room had huge LCD tv, beds nice, bathroom clean, no room service for food, but starbucks in lobby, you can walk to the ala moana shopping center. nice view of ocean.

Great hotel, and very convenient. Staff were efficient and most helpful. We will be back. The convenience of hotel parking removed the parking competition in The Ala Moana Center, a huge plus. I don't know why you have a character limit.

Rooms are a little noisey, due to door opening and closing of other guests. It is not possible to close the door without making a clanking sound. It is no fault of the guests. Apart from that the rooms are excellent and the staff are very friendly and obliging.

Reasonably rated and conveniently located.Look for a special rates on specific online travel agents like Rakuten Travel. I got $89/night rate and even their front staff was surprised for the special rate.

The staff are friendly and the location is excellent. The rooms are clean, good square footage and offer great value by comparison to other hotels. If you would like to be near Ala Moana for a shopping adventure, this is the best location.

There was construction noise right outside our window and it started at 6am?We asked for and received earplugs, but we should have been too about the construction noise when we booked. The staff were quite courteous in providing support.

Very clean room the bed are comptable with a good ocean view. And very good customer service at the front desk. I feels liked I am walking with five star hotel. The location are great you can even walking to the mall.

Staff was consistently helpful and discreet. Room was well appointed and comfortable. View of the ocean was lovely. Location is convent to shopping at Ala Moana Center, the most luxurious mall in the islands, urban Honolulu and Waikiki. Free Parking.

The hotel is excellent and recommended.it’s near to the beach,unfortunately I forget the name of the beach and next to the shopping center -Mercy’s shopping center. The room is quite and I sleep well when I live here.

Room keys needed to be recoded numerous times and no they weren’t stored near a cell phone! Not just us met many people in the constant queues to get them replaced. This is a long process as security don’t want to know and there are always long queues at reception! The longest wait to get back into our room was 45 mins.Building two huge skyscrapers right outside our window so jack hammers from 7am till 530pm 6 days a week. Booked a king got a twin! Too few staff on reception and a pretty lazy grumpy manager when we complained about our repeated key issues! Overall it’s not been a great experience, my other reviews show I’m not a serial complainer and this place is just plain bad!

We always stay here when we visit because of it’s convenient location n it’s always clean n a The Ala Moana is a very nice place to stay, w great service n love their walkway that leads to the shopping center. Also great is the morning buffet which is also at a reasonable price.

Location and access from the airport is good. Shopping center and public beach are in close walking distance (a few minutes to the shopping center, around 10 minutes to the beach). Room cleaning and bed making were pleasant.

Room was way too small to be over $200! Bed was super tiny, looked like a twin size, but still comfortable. Bathroom had to be released by us, and the bathroom had bugs in it, nats to be exact. Good location, but won't be staying again.

Please advice to the restaurant for breakfast not to provide all main courses with pork related food like bacon, ham, etc. There are many muslim visitors in Hawaii who should be accommodated better. Tq

The hotel is located next to Ala Moana Shopping Center and a few minutes drive to Waikiki. Service is superb at the front desk and valet. They even upgraded my room. However, housekeeping seemed to have forgotten to clean my room, which was disappointing. Since I was checking out the next day, I did not bother calling housekeeping. I mentioned this to the front desk agent upon checkout. Other than Starbucks and the top floor, dining is limited. But, there are lots of restaurants nearby to suit your palate.

should have walked out of this hotel, I left comments at front desk, hallway much too cold which caused room to be much too cold, had to get extera blanket, and then purchased extra night clothing, bathroom door blocked entry to tub, when taking shower, the mirror fogged-up, I should receive a refund , as stated before, of some of the room cost

Best location to get around town and Waikiki; convenient and fairly easy to get in and out of lobby. Rooms are okay; bathrooms small but usually clean. On this stay, our bathroom was not as clean as normal; fingerprints around mirror frame, bits of trash on floor. Coffee cups were horrible...I realize that cups and glasses are cleaned with a sanitizing agent but nothing beats plain soap and water.

Friendly staff, good overall cleanliness. Breakfast in the Plantation Cafe next door can be booked on the room. Breakfast overall is okay. The bath equipment was good, but the room furniture needs a refreshment. The location is very good with short walks to Waikiki,the Ala Moana Shopping Mall and TheBus stops in all directions.

I spent 4 days staying at Ala Moana Hotel- so conveniently situated right next to the Mall and I walked to all the stores both inside the mall and all around it - great room overlooking the pool - this is my 5th time staying here - love it

A little more expensive, even with kamaaina rates but can't beat location for interisland getaway. Also really appreciate the lanai for fresh air. Courteous front desk, clean and easy to find out way around.

The Ala Moana hotel is located in a great location next to the shopping mall. It is easy access to bus routes, Ala Moana Park and beach. The hotel is in a safe location near many restaurants and services. The one bedroom suites are a great value if traveling with a family. The ocean front views are a nice option. I would recommend this hotel.

Property is clean and efficient. Nothing fancy but everything works, the staff is very pleasant, Starbucks in the Lobby. Close proximity to Ala Moana Shopping Center and easy location away from Waikiki but still close, makes this a wonderful choice. Kamaaina rates is a welcome and appreciated offering since property is well maintained without being too "frilly". Overnight parking is a bit on the high side.

My husband and I enjoyed our stay. We had a partial ocean view, which was very nice. The room was clean and updated. When we arrived, the hair dryer was missing. I called housekeeping and they brought one up right away. The hotel is conveniently located next to Ala Moana shopping center, where we ate awesome food and did our Christmas shopping! It is also walking distance to the Republik, a concert venue, which we went to one evening. Upon check-out, I left my phone in the room and security went right up and retrieved it for me! We will definitely stay again!

This hotel is great for shopping and small children. I like that it is outside of busy Waikiki and a scenic 45 minute walk if you want to enjoy the offerings there. It's easy to get a trolly or bus if you don't want to do the walk

Easy to get to Downtown and Sand Island for buisness. Starbucks iocation is great for a quick coffee and light bite to eat. Felt safe with the security checking for access to the elevators. Room location was very noisy.

Ala Moana is the perfect place to stay while on Oahu. Easy access in and out to any location. Perfect for any type of shopper. Great food selections right next door. Customer service was excellent. Valet drivers were quick and nice. Great value for anyone. Da best!!

Room temperature was set automatically and not adjustable. The room was cold. We stayed for three nights, and I got a cold because my body could not balance outside and room temperature. We requested blankets, but it didn't help.

Location mainly why I stay at the Ala Moana. But I had 2 issues during this past stay. Noise...Room are not sound proof. Each morning I was awaken at about 5 am by others slamming their doors shut or talking in the hallways. Other issue was at bell desk. My bags were not secured! They left them out in the open where anyone could have taken them! This happened upon check out. I was advised I could leave my bags with bell desk since my ride want arriving later. Very dissapointed

Perfect location near everything. Beds were worse ever, rooms need to be cleaned better. Maybe a upgrade to rooms and hotel would be great. Also maybe front desk staff needs a class on better customer service. They need to learn to treat everyone the same, not on how you look or from where you are from. Valet needs to be more on it and not just stand around when a vechile with the valet tag comes up the drive way, especially if I’m paying $25 a day for valet. They should be opening doors helping with luggage and creating people walking in the doors. This hotel needs a whole new managering staff that’s on their staff to do their job.

The Kamaaina (local) rate and the location is perfect for a weekend get away to do shopping and visit with friends and family. Driving on Nimitz makes it easy to get to the airport and avoid the traffic in Waikiki.

Called to book two rooms requesting the rooms to be on the same floor, side by side. Our request was complete. Best part was the Black Friday (BF) special. We called to make changes with no additional charges instead we received a discounted price from the BF special. We enjoyed our stay and took advantage of the fitness room and valet parking. Employees are very accommodating and friendly. We will recommend to family and friends and will return in the future.

My boy friend and I were only staying for two days and wanted a hotel closest to Straub hospital. The hospital was an easy 15-20 minutes away, which was a nice walk during the day. Loved that this hotel is next to the ala moana mall. Easy place to get food and do our Christmas shopping. Great stay overall and we will definitely recommend others to stay.

My sisters and I have been staying at the Ala Moana Hotel for several years now during the holiday shopping season. Convenience can't be beat! We can lug all our purchases back to the room and go out again. It's also good to be able to put our feet up and rest during the day in the comfort of a/c and tv. Microwave and mini-fridge are also great to re-heat and store our munchies!

Staff is always friendly and always willing to help. The staff there is like family to me I stay there so much. It is my home away from home. It is close to the mall and the rooms are comfortable just like home.

The staff was great and accommodating and our room was just as great. We loved the Kama'aina rates provided and to include breakfast was fantastic. We will definitely be back and recommend it to anyone!

I paid $200 to sleep in a room with roaches first time ever staying there it was disgusting I have photos I left the front desk know she just brushed it off so much customer service Called them twice yesterday to speak to a manager have not even talk to no one yet

My three night stay was comfortable. But one morning I was awakened by the sound of a power tool. I think they were cleaning the balcony window. I worked that evening feeling tired because of the disturbance. Other then that

Thank you to Justin who helped me at check in. Even though at the check in line was long and considering it was Honolulu Marathon weekend with all that people, he showed the aloha spirit and answered all of my questions with a smile.

Promised a queen size bed but stuck with two fulls. Didn’t have time to complain because check in staff was overwhelmed. We were shocked at the check in line and were ultimately late for our engagement

Stayed here for 10night and its excellent value for money and great location.Right next to Ala Moana Mall and across the road from the Ala Moana Park makes for an excellent location. The bus stop is right there at the Mall as well and so convenient to get to Waikiki. You can also go by taxi and its cheap about $10-12 dollars including tip in a big taxi. There is a Starbucks and also a little shop in the foyer of the hotel. These are both fantastic for quick coffees or if you want alcohol or any last minute souvenirs. Great location for Black Friday shopping so you can dump your shopping and go back for more. Has a washing machines and dryers for guests and this is 24/7 which is fantastic for a family of 5. The swimming pool my kids enjoyed 6 out of 10 days were there. There is a lifeguard and she is great. Thank you for great customer service and housekeeping was marvellous.I will always stay at Ala Moana and recommend to everyone.

This hotel has been a landmark for many many years. I last stayed here in 1972 and now it is just as clean and comfortable as then. It is close to shopping and all locations-by car, taxi or public transport.

For $160/night at the Kamaaina rate, I was very disappointed with the size of the room and the view. My view was a building that was under renovation...unit 1146. I also checked in on a Sunday, which is usually the day that people checks out. This being said, I was hoping to get a better room. It's sad to say that the "Kamaaina Rate" is really the worst rooms that are available. If this is the case, then the prices should be cheaper (I could have gone to the Ambassador Hotel for $100 and get a bigger room and better view than what I had on Sunday) and also, don't use the word Kamaaina any more. My experience made me feel that Kamaaina means "The people who deserves less". Anyway, this is just one man opinion and I will not be be coming back.

My business trip was quite comfortable thanks to the convenience of Ala Moana Hotel. Location next to Ala Moana allowed for shopping and dining and I was conveniently located near my meeting locale as well.

Pros:-The room comes with a refrigerator/freezer which is very uncommon in hotels in this area because due to the high levels of tourism, the idea is to have everyone eat out during their stay. - The staff is extremely polite and attentive. The two young men who helped me out at the front desk, Joe and Justin, were able to assist me during this visit with a smile, demonstrating the true meaning of Aloha. The manager, Daryl, was helpful when I needed it and the gentleman from housekeeping, who's name I never found out assisted me when I had a housekeeping issue. - Self parking is a plus, because I'm impatient and hate having to wait for someone to get my car when I'm ready to leave. - Location, it's great because it's just a short walk into Waikiki and connected to the largest outdoor mall on O'ahu. Cons:Cockroaches: On day 2 of being in my room, I found a cockroach on my ceiling. I've lived on O'ahu before so they're nothing new (when they're the large ones!) When you find the smaller/German cockroaches, there's not just one, there's hundreds or more. That same evening I found another cockroach on my dresser. As with the first I killed it and decided that I would notify the management the next day. When I notified the manager on duty, Daryl, it shocked me that he didn't seem too surprised by my discovery and had housekeeping sent to my room to clean it. (This is merely a band-aid because vacuuming the room will not rid it of my unwanted guests.) He agreed to me checking out more than a week early as well as refunding me, but only for the remaining days that I was supposed to stay. I was charged for the days that I'd already been there. When I got off the elevator to go up to meet the housekeeper, I found a cockroach crawling on the table in the hallway and then up the wall. The housekeeping manager was there and I showed it to him, his response was "Oh a German cockroach." After which he went and got a Kleenex, wiped it off the wall and proceeded to have the housekeeper clean my room. Again, his response was not one of surprise, but more a response that he was well aware that this is a problem. He also came into the room with the housekeeper, moved the mini fridge, placed a roach bait behind it and sprayed bug spray underneath it. I also took the spray and sprayed the perimeter of my room. The housekeeper did a great job of cleaning, but I was on edge for the next 2 nights that I had to stay until I was able to check into another hotel. On the morning of my checkout, I was headed downstairs and found another cockroach crawling on the door to the room directly across the hall. Needless to say, I got my belongings, shook them out and got out of there. - Size of the room: These rooms are tiny in comparison to many of the other resorts on island. Two people staying in one double bed room will literally be on top of one another. Summary:I typically leave excellent reviews for places, even if they aren't perfect because most often the staff makes the imperfections bearable.
