This situation was not the same, although the staff that did assist me were phenomenal, even their Aloha spirit couldn't make sleeping with cockroaches acceptable. If anyone from the hotel management reads this review, by all means please feel free to contact me. This hotel is in a wonderful location and honestly with a good deep cleaning could really become one of the premier resorts on island.

Currently I am staying in the lower floor of Ala Moana Hotel by Mantra. First time to stay at this hotel.Last night, about 1.5cm (0.6 inch) roach came out from the drawer of TV cabinet. I called Housekeeper to bring a roach killer spray. 5-10mins later, a housekeeping lady came to bring it, but she explained to me I cannot keep it with me until I kill a roach as for the health hazard reason. It is acceptable but they should bring also "a roach trap catcher(roach motel)" instead. A hotel staff told me he could bring roach bites which cannot catch or kill roaches right away.I talked to a staff or a manager and he told me I could move to another room. But it was almost midnight and it was a long day for me and would not like to pack all my staffs to move to the another room.I texted about this happening to my friend who stayed at this hotel several times and she told me she found roaches few times. That means even if I move to another room, I might encounter with another one again....so I decided not to move.This hotel is not well pest control.I normally stay at Hyatt Regency in Waikiki or Moana Surfrider when I visit Honolulu once/twice times of every year for this past 10 years. I have never seen roaches in those hotels. The location of this hotel is excellent to access to Ala Moana SC. The service is not with the warm Aloha atmosphere. Totally a city business hotel service.Better to bing the folded roach or insect trap catcher just in case, if stay at this hotel.

We came back because we stayed here before and had a good experience. This time we enjoyed our stay but found the swimming pool cold, the coffee in the room mediocre (Red Lion), and the construction noise outside our room bothersome.

I almost always stay at the Ala Moana Hotel when visiting Hawaii. The rooms are clean and the service good. Excellent fitness room. You can walk to Ala Moana Center - a distance of about 1-2 blocks. CAUTION: Beware of what Ala Moana Hotel you are reserving a room from. Recently, there has been an Ala Moana Hotel by ISI that does not provide the same service although it is in the same location. I was told that ISI manages rooms that have been converted to condos and though you check in at the same counter, housekeeping is done (or not) by ISI. (The date of my travel-Sept 2017-is actually the date I was making reservations. I will stay at Ala Moana Hotel by Mantra in 2018 and didn't want to wait until after the trip to alert people to the ownership changes.)

Excellent. Great job by the staff.Of particular note was "Eddie" (Edward) in the Plantation Café for breakfast who has been there so many years. Top notch customer service and courtesy and attention to detail. Outstanding employee.I was a bit disappointed with the Signature restaurant.... Although the customer service and atmosphere met my expectations, the food was not particularly noteworthy. The "wagyu" New York steak was average and not as tender as it should have been given the price. I've enjoyed equally as good a steak from Safeway but the rest of the meal and cocktails were very good, and again, the service was outstanding.

We always stay at the Ala Moana hotel when I run the marathon even though we live on island because we like to avoid the traffic problems. The staff is always friendly and courteous and the rooms are quite nice. Most importantly, the location is the closest to the start line for the marathon.

Everything was perfect for our 2 day stay at Ala Moana Hotel by Mantra. The price was right and the location was perfect. The service was good as ever. The personnel at the hotel was outstanding. I noticed that they added a guard service at the entrance to the main elevators that was not there the year before.

since it was a short stay, property is a great location right next to Ala Moana Shopping Center. I live out in central Oahu and I always make this staycation a good time to the year to do my christmas shopping.

This was our second year staying here and as always, they never disappoint. They had my room ready when i requested a early check in by an hour since I am a Mantra+ member. Also the staff was very courteous.

I have been a loyal guest of Ala Moana Hotel for the last 5 years. I always stay here for my business trips because of the price, location and amenities. I highly recommend it to anyone on vacation or on a business trip.

Extremely small room with lack of attention to detail when cleaned from previous guest. No spare / extra sheets in closet. Adult depends diaper on top shelf of closet instead of sheets. No pen to write on pad of paper and water bottle cap on floor next to bed.

The mirror in the room was located by the bedside but the end table was obstructing the mirror so the mirror was useless. It should be located where one can see oneself after dressing. There was a banquet we attended at the Garden Lanai and the food was good but the air conditioners didn't put out enough cool air for the 300 or more people, some wearing suits, so it was very warm and with the heat our appetites were soon overcome by the heat. One of the hotel clerks who served us was very cordial and made us feel at home!

Simple fact is Honolulu has become too expensive for regular business trips. As hotels begin to become available in the west side, I will make the switch unless there is an alternative.Nice enough hotel but nothing special for that cost.

I picked this hotel without any prior experience or knowledge and was pleasantly surprised. The accommodations and service were great. A good value stay. I would recommend this hotel to others and would stay again.

Alamoana is my families first choice every time we visit Oahu! We love the view, the convenience of walking to the mall and the friendly staff. The hotel is close to a lot of restaurants in walking distance.

Easy parking in-out, conveniently located. Great to have the Shopping Center next door for good restaurants and casual dining, shopping, entertainment, without having to drive/walk into Waikiki. Great beaches very close.

Great service! My room was upgraded since the first room had refrigerator issues. IMO, signage for the different elevators should be more clear. I encountered a frustrated guest trying to get to the 6th floor on the wrong elevators. No sign in elevators stating what floors can be accessed. Overall, I enjoyed my stay and would return. I also would recommend this hotel the my colleagues, friends, and family.

Staying at Ala Moana every year around this time of the season. Hotel staff are nice and helpful. Parking lots are available. Everthing is in walkable distance. Maybe Internet Service can be a little faster?

Nice to have a fridge and microwave. Great location. Rooms were a pretty good size. Lobby was pretty busy, lots of traffic through there. Nice to have the Starbucks right in the hotel. Beds were comfy.

Hotel was fine. I didn't feel as though I received any value by being a Mantra member. Supposed to have a special 'check-in' line - didn't have it. Supposed to get a bottle of water - didn't get it. Supposed to have special 'check-out' line - didn't have it and really needed it. In checking in early (about 11:30am), the only rooms available were city view so not as nice as my last stay. Also, the refrigerator was very noisy (rattle). That's room 1148.

Always a great hotel because of location next to Ala Moana Shopping Center. With new owner, Mantra, check in is so much faster with friendlier front desk staff. Great addition Starbucks in lobby with food choices .

Good room and service. This hotel is convenient to all of Honolulus sights and locations. My only concern was my room was cold. I turned off the A/C but room never did get warm. Wrong side of the hotel I guess. The hotel made my stay easy.

I can't tell you how many times I have stayed in this hotel over the years. This most recent visit was my last. The bed was horrible and both my husband and I woke up with back spasms from the hard, poor condition mattress that was in the room. I inquired several times at the front desk if there was any possibility of moving rooms. It was appears that the room once had a mutch larger bed in it based on where the nightstands had been installed. Usually there isn't a 6 inch gap between the bed and nightstand. You can't beat the location for convenience, but if my experience is any indication of how the mantra group operates their properties, I will be avoiding them.

My family and I wanted to find a property centrally located. It was the greatest thing being right next door to the shopping mall we could do our Christmas shopping and be close enough to some great eateries.

Perfect location for a bit of shopping after a long vacation in the US. Bit of a walk to the beach, although I could have used the pool I suppose. I slept very well & used the well appointed gym. The view from the balcony was not great, with lots of building works across the street

I live on Maui and a trip to Oahu for a medical procedure was unexpectedly extended for a return visit to the Dr. on the following Monday. The Ala Moana Hotel is known for welcoming Kama'aina so it was top on the list to call to try to find accommodation. For me it has been years since I stayed there and I was happy with the cleanliness of the hotel and the friendliness of all the staff we encountered.The big bonus is the hotel's location within walking distance to Ala Moana Shopping Center, so it helped to save on cab fare and provided lots of shopping and dining.

Best hotel in terms of location (Ala Moana Center, nearby restaurants , roadways leading to/from hotel. Most employees are long time employees, most are great showing "aloha" and service to their guests. Feel like guests, not as customers.

Visit Ala Moana Beach Park across the street, a local favorite. Shop, eat and imbibe at Ala Moana Shopping Center, a world class venue. Starbucks on the ground floor and Signature Prime Steak & Seafood on the 36th floor are both worth patroinizing.

Location is fabulous, no need to get a car and pay for parking. It is located by the best bus system in the world. 5 dollars for a day pass, pay driver on bus. Download app "da bus" and you are all set to go.Rooms are clean, small and most come with 2 double beds, not comfortable.they also have a thin little blanket on the bed with no extras in closet. So if you like the weight of a blanket on your shoulders you are out of luck. I also fight with the air conditioner, hit cold hot cold. I finally bought a small mini fan to bring and I have been better.The location is really nice. The mall, beach and Waikiki are walking distance.

Family friendly hotel. Very convenient with shopping nearby. I especially like that they’ve added a Starbucks in their lobby. We were there when they started decorating their lobby for Christmas. The tree that stood in the middle of their entrance was beautiful!

After booking through AirPads, I read some disturbing reviews. There are rooms at the Ala Moana hotel that are privately owned and managed through AirPads. Although hotel personnel check you in and park your car, everything else is AirPads. Be prepared that although the room rate is less, you do not get daily housekeeping unless you pay $20/day. So before I left, I paid for that. There was a "hick up" the first night and the bed wasn't made properly. Be sure to check your bed upon arrival. I called AirPads the next day and it was smooth sailing and the room was immaculate everyday thereafter. We were in room 3522 with an ocean view, king bed. Regardless of who you book with, parking at the hotel is $20 per day. For $25 per day, you get valet parking which is what we did. The savings was worthwhile because we knew what we were getting ourselves into. Also, no matter who you book with, an oceanview is not an oceanfront view. The hotel is not on the beach. Would stay there again.

Strengths - 1) location is close to Ala Moana. We like being off the strip bc we don't mind walking, taking the biki, or driving and parking. It's also right by Shirokiya as well as lots of great Korean restaurants nearby.2) cleanliness, at least the rooms we got were nice and clean. The bathroom could use some updating but it wasn't dirty.3) The lobby is nice and open and there's a big starbucks w/ lots of seating and nice open windows to just sit down and regroup.Weaknesses1) service - we were hosting our wedding dinner at the top floor of the hotel, we wanted early check in to drop off some stuff before the wedding but they were not very accommodating. They said call the morning of, which I did, then they said call at 10, which I did, then they said call at 12, which I did, then they said the only way to do it is to show up at the front desk. Not sure why they didn't just tell me that earlier?2) self-parking - there's only one small elevator to quite a dingy parking lot downstairs. It was a struggle getting all our luggage + our baby's things. There is valet parking available however.Overall, I was satisfied, but next time mb I'll opt for valet parking.

Out here in Hawaii for the week to visit friends. Checked into Ala moana and was greeted by a very friendly front staff named Justin. He advised me that the room I had requested for was right next to an ice vending machine and another next to the elevator. Then gave me a 3rd option for another room. I took the 3rd option. It didn’t have a view but I was ok with it. I’m not planning on staying in my room the whole day. Room is small but cozy and clean. It’s just me so I don’t need a whole lot of space. I would recommend families with kids to upgrade to a larger room. It looks like the carpet was recently changed so I felt ok about walking barefoot There is a lot of construction noise during the day but that’s fine. I’m out most of the day. At night it’s nice and quiet. Starbucks is downstairs and Ala Moana mall within walking distance. Super convenient. Overall, very very very happy with this hotel.

AMH is a great place to stay. The rooms are always clean. The lobby Starbucks was a great addition to the ambience. The Royal Kitchen is terrific. The Steakhouse would be good if they'd lower the volume of their music.

We have always enjoyed staying at the Ala Moana because of it location. Your staff was great and helpful. Only wish we could have gotten a better room rate. love the new sliding doors on the 2nd floor sky walk. Very helpful when your hands are full of bags!

Just came for a family getaway and Judo states tournament hold at salt lake! Room was great but wish there was 2- beds but was ok! Your guy worker put us in a very great spot 10 floor by the elevator n

Although the location of the property is good, rooms are tiny and pricey. Front Desk staff was courteous but not friendly. Bell/Valet staff was excellent. Starbucks in the lobby was very convenient also.
user_name:
Debora K
Hilton Head, South Carolina

review_body: I stayed at here for a business trip. It was clean and the location was fairly decent. Great location to do some shopping but a bit far from the main Waikiki area for the night life(Approx 25 min walk). Always appreciate the great prices for our company!

My daughter and I took an over night trip to Honolulu for some rest and relaxation. This hotel was very accommodating of our needs (early check-in, holding our luggage after check-out, room near elevator). We had a pleasant stay.

My wife and I stayed at this hotel for two nights upon arrival in Oahu. From check in to check out the staff was Chris and friendly. Even though construction was taking place outside of our hotel window the noise was tolerable. We would definitely put this on our list of hotels to return to.

We would stay again and recommend the hotel to others. It was nice to be close to the mall for shopping during Black Friday and other events over that weekend. We may consider staying for Fourth of July and The Annual Lantern Floating Festival. How in advance are we able to book a room at your hotel? Maybe you could have one of your representatives call me and provide that information, that would be helpful in planning our events for the coming year. Thank you!

Love this hotel because of its location, much quieter than Waikiki. All Staff extremely pleasant and helpful. Have stayed there last 4 years. Easy and quick access to Ala Moana Mall. Walking distance to Ward Centre. Our room had views over the ocean and marina. Extremely quiet.

I got corner room, all the way to the East end of floor. My room had an adjoining lounge/breakfast room attached, which was a nice extra. View form the corner room was nice.. Room was clean and comfortable.

Always enjoyed my stay here, this time around the bed and pillow seemed hard. I woke up with a sore neck and back, which is still sore today. Never had this problem staying here before. Staff as usual, outstanding.

I was disappointed in the room. I reserved well in advance for 3 nights. I was placed across from ice machines, elevator and door for employees. Very disappointed in the room!The staff was very knowledgeable. They sent me in the right direction for my downtown travels.
Awesome stay as usual from Staff to the Hotel and everything pertaining to all functions of this Hotel.“EXCELLENT” as usual when I stay there.Thank You to All that work there...V/R sincerely, Mitch

Some minor nits on mechanicals (had to jiggle handle on toilet to work correctly, thermostats was a bit flakey) but overall a nice place to stay, close to shopping and such. Not able to comment on dining at the hotel, ate elsewhere. Would stay again.

The location met our needs. The view of the ocean and the mountains was great although we looked down onto the parking lot of the Ala Moana Shopping mall. The breakfast buffet at the Plantation Café was excellent, but had to find lunch and dinner outside the hotel.

Firstly, the room we had at the hotel was owned and serviced by Luxury Suites. The Ala Moana staff were constrained servicing us as a result. Staff at the hotel were excellent and tried hard to overcome Luxury Suites deficiencies. The room first, was OK a little cramped as we had 2 beds in it and used only one. Room facilities were non existent we had to buy 2 cups just to have a cup of tea or coffiee. We donated these. There was coffee supplied for 3 cups of coffee. There was no kettle for boiling water and we had to use the coffee machine. No plates or bowels although it did have a microwave. The bathroom ceiling was mouldy and we found out why when it leaked water from the unit upstairs overflowing their bath. For someone who has a mould allergy this was not good. The door to the balcony did not lock but this was fixed within 24 hours but not straight away and we slept nervously for 2 nights. The bed we slept in... was ok but I found it broken on our last day when looking for something under it. My husband and family members got stuck in the lift at one point in our stay and this was stressful as I was stuck outside with limited information on their impending release. After that the lifts were a bit unreliable but you learnt to jump out quickly if it did not move. Now to the positive, the linen was clean and the room cleaned once during our stay was excellent. The girls really did put in some effort. The balcony was great and the view outstanding. The location of the hotel was the principle draw card being so close to amenities. The staff at the front reception were excellent and went well out of their way to help at every turn. They remained cheerful and helpful throughout. Advise on staying at this hotel, avoid Luxury Suites booking a room for you and using their services. BOOK Direct with the hotel. Location is excellent being adjacent to Ala Moana centre and bus depot.

I've lost count of the times that I have stayed here as the hotel suits my needs perfectly.... close to shopping, beaches and restaurants. This time it was a brief stay but it couldn't have been better. The Front Desk staff were extremely friendly and helpful and I was allocated a wonderful room on the 38th floor. My only regret was that I couldn't have stayed longer. But I shall be returning next year!

Disappointing, if it wasn’t for your location we wouldn’t have stayed. There was a leak above the toilet that dripped onto our spare towel. We were only there for one night, so we chose not to say anything. We should have been asked if we would like one bed instead of just giving us two on the 13th floor farthest from the elevator.

Ala Moana Hotel is the best place to go if your a tourist on vacation, or just a local on a staycation. It’s location conveniently right next to the mall, so shopping and a wide dining experience is all at your fingertips. The rooms are nice, clean and at an affordable price. The staff is really friendly too.

We went for Black Friday shopping at the Ala Moana Center. You should have "Black Friday Specials" for kamaaina folks since the shopping center is right there and work a deal with Ala Moana for parking on Friday night, since the center is open all day Thursday night, parking is not a problem.

Just a suggestion but if you wanted more attraction, maybe have a live band or something down by the pool at night time it just kinda seemed boring a bit cos i like being outside and having beers and ala moana has a very nice view from the pools but if you're trying to keep it a family orientated place then i guess my suggestion is no point but i had an awesome and fantastic time, staff and people were awesome and would do it again. Thank you guys so much.

Stayed here at the Ala Moana Hotel adjacent to Ala Moana Shopping Center, the world's largest open air mall. Checked in Thursday, Thanksgiving afternoon. Used to be part of the Outrigger chain but now is part of an Australian company, Mantra. Registration staff was pleasant and had our room ready. We stayed in the Kona Tower which faces / overlooks the shopping center. So convenient as we did A LOT of shopping, returned to the room to drop off our spoils and then right back out again to spend more money. LOL. Stayed Thursday and checked out Saturday, two nights. Enough time to take advantage of all of the Black Friday deals. The room had a Queen bed, blackout curtains, was clean and spacious enough with minimum frills. Furniture is dated. Standard amenities ~ iron, ironing board, soap, facial tissue, shoe mit, hairdryer ~ but no shower cap, toothbrush or paste and no complimentary bottles of water. We had to ask for a shower cap and also for an extra blanket as the room got extremely cold overnight. When I called for the extra blanket it took two calls to housekeeping and 45 minutes for them to deliver it.This hotel is also convenient to Ala Moana Beach Park, a three minute walk and a great beach park for swimming and all water sports and for jogging or a leisurely stroll. Across of the Hawaii Convention Center and in walking distance to Waikiki. Want to head downtown? Many bus stops make it easy.Really, the only drawback for my wife and I was the extra blanket incident and no water bottles, both not really a big deal. I would recommend this hotel for any visitor to Honolulu.One last thing. Probably more irritating than the blanket incident. You need to insert your room card each time you go UP in the elevator. Insert quickly and when green light is on, press your floor number. We tried it many times but i guess we weren't doing it correctly and no one explained how to do it when we checked in so back to registration we went.

Ala Moana hotel gives top notch customer service in all areas their employees serve. It is a clean and classy hotel which is located in a prime spot for shopping and/or attending conventions. I have always been happy to be a guest at this hotel. The aloha spirit is alive here.

Rooms are affordable for a near Waikiki hotel. Beach , shopping , restaurants are all in walking distance. The staff has aloha for both kama aina and malihini . Rooms are clean and cool. Service for more towels and setting sleeper sofa was fast.The only negative thing is I thought the bathtub was a little to high to step over to get in.

Room was tiny, refrigerator was broken and smelled, only a full size bed in the room, lanai was a sliding glass door to nowhere overlooking a side street and parking garage that was extremely loud early in the am hours, no late checkout available even when told to ask at different times. If late checkout is not ever offered just tell us that instead of ask when checking in then told to ask again in the morning just to be told that it isn't offered. We will not return or recommend this hotel, yelp should only have 1 star.

Front desk staff and valet were on par and exceptional. Keep up the great service. Rooms were great too. I will recommend Ala Moana Hotel and will be back when I need a room for an event in town. Happy Holidays!

My trip to Oahu was a sad occasion my brother past away. But staying here brought back wonderful memories! The room upgrade which I did not expect was a bonus. The valet and front desk although very busy was very professional! And did their best in a timely fashion.

All the staff was very friendly and helpfull. We stayed in the king suite for 14 nights and the stay was enjoyable with all the amenities. Front desk was alway helpful, housekeeping brought items requested quickly, such as extra towels and bedding. Valete was very courteous and friendly bringing our vehicle up and having it ready.

This hotel is just next door to Ala Moana shopping center. Such a great place to shop and grab something to eat. The hotel is clean and many staff mostly helpful and friendly. Although probably not associated with the hotel some Starbucks personnel were quite rude.

This hotel is centrally located around all the great attractions, with Ala Moana shopping center right there with all the great stores and eateries. Then you have Waikiki just a few minutes day away. The prices are reasonable especially when you book their flash sales.

My overall rating for this stay is above average mainly because the employees we encountered were very friendly and helpful. When checking in our front desk person (Joy, I think) was very personable and helpful in checking us in and providing a better located room. Our housekeeper cleaned the room well and provided extra amenities we needed.My main complaint is with the elevators. Too slow! A lot of people had to cram in the elevators and people on other floors had to catch the next because of the fullness.Also, the toilet paper holder is located a little far back from the toilet. lol

Great location to shop at Ala Moana Mall. Rooms are nice, clean and about 4 star. Prices have gone up over previous years maybe since under new management. Will be price shopping for our trip next year.

Love it, great for our weekend getaway, wish there was room service, didn't know how to set up massage in room. Wish there was a spa in this hotel. Otherwise I love going to the Ala Moana Hotel its great location.

It’s location is ideal for someone who has to do or wants to do a lot of shopping at Ala Moana Center and does not want to be hassled looking for a parking space, especially during the holiday season.

Overall pleasant stay. Construction noise outside was loud in the morning.After numerous visits to your hotel, I have not received any discounts to yourbreakfast eatery. We have booked another stay from 1/10 to 1/17 2018.I hope you can offer us a discount then. Thanks

Travelled to Oahu for Thanksgiving this year and stayed at Ala Moana hotel. Very enjoyable experience except for check in and out. Had to wait 10 minutes for both. Wouldn’t mind that other than the fact, there were desk clerks at their stations (3) that were not helping customers. That made it more difficult to patiently wait for service.

I love staying at the Ala Moana Hotel because it’s clean, quiet and comfortable. It’s close enough to Waikiki that I can walk and far enough from Waikiki that I’m not in the bustle of traffic. Also close to a beautiful swimming beach.

We enjoy staying here for its convenience to the beach (Magic Island) for our morning walk and, of course, to the shopping center. Rooms are clean and service personnel are always very accommodating and friendly. Thank you.

Overall stay was good. Coffee maker was not cleaned during this trip - I woke up the first morning and wanted to make a cup of coffee but it was not cleaned. I stay at your hotel every month. Especially like the courtesy room since I travel for business. However, sometimes the courtesy room is NOT fully cleaned when I use it - towels on the floor, sink not cleaned, etc.

great conference venue. We had a conference for 60 people for three days and the venue and catering was excellent. Efficient and responsive staff. Comfortable rooms. great catering for conference of 60 people
user_name:
SteveKarlie H
Canberra, Australian Capital Territory, Australia

review_body: I spent five nights in this hotel commencing 11/13/17. At 3:15 am on 11/16 my smoke alarm started chirping. I called the front desk and was told a maintenance person would be up to fix. Got dressed but no one showed. Could not sleep. I stopped by the front desk at 7:00 am on my way to business appointment discussed issue and left business card. Returned at 7:00 pm and alarm still chirping. Now two front desk people and assuredly a maid know of the problem. Sought out a third person a Lady at front desk after 7:00 pm and she said I should have contacted a manager!!! So my problem ? No apologies from the Hotel or follow up of any kind . Previous Outrigger Management missed at this Hotel . BTW it took a maintenance man less than a minute to replace the batteries

We had a wonderful time during our stay, although our room was not ready until after 4pm but asked for a late check out of 11 and it was granted. Great location for shopping. During the last night of out stay, we called the front desk at 10:30pm and asked for 2 blankets but never received those blankets.

I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Waikiki. The employees are friendly and very helpful. For the price it's very affordable and you're right next to all the shopping and restaurants.

It was a family appointment short vacation. The hotel is a nice location. Near to a shopping mall. The hotel staff were friendly, clean and safe place. I just wish the hotel room has a longer softer blanket.

We waited a bit for check-in and then the employee was not particularly welcoming or attentive to detail - told us nothing about WiFi access, hotel services, parking, etc., nor did she give us the area map we were told she should have given us. The lobby is always crazy busy with flight crews coming and going and, we saw some school groups too. Lots of shops in the lobby to grab snacks, water, sunscreen, etc. Glad for the multiple, fast elevators. Our king sized room was spacious and well equipped with extra towels, as well as microwave and fridge, which were very handy. Comfy beds too! Our balcony faced the mountain with the city view off to the left and we were treated to a rainbow every morning. We really enjoyed the view! Easy to walk everywhere for food and shopping. We weren't into the huge mall next door, but found ample other places nearby to browse, shop and eat. Pleasant walk to Waikiki Beach for the sunset. Self parking is an extra$20 per night. Not high elegance, but certainly a very nice place to stay. Recommended!

Excellent location as the name suggests for shopping at the Ala Moana centre, great service and within walking distance of some great restaurants. The staff are very knowledgeable about the local area and recommended some great places to eat.

My overall stay at this hotel was very good but it doesn't offer much for kids. My son was bored at the pool and that's usually his favorite part about visiting a hotel. It needs an upgrade and a Jacuzzi would be awesome especially around this time of the year when it gets a little chilly for the locals.

I’ve been coming to this hotel for 15 years. It is the best situated and the easiest to get around. Way more convenient than the strip in Waikiki. You can walk to the ala Moana mall, the park.... you barely need a car. Love it. There’s a Starbucks in the lobby that also serves beer and wine, a wonderful store that has just about everything and a fine dining restaurant (signatures) on the top floor that offers views of Honolulu that take your breath away. Just stay here.

Location is great Hotel is lovely Steam room could have been a bit hotter. The Sauma was not functioning, There is No jacuzzi, and the swimming pool is quite small. Upon check in I was given a complimentary free upgrade. My room 1927 was directly across from major construction site in progress. The noise from the machines & people shouting at each other was very disturbing. Then 7am Sunday morning a helicopter transport of equipment ensued for approx 1.5 hrs.right outside my room on the 19th floor. This made for less than restful Sunday morning.

Convenient to everything. Clean rooms, easy access, good parking, nice breakfast buffet. Staff is always helpful and friendly, good restaurant upstairs, easy walk to Ala Moana shopping center. Only hotel we book.

If Possible Preview Hotel Accommodation Type - Online Misleading description  Poor Hotel Follow-up Communication. Shady Early check-in , Late check-out Policies.Accommodation Cleanliness not up to parTowels and linen Questionable Quality..... Old condition or Poor quality?poor hospitality attitude given by front desk staff - too busy to care !

Guest Service agent was very helpful. Didnt get her name but as soon as we reached the counter she greeted us with the true aloha spirit, very welcoming. She upgraded us to a nice room. The room was very nice but smelt a little like the hospital. One suggestion the bath soap should be a little bigger because it only was enough for 1 person. But in all my overall stay was excellent.

One would think that a well established hotel like the Ala Moana would not be so petty as to charge a fee to print an airline boarding pass at the end of a stay. 50 cents per page is not a financial killer, but it reflects a less than friendly image of a stately icon.

We always have had good service from the employees of Ala Moana, especially the valets and Plantation Kitchen. The noisy room was a negative, but the friendly service from the employees made up for it.

This trip was absolutely perfect! Such a great location with the mall right next to it. Everything was in perfect walking distance. The workers really took care of us. They made sure we had everything we needed and more

Whether for business or pleasure, Kamaina know this is one of the best hotels to stay. The location is perfect, the service consistent. Love that there's a Starbuks in the hotel. Often travel for inter-island business. Nice not needing to drive into Waikiki.

Negative experience with room amenities, room should be inspected thoroughly after every housekeeping service. Room with kitchens should be stocked kitchen amenities and not nickel and dime a guest for a kitchen amenities. Another note was given a set of kitchen amenities and a used dish sponge which was unsanitary.

Always a great palce to stay. The staff is friendly and helpful. Always nice to see the smiling faces. I never have had any bad experiences here and the location is so convinient. Even the parking attendent was nice.

Stayed for a week in the middle of November. Easy, close access to all bus lines and a short walk to the main Waikiki strip (less than 1.5 mi). Heidi at the front desk was especially helpful and cheery. Stayed in the Kona tower, and had no problem with noise. Right next to huge outdoor mall with everything from Gucci to $1 beers in the awesome Shirokiya food court. Olus, the nearest beach is super calm and mellow.  You're not going to spend all your days in your hotel room--the Ala Moana is not super fancy and lush, but it more than serves the needs of most travelers. Room had microwave and small fridge. Would stay again.

The room was very nice and very soundproof (from any outside noise or other rooms); the refrigerator 9as is usual in a hotel room) was loud when running; also, it was a little tricky figuring out how to use the microwave (it didn't seem to have a way to program a specific time), perhaps instructions could be provided.
user_name:
James D
Ocean View, Hawaii, Usa

review_body: Adjacent to Mall, close to yacht club. Older property but well maintained for the most part. Starbucks in the lobby is a big plus. Staff are friendly and helpful. Close to the west side of Waikiki so the traffic is not as bad as other areas of Waikiki. Pick up the pink trolley at the mall nextdoor to take you to additional shopping or close to beaches.

The location and service were exceptional. The staff were friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. The hotel location for driving your own car, public transportation and/or walking proved to be very convenient.

Got an up grade with out asking. How wonderful is that? Next to Ala Moana with fine shopping and Ono grinds. So easy so convenient. Great stay. Will do it all the time. Did a fumigation spray so was great for that or to just spend time away from your usual grind.

15 minute leisurely walk to beach 5 minute crawl to hire shopping centre. This is now Australian owned and the staff are aspiring the Aussie style of service. Which is good by the way. Lovely Starbucks in foyer and great souvenir shops for that last minute purchase for home. Room is comfortable free WiFi great breakfast. I did not use the gym so do not actually know if it had one. Service is great just relating that because it was. Well done loved my stay

The room I stayed did not have a view and it was very small. The clerk at the info desk did not tell us well enough about how parking permission be obtained, although she was very friendly. Facilities was very old, but they were kept clean. The location is convenient for business and it is connected to the Ala Moana Shoping Center, which was nice.

The hotel is well located, especially if you rely on The Bus for getting around. The location is particularly good for if you don't want to be in Waikiki and are okay with being a short bus ride away.The rooms are basic and clean, although I could hear when the next room's toilet was flushed and the tank refilling. It woke me up one night. The housekeeping was uneven but the staff was very friendly and accommodating. Views from some rooms look out on the adjacent shopping center's parking garage. It's a good value with no resort fee.

Great stay with so much walking convenience to all the main Waikiki sights and shopping. Outstanding hotel hospitality and friendly staff. I am a returning customer, and I will be a repeated customer at this hotel for all my Waikiki vacation and business trips.

I wish there a biki bike station at your hotel .. i saw them every where .. i try one out is was great... jean at the front desk was amazing ... the hotel was clean and nice ... house keeper would always greet me when they saw me ...

Our rooms had a lovely terrace/balcony/lanai partially overlooking the water. The facilities and lobby have been updated. Unfortunately, the room, including the bathroom, furnishings and bedding were old.

"Do you have what it takes to stay with us?" Seems to be the prevailing Mantra among the staff members of the Ala Moana...The members in the eateries were much more friendly than the folks at the reception desk. There was always a line and unfriendly faces... It is shame...On the first night when I called housekeeping to request "non-feather" pillows for my room, the house keeper told me that they didn't have any hypoallergenic ones. I suggested that she send someone to the mall next door and purchase a few, so they would have it for the next person, who was allergic to feathers. She told me that she couldn't do that and had to ask her manager...Eventually, I got hypoallergenic pillows.What is with the new trend of having everything "down"?????
user_name:
Armen S
Bloomington, IN, United States

review_body: The staff is friendly and very helpful.Room was clean and had a very nice view of the city and mountainsOnly bad thing was that the ice bucket had a funny smell.Other then that had a get weekend!!!

With a city full of different accommodations, I would return to stay at the Ala Moana. It left that great of an impression in my heart. It was only by luck that I stumbled upon the hotel, as my Mum had a terrible fall in another part of Oahu. I needed to be as close to the hospital without jeopardizing my own safety and comfort.

I forgot a sentimental photo of my grandpa when he was young in the hotel room. And it wasn't turned in. My stay was great though. I always stay here with other family members too. We are originally from Honolulu.

Great location Will be back soon.Bryson at check in was awesome and funny. Mahalo for the hospitality. My Aunty works at the front desk. So I will be back next year and I’m gonna bring my company to stay here for our next business venture

Well not much to say that is positive, ask for a room that doesn't end in 01 if your unlucky enough to get a room ending with 01 don't expect much sleep as there are 6 lift going up and down all night. when 3 of us turned up no wonder the receptionist looked at us strangely there were only 2 beds in the room for 3 people, both beds were smaller than a double. So 9 rather cramped nights. The sheets didn't fit the bed so they didn't change them for sheets that did so nearly fell out of bed when trying to get out because my feet were tangled in the untucked sheet that didn't fit the bed. Can't complain about the cleanliness the room was kept clean they only forgot to clean it a couple of time. The staff could not have been more polite. Having a Star Bucks down in the lobby was a great asset.

Loyal customers for years should have some sort of compensation such as early check in or late checkout..I also notice that service and aloha do not match up to the hotels in Waikiki that cater mostly to tourists. The aloha spirit is not as evident. The allure of your hotel relies mainly on your location. Those who don't drive prefer the convenience of shopping at Ala Moana Shopping Center.

This trip to Hawaii was fourth time for me,this hotel was most comfortable for me so I would like to recommend to my friends and this time I could not try gym but swimming pool so I want to try it,and elevator is faster and safer,thank you for your serve!

After an almost 10-hour flight, we arrived at the hotel at past 9AM. Jetlagged and sleep-deprived, all we wanted to do was take a shower and crawl under the sheets. But we had to follow the hotel's check-in time of 3PM. We passed the time by sightseeing and returned to the hotel at past 4PM. It was almost 5PM by the time we got to our respective rooms. Lo and behold, three out of four paid rooms have not been cleaned yet and were left by the former guests in total disarray. It made us wonder why those rooms were not cleaned yet when the hotel check-out time is 12NN and check-in time is 3PM. Then we discovered that due to its accessibility to the Ala Moana Shopping Center, this is the usual go-to hotel. It always on full-house booking, so the housekeeping people cannot cope with the number of rooms they have to clean everyday. Despite its high volume of guests, it seems like the hotel management is scrimping on hiring people. The housekeeping people could not properly clean the rooms. The carpets smell. The bathroom tiles have mildew. The frontline people are rude, arrogant, and ill-tempered. They are way too stressed out and could barely cope with the number of guests checking in and checking out. Its bell service is also very lousy. We had to call bell service four times and wait for almost 30 minutes before a bellman finally made it to our rooms to help us with our luggages. The duty manager is totally accessible and only reachable by an answering machine. Smiling is not innate in its hotel staff. There are only three redeeming factors in this hotel: 1. Its accessibility to Ala Moana Shopping Center; 2. The breathtaking view of the sea (if you are fortunate enough to score a room with a sea view), and 3. Justine Baisec, the sole helpful, patient, and accommodating front desk officer who was kind and patient enough to help us when we checked in. We did not blame him for giving us rooms that had not been cleaned yet. After all, how does one expect a front desk person to know that the room tagged to be unoccupied is still not made up? I will never go back to this hotel. I will not recommend this to any of my friends.

Wonderful staff and we were serviced daily so felt very appreciated as we stayed 2 weeks ... Memorable 50th ...slept peacefully ... had a view from balcony partial ocean and city...free wifi and great air conditioning...memorable 50th for me.Thankyou Ala Moana

The room in the Kona Tower was great to relax for a short visit. It had everything I needed: internet access, comfortable place to sit and read/work on the computer, coffee maker, fridge, microwave, safe, and a window that could be opened to let fresh air in. The location can't be beat. Ala Moana Beach Park, Ala Moana Shopping Center that has a grocery store, Waikiki are in walking distance.

It is always so nice to stay at the Ala Moana Hotel. As usual, my room this time around was nice and comfortable, and nice view. The microwave oven is a convenient amenity to have - I can always rewarm my Starbucks beverage and muffins. The TV is easy to operate and has a good program selection - easy to shift into relax mode.The in-room safety deposit box always seem to indicate LOW BATTERY - not a comfortable feeling.Perhaps the bathroom could be updated?The closet hangers are nice, but secured to the closet rod - not easy to hang my clothes.

I would go there again and again. The rooms were beautiful, clean and the staff were amazing and always willing to help you. The Hotel was minutes a walk away the biggest ALA Moana shopping centre and beautiful beaches.

This hotel is average in this area.The rooms are decent and the staff is good. The location is several blocks from the newer upscale shopping by Waikiki Beach, but it is next door to the Ala Moana shopping center which is my favorite place to shop and get quick food and finer dining. Ala Moana beach park is across the street for swimming, surfing and picnics. I'm partial to this location since it's away from the tourist area of Waikiki.

We came for an anniversary trip. Our room was small, the Internet sucked, bell service was rude, the beds were very uncomfortable. Did like the location and convenience. We needed early check in and late check out and they would not give either which was included in being part of the mantra club.

Great staff and great location for shopping and dining. Walking distance to just about anything you would want to do. The rooms are clean and easily accessible. Good rates and safe atmosphere for family trips.

Wish the front desk seemed to care a little more about the fact that we're expecting a king size bed not a queen size with a pull out and maybe try to help us.The not caring was probably the most annoying

excellent close to shopping mall lots of choices for food and kid friendly. I just love coming back to this wonderful Hotel when I'm planning my vacation with my family. Keep up the wonderful service.

Overall i have to say that my experience at the Ala Moana Hotel was a great experience. The room was nice and clean and everything was great. The only thing that i wish i could have experienced was the early check in and late check out. Because the hotel was booked before and after our stay we were not able to check in early and check out late. But its understandable. I would definitely would like to stay again on another occasion soon.

Had a great time with my girlfriend and really enjoyed the happy faces that served us. I’ll definitely be coming back there or going to one of the more ritzy hotels downtown. It’s close to everything and the staff is well managed !

My family and I really enjoyed our stay, the view was amazing, the price ok, but the Staff was even better. Because the staff was so awesome I look forward to staying again. Please keep up the good work.

I had quite low expectations of this hotel and was not disappointed. Such a small room and bathroom with a carp ark view. The staff were quite nice though apart from the bellwoman, tried very hard to get a smile from her on several occasions but she was one tough customer! My room was clean but expensive Fortunately I was travelling alone, no way two people and bags could fit in there.

Great hotel, convenient to eateries and shopping. Long lines to check in/check out. Only 2 people manning the front desks when the lines are long. Please have more staff on the front lines when it's busy.

Convenient location was a plus. Room size was a negative. Nice to have a working microwave and refrigerator. Shower knobs were pretty funky, took a while to figure it out and get the temperature just right. Staff were all friendly.

Whenever I stay in Honolulu, Ala Moana Hotel is my #1 choice. Friendly staff, clean rooms and prime location to everything. I had reserved a room in the Kona Tower for the price and was surprised with an upgrade and was able to stay in the Waikiki Tower. Thank you, Ala Moana Hotel!!

Love the fact I can be at Waikiki, without having traffic in Waikiki. If we wanted to go to Waikiki, literally a minute away. Attached to Hawaii's largest mall, with many choices of restaurants. Hotel itself has choices without being overrun by people who are not guests.

We stayed at your hotel the. I've befoew our Hawaiian cruise!!! The restaurant at the top of your hotel was very very good and the young bartender from Texas made our night!!!! We will definitely be back!!!

Nice rooms, close to shopping and friendly staff, very convenient as all my business was located in the same area - dining was great - Ala Moana Shopping Center offered an array of experiences and tastes as there were a multitude of eateries in the area - everyone was friendly and accommodating to our needs daily - so come - enjoy - relax - you'll be glad you came

I think that the " Resident/Kamaaina Rates Kona Tower from $143 - NO RESORT FEE" on your web site is deceiving. it cost $209+ taxes. Not really a good discount if $143 price is not available. Melissa at the front counter was the best part of the day. Very friendly, personable and informative.

Perfect location to access the mall and convention center. The in-house nightclub, Rumours, is a lot of fun! The DJs are very good! And to top it off, No driving necessary! The rooms are nice, clean and the beds are very comfortable.

Clean, comfortable room. We went out for meals nearby every time. Tried the Eggs and Things nearby for breakfast. Dinners on Waikiki beach or the Hard Rock Cafe. The hotel has a Starbucks coffee shop attached and a general store to shop sandwiches, breakfast cereals and other items including liquor. Would stay there again to sleep.

Rooms are clean, handicapped rooms available.Beds comfortable. Only negative is the food situation. 1/ No room service, if you arrive late, the shop may be open.2/ No lunch restaurants available.2/ Diinner is either in the expensive roof restaurant, or the Chinese restaurant which I understand is about to close. Starbucks in the lobby shuts down at 8:30 p.m. Breakfast buffet average, coffee poor.

On business trip where our seminar held. It was not too far from the airport, beach, shopping, Pearl Harbor and also Chinatown. The room was big and refrigerator and microwave oven and coffee maker at room. Wifi is good and Starbucks and convenience store and a gift shop store and a disco lounge. Breakfast is OK, not as many choice as some other top hotel. A very pleasant 3 nights stay.

We had to find a room because of a medical emergency and missed our scheduled flight. The Ala Moana was very accomidating. Check in was smooth and the clerk was very nice and helpful. The only complaint was that we found the room to be small. We will stay there again if we go back to Honolulu, but this time in a larger room.

I had my car valet and later noticed a big scrape on my front bumper of my car after I got home.Room Is small for the price. Staff was very friendly. Location was convenient since we had a fundraiser at Rumours .

Hotel was centrally located to shopping, food and activities. Service was great! Concierge was informative and knowledgeable in all manners of recreating, dinning or just relaxing. Views were very nice and with the Ala Moana mall attached to the hotel the world and all its shopping just steps away.

The deal killer for me was a forced check-out by 11 a.m., with no options for a late check out (or even a usual noon check out. Other than that, the location is excellent for many purposes and the rates reasonable.

Great access to the Honolulu art museum. Also could get the trolley or walk to central Waikiki. Overall great central location. Next time I'll get a water view. Beautiful. Could catch the city bus to and from the airport.

Great Hotel at a location great for shopping. Lots of activity all around. Friendly and very helpful personnel throughout. City night lights were pretty from our mountain view room and was a great background for pictures.

Besr hotel value for business in Honolulu! Super close to the convention center. Next to the Ala Moana Mall. Value overall is excellent. You know something is right when you see TONS of flight crews staying there as well.

I always stay here at the Ala Moana Hotel and have always enjoyed the location and prices. My husband and I stayed here because we were going to the UH football game. It is near Ala Moana and Waikiki, which is always a plus. Will keep staying here as long as the price is right.

This hotel was awesome for shopping. The balcony and ocean view were very nice. I live on Big Island and we traveled to Oahu for state Vball tournaments. It worked great for the team. Room was big with frig, microwave.

Hotel is located next to the Ala Moana mall, which has shopping and many restaurant choices. Hotel rates are good for business travel. The room I had was a little small but I could not beat the price.

Really convenient but watch the price. If you can't make reservations for planned visit way ahead of time, you may have to go elsewhere (for kama'aina). Apparently, it's necessary to check their website almost daily.

The hotel was clean and front desk staff was outstanding. The property location was extremely convenient to local shopping. The only recommendation would be to have more options for dining on the property.

My family and I was disappointed with our check-in the amount that we paid for a room that was not cleaned constantly lied to about the reason we cannot get the room at 3pm ended checking in at 5pm we where upset about being late to our fundraiser that started at 3 ended at 8pm so we missed out 2hrs of that

Room and view are great. Room was very clean. Elevators need some work. in one of them the button for my floor didn't work so I have to go past then come back..Noisy neighbors from 2 am to 4 am hard to sleep.

Check in was slow and took the better part of 30 minutes and that was while at the counter. My room was smaller than your average hotel room and had he stereotypical view of a construction pit. Definitely not worth the $200 per night rate as there are many options in that range. On the positive side there is a big mall next door.

Perfect for a business traveller. No fancy pools, but has all adult amenities close to business venues and entertainment. As we encountered an online booking issue, the reservations desk was very helpful and the issue was resolved without frustration.

We stayed for three nights last week. I love this hotel! It’s close to Ala Moana Shopping Center. The rooms are nice. They are small but provide everything you need in a nice package. A really great time.

I was charged for my room on check in, and then on check out, I was told that the number initially charged was incorrect, and so $28.50 was added to my stay. When I asked to talk to a manager, I was put on a phone with someone who clearly didn't care, and refused to make an effort to meet with me before my flight. Now, I am looking at my credit card statement, and I have two ADDITIONAL charges that I will have to dispute. Do not stay here. (For those who don't care about extra surprise charges, then to be fair, this has a great location.)

Super excellent service. We always stay here when we visit Oahu and was never disappointed. We had a big group with a lot of equipment but staff and valet were extremely patient and offered assistance when needed. Valet had cars and vans ready when requested. Mahalo to everyone

Ala Moana location next to the largest outdoor plaza was brilliant particularly the food court and of course fabulous retail shopping however not a fan of Starbucks coffee Honolulu Coffee Company in the plaza was much higher quality.

The Ala Moana is my top hotel choice when in Honolulu on business. Its proximity to both the Convention Center and the Ala Moana Shopping Center allows me to easily combine business with pleasure without having to drive to dinner. The hotel staff is very professional and the rooms are modern, immaculate, and comfortable. Starbucks in the lobby serves wine and beer, too.

hotel and staff were excellent rooms very good pity about construction site adjoining hotelgreat location to beach and trolley buses to waikiki great starbucks and gift shops & convenience store in hoteljohn horgan

Business trip w/extended vacation. 5 nights business / 6 nights personal vacation. Good location being close to the Ala Moana mall.... a little pricey though as I wanted to switch to the partial ocean view, but decided not to switch due to the cost of being in Hawaii. Will return though, but changing up the breakfast menu as I ate there every day during my business part of the stay as I was able to get reimbursed. I ate out the other times as it was cheaper and had more selections at the Don Quiote location for those that venture out.

Enjoyable stay and I would recommend this hotel. Did not try restaurants But will do next time. Location is what attracted me to this hotel. Rooms were clean. Was nice to have Starbucks in the same location.

Hotel is good and rooms ok. I booked through expedia because it was advertised as no resort fee. It looks like the reservation is done by a 3rd party condo rental. The hotel is super strict with check in, if you have a problem, have a request or anything else you have to contact Gaia for that. i don't think there was even housekeeping till we left. They do let you use the pool and gym facilities though. The rooms are quite small but it was ok for just us 2. It had a nice view of the pool and beach from our balcony. The shopping center is right next door and convenient with a newly open Target to get snacks, towels, snorkeling gear and alcohol. The ala moana beach was quite nice as well and easy walk to it, bring sandals or water shoes because it is a little rocky near the shore. One thing that was a little weird is that they close the pool at sunset.Which is like 7 or 8pm. So if you come back from the beach wanting to hang out by the pool or use it, it will be closed. The gym and steam room are open till 12am but everything is turned off and was a little hard finding the light switch.

Some associates and I were on O‘ahu for business. I always insist on staying at Ala Moana Hotel, it’s very nice for the price, and it’s a superb location. In the past I’ve stayed at other hotels but for dining, coffee in the morning, and some shopping, the Ala Moana Hotel can’t be beat. I don’t get the cheapest room, I get the next level up and it’s perfect. Space to relax and very comfortable. The Plantation Cafe which is on site has an excellent buffet breakfast that opens at 6:30. I stay several times a year for 1-2 nights and my team and I are always happy!

Overall, our room was terrible. Small, noisy fridge, little room to walk...We won''t stay there anymore.There was no room service available. The Plantation only served Breakfast. The Signature too pricey and I don't eat Chinese. The only place left was Ala Moana Center, which we hand to walk to.

Hotel staff very friendly and helpful, rooms big and clean. Convenient for the shopping centre next door reached from the hotel by a sky bridge. Only downside no informal bar. Starbucks does sell wine and beer but shut at 8.30pm . Fairly close to a beach and a 2$ ride to Waikiki Beach. Would stay again

Clean property, nice clean rooms, convenient location for shopping or attending a convention. Just a little pricey for a business trip. It is a better property for someone who want's to do a lot of shopping at the Alamoana shopping center.

Check in took longer than usual as there were only 3 employees. We need to call for more towels. It seemed that the hotel was reducing it complementary items such as shampoo and coffee again not enough for the regitered guests.

The best thing about this property is its location. The property itself is not remarkable as the the shops do not offer anything unique. The addition of a StarBucks is nothing special as there are numerous Starbucks in the immediate areas. Not having a restaurant with dinner service is the biggest deficit.

I always appreciate how clean the Ala Moana Hotel is. I stay here while on Oahu for work. It is very easy to get to and has all the conveniences you could need close by. Front desk staff is always nice.

The staff was very professional, courteous, and knowledgeable. The hotel was very clean and well maintained and our room was very comfortable. For our purposes, it was close to where we needed to go and having the mall right next door was very convenient.

Room # 1602 needs a new king mattress, an express check out card, and always friendly and safe environment. We really enjoyed our stay, the view, the people, the location, and the ease of getting around.

I always book at the Ala Moana when I travel to Honolulu, whether it is for business or pleasure! After renovations all the beds are better than my bed at home. The location is a convenient walk to the beach or nearby dining.

Stay in a hotel which allows independence, in a handy Honolulu location, near bus transport and adjacent to extensive shopping complex. Choose to look after your own holiday, or use assistance of friendly and helpful staff.

Overall hotel stay was very good. House cleaners could do better job. Found a hair clip and some sortof broken plastic on the bathroom floor when first check in. The water in the toilet tank wouldn't fill sometimes, needed to play around with flush handle but other than that everything was very good. Did notice ice machine gone, kind of missed it.

The location is very convenient for Ala Moana mall. Great views but very noisy at night. Bathrooms need updating as the shower is over the bath. We had a full kitchenette but no glassware, crockery or utensils are provided so what do you wash in the dishwasher?

I like the lay out, and it’s location. The entrance into the lobby is excellent with Starbucks, large sitting area, lobby to front desk is nice clean with friendly staff and also large area lots of chairs to hang out.

My biggest frustration here is that I can't just get a bowl of oatmeal and fruit for breakfast without paying $16.50+tax for a whole buffet. As a vegan, the oatmeal and fruit is basically all they offer. Seems so unhelpful and unfair to vegan guests.

This is a large modern hotel in Honolulu and it is the second time I have stayed there. Both time I have been the guest of Kaiser Permanente and my wife has had eye surgery. This is not the usual sort of hotel I would chose on my own.  The desk was efficient, the room was clean and in good repair. There was a refrigerator and a microwave in the room. There was a coffee maker, but only one coffee filter pack, so only one person could have coffee. Isn't that a strange bit of frugality. The only other thing I noticed was that the water from the tap was fairly unpleasant, although seemingly potable. I believe a hotel of this caliber should include a couple bottles of drinkable water in the room. That is my experience with hotels that charge a lot less. Otherwise, its next to a large mall and four blocks from the ocean.

Read my previous review. I felt cheated this stay. For my length of stay, the room was poor as there wasn’t even a chair to sit in. That room should be used for overnighters not someone on business for 5 days. Others in my traveling party had great accommodations, and when asked for something better, I was told there was none available. I felt cheated because I was a kamaaina.

I was very delighted of staying at the Ala Moana Hotel. Very good location, I had enjoy the Hawaii trip. Especialy, it was easy to transport to Ala Moana Shopping Center. I wish it would be better if it had shuttle bus to airport so it was perfect. I had enjoy the vacation and thank you very much.

recommended only if you need to be in that specific area of Honolulu. good Starbucks in the lobby. very busy hotel. rooms sufficiently sized, bed was good quality and firm, and sheets were soft but pillow were too hard. prompt response for housekeeping items, like extra blanket and laundry bags.

I reserved a room with two beds. Upon arrival I was told all such rooms were sold out. We were given a room with a tiny fold out. Once folded out, there was hardly any room in our room! They did not provide two single rooms, which they should have! Also, be aware that there is a giant construction site right accross the street from many of the rooms. So noisey and not romantic at all, if you were hoping for a vacation in paradise.

Perfect location for a business traveler who wants to be near good food, pretty beaches and shopping. Rental bicycles are available right up front, shopping mall with amazing food court is right next door and the beaches are within walking distance.

Just a few minutes from the mall, 15 minutes walking to ala moana beach, 30 minutes to waikiki. Excellent location with a great rooms. I found it very noisy but good internet and facilities. Its verg central close to walmart and obviusly next to the mall

A very good hotel to stay in in a excellent position for shopping, getting to waikiki beach, and many other attractions and activities in Hawaii. From the hotel it was easy to use transport like catching the public bus.

My wife and booked a room for our wedding anniversary and were really disappointed.First, our room was dirty. black hairs in the bathtub and rubbish can not emptied. We called downstairs and asked for another room. We were told to pack our bags and come downstairs to wait for a new room. When we got a new room, no upgrade was offered, no apology from the staff. Nothing. We waited about 20 minutes for the new room and when we went up the key card didn't work. I called from the courtesy phone by the elevator and was told to come down again. They told me I was using the key card wrong but I wasn't. After getting a new key I was unceremoniously dismissed and felt as if I was bothering the staff with my problem. I will never give this hotel my business again.

Always stay here. From valets to front desk to housekeeping, service is excellent. Wish rates were a little better, but you get what you pay for. Have stayed here numerous times & will always stay here.

Customer service was very rude. Hotel did not disclose deposit rates until I checked in and informed me that it was standard protocal for them not to disclose deposit rates. The deposit amount was just as much as 1 night stay

Service was great. Room was nice. Bed could have been a bit more comfortable. Location is downtown so be prepared to deal with traffic and one-way streets, not being able to make left/right turns during the busy traffic afternoons. Very convenient to shopping at Ala Moana mall. Overall, we were very happy with our stay and will probably stay at this hotel again next year.

The room was clean and quiet. The location was awesome. Parking was a little limited but still good. I wish the hot tub was right by the pool. The workers were all very polite and kind. I did try to request a late check out because my flight wasn't until 7:00pm and the girl on the phone said it wasn't possible, which is understandable. However when I checked out at the front desk the man at the front desk told me that I would be able to have a late check out but I had already taken everything out of the room. Not sure why one worker said I couldn't and one said I could. But with that said, Ala Moana is still a very nice hotel, great location and prices were ok.

My husband and I stayed here for one week. During that stay, we had to go back to the front desk every day sometimes twice a day because our room card didn’t work. At this hotel, you need room key in the elevator too. That is very inconvenient. I heard many people in the elevator complain about using room key because their card don’t work either. Front dest never say they are sorry. They just keep saying I may did something wrong with the room card which I didn’t.

Friendly staff and great location. Room was spacious. My kids loved the room. The pool not sooo much, could be upgraded. The price was kind of high, but I got a pretty good deal by searching almost everyday.

So first let me tell you about check in - it was horrible!!!!! We checked in on a Friday afternoon about 4:00. The line was incredibly long in addition to the wait time to actually get to the front desk. Once we checked in we went to our room and the room key didn't work so back down to the front desk we went. Also we had knat like bugs in our kitchen area. They did send someone to address the issue but not sure that it worked. I did have an excellent massage in the Spa room so that was a plus. They have some nice shops and are right next to a fantastic but very expensive open air mall,

First time to stay here. Was not sure what it would be like based on the price. Pulled up and was impressed immediately. From the Valet to the front desk everyone is very friendly and helpful. I needed a copy of a receipt from Starbucks and Gabriel went above and beyond to get it. Rooms are nice nut not over the top. Being connected to the mall and Japanese food Court are definite pluses.

I was attending a conference near to the Ala Moana hotel and I had my mother along for the trip. For me the the hotel was a quick walk to the hosting hotels for the conference and it was great for my mum to spend time in the shops. The Pink bus line was also a great advantage as it was near the hotel ( especially when travelling from Waikiki back to the hotel). The service was prompt and friendly.I would happily stay at the Ala Moana Hotel again.

Stayed for one night on business to see if things have improved...and they haven't. Had a Jnr Suite Ocean View but was actually an Ala Wai canal view. Bed was uncomfortable and linens wrinkled. TV was small and not adjustable so only viewable from small dining chair right in front. Pros- great valet staff, friendly housekeepers, great convenience store inside.

We live part of the year in Kona, and like to come over to Oahu for a change. We have stayed at the Ala Moana twice this year. This is a large hotel, with 36 floors affording great views of the ocean. It is also located adjacent to the Ala Moana Shopping Center, which is quite convenient. There is a beautiful harbor, large park and beach within walking distance. This hotel is under new ownership, and the rooms have been fairly recently renovated. We believe the rooms to be nice, although there is a bit of noise from adjoining rooms and hallway traffic. We opted for a larger suite at the end of the hallway, and it was terrific! The pool needs some updating, but is quite adequate for families. And the gym is large and nice. There is a beautiful new Starbucks off the large lobby which is quite convenient too. We just rode bikes around Waikiki, and then caught an Uber to get back to the hotel. Obviously, we would stay here again.

the hotel is very good located , have all the things you need near by, transportation, eating, shopping, the beds were very comfortable and that was very important , were tired and need a good rest for continuing our vacation, the staff was frienljy, they have storage luggage room, starbuucks coffe inside the hotel, a little convenience store with all u can need and more, they even have a hospitality room, that we were aloud to use at 6 pm the day we were leaving no charge at all, for taking a shower

I called to see if we could do an early check in and they were able to get us in, which was much appreciated. Our little ones were so tired and they needed the rest and was happy that Ala Moana was able to do there best to locate a room for us and get us in early. Rooms were clean; front desk and housekeeping were really nice. Will definitely come back again.

When we arrived at the hotel nothing like expect of course had a harder time with the show cause the knob couldn’t turn on the water, we had a kitchen yet the pots n pans was locked up like they tried to treat use like common thieves, I know I’m from Hawaii don’t mean to be treated that way. I paid almost $600 dollars just to have a kitchen that I couldn’t use. That’s a rip off. Close to the end of my trip I thought was 12pm check out oh boy was I Wong it was 11am. The house keeper came n explain to use it was 11am check out so I close the door n tried to get my things together. Within 10min the security guard came knocking on the door so I answered n all I can said is wow, he was the rudest security guard I ever seen like really who can gather all our things in 10min n he stood outside until we was finished gather our things like really again treat us like a common thrives again

I booked the Ala Moana Mantra Hotel for last 2 nights of or 3 week Hawaii adventure. I wanted somewhere close to the Ala Moana shopping Centre to keep my wife happy for the personal shopping time I had promised she could have at the end of our trip. (We'd already done 5 excellent nights on Waikiki Beach at the start of our trip) The hotel is literally connected to Ala Moana shopping centre by a ramp on the hotel 2nd floor that takes you (1min) to Macy's entry. The hotel is a main base for many international airlines crew accomodation. The hotel doesn't have all the 'bells and whistles' of the hotels down in Waikiki but it was fine for our needs of a family of 4 since we'd already done all the resorts and flash hotels. Uber to Waikiki from the hotel was about $7 - cheaper than 4 people on a trolley bus - never waited more than 2mins for an uber.Our room on the 27th floor (2723?) had a great 180degree sweeping views from the balcony - from mountainsides, across to Waikiki to the yacht harbour to the park.Checkin staff were friendly and efficient, in-room wifi internet included, Starbucks on the ground floor with a good shop for beer, food, drinks, souvenirs etc.

it was all good...the personal were all nice friendly lots of aloha...from the time we check in till we left everyone was nice and friendly.....i live off island and i like the hotel because it has a local feeling to its environment and atmosphere.....

Great location, service, and pricing.Can get all you want from Hawaii but away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki.Very convenient with Starbucks and a mini mart in the lobby that's open to 11:30 PM.And of course, the convenience of being able to walk to the Shopping Center, Walmart, Don Quixote...

I enjoyed my stay at the hotel. I had booked it to celebrate my birthday. Parking space is limited, but you can just walk to the shopping mall for anything. From Check in to Check out the service was excellent. Rooms were perfect as expected. Would love to come back.

For convenience and easy commute to Airport this property has many useful qualities. Many shops and restaurants are right next to the hotel. Waikiki is easily accessible if you choose but keeps you out of the congestion of Waikiki area.

Use the ramp that connects to the shopping mall for convenience. Proximate to the beach and Waikiki. There is a restaurant that is nice on the top floor. The pool and fitness center are very clean and accommodating.

Kindly recognize our housekeeper who was assigned to our room 1912 Oct 4-10, 2017. She was excellent, thorough, friendly and made our stay comfortable and memorable. Mahalo.Please update me when recognition is done. Thank you!Also, Judy - Hotel Operations. Unfortunately, we did not get to meet in person but Judy is responsible for the 10 score given during our stay. Judy made special arrangements to accommodate personal requests - making your hotel #1 in customer service and satisfaction, in my opinion. Mahalo, Judy. Please recognize her efforts as well and update me.Mahalo. ALOHA! Ruby MANAWIS, Sacramento, California

Check-in service was average, room was very adequate for the night, cleanliness of room was average (my coffee maker was filled with water), location was great and very central for meeting with family and friends that day/evening.

The bridge which connects going to the mall was a big help. Nice restaurant and better that they have Starbucks in the lobby. securiry is good and safe hotel. I will recommend this hotel to my family and friends. thanks

Awesome ocean view room overlooking Ala Moana Beach and Waikiki. The room may be a little small but was good enough to have a good night rest. I like the Starbuck and Bar on the ground floor snd always enjoy Rumors night Club.

Perfect location for business and pleasure. Shopping made easy and staff full of Aloha. Wanted a shuttle to the airport and bell captain gave me options and calls to. On from shuttle for me. He even found me in lobby when shuttle van arrived.

All staff were very polite and helpful. Was given outstanding service the whole two weeks we were there. the facilities were clean and well cared for. Staff provided information for great deals on sight seeing and places to go.

Very good service . This hotel always convenient for shopping and transportation needs. Room was ready early. good size room with amenities such as microwave, coffee maker and refrigerator. got excellent service at the front desk. Buffet was bountiful and delicious. Would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family.

Overall excellent facilities and services, however, long lines at the front office made it difficult to get quick questions and requests addressed. It would have been helpful and alleviate frustrations to have some sort of guest/concierge desk to handle quick tasks like leaving keys or parking passes for guests arriving after initial check-in.

Hair everywhere. Good location, tho. Oh, and crud on the coffee mugs. Yuck. Love the location and service, but I’ll have to consider other locations.. cause hairy rooms are a no-go. Right next to Ala Moana shopping center.
