Your employees who clean the rooms are always very courteous and very pleasant. Rooms are very clean just needs updating. Location very convenient and centralized for shopping, eating, beach and Waikiki.

Good location and value for a business hotel away from the Wakiki craziness. Convenient to the Ala Moana mall and beach access at the park. Good staff...boring pool and deck that closes early. Small rooms but very clean.

Stay was okay except for lines at checking in and out of hotel. Room was nice, location is excellent, parking was great, and the people working were very cordial. Sometimes elevators took sometime to arrive but it was okay.

excellent personnel service from valet greeting at unloading pineapple cases and baggage to the garden lanai, setup, food, banquet service, waikiki tower room, rummers night club, very clean rooms and foyer areas we will return again ands again we love the hop and skip to ala mona shopping center

The hotel was clean, the beds were comfortable, and customer service was outstanding. It is a short walk to the trolley and Ala Moana Mall. There is a beautiful park and public beach with free parking 2 blocks from the hotel.

We stayed for 2 nights with 3 families. Have comfortable bed, great pool, Starbucks was an easy breakfast and close to areas we wanted to visit. Shops close so waking was easy for meals and sight seeing in evening.

This stay was short and was used more as a way to relax and catch up on some good nights sleep. We got the Kamaaina special with breakfast and parking. We usually stay at ala Moana hotel at least a weekend every other month, and like always it’s a simple and convienent stay. Close to a lot of food places. And easy to get around.

Stayed twice before. Like the location. Pretty much all the shops were in walking distances as well as some restaurants. Just wish had better pillows tho. Overall it was a great stay. Will be making more reservations in the future

Our stay was good other than the trash underneath one of the beds from the previous stay. To check in the line was very long so it was a very long wait with only 3 workers at the desk. But when I got to the front the worker was very nice:

Excellent service, good location clean rooms , good restaurants, good food Great help from the front desk, thank you Iwalani Segara who helped us through this difficult time of our trip. Housekeeping wasalso helpful to our needs

Didn't see much in the way of security personnel, but I did feel safe and looked-after. The hotel is located very convenient for shopping and site seeing. I would like to see beer on tap in the 36th floor bar/restroom.

Ala Moana is always my go to hotel for Honolulu. The staff is friendly and usually very accommodating. I wish the hotel would provide Hawaiian Miles for those of us who are Kama`aina. The rooms are nicely appointed but could definitely be cleaner. This hotel has always been a good value for the price. The pool could use a renovation and potted plants for a nice ambience.

The staff, service, and accommodations are great; the location is perfect for business and shopping. The valet parking is a bonus and is worth the money but is not necessary if you want to park your own or Uber during your stay.

I did my lodging at Ala Moana Hotel by Mantra because I attended a conference at Hawaii Convention Center. The location is very convenient and the staff are friendly. I was a little disappointed that they no longer do room service, but the man at the front desk did let me know about an app I could download to get delivery from different restaurants around the area.

I would recommend anyone to stay here. Great location and so convenient to shop at Ala Moana Shopping Center. And love the restaurant and Rumors to eat and have fun at one location. I think we will be here more often.

will certainly stay at this hotel again; very convenient location near the beach as well as the huge shopping center with parking. No problems to mention. The drive way to pick up hotel guests areroomy enough that there is no congestion.

I believe the Ala Moana Hotel is not conducive to holding reunions due to the small suite which we had reserved to be used for our hospitality activities. I also encountered another glitch when upon checking in, my room was not ready even when I was there at the check in time..3:00 p.m.

Very noisy room and really uncomfortable bed. The room was old and there was no room service or any toilet ammenities whatsoever. Not even a kettle! We had no sleep that night thanks to this hotel!!!!

It would be nice to have the Kamaaina special always include the 2 complimentary breakfasts and the complimentary parking. That made it an added value the 3 other previous times we have stayed at the Ala Moana Hotel.

The stay was short but the staff made it great. From check in to check out, my girlfriend and I enjoyed everything we could just wish there was room service just to make it easier sometimes. Other than that everything was great. Thank you and your team for an awesome experience.

The workers are very nice. We had the Kama'Aina special package and it was well worth it. Free breakfast, they could have happier workers in the plantation cafe, they all looked stressed out! It was a great weekend for my wife and I

Had a great stay in a comfortable room. Didn't take advantage of the other facilities but other guest seemed to be happy with the workout room, etc. Same for restaurants. Sad to hear that Royal Garden is closing.

Over all a nice hotel, clean, close to the Mall, deceit gym, and friendly staff. But at check out, the lines are super long, with one agent...maybe check out time should be at 1pm, when there are more agents present

Martin Mamuyac , Crime Stoppers USA Conference check-in 9-16, check-out 9-23-17 We entered the elevator and immediately experienced problems with our electronic keys, not allowing us access to our floor. A guest used their card to press the 8th floor. Once we got to our room 833 again issues with the electronic keys. Finally got one to work after 10 minutes or trying when we are already tired from traveling. The room was very clean, with lots of amenities. We did not realize when checking in that we were next to a construction zone and became annoyed that we were awoken Monday thru Friday with construction noises staring at 7 am. No compensation for this inconvenience. I went to get ice and walked all around the 8th floor. Finally called the front desk who referred me to housekeeping. I said I did not want them to bring me ice just need to know where the ice machine was hiding. We were informed our ice machine for the 8th floor was on the 6th floor. So went to the 6th floor and located the ice machine then it was playing the elevator lotto to see how many times I would have to to try the electronic key to get back to my floor.The electronic keys became an issue almost every morning when we used the gym. The gym facility itself was great. The door access was a different story. Usually someone already inside would see others struggling at the door and would stop their workout to open the doors or would wait for another guest who may have a magic key open the gym door.We enjoyed the restaurant just outside the front door on several occasions. Food, and service were very good.On Wednesday we came back to the hotel around 4 pm and learned by trial and error that we were completed locked out of the elevator and our room. I had to wait in the check-in line for 40 minutes to find out we had been checked out because they never connected our extended stay with our original check-in. Not pleasant.We used your concierge a few times. They were good to check us into a show in a nearby hotel and  for lining up a vehicle rental. They seemed to be less than helpful in finding us information about the local bus lines and schedules. Not sure why. Your staff in the lobby, our business events, housekeeping and at check-in were sincere, helpful and professional.

Also we went to Happy Hour...food and drinks were wonderful!The staff were very professional and friendly...it was a great time for me and my family! Also the view from the restaraunt was outstanding....I will definitely come back to this resort!

I'm very disappointed in this hotel. I stayed here a month ago and had a great room with a lanai. This time they gave me a room the is overlooking the mall parking lot and you listen to cars honking and doors slamming all night. Not to mention the brightly lit parking lot. No lanai and the room is half the size of my last one. No price difference. I've attempted to change and they won't move me. Extremely disappointed.

This was my first time staying at your hotel what an Awesome experience. I really appreciate the fast and friendly service of the hotel employees and clean room! the view was a plus. I will definitely plan to stay at Ala moana hotel in the future. Thank You.

I called Housekeeping immediately after arriving at my room to let them know that there was trash all over the floor and that the beds weren't completely made. I was told someone would come up immediately. No one came or called.

Good location and nice rooms, but one side of the hotel is not very conducive for sleeping past 5:30 AM. Garbage pickup or something of the sort takes place at 5:30 AM and work on the new high rise next door begins at 6:00 AM. Two cranes and hundreds of workers are interesting but not good for sleep past 6:00 AM.

The price is a bit much for the value. Rooms are very small, and the beds need to be upgraded. The pool area is nice. Parking, although at a cost is nice to have. Convenience to Ala Moana Beach Park and mall are nice features.

The Ala Moana hotel has a fabulous staff. So friendly and going above and beyond at every interaction. If you’re looking for a clean, friendly, price friendly hotel. Then the Ala Moana is your place. Thank you

I liked the beautiful view from the room I was given. I didn't like that a used towel from the previous guest was hanging in the bathroom. The housekeeper was very sorry that this was an oversight. Her apology was accepted. She was very helpful and quick in providing other items that was needed.

Ala Moana Hotel is conveniently located for many highlighted places to visit. Being connected to the Ala Moana Shopping Center is a plus! There are many eating places surrounding this hotel. The service is local style by local people…with aloha!

Some loose crooked fixtures but other than that my preferred place to stay . Been staying here for years . I like the convenience of being close to shops and eateries,restaurants etc . Employees always kind and friendly

If you're a Hawai`i resident, take advantage of the Kama`aina rates. Easy access to shopping at Ala Moana and many restaurants within walking distance! Highly recommend staying here for couples and families.

It was a nice short stay, I wish you might have had room service as I am disabled and would like to have had breakfast in the room. Other then that I had a nice stay as I stated above and I would stay there again.

Close to home not crowded like Waikiki food &a rooms were awesome. Buffet was great room view spectacular parking at hotel was great rooms were clean & pull out exter bed television got lots of channels to choice from

Loved the small comfort of the room for two with a queen/king size bed. My boyfriend and I had a very relaxing time and pretty much slept like babies the two nights we stayed. The view we had wasn't all that great, but it didn't matter that much because we stayed in the air condition the whole time.

Great new selection of ice & purified water great idea, we filled our flask atleast 3 times daily from the machine. In addition, we had a great view of the Aloha Festivals parade, the convention attendees who stayed on property all had the same response

The location of the hotel is excellent. The Ala Moana Shopping Center is just steps away. It has lots of good variety of eatery around the hotel area. Both the yachting marina and the public buses stop is across the street. You can even catch the bus to go to the airport for $2.50, senior is only $1.

I was forced to book a higher priced room because both of my sons were over 18. However the room seemed basically the same as the other tower and there were only towels/glasses for two in spite of my booking a party of three. What was my extra expense for?

This was my first time staying at the Ala Moana Hotel. The Room was large, clean and perfect for my stay. As a former Resident of Honolulu I greatly Appreciated the Location of the hotel to the places I wanted to go. I was a 10 minute drive from My Alma Mater (Chaminade). My commute to work located near the airport at 7am only took me about 30 minutes to get there. Food and Shopping was of course only minutes walk away.I was able to navigate from my room in the 11th floor to the parking garage and out to the road with ease.Having Starbucks and the Plantation Cafe as easy options for breakfast was a plus.Only concern was that I could not find a light switch for the main part of my room.

Great location next to Ala Moana shopping center and a short walk to restaurants and bus stops nearby.The rooms are clean and spacious enough .The AC system was quieter and more effecient than in other hotels I've stayed in around the Waikiki areaStaff are very friendly and helpful.Stayed here twice and will do so again.

Terence and Janelle at front desk were very accommodating and very professional. Balcony needs cleaning. Ice bucket was a little rusty. Bathroom door was a bit old. Overall, it was a good place to stay. We will definitely stay here again.

Convenient location to shopping and an excellent layover spot before departing for a cruise. If you are up to a challenge you can easily walk to Waikiki. Plenty to see, shop and eat. In the other direction there are several interesting museums.

Peaceful, clean and quiet room with internet access and desk area to work from if you need to get some additional work done before bed. It was great to have a mini shopping mall downstairs as it included gift and clothing shops, a convenience store and a Starbucks!

This hotel is pleasant enough, a bit older and worn around the edges (not very many charging ports, for instance) but very well placed. It's just across the street from the large Ala Moana shopping center, which means there are stores and food courts very nearby. The room itself seemed a bit sparse. I was kind of surprised they offered no bottles of water. The view from an upper balcony showed us a nearby marina and lots of activity down below on the streets, but it was fairly quiet. For my part I didn't like smelling cigarette smoke when out on the balcony; it had to be coming from a nearby room. We were only here one night but would certainly consider returning.

This was a great experience. The hotel was beautiful, the staff was helpful and friendly. We had a little difficulty with opening our room door but other than that the rest was great. The room was comfortable and spacious.

I found a great value price on a flash sale, booked it and was very happy. My boyfriend and I came up for business and leisure. He had meeting with WESPAC fisheries Thurs/Friday and the weekend was relaxation/mini vaca. We enjoy staying at your hotel, although this stay we got stuck into a very small room. I guess that's what you get when you get sale prices. Very disappointing.

Not Good and I will never recommend the Ala Moana Hotel. I will also let Kaiser Travel know not to ever put a handicapped person at your hotel. I found out later that there is an elevator from the lobby to the bottom of the garage, not one of your personnel advised me of that.

I've been staying at Ala Moana Hotel for a long time, as a staycation, business, etc. Location is great, price is good for kama'aina, Round Table pizza delivers free here (love pizza). Overall, I will continue to use this hotel.

Whether staying on business or pleasure, the Ala Moana Hotel does an excellent job in providing a clean, convenient and affordable room in the middle of Honolulu. I can highly recommend them on all facets of hospitality. Mahalo!

I was not impressed with the room. The bathroom was too small, hard to maneuver and clostorphobic. Had trouble sleeping because I could hear people in the hallway and rooms next to us. The A/C was awesome.

The only thing i would change is have better comforters, offer discount to restaurants, quiter ac. Have better breakfast buffets item. Everything else was up to par. Service was good. Everyone was very friendly.

The hotel is very conveniently located for shopping. The rooms are nicely renovated with comfortable beds. The breakfast buffet is quite good. The pool is not anything special. Overall, this is a good value.

The room was clean, and the location was convenient to Ala Monana shopping center. Wish you had your restaurant opened for dinner at the hotel. Parking is a problem for customers of the hotel on Saturday night when you return at night to park. You can't find parking space.

absolutely enjoyed our stay and will definetely return again. Great location, close to lots of shopping, food, and great nightlife. We were able to watch a beautiful Aloha Week Parade during our visit too.

Whenever there is a need for our family to stay overnight in Honolulu, we book it here, the place where kamaaina can afford and relax. It's location is so convenient being next to the AM shopping center. And we love having Starbucks and Runors night club downstairs!

Excellent hotel to stay at. Good location, very close to the Ala Moana shopping centre. So really great places to eat near by. Hotel is very clean and comfortable. We had a view with a good view looking out towards the water.

Quiet hotel! I didn't realize that I never saw any kids here - and this hotel was full and it was so quiet! Advantage- you can self park instead of valet - no waiting for the car! It's on the edge of the mall, which made it so convenient to get things quickly. Tons of food choices and shopping. Front desk was very attentive and location excellent! A great option to Waikiki.

The service at check in was perfect. Jonnell is the main reason for the good review. She answered all my questions and we got to chit chat for a little while while she checked me in. She upgraded our room with the bed size I asked for last minute.

This hotel experience was very disappointing. The Bell Hop staff stood and watched my wife and I carry 5 bags up the hill of the driveway from the shuttle. They never offered to help. We are both close to 60. The front desk staff was talking about non-business related stuff for about 4 minutes before they acknowledged us. These 2 experiences were very unprofessional. The hotel is dated as well. Overall it was a very poor experience. We are on our way back to Honolulu and we will not stay at your hotel again.

This hotel is CONNECTED to the Ala Moana shopping center, is within walking distance to Walmart, Sam's Club, Ross, and the Waikiki Convention Center. The room has free wifi, a frige and MICROWAVE. When we go on vacation we eat at great restaurants and usually bring leftovers back to the room where there's a frige to prevent spoilage but no way to reheat them, so this was a very pleasant surprise. There's an ice machine on each floor and the valet parking is for a very reasonable rate. Compared to the other hotels in Waikiki, you could get better but would have to pay TWICE as much. Nowadays hotels all have flow restricted showers but this one has very adequate pressure and even a bath tub (these are disappearing from hotels more and more).  The workout room has dumbbells and Cybex type machines, treadmills, dry and wet saunas, and even a yoga area with mats you can use for free.The only complaint I had was our room was "ocean view" but you could only see the ocean from the balcony looking far to the right. A more accurate description would be "partial ocean view."That aside, this was definitely the most bang for my buck, I recommend it highly, and will go there again!

The constraints of the room size should warrant lower price points for kamaaina customers if you want return visits. Bed was not firm and bathroom very tight. The parking pass should be flexible enough for local conference attendees who are arriving for an 8am class, staying overnight, and attending an 8-5 class the following day.

I would highly recommend this hotel the co workers and friends. Nice area near everything within walking distance. Super friendly hotel staff and even maids made me happy with the cleanliness of our room everyday

As always, Ala Moana Hotel is the most convenient location to stay in Honolulu. Located nest to Ala Moana Shopping Center makes shopping and dining so accessible and enjoyable. Easy self-parking. Rooms are clean and comfortable!

a great place to stay ..houskeeping was excellent ..service as well...from frt desk to restaurants.to bell hops etc....would stay there again in a heartbeat...much appreciated to make our stay great...lower level restaurant waitress tracy was outstanding..she was a bonus on our vacation..we loved her...

The Ala Moana Hotel has a very vibrant yet relaxing atmosphere. The hotel staff reflect the "Ohana Spirit" of Hawaii and they go out of their way for you in any way necessary. The location is fantastic!

Reasonably priced hotel with breakfast included. Similar to other Honolulu hotels, taxes, fees and parking are all added on and expensive. Pedestrian bridge to Ala Moana mall is very convenient. Ala Moana Park is a short walk away. Great Signature Steakhouse with view on 36th floor. Excellent staff and ambiance. Starbucks in lobby, which my wife loved!

In need of reservations on short notice, do not hesitate to call reservation, you will find very friendly and helpful staff.Great location with direct ramp access to Ala Moana Shopping Center, one of the largest shopping malls in the US.

Enjoyable stay. Staff were personable and professional. Location ideal for combining business and pleasure. Love that your Starbucks serves beer in afternoon/evening. Looking forward to next visit when I return to Hawaii.

Convenient location to and from my training sites in Waikiki and downtown. Relatively quiet area. And room was up to date. Front desk staff was very helpful and pleasant. Check out was quick and easy.

Everything was good. However I I haven't stayed in this hotel for years. Only thing is, I wish they'd have more comfy comfortors. Staff was good but needs to smile a little more. I love that there's a Starbucks now. Overall, my stay was good.

You folks are always amazing, we love your front desk staff, if you could please look up who checked us in we would really love to recognize him!! Always awesome staying here. We are kamaaina and you folks always make us feel important. Your rooms are always clean

Clean and comfy room. Complimentary self-parking and breakfast buffet for two was very convenient. Self-parking was easy. Check in was easy. The breakfast buffet was not fancy but it has all the basics that you'd want for breakfast.

Had a great experience at Ala Moana Hotel. Check in was easy and fast. We were able to get our room keys and our kamaaina perks that came with booking that weekend. Breakfast buffet was great both days. Will definitely recommend.

room was really clean and parking readily available. We enjoyed the convenience of having Ala Moana Shopping Center within walking distance and Starbucks located in the lobby. Thank you for this opportunity to stay in your hotel! We really enjoyed our visit although it was too short!

I stay here often for work when I come to Oahu. It's a great value and they offer nice discounts for locals (holding a HI ID card). It's right across from the Ala Moana shopping center which is convenient. Plus the mall has many restaurants so you'll have dinner options within walking distance too.The rooms are pretty basic, but clean and in good condition. It's not a fancy hotel, so if you're looking for a resort experience then it won't match up. But this is a great place to stay if you're on a budget. There's a Starbucks in the lobby and meeting rooms on the 2nd floor. Plus it's just a block or two from the convention center.Be sure to book early if you're coming for an event. Also, I've heard it's a great place to stay on Thanksgiving to be close to the mall for Black Friday.

On the Friday, We left at 8 am and came back at 3 and out room wasn't set up so I just asked for towels instead of her coming in and setting up our beds it was no sense of doing it if we were already back...

When checking in, the gentleman at the front desk (didn't get his name) was rude and had an attitude. When I called the front desk over the phone to check out, that gentleman was rude as well. The only good customer service I received was from bellhop & housekeeping when they said "Goodbye!" & "Have a nice day."

Pay the extra and stay on the beach. This place is old and the employess arent very nice either. Ck in lines long and never moved. No one in the lobby to advise of problems and room was just ok. Next time will pay the extra and stay on beach

We decided to go on a mini vacation for the weeked and we stayed here at alamoana hotel because it has always been a favorite hotel of ours. When we got there the staff checking us in was beyond rude like that didn't want to be there. We got to our room the AC would not get cold, we didn't have any towels when we arrived, The refrigerator was also making a loud noise. Verry dissappointed this time around!

The Hotel and the service we received was great. The only concern I had was the location of the hotel, the surround area was a little dirty and unappealing. The people we encountered were welcoming and made it a very good experience, this was my first time to Hawaii and I would recommend the hotel to family and friends.

Great location near Hawaii Convention Center and Ala Moana Shopping Center, and along Waikiki beach. Close enough to airport. Room was clean. Amenities provided were good. I would choose to stay there again.

Perfect location, great and friendly staff, will recommend and come stay again. Perfect for vacations and stay-cations. We had an amazing time. Everything was just perfect. Room was clean and spacious.

Great location....walking distance to Ala Moana Shopping center, Convention Center, Ala Moana beach and the city bus. I understand there is an airport shuttle although I did not use it this time around.

This was our first time staying at the Ala Moana. We've been there many times for events but this was our first time as guests. All was great, room, breakfast, pool area and the special Kamaina rate. I can highly recommend it.

We like staying at Ala Moana Hotel because it is away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki but still close enough to the Beach and other sights. Parking and access to main roads is better as Waikiki is a series of one way streets to get in and out of. That being said the Ala Moana Hotel has seen its better days. The hotel is definitely getting worn down and in need of a major overhaul. It seems popular with many Airline flight teams and business people as it is right across the street from Convention center. Pluses are Starbucks in Lobby and location next to Mall and off Waikiki Restaurants which tend to be cheaper. Adequate free Wi-Fi in rooms. No Hot tub at pool and Bathroom amenities are minimal compared to other hotels. We had no problem with room key working but several people were having problems as key is needed to work elevator to go up to room.

Very convenient especially when you have a function to attend too. Parking is reasonable. Staff is very friendly and shows lots of "Aloha". Hotel is walking distance to the shopping mall (Ala Moana Shopping Center). Overall great for families and business people.

Fast and easy check in/out. Rooms were clean, however due to it being a week me and a busy one at that, if your not back at the hotel by 4pm you may have a hard time finding parking. Although there are many dinner options at the hotel and alamoana shopping center is connected so you also have that option.

Excellent customer service but dirty bathroom. Complimentary breakfast was descent. Overall average. If it wasn't for Rumors we'd probably stay else where. The Front Desk staff were wonderful and very polite upon check in and out.

The Entire hotel went through a renovation. The cool tones made it very inviting and cozy. I was in the Kona tower, these rooms are smaller and only has 13 floors. As much as possible, request a room away from their vending machines and ice machines. I forgot to add that as one of my requests, however i did get the King bed as i requested. The lobby is very modern and it and welcoming. They could have more front desk staff during check in, i well over 45 minutes before i got to the counter. This was my staycation destination and i will return to this property again.

The hotel was very nice and clean and the front desk service was adequate. But the bell hop service and the valet was terrible. This surprised us because we have stayed here many times and have never had this much problems with them. Waited over an hour for bell hop service that never came and when we got to the lobby they were just standing there talking story. Valet didn't give us back our ticket on a return trip and then misplaced our keys for about half an hour.

I chose this hotel because it was close to the Hawaii Convention Ctr where I had a conference this weekend. The location was excellent but the room was smaller than I was expecting. Grand children loved the pool and going to the mall was a treat to visit after not going there in the last 5 years.

Very clean. large room .close to shops and easy proximity to Waikiki Beach . Free WiFiThe only thing lacking was a Poolside Bar. It would have been nice to have a cocktail whilst sunbathing. Easy check in. Reception very helpful

The place is very well located and has the basic amenities for a traveler whether family or otherwise. Staff is very friendly in Hawaii, it is right next to the Ala Moana centre which helps with everything, shopping, eating out

There is no where on the property to get food or drinks after 10pm. $20 per night parking Room cards kept not working- 4 times in 8 daysReservation desk gets very very backed up- needs a rep for already reserved guests

Arriving to the hotel the check-in was slowing at the front desk. All employees was friendly and courteous and helpful. Great locations. The activities person helped us to booked activities. We do a helicopter tour around the island of Oahu, it was excellent.

I was assigned to a room that had not yet been prepared after the previous guest left. Balcony door was wide open, beds were disheveled having been slept in, etc. I called the front desk from the room and was told I had to return. I had to haul my luggage back down to the desk to receive a different room. Besides that snafu, the remainder of the stay was fine.

We decided to stay at the Ala Moana Hotel because of it's price and location. We haven't stayed here in a long time. It was nice even if they stuck us locals in the Kona Tower. Rooms a little on the small side.

Our fave place to stay in Honolulu. Great location - next door to shopping/food, and close to the wonderful Ala Moana Beach Park for morning walks. We had brought deep dish pizzas from Chicago for friends which fit easily into the fridge until we could deliver them.

Except for a noisy bar fridge & the construction site start time all was well. The staff at check in, concierge & the Plantation Cafe were very helpful & friendly. The location to the Ala Moana shops & restaurants made the location of the hotel very convenient

The room was clean and housekeeping staff was excellent andthe front desk staff was very helpful.It is so close to the shopping center that it was easy to shop. Using your key to access the elevators made us feel safe.

Overall very good. Bed were a little firm. It was very clean. Service was good but they did not seem to want to move us when we asked for a room higher up because of our view of a parking lot. Wouldn't help us over the phone we had to go down stairs and ask in person but they did move us to the 12th floor after that.

Every thing was good except for the check-in process. We liked the location as it was Walking distance to Ala Moana Shopping Center and to where we had our meeting. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The price was reasonable.

I stay here whenever I come to Oahu. Location is central and just a quick walk from the second floor to the mall. Staff are always courteous and friendly. And there's even a Starbucks in the lobby now that opens bright and early.

Clean and comfortable. Steakhouse on top is very good -priceyNo coffee shop or lunch place on site. Easy walk to shopping center if what u r looking for. Starbucks in lobby has lines for service especially in morning. Airline crew layover hotel

Excellent location to Ala Moana Mall - reasonable rates and great staff.Will return many more times..and highly recommend the hotel to anyone stopping over on Ohau for few days. Star Bucks for a quick breakfast in the lobby is likewise ideal.

This hotel is in good location to Ala Moana mall, and walking distance to Waikiki beach attractions, it's not on a par with the Waikiki hotels but if you are looking for a hotel with good gym and pool and close to awesome shopping it's good. House keeping bit inconsistent and its probably time the hotel had a reburbish. Bed was comfortable.

Hotel is very good for business travel especially with meetings at Hawaii Convention Center. Close proximity makes it very comfortable to walk to shopping and dinning. Great options to save a few dollars on meals.

This deal was a really good deal Thank you so much for the complimentary breakfast and parking. Although it was short it was so relaxing for me Thank you for a wonderful stay the only thing was when we requested for late check out but I asked at the time of check in but I had to call back in the morning to see if we could check out late but it was unavailable.

Standing in line at check in....... I was up next and I noticed that one of the guest reception employee was not with a guest. I was still in line, I ask him at a distance if he was free. He just gave me a blank stare and avoided me and said nothing! The other guest standing behind me waiting to be assisted said, "Wow, I guess he's not talking". Very strange experience/

The location is ideal for my needs when on Oahu. With Ala Moana Shopping Center next door, I never worry that I've forgotten to pack something- Macy's is right there and Long's Drugs is a pleasant stroll down the mall. The line at the lobby's Starbucks can be long in the morning, so give yourself 10 minutes to get your fix. I've only eaten in the upstairs restaurant once, but it was yummy. Generally, I prefer to hit the Shirokiya Market, and there is a fridge in the room if I have leftovers. The hotel is not new, but it is well maintained and truly, the hotel staff is lovely. They are always helpful, welcoming and kind.

The hotel was great with no issues whatsoever regarding staff, the room etc. It is a large hotel so our interactions with staff were limited. They were always helpful & courteous! Location is great. Easy access to Ala Moana (of course) but equally to Waikiki either by bus, trolley or walking (for the more active).

The hotel was comfortable, clean and lots of AlohaFrom drive up to check in was terrificOne of your front desk agent Yvette Iwalani Segovia was an outstanding person she was very cordial, Helpful with my handicap room she's such asset to the Ala Moana Mantra Hotel staff.Overall a very impressive stay...we'll be back next year for our 40th Wedding AnniversaryMahalo to all your staff great job everyone!!!

The hotel staff were friendly and helpful and the hotel was clean and well kept. I would stay here anytime and would recommend this hotel to all my friends and family. The location was perfect and the parking easy.

Ask for water view and higher floor. Hotel is right next to wonderful shopping mall with huge food court. Beach is just a couple blocks away. Easy access to bus transportation if needed. Lots to do and see within a mile's walk. Loved the large Starbucks in lobby. Pool has 9 ft depth at one end which was very nice but pool wasn't open after dusk which was unfortunate.

Room was good, Staff from bellmen, front desk, Signature dinner staff and cafe staff were helpful and went out of their way to take care of us. We had the Kamaaina special and totally will do this again We will definately come back

I've stayed at your property many of times due to the convenience of my needs. However, your rooms are starting to look run down and could use some upgrading, especially the bathroom. Front desk clerk was very pleasant. Big mahalo's

Service was good except that the hotel didn't do anything about my complaint. Clearly there was someone smoking marijuana as the smell was so strong even the housekeeper mentioned that she was having a headache from smelling it. I'm pregnant and I could barely breathe as I passed through the hall and was concerned about my health. Wishing they had done something about it.

good times great location i would stay there again and again and agian. very friendly staff. the rooms were very clean, the view was outstanding. Rumors nightclub right in the hotel, plantation cafe for breakfast. Starbucks right in the lobby, also steps away from the largest shopping mall in the state.

Is it posssible to request a room with a walk in shower. I was able to get into the shower but had difficulty getting out of the tub. Also the shower did not drain well. We really were impressed with the breakfast provided. It was a highlight of our stay.

The walls must be very thin (or my neighbors must have been very loud) because I could hear almost everything going on in the next room. Honestly, I didn't even mind. It was really fun to eavesdrop on the drama haha~

Top notch hotel. Beautiful views of mountains or ocean. Very clean. 1 block from the beach. Right next to huge mall with multiple food courts. Only complaint is the bathroom is too small. Staff were friendly and helpful.

Normally stay there around 30 days a year, staff treats you family, rooms are clean, Convenience store has fresh food, close to Ala Mona shop center, staff always helpful and there to help, mostly there for business trips and they have everything you may need to keep your trip productive

I've stayed here multiple times over the past few years and have never had a bad stay. The staff is efficient yet friendly and everyone goes out of their way to make your stay enjoyable. With the exception of slow Wi-Fi, the hotel amenities are perfect for my needs.

Always a great place to stay and I appreciate the positive and helpful customer service. I have stayed here multiple times and will do so again as well as recommending it to others. Convenient for bisiness. Thank you again.

The reception desk workers are not very friendly. They make you feel like you are bothering them. The valet workers and maids are extremely nice and very helpful, but hotel needs to work on their customer service with their front line staff. Some of them were very rude.

Somewhat small rooms. Wifi in room only. No smoking on your room's balcony. Skimped a little on the coffee fixens. One coffee per day. Pool closes at sunset. Beautiful and well maintained. Excellent staff. Very friendly, courteous and attentive.

From the week before check in throughout our stay, they need to learn customer service and respect to their customers. The local customers were treated very different from the tourist and not in a good way. Everyone should be treated the same. Most were not very friendly and it was like we were bothersome to them. Will be writing a letter to the General Manager.

The wait to check-in was a bit of an issue. I like the proximity to the center to get a bite to eat. I had a good stay. The parking attendant was very nice and helpful. She was genuine, and a joy to speak with

Roaches in my room, front desk never answered the phone when i tried calling them for a question i had. When checking in dont do so during the 3oclock hour. You will have to wait. I waited for 47 mins from the moment I stood in line to getting my keys.

Room was clean and comfortable. AC worked well. Breakfast buffet was ok, could have had more choices. Great location next to Ala Moana shopping center, which has many good food choices. Be sure to check out the new Shirokiya Food Village and the new Foodland market. From Ala Moana, which is a 10 minute walk from hotel, you can take the Pink Line bus to Waikiki, for $2 per person, each way.

My reservations were made for 6 people. (4 adults; 2 children) Much to our dismay we had towels for only 3 and had to call housekeeping to get the rest of the towels. when we returned to the room almost 11 at night only to find no beddings or linens for the hide-a-bed and to have to call housekeeping again. We found these to be inconveniences and the accommodations should have been taken cared of ahead of time. My grandchildren had to sleep on the cushions from the hide-a-bed on the floor. Needless to say I did not appreciate that at all.

It was a pleasure stay.a bad thing was that our room was near a building in construction so the noise starts early in the morning. The daylight becomes from the top of the window...we used pillows to cover it

Hotel is very convenient...located close to Ala Moana, as well as other popular locations.Some of the front desk employees were super nice...one male, not-so-much.The room was nice and clean...only 1 issue, the shower curtain smelled of mildow or mold.

Our room overlooked a major construction site. We were not forewarned of this or compensated for it in any way. The housekeeping service was also quite poor. We waited 3 days just to get tissues in our room after requesting them on day 2.

Hotel staffs are most helpful and curtious Room is clean with adequate amenities.Decoration and color scheme is most pleasant and comfortable.Best value for the location .This hotel is our first recommendation for out of town friends.

The hotel was a great place to stay for my scuba diving vacation. The room was very clean and your hotel staff very friendly. Value for money excellent and the location of Starbucks is a bonus for breakfast.

Very nice stay at the hotel. Service from staff, including front desk, housekeeping & valet was excellent. Room was ready when promised, in great condition and well stocked. Conveniently located for the purpose of my trip.

The hotel was great. The room was nice. The staff was awesome. It's Not too crowded. It's quiet and not loud. I like the plantation cafe. Thanks for the complimentary breakfast. The food was great. I like the pool and the gym.

I have stayed at AMHotel several times and am always very satisfied. I wish there was a nice, affordable restaurant on the property tho. For me it is a staycation, my sister travels from the mainland to visit and the location of your hotel is very convenient for all the activities she plans.

My husband and I had a wonderful stay at Ala Moana Hotel by Mantra, due to the exceptional staff you employ. Our warmest aloha and mahalo to Joe at the reception desk, Thomas the doorman and his staff, the bellmen, and the housekeepers. You treated us like valued family and we are most appreciative. Keep up the great work -- we will definitely return soon!

I see mostly frequent business travelers and the travel industry employees using this hotel. For the vacationer, it may be disappointing not being on the beach. It is next to the Ala Moana Mall. The rooms are clean and have everything needed. We stayed one night at the beginning of our trip, and another at the end of our trip; not much was needed.

We really enjoy staying at the Ala Moana Hotel due to the location next to the huge Ala Moana Mall and all the varied dining venues and necessary transportation needs. The rooms are really nice and CLEAN with comfortable beds. Plenty of good bath towels. Large flat screen TV with remote was very nice. The pool is very inviting. We really enjoyed the Plantation Cafe breakfast with lots of options. An enhanced Starbucks is just inside the lobby. Self parking is very easy.

A few of us rented rooms on 9/8/17. When we later met we found out that we were the only ones who didn't get the same price and benefits as our other family. They received free parking, and 2 free breakfast buffets!! Where was ours?? That was a slap in the face!! We paid for valet & we had NO breakfast!! Plus we paid $5.00 more!! WTH?!! & to make things worse WE ALL KAMA'AINA!! We should have had the SAME treatment!!

Fabulous view. 1 Bedroom Suite was excellent with separate living area and king bed. Perfect for the 3 of us - plenty of room for both of us and our 15 year old. Fabulous view and easy access to use the crosswalk to the Ala Moana Mall.

Great Stay. Comfortable beds great view. Very relaxing. Breakfast was great. Staff outstanding. Price was very reasonable. Parking situation was on the best. Valet parking is the way to go. Excellent stay.

I have stayed here this year as well as in the past.and have always been pleased with my stay. Ala Moana is a lovely hotel adjacent to Ala Moana shopping mall and the shore with great customer service. It is a delightful place to stay!

Nice and convenient hotel. Centrally located. Out of hustle and bustle of Waikiki. Right next to big mall with lots of shopping and dining. Laundry facilities. Negatives-cost of parking, rooms are somewhat small.

We always stay here since it's so convenient being next to the Ala Moana shopping center. The entire staff is pleasant from check-in, housekeeping, to valet parking. Since we had an ocean view suite, we loved watching the fireworks on Friday night.

This is an excellent hotel, ideally situated. Personnel is polite and caring, a perfect hotel except that the card keys sometimes stop working and need to be replaced, and there is construction noise on the city-mountain side. Ocean side with card keys working, and it's the perfect hotel in Honolulu!

Always love staying here when I have the chance. The hotel is super clean and the staff is very helpful and nice. The location is great, it's close to everything. Looking forward to the next time I can getaway and stay here.

I love the location and staff of this hotel. So this last stay was disappointing. First, after a long day, I looked forward to relaxing in the room....we checked in at 7pm. That was ample time for the staff to check the room. We get to the room and unpack. Only to find out the bathroom lock was off centered so you couldn't even close the door. I had to go back down to the lobby, wait in line, request a switch out, go back upstairs, repack, then go to the room. Not exactly a relaxing experience. I then was charged an additional amount after checkout for items I did not use.

I enjoyed my stay. I checked in a little early but the lady was able to find me a room that was ready. I wish I had known about the parking prior to my arrival. It didn't say anything about having to pay for parking. Also, one night it took me about half an hour to find a spot. Other than that it was good.

Super comfort and right by the center was so easy to just walk to the hotel. Will definitely stay again, haven't stayed at Ala moana in many years. Parking could possible be improved, got lost too many times:)

Great facilities and very handy location. The Ala Moana centre it is located next to is amazing for shopping! There are buses close by so you can take a 5 min trip to Waikiki beach. Would be about an hour walk though. Staff were very helpful and accommodating.

Ala moana is the best hotel. Glad I got a good rate. Love rumours night club! Happy they have starbucks and convenience store located in lobby. Love that i can walk to mall. Please keep low prices so i can always stay at the ala moana hotel.

We stayed at this hotel for one night. the bed was comfortable and the room clean and fresh. We had ocean views from the 12th floor. Ideally located right next to the Ala Moana Shopping centre which my wife loved. Easy to catch a bus to downtown Waikiki and return as well. Great that there was a Starbucks located in. the lobby. Need that cappuccino fix daily.

The location of the hotel is very convenient. Only hotel that does not charge a resort fee which is amazing! i always stay here when I visit Oahu for dance battles and I'll continue to stay here for the future.

I am a local resident and was staying in town for business. It was a pleasant stay. I was happy with my room. I stayed for 4 nights and it was great. I asked housekeeping to exchange my used towels for new ones, and that was no problem.

Good place to stay for convenient shopping and close walk to the harbor. Wasn't there to swim but the pool area was really junk, really plain and nothing around the pool. Like a bar or jacuzzi. Could be a lot better

Very clean rooms with exceptional, friendly service from the staff. They are very accommodating from the valet workers to the front desk staff. I have stayed on business and for leisure and I always look forward to my stays at this hotel.

Great staff and an excellent location. Parking garage needs an update. Stall lines are hard to see and driving around all the pillars can be tricky with bigger vehicles but overall good and enjoyable experience.

Happy with the breakfast and parking included with the room rate. Near to shops and right in town. I could have used an extra blanket and have water bottles available for use in the coffee maker. This is my second trip in 2 months and always use this hotel.

Well satisfied with the property. Rooms were clean and modern. Very convenient location. Staff pleasant and very helpful. Housekeeping is one of the best we have experienced. We are old time customers and will definitely be back.

Never enjoy 2nd night due to room was not cleaned, beds not done, towel was not replaced, no coffee. Called housekeeping for service but nothing was done. I rented 2 different rooms and both rooms was not taken care off

Convenient and fast walking distance to Ala Moana Shopping Center. Lobby is not fancy or elaborate. The lobby is not inviting. Lots of room to sit in Starbucks. The valet area is busy but it's because cars or valet parked cars alongside

Room was booked for 3 and there was barely any room to move. Pull out was hard and uncomfortable and had no blankets. Had to call to get and the response was they only put in on need. Did they think 3 could fit in the queen? Details stated a Lanai but all it was was a door that opened to a railing.

I'm not disapointed of choosing this hotel. Litteraly next to the ala moana center! There's a bridge between the hotel and the shopping mall which is so convenient. The room is cute and well equiped (mini fridge, microwake, coffee, tv, etc...) the beds are so comfy!The only minus thing is the checkin time which is 3.00 PM, to me it is too late!!

Would be nice if pool was open later than 7pm. Rooms were small and not as nice/new as shown on the website (some wear to carpet,etc) but overall in good condition. It was relatively quite and bed was comfortable. Everything worked well but the room safe had an error of low battery that they said was "normal" and could not be fixed. Great location, close to beach, shopping, and restaurants. Within walking distance of downtown Waikiki (just over a mile) and Ala Moana shopping mall (a block or so to entrance) We hope to return.

Hotel's location not being directly on Waikiki beach presented great value. Nightly rate was somewhat lower than Hilton, Hyatt and Westin of the worlds. Ala Moana center next to the hotel provided cost-effective dinner and nightlife/shopping options in walking distance. Only setback was the size of the room. It felt small to us as we stayed for 5 nights and carried heavy luggage. Hotel amenities including small marketplace was very helpful. Starbucks inside the hotel is always a plus.

I really liked the peace and quite that I received. When I returned my room was if I just came in, and everyone was very pleasant to talk to and very helpful. The only one thing, if I had to be negative was that there was no room service although there was restaurants downstairs, they were only open at certain hours, all in all it was a delightful stay. Thank you!

The Ala Moana is a great place to stay if you are in town for a conference! A short walk to the conference center and adjacent to the Ala Moana Mall with lots of stores and a variety of restaurants. There is a Starbucks inside the hotel as well as a little market with ready to eat foods, beverages and sundries. This is an easy shuttle ride from the airport or the hotel also has both valet and self parking options if you are renting a car. The rooms are simple, with a small fridge and coffee maker. All in all a great location and price if you are staying in Honolulu!

Main issue was the construction going in right outside my room. I was told "you won't even be able to hear it" only if you're deaf could you.not hear it, and the sitems was dirty, standing pool of green water, very loud, not a good view if Hawaii!

The hotel facilities are good and service was faultless. Located next to the shopping centre and ~30 minutes walk to Waikiki. The Waikiki trolley stop is about 8 minutes walk from the hotel, allow wait time as it gets very crowded.

The location and access to the mall was great. The parking at the hotel was poor. You have to pay for either self park or valet upfront at check-in. Unless you stayed there before, you have no idea how extremely limited and sucky the hotel parking is. If it is full, they don't give you the option for valet without paying the full charge for it, not just the difference, thus paying for parking twice. They give you the option of parking out by the mall and dragging your luggage back and forth through the streets.The room was pleasant, including the view, although the bathroom smelled of urine.I booked this hotel because of the no resort fees. I appreciate not getting charged for ammenities I don't use. Starbucks in the lobby was real bonus as well.

It was a very nice hotel and our stay was enjoyable. It was close to the convention center where the comic convention was and that was excellent. The staff were very friendly and the cleaning of the room was great.

Overal stay was wonderful service was excellent and on a timely manner. Location to the convention center, Ala Moana Shopping Center , and surrounding area of unique shops and restaurants makes the stay worth while.

This hotel is huge!! It has a couple souvenir shops, convenient store, massage/spa, a couple restaurants, a Starbucks, and many more! Not to mention there is a short bridge on Level 2 connected to the mall parking lot (Macy's entrance door). Ala Moana Beach Park is about a 10-minute walk. Behind the hotel there is a canal/river that leads to the ocean for a nice evening or afternoon walk. Restaurants, Walgreens, & Walmart nearby (less than a mile walk). About half-hour walk to the Waikiki beach area. We didn't mind walking there. It didn't seem like a long walk because we enjoyed every corner of the path which was a straight shot from the hotel. Hotel is clean. Bed was comfortable. Pillows were soft. Very clean and well-maintained hotel. We were happy with the room we got in Kona Tower. We had a view of the ocean which was nice. I have to mention that they have a concierge desk that can help you plan your days in paradise. Monica helped us make our trip memorable so that was a plus. We were happy with this hotel's location as we are not huge beach people anyway and we had no complaints about anything in this hotel. If your main reason of going to Hawai'i is to be on the beach almost every day and all day, I say stay away from this area and pay the extra $$$ to be on the Waikiki beach area. Otherwise, this hotel is perfect for anybody else! We would definitely stay here again and would recommend to family and friends. Mahalo for a great lodging experience Ala Moana Hotel!

Great location. Staff friendly and helpful. Would have liked to be able to use the pool at night.ProsGreat LocationGreat PriceCleanFriendly StaffEverything in walking distanceConsNot enough self parkingShower drain slow to go downPool hours

Beyond compare. A great example of the Aloha spirit of our islands. Service and food at restaurant is the best and we never stay anywhere else when we come to Oahu from our home in Kona. Definitely a 5 star recommendation!

Clean hotel, friendly staff, close to Ala Moana shopping centre and a 20 min walk to Waikiki. Starbucks in the lobby was awesome for your morning coffee! Rooms were a bit small but overall it was a great hotel. Would stay there again.

Living on one of the neighbor islands often means traveling to Honolulu for medical appointments. The Ala Moana Hotel is quite convenient to Queen's Hospital and associated medical offices and I have found it to be a very pleasant place to stay.

Pros:The staff is very friendly and top notch! They will try their best to help you out and make sure you have a pleasant stay. My room and towels were always clean when I returned, with the bed made. The gym is small and neat, but never crowded. The pool is also small and neat, with many chairs to tan in. If one is in the taller tower, the view is breathtaking. The mall is connected to the hotel by a bridge. The AC in the room was responsive. I loved the beds.Cons: My view outside the window is horrible. There is two huge construction cranes blocking the view with a lot of sound from the machinery past 6AM. I am a heavy sleeper and fall asleep easily, but the construction really hampers my quality and quantity. Luckily I work every day early in the morning, so I only had to deal with it on my off days. I was in Kona tower, so the taller tower is definitely higher quality. The room felt small, but I also carried alot of luggage, and am used to paying a third of the price for almost4 times the size in Texas. Not alot of easy to access wall ports near the desks, so I had trouble hooking up my computer for my extended stay. The fridge felt too small. Overall: I have visited a friend's room in the taller tower, and would only return here if I could get the same.

Ala Moana is perfect for a central location that is clean and a spot when you don't plan on spending a lot of time in your room. It's great because I didn't need fancy, just clean and comfortable for a trip.

Great location. Easy access to buses. Great pool area. Didn't try any of the restaurants as we spent most time venturing around. Concierge were a great help with tours. Very hand being right beside the Ala Moana shopping complex which had everything you needed. Across from a quiet little beach. Short bus trip to Waikiki..

We needed to changed rooms because the first room had dirty sticky/tacky glass and drawer fronts on the end tables and dresser -- very uncharacteristic. The front desk person kindly found us the same type of room to move to and a very nice man/concierge helped us move our luggage from one room to another. A very painless change.

During comic con and a wedding renewal party at rumors ala moana was a nice place to stay and unwind. Pool and nice rooms. It is also the same place I got to pick up my VIP tickets for comic con. I am staying there next comic con.

The hotel's location between Waikiki and downtown made it convenient for both. The rooftop pool and deck area were very nice and appreciated. Also, having meal choices in the hotel was very convenient at the end of the day so you don't have to go out for quality food.

My family and I really enjoyed our stay. It was very convenient to have an ABC like store within the hotel so people do have to travel far. It was also nice to be so close to the convention center since we attended the comic con.

Clean rooms, quiet, great valet, check in line was long on a Friday afternoon. Great location to Ala Moana shopping center. Overall ease and comfort was great. Not enough trash bins on the floors for guest to leave their rubbish.

All the bad reviews about rude customer service is true! They wouldn't let me pay with my credit card because the first name was different from my driver's license. The last name was same. I am a diminutive Asian female, I speak English, grew up in Hawaii, so I don't look like an ID theft. The manager told me that the "quality of the signature" of the two cards were not same. Not only did he insult me, but he was a true-blue liar. I signed both cards! They forced me to pay the down deposit of $150 in cash. When I checked out, they gave me the same hassle again. I agreed to pay another 3 nights of stay in cash upfront. When the manager saw me flash $500 in cash, he saw the green light and agreed to accept MY credit card payment for the stay #1.You might enjoy the convenience of the walking ramp to the Ala Moana Center, and the local buses that come to that Center. Don't worry. They have buses that do circulars from Ala Moana Center to Waikiki for $2 only. Thus, I will never stay here again, nor recommend anyone to do so unless they want to be treated like a criminal in Hawaii. Just go over to Waikiki and be treated with ALOHA by respectful staff as a top-dollar paying tourist deserves.

This hotel is great and its location even better! It's attached to the huge Ala Moana Center and is right in front of a nice beach as well.. It's not far from Waikiki beach either and there are trolley services that have different lines to go around the island that stops right there. I really enjoyed my stay there!

Excellent hotel. Convenient location. Central location for everything. Shopping. Hospitality is excellent except for the person that checked us out, not too friendly, need to work in being more friendly. One bad apple makes it look bad in a whole. Jan in reservation Excellent! Thank you so much for a last minute resv. Overall, excellent hotel! Love!

Nice staff The only thing was we should of ask for queens size beds. Beds was kind of small. Me, my wife , and two children stayed at the hotel . Wish the pool was opened longer. It close to early. Other that love the place .

Nice location, a little bit ways off from the beach but still very convenient for many other activities. The room was clean and comfortable. Had a bar at the top, ( they don't allow hats, I was on vacation and chose to go else where they did). Also had a club at the lower lever. Was not a big fan of the breakfast offered, but there are many other alternatives nearby.

I just wish the initial contact with the front desk was friendlier. We come to your hotel every year (my daughter and I). She really enjoyed the gym. It would be nice if there was a little snack bar at the pool but the Starbucks in the Lobby makes up for it.

It's was perfect. Everything about my stay was perfect, I love the kind and helpful staff, the affordable pricing and the great location, it's all made the experience excellent, and has helped to make Ala Moana the only hotel I'll stay and recommend to others.

Great hotel, near the largest outdoor mall in the US. Walking distance to Ala Moana Beach Park, and a short drive to Waikiki. Clean rooms, great staff and a reasonable price. I love everything about this hotel and the quality service of the staff.

This was a great last minute starvation. My boyfriend and I really enjoyed ourselves. We had a night on the town and nut was wonderful. The valet service really helped us out being that we did not want to walk back and forth looking for parking. We will be back soon

Hotel was clean and service all around was excellent.Staff was friendly and helpful. Lots of activities for everyone conveniently around the hotel. Shopping and dining is walking distance. I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

My flight was from Juneau to Anchorage and it was great. I love Alaska Airlines. Their crew is always so professional. Starbucks coffee doesn't hurt either. The waiting area in Juneau could use a real restaurant. In order to eat a real meal I had to leave the airport.

great location near dining, convention center, and shopping. Good staff, friendly and welcoming. Receptionist gave great advice for dinner. Feel safe on walkway to shopping center in evening. Clean and nice Starbucks for quick breakfast.

Property was good but had construction next to the property. Starbucks is in the main lobby which is good for a quick snack and a drink. Ala Moana shopping center is next door. Stayed for Comic Con which was at the convention center. This made it easy to walk back and forth.

I loved it. My sleep was amazing I got to sleep like a baby. The room was just enough for me and my family. The banquet team were really excellent because we were for an event in the ballroom. It made my stay wonderful and easy.

I like that convenience store at the Lobby. Clerk was friendlier than the front desk. Prices very reasonable. I know it is difficult to be friendly or cordial in this type of high-activity environment, but having a smile on someones face is all you need in most customer service scenarios. I always grade the customer service from POS individuals. Tourist can be some of the hardest consumers to work with, but body language and making an effort to smile is extremely important for the Aloha Spirit; it reflects management.

great stay but watch out for the excessive charge to print your boarding passes! Signature restaurant at the top was fantastic. Stayed in the newer tower with the larger rooms and would recommend that.

Kamaaina rates and senior rates are very close. Rates could be better for local people. Usually travel for mini vacay or business trip and hard in room. Room is only to freshen up and sleep. The location is convenient and centralized which is good.

Great hotel and great location for Moana shopping centre. Not too far to Waikiki. Convenient for food shopping and night out at the center (MaiTai bar is great) Great value because the room are not old

The room was clean, the king-sized bed was comfortable, and the amenities were appreciated. The maid service was timely and well done. Cost of the story is already pricey, so adding $20 a day for parking plus all of the taxes made the total cost a bit "overwhelming". Sometimes I'd like to stay longer, but that additional cost makes the total grow too much! The key locks probably need to be cleaned as our room keys needed to be inserted and reinserted several times before we could move in the elevator and/or get into our room.

We have stayed here many times over the years and it never disappoints. Convenient location, comfortable rooms, staff and price of rooms are always a plus. Doesn't hurt that it's right next door to my favorite place to shop.

The customer service here was excellent! Everyone I came into contact with went out of their way to make sure I had everything I needed. I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone I know. We will be back!

This is the go-to hotel when in Honolulu for work. location is between the downtown business district and the play and shop areas of the island. Hotel is usually busy BUT the rooms are well enough appointed and comfortable, and it's easy to get in and out.

Chose this hotel due to location and reviews of cleanliness. I wasn't disapppinted. Parking fee was reasonable compared to other hotels. Great that it isn't in Waikiki. Also has a Starbucks in lobby, definitely a plus!!

Lovely hotel, very clean, amazing views, great beach across the road that is very calm and not as busy compared to Waikiki. Easy access to mall. Limited places to eat out at night, didn't feel safe walking the streets

Service was excellent. I only wish the check out time wasn't early...possibly noon or 1:00 would be great! More specials and deals for Kamaaina to make it a longer stay with lots of shopping at Ala Moana. Love the location and ease of getting around.

The hotel sercice is very good, but there are some drawbacks: the beds are not wedge, each time they turn around, they make noise and the hotel needs more wheelchairs.(they have only one were we stayed)

Room was clean didn't have enough time to enjoy and pay attention to any details because i came in so late and had to leave so early due to 11 a.m. check out. I would use this hotel again in the future to check out more of it and the surrounding area.

The customer service from the front desk, valet service, and house keeping were very great and friendly. Major complaint, is the fact that we found old alcohol bottles left in the cabinet of our room. We did have a 1 bedroom suite that included a stove, dishwasher, fridge and microwave. However, no tools, or utensils were provided even after contacting housekeeping. I find that ridiculous.

My family n I really love this hotel. Every year we travel to Oahu and this HOTEL always our second home.Thanks Ala Moana Hotel for your great service,friendly staff. Your team always do great job. Ty

Always a great place to stay overnight for get-togethers in town. This time, the special price was too good to pass up - its rare to get lowered Kamaaina Prices here. This time around, Check-In took so long, only 2 people! Never experienced this long wait before. If your room card doesn't work in the elevator, it doesn't work for you room! Overall, the stay was nice and convenient, but wasn't feeling the "Aloha Vibe" from the check-in staff, even when called to get late check out the next day. Other staff members were very nice, Security to let us in our room, housekeeping person brought us shower items...Just a very unusual start of our hotel stay. Until the next time...Have a Good One!

Check in slow! After waiting 1/2 hour some male walked to flight crew check in and was checked in. Totally not acceptable!!! Management needs to get staff together and set check in procedures that are fair to all paying customers.

I stayed here for two nights.Service is consistently poor throughout the hotel. Staff seem to take a "you should be grateful for staying here" attitude rather than the usual friendly approach found in hotels. Check-in was rather abrupt, bell hops are simply rude, front desk staff completely disinterested. I travel a lot and honestly and it is very unusual to see this type of service in America.Room was large, nicely laid out, and quiet. Sleep quality is good.Soap, shampoo, toilet paper are all very basic (tiny piece of soap, single ply toilet paper, no tissues, no bottles of water, etc.) Room had a kitchen with microwave, fridge, etc - however, no plates, utensils, etc.Location is convenient for the shopping mall. However, very seedy neighborhood consisting of multiple strip joints, massage parlors, and many homeless people. Hotel does have a lot of security around the perimeter.Food options in the hotel are very limited. No room service. There is a coffee shop available 6-10a, a starbucks 530a-830p, a steak house and a chinese restaurant. Service in the chinese restaurant is beyond terrible - maitrede Wifi is free but kept dropping Internet connection (every few minutes). I would not recommend not stay here again.

Ala Moana is always the first place I look to stay at. However, the prices are not Kamaaina friendly sometimes. If and when I do get a chance to stay there, it's always great. I love being close the shops and food.

Nice hotel - not upscale but descent rooms, clean and conveniently located to everything including mall and Ala Moana park. Front desk staff is not as friendly as other properties I've stayed at throughout the islands as they appear somewhat nonchalant and unenthusiastic about being there.

This hotel is great! We arrived very early in the morning and although we couldn't check in we were given the password for the wifi and was allowed to use all the facilities available! The rooms are a good size and the bed was comfy. The staff were great and the pool was amazing!! I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone

Excellent room, amenities and location. The hotel is located within walking distance of Ala Moana Park, Ala Moana Beach, Ala Moana Shopping Center and Waikiki Beach. The pool is really nice and fitness room is the best of any hotel I've ever stayed in. There is a small grocery store and Starbucks in the hotel too, both of which came in handy as a business traveler.

I stay here all the time and am never disappointed. Very convenient location just outside Waikiki and right next to Ala Moana Shopping center. Close to many dining and entertainment options. Staff is always friendly and very accommodating.

Upon arrival at the hotel we found a cockroach in our bed. We packed our bags and went to the front desk where we were moved to a bigger, but not so clean room. We do appreciate the upgrade, but we also would have appreciated not having to unpack then repack our belongings and sleeping in a clean room would have been great.

I live on the Big Island, I had to travel to Oahu for a appointment to have a pace maker implanted at Queens Medical Center. I asked my son who lives in Seattle to arrange for me a place to stay prior to and after my surgery. Ala Moana was the Hotel he put me in.

Location, nice room, and friendly. Service was great for the 4 of us. My friends always stay here when they visit from San Francisco. I have stayed here a few times because it's away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki.

excellent local - close to airport, dining and shopping. Staff is courteous and professional. Starbucks is a great addition to property. Chinese restaurant while independent of hotel has a negative impact on hotel. Signature Steak House is awesome.

Staff was very friendly, professional and prompt. We had forgotten a toothbrush and they had one up to the room within 15 minutes. The room was clean and we loved having the Starbucks in the lobby. Our only complaint was having to use the keycard to get up to the room. Not everyone carried one at all times and it was a pain to have someone come all the way back down to the lobby to escort the kids back up to the room. Otherwise a great place to stay.

Thoroughly enjoyed my stay. The staff was especially friendly and welcoming and you can't beat being across the parking lot from the shopping center. I would definitely recommend this hotel for business or pleasure.

Was disappointed as the room I reserved was not available and was forced to stay in a room with one bed for the three of us. Customer service was not great either. When we called down to request for a blanket and pillow, we were told that it was in the closet in which is wasn't. Just seemed hard to get an extra blanket when they stuck us in this room with a shortage of sleeping areas. The room was very small. On the plus side, the a/c was working well and the elevators were fast.

I drove a large 12 foot box truck that required special parking needs. The two parking attendants at Ala Moana, Richel Bragado and Clinton, were incredibly helpful. When I was parking the truck, they would be my eyes and signal to me to reverse the truck, which was so helpful because I had trouble seeing what was behind the truck since there was no rearview mirror. They also coned off my parking space when I was gone during the day so that the space would be available to me when I returned at the end of the work day. Richel and Clinton were really friendly and I thoroughly enjoyed every conversation I had with them. Speaking with them were the bright spots in my otherwise long work days and I left every conversation with them with a smile on my face. Richel and Clinton were extremely helpful and kind to me, from our very first meeting when I was just a stranger to them, to the end of my two week stay when we shared stories with each other and laughed together. They were one of the main reasons I enjoyed my stay so much. I have such high praise for them and hope that this review will give them the credit and recognition that they deserve.The rest of the hotel staff that I interacted with, from Heide at the front desk to the cleaning staff to the Starbucks barista, were also very friendly and I had many enjoyable conversations with them. I appreciated this level of service and give the staff's friendliness, attitude, and interaction with guests five stars out of five.

Our stay was pretty great actually. Valet workers were always very friendly and helpful. Front desk service was friendly as well. Rooms were decent, we did notice gross small hairs on the walls and ceiling of our bathroom, which we thought was disgusting! However, during our stay my family also got a suite and their room wasn't very clean as well. Cabinet handles were sticky and there were old alcohol bottles in one of the cabinets. We were also very disappointed about the fact that there were no plates and utensils available in a suite that had a stove and dishwasher. When we called housekeeping, we were told that it wasn't provided, which makes absolute no sense! They expect us to buy pots for our stay? Basically everything else was decent except for the cleanliness of the rooms, which is very important!

The location and reasonable price makes it why we always stay there. Decent rooms. If you can get in a suite, it is the best deal. The regular rooms are ok for couples or single people. Staff is friendly.

We love staying at the Ala Moana Hotel because we always provided great service from the reservations agents, when I called to make my reservation, to the front desk clerk, when we checked in, to the housekeeping, and everyone that works at the hotel. We loved the fact that it is just a walk away from the mall and our children love the pool.

The amenities are great. The best hotel Sundry shop I have ever been to; really nice shops; huge Starbucks; easily accessible business center and friendly staff. The rooms, although small have a lot of things I like that even a lot of big resorts are doing away with like real glass glasses, real coffee cups and real coffee makers. Also the air conditioning worked well.

Great location, with easy access. Friendly staff. My only wish would a firmer bed to sleep on. The suites were nice and huge. It was really nice to have the sky bridge to ala Moana. The plantation cafe had great food and the atmosphere was perfect. The parking garage was a great size and we could always had parking for our car.

I stayed in the Kona tower for 3 nights. As a travel agent I have the opportunity to stay in many types of properties and I found the room was small and the amenities basic, but generally clean and well serviced. There is quite alot of noise from slamming doors and adjaciemt rooms where you can hear others talking through the walls. The advantage of this hotel is its convienient location to the mall and unlike many of the Waikiki hotels it also offers free wifi with no resort fee. The hotel is a decent 3 star property and perfectly adequet for a short stay if shopping is your focus. More attention could be payed to cleanliness of the public spaces and corridors.

My daughter and I had an overnight stay at the Ala Moana Hotel on our way back to New Zealand from Maui. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful especially the lovely lady at check in. We were very lucky to be upgraded to a room on the 30th floor with a lovely view of the Marina and Ocean.
