I only wish we had had more time to enjoy it!The room was clean and very comfortable with two decent sized beds. The only downside was our room keys that didn't work and we had to get them changed 3 times but this was sorted out efficiently. Was great to have the walkway to the shopping mallWould stay here again anytime.

From a neighbor-island, it was a very nice place to wind down and rejuvenate. Would have appreciated a "better" kamaaina rate, but would still return, none-the-less. Convenient and classy. Hotel staff there when you needed them.

Don't get me wrong, I like the location but for having to call room service and get a not friendly greeting made me feel that I could've stayed elsewhere close for similar cost.I'm glad they provide complimentary coffee for the morning, but provide no water to make it with and tap water tastes like old pipes. As usual u can hear the neighbors water from them showering.If it is just a place to lay your head. Then this is the place. Great location to stay next to a large mall.If you want more aloha aside from the wonderful desk workers, unfortunately this is not the place.

I wish that the parking was a bit "cheaper" or none at all instead of the $20.00 a night. Appreciated the upgrade, and the service of your staff. The hair dryer that was provided in the room had a broken switch. Called in the problem and it was taken care of in what i feel was in good time. Overall I had a very good experience staying there as a guest for one night.

Love this Hotel, not only it has kamaaina rates, no resort fee, but it's walking distance to the Mall which I really love the most. So convenient and a lot of eating places to choose from. Room smells fresh and clean. I will definitely come back!

We like the location of the hotel as we were having a surgical procedure done at Kapiolani Medical Center. Our bathroom was very smelly as though the smell was coming from upstairs. By the time we got to our room with our luggage we were too tired to move. Our room was next to the elevator which meant the sound of the elevators going up and down kept us up most of the night.

We arrived on a Saturday morning, check in was efficient and pleasant. Our room was nice with a balcony. We had a refrigerator and microwave. The hotel had two shops on the main lobby, and a store to pick up groceries. The pool was very nice with shaded areas. The hotel was adjacent to a large shopping center which I truly enjoyed. The only problem I had was with housekeeping, they would not replace the dirty glasses.

I had a pretty interesting stay. Let me start off with the positive by saying the room service of cleaning the rooms daily was outstanding. Also ordering of food was pretty easy. Initially when I arrived I had to wait in line 25 minutes which isn't too bad due to many flights arriving. The issue I had was the elevators would rarely read room key cards and would cause you to skip past your floor often which wasted my time. My room had a large amount of mold on the ceiling with pant coming off the ceiling in the room. Sleep was interrupted by the sounds of construction on adjacent buildings. Parking was a nightmare it can take 20 mins to find a spot in the garage and you paid to park. The parking attendants were always friendly. Lastly what set me over the top. On the day of my last stay the fact that there was feces on the carpet in the lobby and entering / exiting the elevator which some mad it on my luggage. This was terrible. My experience here was terrible and for the amount of money I paid I would not recommend.

We returned to Hawaii for my father's funeral. We chose the Ala Moana Hotel by Mantra because of it's convenient location and great reviews. The hotel room was clean, quiet, and secure. The valet, front desk, and housekeeping teams were EXCELLENT! The food was also delicious at the Signature Restaurant! We truly had a great time and experienced the wonderful "Aloha" Spirit!! Thank you Ala Moana by Manfra!!

I hadn't stayed at Ala Moana in years. I was pleasantly surprised by the upgrades to room and really enjoyed my stay. The staff was friendly and helpful. It was great being across from the beach park which made it easy to exercise. I also enjoyed being close by to bike share stations located outside and in the park.

I needed to temporarily vacate my home. I chose this hotel because everything I needed was in walking distance or easily accessible transportation- as I still needed to work. Prices were lower than Waikiki and better amenities and services than an AirBnb. MAll for shopping, lots of restaurants, beach across the street. Great option. Not 4/5 stars (and they don't pretend to be), but at the top of the 3's. Will stay again. Super friendly, professional staff. Mahalo!

As I said previously, the room I stayed in needed some renovations and the bathroom needed additional cleaning after I took occupation of it. However the staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. They truly get being customer-centric.

Was able to get a kamaaina deal online. Staff we encountered were helpful and friendly. We were able to enjoy ourselves with familiar hotel and its location. Easy walking distances to places we need to go. Also, close to the new biki rentals. Thank you!

I have always enjoyed my stays at the Ala Moana Hotel. I first stayed with you when you were only opened for about 3 weeks...long, long ago. I have seen how lovely you have progressed. I love everything about your hotel and intend to continue staying with you...Irene Wilhelm

I love the convenience of the Mall being close to the hotel. You many different eatery and shops to check out. The staff at the hotel are helpful and quick to your needs. I also like the touch of Starbucks being right there in the lobby area.

Great location for shopping and easy access to Ala Moana beach park.Room is clean. Has a small balcony. The city view room that we had doesn't have great view.Friendly and helpful staff. Starbucks downstairs.We were there on the 4th July, so we could watch the fireworks from the Ala Moana parking lot right outside the hotel's access to the mall.

We came to Oahu for a state senior softball tournament and selected Ala Moana Hotel because of location being close to the Ala Moana shopping center where it is a one stop shop and dine. We[ve been to your hotel a few times in the past and were very satisfied with the accommodations. Prior to then, we stayed at Pagoda Hotel. Also, having Starbucks at your hotel tops it all! Wake up in the morning and there is Starbucks for coffee and a light breakfast.

You can't beat the convenient location of this hotel as it is right next door to a huge shopping mall. The second floor leads right from the hotel directly to the mall so you don't even have to go down to street levdl. The Kona Tower rooms are quite small but provide mini fridge, microwave, and coffee maker. Perfect for a local family getaway with discounted prices for Hawaii residents.

Thus hotel is in an ideal location as per other reviews. It's adjacent to a large shopping center. The 1 br suite was adequate as expected. Starbucks in lobby a big plus. The beds were very comfortable. Most important the room & bathroom were clean. Gave 3 stars b/c check in took an unreasonable amount of time (1 hr) not a good start. For an established hotel would think a more efficient check in procedure would be expected. Not sure what the young man was doing given the fact we were the only people checking in at the time. Will stay again. Like location

We got a free upgrade on arrival! Room was beautiful and views were outstanding.Staff were so friendly, easy going and helpful.Hotel has everything you need within and the location was perfect being just outside of the really busy tourist area. Great local beach right across the road which made my stay. Hands down best Hotel I've ever stayed at. Mahalo

Good location. Depending where you are driving in from, it could be hard to get too, but it is on a good location. Ala Moana mall is right there, the beach is relatively close, walking distance. Paying extra for partial ocean view is worth it. Microwave and refrigerator in room. Will be staying here again

Great family vacation. Location to shopping center an asset as it was convenient to get milk and snacks for grandkids. Grandkids loved the balcony and the view it offered. We also loved the swimming pool. (Would have been perfect if there was a shallower area for toddlers.)

Terrible, unfriendly and very dated hotel. I came for a nice relaxing vacation with my spouse, just needed a place next to the Chabad next door for the weekend. Staff was rude a group of us were unimpressed.

We asked for a privacy card at the front desk but never received it. General staff was mostly pleasant except the reservationist at check out, who snapped their fingers to call us in line. No greeting. Kind of rude.

We enjoyed our stay in our room and the time we spent in Rumors nightclub to celebrate a friend's birthday party. We also especially enjoyed when checking in at the front desk that we were randomly selected for a free room upgrade.

I am very glad I stay and I will go back. I hope the next time it will be a little longer. From the time we got at the hotel your car porters and bell men gave us information that help us to check in, as well as your front desk clerk.

Great place for locals to staycation. All staff were very professional and helpful - great customer service. Great having a Starbucks in the lobby - wish they stayed open a little later than 8:30 p.m. Looking forward to my next stay.

The outside of the hotel is very nice and in a good spot because it is right next ala Moana center. The lobby was neat and all employees were very kind and caring like they wanted you to be there. And the valet service was fast didn't wait for long. The room was nice and the act was cold. And then bed and pillows were very comfortable. I called housekeeping twice and didn't take them long to bring my request up to my room. Hot towels were provided when requested. Overalls very good hote I will come back.

The hotel is centrally located in Honolulu to beaches, shopping, and many places to eat. The room was very clean and well appointed. This is clearly a popular location but the online booking made it easy to find a room.

Checking in was fast and easy and the front desk staff were friendly and helpful. View was adequate, mountains, and there was construction outside but luckily I couldn't hear it. Being located next to the mall makes it easy to do some shopping and find dinner. The Starbucks and sundry store in the lobby are great amenities as is the workout room. I wish the pool stayed open a little later.The room was OK, and would have been more enjoyable if there weren't 4 cockroaches living in it.

The room was very nice,and comrortable.And very clean.It was first time to stay KONA tower,because we always stayed Wikiki tower,the location was not so good.And because of construction it was very loudy.

Very family orientated and also I thought your sundry shop is by far one of the best I've shopped in at any hotel! Not over priced like most of the other hotels and something for everyone! Great gifts as well as great snacks!

disappointed at the new CC policy. Website pictures and description were deceiving. The pullout "sofa" was only a twin and dirty! Our past stays had no problem. new company? new procedure? didn't go well with us. was offered an upgrade but had to pay a portion. other than that Reid at the Front Desk was helpful and did the best he could.Hotels should have a 1 nite Courtesy Rate..!!

The room had mold and not small amount of mold a lot of mold, the entire corner of room had mold, took many pics as if I get sick from it. Bathroom smelt like piss, no one service my room when I was out on a long day, returned at 4 pm with the room not cleaned !!! Called for towels and they took forever to get me towels so I was late to get to my next apt.

We always stay in the Ala Moana Hotel when we need to attend a party or event in the Waikiki area.Ala Moana hotel is our go to hotel because of it location, their pleasant staff, and clean accommodations.

Really enjoyed our time there. Will definitely stay here on our next visit.The lobby Starbucks needs to stay open longer than 8:30 PM. At least until 10PM.Room was fantastic, could have used an additional blanket.

I always enjoy my stay at the Ala Moana Hotel. But I hope on getting a better view the next time, with reasonable pricing. A crane is not what I'd like to wake up to and see every morning. The king bed was absolutely wonderful though.

Good hotel, very convenient but the room was really small with just the bare necessities. The bed was very uncomfortable with a big dip in the middle. The front desk staff needs some customer service training. No personality, now welcome, no smile. I was on the 4th floor over looking the roof and ramp to the shopping center.I am a Kamaaina and wished for something a little better. It would be good to have a good impression to bring back the Kamaaina's.

Right next to the mall! Had a Starbucks inside and ATMs which were handy.Very busy hotel but good facilities. Close to everything. Friendly staff even though they were clearly under pressure during busy periods.

All was great except for the man at the front desk who was rude to begin with then worse after our key didn't work twice. He was not considerate as we were tired and had to walk to and from room twice to get key to work. Usually during my stays the front desk staff is very friendly and helpful, not this time!!!

Just a short walk to Waikiki and right next to a giant mall. I had fun, got some great exercise. Loved it. Just that if your staying in the Kona tower, be aware of the construction across the street, they like to start early. So you wont need a wake up call lol!

Its a really great place to relax and have fun and tge people that work there is great and they smile every time you walk in the hotel its a great place to be a. I would recommend this place with friends and family. When we come back to Hawaii.
user_name:
Cody906
North Carolina Coast, North Carolina

review_body: Check in time was super long and the lobby wasn't air conditioned enough so it was quite hot. Check in staff was friendly though. Room was okay. The beds were pretty springy and the bathroom was super small. Okay for a short stay.

A very clean, convenient, safe, and pleasant hotel. Definitely a local favorite. The staff from check-in to dining are super friendly and accommodating to meeting your needs whether business or pleasure.

Appreciated the front desk arranging it so that my Son and his family got a room right next to us. I was babysitting my grandsons while their parents went to a concert. Having the rooms next to each other made it so much easier. We will definitely be back!

The over all stay was ok but the parking situation was just terrible . See previous comments to the general manager. To have valet cars parked in front of self parked cars is just ridiculous and having to pay $20 a day makes it worse

Busy but fun. Kind helpful staff. Delicious food. Festive Atmosphere. Good location. Fast service,. Well worth it. Would recommend it to many . check in and checkout was easy. Would return for another adventure.

Staff at Ala Moana is really good. Only downers were bed size (hard to put two kids on a double bed, would like twin rooms to have two queeens -- but the pre-existing layout of the room will not allow for it). Also parking on weekends (self-park) is horrible. Other than that, great staff, great location. Would recommend.

Perfect location for in-town work and relaxation. I spent time going to meetings and the mall, an easy combination. The room and hallway were perfectly quiet despite having a lot of families staying there. The Starbucks in the lobby is one of the best I've seen.

Stayed there for one night. Rooms er nice and ok. Sometimes noise from other rooms. Breakfast USD 17.5 - too expensive for this quality. Staff at the front desk (both check in and out) are ot so friendly, no smile sometimes rude answers. They even could not fix a cab. Just said go outside. Most of the front desk staff looked bored and not satisfied with there jobb. Worst service under our stay in Hawaii. Stayed i 3 different hotels.

Great service and neat hotel located right beside ala moana center where all kinds of eatery and shopping are available. Great view on part of ocean, nice pool and awesome elevator. We enjoyed our stay.

Didn't want friends to drive home after big event, for everyones safety, we sought safe refuge. Rooms were clean and walls thick and well insulated for sound. Coffee in room, muffins downstairs...Great!

Be prepared for long check in and check out lines in reservations and valet parking at required times.Might want to try express check out thru television. Otherwise a great location to the shopping mall and into Waikiki.

for just one night because i attended a function at the hotel. thin walls - could hear the shower going on in the next room - not too pleased with that. air was not as cool as it should be. otherwise good place to stay.

Please focus and improve front desk manners . A smile goes a long way . New management must not leave behind a traditional Hawaiaan friendly and helpful trait . A polite and helpful manager is definitely a must for a popular and well known Hotel .

Right next to Ala Moana Shopping Center, once you check in, everything that you need is right there. Shopping, dining, the beach, the convention center, etc. It is all about location, location, location.

My family and I lives on West Oahu and we enjoyed our stay here at Ala moana for a little while. It was close to the mall and a lot other stores were in the area. We loved the location and will be back

Even though it has 1000 rooms, I did not feel like just a number. Everyone was so nice and helpful. I had a great view of the ocean. One or two things that could be improved: no vent in the bathroom caused the smoke alarm to go off when I took a hot shower. Also, there is not a good chair for the desk - there is only a stool and it was too low for me to use to type on the laptop. The hotel did provide a chair for me upon request, but it did not have wheels and was also too low, so I was not very comfortable doing work. Also the Expedia guy at the tour desk talked me into doing a luau at Paradise Cove, and it was horrible. On top of that, their bus did not come to pick me up so I had to get a Lyft driver to take me, for an extra $70. Avoid the Plantation restaurant - breakfast buffet is no better than what you'd get for free at most hotels, and they charge you a lot for it. However, the fruit was really fresh and good. I suggest the Atkinson Grill down the street for a fantastic breakfast. The Chinese restaurant on the 3rd floor is fantastic - I ate there twice for dim sum.

Perhaps it's the new management but this Sunday morning was a nightmare for anyone trying to catch a flight. For some reason they sell more parking passes than they can accommodate. So they require you to use valet parking and they double park cars downstairs - it guess it increases revenue for the hotel and valets. When we attempted to get our car at 945am, the line was perhaps 30 deep. I estimated that for almost every car, they had to run downstairs, locate your car, identify the car in front of yours, run back upstairs for the key, then move the obstructing car out of the way, move you car, park the obstructing car, then drive your car upstairs, at least ten minutes per car. Luckily, we were just planning an outing so we gave up and walked to an alternate attraction. Later when we returned at 100om, I asked the valet how long it took to clear out the mess - he said over two hours. I told him a lot of persons must have been yelling about missing flights. I like the hotel but it is no longer an option if I have to catch a flight on a weekend prior to 3pm.

Our room had a bad odor. The valet parking was a nightmare upon checkout, with a 45 minute long line. All in all it was a disappointing weekend. We appreciated the close proximity to the mall and restaurants and also the front desk staff was courteous.

Actually its the best kept secret and sharing how awesome it is will make it difficult to stay in the future!!! But, we can't help but share. The hotel is in a prime location to avoid all of the Waikiki traffic but close enough to walk to the action. It is also conveniently located to give easy access to downtown and all major streets/highways if driving happens to be your thing. It is connected to the Ala Moana shopping center making it convenient and safe for even a lone traveler to get to world class shopping and dining. Did I mention its across the street from beautiful Ala Moana Beach park? Best beach around. Oh and for all you Starbucks diehards, go no further than the lobby. Feel like dancing - check out the fun at Rumours. Looking for a beautiful restaurant with the most beautiful view - head to the top floor. This hotel by far offers the best location, activity options, nice accommodations and amazingly friendly staff. Never disappointed.

Very good Sevice! Spectacular view. Very accesible to wherever wanted to go. We recieved free upgrade to ocean view. I would recommend this hotel to friends and family. We will be coming back again on our next trip to Oahu.

Great stay! Front Desk Awesome no long line! Clerk was courtesy with lots of Aloha. Room was very clean and had a spectacular view! Plus the weather was picture perfect on arrival and departure. Hotel was perfect for the event which we attended. Would definitely recommend Ala Moana Hotel.

Perfect location, I was attending a function in the hotel. I was in the room for approx. I2 hrs., this included sleeping. The room was clean and quiet, except for humming of A/C and refrigerator. I would stay here again because of the convenient location.

This has always been our go to hotel when doing business in Honolulu. Convenient location and they give a locals rate. That being said we book an partial Ocean view room which we didn't get. Second the rooms are looking a little shabby. Third the beds made both of our backs hurt. Staff is always friendly and helpful.
overall very good, the location a plus. This was a school shopping trip, so it met all my expectations.front end service quick and efficient. Plantation cafe breakfast buffet nice, wait staff superb.

Staff was incredibly friendly but the room was subpar with multiple issues ranging from inaccurate/non-functioning A.C. to a completely clogged sink. The room definitely shows that the hotel is not a new construction. Doors and walls are not even remotely insulated causing any noise from outside to disrupt my sleep. The air conditioner stopped randomly throughout the night awakening me from the loud fan which would stop entirely.

The staff - all that I came in contact with - were friendly, helpful and concerned about my stay and comfort. My room was clean and comfortable. My privacy was respected. The closeness to Ala Moana Shopping Center made retail therapy easy toy accomplish.

We were fumigating our home and needed a place to stay for the night. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. Good location being so close to the Ala Moana Shopping Center. recommend this hotel for local people that do not want to go into Waikiki.

Right next to the mall, in walking distance ruin beach/park. Rooms are small and stingy on amenity - no pen or memo pad. Parking is small and $20/night. Everything is pricey, but you know, it is Hawaii.

Very convenient location, just steps away from Ala Moana shopping center. Makes finding meals easier, especially traveling with little ones (not to mention binge shopping). Rooms clean, maid service above satisfactory. Will visit again in the future!

Welcoming, friendly and professional service by Heidi, reception, Jason at bells and Michael and all the guys at valet!, And Thomas at pool. Housekeeper always greeted and offered assistance. Although I'm local was treated as a mainland dignitary! Mahalo. Ahui hou!

Not sure about how to rate it above a 3 but not quite a 4 in my book. I've been here before and know that the Kona tower has smaller rooms. The room was as expected but you can really hear the bathroom (sink, faucet, etc) in the next room when being used. The door to the bathroom swings inwards and blocks the access to the tub (if you want to leave the door open). The staff was really friendly and the valet gave me some good directions. The down escalator wasn't working at the time and there really weren't any signs giving you any options (no stairs) of how to get down to the lobby although the elevators were close by. Parking was pretty expensive but comparable to the Waikiki hotels but this hotel is pretty centralized if you wanted to just walk around the area. Stayed on a Monday night and the night club/bar didn't open in the evening. But overall, I like this hotel.

Ala Moana Hotel is noted for Islanders as the place to stay for convenience and "aloha" atmosphere. This feeling has a lot to do with its long time employees, and must also be due to training by management. Convenient location (next to Major Shopping center), clean rooms. Rooms are a little outdated, but still acceptable

Overall, really like the hotel and always recommend it to friends and family. Safe and convenient. Staff pretty much helpful and kind, still got some of those who are grouchy though. Bathroom wasn't cleaned properly, hair in the tub and all over the bathroom floor and it wasn't mine hair. Found this upon check in.

The hotel was very conveniently located for the convention center and for access to the mall. You will walk a little ways to get to the beach, but it seems like it's always nice weather, so the walk is nice. Overall the hotel room was good and the service was good. I would probably stay there again if I go back for another conference. In booking the room, I had a hard time getting people on the phone, but they were good about requests for the room once I got there.

We recommend your hotel for location and service. Service was very good. Helpful personnel. Location was great. Easy walk everywhere we needed to be. Try the harbor pub by ilakai for a good breakfast and pizza.

My room key stopped working four times in one day, it was a burden to have to wait in line at the front desk to get a new key made. The staff was pleasant to deal with but offered nothing to but I'm sorry after I told them this has happened two, three, four times.

We come every year for my daughters birthday and I think this will probably be our last time visiting. Not gonna recommend this place to anyone. Over charged my card and I've called numerous times to try to fix this and the "accounting department" (really just one person) is always away from her desk! Most of the staff at the front desk were amazing but some were soooo rude and me and my fiancé has to end up helping a tourist find the blaisdell because a front desk receptionist just flat out told the guest "idk"..

Best hotel in Honolulu for quality, price, convenience, and service. When we arrived we were greeted by friendly staff who got our room very fast. The room was clean and spacious with a wonderful view of Waikiki and Manoa. Would recommend the Ala Moana Hotel to everyone irrespective of budgetary concerns because you're getting the most bang for your buck...plus the convenience of the Shopping Center just outside your door.

Ala Moana hotel has great service. I have been to many hotels and this experience was by far the best. I will definitely be staying at this hotel in the near future. I will highly recommend the Ala Moana hotel to both family and friends.

Ala Moana was known as the kamaaina hotel in the past, but the hotel no longer caters to the neighbor island kamaaina. The front desk needs some training in aloha. They seem so business like. When checking in or checking out, I feel like I'm burdening the front desk staff.

Convenient location. Rooms are clean. They've also recently opened a Starbucks in their lobby, which gives the hotel a huge plus! On the downside, self parking can sometimes get tough depending on the time of day. However, $25 a day, will get you valet parking.

I loved the ease of walking from the Ala Moana Mall to the Ala Moana Hotel. We were greeted with friendly service. We loved the view from our room and the room was superb. We celebrated our 50th yr wedding anniversary. Truly enjoyed this stay at this hotel.

We travel on a annual basis to Honolulu, and more often than not we stay at the Ala Moana Hotel. They need some help at the front desk, and the parking is difficult, but in terms of value and hospitality, it is a great hotel.

Over 30 minutes to checkin. Poor room layout. Hard and uncomfortable sofa bed for the kids. Blankets and towels only provided for 2 people instead of 4. Asked for more but didn't arrive till 24hrs later.

This is a great location especially the shopping center and coffee shop at the lobby. Room was very neat and clean. Would like to at least have a later check out time since check in is not till 3pm and check out is 11 am which does not give ample time to use the pool if we wanted to. Also, it would be nice to be informed about the club facility with having discounted entrance fee. just heard the couple in front of us that they were staying at the hotel so they were asked for room key and was given half off entrance fee so I told my husband to show key also. this would be helpful if told at registration time.

We just got back from Oahu, and stayed at Ala Moana Hotel by Mantra and had a great time, with all the years coming and staying at the hotel this is our second actually using their swimming pool, with the kids not only the staff was wonderful but very pleasant. The housekeeping was wonderful especially when we asked for extra bedding and pillows for their pull out sofa. The floor we got was a sight to have ocean view. The only thing is the elevatiors can get a little busy for time to time, especially when its check in or check out but other then that it was a blast....... Will be definitely returning to this hotel

Mahalo, we were able to book a room.We came in from Kauai and stayed at our family friend's house in Ewa Beach.Staying at the Ala Moana Hotel afforded a closer & comfortable place to get to my Dad's Memorial Service at Hawaiian Memorial Park & Cemetary,

Your ratings below are not true. Your system is automatically putting in excellent when I'm trying to rate differently. Your system is cheating. This makes for a dishonest review. Your Wi-Fi system was poor. It kept kicking us out. Our key stopped working after the first day and we had to get another one so we were locked out for awhile.

Thank you for an amazing stay. I hope to be able to return and stay there someday. It was clean, quiet, and comfortable. Hopefully next trip I will be able to stay longer than one night. Well done Ala Moana.

The check in time at 2:35 this Friday was horrible as the wait was too long. I was in line for 35 minutes before checking in. I would suggest you have an employee (or two) with i-pads to check in people while they are in line to speed up the process. No one wants their first experience at a hotel to be a crazy long wait just to check into their room to begin their vacation!!!!!

Perfect!! Clean room, comfortable bed with quality linens and soft towels (last hotel we stayed in had sandpaper towels that we did not appreciate at all), our floor was quiet at night and the view of the ocean was very nice. Also, parking was convenient and reasonable. Lots of restaurants and shopping within walking distance and a Starbucks in the lobby. We really enjoyed our stay there. Will be back!!

Our stay was nice except for the registration for our room. Registration took two hours. Management should have had a better plan for issues of this nature. This problem is enough to sway away from coming back to your resort hotel.

I mentioned and made review comments in my notes to the manager - you should have put this page first in your survey. Overall a nice visit and room to sleep in since we didn't hang around the hotel we got out to see the sights, eat and visit family. View of construction was unattractive but nothing unusual for the area. Like the location, price was good for my budget, wish I could have stayed longer get but I'll be back.

The low cost doesnt justify an hour and a half in line for reception.We visited twice and thought that the first time this happened was a coincidence. We came on a friday early afternoon and thought it was that. The second time was a tuesday evening. The staff is underpaid and uninterested in helping. Anything that requires service is very delayed.We travel a lot(!!). A lot means 40% of our time is travel. So we see a lot of hotels. This is a hotel like any other. Its not bad, perse, its just eats up hours of your time at reception amd if you need anything. We found that to be annoying when on vacation.

Rooms in Kona Tower are on the small size, but was clean and looks like recently renovated. Very convenient location connected to Ala Moana Center. I would stay there again. Would have been nice to get a discount on parking for multiple night staybut in this area places charge whatever they can get away with.

Comfortable room with full size fridge, microwave and coffee maker. Easy access to shopping centre and close to beach and public transport. Loved the Starbucks (served wine and beer after 4pm). Buffet breakfast good value. Easy access to Waikiki beach.

New owners, Mantra of Australia, have jacked up the price by $30 a night per room. Yet, I see no improvements and service was not as good as when it was owned/operated by Outrigger. Rooms are overpriced for what you get and the location.

For a 30 year old hotel/condominium, the Ala Moana has held up well. Generally clean and bright inside and out. However, the check-in process, with a convention group, was poorly executed taking over 1.5 hours to check in. (Leaving for dinner a couple of hours later, the line to check-in was still significant.) If you are depending on convention groups for conventions at the Convention Center just a block away, they need to be able to book people quicker and have translators for non-English speaking people who had difficulty checking in and slowed the process. They did show they take care of the buildings with window washers and exterminators for ants, but area behind the curtains where they have a sponge-like material in the patio door track to soften the door when opened looked a bit moldy. Finally, though being on the 31st floor, the tub drain was a bit slow when showering. There was an inch pool of water when finished, and it drained after about a minute. Just a little more attention would have given the property a 5.

I attended a conference held in convention center and this hotel is an ideal place, which is of high quality and is very near to the convention center. The stuff in the room is neat and clean and the price is also acceptable for me.

Hotel is currently near a construction site. There were some ants in the room, housekeeping took care of it the next morning and sprayed. I had asked downstairs for another room, but the room I had originally was better than the one that they had available. The bed was comfortable and the New Starbucks in the hotel is a plus and makes a nice place to read emails and or meet friends.

Overall the hotel is nice. Location is amazing. Activities/tour booking personnel are rude. At night the hotel was a little noisy, but this is understandable since people are on vacation. I just wish my interaction with the activities personnel was a little better, they were extremely rude and hated talking to people.

3 hour line to check in. Not organized front staff. This hotel is an icon in HNL, the new management won't last long hopefully. The elevators are bit programmed well. You can stop every floor from the top down. 6 elevators seems like 3 work. Manager at front flustered and unable to efficiently put out fires. Not receptive to suggestions.

Check- in I stood in line for two hours this is crazy. This needs to get fixed. Before you changed ownership and procedures I really liked this Hotel. Now with this check-in it total shifts me the other way. I am 60+ years old and standing in line that long seriously hurt my back and feet. It totally ruined my stay. I am still recovering two weeks later. I have never experienced anything like this and I have stayed in hotels all over the world. I have been staying at the Ala Moana Hotel almost weekly for years. Before the change of ownership/procedures the check in was around 15-20 minutes max. Two hours is ridiculous. I am surprised people are not dropping out with medical concerns. I almost did. If I wanted the trouble I would talk to a lawyer. My back is still hurting me. I am not saying the hotel is totally responsible for my bad back but standing in line for two hours did not help it either. I spent most of my trip recovering instead of accomplishing what I needed too.

We have stayed at Ala Moana Hotel in the past years and enjoyed it every time. The entire staff were friendly--from chk in to valet, housekeeping, breakfast and at chk out. We like the location because it is very convenient and easy to drive to/from. Rooms were private and spacious and we didn't mind paying extra for the OV suite. This trip, we ventured off to the pool on the third floor. It was small than some would expect, but enough to get a quick dip and escape from the city. The Uncle that we got our towels from was very friendly and shared some tips with us. The are felt safe. Plantation Cafe is always a hit! We try to dine there at least once during our stay. Again, very friendly staff and the food options were great, especially at an affordable price. Next time, we will definitely try the dim sum restaurant on the third floor (unfortunately, our schedule didn't allow us enough time this trip). Lastly, the front desk clerk (male upon chk in) and bell desk were very kind and understanding with our lost baggage. Although it didn't arrive, they were very sympathetic and reassuring. No one was tired of our daily inquiring of our daughter's suitcase. We appreciated that of them and it helped made our stay enjoyable. Overall, we will definitely return and look forward to spending another enjoyable and memorable trip with all of you! Aloha!

Because this was a business trip that was set up by my company, I was in a city view room. Well, actually it was a neighboring condo and parking lot under construction view. I am accustomed to staying in better accommodations with real views when I book my own travel. Unfortunately this had an affect on my overall opinion of my stay. Obviously this is not your shortcoming, but you asked for my opinion of my recent stay, and this is it. Also, I gave a lower score on cleanliness as there were several dark hairs clearly visible when I first walked in to the bathroom. Mahalo.

I was very disappointed this time around and my family and I usually enjoy our time at this hotel. I was very disappointed in the checkin processing and room. The customer service agents weren't friendly or smiling and the guy helping us also over charged me $20.

The location is perfect. Next to the Ala Moana Center, nearby to Waikiki but far enough away to not have all the hustle and bustle or crowds. Room prices are good and the Kamaina rate was good. SEverthing you need is at the hotel or within 2 minutes.

Great place to stay when on Business, especially if attending meetings/conferences at the Hawaii Convention Center. It is just a couple of blocks away. Also, the fact that Ala Moana Shopping Center is just next door makes it easy to grab a bite to eat when you get tired of convention food. Also, if you take a cab from the airport to Ala Moana it is about $30.00 one way. I never checked out the shuttle service.

The hotel is conveniently located on the edge of Waikiki and the shopping mall. Great location and service. I've always enjoyed the friendliness of the staff and support as we've brought our team over from the Big Island each year (usually 3 times a year).

Hotel was nice, staff was friendly and very helpful. Location was perfect. It was nice that was right next door to shopping and many dining options. The only negative thing was the uncomfortable beds.

The best thing about this hotel is its location, right next to Ala Moana Shopping Center, that has hundreds of shops and restaurants. There's a walkway that takes you directly to the mall, located on the second floor. There are also Starbucks and some small shops in the lobby, which are convenient. The pool and fitness center at the hotel were nice, and the staff were very friendly and helpful. We had no problems at check in but did notice an extremely long line at the front desk several afternoons we were there.

We only stayed overnight after flying in from Maui in the afternoon and leaving for our International flight early the next day. The Hotel was suitable for our needs; clean rooms, close to shopping centre where we had dinner and our last lot of shopping, Bell desk staff that were helpful.

Wonderful place near the beach/mall and Waikiki, staff are very welcoming And Starbucks is a big plus in lobby has free wifi and the rooms are very reasonable and reliable this place is a must comeback to type of place

The staff treated me and my daughter with utmost care and service. I requested a handicap accessible room as she is in a wheelchair. Very nice room, and she wanted to stay another night....From the people who greeted us at curbside to the front desk, I have very good things to say about them. Having Starbucks in the lobby is another plus. Thank you

After initially getting in our room, later , our room key did not work for the gym, we followed another person inside. Then my 12 yr old son wanted to go back to the room and his key did not work, he went to the front desk for help but no one could help him because he had no ID , ( most 12 yr olds don't !!) so instead security went with him as they stood outside the room for 1 hour my son thought he had to stay with security rather than come and get me at the gym!!! He was not helped and this was horrible for him !! When I went to the front desk to get new room keys and explained what occurred , Nothing was offered for the trouble we experienced !!!

The staff is very helpful and gracious. Walking distance to Ala Moana Park and Magic Island as well as Ala Moana Shopping Center. Bus stop is very close and walking distances to trolleys that frequent Waikiki.

also loved the comp. parking!!! see earlier comments. sorry I didn't do this correctly.Overall excellent as always.Always recommend to friends and family.Convenient to shopping center. Rooms were clean and well maintained.

Excellent property to stay at for a vacation. Super friendly staff. Very clean hotel in a great location with a couple great restaurant surrounding the hotel. I would highly recommend staying here. I will be back soon that's for sure.

This is a good hotel for walking to the beaches, shopping, driving to Pearl Harbor and other tourist spots.If you want a Hawaiian feel, pool hours past 6, a pool bar and beach front this isn't the hotel for you.

I've stayed here several times and each time I leave more than satisfied! I will definitely be staying here again. Good for family. Very convenient. The price was very affordable for the quality. Good job!

Killed one roach, balcony sliding door was left open by cleaning crew, nearby construction started at 0600 and sounded like it was taking place on my balcony. Location is outstanding and for the most part it is a clean hotel! Free wifi is a bonus!!

The Ala Moana Hotel has always been excellent for the price. I have stayed over 50 nights and have not had any problems. It is quiet and next to Ala Moana shopping center. Great place for business travelers.
Had a great service and nice rooms.Good hotel and next to do shopping and great selection for breakfast lunch and dinner.Will likely return!Front service was awesome with local deals.I recommend it!

The rooms were very clean the only thing was that it was almost the last room at the end of the hallway. Staff were very friendly and helpful . Check in and checkout was quick and simple. Valet assistance was quick and friendly Atmosphere of the hotel was warm and friendly. Room service should be available so we didn't have to leave the room. It would be better if we had more restaurants or eating places of choice

So the check in process was very frustrating and not customer service stellar. The room service was not up to usual standards. Even though the valet parking had some scratches on our rental the valet staff were very friendly, professional and had customer service in mind.

The hotel was very clean and the staff was very helpful and generous to us during our stay. The staff at the bell desk were very kind to hold our luggage until we were able to check in to our room and they also held our luggage when we checked out until we were ready to go to the airport. Ease to get a taxi was outstanding!

We always stay at your hotel because it is conveniently located in the center of restaurants and shopping.This past stay (Friday July 15- Saturday 16 2017) we experienced a mistake made by staff.Checking in (2:45 pm) was a breeze and our reservations agent was very friendly. We got our room keys and headed up to the room. Later that evening I logged onto my credit card website to check charges as I regularly do when on vacation. I came to find out the was a charge on my credit card for the for $167 (correct charge for the room) and another charge for $1,201. I immediately went down to the front desk I believe around (11:00 pm) to speak with the night agent. He told me, "right now in the system it only shows the correct room charge. ($167)." He would wait until the 3am reports to come out and will leave a message on my room phone if anything comes up.The next morning the gentleman left a message saying, "that the charge of $1,201 was charge to my credit card, but immediately reversed.I came to figure out that our check in agent must have inputed 1201 into the "charge box" because our room number was 1201.I appreciate that he caught it right away. I also appreciate the night agent for running the report and getting back to me.I only thing I was disappointed about was that, because credit card refunds take 1-2 business days and it was the weekend, my credit card account would not be credited back until roughly Wednesday July 19 2017. It was a substantial amount of money so purchases for that weekend had to be put on hold.My credit card was credited back the $1201 and everything is back to normal.Luckily we are coming back to stay at the hotel on Thursday July 27th- Sunday July 30th.

Clean, Comfortable and close to shopping and restaurants. Pool was a great place to spend time in the warm Hawaii sun. Signature happy hour was a beautiful spot to enjoy the view. Check-in has long lines

Being that Ala Moana Shopping Center is next door it's just to business like, no family atmosphere. Did not feel the aloha. Found items under bed from previous guest, refrigerator was not cold enough n it shakes

Convenient location(close to Convention Center and the Ala Moana Shopping Center), parking availability is a plus,and the amenities provided are all excellent and the reason why I choose to stay here.

the room was great and the location was awesome! walking distance to the mall! The housekeeping were very nice and thoughtful. However one of the worker on the Bell was being mean to my friend. She have no manners.

The room was small but clean, and a good location for the mall, but the "old tower" had the worst soundproofing ever. Toilets flushing and vacuuming at 0630 was loud enough that it seemed to be in my room!

Staff was very helpful and considerate. Room was small for the price, an appropriate rate would be $125. Location next to shopping center was convenient. Lack of food outlets; restaurant for meals, refreshments, would be nice. Three star hotel rating.

Great location, convenient. Need more agents foe check in. Took 35 minutes. Line was out the door. Front desk needs help! People don't want to come to a hotel and wait 35 minutes plus for there first introduction to Oahu.

I usually stay this hotel when I visit Honolulu.The location is very convenient for me.Because I can go to shopping and sightseeing by Bus or trolley or on foot .And I love seeing Diamond head and ocean at Waikiki tower's lanai in the morning .

Overall highly recommend all the staff and facilities . Super location with such convenient access to the huge plaza next door.Chose this hotel because it hosted the 47th Annual Ukulele Festival Gala Ball. This meant we did not have to leave the premises at all for this night out.

Staff was very friendly. Koa, matt and Robin at Valet to Thomas (believe that was his name) at the pool. We had a wonderful time. Although, if the hotel knows the reservation is for 4 people, they should have 4 towels in bathroom ready to go.

We usually stay at Ala Moana because of the location and guest experience however this last visit was surprisingly horrible. We had to turn on the toilet and fill the tank with water so it would work. We had to contact housekeeping for our bath linens because none were in the bathroom and there were only two small pillows to sleep with and were denied extra pillows when we asked housekeeping.

Stayed one night at the Ala Moana in Waikiki, nice property at a very reasonable prize for the amenities, Convenient store, Starbucks, Nightclub and Breakfast place right on the property. Short walk to harbor or downtown, shopping right next door at the Ala Moana Center. Room was a bit small but definitely doable for a short stay, rooms have fridge, microwave and coffee maker, iron, board and safe. Will stay again.

Hospitality was impeccable. Valet Drivers were very friendly and helpful. Housekeeping was wonderful, paying attention to details. Front desk staff were friendly. Pool attendant was extremely friendly with many helpful tips. The convienience of everything being within walking distance was an added plus. We will definitely be back. Thank you for taking care of the locals!

Very nice as always, but high rates this weekend. Next month rates is $130 compared to $192 this month. Enjoyed the convenience and location, clean rooms with everything working in the room. Would highly recommend hotel to friends and family.

Loved the hotel and great location. Close to beach, shopping and restaurant's. Only had 1 night here and wish I was able to stay longer. Hotel was a little over priced but then again it's high tourist season so everything is expensive

By far the WORST hotel I've ever stayed! The receptionist who made my check in was SUPER rude. They gave me the wrong room and it was super tricky to get me to the right one. Once I arrived to the new room the smell was terrible, when I saw there was food from the last people on the refrigerator. No quiet rooms. Never coming back to this hotel for sure!

I stayed here on my way back to Australia just for a few hours. Can recommend the food at the plantation cafe but you can't book to your room unfortunately. Would have liked more time but on the whole, I enjoyed staying there. The guy on the reception when I checked out wasn't the friendliest and seemed annoyed that he was having to deal with quite a few people trying to check out. But apart from that, everything else was fine.

Always look forward to staying at Ala Moana Hotel. It's in a perfect location to travel to other destinations. Parking was a little difficult as we needed to search for a while to park but we did find a parking.

Only complain was the very loud construction noise which started just before 7am. Not good when u hope to sleep in. Other than that this location is very convenient. Housekeeping and valet staff very friendly!!

good location, clean, plenty of towels, fridge and microwave and coffee pot was awesome. plenty of shopping! located near the top of wiakiki so there's easy access and taxi's wont be that expensive, not too far from either convention center.

buttons below do not work correctly service -fairclean -fairvalue - goodlocation very goodsleep - fair rooms - fairlobby was very crowded, had homeless people in the lobby and Starbucks area, very bad for doing business

Close to mall, had all amenities that I needed but noises within the hotel and construction behind hotel was AWFUL. Noises began at 5:30am, so early when I really wanted and needed to sleep. Clean rooms...but just terrible sleep!!

Looking for a place to help celebrate a friends birthday, I came across the Ala Moana Hotel. I wanted to have a nice & quiet escape and that's exactly what it was! The staff was friendly and the rooms were clean! A little smaller than I'm used to but it was really nice! We were also able to get in a little swim time before we checked out. The pool area was nice, spacious and clean! Since we stayed there we had dinner at The Signature on the top floor. The food was amazing and the staff was very friendly. The 10% discount was also a plus!

Overall a good stay that's Quintin a reasonable walking distance to nearby attractions. The downside it is not on the beach but being next to the ala moana center, it gives options for dining and shopping. The parking is a bit expensive per night and tight as the spots are small and sometimes the valets doublepark in the garage.

For a busy weekend it was a nice weekend stay at this hotel. Came over for a evening meeting and we were able to relax and enjoy for the balance of the weekend. So central to everything we needed. Shopping, dining.

Check-in was long, but the housekeeping staff were friendly and helpful. Rooms were noisy and outdated, and our shower curtain was a little musty smelling, but the room was clean. We had a terrible view of a building under construction, but I guess that's what you get for a city-view room.

Everything you need at an excellent location is just the start. From the check in staff to the incredibly fast valet crew, have made it so I won't stay anywhere else. If you need a place with a great view, that is close to Waikiki, and where everyone treats you like you're their only guest, then this is the hotel you need to stay at.

Hotel feels too much like a tourist trap. Needs modernization. The beds are stiff. Wifi didnt work my entire stay. Parking was rarely available unless I valet. Took 90 min to checkin because Mondays are likely days they will have more customers than employees.

Can't beat the location, it is right next to Ala Moana Mall and a major bus hub. Cons: There were ants in my room and you can hear it every time someone in your hall leaves their room because the doors slam.

Before and after hip replacement surgery, we stayed at the hotel, including an extra night for recovery. It worked well except for being at the very end of a long hall in the Kona tower and the challenge of finding a meal we could take to the room on the last night. The room was quiet and we appreciated the microwave and assistance on the last day getting a taxi.

Construction started every morning next door at 5:00 AM We left a note to change the sheets and they were not changedMaid service was late most days The location is great We stayed here last November and it was greatWhat happened?
user_name:
James K
Lake Arrowhead, United States

review_body: I have been staycationing here for many years because of its affordable rates and proximity to the Mall. The staff are very welcoming and the rooms are very clean. I always look forward to staying here every year!

Very Good hotel. I like this place very much for our next trip we still want to stay in Ala Moana Hotel and I'll recommend to all my friend and relative. Also the Royal Garden restaurant food is the best and good service ,definitely we will take our friend to this restaurant for lunch and dinner.

Very busy hotel, not enough front desk staff, expect long wait to check in. One BR suite was very nice size but absolutely nothing for the Kitchenette, not even a dish towel, unless you pay an extra $25 a night. Do not expect your reservation request to be given automatically, ask when checking in or you may find you are not in a room you asked for.

The hotel has a great location, it's clean and everyone was very friendly. The stop at least the restaurant for breakfast and there was a good choice of good food (besides the jam that honestly I was expecting a higher quality).

Wonderful brief stay at the Ala Moana Hotel. Convenient shopping at Ala Moana shops, dining, and meeting old friends. So close to the Convention Center for all day meeting. Then an easy return to the airport.

Hawaii is amazing and your hotel does enhance your experience. The Ala Moana is a beautiful hotel and the staff was excellent. Check in was slow but everything else was great. The store in the lobby was so convenient for water and snacks also great gift items.

The hotel was in a good location to access the Ala Moana Mall. Nothing fancy, just a short walk for most meals at the food court, or Foodland grocery store made it very affordable. Service was great and the staff helpful.

Will not stay here again, poor service, smelly room. Hotel gives priority to flight crews. If flight crew checks out late, you get your room late. They don't have to wait in line for their rooms, i guess they are too special. I guess the average person who save a long time for their vacation is not so important. Room was dirty, as was the beds. Smelled as if someone was sick in the room.

Convenient location, some staff issues, some accommodation problems. Welcome line was 1 hour long for signing in. Surely, this could be improved! Check out process was efficient and friendly. Some problems with elevators were inconvenient.

I was there for conferences and I had to be in bed early...It was very very quiet...Not once did I hear noise or anything.Very comfortable bed...great sleepVery classy place close to the beach and the huge shopping center...

I and my husband had not been here for a while and so I thought it warranted another try - hence this review....Again, the staff was very courteous and happy, and always spot on with any request like more towels, etc. On the subject of towels, there were 4 adults in this room and four names on the register and we NEVER got 4 bath towels delivered even after requested the first day. The room was ok, not good, not bad, just ok. The cleanliness of the room and the maid service each day was terrible! The coffee cups were actually just wiped out with a rag and you could see the swipe marks and coffee still on them. It was gross! The tub wasn't cleaned each day and the bath linens were not ever fully replaced (read maybe two wash cloths, 3 hand towels) and it was different each day. I don't think we'll return.

It was sort of ok, I loved the view and the location was everything close by. Service from valet excellent, they were courtesy and kind, the front desk people was very helpful and they were knowledgeable.

I stay there for five nights. My room was on the 14th floor next to elevator. Very first night was one of the worst night me and my husband had. Just couldn't asleep. Next morning I request to change my room front desk was like sorry we are over booked check later. Check with front desk all most every day 3-4 times never got my room changed.Worst asleeping time their.☹️

This place is in a busy area of the city right next to a VERY large mall. The surrounding neighborhood is not really conducive to walking and wandering, but the mall itself is great to explore. The room was very neat and clean. I could tell that they took pride in housekeeping. Because this was our last hotel (3 others during this stay) it might not be a fair assessment to say it seemed a bit sterile. This is not a bad thing - it just did not have the Hawaiian, laid-back feel. It was more of a business trip hotel instead of a vacation hotel. With that said - we had zero issue with the location and the facilities. This place is very nice and, of course, has the easy path to shopping and food being next door. A hotel guest doesn't even have to go out on the street to get to the mall. There is a bridge from the 2nd floor of the hotel into the Macy's wing of the mall.
user_name:
road_tripping9110
New York City, New York

review_body: The view from the hotel was beautiful right across the street from the beach. I love the fact that the mall with in walking distance. Just very disappointed that the pool close early and the spa and fitness room wasn't available for use.

Just wished that had more bigger rooms and maybe had a "wedding" suite? Where there's adequate area for getting ready and hanging of wedding dress. Room was clean, just a bit noisy in hearing neighboring room. Awesome view.

As usual - the Alamoana Hotel provided a clean, comfortable and convenient place for our stay. The hotels, rooms, appearance, comfort and cleanliness was enjoyable. The front desk staff needs improvement on their guest interaction. They are not friendly, warm or welcoming - they are lacking the spirit of aloha or even a simple smile.

The hotel is nice for the price. It's recently been rentovated and is much cleaner than it used to be. Hotel staff is friendly and helpful. However the rooms are very small but have a mini fridge and microwave. The hotel is conveniently located right next door to ala moana mall which makes it just a few minute walk over to shopping and food. We are here because my husband is working and myself and children came along to do a little school shopping, we are from maui. Not a very impressive pool and there is no hot tub but we are only here for a few days and live in Hawaii so it wasn't a huge deal to us but if you are here on a family vacation that might be a deal breaker if you have kids that really want to spend a lot of time in the pool. For the price of the room, about half of other hotels in the area, it is a great deal but of course in Hawaii you get what you pay for. If you want a nice ocean view and closer to the beach this might not be your ideal place but if you are here for just sleeping and city life and not wanting to break the bank this might be your ideal hotel.

I stayed here for 4 nights. The room is cleaned and big, microwave oven and coffee maker are provided. The staff are very nice and helpful. I got some problems in the bathroom and they were solved by the staff very quickly. A shopping mall is just located beside the hotel which is connected by a bridge only. The Ala moana mall is the biggest mall in Hawaii, you can find most of the brands there. This hotel is actually very convenient, you can take the pink line to Waikiki beachside with just about 15 mins.

We were astounded when we walked into the lobby - the lobby is gorgeous and makes the hotel seem very high class. Our room was very very small though. There were only 2 of us so it was fine but we would have been happier with some more space. The room did not have adequate blankets and we were cold - the room was very stale without turning on the AC but very cold with the AC. The bathroom was nice. Admittedly, we got the cheapest room available but we were not expecting what we got after walking through the lobby.

walls way too thin - see previous page for comment. I couldn't believe what I had to hear in the middle of the night. If there is a way to do family-friendly floors I might consider staying here again, but if not. I probably wouldn't.

Booked on your res line; and THOUGHT I locked in a rate! only to find out that at checkin the rate was increased, I protested and asked for a supervisor, and was told this happens ALL the time in ALL resorts!!! Not! Clearly what you quote you will need to honor... I stood my ground till I was assured the rate would not change .. How dare you! Be honest... I promise I will post on all three of my face book sites as well! You can call me 808-242-6762

This hotel has so much potential! Great location, clean rooms, lots of dining options. But first you have to get by the front desk check in staff. Good luck! I have never been so insulted in all my years of travel. I've stayed here for years and now I'm not sure I can ever go back-they will make you wait while they: check in every possible airplane employee they can find, chat about what they're doing after their shifts, make phone calls, clack away on their computers...and then when you finally catch their eye, they ask if you need something. YES-I NEED YOU TO GO BACK TO THE TRAINER AND LEARN HOW TO BE PROFESSIONAL AND COURTEOUS. Complaints to the GSM went nowhere, leaving us to assume they are ok with this behavior. What a shame.

I stayed here for two nights the week of 7/3/17 for a work visit. I found the front desk staff to be very helpful, no problems there. My room was clean, although slightly dated. I think the hotel itself is in a good location, within walking distance to the large mall and park on the waterfront.There is a Starbuck's in the lobby which was nice for my travel weary self. I have no complaints, room was clean and everything went smoothly.

The hotel was fine, but a little expensive for what we got. I paid for an ocean view room. What they have are actually partial views. Also, I understand that big cities have homeless people, but they need to do a better job at keeping them away from the hotel entrance. They have a nice sitting area outside, but it is full of homeless people.

it was alright. valet service was great! check in took a while but they were all very patient and courteous to everyone! the rooms we were given were an amazing view for the fireworks! check out was quick.

enjoyed the room, great view to see the fireworks show right from the balcony. would like to maybe get the room at the end of the building we were in for a full, unobstructed view of the entire fireworks show.

Close to convention center, beach park, and shopping. I spent many early mornings and evenings enjoying the breathtaking ocean views. Highly recommend the Waikiki Tower with ocean views. The bed was a little lumpy, but was able to get some sleep in.

Always a pleasure to book a stay in this hotel. We look forward to future stays. Great location, accommodations, staff and amenities. The room was comfortable, clean and affordable. The Signature restaurant was excellent.

I booked directly through hotel stating that my purpose was to see the fireworks. I was not told that hotel doesn't face ocean. Room 3024 should be considered a city view with partial ocean view.Ocean view should be an ocean view.

Great hotel for shopping enthusiasts as location is very convenient to the Ala Moana centre. It is also short walk to the Ala Moana beach. Great for a short stay if you want to break up your stay and be away from the waikiki crowds and action. Not too convenient if you want close access to waikiki unless you have a car to travel back and forth as trolleys and buses do take longer for travel.

Our toilet overflowed and the toilet had a loud annoying screeching sound that lasted about 2 minutes after flushing. It took a while for someone to come clean the overflow of the toilet. Catching an elevator took a while due to long lines.

Hotel is located right next to Ala Moana Shopping Center and walking there with my 7 and 9 year old was no problem. Having a Starbucks onsite was awesome! Valet parking is totally worth the $25/day fee

Clean hotel, very convenient to mall. Manager very unresponsive to hotel issues. Manager on duty was thoughtless and nonresponsive to friends issues with other room. There should be a separate rating column for management. They really rated a 1/2 star if even that. Go figure.

Great location near mall & Waikiki, making it a convenient choice for a quick trip. Nightly rates are reasonable. Standard rooms are pretty small, not much room to get around if sharing room with a family. Nothing fancy, but serves it's purpose.

Great location. A lot the activities me and my friends wanted to do were within walking distance. The mall is connected to the hotel. The people who work there are so nice and very helpful. The room was a perfect size, the mattress was comfortable, and the pillows weren't flat. There are no complaints here!

It was great. I would come and would recommend this hotel to my friends and family. However, the pool should remain open at least to 9 p.m. this way the families are able to enjoy the pool after a long day.

The worst stay I ever had in a hotel. Poor customer service especially Melissa the front desk agent. She has no customer service and bad attitude. She's so rude and keep treating patrons horribly. Wifi in room is terrible, fridge is not working and the room is extremely small.

I did not realize the high-demand property this is. We checked in just before the crunch but no problems and friendly staff. I would have liked a extension to check out time but the 'sold out' condition was OK particularly when I saw the lo-ng line in the lobby. Very professional and friendly staff!

A one night stay. To enjoy the 4th if july holiday. Room was nice and the view was great to watch fireworks. It's a great location near shopping mall and the beach. Nice hotel. Pleasant place to stay.

Tips == qtips. It was fine. Pillow hard as rocks. Staff very friendly....we are used to smaller hotels. So it was a change...and nice change....breakfast best bargain in town!!! And the hotel is fairly priced. Have I reached 200 ?

Our stay thus past week was fun and enjoyable. The kids came to visit and had lots of fun while there. The place was nice, quite and clean room service was always on time and did what was asked for, we will defiantly come back again soon!

I stayed at your hotel in May and then again in July. I found it a good value and a very nice place to stay . My stay in July 1 room I had the refrigerator did not work to engineers came up and could not fix it and I was immediately given another room. They also help me move

Being a local I love that everything is within walking or driving distance. The room that I was given had a perfect view of the city connecting to the majestic blue ocean of Ala Moana Beach park. The rooms are comfy and the privacy is superb! Definitely will come back for another stay-cation!

Poor customer service. Room overpriced.I have reserved the room a few months back for 4th of July.. paid for the view and got rigged:(Front desks ladies were very rude and no knowledge of customer service.

I was very surprised that we could not swim after 6 pm. The pool is there and we needed to allow the kids to burn off some energy, but we were told is was closed. What good is having a pool if it is only open when you are busy?

Rooms are good and pretty clean. OK for a hotel on business. Pool had a nice water temperature. Workout room has been in disrepair for quite some time. I noticed they finally began renovations when I was there the last week of June, 2017. Maybe that will update that area.Good location next to mall, reasonable walking distance to Waikiki.Self parking at $20 per day is more reasonable than most other places. Laundry services are outrageously priced ($8.50 for one shirt, not dry cleaned, laundered and ironed).

Very centrally located to Waikiki and downtown. We had a great view (mountain and partial ocean) from our room. However, it took about an hour to check in but I suppose that's expected during the 4th of July holiday.

Our suite was perfect to view the fireworks. However, the shower curtain set smelled unclean (please wash or change). Also, the coffee condiments were very old. Other than that, we enjoyed our stay...

Nice stay for the family on the 4th of July for the fire works show!! Although the room I paid for was not available due to an over sight of a "late stay/check out" due to their flight delay... they were very accommodating and tried their best to find the best room possible that was comparable.

the valet service was very helpful and so was the front office staff.our maid service was excellent they providing us with clean beds and a very clean room, Mahalo for sharing the Aloha sprit with us.

Ala Moana hotel is located in the heart of Honolulu, connected to the islands biggest mall, closely located to the beach and convenient for transportation making it an ideal location to plan your day from. Public transportation is also close by. Staff is friendly. They also have a Stabucks in the lobby.

At this hotel you are always greeted with Aloha. Walking distance to the mall and Waikiki. Super friendly staff always makes the stay nice. This has got to be the best location in Honolulu. The rates can't be beat compared to more expensive hotels in Waikiki.

The picture of the room looked a whole lot bigger than what it really was. Knob in shower was very worn and broken by the next morning. Check-in clerk and housekeeping staff was very friendly. Washer/Dryer room was very convenient being that we were there for a basketball tournament at the convention center.

I enjoyed my stay at the Ala Moana Hotel. The room was great, loved that there was a coffee maker and fridge and that there were plenty of toiletries that were restocked all the time.The pillows were a little to plush for my taste but that is just a personal preference.

Good job, I understand you were busy but no excuse to clean my room with half an effort. Great location pool was nice and the fact the Starbucks serves alcohol was a plus! Location to the states largest shopping mall didn't hurt either.

Not happy with reservations and customer service is poor. Could not go by my rate unless I show them a proof. Altered my reservation but I had 2 rooms reserved instead of one. Housekeeping was superb though! My confirmation does not even show my rate so how do you prove the rate that was quoted.

Stayed here many times, always clean and good location.Staff is very nice and helpful.It's an old building, but its been fixed up and up keep is good, night club down stairs and fine food upstairs, also coffee shop on the ground level, gym and access way to the shopping center.valet parking is kinda expensive but it may just be the going rate $25 a day, $20 to self park.

Good stay, convenient coffee shop in the lobby (Starbucks), as well as a pool and a very high end mall across the street. Our room was clean, staff really friendly and went above and beyond great service in almost all interactions we had with them. We stayed on the older Kona building but really when I wasn't in conference we were at the beach or exploring. We did arrive from our flight late, and both of us were really hungry. So we went over to the mall for some late night eats, (at Mai Tai, I'd only recommend the sliders.) I'll write another review. Back to the hotel. Staff were excellent, room services as well as counter, concierge and bell hop. Conference rooms were well supplied with beverages and the food was good. The desserts were amazing!!!! For transport, after a few bus and taxi rides... traffic can be really congested. We ended up using Biki, bicycles. It's a new thing on the island. Download the app as you can see where the bikes are, and if there is also space to drop them off at your destination. (We booked two per credit card). It was cheaper then a taxi and get to experience the sites more. We used Biki to get to Waikiki beach and back. You could walk it. But we wanted to save our energy for surfing...To and from the airport we booked with "Speedi shuttle". Clean, professional, and we also used them both ways. $15 per person, and they take credit. The workers were advertising the rides, while we we're waiting for our bags. They did come recommended from the hotel. And we will use them again.

The hotel is beautiful, the staff is great. I had to wait in line for half an hour to get my key card reset. Clean and comfortable. I'd stay there again. Except for Reception, a really good experience.

Everything was okay wished it was a little more reasonable in price would have loved to have stayed from Friday to Wednesday. We live on the other side of the island with a bunch of people. Just to getaway to relax once in a while would be awesome.

Comming home for a quick stay was very comfortable and the staff was very helpful at all timesMahalo for your prompt attention upon our arrival as we arrived early and were very tired from our flight. The desk clerk was ready and able to give us the attention we needed and I thank you for having employees who show their aloha.

Not Satisfied with the service received at the Front Desk. Did not meet my expectation. Location was convenient but overall was not satisfied with the overall services. Need to work with Front Desk team to have more hospitality and provide it!!

great location and staff! nice rooms! need to change and/or upgrade beds. the valet service was very efficient! The pool was good and nice fitness room. The best location as we were playing bb at the convention center across the street.

For the most part, was pleased with my experience. However, I was not very pleased with customer service at check-in...especially when I had to go back to the front desk because my room keys did not work...it would be nice if front desk personnel would ensure that room keys would work when they give them to the customer.

Lines were long upon check in. Finally got our room keys, went to room, but rooms weren't even cleaned yet. Had to wait in the hallway for 40 minutes until housekeeping got to our room. Not a great experience. One of the few positives were the location, and valet service.

The room was very confortable and clean. The pool water was at a good temperature. The room , its amenities and the extras all deserve the price. So I had a pleasant stay in this hotel.I strongly recommend Ala Moana Hotel.

If you are looking for a 5-star hotel with fancy service, Ala Moana Hotel may not be your choice. However, if you are looking for a family-friendly environment with convenient location, this should be on your list. I made the reservation half a year in advance when I realized I missed my X'mas vacation and did not want to miss a great summer. I had several phone and email conversations with the hotel staff before my arrival. The last one was about my delayed flight. All communication was smooth. All of my requests, such as high floor, ocean view, king size bed, and arrival of one day late, were all met. Everyday the room was cleaned thoroughly. After several hours' walking around, I always came back to a clean room, and as I opened the door to the balcony, sunshine and great ocean view made me feel really relaxing.

we always stay here because it's right next to the mall and they have a dim sum restaurant downstairs. if you don't like tight spaces I would NOT recommend staying in the Kona tower. I learned my lesson once and that was enough. Plus, the Kona tower does not have a balcony.

The special rate deal with free parking was greatly appreciated and made our new grandparent visit very enjoyable. If these offers were more frequent, we would stay in town more. My only concerns were no tissues or extra blankets were in room; however, Housekeeping promptly delivered upon request. Mahalo.
