Room was very clean and neat but space was a little tight. Bathroom was clean, loved the shower pressure and heat. Easy check in and check out, everything was perfect and to what i thought the expectation should be at.

Excellent front desk service and also valet service. We got to hotel 30 mins. before check in time and front desk staff allowed us to check in. Because our original room wasn't ready they gave us an upgrade. We certainly appreciated that. Also they had someone come and make up the pull out bed right away. Such great service.

This is an older hotel but still nice although a little dated its clean and what you would expect. I think it offers value for money. Conveniently located next to Ala Moana shopping center.Walking across from the 2nd floor you can arrive at the shops within a few of minutes.The beach is walking distance as well but at least 15 to 20 mins walk across the road through the beach park.I only stayed one night but found the service to be very good.Plenty of food options within the hotel and a food hall is also located within Ala Moana shopping center.

We enjoyed the stay. I liked the security system for the elevator and the proximity to the Ala Moana shopping center. We had no problem parking, but I saw the double parking in the morning.I recommend having the facility map of your pool, stores and restaurants in your room or offering the map at check-in.

Stayed for 6 nights and found the room to be satisfactory- I was only there to sleep. The picture on the website lead me to believe there was a balcony, but in all the room was great. The service there was very good and the location is close to anything in the immediate area and a great place to catch the buses. Had a very pleasant stay there.

Great to stay at Ala Moana Hotel because shopping at Ala Moana Shopping Center is so convenient!Thanks for storing our luggage while we shopped after we checked out. Also, thanks for the immediate taxi service! Wonderful experience!

Nice room if a bit small. Good to see it renovated and updated. Accommodating service personnel. Good place to stay if you want to be centrally located. Easy access to beach, shopping and just outside of Waikiki. Signature Prime Steak House was nice with a great view.

We stay here on our putter island trip all the time. May re-think next time. Dirty, dirty rooms, as if they went in, changed sheets and said, no one will notice any details. Very disappointed this stay!!!

Convenient and a great value for residents and vacationers. Location is centralized and easy to acess. Rooms are adequate and clean. Amenities are thoughtful and of good quality. Quiet and privacy is respected.

Great place to stay - very close to the convention center for my meeting. Close to the mall for a large selection of restaurants. Friendly staff that were eager to help. The check-in lines were a little long but relatively fast moving. Easy ride to the beach or a short walk to access transit options.

It was a nice short get away, front desk was awsome, we had no problems with our stay. Room serbice was fast and polite. It was noce that the mall was just a bridge away and walking distance. Cant wait for my next mini staycation.

The hotel is Conveniently located adjacent to the ala moana mall with its great shopping and restaurants. The hotel was a good value considering location, convenience and amenities. I would definitely stay there again.

Quick and easy check-in and check-out. All staff were friendly and accommodating. Room clean and comfortable. Easy walk to Ala Moana Shopping Mall and access to public transportation to Waikiki and nice restaurants. Walking distance to the Ala Moana Beach.

Great stay, glad to have had a microwave and refrigerator in the room. Very clean. We were able to check in early, that was awesome, checking out was fast and easy, valet was friendly and fast. Staying there again, hope room has microwave and refrigerator again.

We had a great room, all the amenities such as hair dryer, coffee maker, t.v., food information and breakfast in the Plantation Cafe were great. We enjoyed the view we had of the ocean and AlaMoana Shopping Mall. We enjoyed being attached to the mall for shopping and browsing. Very convenient.

The housekeeping barely cameand service our room. I had to call mostly everyday for towels in the room. I had to throw away my own trash and the room wasn't even ready when I checked in around 8:45 PM.

We previously stayed at the Ala Moana when it was owned by Outrigger, so the mistakes I made this time in booking were my own. I didn't realize that every room had been sold off iindividually, and presently, only some of the rooms are managed by the Ala Moana, owned presently by Mantra. The rooms are called condominiums, but they are just hotel rooms. If you book through the hotel, you will receive actual hotel housekeeping, at no extra charge (unfortunately, as one reviewer wrote, many housekeepers are getting carried away with "tipping"). I booked a room managed by LSI Management. Everything negative is a reflection on this management company, not the hotel. With LSI management company, you have to pay extra for everything: $15 for addtional sets of towels$22 for replacement of towels, bathroom clean, make bed, remove trash$35 for full clean, replacement of towels, bathroom clean, change sheets, vacuum, dust, trash removal.Fine if your staying 1 night, we stayed 4 nights. We paid for the ocean view corner room, (the rooms ending in 08), which we have stayed in before. These are nice rooms, a bit dated, but comfortable, and the view is nice. Our room for this stay was 1908. The room was clean, but, 2 of the 5 lights in the bathroom were out, making it very dim, 1 of the lights by the bed was completely broken, so no reading on that side, no hairdryer, a partial roll of toilet paper, no trash pick up, and no cleaning supplies. Not to mention no clean towels or sheets, unless we wanted to pay extra.I like the location of this hotel. There is a walkway on the second floor that takes you to the mall right next door. In addition to obvious shopping, it has a grocery and lots of food places. I like to run in the mornings, and the park is just across the street. A nice track goes along the ocean, and is a very nice run. The convention center is a block away. I will stay at this hotel again, but, next time, I will make sure I book a room managed by the hotel.

Rooms small but clean, checkout line long(not for me personally but saw long lines) reasonable rate.Liked Plantation Cafe for breakfast but the food service needs to update-no aspartame sweetener please! Truvia or Splenda is better.Price shouldn't be a consideration as Starbucks uses it. aspartame and saccharin are known to be harmful and cause cancer!

Rooms were clean and hotel in a great location. The service was fine. The fact that there was no resort fee made it very competitive with other hotels. The room size was kind of tight but it was really clean.

The Ala Moana is the perfect balance. It is on the edge of Waikiki, so you can indulge there if you chose - but being on the edge allows you to enjoy a more relaxed stay without the hustle and bustle of Waikiki.Staff are always friendly, especially the valet guys and the rooms are well appointed and clean.This is the only place we stay when we visit Oahu 5-10 times per year.

The staff was wonderful, the rooms were clean and had everything I needed. Hotel entrance is welcoming and the front desk check in was perfect. They a couple of resturants and StarBucks. They are next to the mall, so food was never a problem. Many food choices both inside and outside of the hotel Overall great job!

Enjoyed our stay. Convenient. Within walking distances of some great restaurants and shopping. Staff was courteous and friendly. The beds could be a little more softer and the pillows a little firmer. But overall I'll be coming back to stay in the future.

Had a great experience. The location was excellent. Staff was very professional and helpful at all times. Rooms a little small but good for the purpose. Loved the restaurant on the 36th floor. Overall experience was awesome! Thank you for providing a great comfortable experice.

I don't have anything else to say but services to local should be better. I would like to go back to this hotel in the future but even kamaainas should be treated fairly because when tourists are down we can be of help. Thanks!

This was a very pleasant stay. I especially like the spacious pool deck! The room was comfortable & functional. It was terrific for the price paid. Front desk was very pleasant & efficient. If you like to shop, this is the place for you at the Ala Moana mall!

We love the consistency of great customer service, great Kamaaina rate, the location is perfect and minutes away from the best restaurants in town. The beach is within walking distance, and Starbucks is in the Lobby.

There was construction outside our balcony that no one notified us for. I couldn't even open the door. I tried and all this dust came in the room causing me horrible allergies all day. I usually stay here on staycations multiple times before, but after this trip I will never stay here again. Horrible experience

Convenient location outside the congestion of Waikiki.Courteous and efficient staff.Clean and spacious rooms in the Waikiki Tower.It's not the Four Seasons, but the cleanliness, hospitality and convenience is much more important to me.I would definitely stay here again.

Hotel was very clean and had all the conveniences, staff was friendly and efficient, parking not a problem, location can't be beat. Signature Restaurant on top was very accommodating on our 50th wedding anniversary.

It was a fine room once we moved to the Waikiki tower with bigger rooms, but the service wasn't good at all. They wouldn't let me change rooms over the phone and told me they wouldn't even hold the room I would have to wait in a lengthy line again, and sign and get papers. My wait time due to having to wait in line twice was 1.5 hours.

I love staying here because of the location, it's close to food, shopping and the beach...the rooms at times are a bit or miss, some are great and others it seems that the care of the room was mostly surface...yet the majority of the people that work there are pleasant and friendly...

Right in the middle of everything. 2 minute walk to Ala Moana Shopping Center. Close to Waikiki Beach area without being stuck in the traffic. 15 minutes from the airport. Always helpful staff full of aloha. Plus there is a Starbucks in the lobby

I traveled to Honolulu on short notice for eye surgery. I appreciated their concern and helping me and my with with a late check in. The location is convenient to downtown and the physician I had to see following eye surgery.

The convenience of having a major mall right next door, was a huge plus. The rooms were comfortable and were well worth the price. On our next stay, I would want to try the one bedroom suites instead.

My husband and I have stayed at Ala Moana Hotel for the past 15 years and the accommodations have declined. I think it's time for some renovations. The carpet in the room were stained and the bedding felt stiff and uncomfortable.

Would have been nice to be able to order in the room. Room was nice but thought it odd to have the kitchenette but no dishes or utensils, paper towels. There was no bathroom facial tissues. Aside from those features overall the room was very nice.

Always a pleasure staying here however price is on the high end nice rooms very convenient to lots of shopping and dining this is my favorite hotel to stay at. One negative is noise. Rooms are not sound proof. I could hear kids down the hall and doors slamming across the hall.

This is our first time staying at Ala Moana! We flew in late and left early. We kept it short because we didn't know how our stay was gonna be. After spending less than 12 hrs there I tried to change our reservation for a longer stay but they were fully booked! Hotel was fully loaded, attached to the mall and an awesome restaurant! The security feature in the elevator took the cake! I would recommend this hotel and I plan to visit in the near future!

I've stayed at other hotels before but the service and convenience of the Ala Moana Hotel cannot be matched. The rates were also very competitive. The Ala Moana Hotel will be always be our first choice when traveling to Oahu.

I stayed overnight for a business trip, and had a good stay. The staff was superb, and they delivered excellent service with a smile. The room was clean; a bit outdated, but still clean. The centralized location of the hotel was perfect, especially since I didn't rent a car. Thank you for a great stay.

Requirement of room key to access elevators 24 hours a day is annoying. Wifi kept dropping (don't play on-line games as you'll lose your spot).Housekeepers are very helpful. Front Desk registration could be a bit faster.Centrally located is a plus.

I always love staying at the Ala Moana Hotel!! It's so close to everything!! Great location, I just recommend you change the shower heads in the bathrooms because they kind of suck lol but overall it was a great stay(:

Great hotel- The perfect distance from town, easy to catch the $2 trolley in to Waikiki Beach- the daily cleaning staff were excellent, our room always felt clean and refreshed- Valet parking great value and wonderful staff, even when it is busy- The pool area was adequate but it could use some nicer surroundings- Good value, even in peak season

Second rate hotel. I knew it would be a bad stay after the male check-in clerk didn't say hello or really say anything because he already knew he was going to give me the worst room in the hotel (Rm 1139) check the busted shower nozzle and the empty bottles under the sink

I have stayed at this hotel several times because of the location to shopping. The rooms are acceptable and clean. The house keeping staff is always very friendly and helpful. The desk staff are not friendly or accommodating. The don't appears to like their job.

My room was next to the ice machine, so late night guests using the machine woke me up. It was quite loud. Valet service was quick! Location next to the mall was convenient. Starbucks in the lobby was great!

The suite we stayed in with 3 peiple literally had 2 glasses and 2 mugs. No silverware or any other utensils were available. What is the point of staying in a suite, which even has a dishwasher in the kitchen, if you cannot utilize it?? We were very disappointed!

Convenient and clean. Would stay again. Very close to activities such as shopping, dining and the beach. Right across the street from the Convention Center. So, guests can walk to most activities. Parking can be an issue if hotel is full and or there are events in the banquet rooms.

Our visit was overall. Our first stay was perfect. Last one not as good but got better after our room was changed. Location is great. We will go back but be more mindful when booking to book in the tower.

It wasn't an enjoyable stay. We had a dirty room and out water pressure made it difficult to get an decent shower. And when we requested to check in early n check out late both requests were denied. so overall I suggest that u do ur research about the hotel u wanna stay at before u stay there

Good location at Ala Moana Center. A very small room makes you feel cramped, no desk chair. The hotel lacks food choices. There is a 'cafe' that serves an over-priced buffet only breakfast, but it is only open 6Am to 10AM.

Great location, beautiful room, accommodating staff. Parking is a bit pricey and there's no room service but other than that, it's a great property. The bed was comfortable but the pillows are too big and gave me a headache.

Security and a guest broke into our room without knocking. Just unlocked the door with us in the room and started looking around for an item. Didn't even say sorry. Manager was no help. Treated as if nothing happened. Shocked at the treatment under Mantra. This used to be a great hotel. I'm still waiting for a follow up from the manager. Been couple of weeks already.

Met all my needs. Good gym facility. Good location and free wifi to get things done. Appreciate having Starbucks in the lobby. This is my third time staying here and would recommend it to my coworkers as well.

My wife and daughter stayed overnight after their function @ the hotel and really enjoyed themselves. Front desk was very accommodating--we had a room on the 35th floor with a partial ocean view--beautiful! The only small glitch we experienced was the elevator(s) wasn't reading the key card so you had to reinsert or wiggle the key card to make it work. Other than that, they enjoyed their stay @ the hotel. Much Mahalos!

Not in the middle of Waikiki... love it.Great location for everything... love it.Bell desk and front entrance stuff are very helpful.One thing I would like to see is... as we check in, the line is not too long.

I used the Ala for a crash pad while visiting the Queens center. The place was very busy when I arrived but the check-in process didn't take very long. The rooms are ok, nothing fantastic, but nothing wrong with them either. The only thing that bothered me was that the coffee makers in the rooms are very cheap and made a mess both times I tried to make coffee. At $200 a night, I expected better. There is a convenience store in the building that has just about anything you need, from water to adult beverages.

We were leaving the island for good. The stay was very quiet like we like it. The housekeeping was awesome everyday and front desk was very polite. Thank you for making our 1st ever stay and leave awesome!!!

All in all a good experience. We went during an extremely busy weekend so check in was quite long, but it was to be expected. We always pick this hotel mostly for location. It's easy to get around town and easy access to food and shopping. Hotel itself is quite nice with some great shops.

This is not our first stay at the Ala Moana Hotel. We got a great rate and a room that overlooked Magic Island so we could watch the return of the Hokule'a from our room. The staff is very friendly as usual dishing out the aloha style hospitality. We'll definitely be staying there again.- Doug, former Hawaii resident.

It was my husbands birthday and we loved the hotel; the only thing was not enough toiletries only one of each. We also had our wedding reception there and that was so awesome. We stayed there that night but didn't get complimentary to Rumors. At least that we should of got

Rooms were very clean and Housekeeping staff were friendly and thorough. Valet staff were efficient and always exchanged pleasantries. View from the room was beautiful. Location is really good with the shopping center right next door.

This hotel was Clean and Excellent Customer Service. The room was clean and up to date and the front desk staff was friendly and efficient! The rest of the staff was also friendly and made guests feel welcome -from the security to the bellmen to the valets. I would recommend this property.

We were glad that we booked an ocean view room in time to see the Hokulea Homecoming at Magic Island. Ala Moana Hotel has always been one of my favorite kamaaina hotel to stay at with it's location to the beach and Ala Moana shopping mall.

Stay here if you want to stay out of Waikiki, save some money, and don't mind a small room. Service was fine but not the friendliest and the front desk got confused over our parking (which is an antiquated paper system). We had a lovely view and walked to shopping, restaurants, and the beach.

Rooms were clean...disappointed that I couldn't get late check out. Felt like that staff was overwhelmed by Hokulea weekend. The staff was friendly. Felt like this hotel did what I needed it to do, place near Magic Island and sleep.

Front desk and buffet staff were very kind and welcoming. Check in line was a bit crazy. The close proximity to the shops and restaurants was ideal for not having a rental car. Overall cleanliness of the room and hotel was good.

I am grateful for your staff for accommodating my family. We had an incident at our home with plumbing so we needed a place to stay. The initial reservation associate book the room I needed for August. I was sure I had said I needed a room immediately. The reservation desk did help me in this situation and got my family a place to stay.

Found silver fish in pull out bed along with droppings. Called front desk to relocate. Room was pretty small but great location. For kamaina price and location. It was a deal. Nice to see locals as well as people from afar

This hotel is perfect for an Hawaiian shopping stopover as it is connected to the Ala Moana Shopping Centre. It has a great pool area and the Happy Hour at Signature Restaurant is fantastic. The rooms may be compact and a little dated, but the location more than makes up for that.

The room was tiny; way smaller than I expected. The sofa bed did not have any sheets or blankets so I had to call housekeeping to bring some to our room then make the bed on my own (not that I don't know how to but it should have already been done). Best thing about this hotel is the mall being right there.

Wonderful stay ! The suites were very roomy and comfortable for our wedding party.I will book again. Very nice décor, staff very friendly and helpful, Close to shopping,airport, restaurants ! also, it was pretty close to our venue at the Koolau mountains !

We enjoyed using the suite as a gathering place for the family. The noise from the construction next door made sleeping late impossible. The check in and check out lines were also too long. Otherwise, it was a nice stay.

Arrived at 3PM, waited at least 30 minutes to get checked in, it was much too long; self parking was convenient, but good luck finding space if you come back late; housekeeping was inconsistent in replenishing towels and I had to call housekeeping twice to get more towels; location is great as it's right next to Ala Moana Shopping Center and you can walk to it from the 2nd floor; the bed was really uncomfortable, but it was better than being too soft. I had good wi-fi so tha was real plus for me.

Ok stay overall. Check in was slow, nice-sized room, quiet, A/C worked perfectly, clean room, parking structure full given the weekend's special event, nice staff, didn't use any amenities, enjoyed the Plantation Café, quick service, nicely priced.

I stayed here with my mom for my birthday. The beds are comfortable. The Chinese restaurant is delicious. Only thing I'm unhappy with is the front desk guy hung up on me while I was talking. We were only on the phone for like 2 minutes too. My job deals with customer service so I was really shocked when he hung up on me like that.

First nite 6/16 there was some loud grinding noise few times?? Was it ac?!What happened to little Room Service?! We called at 1130pm and was advised to go to 7-11. Operator could have suggested Sura Hawaii which someone took us to the next nite and it was excellent food!!

Everything was excellent! We wanted to stay close to Ala Moana Beach because the Hokulea was arriving the next morning. The Ala Moana Hotel met and exceeded our expectations. The staff was professional and friendly and although the check in took long due to the large amount of people checking in, we were very happy with our stay.

The Ala Moana Hotel is in a great location. It is very easy to get to. The front desk staff was very friendly and very accommodating. The valets were a little rough around the edges, but very quick. When we were waiting for our car, there was a homeless man who came up and was making another female customer a little uncomfortable as well as the rest of us waiting. But the valet stepped in, took the attention off the customer, and, through jokes, got the man to leave. To use their valet is $25 a day. If you don't use the valet, there's no guarantee you'll have parking in their structure and you'll need to park on the street if no stalls are available. The rooms are little small, but good for two people. Any more in a room might be a bit crowded. But overall a good choice.

Everyone was great at the check in process considering how busy you were. The room was fine but someone should have cleaned it better. Old food in fridge and kids dirty underwear on floor next to small couch. Other than that it was fine for a quick stay.

Great location central to shopping and the best swimming beach in the world. Nice pool, great weight room, fast checkout! The Starbucks on site is very cool! There are no "hang-ups" or dumb waits at this hotel: Service is fast and efficient. Coffee in the room, ironing board and iron, nice TV, free WiFi, perfect for a great stay!

Great Hotel And Ammenities Within Walking Distance Of Waikiki And The Shopping Center, Perfect Location. Housekeeping Were Very Accommodating And Check-In/Out Was Quick And Easy. Would Definitely Stay Again.

We usually love staying here but this time around, there were a few disappointments. From checking in & not being able to accommodate out reservation to one of our keys not working. Not sure if we will be back.

Needed a quick trip to Honolulu, but ended up enjoying the are and was able to walk to most places. Used the Activities Desk which was very helpful to plan a tour in the limited time I had. Room was very tidy and I great condition!

Property is Okay. But for the price of the stay I was expecting a nicer bathroom. TV remote didn't work. TV is small. It was nice that the iron worked and the ironing board was of good quality. I HATED THE BED. I'm 6'7" so I need at minimum a queen size. I ordered a one person room with the queen size bed. They gave me a two person room with two twin size beds that are not capable of combining. HORRIBLE. I had to sleep in diagonal and even then any small shift and I would be off. Sleep is the most important aspect of my stay. You have FAILED.

No hidden resort fees, nice hotel with lots of amenities. Only stayed one night but it was very comfortable. we had a less expensive room without a view in the Kona tower. If view is important, pay the extra but for us, we just slept there and then went out to experience Honolulu.

Convenient location. Easy to get to, but when property is sold out, you need a better solution to checking in rather than having someone wait in line for 2 hours. But thank you for providing water to those that were in line.

We LOVE the Ala Moana Hotel! However, hotel management could've done a better job staffing the hotel this weekend. We had a LONG wait to check in (over 1 hour). One of our key cards did NOT work after checking in. Our room door did not automatically close, we always had to push/pull it shut, hotel security knocked on our door one of the times it did not shut properly.

I really enjoyed my stay at The Ala Moana hotel! The staff was really nice from check-in to check-out. They were very accommodating with all my needs. This is the perfect vacation or staycation spot!!

Arrived at 2 p.m. on a busy weekend. The check-in line had about 100 people in it, we waited about an hour and it moved forward only about 5 feet. We decided to come back later at 5 p.m. The line was still ridiculously long. No communication from the hotel letting us know what was going on, no offering water, etc. Absolutely nothing! We waited another hour and decided to leave a second time because we would be late for a wedding rehearsal dinner. We went to dinner in the same clothes we had on from that morning, no shower, no nothing. We were miserable. Finally, we returned to the hotel at 8:30 and there were only about 25 people standing in line. After a 30 minute wait we were able to finally check-in. Shame on you Ala Moana Hotel for being so unprepared!

We stayed at the Ala Moana Hotel for the homecoming of the Hokule'a. Overall, our stay was comfortable and the staff were friendly and accomodating. However, utensils and plates wree not provided in the room and we were given plastic utensils buy Housekeeping. There were also bugs in the bathroom.

Again, I've complained of this before, your hotel has not aloha -- no smiles, no warmth, no welcome. Just very depressed people who never look you in the eye, never smile and never make you feel welcome. Sad. Also, the noise quality has MUCH to be desired. You can hear everyone around you, below and next door, taking a shower and every word whispered in the hallways. I just like the location, period.

Went here for a special occassion. There were kind and friendly staff. It was a bit expensive, but the view was beautiful, room had a fridge, microwave, and coffee pot. No room service but fresh lemon water and Starbucks in the lobby were great.

If you're expecting a large check in I would hope some time of plans would be made on behalf of the hotel to expedite the check in process. I waited over an hour in line to check it - that's right over an hour to get my room key! When getting to the room I was excited that the room was cooled down, the bedding was soft and smelt great! It was a great hotel central to the everything Waikiki had to offer. I didn't felt welcomed by the staff.Just note that check out time is 12 noon. They don't tell you that or have it anywhere in the room.

Very busy weekend for this hotel and service at the front desk was slow. Love the Bell Hops they are so good. If you want to know anything go there 1st.Crew check in should be pre assigned and not interrupt other guests business. Even their keyscould be picked up at the wonderful Bell Hops.This hotel has a great location for shopping away from the hustle of the Beach front and with all the transport to anywhere else on the island in one place in and around the Ala Moana Centre.
user_name:
Maureen M
Grand Canyon National Park, Arizona

review_body: Great place to stay with all the conveniences within reach. Clean rooms, friendly staff and great value. I really enjoyed the newly renovated rooms which gave me a true vacation away from home feel with all the comfort in the world.

Clean, nice, with decent pricing and right on the bus line. It is my go to hotel when i need to go to oahu from maui. Kama'aina rates too. great staff, book direct though. You wont get the service of the hotel if you wind up getting a condo.

Great staff! Positive response from Front Desk. Asked for a room change once we got into the room and Front Desk and Housekeeping made it happen! Location of the hotel is perfect for anyone on vacation or for business!

Excellent room and service provided by all staff we came in contact with. Nice and close to buses and the Ala Moana centre which the girls enjoyed. I would recommend your hotel and especially the small suites to other family members and friends.

Nice atmosphere, no frills, and close to Ala Moana Center is why we have stayed here when passing by between Gua and the mainland. Coming from another island, being close to the beach is not a big deal for my wife and me. Plus we enjoy not being in the hustle and bustle of Waikiki.

Construction was so loud. Other than that, everything was very good. Location is so good. Close to the mall. Excellent transportation. Check-in and check out process was efficient and good. Although the mountain view was great, the construction site was unfortunately very distracting.

Nice place - I would stay there again, no doubt. Could use better parking arrangement, but not bad for that part of town. Beds were very comfortable and buffet breakfast in restaurant was excellent. Mahalo

Great from the front desk to the maid service, everything was great. Elevators were really quick, the use of your room card was great security feature. Valet was quick and very helpful and friendly. Over all experience was great and will definitely revisit this hotel.

I hope you will commend Heidi for an excellent service. She should be valued for her level of expertise. She was fast, knowledgeable and extremely and genuinely pleasant. Thanks you for a pleasant stay.

This was my first and perhaps only stay. Overall, a cut below. No blanket! Traffic noise. Construction site view and noise. Confusing parking ticket system. Parking area needs repaving. Confusing TV remote, couldn't get it to work. Guide cards are needed for TV and the old style microwave. Worn shower fixtures. The only positive is the proximity to the medical offices in the Ala Moana building. If that is not the reason for the stay, I would not recommend the Ala Moana hotel. In light of the above, "special" low cost rates should ALWAYS be available.

My husband and I checked in for medical purpose and was referred to us by my co-worker. Didn't expect too much because the room price was not bad. Our view was the construction site and the room was on a small size. The only thing we had an issue was the towels inside the bathroom. Two out of six had mud/dirt in them (was really grossed out). Exchange it to the maid that we saw on the hallway.

We had a lovely time! Great location. We were in town for a family funeral. The location, cleanliness, efficiency of employees were great. Employees were friendly and professional. We will stay again.

Everything was wonderful except the air conditioning in our room was not as strong and cold as I remember in past rooms. I would definetly stay there again and for the price that I received it was perfect for a night stay

We had to queue for 40 mins to check in. This seems excessive.Location with easy access to Ala Moana shopping Centre was great. Hotel room was small but adequate but not cheap. Ironing board and iron in the room was appreciated.

I would change the coffee mugs to disposal type. i do not drink the coffee in the room due to the way the mugs are cleaned. Many hotels are now using healthier disposal cups. It is hygienic safe and make the stay perfect.

Room, Staff, Service were excellent. Will return in the near future and beyond. Complex was centrally located to all attractions and avoided the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. Nicely located next to Ala Moana Center for the ladies of our party.

Front office makes a lasting impression & I was not happy upon arrival. Eye contact & Aloha is expected, got neither which is especially sad because I am Kamaaiana. If location of hotel wasn't so convenient I'd choose to stay elsewhere

We come from a background in hotels and the service is excellent. There was one tiny little problem when we got to our room and they took care of it immediately. Excellent & Professional service from the Front desk, bellman, housekeeping and sundry store. Mahalo!

Stayed for the Kam day holiday. Shower was draining very slow and would clog up. The refrigerator was leaking and also the a/c would turn on and off so the room would be very hot at times. We couldn't open the door because it would be even hotter. Also the rates were so high for the room I had. The beds were very lumpy.

Partial Ocean view in Waikiki Tower room. Nice room and view. Very comfortable room with nice view of nearby boat harbor. Breakfast buffet very disappointing. Extremely over priced. Quick check in and check out. Like that it is a non-smoking hotel.

Excellent service and great room! The hotel is right next to the largest open-air shopping center in the world, the Ala Moana Center. My family and I will be coming back in December 2017 and will be staying at this hotel again!

Except for exasperating long line for check in, all was well at the hotel..Road repairs and construction in and around Ala Moana Center adds minutes and frustration to travel time when you need to get somewhere quickly.

The service from valet, to front desk, as well as housekeeping met or exceeded our standards. I haven't been there for a few years, and was happy to return and still have that Kama'aina welcome. I think it is important that the local people be treated to the warm Aloha spirit. I have experienced places where the local people were not treated as nice as the mainland visitors, and that is sad. So I am happy to say, we will be returning again because of the hospitality shown at your property. Mahalo nui loa...

It is hard to beat the location, just outside of Waikiki and right next to Ala Moana Center. We live on the outer islands and try to mix business with pleasure when we have to travel to Oahu. The convenient location is easy to get to from the airport by freeway or surface street, shopping and movies are easy to get to, and the staff are always friendly and helpful.

Unfortunately, I was staying there for Medical purposes at Queens hospital. There is only Pagoda's and Ala Moana that is convenient for outer island families who's family is in Queens. I wish you the room cost was a little more reasonable rate and flexibility, I had to go on different sites to book or extend my stay. The front desk could not extend directly. The first time the front desk said I'm sorry we are booked and have no rooms available. I came in from the big island and she had no sensitivity what so ever. So I booked it online litterly everyday, then I had to check out and check back in. Had I knew how long my dad was going to stay in the hospital I would have booked it all one time but unfortunately it was day to day. Now on the flip side I did have a couple of friendly front desk staff. The valet guys was excellent! The convenience of your location is the best.

The Ala Moana Hotel is my home away from home. From the valet, to house keeping, to the waiters. Everything made my stay there AMAZING!! The view was beautiful! We had an ocean view room. Overall we just enjoyed being there!!

power outage 10 min after arrival so we couldnt get into our room after a grueling flight day didn't have enough info on the amenities and their location also the hours of said amenities location was good for us

AirPads will add hidden fees to their slightly cheaper rates. You will not know this until you are checking in. We were hit with nearly $100 in resort/key fees. Promised a refund to get me off the phone, but it never materialized. Lesson learned: I will only book directly with the Ala Moana Hotel from now on.

Although check-in was a long wait, everything about the hotel was great. Staff was helpful, pool was clean, rooms were excellent. Parking was a little confusing, the attendants didn't explain how to enter and exit until our last day. Other than that, our stay was great.

Very clean and comfortable. Excellent staff and convenient location.The self parking was very convenient and affordable. The hotel was walking distance to mall and convention center. The pool and workout center was in excellent condition.

Our hotel was centrally located to our conference as well as the mall. The staff was friendly and amenable. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The gym was a great place to work out in. We loved have my the quick access to the mall for shopping and eating. Overall, our stay was awesome.

I have not been to the hotel since the 70's and frankly the lobby is stunning, the layout, the decor and color scheme are outstanding. My room was also outstanding love the color choices and it was well layed out. The staff was very professional, courteous and helpful. I would have liked some directions or tips on use of the key card for the elevator and the room and some directions on use of the computers to print out my boarding pass but once it was explained to me I was okay. I just wished it had been done when I checked in. Other than that it was a lovely stay and will be staying in your beautiful hotel again in the near future. Of course that ramp to Ala Moana shopping is a big bonus for your hotel guest. Thank you

Will definitely be back. Service was great, except the fact that we had to wait almost an hour to check in, but it was okay because we knew there we a lot of events going on that weekend. Definitely will return!

Overall it was a positive experience. We're local (currently living on the Big Island) and this is the first time staying here since it was renamed to Ala Moana Hotel by Mantra. This is an ideal location -- close to the shopping center, Ala Moana beach park, Waikiki, Walmart and grocery stores. We still had a car, but we had in and out privileges and never had an issue finding parking. The room was a good enough size. The bathroom felt a little small - only one person can be in there at a time. My husband didn't have a comfortable sleep on the bed, but it was fine for me. Decent options for coffee, however, no stirrers were provided. Always nice to have a fridge and microwave in the room. Complimentary wifi is also nice to have. Great deal for kama'ainas!!

Hope for renovation and upgrades bigger parking spaces great location near the mall and the beach and the convention more people at check in counter at peak check in hour Starbucks is new and a plus..

The service provided by the staff was excellent. I have stayed at the Ala Moana many times over the years but this was the best. I did make a comment about the furniture in room 860. No desk chair and a small sofa bed that didn't belong there. Evidence of this is that the tooo big picture extended below the back of the sofa. I know that this provides extra sleeping space but the room was not built for this.

We come here almost every year and love the location. Close to shops and food and easy to commute to any place we want to visit on the island. And we have always found the staff to be so very helpful and positive. It's always a pleasure to be there. Thank you

Rqstd hotel accommodations the the KS Ed Tech 2017 Conference. Earlier, the property was sold out. I happened to check availability on 6/5/17 and was able to confirm the booking. The Res Dept is friendly (Shauna ?)! I was extremely happy!

Our stay was Awesomeness it was last minute but still awesome beautiful hotel I wish we stayed longer :) thank u for so,e great service and Justin at front desk was very helpful and provided us with hospitality room love his Aloha spirit!

Basically, it was clean and comfortable to stay. However the frige was kind of noisy. And it's unavoidable, but the the noise from constructing something in midnight was kind of big. Anyway your hotel is of convenience to be close to the convension center and shopping mall. Thanks.

I stay at the Ala Moana frequently for work and pleasure. You cannot beat the location if you are planning at shopping at the mall. Usually I really enjoy my stay, however, this time I was very disappointed. The shuttle back to the airport was a half hour late arriving and the front desk's solution was "pay for a cab." The sheets in our room were stained, the air conditiner left a big puddle on the floor, and the toilet did. It flush properly.

It was a nice stay. We missed our flight and had to book one night last min. We had been staying down the street for 6days prior at the Marina Tower, the room we got with you guys was smaller but way nicer amenities. And the pool was very nice!

Excellent staff interaction .. great location. Lobby and services are so inviting and relaxing. When I wanted to change rooms due to misunderstanding, lady at front desk was so kind and understanding.

We stayed overnight before embarking on a cruise. This is very close to the port side embarkation site. For the purpose, the facilities were adequate. Location is made better by being next to the Ala Moana Shopping Mall. Otherwise not too impressive. Tariff and convenience were the strong points. Would stay again for these reasons.

Our room was clean and tidy. The King size bed turned out to be a Queen and our Mtn. view room was a construction site. But the staff was very sweet and I absolutely loved the buffet breakfast with fresh fruit and juice, also lots of entrée breakfast items to choose from. Try to stay clear of Concierge, the lady running the desk really had a negative impact on our trip which is why we rated this place just Average.

My colleagues and I flew in to meet and greet our freshman students and their parents. 38 families participated. Our banquet room was Garden lanaiThe staff was Awesome the food was Great! We all enjoyed our experience!

Reasonable and friendly environment for personal or stay for business. I would stay there on a future stay. Locals and kamaainas should be standard rates with no blackouts. Thank you and look forward to coming back soon

We had a great room with a view of the harbor from 35 th floor. The hotel is older but you can not beat the location attached to the mall. Starbucks downstairs in the lobby.Must have a cocktail at the bar in the hotel .Great view!!!!

Hotel is fine, but in-hotel casual dining options for lunch & dinner are very limited. If you cannot or choose not to walk a fair distance or drive somewhere, you are left with "to-go" food. The rooms do have refrigerators & microwaves.

We enjoyed our stay at the Ala Moana - it was our third time. Good because of the service, location, rooms and overall offerings of the hotel. Heidi, the desk agent checking us in was so nice, courteous and professional. We appreciate her tips and recommendations about new local restaurants and places to visit. Heidi exudes the genuine "Aloha Spirit."

Just stayed here for business and was disappointed. Not by the service, which exemplified the aloha spirit, but by the ratty, rundown state of the hotel. Carpets were frayed, pillows were hard, and when I asked why I couldn't charge my meal to the room, my server told me that their system had been down for weeks. The place needs a remodel!

Clean environment and close by to shop and mall. Night club and restaurant also good and very enjoyable. Will definitely stay here again, as a matter of fact I always stay here when on island. Enjoy your stay

This was a wonderful, convenient stay. The room was clean, the people were friendly. I asked what time check out was and the guy told me noon and then chased me down to tell me he was sorry and that it was at 11 am.

I enjoyed the great service and amenities at the Ala Moana Hotel. The down fall of my stay was the bathroom shower, the shower faucet dripped all night and the shower drain was plugged. Other than that my stay there was excellent! Thank you!

Perfect for my business travel. Great service, food, rooms and close to everything I needed.I would recommend this for any business travel. I would stay here again...I have stayed here many times before and am still happy

The worst stay I ever had in a hotel. The worst room, noisy as hell. Could hear water running in the pipes all night. Also doors slamming as if my door was open. Smelled horrible. I won't be staying here ever again

This was the first time that I stayed at your establishment, but it will not be the last. You are a top-notch establishment and I will forever remember it as a place to be cherished and enjoyed. Thanks to you and your staff for helping me to show my wife how much I appreciate her supporting me through my 24 years of service and remaining married to me.

Thank you, Manny Bucco, Ala Moana Events Coordinator for making our Wedding weekend the BEST!!! You are a delight to work with and we are so happy we had the opportunity to work with you!!! We highly recommend Ala Moana hotel as your top choice for all events and celebrations! Convenient location, quality customer service, and very accommodating!

A little on the pricey side, even for kamaaina, however the location is convenient. Rooms were clean. The little convenienc store has a really pleasant cashier. I believe her name was So Yun. She's probably half the reason I go back. Joyce is the nicest person in the reservations dept.

The room was very dirty and filthy.There were fingerprints, in the glass doors and outside glass by the lanai. There are hair strands in the shelves and clipped nail by the bathroom floors. The desks are dusty and rugs & floors are not vaccummed

The front desk registration staff, especially a Ms. Jean, was top-notch - superb, professional customer service!! Valet attendants were great as well. Very convenient location and will definitely stay here again.

The Ala Moana was the "convention hotel" for a recent meeting. It's only a couple blocks from the Hawaii Convention Center, is adjacent to the Ala Moana mall (you can walk to the Macys across their back parking garage off of the 2nd floor), and is equally close to Ala Moana park and its beaches and running trails. It's a long-ish walk into Waikiki, but it's doable, so one can stay there and do the traditional Honolulu tourist stuff, especially if you're not averse to the local buses. The "Kona Tower" rooms are on the small side, but are more than sufficient for a business visitor's needs. From the business perspective, the internet access was irritating - it was parsed by room, but my room never officially worked, so I ended up "sponging" off of signals from several adjacent rooms. They have a Starbucks on site that serves beer, and an in-hotel ABC -store equivalent that carries fresh fruit and coffee for making, so one doesn't have to do the $20+ breakfast buffet their hotel restaurant serves (and I didn't, not even one morning). The staff are very professional and helpful on all matters, and they know the town well - they put me onto several very nice restaurants in the immediate vicinity. It's clearly popular with Japanese tour companies (you'll encounter crowds in the mornings in their back lobby, waiting to board tour buses), but they're never so mobbed that service is a problem. I'd certainly stay there again, and for-sure in lieu of many of the Waikiki options the next time I'm in for business.

We were so happy with our stay at Ala Moana Hotel when we visited in conjunction with the Lantern Floating event at the beach across the street. The hotel rooms were spacious, clean and neat. Our suite had a wonderful view and the staff were very accommodating throughout out stay. We'll be back next year.

Hotel didn't seem full and I've stayed their numerous times in the past, but was put on the 4th floor facing the parking lot. Kinda sucked, but I'm sure better people got the better rooms. Also Lawrence Lum is the greatest front desk manager ever.

was there one night only for the annual lantern floating ceremony. so glad we got a room. the room was lovely and clean, the elevators were fast, great security, so convenient, and overall a nice ambiance. will definitely be there are thankful kamaainas.

Location was just great & housekeeping was also just right, but membership benefits were no where, which disappointed me & my family, who are repeaters of Outrigger chain hotels.It is a shame on your new management.

Stayed at other hotels nearby but this was very convenient. On a Business promo 1st night, then a neighbors Wedding next few. Our Room was upper floor partial ocean was very comfortable. I'd stay there again.

Great Hotel, Small Bathroom. Door to close to toilet hard to close, and privacy issue as its next to entry door. Great Gym and Pool. Will stay again soon.don't like the survey as needs to many words to submit.

Ala Moana Hotel has always been a good hotel. Clean and so convenient for shopping and food. It's also been great allowing us to have the room we wanted when we requested a certain one in order for us to be able to see the view of our work site which is very important.

Location was very convenient for a conference at the Convention Centre. We had a Kona Tower room, which was very small, no balcony and our view was the mall parking lot, but the most reasonably priced room we could find in the area. Staff was accommodating with requests. Close to the mall and other shopping. Free wifi was available.The biggest plus was it was within walking distance to the Convention Centre.

If you are looking for an Ocean view - this is NOT the hotel for you. There are many other high rise buildings that block your view, so your 'ocean view' is really a slice between 2 high rises. Rooms are okay. No pool bar was disappointing. Location next to Ala Moana Shopping center is a plus. $40/day for parking was a bit expensive.

We were assigned to room 552 in the Kona Tower. The toilet was running at intervals all day and night, which resulted in a very sleepless night. Reported to the front desk agent and she said that the issue would be brought to the attention of the maintenance staff. The issue was not corrected for our second night stay. Again we did not get a good night's sleep. Upon checking out I again reported the issue.

I was looking for a reasonable price hotel walking distance to beach and Mall. This hotel was perfect for my needs. There was a Starbucks in the lobby. Also, the next door Mall has a huge food court that is very reasonably priced. There is a sky walkway that connects the hotel and Mall.

By far a very pleasant stay. My husband and I loved that we were not located in the Waikiki area with all that congestion. The staff very happy and eager to serve which shows that they too are well taken care of.

This hotel is clean, safe and a great location for shopping, venues and going to Waikiki without being in a touristy area! I found the staff friendly, helpful and felt they genuinely cared about their guests. I have been coming here for years and they have only improved with time - the upgrades are beautiful.

We always stay here for a staycation because we like to go to Rumours and won't have to drive home. Everyone is always nice and quick to take care of any problems if there are any. The lady that works in the convenience store is also very nice.

Another very nice stay, 3rd time over the last several years. Courteous, friendly and helpful staff - including valet, front desk, bell service and housekeepers.Higher floors are best. Not sure it really counts as a "partial ocean view" if you have to lean out from the lanai and peer around the dividing wall.

The A/C and hot shower were prime for this stay-cation. Breakfast was great and it's nice to be able to walk to the mall. The Starbucks in the lobby was quite well done. The HGTV was a great addition to the stay.

Ala Moana Hotel is conveniently located in Honolulu. Waikiki is within walking distance, while world class shopping can be had at the adjacent Ala Moana Center. More affordable eating is also available in the shopping center as well as in adjacent diners. For beach activities, the Ala Moana Park is where locals in the know hand out. It has easy access to downtown Honlulu and the airport. The hotel has an excellent fitness center. All in all its hard to pass up this hotel.
user_name:
Dana Point M
Dana Point, California

review_body: Everything is right at your feet. Able to walk or drive to a lot of restaurants or shopping andAlso the beach. Eating places at the hotel is excellent the snack shop is convenient. TheSwimming pool is excellent and you're able just to relax in the room with a beautiful view. TheBreakfast buffet was very good. Different variety and selections for a very healthy breakfast.

Our last minute request for a room but your customer service rep took an extra step to assist us. The room was clean and comfortable. There were extra everything. The only problem I cannotoperate the microwave..

hotel was very clean and location was perfect. staff members were very helpful. i highly recommend this hotel to friends and family. mall and park were walking distance. public transportation was easily accessible.

Great venue and access to the shopping center. The hotel staff was very courteous and responded immediately to my requests. I especially appreciated the provision of a microwave in the room. I wish more packets of coffee could be made available. Thank you.

Room was clean. Excellent view for partial ocean view. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Iwalani was very helpful in replacing my room key when it wouldn't work. Love that it's just a short walk to the mall for food and shopping and that Starbucks is right downstairs in the lobby. Wish the price was slightly cheaper for kama'aina but it's still an awesome place and location to stay at. Never disappointed!

Still great location to stay if going to the beach or want to do some shopping and not worry about parking spaces. Do need some kind of shuttle or trolley to go to Waikiki if you don't want to drive there.

Hotel was so beautiful. Had shops and Starbucks too. Close to lots of restaurants. Had a nice breakfast Buffett. We really loved our stay here. We visited a fabric store down the street. Fancy restaurant upstairs as well.

We stayed here for a few days. The bed is a lot smaller than they described online. It's more like full size that felt like a twin size. The place is clean. Staff are friendly and responsive. It's a busy place. Starbucks there serves great coffee. Boutique shops are convenient. It's great for people who love to shop. It was too far from the beach.

Misadvertisement, front desk attitude First off...I enjoyed my stay at the Ala Moana hotel. And I will be back, but, there were some things I was disappointed in. I arranged my stay online, and if you're goin to advertise partial ocean view, especially to Kama'ana, don't offer a room with a view of the Macy's parking lot. And, when I went to the front desk to change my room, they seemed uninterested and couldn't even offer a smile thoughout the conversation. Also when I checked out, there was no smile, no "thank you for your stay" nothing. That was a red flag. But, I did get upgraded to an amazing room with a lanai and ocean view on the 31st floor. Thank you for your time and I hope this was helpful, easy

Nice and friendly customer service plus we like the idea that after check out u have 30mins freshen up I will recommend this to all my relatives close to the mall and it's very convenient we all enjoy

We visited Oahu from the Big Island to take Apple classes. Ala Moana was convient, clean, and service was excellent. Our room was very nice and well appointed. The service staff very pleasant and did a wonderfully thorough job.Mahalo

The check in was very fast and service great the room was ready when we got there and parking was not a problem, Great location and worth value of the stay. Looking forward to staying here next month again to relax and visit friends.

I expected more for the price I paid..... Video of the 1 bedroom suite online made the room seem bigger then it is. Pillows, blankets, and bath towels are too small.... Suite's do not come with any napkins.... I don't understand why you need pay to rent the kitchen supplies if you are already paying for the suite.... Microwave didn't work well, parking is very limited.

room fixtures will need to be maintained... iron was not working, bathroom fixtures can be upgraded, refrigerator needs to be replaced (too noisy), parking garage can use more space.hotel location is great, great staff

Really like this hotel. It is comfortable and clean and the people who work there are very kind. We were able to get into the room earlier than 2pm which was important since this trip was part of a stressful time for our family.

The overall condition of the hotel show need of renovation and needs to be updated. We like the hotel but it is right on the border of being old and unappealing. I seems that little things are being overlooked as far repairs go and now all the little things have added up to an dated building.

This is a very nice, busy hotel. Perfect for those not looking for beach frontage. Good services within the hotel, and easy walk to Ala Moana Mall. I especially enjoyed having Starbucks within the lobby.

First off, bell/ Valet couldn't help with unloading me and my little girls bag just because we said we could roll our own carry ons, the front desk agent was very friendly which was the ONLY plus, we requested for additional sheets/ blankets but it never came (had to use the extra towel to warm my little girl up), woke up in the middle of the night and turned lights on to find 3 little roaches crawling on the carpet, the refrigerator smelled like old food, requested for a late check out as my little girl was still sleeping and the person on the phone rudely said "absolutely not...we no longer do that" (only to find out other friends traveling with us were granted late check outs), at departing bell/valet was no help loading our bags again...they stood there no more than a 2 feet away taking to each other and just looked over at us struggling to lift the bags into the car.

I stayed here because a seminar I was attending was at this location. The staff was not very friendly or helpful. The cost was comparable to a hotel with more amenities so I would say that the general value was poor to average.

I was disappointed in the smell of rotten seaweed in the room. The pool closed at 7pm, no hot tub. The sauna had no directions for use and I never got it working.The construction noise for the Kona Tower was horrible.

All I can say is this hotel downgraded since I was there about 7 years ago,Rooms are no longer sound-proof so I could hear neighbor laughing,motorcycles and traffic nearby. Refrigerator was no longer filled with drinks or food. This will probably be my last visit.

Normally I stay in a Aiea Hotel a couple of times a year on business and tried the Ala Moana Hotel based on the price and location. The felt the location would be quieter than Waikiki and the room costs were reasonable. Considering the age of the hotel, I did not expect how elegant, modern and clean it was, I was expecting a darker cluttered environment but was hit with a wow factor. Right from the parking area in the basement lower floor to the main floor reception to the 28th floor was so bright, warm, friendly and extremely efficient at making you feel welcomed to the Ala Moana.The room and parking costs were great value considering the level of high level of service and accommodation received. The room was very quiet and even major high-rise building construction across the street was unnoticeable since it started mid morning and ended late afternoon. The room was well laid out, very comfortable bed with linen and pillows you would expect in your house. All hotel staff were warm and friendly along with being well trained to provide any information you needed. The lower parkade was easy to access and you could come and go as often as you desire for one daily cost.I recommend try the Ala Moana next visit and you will also be wanting to come back again.

Located just next to the conference center and nice rooms, but amazingly slow reception and strange policy about room payment needed at arrival, even though your room mate is arriving later on and you would like to share the costs.

I had a great experience at the Ala Moana. They have a very professional and courteous staff at a very comfortable facility. I highly recommend it . Shopping nearby and ocean just a short walk away. Great coffee shop in the lobby too.

Comfort, relaxation, very helpful staff. We were upgraded to suite in Waikiki Tower.What a wonderful surprise ! Lots of room, with a full kitchen.Lovely mauka views.Valet service very fast and friendly!

Stayed in a Suite using bedroom and fold-out sofa for myself and 20 year old daughter. Rooms are overdue for many upgrades and renovations including plumbing, electrical, and the addition of a least some extended TV services (there are currently none).

I recently had to travel to Honolulu on business and looked for an affordable hotel in a good location. I booked at the Ala Moana hotel and could not have been happier. My room was clean and maintained beautifully. The hotel staff was gracious and could not have been more helpful. There is a Starbucks right in the lobby for a great cup of morning coffee. I had a delightful meal in the steakhouse at the top of the hotel. It was a delicious dinner and the view is one of the best on the island! The hotel directly connect via a ramp to the Ala Moana Center. There are high end shops and restaurants galore and a grocery store and food court. The choices for food and shopping were endless and easily reached to pick up snacks and a stop in the drug store to pick up something I had forgotten. It turned out to be the perfect price point for my clients, the perfect location and the perfect hotel for a busy business trip. I would definitely stay there again when returning to Honolulu.

The place is highly recommended to someone who would like to enjoy relaxing atmosphere away from busy and crowded Waikiki. Ala Moana Hotel is located next to Ala Moana Shopping Center and almost in front of Ala Moana Park from which we can enjoy the best view of Waikiki over the ocean.It is still walking distance from Waikiki.

I flew to Oahu to have some eye surgery and chose the Ala Moana Hotel for its location and access to the Ala Moana Shopping Center. I am not a big shopper but it allowed easy access to a variety of eating establishments and a place to pass the time during my surgery stay.

I wish we were told about the construction - Saturday early morning (430am) there was loud grinding noises coming from the construction site (like someone was running the jack hammer) I just wish someone had told us about the construction I would have asked to pay for another room location. Our AC unit kept knocking off -luckily my husband put a bottle cap to magnetize the door. Just was disappointed for the amount we paid for the room and to be awoken at 430am. The plus side the location of hotel was great we walked to ala moana and ala moana beach. Service was good as well.

Very good, I stay here a couple of times a year, for many years.The breakfast at the Plantation Café, is nice and comfortable.Ala Moana Center is a good reason to stay here.That is why I keep coming back.

Stayed at this hotel on a 5 day business trip, mostly associated with the Convention Center which is a short walk down the street. Can also walk to the beach for swimming, or the mall for shopping needs, and there is good bus service to UH. Street noise is a bit loud at times, but only when the balcony door is open. Plenty quiet at night for sleeping and the room was clean and kept clean by the staff. All staff I interacted with were very personable and helpful. The hotel is just off the main Waikiki cluster of hotels and shops, which I prefer. I would stay here again when on business. Photos are from the 24th floor.

We stayed here last year and my husband stayed in 2015. We got a 1 bedroom suite and it was awesome. Kids had their on area and kitchen and we had our own bedroom and fridge. The price was amazing too. Maids do an amazing job as does everyone from the front desk staff to the valet staff! Couldn't be more satisfied! We will definitely back next year!

The valet staff is very cordial and accommodating, they managed quite a large amount of people's vehicles with very little stress on the customer. Housekeeping had to be called to the room to clean it after 2:00, that was disappointing as the rest of the rooms on the floor had been cleaned but they apparently forgot to clean mine. Front desk wasn't too friendly. Room view was beautiful but expensive.

Loved the kamaaina rate, pleasant experience at check-in, accommodations in room, location, cleanliness of establishment & thankfully, no ridiculous "resort fees" charge. Enjoyed stay & would pick this hotel as the number 1 search for future travel to Oahu

Booked through booking.com. 1 week was advertised at £494. They fail to total up any additional costs, even when checking out where you expect to see the final total.Even the confirmation email states £494.Turns out they took £800+ out of my account. Booking.com were very unhelpful and said it was clearly stated (which it wasnt), therefore I have been charged £247 cancellation fee. Waiting for a refund now.Having read reviews after, it seems a lot of people have been scammed with these additional charges.Will be complaining higher. I hope people read this before booking!!

My favorite thing about the hotel is the location. The mall is a one stop shop, and the hotel is right there. Thank you for having a microwave in all your rooms. My husband and I love staying at your hotel. It's always our first choice.
user_name:
Ciera E
Lanai City, United States

review_body: Awesome customer relations. He checked me in and listened to my terrible day and even put in a few choice encouraging words. All while simutainiously checking me in. I was impressed and my mood went from drab to fab.. Literally saved the day. Made me feel like all would be well Ana I was heard at least. That made ALL the difference

the location of the hotel is its most valuable asset. the ease of getting to ala moana mall is great.however, the rooms are on the smaller side & the bathrooms are really small. there are issues with things not working & should be checked and addressed as soon as you get into your room. this will save you headaches.

We enjoyed the stay and hopefully we can get better rates next time...this was strictly business ( I had a doctor's appointment on Thursday.) It was for the convenience of staying at your hotel. Thanks for a fine trip...

Great service with a prime location. Next time I will definitely stay longer! We had a great time shopping and dining in the evenings, the on site Starbucks is a fabulous addition, and the staff was courteous. Also, the beds were great!

There was a lady at the front desk that was very helpful and concerned about how my stay was. She issued me a parking permit. She made sure all my concerns were addressed in a professional and timely manner.

The hotel is starting to look a little run down. I stayed here every month from 2011 to 2014 and see the difference although Starbucks is a great addition. I stayed in a mountain one bedroom suite and was disappointed. It looks bare and the back of the towel rack had paint peeling. It needs a little makeover.

Its about average for the price range. There are some nice rooms and some crummy ones (stayed in both). The location is the draw for me, easy access to and from the highways (to get out of the city), next to the park, not a far walk from the beach and attached to the mall. Good Wifi, good common area amenities, even while the older rooms aren't the nicest, they are clean (in my experience).

Personnel with lots of Aloha!I was greeting at the front desk by very friendly service people! they quickly gave me what was needed to get underway. Helped with amenities and directions to get about the town. They service personnel went the extra mile to keep rooms clean. Pillows in room were too small for our use .It could have been more comfortable. I thought it was unusual and small in size.

Poor quality furnishings in room. Bell desk unfriendly! do their job only.. Union rules!!! cleaning staff not trained in detail. no vacuuming and left used shampoo in shower everyday for 10 days... old and it shows.. great location... vent blows directly on bed

Excellent I'm always treated with respect. Your staff attend to my needs with a awesome hospitality. Signature restaurant is the best my family enjoy the view for the first time and the service. For me I return every chance I get for business and pleasure. Our company will always use your hotel for events that occur. The only issue I had is having breakfast where I had to flag someone down for more coffee. I don't see much Aloha from your waiter/waitress. Being an x-waitress myself you always want to be sure your customer you attend to is satisfied. In this case I did not feel that it's my second time I had this issue. Otherwise all is good.Rae Kama'i

Enjoyed our stay for 3 nights. Clean facilities with the A la Moana shopping center in walking distance.Despite being busy, employees always had time to greet us and answer our questions. Location is perfect to launch off for shopping and appointments.

The Hotel Staff was very helpful and Pleasant. Being next to the park was really nice, as I was able to get in 2 days of exercise in a beautiful location. Having the Ala Moana Mall attached by crosswalk made getting to shopping and dinner very easy. It is easy to get in and out of Waikiki from this location.

The stay was mostly excellent on 5/16/17–5/17/17. The only negative experience was trying to get a receipt emailed to me at around 9PM on the evening after checkout (5/17/17). Had to call back after one rude guy with an attitude refused to help me—saying the front desk did not have email and I needed to call back the next day to talk to a different department. I called back 20 minutes later and Joe at front desk got me my receipt, saying they had a print center that could scan and email the receipt to me. So, one front desk guy almost spoiled my impression of the hotel.

The cleanliness of the room was below average. I was definitely disappointed in that. I've stayed at this hotel before & though their communication isn't great (I asked front desk about a crib for my child, they told me the crib was already in the room, get to my room no crib I called again then they said they'd get one to me asap. Took over an hour to get the crib to my room) anyways this time my room was dirty, crumbs on the ground, bathroom floor had hair from someone else and there were several cockroaches. One even crawled up onto the bed next to my arm while I was laying down.

Our stay was great! There was one day that we got back to our room around 1 or 2 pm and it still wasn't cleaned. Wish they could have cleaned it earlier. And your kamaaina rates are a bit high. Overall, great location and great hotel!

This hotel has a three day cancellation policy, and requires all payment upfront. Not a good place for a business trip. Other than that, the hotel itself is great. If not for their policies, I would definitely recommend this hotel.

We stay at the hotel when we have appointments early the following day or on consecutive days just to avoid the hassle of rush hour. The hotel is decent but not fancy. My wife complained of a bathroom odor, and the sinks and tubs drained slowly. Wifi speed was good. The partial ocean views may be visible only from the lanai.

We always stay at the Ala Moana Hotel whenever we visit Oahu. The hotel is very clean, staff are friendly and helpful and it is located within walking distance to Ala Moana shopping center. Within the shopping center food court you can order a variety of food and eat there or take back to the room which are equipped with a microwave & refrigerator so your meal can be eaten at a later time. The hotel is also located within walking distance of Ala Moana beach and Magic Island park.

Overall very good. Beds were comfortable but the pillows were lumpy and not comfortable. Convenient location as we were there for Moanalua Kaiser for medical procedure. Good location for restaurants and shopping.

I have stayed at Ala Moana Hotel for quite a few years while my daughter was attending University of Hawaii at Manoa . It is a wonderful hotel , centrally located , very clean , excellent customer service , & a great value .

I was disappointed when I purchase a ocean view. I got a partial view room also the ice mean on floor 23 did not work very well I had to go to another floor to use one that worked better. The front desk need more agents to work the check in line. Checking in at 2p was a huge line.

I last stayed at Ala Moana Hotel when it was a Radisson hotel and loved it so I had no qualms about booking a room at the Ala Moana even though it's now a Mantra hotel. I paid for an ocean view room in the Waikiki Tower and was surprised at the lack of amenities: no bathrobe; no room service; it looked like a basic room. The shower smelled of mildew (no ventilation fan) and I had to keep the door closed because of the smell and my asthma. The toilet paper holder placement was very uncomfortable. The shower soap wrap was so difficult to open that even my teeth couldn't tear it open. The ottoman for the "desk" was so low I had to put two pillows on it and place my laptop in the drawer to type fairly comfortably. The sconces were crooked and when I tried to straighten them one of them flipped over and looked like it wanted to fall off the wall. The pillows were in sad shape: small, old, and only two to a bed. (Other hotels have bigger, better, and more pillows.) The bed was so uncomfortable--I could feel the springs in it. The safe showed a "battery low" message so I had to hang a PRIVACY tag on my door to keep people out of the room and keep my things safe while I was at the shopping center. I'm not sure I'll stay at the Ala Moana again. If I do I certainly won't spend the money for an ocean view room: It wasn't worth the price.

Ala Moana Hotel is beautiful as always, great location. Near Ala Moana Shopping Center, Beach, Bars etc. Nephew performs a lot at Hawaiian Brian's so it's perfect mini vaca for my husband and myself. We always have a group of friends who also stay there as well. Being near Ala Moana Shopping Center is always very convenient too........................ Shopping and Eateries.

Very nice on the outside and such a great location.. but for its reputation.. price and location... very disappointed on the cleanliness.. see pictures of dirty restroom. Unmaintained.. i even stayed at the Waikiki Tower! Which is supposed to be better... super disappointed! Amenities too were so basic... i had to call for toothbrush! Only thing that makes up for it.. is of course location. Theres bridge connection to Ala Moana Center and a Starbucks at the lobby.

I annually do the Honolulu Triathlon and the Ala Moana Hotel is the place the stay. The hotel is right next to Magic Island and Ala Moana beach park where the race occurs. It is a 10 minute walk to the starting line. The hotel is conveniently located next to the Ala Moana Shopping Center. You can shop till you drop and find wonderful places to eat. From simple plate lunches to fine dining. The entire hospitality staff- Valet, Bell hops, Check-in (Justin) recognize me from my past stays and took care of me. We are one big family. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. I had a wonderful sleep prior to my race.

Being right next to the Ala Moana Center Mall was very convenient. The concierge was very helpful.My only comment: my door card only worked once; we had been using my husband's card but still had to make at least 3 tries. I did not complain because my husband's card somehow worked.

Great place to stay if shopping is on your mind. Valet personnel is awesome! Just be prepared to check-out before 11:00 a.m. it's their new policy, no longer noon. I liked that the hotel has a safer way to walk over to the shopping mall.

Kamaaina Rate is not available online reservation with Mantra. Call the hotel direct. Also make sure to follow up on beddings if you have four occupants, we reserved 2double beds for 4adults but our second bed was not made and waited a full hour for the beddings (this was at midnight after a graduation celebration).

Perfect location, clean and comfortable accommodations. Nice view, close to Ala Moana Shopping Center, Ala Wai Boat Harbor and the Ala Moana Beach Park, which is ideal for swimming with young children and relaxing. Rooms had basic amenities, and the nice hot shower are always a welcome.

This hotel is conveniently located for both business travelers as well as tourists. Apparently, ownership of the hotel recently changed hands. I checked out at noon and was told the checkout time was changed to 11:00 am even though the guest manual in the room still states noon. The room is also in need of some renovations.
