The shower in my room had a leaking pipe which caused water to leak from the ceiling (!) directly above my shower whenever I used the shower. Also any noise in the hallway is clearly heard in the room. I was also surprised that the air conditioner automatically turned on several times during the night even though I turned off the air conditioner which resulted in several cold nights in Hawaii!

Close to the mall and Walmart. Good Location and only 20 minutes away from the airport. Glad that there is a Starbucks in the hotel.Room was clean and the cleaners were courteous. Will sure go back if we travel to Honolulu again!

Too many inconvinience considering the high standard that I was expecting to Ala Moana hotel..shower knob broken, ice box making intermitently buzzing sound throughout the night, shower drainage is not good..

Please read the proceeding comments that I have already left. It fully explains about my feeling. The two gentlemen when I checked in were very aggressive and lack good customer service. the women were amazing. and the elevators were annoying

Liked the view, location, & staff. Was disappointed that there was no restaurant open for lunch except for Dim Sum. We were looking for a nice restaurant in the hotel where we could get a salad, or sandwich. We ended up ordering a pizza that was delivered. We had to meet the delivery person in the lobby, they were not able to get up to our room.

As you can imagine good stays and not so goods stays are balanced. Sometime, like when you changed the system in early April this year our staff had to suffer. One gay had to change the room by check in and check out three time in one week, I never experienced something like that before. This year I arrived in February, left at the end of March for Tokyo meetings and was back on the 3rd of April experiencing the new system. Three Kume Sekkei staff member are at the moment in the hotel, I'm back in September and October.

Stay elsewhere!Most rooms are VERY small, not cute like other boutique hotels, just small! I booked a city-mountain view room, and ended up with a fantastic view of the parking/office building just 40 - 50 feet away. The new ottomans that are the desk chairs just are not conducive to business travel.I received a run around when I asked about a room change, so I turned my three night stay into a one night stay and went to a national brand hotel nearby with a bigger room, better rate, and much better view.

The stay was satisfactory until I saw a rat in the corridor. Now I am wondering if things are clean here. The room cleaning seems fine and the convenience to the Ala Moana Center is unbeatable. I come to Honolulu and stay here often mainly due to the location and convenience and kind of old fashioned feeling about the hotel, and no daily resort fee.

Rooms in the Kona tower are smaller that what the picture shows...it also have beds that states queen side but I feel if could be considered as a full size bed....just because me and my wife shoukders touch one another while laying side by side on our backs...

Great place to stay away from home. We really enjoy our stay, it is a very good experience. Very close to everything most specially to the mall. Next time I will visit Honolulu I surely will come and stay at your beautiful place. Before I forget, even the cleaners or room attendant are very gracious and caring. I can tell that they really love what they are doing, and they do the best the can what they love.Thank you.

Price was reasonable especially for the location. Bathroom is a bit tight with the door right up on you. Also there was a used Kleenex on the counter and I did see a couple of small roaches in the bathroom as well.

Great location-especially for shopping,connected to Ala Moana shopping center. Out of the hustle & bustle of Waikiki. Newly remodeled rooms. Many different restaurants to choose from in Ala Moana shopping center.

We had such a great stay here. Central to so many things. Staff was awesome. Right next to the mall. Close to Waikiki. Little convenience store located on lobby floor plus a Starbucks. Rooms had coffee makers and blow dryers. Saved us money and time.

Average hotel stay which fit my needs. Best thing about it is location, connected to Ala Moana Shopping Center and walking distance to other local establishments I frequent outside of Waikiki. Also walking distance to Ala Moana Beach Park across the street.

Ask questions before checking in to make sure you have at least blankets and pillows for everyone. Make sure they stock up the coffee!! Don't sleep in or you will miss breakfast buffet which closes way too early!! We had the large suite with beautiful view, cozy and quiet otherwise!

Please upgrade the shower, the pressure was too soft and the handle was broken. Also, please upgrade the pillows, the pillows were too small and not very comfortable. Other than that, I really enjoy staying at the Ala Moana Hotel. It is where we always come with our families!

We have stayed at this hotel almost every time we visited Oahu for over 10 years and we never had any complaints. It's location is conveniently located next to Ala Moana Shopping Center.However, this trip was a little disappointing. We found a live roach on our curtain and a dead roach in the bathroom. The toilet was not cleaned well (debris behind the seat cover) and there was a hair on one of the clean towels. The valet staff were very courtesy.
user_name:
Sheri Lee K F
Kailua-Kona, Hawaii

review_body: Ala Moana is our go to hotel for last minute trips to Oahu. It is a decent clean hotel right next to lots of shopping! Although we come from being spoiled with lodging at the Sheraton Waikiki, Ala Moana does a fine job with the overall upkeep and maintenance of the hotel. Staff is friendly and accommodating.

Workers was so nice and accommodating! Got to checkout a hour later with no charge. Housekeeping staff was fast and nice. Price was reasonable and a bonus was a walking distance to the Alamoana mall. And took a swim in pool with no charge! Thank you all! Will definitely be back soon

We came for a family fundraiser, and were welcomed with Smile's and Hospitality. The staff went out of their way to accommodate any and all Request to our satisfaction. Mahalo again to the people of Ala Moana Hotel Mantra.

As a shopper I couldn't have asked for a better location. Adjacent to shopping mall. Waikiki beach 10 minutes via $2.00 shopping shuttle. Had a fabulous stay post cruises Great hotel, staff and service. Rooms looking a bit tired, esp bathroom. Needs sprucing up.

The check in experience was tedious. Room wasn't ready. I arrived at 7:30 am, finally got into my room at 11:30am, to rush preparing myself for a 12:00pm funeral service. Unnecessary stress!!! Staff was polite, but ineffective.

Comfy beds = great night of sleep! Extra pillow located in the closet if you need it. This is a great value for Kama'aina and a perfect location. Located close to excellent restaurants and the Ala Moana mall.

Excellent! Heide should be complimented and rewarded on her customer service skills! Heide ensured we had an excellent room as well as ensuring the room was ready for us. The housecleaning staff should be congratulated and also rewarded for their excellent service!

Room was great, Kona tower 11th floor, very quiet; excellent location; staff friendly. Had better experience in past with registration staff. Room was supposed to be prepaid, but I had to pay. Next day corporate office had to get reversal on my cc -- they had already prepaid. Still waiting for reversal.

We stayed one night because my husband was getting outpatient surgery the next morning. We live on the big island and I have stayed here several times for business. Rooms are clean and comfortable. This time we were put in a room on the 21st floor with a decent view of the city and a nice lanai. Good value for the money compared to other hotels in the city. Convenient to Ala Moana Center Mall, right next door.

Stayed at the Ala Moana during a recent conference.The good: The hotel is *very* convenient to the Waikiki conference center and the Ala Moana shopping center. The rooms are very clean, quiet, and have comfortable beds and all the necessities. Free wifi in the room, but that may have been included in the conference rate. Closest beach is down the street at Ala Moana park. The staff is friendly, and there is a Starbuck's in the lobby (if you like that).The not-so-good:Waikiki beach is farther away. The area around the hotel is not as nice as the rest of Waikiki, but it seems safe enough. The lobby is spacious and entertaining, but it's a bit dank. Old carpet maybe? The line to check in (Friday afternoon) was very long and moved slowly. The room looking towards the hills (city/hill side), overlooking a construction site. At least having a high floor and the relatively short workday made the noise less apparent.

Our accommodations were the best we have ever experienced in Oahu, and the service was exceptionable. The ocean view upper level room offered a view which is indescribable. The staff is to be commended for making our 64th anniversary celebration so special.

You can change the aesthetics of the hotel, but if the employees keep treating patrons horribly, you can guarantee this turns into raunchy motel soon. The reservations folks didn't give the same information as the front desk staff. And the other staff were just rude. Acting as if this was a luxury destination. Surprise! Far from!

Stayed here for an overnighter while on a business trip from a neighbor island. Great location, next to Ala Moana Shopping Center. After being in a workshop all day I took a presunset walk across the street at Ala Moana Beach park and Magic Island. Had to leave early in the morning, Starbucks in lobby was quick as were the friendly bell staff. For sure I will stay here again, it's been awhile since the last time.

We did a staycation and chose the hotel for it's overall comfort, convenience and value. The rooms are nice & clean although a bit on the smaller side. We slept well and loved that a Starbucks was located in the lobby & the shopping center is right next door! The staff was pleasant & housekeeping did a great job! We'll definitely come back to the Ala Moans Hotel!

Good value. Great staff. Great location. Plenty of choice for restaurants. Highly recommended top floor restaurant with breath taking views as well as excellent food and service. Scallops are superb and good value!

Excellent and friendly services. Consistent with previous stays at this property. I would definitely recommend this property to friends and associates who visit Honolulu. I will also stay here again when future business takes me to Honolulu.

Great hotel, great staff. Very convenient.. very centralized Stayed there for medical reason.. would like to return on better reasons to fully enjoy myself. Only problem leaky toilet and Oder... .. notified agent when checking out

Average due to location. Beds are junk, all spring no cushion. Something you would expect from a low budget motel, not a well known hotel. Same with bedding. House keepers need to pay attention to details. Just got room, no shower soap, coffee next morning only one packet of creamer. On check out day called front desk to ask about checkout, kept cutting me off and could not finish question, they kept saying checkout is at 11. No that wasn't my question. I think the best customer service from there was the Vallet, great people. Definitely didn't get what I paid for.

speed up the check in process. The water with lemon glass container was totally empty and the line was past the main bank of elevators. I was late to my appointment due to the 45 minute wait in line. hope it improves

We have been staying at the Ala Moana Hotel for decades. Every time we stay, we always find all staff members to be helpful. The room is always clean and has great amenities like a fridge, microwave, drip coffee maker with coffee and storage space. The hotel is conveniently located next to the sopping mall and bus system. We never rent a car, just always take the bus. The Royal Garden Chinese Restaurant is excellent. The pupus and drinks at Signatures are also good.

I like the ease of walking distances to the Ala Moana Shopping Center and the Hawaii Convention Center.Most times we would be in the Kona Towers with the Kama'aina rates.Few times we would be upgraded to the Waikiki Towers (better views) which most times are booked.

Bathroom sink was draining very slowly. We asked for maintenance to take a look. When we came back later that day the sink was fixed. Housekeeping also did a great job on the room. The bed and pillows are very uncomfortable.

I stayed here for one week for a meeting at the Hawaii Convention Center. Business trip. Only 5-min walk to the Convention Center so the location is superior for business purpose. Right next to the hotel is the Ala Moana Center, which has both commonly-seen stores and high-end ones. You can walk 2 min to the east end of the shopping center, where Macy's is, right from the 2nd floor of the hotel.The room is clean and standard. Service is professional. The checkin/checkout lines at the front desk can be long (~30 min wait) if you run into large groups. The hotel seems to hold lots of people coming for big events/conferences. One great fact: this is a so-called hospitality hotel and it provides a guest room for existing customers for convenient use of up to 30 min, on a first-come-first-serve basis. They only have one room available for this purpose. On the last day of my stay, I checked out early in the morning and went to beach. I took advantage of this service and went back to the hotel to take shower and get changed for my flight at night.

Excellent service, friendly, super clean, comfortable beds/pillows, starbucks in the lobby area was an excellent plus as well. Being connected to ala moana shopping center made it accessible to shopping. I LOVE MY FREQUENT STAYS HERE. Mahalo Nui Ala Moana Hotel!

Front desk workers are not friendly. When asked to be put by our friends room, they act as if it's such a hassle and blamed the worker before them that they should've done it. They are also very grouchy and said No very cruelt when asked if late check out was available

I have always like the location of the Ala Moana Hotel. It is a clean facility and right next door to the Ala Moana Shopping Center so there's no driving involved in order to get some quick shopping done.

Check in too way too long. 35 to 45 min. Ocean view suite is beautiful. Valet staff was excellent maid service and the cleaning people was great. Over all everything was good just the long wait to get checked in oh I checked in at 5pm not sure if that makes a difference m.. mahalos.

I stay at your hotel 1 to 2 times a year. I love the closeness of the hotel to freeway, UH, doctors and Ala Moana Center. Please keep the kamaaina rates relatively low for the neighbor travelers who use the hotel requently.

Room, facilities, valet personnel, room service personnel great, but check in process was not well received as the check in processing agents seemed very confused which caused us as well as others to wait in line for 45 plus minutes to check in and get room assignments..

This Hotel was so convenient access to mall and the bus stop. the services at the lobby they are so helpful l and friendly. The housekeeper are great and so respectful. and convenient to leave your baggage after check out while our flight is still at night,

Great hotel. I was there for 5 nights and enjoyed my stay. The staff were very nice and gave good directions and recommendations for restaurants and events to take part in. I would definitely stay here again.

Hotel rates and accommodations were nice, was highly dissatisfied with Signature steak service. I wrote a full review on the previous page, I do not understand why your survey is asking me to write a review again.

Nice clean facility with great location near the mall! I enjoyed the fitness gym, pool, and ease of walking to the mall. Also, the front desk personnel were kind/helpful and cleaning employees were disciplined and trustworthy.

There may be a long line at check-in, but trust me its worth it!! The customer service was excellent, rooms were beautiful, clean, and spacious! This hotel is conveniently situated at the most ideal location. Across from the beach, connected to the mall for shopping and dinning, and you are able to see the Fireworks show from your room!! This place is perfect for Kamaaina and visitors!!

excellent customer service, valet parking and location is central and convenient. we had dinner at the Signature Restaurant, and the view was wonderful, as well as the service. We definitely will stay at the Ala Moana Hotel the next time we travel to Oahu.

Jennel at the front desk. Great customer service. She deserves 5 stars. She remained calm and collect and still got everyone a room even though overbooking took place. Front desk held themselves together.

I stood in line to check in for nearly an hour. I estimate that there were only 15 people standing line in front of me. Either the computers were down, or they are too slow, or there were not enough employees checking people in.

hotel is totally dated. My room was dirty. There were crumbs INSIDE my sheets. Super slow service during checking in, as you have to pay for everything upfront. Earlier checkout time than before and had to pay an additional $90 to checkout later. Always stayed here before due to location, but won't ever again. Gross!

We were part of the Lions convention and must say it was a very well organized event. The meetings and lunch provided was great and the rooms were so clean and well maintained. The banquet dinner was over the top with the entertainment and the meal the chef prepared was first class. Thank you Ala Moana Hotel for making my first convention a very memorable one and thanks for your superior service..

Friendly service; registration personnel very polite and easy to deal with. Room service excellent and very timely in having room ready from day to day. Plantation Cafe excellent; food very good, but more importantly, staff there very courteous and willing to accommodate without delay.

Beds are extremely uncomfortable. Wake up with sore neck and back every day. Front desk woman very rude and not helpful. Everyone else - housekeeping, parking, pool, and concierge staff was friendly and helpful.

You will pay a higher rate that visitors. The rooms are unbelievable tiny. After waiting an hour in line to register you will be waited on a rude front desk clerk who does not smile. Auwe!! There are other hotels who would welcome our business and appreciate the locals who support them.

Great hotel close to everything especially being closed to ala moana hotel. I would recommend this hotel to everyone of my family and friends. I come here for all of my trainings on Oahu. Staff are prompt.

I would only stay in this hotel for its great location. But don't expect much aloha spirit with the services. The front desk agents were unfriendly and slow - they made it a point not to have eye contacts with guests waiting in line even when they were not helping any other guests. The standard room (in Kona Tower) is small but adequate. However, all of the room doors slam shut loudly. We were unable to sleep well as guests from other rooms next to us were going in and out all night.

That's right the Ala Moana Hotel is right next door to the Ala Moana Mall...the largest open air shopping center in the world (so they say). So if shopping is your thing get up hit the Starbucks in the lobby walk next door and try to see all of the stores...you can't.We are a short ride from the airport and a short walk to downtown Honolulu...oh yeah with lots more shopping.Reception offers easy check in their lobby has lots of cozy chairs and nooks for reading. You'll find Their new Starbucks with beer wine and more food selections. Their lobby has soft chairs and desk chairs and is full of guests locals and students.The Royal Garden on the second floor with its white table cloths features Asian and native fare.Up to the third floor for the pool and work out area. Relax in their lounge chairs in the sun (careful) and shade.Now head up to the 36th floor for spectacular views of DIAMONDHEAD Honolulu and the blue Pacific. Their Signature Prime Steak & Seafood has a daily happy hour 4:30-6:30 (see review) as well as scenic fine dining entertainment and great service.Their service is good rooms are comfortable with some offering great views from their ocean side balconies. There are several gift shops Starbucks and eateries and their always busy...a good sign. Oh yeah...The Ala Moana Mall if you need sunscreen or a hat (Lids). Happy Shopping,Ricardo y Julia

I love this hotel and try to stay here often (location and friendly helpful staff) BUT my overall rating got hurt this trip because I was disappointed with the cleanliness of my room AND the noise/busy-ness. Cleanliness: It was still much better than a lot of Honolulu hotels I've stayed at, but the housekeeper failed on some small details in my room. The common areas were immaculate though. Noise: There were several youth groups staying and it got loud every so often late at night to wake me, but not long or frequent enough to call security. This is a favorite hotel for neighbor islanders, frequent travelers, parties and conventions, so I knew what to expect, but the hotel felt too busy (although surprisingly didn't feel crowded) for this particular trip.

I am kamaaina and have always loved your hotel particularly for its priceless location, but the check-in process (an hour-long wait!) this time was a deal-breaker. I will not be back unless I read in the reviews that this problem has been fixed. If you are using a new system that takes longer, triple or quadruple the reception desk staffing until you can get check-in to 10 minutes or less. Otherwise, why even bother?

Ala Moana is always top notch. I have stayed there three times and am always very happy with the experience. I is adjacent ot the Ala Moana Center for shopping. There is a Walmart nearby. Try Don Quixote supermarket for a taste of Asia without leaving Waikiki. Facility is well-maintained and always clean. Despite the noise of Waikiki the rooms are quiet and you can always get a good night sleep. Self parking or valet parking available. I will be back again next year.

It was beautiful, in the center of all places we needed to be at, and next to Ala Moana Shopping Center. The service was great. There's more than enough elevators that you're not waiting in a long line to get on one.

Clean, friendly and they have Starbucks and Rumours! Not to mention the shopping mall within walking distance. Their rooms are always tidy and the staff are very welcoming! We love Ala Moana Hotel and the year round Kama'Aina specials

Hotel located very well regarding convention center and shopping mall. Apart from that not very charming environment. Waikiki and beach within footwalk.Room and Service reasonable. However long queue during checkin.Need to wait some moment for the elevator during busy times.Plus: had a microwave oven in the room.Size of room sufficient but not spatious.

Overall a great stay with 2 small children. Great location. Had a very slow drain in our tub but other than that, we enjoyed our stay. Would recommend hotel if you don't want to stay in the middle of busy Waikiki.

Kamaaina choice... It is with happiest of memories, I choose this hotel, I use to stay here so frequently, front desk would remember my name. Many years later I remember why I love it here. Location​, location, location!!! I also brought friends and family who have not been here, with happy thoughts to return. thank you again! For making my choice to come back to my favorite place to stay

Enjoy the convenience of the location, everyone was very peasant, the room was clean. Had a little difficulty with the AC but got use to it. Would certainly stay there again. I would like to have some notices of room rates and know when the rooms are cheapest during the year.

Convenient location and a good price - basic amenities beds could be more comfortable but overall not bad - enjoy staying here when we have something in town and it's convenient to stay over and not have the long drive home

Great quality for the entire hotel.hotel front desk, guest rooms, restaurant Sky, lobby, parking all organized and courteous service. lobby good meeting place for guest and business attraction. we would recommend to our friends and family.

The internet was patchy and I couldn't use it continuously for more than 15 minutes. The staff was helpful and friendly. My room was however facing the construction site that was a source of constant noise.

The hotel is convenient to walk to the mall and the Hawaii Convention Center; however, sound insulation is poor. I heard neighbors and running water from inside the hotel loud enough to wake me from a sound sleep.

I always stay at ala moana because of the location, convenience, & great service as well as affordable rates. The only thing I would recommend is upgrading the bathroom amenities. The shampoo/conditioner doesn't work well for women's hair & the soap isn't big enough for two people to take a shower. But all in all, ala moana is always my go to hotel & I will continue staying with you folks in future trips to come.

Our only issue is that we felt we should have been told that construction was going to start in the morning at 7a.Some of the font dest staff had a could care less attitude that was not very aloha. I know was a busy week but at least give the impression you care.

Starbucks in lobby was nice. Rooms a bit small but location is good for shopping and going to the convention center. View is nice on ocean side. I forgot my cell phone charger in the room and called to let housekeeping know but I never got it back and it didn't seem like they cared much about it either.

The place is very beautiful to stay. My room have 2 balcony and sitting arrangements outside to eat or just relax. Room have one bed and tv. One kitchen too. The kitchen have not many utensils, no knife, or not like a vacation home. But there is a freeze, microwave , gas and some plates, bowls, cups and spoon. In emergency anyone can cook or warm up food. The most beautiful thing of the room is the view from your bed . Amazingly sky, city, beach view .. and you cant take off your eyes from it. The hotel is huge, in the 2nd floor there is the connection with shopping mall , biggest open mall where u can just go and chill. Nice place to stay as its in the middle of the city so most of the things are nearby in waking distance. Love everything about it. I stayed in room 3301. So all the details descriptions about the same. One major drawback in the hotel I found the internet, its very slow and keeps disappearing. Otherwise no complaints.

The check in and check out procedure were very quick and courteous. The room was clean. We would very much like to come back to stay again. For this, it would be nice if there is a membership. It has a very good for money.

Very convenient and accessible location to all of downtown and major shopping outlets. Rooms are very clean and updated. Customer service is helpful, friendly and willing to go the extra mile to make your stay enjoyable

The service at the Ala Moana hotel is amazing. The best staff members I have encountered all around at any hotel. I was extremely shocked to see the quality of the room. It is very small. The pullout chair in the room was stained (although we never used it).

My mom and I stayed at the hotel and showered after returning from our event. Shower couldn't turn off and called the desk 2 times. Tried to contact a manager after leaving since we were unable to let the hotel know before we left for our early flight. Still no response back after leaving a message upon returning home.

It's a decent, clean and affordable hotel. Nothing is particularly awesome and/or amazing. Location is generally good, especially as it is close to the mall and Waikiki. Valet service was excellent. Check-In was not very efficient as a very long line. Walls are a bit thin as can hear all the voices in the hallway

This hotel is in a good location if you want to be near Ala Moana shopping center. Rooms are extremely small. More like New York City size rooms. Definitely over priced especially with the cost of parking with not much amenities.

In Hawaii, finding decent lodging at an affordable price can sometimes be challenging. The Ala Moana Hotel, however, does a great job covering both. An enjoyable experience and the online booking process was very user friendly.

From Friday afternoon through Sunday morning the service and professionalism displayed by the entire staff of the Ala Moana Hotel was stellar. The hotel staff provided us with outstanding support throughout our event and took care of us beyond our expectations. We look forward to working with the hotel staff in our future functions and appreciate all of efforts.

Hotel was very nice and clean. Maid service was awesome. Literally walked to Ala Moana Mall which was great. Other food vendors near by and all within walking distance. Starbucks is located on ground floor as well as taxi cabs were waiting in lobby ready to take you to your destination.

A short walk to shopping, restaurants, beach and park.Good service at front desk, pleasant, friendly staff.Room - standard but comfortable, clean and with adequate supplies.used valet parking which was very convenient.

Rooms are nice with microwave, refrigerator, and wifi included in the price. Construction noise outside the mountain view rooms was somewhat annoying early in the morning. Hotel is connected to Ala Moana Center, a great mall. Walking distance to Magic Park and convention center. Shuttle necessary to get to Waikiki, but shuttle is convenient and cheap. If you are arriving at a busy time - 3 to 6 pm - be prepared to wait 1/2 hour or more to check in.
user_name:
Ruth G
Baltimore, Maryland, United States

review_body: Air conditioner worked extremely poorly, even after service by tech. No shampoo in shower. Twice we had key failure and had to go to front desk for new keys during our 3 day stay. Horrible sewer smell in elevator vestibule on our floor. Room coffee poor.

Rooms clean, convenient front desk staff is friendly. Housekeeping friendly and accommodating.Price a little high compared to other hotels that have the same quality. The convenience is what raises the price. I hope this new owners will show appreciation for return customers, The front desk recognizes the return customers.

If don't want to deal with busyness of Waikiki this is the place to stay. Reasonable, room clean, microwave,refridgerator in room. Adequate towels provided. Best to stay in Waikiki tower on upper floor to get away from traffic sounds

The staff were friendly and helpful. The room was very noisy, conversations from adjacent rooms and the hallway could be heard very late into the night. The bathroom had hair in the shower and on the floor upon arrival. Beds not very comfortable.

We booked a room with a partial icean view (Kona tower) 2 months in advance and asked a top floor in Comments when booking.We got a room on the 8th floor with a parking view, with no balcony. The room description was not really clear on the website, we expected to have a balcony. We also expected a bigger room and better view for the money we paid.

Overall great experience.. looking at the lobby you would think the rooms are more classy, but not bad for the price in Hawaii. Close to several attractions, valet parking or self parking available if needed. Walk way from hotel to the mall. All sorts of transportation available if you need to be picked up from the hotel.

The Room was overpriced for the mediocre service provided. When you have guest you cater to their needs; that wasn't handled properly. The room and view was ok. It served its purpose, but did not fit four people in the room.

The hotel is clean the rooms are ok.It is close to the convention center.Thr rooms in the Waikiki tower facing the pool are preferable especially at high floors.Staff is very friendly and helpful.The proximity of the ala moana shopping mall is good if you have not much time for shopping.

I travel alot, inter-island and mainland travel. Ala Moana is the only hotel that I've been to recently that actually has a 4-cup REAL coffee maker in the room, along with a larger-than-usual refridgerator. Also a microwave! All very important for me in my travels and sets them apart from the "average" hotel. Mahalo!

This hotel is situated in a perfect location with easy access to the best shopping and best food available that being at the Ala Moana Shopping Center, the largest open-air shopping center in the world.

Just a bit more vamping of the rooms and hallways outside the lifts perhaps....The coffee machine didn't work and there was only one choice of coffee, would have loved some decaf at night.There was building at a property outside our window so very noisy in the morning.Can't be helped I guess by you guys so I wore ear plugs to block the noise.Overall a fun experience and the staff were very friendly.Great gym...although we didn't use it as we walked our legs off most days.Fabulous free wi-fi!! Thank you for that.

Welcoming staff from Thomas the door man, valet, housekeeping - all great! Location perfect, outside of Waikiki & connected to Ala Moana Center. Visit family & friends 4 times a year, always staying at the Ala Moana.
user_name:
Ann R
Rio de Janeiro, RJ

review_body: We've stayed in several resorts in Oahu. This is a great place for short or long-term stay. The amenities are wonderful. The location is fabulous- walking distance to Waikiki and Kaka'aku.and not to mention the Ala Moana mall being right next door. We will certainly stay here again.

Excellent place to stay without going into the heart of Waikiki. The food and service at all of the hotel restaurants was at it's best. Front desk and housekeeping personnel were attentive and helpful in every way.

Lost your Aloha spirit. No complimentary parking, breakfast or water for locals, Room quality adequate. should provide blankets and better pillows. Faucet fell off when turning the handle. Conference food was excellent and service was great.

I have been staying at the Ala Moana hotel for 2 decades. Yes I have also stayed at several high end hotels on Waikiki as well over the years. My wife recently joined me on a business trip to Honolulu and we decided to go down to Waikiki for early dinner. Well it's changed down there and the both of us could not wait to be back at our much quieter hotel and slow pace to relax. Bottom line Ala Moana is clean, good location, relaxing and the staff are very nice. If you want a hotel that isn't vacation central and a good place to hub out of on your vacation, stay here aloha

We were there for 3 nights, the room was nice however the tub did not drain properly so we notified the front desk and were told they only rent the rooms (no maintenance). They said they do not own the rooms. The are owned by individuals, who are responsible for everything regarding the room. We were given a 1-800 number to call-only there during normal working hours. The did fix it the next day. If you need anything for the room it cost extra (soap, another towel, toilet paper anything it's extra). They only clean it after you check out, not while your staying there. The front desk people were very rude when you request for any help. The breakfast buffet was the best thing a this Hotel. The service was also very good.

We returning home to visit ohana (family and loved ones), we usually stay at the Ala Moana Hotel. It is conveniently located, has excellent ocean or mountain views, and ALL staff is friendly, attentive, helpful - overall wonderful. Rooms are comfortable, clean (of course), and quiet (surprising!). Oh, I forgot to mention, it is also affordable.

We are kama'aina and our visit this time was a mixed bag. The staff was friendly and courteous, especially the valets and bellman. We had to store our luggage and they were prompt with loading and getting our car.Check-in was a NIGHTMARE. The front desk was completely understaffed at peak check-in time as well as several hours later. It took us over an hour to get checked-in, and the line was longer than when we started when we walked away. We had to be at my daughter's performance and didn't even get a chance to shower before having to leave for the concert because check-in took so long. There was a medical convention going on that weekend so the hotel was busy. This is completely understandable; but what is unforgivable is that Ala Moana was not prepared to handle the load. I was turned off enough to consider heading to the Prince instead. I'm not sure if this is due to the new management or not, since the last time I visited, the hotel was still Outrigger. Please fix this. As a hotel, you know when you are going to be busy just by looking at your reservations. Be prepared.BTW, I only stayed one night and paid $250 which I consider too high for kama'aina. We visit frequently from a neighbor island and Ala Moana is usually where we stay without question. Next time we may shop around.

This hotel is not bad for the price as it is a little cheaper than a lot of the bigger chains. It is also located next to a HUUUUGE mall with great restaurants and tons of shops. That is its best feature. The hotel seems a little dated but the rooms and service are fine. It is close enough to the beach that you can walk there in less than 10 minutes. It is off the beaten path compared to the bigger ones and if not near the Ala Moana Mall, would be a dud.

My wife, her sister and I visit Honolulu twice a year to visit family and eat crab. Ala Moana Hotel has the best price for room quality and is usually our hotel of choice. Pagoda is an alternative, but it's always disappointing; not worth the few dollars saved. We've been staying at Ala Moana Hotel since the early 1980s.

The hotel location was by far the best. Quality of the services and room space was beyond pleased. It was a very memorable time we had! The club rumors down stairs was such a plus to avoid drinking and driving. The hotel store was very reasonable on prices and some items was also cheaper than expected.

Bad service's reason is New computer system problem which Front said.I think you need retraining your stuff.The customer need at least normal service even you have new computer.First time I can not get Receipt which reason is New computer can issue early checkout...

Service was good, the style of The hotel is pretty out of date and furniture in our rooms were a bit dinged up other that it was still nice place. Kinda pricey. I felt that I paid more for the location than the room.

The check out on Sunday was very good, but the checking in on Friday afternoon was not appreciated,although the line kept moving, I wish I knew ahead of time to come earlier since our flight came inway before check in time.

The only challenge I had was the key cards did not work. Having to re-key my card 3 times for a one nite stay was inconvenient. I know not to keep the cards by other credit cards, cell phones, magnets etc.

This was a nice hotel, but the check in service needs more improvement. Maybe you should also consider bus shuttle to the mall, because it's too far from hotel. I did like the privacy of the room, and the bed and bathroom were nice. Also liked that you offered a microwave.

Inform your visitors of the noise from construction. This business trip was very hard being we hardly slept because of the noise from the all night construction going on at the Ala Moana center.I informed the front desk 3 times but they didn't have a clue about the noise.

Hotel is conveniently located next to the Ala Moana mall. Hotel is more business than fun, but the service is good and the place doesn't feel overly touristy. Also I'm walking distance from park and beach.

As a Hawaii Island resident I routinely visit Honolulu several times a year. I choose to stay at the Ala Moana Hotel because of its location, Kamaaina rates, friendliness of the staff and cleanliness of the rooms. I have stayed at other hotels in the area but my first choice is always the Ala Moana Hotel.

The hotel is located next to a mall and so shopping was likely :). It is located not far from the interstate and so it was easy to travel to my meeting. The staff was pleasant and housekeeping did a wonderful job.

Very nice hotel. Nice ocean view rooms ending in 08 and 07. Secure elevator, nice staff, good cafe attached for breakfast with an extensive buffet. Starbucks in the lobby, steak place on the roof. Check in can be a long line. Plenty of taxis in the queue.

This is a great location for business/shopping/sightseeing/visiting relatives in Honolulu for us neighbor island folks. Waikiki is too intimidating to drive through and expensive for leisure activities. The Ala Moana is close to downtown, great restaurants of all kinds and even Waikiki if that is where you want to go.

I could get on the bus to Kailua #57 or 57A near the hotel.As there is Ala Moana bus stop, I could go everywhere! I could buy water and beer at the hotel store.I could go Kaka'aco and Ward area by walking.

Service, late to a family birthday party gathering. Inconvenience.....The Aloha Spirit had disappeared with "Mantra". Need to improve their leadership, attitude issues and willingness to help. Being their customer for the past 25 years, convenient location.

Long check in lines - waiting over an hour to check in! I've never experienced this in all of the years that I've stayed at this hotel. I understand that the hotel is under new management, however, there needs to be a solution to this aggravating problem.

Overall good hotel. But the new system really messed up the late check out I had on all the rooms I booked (3 suites) This caused a security guard and the manager to go to 2 of the 3 rooms and give them half an hour to pack and checkout but already had late check out. Only to go to reception and they tell me 'oops! we found your transaction' So embarrassing That was the only thing but overall good hotel, clean and convenient

We stayed here to prep for proms back to back. I love the location and convenience of being right next to the mall. It would be nice if there was earlier check in avail without penalty to pay another day. And check out at early afternoon like 1p so stays are almost 24hrs.

I stayed for 2 nights and enjoyed the stay thanks to the hotel's proximity to world's largest open-air mall and the excellent Ala Moana Beach park. Even though there are countless restaurants near by, we opted to have Dim Sum lunch in their Chinese restaurant and dinner in their steakhouse. I am glad that we did. Great food, nice ambience, excellent service. While I can't say that the front desk clerks or the valet were rude, they were just "all-business," unlike the housekeeping staff who always greeted us with a cheerful "Aloha!" Our room was comfortable and clean and the AC was quiet, and efficient. Our balcony with its partial ocean view provided a nice place to chill out. Great location and value.

I love the location of the hotel. Room definitely needs better cleaning and preventive maintenance. Upon arrival found sticky object in front of the refrigerator, hairs on the bathroom floors and shower curtain dirty. Bathroom had a musty smell. Bed linens stained.

Enjoy booking rooms at the Ala Moana. We purchased the 1 bedroom junior suite. Located on the 25th or 26th floor if I recall. Phone in room didn't have a housekeeping button instead it was for the bell boy. So called front desk and they got housekeeping to do the bedding for the pull out sofa.

Spent 3 nights and 4 days here during Easter Weekend. It was perfect for my family, as we were constantly on the go. It is the perfect business hotel. The room was just right, nothing fancy. The staff were helpful and kind. The pool is average, but the location is perfect. Husband could stay in the room while the daughter and I went shopping.

This hotel has a great location, comfortable rooms, Starbucks in the lobby, ABC store with a great selection of food, drinks, sundries and gifts and some good restaurant/bar options. A short walk away is the Ala Moana mall with great shopping and dining. The convention center is also very close. The front desk experience is very poor-you may or may not even get a "welcome to Hawaii", let alone a smile. If you aren't put off by the complete lack of customer service there, the rest of your stay should be great.

We've stayed at the Ala Moana on 3 different occasions, it is a very convenient location with access to Ala Moana shopping mall.It is not a glitzy hotel , but still a very decent, confortable and clean hotel , and there's Ala Moana beach park across the road if you feel like bathing in the warm pacific water.Had a rental car which is a must to be able to visit the island at one's own pace and stoping when one feels like it.

So hard to find CARING workers!!!!! Front desk personnel was without feeling!! I've been a firefighter for 31 years and I constantly remind "my" crew that safety and patient care should be high on our list as well as courteous , respectful, caring and integrity also when treating folks that we respond to...some of the front desk personnel might be in need of more training...after 40 years of going to AlaMoana hotel it might be time to make a change? And that's for my family and friends too...so sorry but just being honest!!

Fairly Average, staff was very friendly...but I had to hobble inside to find a cart for our stuff (I say hobble because I was in a medical boot) before anyone acknowledged we needed help, we had almost completely unpacked our vehicle before I went looking for a cart.....so 3-5 mins had passed and again I had to go looking for a cart for my husband and I.

Your hotel served all my needs. Across the street from the beautiful Ala Moana Park; adjacent to the Ala Moana Shopping Center and great restaurants; located near the "Bus" transfer center. Within walking distance (30 minutes) of Waikiki beach if you are inclined to walk. No need to rent a car. The City Bus took me all around the island.

Check in during the peak period should be avoided unless you are ok with waiting for more than 20-minutes. Rooms are on the smaller side, however are in very good condition. Adequate parking no longer seems to be an issue.

Do not enjoy the crowds at Waikiki beach or the resorts. This location and property is calm and has a multitude of options for shopping, beach activity, food, etc, and more affordable than Waikiki. You don't need a car either.

This place is a hidden gem. We will make more stays to keep our night outings a safe one. The staff was friendly and house keeping took care of request fast. The pool area was nice and the convenient access to the mall was awesome

The check-in went very smoothly and the room was very clean and neat. It was a very comfortable stay and would highly consider using this hotel again. Next stay we will try more of the restaurants on the property.

Self-parking was a bit difficult to access, i.e., tight entry/exit and hard to reach keycard machines, haphazard parking aisles, narrow stair to lobby, small elevator. TV should be included in the room fee.

We had an event fundraiser at Rumors. The location was perfect for everyone. Your staff was very friendly. Rooms were very clean and comfortable. I would highly recommend my friends and family to stay here away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki.

People are very friendly. Easy to get to, location is walking distance to many different places to eat. I ate at the Chinese Resturant for the first time on the third floor. I upgraded one step and ended up with a much better view where I could even see the ocean. There was a porch with a table and 2 chairs on the 16th floor.

I believe those room facing the noisy construction site should of been way discounted. I wound not mind staying in that room but the price should reflect the environment, Also, heads up I had family members staying in your private owned rooms. The cleaniness was very very poor the service very very very poor..These rooms still carry the Ala Moana by Mantra name just saying.....

I always enjoy staying at the Ala Moana. Because I was there for outpatient surgery, it's at a convenient location between Surgicare and Queen's Hospital doctor offices. And, of course, havingthe shopping mall right there within walking distance makes it even more appealing!

Maybe you should have your front desk and bell men review your treatment of there guest with a little bit more of ALOHA. Our room was not done when we reached it, but your cleaning women was very apologetic and let us in and finisher, we didn't mind because she was a nice person.

I have been staying here for a long time now. I always have such nice time staying here. The staff are very helpful and informative on places I want to check out. Its very close to the beach albeit not waikiki, but waikiki is just a couple of miles walk away so not so bad. The second floor is connected to the mall and has great shopping and eating places. The area itself is in the center of many great places to see and get food from and shop so that is top notch for me. There's a starbucks right in the lobby and so its convenient to get coffee or do a little meeting over coffee. The rooms are always neat and has everything you need. Microwave and fridge. There are balconies in the room that has awesome view of the city skyline or the ocean. Lovely and authentic hawaiian stay.

went for a convention located at the hawaii convention center so alamoana hotel is the closet hotel to it.After many years of attending this convention and thus staying at your hotel i was pleasantly surprised to see water stations for refreshments out in the lobby. It may seem like a small gesture from the hotel but it meant a lot to me as well of my other convention attendees so thank you for that. I can't wait to see more changes when i come for next years convention!

Very pleased with quality of room and great service. Rooms are always is great condition upon arrival. Cannot review housekeeping service because we opted to forgot to remove the privacy notice on door.

As always a great location, clean and friendly. Starbucks a nice addition. Miss the occasional upgrades and frequent user benefits under the new ownership. Perhaps those will return as new owners get settled in. Parking and car rental always a bit expensive so put Uber to work this time.
user_name:
Frank G
Kailua Kona, United States

review_body: Please fix the room and elevator access keys. They are extremely difficult to use and I find myself often standing outside my door or inside an elevator for way longer then anyone should to get the card to be recognized by the room or elevator reader system.

Beds weren't as comfortable, lighting was hard to figure out. But overall the staff was helpful and informative and the room was cozy. I would stay here again for either business or pleasure aka conventions.

I love staying here I have stayed here on numerous occasions it's This is my favorite place to stay. I recommend this hotel to all my family and friends. I have stayed here for work as well. I love the convenience of Ala Moana shopping center!

The agent that checked me in was not friendly at all. I enjoy staying at the Ala Moana Hotel and this is the first time I experienced this. Most times the agents are extremely friendly! The hotel and the rooms are very nice and the bed was very comfortable!

We have been staying at this hotel every year for 5+ years sometimes twice a year. This year check in was especially slow which was understanding because of the new system but one hour in line is a very long wait. We checked in later this time around 6pm on 4/7/17 but man that was long. We got put in a nice room but the view was horrible. It would be nice if you could put returning customers in rooms with a nicer view instead of a view of kona tower.

I attended a convention with a friend and we had to share a bed since we were not allowed to reserve a room based on number of beds. We asked for 2 beds but the staff said sorry but many people were in the same shoes.

Everything was fine. Hotel workers were ALL extremely helpful and professional. We had the Kona Tower area, been there before and would go again. Floor was missing the ice machines so I had to go to another area to get ice. Used the washing machine facility. Excellent condition. Will return on Mar 2018.

I personally liked where the hotel was in relation to the beach and park. I was able to obtain some spectacular photos of the sunset and waves. It was perfectly located and had great access to the Mall which was great for two teenagers with me.

Great hotel for business trip. It is about a 10 minute ride to Waikiki Beach and less than a $10 ride via Uber. Great location next to Ala Moana Shopping Plaza which has tons of stores and great places to eat. There is a Starbucks inside the lobby is very convenient.

Would recommend for those who love shopping. Convenient location for food and other necessities. Parking garage is a little tight but we never had problems finding anew open slot. Publice transportation is nearby so you may consider not renting a car.

The apartment was filthy. The owner was uncontactable after our stay so we have been unable to confront him directly. Apparently sets up a "one-off" email address. Booked through Airbnb and now unable to revise review - which we held back on to give the owner a chance to respond or put things right. If you don't mind hairs in the bed and a dirty toilet then you wil be fine. Don't mind old and shabby but it really must be clean. DO NOT STAY HERE UNLESS YOU ARE DESPERATE.

The beds were amazing to sleep on. I wish my bed was as comfortable as tge hotel's. Also I really like that green comforter. I wish I knew where I could get a set of my own. If the hotel started selling their bed sets- I would definitly buy it.

Very pleasant staff, clean rooms, small garage though. Hard to sleep well with Ice machine right across hall. I would recommend to friends & family though. Nice to have restaurants in hotel, central to Waikiki.

Our recent stay at the Ala Moana Hotel was just as satisfying as our last!The staff at the Ala Moana from check in to check out were friendly and courteous making our stay most enjoyable! They are truly committed to customer satisfaction! We will be returning next year!

It's always a pleasure staying at the Ala Moana Hotel. Rates are reasonable, check in is quick and easy, hotel staff very friendly, great location...can't complain too much. Because it was Kawaii Kon weekend, the check in line was horrendously long standing in line over an hour. This happens every year. There should be more staff on hand to check in your customers as quickly as possible. Also there were a number of checked in customers returning to the counter due to their key card not working. Unfortunately, we ended up being one of them as well. BUT, aside from that, the stay at Ala Moana is always a good one.

The price, location and rooms were all fantastic. The staff definitely had the ALOHA spirit. The gift shop was great. Things were reasonably priced. The spam musubi really hit the spot when I wanted a light snack. I've stayed at dozens of hotels over the years and this is my favorite.

Everything went good. It was just that my room got mixed up. Front desk did not let me know if I will be having the two beds or not as I requested it when reserving a room online. Had it fixed when making a phone call to the front desk manager and set me up with the room that I needed. Then everything was awesome after that.

The Wi-Fi not working, and tv would loose picture. Aside from that the stay was enjoyable due to the main facts that I was able to check in earlier then 3, and that the room service lady was very nice.

There was only one concern. When our original reservation was made the price was quoted at either $149.95 or $159.95. But I was charged $179.95 per day during our stay. No explanation was given as to why the difference. When I informed the clerk, she just shrugged her shoulders and said they were learning a new computer system.

In April 2017 I stayed at the Alo Moana Hotel in Honalulu. The Hotel is centrally located and adjoins the Alo Moana shopping centre, which is several blocks in length and multi storey. The shopping centre adjacent has stores like Macy's, The Apple Store, Bloomingdales, Microsoft, and many other upmarket and regular brand and speciality shops. It is close to the convention centre (1 to 2 minute walk). A red double story shuttle bus can pick you up in front of the shopping centre and take you around to all the popular tourist places for $2 a trip. I'd recommend visiting Pearl Harbour, Diamond Head (volcano) and the Northern side of the island for the surf beaches. The only part of staying at the hotel I disliked was the breakfast bar. It was well priced, but I just didn't like the range of food and the cramped nature of the eatery due to the number of people in the breakfast area.

I always enjoy staying at this hotel. Front desk staff is always friendly and offers great customer service. My only wish is that it was more affordable for local people. Because of the cost, I only stay there once or twice a year.

Great room/ Comfortable bed. Staff was very courteous and knowledgeable. Close location to Ala moana center with easy access to the mall. Love that the have Starbucks in the hotel and that they have an in house massage center.

Disappointed with Rumours. Music during BIG CHILL was not oldies but rather melancholy dance music. Please bring back the free buffet line and charge $5 entry fee for buffet, music, drinks in a comfortable place from 5pm. You have better chance to lure more people, especially the local seniors.

We use this hotel many times. I know it was a busy time because of convention, but front desk was not very friendly this time. Also usually they explain to us why kind of room, but this time I haven't get any information. I didn't know there was a big construction in mountainside, if we know it, we requested ocean side if they have availability, usually they did every time we stay, but this time we feel not very welcomed.Our room smoke detector was beeping, it was very quick housekeeping sent a man to fix, we appreciated.

I'm not sure if they think because I'm local I don't deserve the quality of customer service which is shown to tourist. The same sort of urgency and attention should be given to every guest it should not matter if they are kamaiana or not

I was very happy with this hotel, it is within walkiing distance to the Convenction center also Ala Moana mall , accross from the beach and I was able to see the friday night fireworks from my room, I will be staying at this hotel again.

The location was great . All the employees are all helpful. I ate breakfast at the Plantation Cafe and the food was great. I will be back and love to stay there again. I enjoy my happy hour too at Signature.

We come often to Oahu for Shopping and dining. I feel if you want local business, you shouldn't give them the worst rooms. Tiny , looked at a construction site. No balcony. We get much nicer rooms for a few dollars more on the beach. When we crossed over to the mall, it stunk of sewage

It was an hour long wait to check in because of a local event in which I was told "all 700 rooms are being filled". As lame as it was to stand in line, they were professional and nice, apologizing for the wait.

Overall my stay was pleasant, other than the location of the room (next to elevators). Amenities were great and location is perfect. Room was clean and in good order, housekeeping staff did a wonderful job...This was my 3rd stay at Ala Moana and I will return!

You have a new software for checking in and your workers seemed to be all confused. That was the longest by far that I had to wait while checking in. Unfortunately you could see the frustration in your workers. Perhaps either the system is not that good or enough training was not provided for a smoother transition.

Everyone was pleasant and friendly. I spent very little time at the hotel, but thought having a little store and Starbucks right downstairs was super convenient. Room was nice, clean, and comfortable.

We checked in on 4/1/17 at 1:45 & was told our room wasn't ready but we could precheck in. We went back at 3 and the line was an hour long. They should have checked us in and just told us our room would be ready at 3

The bathroom make lot of noises because water leaking inside the toilet... at business center the computer would not print my boarding passes and I was told by front desk, it third party nothing he can help..

paid for a suite thinking it comes with everything such as kitchen apliances and able to watch movies but it didnt come with none of them as the othere hotels we went to did and paid an actualower rate

Where to start. Called us late at night to let us know there was aproblem and we needed to pay more. Told them no and were told to email them to fix it...told them no. Loud construction noise starting very eearly. Trash collection noise at 4:50 am. Seedy location with strip clubs and escort houses close by. Don't even think of walking in Ala Moana Park and the beach at night. Not coming back!

Excellent location if have event in HCC, 3 mins walking distance. Also connect with Ala Moana shopping center. Always taxi stand by out of the hotel. Business center have printing machine for complimentary usage.

Were told at check in that no guarantees we get what we asked for at booking a month and a half prior. Lobby restroom trash overflowing Hotel in transition and check in chaotic desk people stressed -not the aloha were used to. Bellmen and valet up to par tho.

at the ala moana hotel, everything is great and a super value; live music in the lobby, central to everything in honolulu, shopping, restaurants, business... rooms are clean, fresh sheets daily, and access to convenience store and starbucks downstairs main level... the only thing that could improve, the beds need an update... easy fix.

Besides terrible experiences and wait times at check in and check out, we seem to always be put in your oldest tower. Is this because we make our reservations using your "Kama'aina Rate" option, and that throws us locals into the old tower every time we book, and all the tourists come pouring out of the nicer, newer towers? Sure appears to be the case. If your front desk would have given us some type of discount or coupon special for future use due to the poor service with your "newly installed computer system", that at least would we the kind, courteous, apologetic thing to do, putting the aloha spirit you advertise into action and not just on paper. It will be interesting (and surprising) if my husband decides to book at Ala Moana Hotel again, even though he used to be a fan.

One of my favorite places to stay when visiting Honolulu whether it's for leisure or work.Favorite Perks: Waikiki Beach and Ala Moana Mall are within walking distance, valet is only $5 more, exceptional cleanliness and helpful concierge (shout out to TONY at check in, you went above and beyond to accommodate us), nice breakfast buffet, fridge/mini mart inside the hotel. My wife and I found it very convenient and worth every penny!

You can't go wrong staying at the Ala Moana hotel. It is right next to Ala Moana shopping center with dozens of restaurants and hundreds of shops. The rooms are a little "dated" but clean and well cared for. The staff is excellent. Always willing to help and very attentive. Why not "five stars". The hotel has limited dining options and the parking is $20 (self) and $25 (valet) which is a little pricey. But I would definitely recommend this hotel to "locals" and visitors alike

We booked a King-sized bed room while here on business. They claimed that we booked their cheapest room - which was barely a closet with a twin-sized bed. Not acceptable, and since they claimed to be overbooked, they could not accommodate us. Ended up going somewhere else. Paid more, but were infinitely happier. Beware!

3/26/2017 We stayed at this hotel, in order to avoid the hassle, and bustle, of the "Magic Mile" hotels on Waikiki.  I must first say, this without hesitation, this is the cleanest hotel in Honolulu, Hi!  Every area of this hotel was immaculate! The staff is absolutely amazing as well! From the parking valets, to the various shops, boutiques, well stocked store, to the housekeeping, and environmental staff..just Awesome! Parking is the best value in the area I believe. Valet parking is $25 per night, (excluding gratuity), and $20 a day self-park, with in and out privileges.  There is ample parking, well lighted, with roving Security Officers in the underground parking.  There is an elevator, that takes you to the lobby, and on to your secure elevators, as they require a room key to utilize them. There are security cameras in them, and throughout the building for your safety.  Check-in, and check-out was a breeze! We bought the room in a package with air, so we drew #1240. The room is small, as rooms go, but we don't spend much time in it.  It was immaculate upon entry! Fresh!, Well appointed for the price! Fridge, coffee maker, safe, (pls. Purchase your own coffee in the store), the free coffee was hideous. Bathroom was fresh! , and well supplied with towels, and products.  TV had cable, and great channels, and was 42"! The bed is Queen sized, and very uncomfortable! If you are a larger person, 2 queen beds are a definite must!  There is no balcony, but a railing, that a child can get around! DO NOT RENT THIS ROOM WITH CHILDREN!!! The view was another condo building, and a construction site, but this is what we paid for. The construction was not very noisy, but it's there.. just a head's up! The Steakhouse is Amazing! As is the Royal Garden Restaurant! Many of the locals were dining here! Fair WARNING! about The Plantation Cafe. The food on the buffet was cold, tasteless, old, and a very pour value. I should have known..the place was empty! The staff...Excellent! But you can't eat them..so please don't ruin your day dining here!  There is no room service! Plenty of places to eat nearby! The Ala Moana Mall is connected to the hotel, at the 2nd fl, and a short, walk away, to World Class shopping, fast food, and upscale dining!  The pool area is very nice, with only 2 tables for snacks, and beverages. Overall, the hotel was an Excellent value!  Centrally located, minutes away from everything! Quite, Very clean, safe, and family friendly!  We will stay here, again, and again, but with a better room, and not in the Kona Tower. Mahalo! and Aloha!

This hotel is well postioned between the best mall in Honolulu and the gorgeous and quiet beaches of the Ala Moana beach and state park. Hotel is being converted to condos but rentals are still reasonable. Don't expect the glamour in your room. It's tile floors with holiday Inn type wall unit air and thin sheets and blankets. Bathroom amenities are not so great- bring your own favorite. However, the microwave and minifridge is a nice addition. Starbucks in the lobby and a beautiful view of the island from bar restaurant on the top floor. The pool and exercise room on same floor is also a great highlight of the hotel. There is a lobby pantry with all kinds of food and drinks so you never have to leave hotel if you don't want to. And you might just want to stay and watch the sun go down after check in from your private balcony over the marina or the mountain tops behind the hotel! However, if using your laptop-wifi unsecured and connections are intermittent.

My wife and I and her parents had a great stay at the Ala Moana Hotel, primarily thanks to Justin at the front desk. Our initial mountain view room in the Kona Tower was terrible, we faced a construction site with a large, noisy crane. Justin changed our room to one with partial city and water views. Our parent’s room, initially in the Kona Tower, was upgraded to the Waikiki Tower for access to in-room handicap facilities. Their room was not only larger, it also had incredible views. And, Justin thoughtfully placed us on the same floors in both the Kona and Waikiki Towers so that we could easily walk across the towers without having to deal with elevators! Now that’s what I call attention to detail and customer satisfaction!

We stay here several times per year. We Love it as a centrally located place to stay.- Has Starbucks in the lobby!Staff courteous. Next to Ala Mona shopping center. We walk a lot and enjoy how easy it is to get around. Great happy hour on 36th floor every day at 4:30. Great view, great piano bar.

The rooms are lovely with a great ocean view and balcony. However, as an owner, the Rental Pool Management takes over 50% of the revenue. The personnel in the office are downright uncooperative and nasty to the owners as well as over charging for whatever they can think of. It has priced many owners out of their units and caused foreclosures. It is a great place to stay but a terrible investment!

I stayed in an AirBnb unit so won't write about the room and services related to it since each situation seems to be unique. But here is a tip for future hotel guests:If your room is in the Waikiki tower on the 13th floor or below, use the elevator bank for the Kona side of the hotel instead of the one for the Waikiki side of the hotel. It makes almost no difference in time to walk from one of the elevator banks to the other when you consider how many people there are using the Waikiki elevator bank. I almost always had a whole "Kona" elevator (there are three) to myself but never had a "Waikiki" elevator to myself. You need to insert your room's card key to go up in any elevator, and mine worked 100% of the time in the "Kona" elevators, while I (and others) experienced read errors almost a third of the time in the "Waikiki" elevators. You can still access the second floor bridge to the shopping center from the "Kona" elevators, and if you are carrying groceries back from Don Quijote (a nearby supermarket), the Kona side elevator bank is actually closer to the hotel's side entrance.

We like to walk, so this hotel was good for us. Waikiki Beach was about a 15 min. walk, as was downtown Honolulu. There is a large mall next to the hotel, with lots of restaurants and shops. The hotel was clean and reasonable, the concierge helpful and knowledgeable and desk staff friendly and efficient. There are a few shops in the hotel and a Starbuck's that serves wine in the afternoon. It was a perfect place for us.

I stayed here for 5 days. This very large roomed hotel is older but kept very well. I recommend it. Excellent customer service, good price point & perfect area for walking, eating, etc. I had partial ocean view & very happy with that. Comfortable bed. A must for me. My one negative is there was no 'DO NOT DISTURB SIGN' in my room. Some of us do not wish to have daily maid service & definitely do not wish to be disturbed when I say so. Upon getting to my room, I called for that door sign & was given one promptly. However... I would not even mention this missing option - except upon my allowing maid service, second full day, she removed it from my room! Now that ticked me off. Would I stay again? Yes. Nice people from excellent doormen, bellmen front desk. And I liked the base price & NO added daily resort fee plus free WIFI. WIFI Excellent.

Nice hotel next to the Ala Moana Mall. The hotel also has independently owned condo rooms, which I stayed in. It's a hotel room with a small fridge, microwave & coffee maker. The staff has been wonderful! Great customer service. The hotel is walking distance from Ala Moana Beach Park and 30 minute walk to Waikiki. You can also take the bus anywhere for $2.50. Overall very nice, clean place to stay.

The location is great: close to Ala Moana Park, the Shopping Mall, restaurants, banks etc. We were on the 35 floor with a nice mountain view facing Punchbowl. However there was some machine humming all night. It was disturbing. In the morning there is also construction noise.Also the room leaked.

When you book your hotel weeks in advance and you arrive after a 12 hour flight, you expect when you reach your hotel, you will find a nice clean room, made up and ready to go. That was not my experience at this hotel when I arrived at 9:30 pm in the evening.. When I was handed the keys and got to my room, I found a mess, like the previous guest just walked out of the room. Of course, I went back to the front desk to get a new room, but was told sorry, "It's not our room." What? Not your room? Whose is it? On checking, the clerk told me that my room was owned by Gaia and it was their responsibility to fix. She explained that this was a condo hotel and different rooms were owned by different landlords. She gave me a number where I could contact the Gaia people. The idea of checking into a hotel where the front desk is not responsible for your room was new to me. After some fuss on my part, the lady at the desk, who worked for "Ala Moana by Mantra" agreed to call the Gaia office, to see if I could be given another, perhaps clean, room. It seems that "Ala Moana by Gaia" could neither provide another room or clean the one I was originally assigned. After more than an hour of back and forth, "Ala Moana by Gaia" agreed to pay for one of the rooms owned by "Ala Moana by Mantra" for one night. The following day I would be moved to a room owned by "Ala Moana by Gaia". So eventually a got a bed for the night after considerable aggravation. It is disconcerting not to be able to rely on the front desk when you are staying at a hotel and are instead being serviced by a third party, who is not even in the hotel. In none of the advertising I saw for Ala Moana was this confusing arrangement made clear. My advice to anyone contemplating the use of this hotel to make sure who they are renting from. It seems that "Ala Moana by Mantra" runs the front desk and owns many of the rooms, while "Ala Moana by Gaia" is one of several landlords who own and rent rooms in the building. At no time during my stay was my room made up nor did I receive fresh towels. The coffee maker was broken in the room I was finally assigned, but they did provide a new one, after some delay
user_name:
llflan
New York City, New York

review_body: We needed a hotel for a couple of nights due to tenting/fumigation of our home. They offered us Kama'aina rate plus $20 for a vehicle. I called to make a reservation because I kept getting different websites and prices and didn't know if they were legit. The doormen, concierge, reception desk were all professional and welcomed us. The room was very clean, bedding crisp and fresh, bathroom showed it's age slightly. When we arrived needed another set of towels; called housekeeping; they came right away. We loved being able to walk to Ala Moana Center food court so everyone could have their choice for dinner. We loved the big Starbucks in the lobby so we could enjoy breakfast every morning before going to school/work. Many hotels have a small Starbucks or kiosk and it isn't very inviting. The hotel parking needs a lot of work. The road is uneven and broken up, but serves our purpose. We used the fitness center which was very nice, clean, lots of towels and not crowded. We wanted to use pool, but it closes at sunset. We loved the microwave and mini fridge so we could make popcorn and bring in drinks and fruits for snacks. There is a restaurant that serves a breakfast buffet but it doesn't open until 6:30am which was a little late for us since I needed to be at the office by 7am. All in all, it was a great hotel. We would use again if necessary.

This hotel is attached via skywalk to the parking deck of the Ala Moana Center. It was also walking distance to Walmart. There were several little gift shops in the lobby. Our room was pretty spacious with a view of the mall and buildings. The bathroom was a little older but still served its purpose. As I recall, the tv had English channels as well as Asian channels. I also appreciated the minifridge and microwave in the room. The gym had many machines. I really liked the location in the city, but it is a little farther from Waikiki if you're a tourist.

Clean, well-kept hotel, good size room with all amenities. However, I experienced the longest wait for check-in ever - eventually an additional staff member emerged from the back office to help clear the long line.The in-room wifi is near-useless, barely sufficient for sending and receiving email. I suspect they are so concerned about people using it for Netflix streaming, they have crippled the connection to be barely there at all. For example, I was unable to load one of my Kindle ebooks for the journey back. Hotels need to realise that we are now in the 21st century, and providing decent Internet is as basic as plumbing, electric light and air-conditioning.

We were welcomed warmly into the hotel when we arrived. All the staffs at the reception and the concierge were very helpful. However, as we booked our room from a 3rd-party site, we didn't know it's actually serviced by another company called Airpads. The service from Airpads is horrible. The charge $30 for every time they clean up the room. So to save some money, I only requested to have the towel changed, which is free. However, I ordered the towel at 3pm, they only came at 8pm. And they do not collect back the soiled towels. The guy told us, the hotel will clear after we check out, which is 1 week later. Imagine the smell of the wet, soiled towels in the room for 1 week??? The following day, the toilet bowl in the room was choked, and water were leaking from the toilet bowl. We tried to call the hotel to fix it but again because its own by Airpads, they can't help us. We have tried calling Airpads, but nobody pick up the line!! We didn't dare to use the the toilet at all. No more booking from Airpads! Bad experience.

Be very careful when you book at this hotel. They give a good rate on many websites. After you make the reservation, they remind you that there is a $50 per day resort service fee. Their advertised rates are very dishonest.

Walking distance to ALAMoanaCenter over connecting bridge walk.STAFF were very friendly.Rooms are a little small,but has all amenities you will need.Our balcony was a nice touch.Tv has has most of local and cable chañnels.Housekeeping always had our room cleaned when we returned every afternoon.Prices during holiday season was a little high,so book early.

Although the host hotel for the recent conference I attended was The Prince Hotel, I opted to stay across the street at the Ala Moana hotel because I've always liked my stays there. I didn't want to drive and pay a convention center parking fee and didn't want to walk a further distance by staying at The Prince. There's no daily resort fee nor wifi fee. I stayed in the cheaper Kona Tower and loved my stay. There's a refrigerator and microwave oven. Housekeeping cleaned my room early and I could come back to a ready made room by 1:30pm.
