And for Kamaainas.....we get good rates. It's next door to the Ala Moana shopping center which is definitely a huge plus!...and there's a walking ramp from the second floor. Parking is $20 per day.

We went to the hotel restaurant, The Signature, for a birthday dinner. We were given a great table with a city & seaside view. After a few minutes, a party of 10 with 5 small children were seated next to us with the conversation and noise associated with a group of that size. We asked to be moved and were taken to a table on the other side of the restaurant, by the manager Leslie, with the same great view. She asked what the occasion was and we told her. The server arrived and wished my girlfriend a happy birthday. The server made dinner suggestions which we accepted. Dinner was SUPERB !! Excellent seafood and service by the server and bus people. After dinner, the server brought us free a free desert and so did the manager, Leslie, who came over to check on us. The second free desert surprised our server too. The is a great place for a special occasion and hopefully, the manager Leslie will be working and treat you like a VIP too.

Great Accommodation close to Ala Moana Shopping Centre, Walmart, Don Quijote Shopping for Food.When booking in we where a little surprised to be asked if we wish to purchase the starter kit for $25US which consisted of frypan, pot, plates, knives forks, spoons etcnothing was in the cupboards except two coffee mugs, no tea towels.When travelling we now take two chinese containers to use in microwaves, as there never appears to be any thing that you can use in the microwave .

Went to a conference at the convention center and this was the perfect location. Not a great location for people who want to lounge on the beach, but I actually loved it. It's a 5 minute walk to Ala Moana Beach which seemed filled with locals lounging, fishing, and barbecuing. Also had a small man made beach perfect for kids. It's next to the Ala Moana mall as well, which was great for delicious, cheap eats--check out their food court and the Shirokiya Village Walk. And, lastly--if you want to go to Waikiki, just hop on the Pink line trolley, and for $2 you're in Waikiki Beach in 10 minutes. The hotel itself was clean and had a great, inexpensive convenience store and Starbucks in the lobby.
user_name:
onehong1204
New York City, New York

review_body: For only $140 per night this is a great hotel.. the rooms are really nice and the hotel location can't be beat.. its an easy walk to Ala moana shopping center, all the restaurants and shops you could possibly want...

Ala Moana Hotel has been a local favorite for decades. It's convenient location just on the outskirts of Waikiki and directly (connected) adjacent to Ala Moana Shopping Center really can't be beat. The rooms are small, but the location is why you stay. Staff is friendly and helpful. The hotel lobby can be confusing, but once you get lost a couple times, it becomes easier. Pay extra for the buffet breakfast.

This trip was a combination of business and friends. The proximity of the hotel to the convention center was superb. Also the big mall with every shop imaginable next door made for easy shopping and quick bites to eat. The negatives: staff friendly but not terribly efficient. Housekeeping: less than stellar. Amenities: nothing special. Nice to have Starbucks in lobby. But I'd skip dim sum at the Chinese spot on second floor.

Stayed here with my wife for several nights on the way home to Australia. Couldn't compliment the staff enough, they were fantastic. Made a couple of tour bookings while we were there through the desk and the local knowledge and advice was incredible. All the lobby staff were a great help. If you like shopping it's joined to the Ala Moana shopping centre by a ramp. The location is a pleasant walk to the beaches. Although we didn't include breakfast when we booked, we were given complimentary buffet breakfasts for both of us for two days. Excellent range of food to choose from and all very tasty. Particularly liked some of the sausages they had. Wait staff were very friendly and the coffee just kept coming. Very nice place to stay. Gift shops and coffee shop in the lobby. Good sized room with ocean views and a comfortable bed.

Stayed at this property to access Ala Moana Center easily. Good: room spacious and clean. Ocean view absolutely worth the price! Staff very friendly and helpful. Not so good: surprised at how loud the noise from the Mai Tai bar at the shopping center was at night, wasn't expecting this. Having to use room key during the day was a hassle, constantly digging in purse trying to locate. Wi-fi spotty, kept bouncing from 'room to room' on it's own. Kept losing connection on my tablet which got to be annoying. Bad aside, I would stay again given the proximity to Ala Moana Center and friendly staff.

very good for the price, great location for the convention center, nice rooms, great wi-fi, overall great, good amenities, did not use the pool but was nice, and the staff was very freindly and caring, would go again

Although the conference hosts forgot to make reservations the hotel was able to get us a room at our very late arrival. Very clean room and friendly staff. Located in downtown Honolulu it was within walking distance of some good restaurants and the restaurant on the 36th floor was great.

We stayed in the Waikiki tower. Check-in was easy, special thanks to Heide for seeing that we got a room with the amenities we requested (and for being all-around awesome and super nice). All front desk, valets and staff we interacted with were kind and helpful. There is a great Starbucks in the lobby a couple of good gift shops, two restaurants and also a nightclub that we didn't visit. The hotel is connected to a huge mall and supermarket (food land farms) so its easy to eat well, get local fresh fruits and a variety of prepared meals. We had a car but I think there's good public transportation system available too. Our room was on the 29th floor and the partial ocean view was fantastic. Being from New England, we appreciated the extra strong air conditioning. Housekeeping kept our room spotless and accommodated our requests. The bathroom was roomier than most hotel bathrooms and the tub was roomy enough for me (a bigger than average person) to relax for a soak after a long day of hiking/sightseeing. We liked that there was a refrigerator and a microwave and small coffee maker for coffee or hot water. The six available elevators were often crowded especially since this hotel caters to conventions and large groups, but only once on a weekend were we inconvenienced by a large horde of drinky convention attendees. All in all We enjoyed our stay at this hotel and will likely return next time we visit Oahu.

One night stay for business. Lots of parking out front of hotel. Super large foyer. Reception was ok, plan I think is to get you through quickly. I was on 36th floor, ocean view - gorgeous! Room was clean & had everything you would need. Would recommend.

I stayed in this hotel with my parents on a visit to Pearl Harbor. The room was clean and the staff was very friendly to us. My father being a Survivor picked this hotel they made us so welcome here the food was great as well.

Stayed at this hotel for the conference. Overall a very good experience. Rooms very reasonable, staff very helpful, has better than average gym and a pool. Next door to Ala Moana shopping centre with wide range of stores and good food court.One block away from beach which provided a good exercise opportunity at the end of conference day. Starbucks on ground floor but didn't have opportunity to test on site restaurants.Very close to conference centre.Overall would return for another conference and stay here

Stayed here for work not for vacation so this was just perfect.The front desk workers we very kind and attentive. Our room was on the 30th floor and we had a partial ocean view. It was comfortable and clean. It has a microwave and small fridge which were great to store things for a light breakfast. It also has a coffee pot. There is a Mall located across the street where you can find every thing you need. The hotel has a Starbuck and several places to eat. The Convention Center is less then 5 minutes and if you don't mind walkig a bit you will find plenty of fun at the beach. The hotel offers several tours and Jason took great care in helping us choose what suit us best with the little free time we had. All in all we enjoyed our stay and would come again.

This grand hotel was lovely! So popular that several flight crews stay there often & the Japanese Prime Minister was there when we were as well! Hotel staff was VERY friendly. Starbucks in the lobby was a life saver when dealing with jet lag! Room was perfect, clean but tiny. View of the city was cool. Beach views were available. Rooftop pool was cool & you could borrow towels for the beach. Our tours picked us up right at the hotel. Beach was one block down. Mall was attached to the hotel which came in handy if you needed to pick up any items. Hotel was in walking distance to a lot. Waikiki Beach wasn't far. Overall a great experience! Everyone was accommodating!

Is was my first ever budget hotel get away to Hawaii Honolulu from Jan10-15. with my daughter. We arrival late at night and upon check in was told that we requested a twin room but as for the Kona Tower there's no twin room only queen bed, but they can open up the sofa bed for me, of cause i'm not to please with it coz it be better if you told me earlier so that i can change for other category. The staff check us in pretty fast, staff was helpfully but not friendly at allThe room was neat and clean, but the bed was awful small. looks more like the semi bed room, i did not open the sofa bed coz i don't think we have space to more around, there's microwave and fridge in the room . Our room view is facing the construction site very noisy . The colour of the room look like the Honolulu cookie packaging, it was a nice pastel green .There's Starbucks and convenience store at the lobby, that was nice. On the 3rd floor there's a small pool, a steam room , sauna room and Gym room. staff there was very friendly. WiFi was excellent!location was excellent! 5 mints walking distance to Ala Moana shopping centre ( you have to walk thru the parking lot to the mall) 10 mints walk to the beach at Ala Moana park (they provided towel over there) but we prefer to walk 20 mints to the Hawaiian Hilton beach each day for tanning. lots of restaurant around the area staff: I'm not to pleased with them, no smile from them except the last day, i extended extra one night coz my flight was late at night, i came down to recheck my room the staff Melissa was really helpfully and friendly and it make my day, hopefully the management will see that the hire more staff like her as Honolulu suppose to be a warm n friendly state. the housekeeping was excellent! only one day the room was not clean after 5:30 pm, i have to call them over to clean it.Bell service staff was pretty friendly too.i don't think i will check in this hotel but if anyone does make sure you request the Waikiki tower ocean view. i think i make a lot of different. but for my with the price i rather stay at the Hawaiian Hilton instead.i rate them 3 star is mainly the impression or the front staff was not friendly enough but location view i think is great!

Our room was on the 7th floor of the Kona tower. We could see fireworks exploding in areas outside the hotel. The room was somewhat small but met our needs with a fridge, microwave and coffee maker.The hotel is within walking distance of the Ala Moana park and beach. It is calmer than the Waikiki beach. We also walked to the Waikiki area as the weather was enjoyable. Hop on Hop off type of buses run from the Ala Moana shopping centre. The pool closes as sunset so we did not use it as it was in the evening when we were at the hotel and would have enjoyed a swim. We checked in December 31 for 2 nights. On January 1 we inquired about a late checkout on January 2 as we had a late flight and were going on an excursion to Pearl Harbour. The first response was that we could not have one unless approved by the manager the next morning. A few hours later we returned to the desk and asked about purchasing a late check out. We were served by a different individual this time. She was more amenable to addressing our request. As our current room was reserved as part of a large group it was not available for a late check out. The agent suggested that we could move rooms the next day. The final solution was that we were moving that night down the hall. We appreciated the service of the woman who assisted us but were disappointed with the first individual as he didn't take the time to tell us that there would be no possibility of a late check out with our room.

I booked this hotel as I was attending a conference at the nearby convention center. For that reason I didn't think it was necessary to book a room with any special view and I assumed that a mountain view room would be more than sufficient for a work trip. When I checked in I was informed that a new tower was under construction, but not to worry "it will only be during the day". So as long as am not in my room during daylight hours, it's fine right!?! Yeah right, no problem :( I go look at my room in the Kona (inferior) tower...it's on the 6th floor and my "mountain view" is a direct view of the construction site (see photos and then imagine the associated noise). It would be one thing if they had informed me at booking, but it was just an awful surprise when I arrived. In addition, the room was very small with only enough room for a queen bed. I then asked for a different room, even offering to wait until later in the afternoon if there was not other availability at that moment. I was told there were no other rooms and my only option for a better room was to "upgrade" to the Waikiki tower if I wanted to pay the additional price, although that room too would be a "mountain"/construction view (see first photo below). I ultimately "upgraded" because the Waikiki tower room was several floors higher and larger and so I hoped it would have slightly less construction noise, but really the rooms here are not worth the price, especially if your balcony overlooks a construction pit. And take a look at my photos: the construction site is a dirt square with nary a pilon or rebar to be found....this project is JUST beginning. Also, keep in mind that this is hotel/condo building and it feels much more like a condo then a hotel. It's a very DIY type of experience.Pros: microwave and good-sized fridge even in the tiny Kona tower roomCons: lacks consistent hotel-type service, no one ever offered to help me with my bags, including when I changed rooms.I would only recommend considering this hotel if you get a REALLY exceptional deal and don't care about your room at all. I will never stay here again.

We unfortunately only stayed here for one night after a 10 night stay in Waikiki. We wish we had shortened our Waikiki stay and spent a few extra nights at this hotel.We arrived very early (after checking out of our other hotel) and our room wasn't available, we left our bags and came back a couple of hours later. Although still early we inquired if our room was available, although it wasn't ready the lady on the reception desk moved us to another suite, but on a much higher floor (level 30) so that we could check in.There were 3 of us so we booked the 1 bedroom suite, which was a great size. It had a small kitchen and dining table. I also liked how the bedroom and lounge room (where the sofa bed was) was also separated by a hallway and bathroom, which offers extra privacy. The room was very clean and modern. The bathroom was huge and also had a deep bath, unlike some of the shallow ones in other hotels.The hotel is also an easy stroll to Alan Moana shopping centre with an access point on level 2 which takes you out straight to the carpark area / Macy's entrance. The only cons of the room are:* There is no door on the bedroom, not a huge problem, but there is a sliding door on the lounge room which then closes off from the hallway/bedroom/bathroom. (Not an issue just FYI in case you need additional privacy).* My Mum was on the sofa bed and did mention that it was uncomfortable, might be ok for kids or small adults though.Overall we would definitely recommend this hotel and would consider staying here longer next time rather then Waikiki. There is also a small convenience store and Starbucks at the bottom of the hotel.

We booked through the independent company airpads which owns condos at Ala Moana. We were duped in booking a deluxe suite with an ocean view for 4 adults and what we got was a studio room with enough space for two adults. It had a queen bed and a small half twin size chair pull out. There was a kitchenette, but no cleaning service and ketchup packaged amenities made in china. There was a nice view of kapiolani park and the ala moana parking lot. Luckily we were there for only 3 nights and with two young children, one of which had to sleep on the floor. Our room was terribly maintained. Don't book from Airpads... Book with the hotel directly... never will make that mistake again.

Great location - next to the shopping center with a Starbucks at the lobby. I sytayed at an AIR bnb unit which had a microwave - fridge and a spacious double bed. Was here for the Honolulu Marathon - which is a walking distance to the start and finish.

We always stay here when we come to Honolulu. They have recently added a starbucks to the lobby, which makes it convenient for coffee as you are leaving for your day. This hotel is directly opposite the Ala Moana shopping centre. It is connected via a bridge and you can walk across without too much traffic. Please keep in mind though you do have to walk through the shopping car park to get to the mall. The beach is also in walking distance, as well as everything you could need in side streets. You can also catch the trolley to waikiki for the day if you feel like it. I enjoy staying here as it is close enough to waikiki without too much of the touristy noise and traps. The only issue which you will find in most hotels is the parking. We paid an additional $25 a day to park our rental on site. They have a valet service, but the $25 does not cover tips. We decided that we would rather pay than worry about the car on the street.

We have been staying here for 2 weeks now out of our month long vacation. We rented a condo here which is basically one of their 225 sq ft rooms. This hotel does not have much 'going for it' other than the fact that its connected to the shopping mall. We have come and gone a minimum of 3 times per day and have been greeted once only! Their decorations are definately lacking and they have nothing festive for their guests. The don't seem to care at all! It's not the cleanest place...hallways are barely cleaned and always have garbage over flowing. There was a shooting here as well while we have been here (mall on Christmas day when it was closed) then also heard more shootings. Their fee's are an additional $25 per night for internet and of course pool use and fitness centre up from $15. If I could get a refund on our last 2 weeks here, I would most definately go elsewhere to stay. Although they say it has been updated, its dated, meaning not modern or contemporary. Very noisy and loud! Now that there is a brand new hotel being build right outside our window, we are woken up every morning at 7:30....wish we had known!!! This hotel thrives on airline pilots and attendants...they seem to like to cater to them rather than guests that are staying long term. They seem to ignore us and leave it up to the condo owners. Any issues are swept under the carpet and passed off. I would NOT recommend this hotel to my friends or family or strangers for that matter but I don't think they really care anyway.

Staying here fo christmas New Year.Great staff, very helpful Clean room, cumfortable bed.Only bad thing is the noise in the room.Can hear the folks in the rooms both sides of us.Plumbing noise is not good, as well as the noise from the street.Our room has a great view of a car park and construction site.

We did a short stopover in Honolulu and selected Ala Moana rather than an airport hotel. It was a great choice as Ala Moana offers large well furnished rooms which are Hawaiin Contemporary in design and its great value.The Hotel is attached to the newly expanded and huge Ala Moana Shopping Centre which allowed us to do some Christmas shopping.The hotels is only a $2 Pink Line bus ride from Waikiki which takes about 10 minutes, so its very convenient. It is also about a 10 minute to the beach at Ala Moana park which is a very pretty spot.  It is great hotel for shoppers or those who want the many food options available in the shopping centre food court.

My partner and I were there for both a business trip and vacation. We were there for five days. I am not sure if I would stay there again. However , it was good for what it was. We were up on the 11th floor and the view of the mountains was nice. However , there was an alley down below and there was two shootings. All of this was around 2 or 3 am. I'm not sure of the time because we woke up when we heard the shootings. There was about 10 police cars and a lot of activities going on.

The hotel room was very comfortable and convenient to the Ala Moana mall. I especially appreciated the lobby elevator to parking garage. Parking is about $20 for self park and $25 for valet. The check in and check out process line can be long if you arrive during rush times, otherwise the process is smooth.

This hotel is for people who want to stay close to Waikiki and shopping (Ala Moana Center) but don't want the hustle of Waikiki. Rooms are a bit small but clean and with a tv with lots of stations. There are many good dining choices at Ala Moana center or in the surrounding streets that are not as pricey as Waikiki. Hotel is near several bus stops. The beach is in walking distance but it's not my favorite for swimming (I prefer more coral and fish for snorkeling).

The hotel is perfect for anyone who loves to shop. Just a quick walk next door and you're in the world's biggest open air shopping centre! Many fabulous bargains at a variety of retailers such as Macy's, Forever 21, miu miu, Prada, MAC, etc.

Stayed 12/2-12/5Plusses: Price (cheaper than other surrounding hotels)Location (across the street from a no-frills beach and park)Connected to the Ala Moana mallIn the hotel there is a Starbucks, an AWESOME mini mart with groceries, fun snacks, and lots of gifts. Minuses:Bed was not comfortable.Bedding was flimsy - I wanted a thicker blanket.Staff was not particularly friendly.I was not in the tower but I did have a room with partial harbor views. Got a nice breeze.Liked having a mini fridge and microwave in the room.The bridge connecting the mall isn't all that convenient, esp if you're not staying in the tower. You have to go down to the lobby, walk through, go up the escalator, then out the door. You get out to a ramp that lets you out at the very end of the Macy's parking lot.

Everything worked except 1). The shower curtain had a section that was torn and gaping. 2). Our room was not cleaned after the 3:30pm when the privacy tag was removed. The room rate was $260 per night.

Ala Moana Hotel was where we stayed for our trip to Honolulu, and it was located just right for the activities we were planning. It is very close to Waikiki Beach and the all the best shopping in the area, including the HUGE Ala Moana Shopping Centre right next door. It also worked well as our base for when we explored around the island.Our room was perfect! The bed was comfortable, which is important to me because I don't usually sleep well in hotels. The outdoor pool and hot tub areas were very nice and spacious, and the fitness room was awesome!We found the staff was courteous and knowledgeable about the area and gave great advice about what to do and where to eat.The property is kept in beautiful condition. I would definitely stay there again!

Ala Moana Hotel is locate in very ideal for people who likes shopping and beach. Hotel is located right at Ala Moana Shopping Center which just added EWA side includes (Bloomingdales,Norstrum, Shirokiya Japanese style foodcourts) and much more. Also Ala Moana shopping center is convenient to public transportations and Tour Company (JTB, HIS, JAL) transportations. Plus hotel is located right between Ala Moana Blvd and Kapiolani Blvd (two Honolulu main streets) easy access to Waikiki, downtown and Airport.

This hotel has been on my must-try list for a while now and after a 3-night stay, here’s my report!Check-in at 11am (or thereabouts) was with Lianne who promptly assigned us to our Waikiki Tower Mountain View Room. No line at check-in. Jason at Bell Services had our luggage delivered to our room shortly after.Pros• Early check-in was a big plus especially as the hotel was fully booked!• Bell Staff were very courteous and wiki wiki• Our Room, 1932 had double-glazing so it was very quiet (we had requested a quiet room with a higher floor at time of booking)• Housekeeping was excellent – the room was very clean and toiletries replenished daily• Laundry facilities on the Kona Tower 13th floor was ample• Access to Ala Moana Center (via Mall carpark) on the 2nd floor was very convenient• Self-park below the hotel was great, lots were plentiful and easy to navigate. Attendants were very friendly• Location is good – a small street away from Kapiolani Blvd with its many eateries (the Original Pancake House, Pho One etc)• Room still felt new and color scheme was very pleasantCons• Room 1932 Mountain view was rather poor – an empty building site below, a obstructed view on the left…hardly scenic so we didn’t use the lanai at all• Hotel is popular with convention attendees, flight crew so lines at Reception can be very long• The hotel is an older structure. Plumbing is noisy and lifts are slowTip• Book Waikiki TowerOverall a pleasant stay, big disappointment was the Mauka view from our room. You won’t get the Waikiki vibe here (which we missed). Then again, it’s a lot quieter too. Would stay again for a layover perhaps if we can secure a good website rate.

Ala Mona hotels a mid range cost hotel. very clean i very courteous employees who are always willing to help if needed. one can access any kind od trips, transportation right there at the front desk, with pick up. one can also rent bicycles in the street around the corner

Right next to Ala Moana shopping Mall , great shopping location, walking distance to local supermarket. There are many great restaurants and shops located inside the shopping center. It around 15 to 20 minutes to airport and 5 to 10 minutes to Waikiki.

This hotel was recently (I'm told) updated, and it's nice. Great for business travel. Rooms a bit on the small side, but you shouldn't be in there much! The restaurant on the 36th door is great but expensive outside of "happy hour". The bar menu is a good substitute outside of happy hour. The Ala Moana shopping center is right next door...far too convenient!

Great location, right next to Ala Moana shopping center and across the street to the convention center. And walking distance to Ala Moana beach Park. The room is clean, and quiet. A little on the smaller side.

Booked this for three days got a king with balcony. Very nice room with refrig and micro. Nice pool and store. They have a nightclub in the lobby and the property is attached to the mall. Easy walk to the beach. Only thing, don't walk around at night. Up the street is Atkinson Grill, nice place to eat.

We booked the Ala Moana Hotel for one night because we were going to a concert at the Republik which is located near by. We were able to check in early, and we were upgraded to the Waikiki tower with a beautiful ocean view. They called it a partial ocean view because there is a building blocking a complete view, but it was an awesome surprise! Desk clerk was very pleasant, as a matter of fact, everyone staff member we encountered was very pleasant. Starbucks in the lobby was a great place to enjoy an afternoon "wake up" coffee. After the concert we were able to stop in the connivence shop to get a cold drink and some snacks. We enjoyed our morning coffee on the lanai soaking in the view. We will definitely book here and stay here again!!
user_name:
Stacy C
Ewa Beach, United States

review_body: Great hotel for visitors who rent a car and plan to visit the other beautiful beaches, and not just Waikiki. Shopping and food are great at the mall. Have stayed here three times and they are slowly improving the hotel.

Stayed at this hotel countless times while on business. Staff is always friendly & courteous. Rooms might be on the smallish side but are clean & many have been renovated. While the hotel is very close to Waikiki, it is not within Waikiki. If you're planning a shopping expedition to the enormous Ala Moana Center for endless shopping and dining options, the mall is simply a walk down a short ramp & across a parking lot. Starbucks recently opened right in the lobby of the hotel plus there's a fine steak & seafood restaurant on premises, a nightclub & also one of our favorite Chinese restaurants for lunch, the Royal Garden. The coffee shop at the lobby is just okay but convenient for those who don't want to venture out for breakfast in the morning. The Hawaii Convention Center is a short walk away. There are two towers - the Waikiki Tower & the Kona Tower. The rates are higher for the Waikiki Tower but if the rates are close enough, I'd book the Waikiki tower. The rooms are larger, they are closer to the lobby & if you'd enjoy sitting outside on a lanai, the Kona Tower rooms have none. There is a charge for overnight parking & a higher charge for overnight parking w/valet service.There's a recently renovated sundry store/gift shop near the lobby with an array of snacks, food items & beverages - nicely stocked. Prices might be a bit higher but it's nice not having to carry groceries from the mall. Convenient hotel in so many ways.

clean room, it was actually under construction at the time we went but we still enjoyed ourselves.easy access to the beach and shops. I would def' stay there again too!the view we had was amazing and the sunsets were gorgeous!

Worst holiday accommodation experience ever. We booked through booking.com and when we arrived at the hotel, they told us that our room is managed by a third party company and not under the hotel. The hotel staff also mentioned that 70% of the room sales are managed by the third party. This was the beginning of our nightmare. There were 3 of us (1 girl and 2 guys) and we booked a King bed with a sofa. The hotel gave us 2 double beds. When we requested to change, they told us hey can't do that as we are managed by the third party. We called the third party and it was difficult to reach them as they didn't pick up the call. With no alternative solution, we had to make do with this uncomfortable decision. That was not all. The room only had toiletries and amenities for 2 people. There were 3 of us. The hotel staff refused to provide us with an additional towel because we are managed by the third party. Nobody topped up our toiletries the next day and when we were short of toilet roll, we called reception, house keeping and they all directed us around and around. Even the customer service manager gave us a call back and she wasn't very polite because they said they get such complaints all the time and we are managed by the third party. So she said she cannot spare us anything, not even an additional roll of toilet paper and she suggested us to go and buy from the store across the road. Amazing customer serivice over here. She mentioned that she would call the third party for us also. Well, that is 2 days gone already. My advice is do not even book this hotel as you will not know whether the room you book is under the hotel or the third party company. Remember 70% chance you would go through this same frustration. You have been warned. Beautiful view and good location though. Cheers.

Booked online. Advised this was a MAHALO GIFT we paying for our daughter & husband. All I can say is that particular Saturday Night shift worker SUCKED! No Customer Service! She reads my notes but still gives them the bill. No explanation of checkin process. Worst was the 45minutes wait for their room and it wasn't busy (evening checkin). I booked an ocean view room but when they went to the room it looked more mountain, diamond head and partial ocean view room. Went back down to inquire and was rudely told, ah yah you on the 25th floor! My daughter explained what the description said and her reply was, why you like change your room? So she left. Went back during day shift and all the workers was so professional. So Aloha Spirit! They Apologized for the prior evening experience and made sure they felt WELCOMED! Suggested they makesure to fillout questionaire. Found on web, breakdown of rooms. They should change room description to Partial Ocean View room instead of Ocean view cause it was deceiving. Did like the room amenities and the decor was nice! Tub was awesome for bubble bath! Cool to hangout in room! Can walk to shopping center and many restaurants. Prime Location, away from busy Waikiki roads. Next time I wanna pay for an Oceanview room, I'm just gonna book the Suites cause they do have Ocean Front rooms, no deception there. Probably will make sure I check in earlier.

Ala Moana Hotel is the best hotel of you are planning on spending time at the Ala Moana Shopping Center. It is attached to the mall via a parking lot, so very easy and convenient to walk to. We stayed here with an infant thinking it would be convenient if we were at the mall and needed to split up and someone head back to the hotel room early. We also weren't planning on staying IN Waikiki. We used to stay at another local favorite, The Pagoda Hotel, but the last 4 or 5 times we stayed there, I promised myself we wouldn't again.The Ala Moana Hotel costs a little more, but it is worth it. Rooms are average of what you find in Honolulu- little bit aged at times, but nothing really to complain about. One thing I thought was weird, was I booked two rooms at the same time online, for the same price. I checked in earlier, then after picking up family from the airport a few hours later, checked into the second room.When checking in the first time I got to the counter at the same time as another couple next to us. The desk agent said to the other guy "great news, we have upgraded you to the newer tower at no charge". I thought that was pretty great, but am not the type to say "hey, that guy got an upgrade, can I have one too?"After that, I thought nothing of it. However, when checking in to my second room I booked, the desk agent said the same thing to my mother who was using the room. I thought it was kind of strange a few hours later, they gave her an upgraded room as well.Anyhow, just a weird observation, I still enjoyed my stay, and will stay here again.The Starbucks in the lobby was convenient, and pretty cool- they serve beer and wine in the evenings. Also, there is a Chinese restaurant in the hotel that is very good. This is our go to spot for dim sum. Delicious and clean. No need to drive to Chinatown for good dim sum.Parking is a little strange here. Because of so many one way streets, it's a little humbug having to drive around the block to access the parking lot. That is minor though, not a big deal. Would definitely LOVE to see the Ala Moana Hotel give a kama'aina rate on parking rates though, as many other hotels to. That would be greatly appreciated.

I stayed for nearly two weeks to participate in a conference in the nearby convention center. For that purpose, as well as taking advantage of some shopping, it was great! The room was ok, but nothing great. It got better when I had them move me to an ocean-view room, which was more appealing than looking at the parking lot of the mall. The Starbucks in the lobby was decent, but had long lines in the morning. I also appreciated the convenience store in the lobby. Service overall was fine, but nothing special.

Love the location for what I need. It's right by Ala Moana park, as well as adjacent to a mall with shopping & food. Rooms are average, not very big, no room service. Decent & clean, no problems. The front desk service can be VERY slow, any time of night. When arriving tired & fatigued, I've spent over half hour waiting to get checked in. This is frustrating.

I live in Honolulu. I just needed to stay in a decent, moderately priced hotel so that we could have a place to stay during our wedding weekend. Ala Moana Hotel is a great place that local residents always flock to when they need such a place to stay. It's physically connected to the huge Ala Moana Shopping Center (probably more than 350 stores) by a parking lot. It's situated right on the border of the Waikiki tourist area (about a 15 minute walk) and about a 3 minute walk to the Convention Center. The rooms are spacious and clean, offer pretty good views of either the mountains or the ocean (both views are pretty nice), and have a ton of places within walking distance to eat. The property consists of two towers, the Kona Tower, which has slightly smaller rooms with no balcony, and the Waikiki Tower, which is the taller of the two and has larger rooms with balconies. If you're tired of staying in Waikiki, or need a place to stay because you are attending an event at the Convention Center, the Ala Moana Hotel is a solid choice.

I was forced to give them a star, so here you go one star. Well let me just get straight to it. My stay could have been a lot better and I should have just cancelled my week long reservation and went elsewhere. I made an on-line reservation via their website on 8/29/16 for a stay on 9/11-9/16/16. A few days later I went back to their website in attempt to extend my reservation by one day (9/17/16) and their online booking system could not accommodate my request. So I used other search engines (Orbitz, Hotels.com etc.) to find a hotel that could accommodate my extra day. Low and behold I found rooms available at the same hotel (Ala Moana) that I just inquired with. So at this point I am a little perplexed trying to understand and navigate this dilemma. So I call Ala Moana directly to find answers and they have no rooms available but on third-party sites they are available. Of course the reservation folks had no answers or clues on why I am experiencing this and that I should book via the third-party website if it’s available because their hands are tied. So I ended up booking this single reservation. So speed things up, I am all checked-in and trying to make the most of this trip and reservation. So few days after checking-in, I thought it would be a great idea to ask the front-desk staff about my experience and explorer the possibilities of being able to stay in the same room, instead of grabbing my things and relocating to another room within the same hotel. While let’s just say wishful thinking and what a terd sandwich to say the least. By the end of the day I ended up talking to several front desk staff and then the lovely night-shift manager whole couldn't tell his rear hole from a hole in the ground to say the least. I was trying to have him explain their booking process, online reservation system, and their involvement with third-party reservation sites. All I got from him was lip service and 14 years in industry and blah blah blah. I ended up leaving (walking away) by his 4th explanation of my reservation experience and told him to shove it and his 14 years.So let’s just say the check-out and check-in process is insane and you better pray that your room is ready, computers are online, or flight crew. Also, you might as well leave your reasons and explanations at the airport because these folks could careless on how bad you need your room. Don't ask for a stupervisor, because they'll really tell you to go pound Hawaiian sand and come back and just maybeee your room might be ready. I'm telling you! So I had to wait in-line for 30min to check-out of my first room and then to be told that the computers are off-line at the moment and to come back in an hour so that I can check into my second room. At this point I am ready to walk the plank in the shark infested waters so I don't have to interact with this hotel. Mysteriously they were able to check me out but not re-check me in???But wait, if I recall correctly they have one or two customer service or appreciate certs in the lobby from early or mid-2000s to show you their greatness once upon a time.You've been warn stay clear from this hotel. Then again you don't miss what you don't know (or experience).
user_name:
Nachobusiness81
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We stayed one night at this hotel on arrival into Honolulu before moving over to Kauai..the hotel is very clean and comfortable..check in staff very helpful.We tried for ealry check in, howcer the hotel was heavily booked the night before and check out is not until 12 pm..the staff were amazing though, and managed a room for us by 11am..starbucks located in the foyer, and plantation cafe has a very delicious buffet breakfast.The ala moana shopping centre is right next door with a walkover ramp from the hotel.Also located next door in the Ala Moana mall is the Waikiki trolley stop, which takes you right around Waikiki for $2.50...i would definately stay here if I am to travelmto Honolulu in the future.

Several years ago, I reviewed this hotel with the title "Great hotel, but with drawbacks." I would like to revise that review to simply "Great Hotel." Although not on the beach, our room on the 31st floor had great views of the Harbor and Ala Moana Park. Close to everything -- Ala Moana Mall (adjacent), the beaches and great dining. The reservations I had have been removed. A new high end steak house (The Signature) has been opened on the top floor with a well stocked bar. Same hotel, only better.

Close to Waikiki and the Ala Moana shopping center. Very clean room and the employees were really nice. I really loved that there's a Starbuck's in the hotel and that the items in the hotel snack shop were reasonably priced.The only negatives: our room in the Kona Tower were tiny...and so was the bathroom. The tub is super deep so, if you are not flexible or if you are short, you could have difficulty getting in and out of the tub. I do not recall having that issue last time when we stayed...I think we got the Waikiki Tower that time.Also the tub was slow to drain & the refrigerator made an odd whooping noise. We did report those issues to the front desk on check out and hopefully these are issues easily fixed. They were a little annoying but not a terrible inconvenience.I still love the Ala Moana Hotel & will stay there again.

The Ala Moana is a great hotel with local decor and the Aloha Spirit with amenities well beyond comparatively priced hotels in Waikiki. They package with the airlines. I have put in a detailed review which has not been picked up by the system so I subset you go to their website.
user_name:
Harvey E
New York City, New York

review_body: Our room was on the small side, but it was very clean. I usually don't go barefoot in a hotel because I'm too grossed out, but was fine in our room. Not the most up-to-date, but not seriously outdated either. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is right next to the Ala Moana shopping center which (according the literature) is the largest open air mall. Short cab / Uber ride to Waikiki one direction and fishing or catamaran tours in other direction. Walking distance to beach park. If you need to check out early for a tour you can come back later that day and use a "hospitality room" to clean up, which was a nice benefit before 18 hours of traveling back home. Chinese restaurant (so so) and steakhouse (pricey) with great bartending staff (i.e. fun!) on premises. Nice workout and pool facilities.

The Ala Moana hotel in Honolulu is located next to the Ala Moana Center shopping mall, near the convention center (and just outside of Waikiki). The hotel has been updated somewhat from its old look in the 1980s and 1990s, I think around when the convention center was opened a number of years ago. It is in a very convenient location - there is much shopping in that area, not just the Ala Moana mall, but a big Wal-Mart, a Target that will open in 2017, a very big and well-stocked Walgreen, the big and interesting Don Quixote supermarket and mini-mall, and the Ward Village, Ward Warehouse, Ward Center area of small malls (along with two Ross stores in that area). The transportation for the hotel is very good - many of Oahu's buses stop at Ala Moana, there are many shuttle and trolley buses, and the new train will have a station there later when it opens in a few years. The hotel itself needs a lot of updating. The room floor files are old, the beds are the older, short types (as opposed to the excellent, high and soft Marriott hotel-chain beds), the furnishings are ok but also dated. There are some condo-rooms also there for rent, but as far as I could see, they were pretty old looking also. Perhaps there are some exceptions, but check your rooms carefully. The price is not bad, though the hotel is very busy with airline people checking in and out at all hours. But if you don't mind that, overall, Ala Moana hotel is an ok place to stay, convenient, clean, reasonably modern, good (though pricey) parking, with an excellent shopping and transportation location.

I suggest an upgraded room. It's not much more. I suggest valet parking. I have stayed at the Alamoana Hotel numerous times in the the few years. I have always been treated exceptionally well. Walking distance to Waikiki and without the madness. I hesitated to write this review for fear that the hotel may be sold out the next time I want to visit Oahu. It happens.
We have had a great stay so far, room is maintained daily if you wish.. a/c works fine and bed was not to bad at all! Tour desk and Starbucks in the lobby and access to the ala Moana mall from hotel

I had stayed at the Ala Moana Hotel for numerous times in the past by booking with the hotel directly. I had always liked this hotel because: (1) it is right next to the Ala Moana Shopping Center and (2) the prices were reasonable (at least in local resident rate) for its amenities. My most recent stay has changed my opinion about the Ala Moana Hotel. The room I was given this time was very tiny--with even tinier bathroom--when compared to all of my previous stays. But the real issue wasn't the room size - it was the bathroom. I almost gagged when I opened the shower curtain which gave off a strong moldy smell. The bath tub drained very slowly so there was always a lake before I could even get the water temperature right. The faucet was so tight that I needed both hands to turn it... and I could keep turning it to the right with the water going either super hot or cold with each turn... The bath tub caulking showed moldy spots... The hair dryer worked for two minutes and died... The handle on the bathroom door was not put on quite right (the handle didn't fully cover the hole on the door)...I don't know if I was given such a low-grade room because I booked it through TripAdvisor (via getaroom). The price was only slightly better than the local resident rate. On the plus side, the room I got came with a full-size bed and a single-size pull-out sofa bed. The sofa bed was quite comfortable.

This review is for Ala Moana Hotel Gaia Resort. It more of a condo rental then a hotel. You checked in at the Ala Moana Hotel's front desk and you can used their lobby, pool and elevators but you get no room service. So what you get is what the condo owner give you. In my case, it got a nice room. It came with a microwave and refrigerator. A/C works perfectly. Cabinets got dishes, cups, and forks/knives. The place was very clean and I kept it that way. It even had a vacuum cleaner (small one) just in case. Bathroom came with three wash clothes, four towels but no hand towels or foot mat when getting out of shower. Bed was comfortable but it only came with two lame pillows and bit of a ragged blanket and sheet. Great view of the Punchbowl and what the top of Ala Moana Center looks like. The real downside were, it came with only ONE roll of toilet paper (had to steal some more from my parents). Funny that Trip Advisor don't have this "Gaia Resort" listed. I thought the cost was bit too much and funny thing is, they charged me for the entire stay even before I got on the plane. Watch out for that just in case. Location of Ala Moana Hotel proves to be ideal. Close to the Ala Moana Beach, shopping center and several other places. Easy bus ride to Waikiki and activities there. I could live without room service but I hope whoever own this place to provide a better blanket and more toilet paper rolls. I left two extra behind just to be friendly. Oh yeah....the hotel appears to be plague with false fire alarms. Quite irritating when it tell you to move to the lobby via fire escape and you are on the 35th Floor. Luckily, couple of minutes later, you get a recall announcement!!Another downer just to be fair is that the internet service is super spotty. I am not sure if it the hotel itself that is lame or the condo owner. But it was lame!! The cable TV was also pretty lame as the channels were rather limited but they do have HDTV and some of the sports channels were in HD. That is good, limited but good. And do wish they will provide a real office chair for your desk, instead of some sort of a sitting stool!But overall, it wasn't a bad stay, it wasn't a great one either but something I can live with. I am not sure if the hotel side of this was any better or not.....!

Sure you can stay anywhere in Waikiki but this hotel has just all you need. Gym, pool, restaurants, shop, bar and a Starbucks and super staff!! I come here regularly and always feel at easy and welcome by the reception and the housekeepers always greet me with full enthusiasm! The rooms are spacious if only the shower was a little more straight forward to operate it would have been perfect. The Ala Moana shopping mall next door never stops to entertain me and a jog or swim at Ala Moana park beach do come recommended. If it wasn't for business i.e. Someone else books my accommodation I will come here privately too. Keep up the good work people from Ala Moana Hotel.

It's a very good location, next to the Ala Moana mall and Ala Moana park / beach. The rooms are nice and the TVs are big. Each room has free and easy to connect to WiFi. The only complaint I had was that not all of the front desk staff was very friendly when I checked in. Maybe I caught them on a bad day. Other than that, no complaints. I had a nice view and a nice room. I'd definitely stay again.

Near Downtown and Ala Moana Mall this hotel was used for a business trip for three nights. The room was basic tourist level but not special. My room was on the 7th floor above a street where people liked to drag race at 2 am. An engineer had to come to assist in getting the internet working at all and it was a problem during the entire stay. I went to the Starbucks in the lobby to check my email most of the time. Starbucks internet worked. The breakfast I had as part of the package was outstanding with a superior buffet and great service. I would advise you to get the breakfast package if you are a breakfast person.

Ala Moana is an average hotel in comparison to many others. Basic room is small, lobby is good, nice Starbucks and amenities shop, but the immediate area surrounding the hotel is still sketch. The walk over to the mall around the corner had some interesting smells and characters as you have to walk through the lower levels of the malls parking garage. I would recommend driving. Staff was good, location is central, but I'd rather the hassle of Waikiki hotels than this one. If you have business at the convention hall it's probably most convenient. Overall it's OK, but not great.

Prices are competitive, rooms are clean, staff are friendly, shopping is convenient (Ala Moana, Don Qijote, and Wal-Mart are very close, not to mention the in-house shop for small items, last-minute souvenirs, and snacks) lots of food choices are close. Diamond Head and the southeast coast are just a short drive away, and the airport is too.

Well, the highest compliment is that local Honolulu residents booked me at this hotel saying that it is central to everything. In a way, they were right. The large shopping mall with high end stores is a parking lot away and there is also a huge food court and maybe the biggest japanese food court in Hawaii within two blocks. Walk up front and there is the beach a short distance away.The room was clean, with coffee maker, microwave and refrigerator for the tourist with leftovers. A balcony adjoining the room gave a panoramic view of Honolulu. Room was medium sized. A pool and gym are in the building. Free wifi. My Honolulu friend recommends the dim sum place on the third floor.

My mother, myself and my brother came to visit family in Waikiki and stayed at the Ala Moana because they offered a suite of rooms. We were on the 21st floor, mountain facing to catch the wind. The rooms were spacious and clean, beautiful view, lanai off the bedroom, very comfortable pull out couch in the living room. Two microwaves, two fridges, dishwasher and stovetop let us fix meals in the suite or reheat. Ala Moana shopping center just outside the 2nd floor escalator. Highly recommend for a close to waikiki but a little more relaxed stay.

I stay here a couple of times per year. The place is adequate for a business traveler. The rooms in the old tower are small and have a very old feel. There is just enough room to set up a computer and get to work. The wifi is adequate. On this visit, my room was very dirty to start with. I mustered up some patience and asked for a thorough cleaning since no other rooms were available that were on a high floor. They cleaned it again and I was satisfied.The location of this hotel is great with the mall next door and the convention center a block away. Get a room on a higher floor. The noise from street can be very overwhelming.

If you don't have to be in Waikiki or on the beach, this is a very convenient place to stay. It's connected to the Ala Moana Center, the large shopping mall with large food court. The hotel is clean, but the rooms are a bit on the small side. The pillows are ridiculously small. The water pressure is pretty low, probably for conservation. There's a Starbucks in the lobby. I would stay here again.

If you're an outer-island kama'āina looking for a great place to stay, the Ala Moana Hotel is one of the best options in Honolulu/Waikīkī. I am from the island of Hawai'i (AKA the Big Island) and I was looking for an affordable option that was in a good location. The Ala Moana Hotel is one of those options to highly consider. It is adjacent to the Ala Moana Center, which literally has almost EVERYTHING, it is walking distance from the Ala Moana Beach Park, it is close to the Kea'aumoku Walmart and Walgreens, and if you want to go to famous Waikīkī, you can catch the Waikīkī Trolley at the Ala Moana Center for just $2. Other than the great location, the hotel itself has a very upscale yet kama'āina friendly atmosphere, well furnished, modern and comfortable guest rooms with FREE WIFI, spacious and relaxing pool deck, full-service fitness center, Starbucks in the lobby, courteous and friendly staff, skybridge to the Ala Moana Center, and like I mentioned earlier, LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION! The hotel also offers a $14 airport shuttle service that you can utilize (taxi is too expensive; city bus too crowded). The hotel also has good dining options on-site and the Ala Moana Center has a very large and well-appointed food court. Overall, the Ala Moana Hotel is a great, kama'āina friendly option that won't break the bank at around $135/night (plus tax and $55 incidentals deposit). I highly recommend the Ala Moana Hotel for kama'āina and visitors alike.IMPORTANT INFORMATION:1) If paying with DEBIT, they will hold/take out the amount of the reservation PLUS a $55 incidentals deposit AT THE TIME OF CHECK-IN.2) Call the bell desk to arrange for the $14 (per person) airport shuttle service.3) The KONA TOWER is the best value and each room has 1 double bed and 1 pull-out sofa bed, however, there's no lānai (there is a sliding door you can open but the railing is right in front of the door, which is to be expected considering the GREAT LOW PRICE!).4) The elevators are key-card operated, so only guests can use the elevators to the higher floors (safe and secure).5) The skybridge to the Ala Moana Center is on the 2nd floor, pool deck and fitness center are on the 3rd floor of the Waikīkī tower and can be accesed from a door at the 4th floor elevator lobby of the Kona Tower.6) The bell desk can hold your bags for you after you check-out if you're not heading to the airport right away FREE of charge.7) No resort fee!**If you want to bring back Manapua and Pork Hash for the 'ohana back home, Chun Wah Kam Noodle Factory is close by!**

If looking for a decent hotel with a 1 minute walk to the convention center - this is it. Very friendly and helpful staff all the way around. I'd like to rate it 3.5 stars - but will round up to 4.Why the 3.5? I thought it could use some room updates as it seemed. It isn't a dirty or run down property at all - very clean. But felt older. Other complaint - the restaurant didn't open until 6:30am on weekdays which surprised me. For the business traveler who needs to be somewhere by 7am - that doesn't work. BUT, there is a starbucks that opens earlier for pastries and such.

Entered the Ala Moana hotel and asked for a room for one night. "Sorry, we're sold out". I pulled out my phone at the front desk and pulled up the hotel's reservation system, rooms available. Really? Showed it to the front desk clerk who accessed his system, went and asked someone something and said "We have rooms available". Really again? So, I got a room with a mountain view overlooking the parking lot that most reviewers found distasteful. Yes, the view sucked and $150 rate with AAA was a bit much, but the room was fine. Small, very small, but adequate for my needs. I wasn't there for the view, needed a room, with a bed and air conditioning. Room was actually kinda cute. Lion Coffee provided in room. Hotel front desk folks need some training on how to be nice, it was my first night in Hawaii. Gift shop has a lot of food and gift items, but extremely expensive. Starbucks on site (out of Pumpkin Spice stuff...boo). Convenient location across from Ala Moana Mall and restaurants. Planned on staying with relatives across the street at Sunset Towers, but no AC in that building in case you're wondering why I didn't make reservations in advance.

We stayed here last year. This year we again had a Waikiki Tower-Ocean View room, but it was on the 29th floor from September 22nd to October 3rd. The front-desk agent was extremely helpful in moving us to a room away from the elevators and ice machines! The hotel is close to Ala Moana Park, Beach, and Mall. The room was very nice, the HVAC system works very well, but the archaic, 1970's-era Time-Warner Oceanic cable service with its slow scrolling menus and service is very mediocre and the remote does not work for most options. Room service is very good, but the attendant failed to replace the missing shower curtain ring after I informed her of this. It was also annoying to have to keep reminding them that we wanted extra drinking glasses. These are minor issues, but they illustrate the need for better employee follow-up.The valet service is better, but the traffic design and signage needs improvement. There are essentially five lanes, but they are unmarked, and one woman complained that she waited ten minutes for her ride to get through the congestion. Managers need to enforce a "no texting" rule during working hours for the valets, however.The wonderful Plantation Café buffet is only open for breakfast and serves fresh fruit, juices, pastries, eggs, waffles, breakfast meats, chef's specials, great coffee and is fairly priced considering the choices. Kathy, one of the servers, is wonderful! The hotel now has a well visited in-house Starbuck's franchise. The handy hotel store has just about everything: food, refreshments, clothes, souvenirs, toiletries, etc. but it is a little pricey.We did not use the pool this time, so I do not know if the chlorine levels have been adjusted. The $20 per day parking fee is annoying, but I imagine all the hotels levy it. We did not get a chance to meet with the hotel management, but we will try next time.

I stayed here for a conference in the city. The hotel is expensive but that seems to be the case in most hotels in this town. The room was average size, clean, comfortable. The wifi worked well. The hotel location right next to the shopping mall made it useful. A downside, no breakfast included in the rate, cheap. The main issued I noticed with a colleague is that the hotel made a hold on his credit card upon arrival as a security for other expenses under the promise that at the check out this charge would be removed. Well, that was a month ago and the hold is still in the credit card and the hotel just gives excuses and does not remove it. I find this to be very strange.

The hotel is located between Ala Moana park/beach and Waikiki Beach. It is attached to the mall which is huge and has every high end store imaginable. The food court in the mall has some unique Hawaiian flavors. After travelling for about 13 hours it was extremely disappointing that It took over an hour to check into the hotel. The wifi is somewhat sketchy in the lobby. Use the Starbucks one. Given that Starbucks is right in the lobby it would have been good business to team up and offer the clients checking in a small sampling of coffee or cold beverage.Once in the room, I was disappointed. We were on the 13th floor. It was so loud from street traffic, sirens and overall 'downtown' noise. We had 2 double beds. My hubby is 6.5. I'm much shorter and even my feet hung off the end of the bed. The room was clean. We asked for a new room and we were accommodated the next day. The 25th floor was much quieter. The staff were all friendly. The rooms were cleaned upon request each day and fresh towels were always stocked. The gym was well equipped but small and no view at all. A closed in court yard. The pool could have been so much prettier. More foliage or décor. It was quite sterile and closed very early. No evening swims after a long day.We could see the sun sets - which were incredible - from the stairway balcony. They were only marred by the giant construction cranes. Downtown Oahu is very different from the rest of the Island. Do yourself a favour and do the Circle island tour. 8 Hour day but so worth it. Different world from downtown. Well stocked store in the lobby will hook you up with anything you've forgotten as well as beer/wine and souvenirs. We had appetizers and a drink in the bar at the top of the hotel. Not bad for happy hour. Not sure I'd stay again but clean and good service.

Best place to stay for large convention. I would be back in my room resting while others staying in other parts of honolulu were standing in line waiting for a shuttle. The hotel staff were freindly and accomodating. Parking garage for the Ala Moana shopping center is connected to hotel by a sky bridge. Short walk to the magic island beach for some of the best sunsets on the island. We stayed here during convention, but got out of honolulu for a few days once convention ended.

We have been been to Honolulu many times and decided to stay at the Ala Moana Hotel this time because of it's proximity to the Ala Moana Mall. We were pleasantly surprised at the friendly and professional service we received during our stay. The rooms in the Waikiki Tower were clean and nicely furnished and also has a nice balcony to enjoy all the views. We started our days at the Plantation Cafe, it's a nice place to start your day off with a buffet full of scrambled egg chef style, sausage, bacon, oatmeal, fried rice, pastries, juices, coffee, fresh fruits including plenty of fresh papayas. We enjoyed all the shopping and restaurants next to the hotel. Also, the pool is a nice place to relax after a long day. We will be staying at the Ala Moana Hotel on our next trip to Honolulu !!

If you're going to stay on Waikiki beach then look no further than the timeless Ala Moana Hotel. If you want nostalgic then ask for the original/remodeled rooms. If you want hi-rise with views then the tower is your best bet.

Stayed there for a Congress event. The hotel is overpriced for what it really offers. My room was by the ice machine and it made such a loud noise that I had to change rooms. The hotel staff offered another room... which was in front of another ice machine. So I asked for another room again, and was kindly relocated. One night one side of my bed sheets were wet - there was a big blue stain on them. It was late in the evening, they came to change the sheets. Another colleague had the same problem. Finally, for some reason a bif fan was left in a corridor, making a loud noise... stayed there until I told the staff about it, and they removed it. Appart from these little adventures, it is an OK hotel... but I find it overprized for what it offers.

We had a great time here, located right next to the mall if you like to shop. We did not have dinner in any of the hotel restraunts, but did have the breakfast buffet a few mornings and the kids loved the options. Starbucks on site was a convince. The rooms are small and well appointed. The pool is quiet and relaxing. I would stay here again if I found myself wanting to stay in the city.

Good value hotel, with nice people, a fitness room, and a pool that's closed most of the time. So, if you just need a place a crash for the night before you fly out in the morning (several pilots stay here) and a Starbucks that offers microbrews, this is you place. Also, just down the street from convention center, mall, and Ala Mona Beach.

Very comfortable room in the Waikiki Tower, with a balcony to enjoy the pleasant weather. Was first shown a room in the Kona Tower - smaller and without balcony. Good location close to the Convention Center and a variety of restaurants and a great supermarket at the Ala Moana shopping center. Free WiFi with good service.

Ala Moana Hotel is the closest to the convention center in Honolulu, but it is really big -feels like disney world or a giant resort hotel. There are a few restaurants but no room service or great hang out bar. In the lobby is a starbucks that serves beer and wine and intersting snacks -but the hotel caters to big conferences and it serves its purpose. The gym is great and it is close enough to walk to the beach.

Great room (ocean view one bedroom suite), very clean and modern. Good location just away from the craziness of Waikiki, and next to Ala Moana Centre and public transport. Shame about the disinterested and rude bell staff....

The best part of this hotel is it's proximity to Ala Moana shopping centre which gives shoppers access to luxury gds and great sales at macy's - ladies, get the 10% visitor discount on the 1st flr of macy's and happy shopping! That being said, breakfast is pretty basic and limited in selection - eggs, bacon, potatoes, a small japanese selection, about 3-4 different types of rolls /bread, yoghurt, kimchi, 2 fruits...etc. I was really sad that they no longer had the cornbeef hash and liver & onions fry for brekky which I really looked forward to. Rooms have been upgraded but still look old and are small for price compared to beachfront hotels along waikiki but stayed here due to familiarity. Bathrm could be better cleaned - had hair on the flr and shower area. Could also do with upgrading the aircon and bathrm because temps are a bit erractic there. No housekeeping, and would have to pay for it which was a shock cause it was not stated when booking, fortunately not a big deal for me as I can do without it but gd to have known about it in advance as it would have annoyed me greatly if I had stayed more than a wk. As always, staff are helpful, knowledgeable, friendly and will make you feel right at home! You can get your water frm the convenience store in the lobby next to starbucks if you don't feel like walking far - prices are pretty reasonable there too. Overall okay time, but I may get an apt or search for a better deal ard waikiki beach nxt time.

Stayed here for 4 nights and enjoyed the pool a lot. The rooms are standard and nothing too fancy but they do the job. The Ala Moana shopping centre is next door with a food court and plenty of other shops. Starbucks is downstairs and a Chinese Restaurant near the pool with another restaurant on the 39th floor.

8 days at this great location. In Hawaii for a conference. Came in early to enjoy O'ahu before the conference started. Got in Monday the 12th and had a nice surprise we were upgraded to ocean view room no additional charge and no resort fees. Room was clean and was kept clean throughout. Only bad thing I could say was not enough room in bathroom to keep toothbrush etc as it was just a sink. Loved the shower though. Also great it has a fridge and microwave. Little convenience store was nice and it is right next to the Ala Moana Mall with many choices to eat

Night club at the hotel was okay. Older crowd and music was good. I like it and it wasn't no techno music. We had a private room to celebrate the birthday. I do recommend to get the room, totally worth it.

Booked an ocean view room ( paid more) for 3 persons (also paid more). On checkin found out that my room allocated was condominium part of the hotel...facing mountains and buildings and for 2 persons. Also it is managed by Luxury Suites hotel (which is also a sham because there is nothing luxury about them) which doesnt answer calls and when they do ...you have to use their emergency services which is rude and not much of a service. Ala Moana hotel is definitely out of my preferred list now. Don't get cheated like me. Agoda also is also part of this sham and has misrepresented the booking as a hotel.

Stayed five days at this hotel located next door to the Ala Moana shopping center. This is the largest outdoor mall in the USA. The stores were great, the variety of restaurants and eating options were unbelievable. The hotel is one block from the beach and next door to Ala Moana Park. The hotel was clean and with all the amenities you could ask for. There were no additional resort fees as it was included in the nightly rate so I didn't have an outstanding bill when I checked out. The staff was friendly and helpful and the balcony was a special nice surprise. I was able to drink my coffee and enjoy the view. Would return should I ever return to this beautiful city.

We choose this hotel because we had 24 hours in Honolulu for a layover, and wanted more options than the airport hotels but didn't want to face the traffic of the main tourism area. This hotel was a good choice for us for many reasons. It's closer to the airport than many other places. But it's big bonus is that it's connected to two cool things: a massive mall and, across the street, a huge park and beach, Ala Moana Beach Park. Clearly locals dominate the beach, in a good way, as it has a great sense of community and lots of beach amenities. There's a small protected ocean swimming area for kids, for example. The walls are thin; when someone in the room next to us sneezed, I jumped because it sounded like they were in our room. But that's all the noise they made (or else the air conditioner covered other sounds). It's a little hard to get someone's attention in the busy lobby area, but otherwise staff seemed very attentive and helpful.

Across the street from the conference center and within walking distance of touristy parts of Honolulu. Good location. Quality, however, isn't great. Bed is uncomfortable, room is small, and amenities are lacking.

Good location, 5 min to Ala Moana shopping centre. A bit far from Waikiki but you can walk for 30-40 min or take a bus. Room is modern and clean but very small. Bed is not comfortable, small and bouncy. I'd get a twin room next time. Felt more like a business hotel.

I visit Hawaii yearly and always stay at Ala Moana Hotel for a couple of days before going to my timeshare. Hotel is clean, a little dated but I stay there for the location. Next to Ala Moana shopping center and close to Waikiki. Like to do my gift shopping before heading out of the city. Will be back next year. A lot of these rooms are owned by individuals. If you book through a 3rd party and not the hotel directly, you are not entitled to tidy services or clean towels. You need to contact whoever you booked through. Beware of this.

My wife likes to get off this rock once and a while. We are foodies! So of course Honolulu has the best places. This is our first time staying at Ala Moana Hotel and WOW we enjoyed this first time experience! They also upgraded us to a very nice suite! We will be back!

A bit disappointing room, very small and very dated. Lampshades were mismatched and lightbulbs weren't all working. The room gets too humid after a shower as there is no fan in the bathroom. Only one person can be in the bathroom at a time. But there is a microwave and frig. Starbucks is in the lobby

My Mom and I love the fact the this hotel is within walking distance of the Ala Moans Shopping Center. The only thing my Mom didn't like was that she didn't want her sheets and towels replaced. But other than that the room was comfortable.

Stayed for three days and two nights here and was very happy with the service from staff and the amenities offered particularly the friendliness of the Bell staff and their helpfulness!A well appointed hotel very close to the Ala Moana shopping centreI stayed on the 29th floor which had views to the harbour.Bed was very comfy; in fact I had two beds in my room.

I spent a week there and was disappointed. Location was great as I was attending a conference at the nearby Convention Center, but the hotel lacks quite some services. No Room Service available, breakfast restaurant is often very crowded expect to queue, same for Starbucks within the lobby. Rooms are ok, but cleaning service can be done pretty late, do not expect your room cleaned by noon even if you leave at 830am. On the good side, free wifi in the rooms and in the lobby, and nice convenient store in the lobby with a lot of stuff to drink or eat.

Living on Maui I travel to Honolulu often. I have stayed at this hotel now about 30+ times in the last 5 years. Itʻs an ideal location for shopping, especially around the holidays because itʻs very convenient next to Ala Moana Shopping Center, the only hotel with a joined ramp on the second floor leading to the mall.This Hotel is also located about a block away from the Hawaii Convention Center, making it really convenient for any convention being held there. Great workout gym and a fantastic pool to relax. You can even order Pizza and meet the driver downstairs to pay and pickup for your order which is always a plus, especially when traveling with a group of kids this is an excellent option at the side entrance downstairs. Why my 4 Star rating?The downside to this hotel is that only part of the hotel rooms have been renovated, so staying in the Kona Towers you could end up with the older harder beds, which is a bit uncomfortable and hard to sleep on. Itʻs worth upgrading to the Waikiki Towers where most of the rooms are newly renovated. This Hotel does get a bit busy too because most tour companies book their rooms here, especially from Japan. Airline pilots as well as flight crews can almost always be seen checking in or out here, so your checking in or out experience could take a while. Our last stay took me about 45 minutes to get to the counter. Most of the staff at the check in counter is friendly and courteous, there are a few who seem to have been there for a while and donʻt have much customer-care passion, and seem to just exist and be there for work because a friendly smile and "Aloha, how can I help you" vocabulary is far from their daily language. All in all, this is a great place to stay for convenience and accessibility to the city surroundings.

We are local HI family. This is my 3rd time to stay in this hotel. The last time, I had a very unpleasant experience, but this time, much improvement.Check In: Staff was efficient & professional. Very pleasant welcomeRooms: clean, beautiful decor & complete amenitiesCheck out: a breezeWifi: fastWe stayed overnight because our house was being tented for fumigation (termite). Kamaaina rate was awesome compared to the other hotels closer to central oahu.We gad a wheelchair bound person and the accessible room was very convenient.We were very comfortable and felt safe in this hotel. Plus Ala moana center is near, lots of eating places & things to do. It was a plus that a starbucks was in the lobby.

The Ala Moana is very, very picturesque. Beautiful sunsets and a classic (and large) Banyan tree in the courtyard paired with white accents throughout the hotel make this place such a lovely destination. Rooms are large and the views of Waikiki Beach are stunning. There are beach rentals for surfboards, paddleboards, outriggers, and catamaran rides. Just be prepared that it gets extremely crowded on the beach as well as surfing. If you're not paying attention you WILL get run over or yelled at to get out of the way by people on boats or other surfers.Take a long walk or a short taxi ride to get poke at Ono Seafood followed by malasadas at Leonards Bakery. Definitely take a day and drive up to the north shore where you'll feel like you have breathing room.

The room is good with everything else,Very good access to the Mall. except the toiletry No toothbrush.At the restaurant The service was very slow we waited 15 minutes to be seated even when they have a lot of space.

This hotel is located right next to Ala Moana mall and about two blocks from Ala Moana beach. It was very convenient for us as we only had one rental car and were splitting up for some of our days in Honolulu. There were plenty of restaurants and a couple of co ops with in walking distance or a short drive which was nice for stocking up. There's a Starbucks, 1-2 restaurants and a convenience store in the lobby. The hotel is clean and quiet and the service was fine. The underground parking is small and fills up early but there are attendants there in the evening to help guide you into makeshift spots. Over all this is a good reasonably priced hotel for the heart of the city. Not a resort hotel.

Smack up against the Ala moana Shopping center which is the largest in the Pacific rim. While not a 5 star hotel, its clean, has a great staff, and did I mention location??? Grab a bus out front or skip the hussle bussle and continue across the street to The park and excellent beach with viturally no tourists.
