There's a protected cove to the left of the beach where you won't have to worry about the young one as much. In the evening, the hotel offers an excellent restaurant and bar on top that rivals anyplace in Honolulu

Recently stayed at this hotel for business. I was given a room in the Kona building. I read a number of disappointed reviews about this particular building, but it was the perfect place for me. After a long day of interacting with people, I just wanted to be alone to vegetate. My room, and everything I saw on the way to my room, appeared to be freshly updated. No musty smell which can be so common in older hotels. The room, not huge, was nicely appointed. I loved that my room had a mini fridge and a microwave. No lanai, but I had an amazing view of the Ala Moana beach park and the two yacht clubs. The hotel is centrally situated which made travel to various parts of the area a breeze. The fact that it's a "sky bridge" away from the Ala Moana shopping center might make a shopper's heart skip a beat. I did not avail myself of the on-property restaurants but did buy a number of food items at the hotel's sundry store. The only downside, to my way of thinking, was the parking situation. The hotel offered both self and valet parking. Unfortunately, the hotel was packed the weekend during my stay. Valet parking was sold out. Self parking, when returning after 5pm, was a nightmare. Being very familiar with the high cost of hotel rooms in the Honolulu/Waikiki areas, this hotel offered a lovely room at a very fair price.
user_name:
Nancy Z
Captain Cook, Hawaii, United States

review_body: This hotel is well placed for shopping as it links with Ala Moana Shopping Centre and being across the road from a park and safe swimming area.The addition of Starbucks in the lobby and well stocked shops is a plus. Waikiki Tower rooms are the better ones, with lanais, and our view of the mountain area suited us with its morning sun and views of the Friday fireworks. Our room had a small kitchen, and the two fridges in the apartment was helpful.The pool area was clean and pool attendants friendly. The gym had good equipment and both a wet and dry sauna. The hotel is just out of the Waikiki area but close enough to walk to. We find this is our go to hotel in Oahu.

Via Hotels.com, I was able to secure a room facing Waikiki Tower and it was fantastic. Ala Moana Hotel is centrally located to get to the sights and sounds of Honolulu. It has one of the best and safest nightclubs (on site) that is popular with many: Club Rumors. For shoppers, the Ala Moana Shopping Center is right there. Parking is plentiful during the day At night, it can be problematic.

Usually stay there for its location so convenient to restaurants, shopping and other local attractions. Really love that the hotel is connected by a walkway to the mall. It even has a pretty decent Chinese restaurant on the third floor- for those mornings you are too lazy to drive to Chinatown for dim sum. Rooms, though not consistent in size or floor plan, they are clean and modern. The few negatives are: 1) long check in lines (lots of flight crews and locals)2) loud intoxicated people on Friday and Saturday nights (Rumors night club in lobby)3) loud cars and people if you are unfortunate to get a room above the mall parking lot. Loud enough to be woken up after the bars close and the party continues on outside. 4) horrific nightmare underground parking that appears to have been placed as an after thought. It's difficult for even a compact car to maneuver into a stall. Valet parking is almost a must, but sometimes actually sold out

I was there last year 2015. It was a family oriented hotel. It was a convenient location because it is close places I like. The Ala Moana Shopping Center is across the parking lot. You see Macy when you come out of the back of the hotel that links you to the Center. Through Macy's you can get to the other shops in the Center. Walmart is located right outside of the old Nordstrom location. A few blocks down is Don Quijote Supermarket on Kaheka Street. It is a very popular market for one stop shopping for locals and tourists. They have all kinds of macadamia nuts, Hawaiian cookies and candies, souvenirs (gift bags, key chains, magnets, etc.), clothes (hats, dresses, shirts, T-shirts, etc.), food (poke, musubi, fish, fruits & vegetables, general grocery). It is a fun store to visit. The Ward Center is also close by. Ross is across from Walmart. I love the location. You can eat at the food courts at the Ala Moana Shopping Center or the restaurants there. I love the location.

Ala Moana Hotel has a great hotel in an outstanding location for the shoppers and especially those who enjoy the abundant variety of local eateries. Staff have always been friendly and helpful.The one drawback has been the lack of parking and it's haphazard management of underground parking lot especially if you came back late in the evening. Surprisingly on my latest trip the parking situation has greatly improved. Spaces are still tight but new parking management has made iit workable enough that I no longer return with dread. Good job addressing a big score point!!!

Horrible do not book thru LSI or Expedia. Could not get room cleaned....had to pay them to pick up garbage. Bums hang out right outside lobby. Would never stay here again. Spent thousands of dollars and did hardly anything. Very disappointed with Hawaii. Will go to Mexico next vacation.

I was very torn between giving this hotel a 4 or a 3 based purely on value for money, however I felt that a 3 would be unfair given that there was nothing bad about our stay or the hotel itself.We stayed one night at the Ala Moana Hotel on a stopover in Honolulu. The hotel was nice, in a good location (right beside Ala Moana shopping centre and across the road from the park and beach) and we got a great night sleep- but I did not find this to be good value for money.In our two weeks in Hawaii this was the most expensive hotel that we stayed in yet this was a standard room, our room was very small, breakfast was not included, there was no airport shuttle, there was no view and we were a 10 minute bus ride from the centre of Waikiki.We had a good stay, our room was nice and clean and the staff were reasonably friendly- I was really disappointed in the value for money though, especially given the extremely high price of the room.

This was our first stay at this hotel and we were only here for 2 nights. My husband was here on business and I tagged along. Every staff member we encountered was very friendly and accommodating. While my husband was working I ate breakfast solo at the Plantation Cafe. They had a nice hot and cold selection. Loved all the fresh fruit! A special shout out to my server Debbie! She was awesome! It was nice being connected to the Ala Moana shopping center and their very large food court. We will definitely stay here again on his future business trips since he gets to choose which hotel he stays at.

Fantastic high rise hotel, 36 stories tall, with direct access to the famous Ala Moana Shopping Centre. I decided to spend my last night in Honolulu at this hotel as it was closer to the airport and convenient for last minute shopping at the centre. At check-in, I was given a room on a higher level. Key worked fine but uh oh, the room looked to be occupied or had not been made up. Back in the elevator and down to Reception. A key to another room. Back up in the elevator, and...you guessed it, this room, too, had not been made up. Another trip back down to the Front Desk to a very embarrassed staff member who apologised profusely and offered me a suite on the 34th floor. And WOW! Was I glad the previous rooms had not been ready. Suite 3407 was absolutely gorgeous, not to mention spotless! A separate bedroom, lounge, dining and kitchenette area. Dishwasher, microwave, the lot! An extremely spacious suite with a balcony off the bedroom and large sliding doors in the lounge/dining area with the most spectacular views of the ocean and Honolulu skyline. "Stuff happens" and every cloud can have a silver lining, it just depends on who you get on the Front Desk. Thanks again for the free upgrade Ala Moana Hotel. I will definitely be staying with you again. Oh, there's a Starbucks on site at the Lobby level and The Signature Restaurant and Bar with live music and happy hour daily on Level 36!

We wanted to be close to the Mall and we were, but the rooms are so small we felt claustrophobic and had to stay out as much as possible. Otherwise the place was fine with clean bathroom, quiet hallways and no surprises. If you need to be close to the Mall and Convention Center, this is the place but be sure and check the room size before you book. This is also more of a business traveler hotel so you might want to leave the kids at home.

Staff were very friendly & helpful.... Free fast wi-fi in room. Room was very comfortable with ocean view, loved walkway to shopping mall. Starbucks in the lobby was a great idea ☕️ Plus the also have a store for last minute needs. Would definitely stay here again 10/10.

This is the hotel to stay in for Honolulu. Close to shopping, food, and tourist sites but not a resort hotel. Ala Moana shopping centre was wonderful for all price ranges and the Shirokiya Japan Village Walk had more food than you can dream about! Staff was friendly and efficient. Room had excellent city view and comfortable beds. Will definitely stay there again next time.

Big Hotel. Rooms are big, comfortable, clean and quite. Staff is efficient and friendly. Very good breakfast and Located very close to the main shopping mall. Has a very good tourism agency in the lobby where you can book all kind of tours in the island.I recommend to stay at this hotel for business or vacation.

The room was quite small with a comfortable bed, reading lamps and a desk. Bathroom was cramped with a shower over bath. A coffee maker was in the room but no coffee supplied, only tea bags and sugar. The room was clean and tidy. There was a well stocked shop in the hotel and the staff there were very friendly and obliging. The restaurant offered two paid options for breakfast with a reasonable selection of food for each. There was also a fast food outlet off to one side of the lobby The staff here were also friendly and obliging. The hotel was a $40 taxi ride from the airport. It was a good location with direct entry into the Ala Moana Centre, a seven minute walk to the bus stop for buses 20 and 42 that took you to Pearl Harbour, a block away from a park and local beach. We were in this hotel for two nights only and flagged away the walk to Waikiki Beach. The reception staff were friendly and efficient and the concierge was really helpful. The wifi was free and it worked well. I would be happy to stay here again if it was for a few nights only but would find the room too small for a lengthy stay.

Was here for work for 10 days and can't find much to complain about. The rooms are nice and clean, however a bit tight. All amenities as described. Very easy to walk to adjacent mall with lots to do and eat. Front desk very friendly and helpful. However, this is not your typical resort hotel like those that are beach front. More of a city type hotel that is located within a resort city. Parking is easy and secured. Of course it sucks that you have to pay $18 bucks for parking nightly but it's standard practice around the city.

We arrived at the hotel & were going to reserve via hotel tonight app. The desk clerk told us there were only suites available...triple the rate. I asked if we booked thru the app & reserved a room with said rate, what we would get. We told us to try to book, which we did...paid $191...only to be told all their standard rooms were dirty (it's 1am) and we would have to come back at 3pm. We asked for the manager & she was the manager. We now have an unneeded reservation. Hotel manager was not accommodating & spoke broken english. The hotel's exterior is much nicer than interior. Furnishings are dated. This is certainly not the usual welcoming Hawaiian experience.
user_name:
Heather B
Myrtle Beach, South Carolina

review_body: The Ala Moana Hotel is always a very good choice. The staff is consistently pleasant and welcoming. Each interaction is easy and wholesome. The hotel is centrally located and attached to an awesome shopping mall. There are many food choices for all budgets and a full service Starbucks in the lobby. You can go to the beach across the street at the Ala Moana park. It's always my first choice when going to Honolulu and it's always a good choice.

Booked this room through Trip Advisor. It was not booked directly with the hotel but with LSI Resorts at Ala Moana. The room was a junior suite - 3315 - and it was lovely. It is important to know that no maid service comes with the room rate, but it can be arranged for an additional cost. The room had an ocean view and was very comfortable, clean, and had everything one would want. The only issue was that the internet would not stay up or hook up to the room - could access internet via other rooms. Not really a big issue. All in all it was an excellent stay and LSI Resorts is a great company to book through, everyone I spoke to was professional and helpful.

This hotel is top-notch as far as service, looks, and amenities are concerned. Park by valet. You can do it yourself, but you won't save much money and it is not worth it. It is convenient to Waikiki and Pearl Harbor is not a bad drive from there - or you can catch a bus or taxi. Starbucks inside.

We came to Hawaii for a conference, which I wasn't attending, and only chose this hotel for its location to the convention center. The hotel is right next to the Ala Moana mall which is great for avid shoppers. I spent my days around Waiki area- Diamond Head Park, Zoo, Bike tours etc it was tedious but convenient with the shuttle bus that leaves from the Mall. If I were coming back for a vacation only, I'd chose a hotel closer to Waiki. Check in and check out was painfully slow, the hotel itself was alright, rooms contained everything we needed and the beds were comfortable. View of the Mall carpark wasn't appealing but typically don't look out the window much. The fridge was so loud I had to unplug it on the first night which I tried, and failed, to communicate this to housekeeping. Internet was fast, and free. Pool area was plain, needs some decorating. Breakfast was mostly the same everyday, it was fine but nothing to rave about. All in all our stay was pleasant and we had a good time, this is not an impressive hotel but does the job.

From the moment we stepped into the Hotel, we felt special. Our room had all the ammenities we needed, microwave, refrigerator, coffee maker and coffee, lotions and shampoo! This was a pleasure and medical trip. Close enough to walk to the beach, shops, restaurants, nightlife and the Dr's office!!!  The staff here are always pleasant and helpful. The hotel common areas as well as the rooms are impeccably clean.

I have stayed at this hotel several times while on the island for work, and its never been my favorite... HOWEVER... I really feel that they are making an effort to update and improve the property. I stayed here 2 times in July and both times were in an updated room that was fresh, comfortable and clean. I believe they recently got bought by another chain (but I'm not sure if this is true) and it seems they are really trying to improve the property. I will say this though, the hotel staff always gives you a nice "aloha welcome and the Aloha spirit" The hotel is also in a prime location... you are connected to the mall if you would like to do some shopping, and an easy walk to the beach and also to the excitement of Waikiki!

This hotel is located steps away from the mall and a few blocks from Waikiki Beach and eateries. Public buses pass in every direction for quick rides to local tourist attractions. I spent one day at the beach and the next day I rode the bus to Diamond Head state park for a day of hiking! I had a great time.

We spent nine days at the Ala Moana for a conference and a few days afterward for vacation. The hotel is good, rooms are clean, and staff is helpful and friendly. My only complaint is that you have to pay for things that in other hotels are complimentary, e.g. business center. You have to pay for the time in the computer which doesn't load quickly so time/money ticks away before you can even start working.

This property was not a 4 star hotel but we enjoyed our week long stay there. It was moderately priced and very convenient especially to the Ala Moana Mall which is accessible by a walkway bridge from the second floor. Parking underground was a bit tough which we did the first night but the valet parking was great for $5 more than self parking. The valet guys were friendly and quick in getting our car out whenever we needed it. They definitely earned and deserved the tips. The only drawback was that we were in a handicapped room for some reason and the opening the door was a pain (noisy and hard to use unless you pushed the handicapped button to activate). And the portable shower head leaked when you took a bath (guess we could have complained about that, but oh well).We had a view of the pool area so not much to look at but the room itself was spacious and fairly quiet from the outside noise. It was actually noisier from the hallway and neighboring rooms since we were close to the elevator. Didn't affect our sleeping though.Can't comment about the restaurants or nightclub as we didn't go there but having a Starbucks downstairs was nice although they closed early at 7pm and had a limited selection of breakfast sandwiches in the morning since they were busy in the early am. But the room had a coffee maker, refrigerator and microwave and that was great.It was easy to drive to the airport and around town from there too. We were there for a wedding outside of the hotel and we had no issues getting around the city from the hotel. It was much better than the very crowded and more expensive properties in Waikiki we stayed at previously. We drove into Waikiki one night and it took forever to drive through, let alone find somewhere to park (finally gave up after going in circles for 20 minutes and paid $15 for a public lot). There was a trolley stop across the street but we didn't use that option. There was places to eat that you could walk to and of course the mall across the street also had a lot of options.

Staying here for business while working in either Honolulu or Waikiki is great. I come to Honolulu several times each year and like to stay at this hotel for the convenience, cleanliness and it's close to everything. Super clean, and there is a Starbucks in the lobby and it is next to Ala Moana shopping center. Plus it's easy to get to the airport quickly

Room 946The rooms are updated but ours were terribly noisy. Sirens and construction noise around the clock. The room was tiny. The maids would just rinse out mugs and glasses instead of giving us new ones. There aren't very many decent places to eat neat here unless you enjoy chain restaurants. They make you check out towels and threaten to charge you $20 if they aren't returned by 6. The pool keeps silly hours. Open late and close early. The Chinese restaurant and the bar/cluba Rumors are dirty and old and haven't been updated since the 70's. The closest beachest are crappy and gross. The hotel has a ridiculous policy of charging an extra $50 ler additional person staying in the room. The people at the bell desk were terribly unhelpful and lazy. Lastly, they treat the military people staying here terribly. They design policies to rip them off and price gouge them at every turn. This hotel has no redeeming qualities and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone!

Stayed at this wonderful hotel again after 1 year. I seems they had spruced up the rooms with new carpet and curtains, bedcovers etc. There is now even a Starbucks in the lobby! The rooms are spacious and I would recommend that you stay in the Waikiki Tower and do take a room with a partial or full sea view! As usual, the location of the hotel is easy to get to especially if driving in Honolulu for the first time and parking is a breeze. Service levels are good in the hotel and the Chinese restaurant serves very decent food at reasonable prices. If you want to be away from the crowds in Waikiki but yet close enough to get to, then stay here. The Mall next door has all the major shops and department stores!

Our room was in the back tower but we still had a nice view of the harbour and ocean especially during 4th of July to watch the fireworks right outside our window! The Starbucks and the shop next to reception was very handy. The hotel is situated very near a Waikiki Trolley stop which was really useful for us as this is how we travelled about the city. The Ala Moana shopping centre next door was also good for food and shopping when we wanted.

Ala Moana hotel is located very close to the Ala Moana shipping area which is great for all shopping enthusiasts like my wife. If you have a car you can park during the day in the huge Ala Moana parking garage just outside the hotel which is very convenient.We found our mountain view room to be of ok standard and quality, however I prefer the shower to have a shower handle instead of or in addition to the faucet. One of the TVs wasn’t configured when we arrived but got fixed the day after notifying the hotel staff.The hotel pool doesn’t have a bar and there is a note on the wall stating that you can’t bring any outside food or beverages, this was a disappointment.The hotel has a Starbucks which is located downstairs and that’s good.The hotel breakfast selection was very limited and you got tired of it very quickly.I have a 3-year-old son who is very active and we always check the hotel room for anything that could be of danger to him. One day the cleaners left a bottle of detergent in our room that my son got a hold of and sprayed all over his face and in his mouth. We had to take an ambulance to the hospital and have him checked out. During that time, I didn’t feel that the hotel tried to make up for that it was their fault the bottle got left in the room. And after returning back to the hotel we didn’t hear anything from the hotel, no reimbursement of impending or possible future damages to my son nor a phone call or visit from the manager.We will not be staying at this hotel in the future and if you care about the safety of your child I recommend that you stay away from Ala Moana hotel as well.

Stayed here in 2013 and now 2016. This time was 12 nights.My 12th vacation in Hawaii since 1988.Stayed in the base base room type in Kona tower it was almost $300AUD per night with no balcony and very very small room.If you can cough up the extra dough then stay in Waikiki tower bc the rooms are much bigger and you get a balcony.P R O ' S:Air con in room was quiet powerful responsive and appeared brand new.Room storage was very good plenty of drawer space.Furniture was attractive and seemed new good qualityGood size flat screen TVMattress firm and very very comfortable.jMaid service was good very friendly and accommodatingPool fantastic one of the best on the island large salt water and 9ft deepPool deck was massive plenty of space and banana lounges. Pool staff verycourteous and friendly.Really nice big new bedside tablesRoom lighting pretty good just the bathroom could be a bit brighter over mirrorExcellently equipped GymOverall the room seemed fresh and newBeautiful tiles on the floor in entrance and bathroomVery fast and responsive liftsReasonable walking distance to every thing. But to get to the main drag you need the bus.Take the pink shuttle its more reliable than the bus and its the same price and it runs way more often. You can buy the ticket on board. Its double decker and open roof so a real fun and pleasurable way to get around.Fantastic little fridge and microwave they both worked like a dream and seemed quite new.Magnificent and deep bath spoil yourself have a bath. I am 6ft 4inch and it accommodated me quite easily.C O N ' SPillows were horrible lumpy and could not sleep had to go kmart and buy a $5 pillow which was a dream. Why cant the hotel source nice pillows ????Shower water flow was pathetic very hard to get wet. But out of the tap it flooded out like a torrent.Room I had was very very small, ok for 1 person impossible for more.Very loud slamming doors on rooms became very annoying when you are trying to sleep. Sound proofing btw room not good could hear ppl sneezing and coughing.No cordless phone which was crazy having to sit at desk to talk.Heavy construction taking place next door started at 7am and was disturbing.Some staff on the front desk could be a bit friendlier I guess bc the hotel has 1100 rooms it loses some of its warmth.This hotel is used for flight attendants and they were every where every day and they are loud and obnoxious. In the lobby at the pool. Luckily it was in very small doses.You will most likely never get an early check in so if you arrive at 7am like me expect to wait 7 hours for your room. Awake 32 hours straight so guess what I was totaled. Zero sympathy from front desk. Was told to next time pre book an extra night before.

"You go to the beach, go in the water, put your wallet in the sneaker. Who's gonna know? What criminal mind could penetrate this fortress of security?"Close to Waikiki, but not IN it... check. Close to lots of shopping and restaurants... check. Walk to the beach... check. Steakhouse and Starbucks in the hotel... check. Spectacular views & sunsets... check. Staff and grounds excellent... check.Room was a bit small, but hey, it was clean and comfortable - with all the other plus pieces, I'll take it and still give it 4 stars. Too much I like about this hotel and the staff are really top notch, from parking valets, to bell staff, reception, and housekeeping... all really friendly and helpful. Conference and meeting rooms were well kept and had updated equipment. Step from the hotel to Beachwalk, Ala Moana Shopping Center, Kapiolani Blvd., trolleys to Waikiki, 15 minutes to Airport or Diamond Head, 25 minutes to Arizona Memorial or Hanauma Bay... even see the fireworks from the Hilton. Yeah central location is this spots middle name.There are condos for rent for longer stays (vrbo.com) or look for package deals for main hotel stays.

I used to come to this hotel every year and I am an owner to one of the unit.I have been here for about 3 weeks and I am sick and tired of homeless coming to our lobby using bathrooms and stealing from the lobby stores.I complained to the hotel and home owners association .Today I went to the bathroom 's lobby and I got harassed by homeless that was inside one of the bathroom , when he came out start charging against me requesting money, he was high on drugs, i ran out and he did the same.Hotels claims that the lobby bathrooms are public bathrooms and they have only two security guards.Shame on the hotel management George

The Ala Moana hotel is a fine hotel. We stayed in the shorter of the towers and had a marina view from the 9th floor, actually very pretty. There is a Starbucks in the lobby as well as a small store. Both were very convenient. As others have said the rooms are very small but you're in Hawaii, get out of the room! There is a trolly that will get you most places that you can catch 2 blocks away at the mall. You can walk to Waikiki as well. It's probably about one mile. It is close to a nice beach park and the Ala Moana Mall. If you like shopping go there. It has every store. if you are looking for the Hawaii resort beach experience this might not be the hotel for you, but if you want a nice hotel for a decent price then book this one.

The rooms are a little bit cramped with somewhat dated furnishings, however they are very clean. The bathroom was a little crowded as well. The little mini refrigerator was definitely nice to have! Staff and service was perfect and having the Starbucks in the lobby is a bonus. But what is really great about this hotel is that it is across the street from the Ala Moana Beach Park. And there is even an attached walk way/garage to the Ala Moana mall which is a huge outdoor mall with shopping for all classes. Definitely hit the mall for restaurants and go to Mai Tai if you need an outdoor bar with live music. Otherwise you're kind of a hike from downtown Waikiki. Google Don Quixote if you want to get some local and fairly good Asian street food. The shop itself is a mix between a Walmart and a local market and a GREAT place to pick up your requisite Hawaii gifts for the poor ones you left behind at home ;)

My room was really small, but it's Hawaii so I didn't spend much time inside. Everything was very clean and well stocked. The staff was nice.It was nice having a restaurant downstairs and some little shops to get gifts or a snack. The pool was nice, but closed at sundown, which was 7 o'clock. Most hotels I've been to leave their pool open and turn on some lights so people can swim later at night. I was there for a work conference and didn't get back to the hotel until 9 every evening. That made the pool useless for me.There are two towers to the hotel. My tower didn't connect to the third floor with the pool/workout room. So I had to go down to the lobby on one set of elevators and up on another set. Kinda inconvenient. You also need to insert your room key to make the elevator work. It's a security thing, which was nice, but it was a little bit of a hassle to get everyone on the elevator to insert their key and press their floor.They have a Business Center, but you have to pay to use it. I didn't bring my laptop because I saw they had a Business center. But it charges by the minute so I just used my cell phone to check email instead. My mattress was also really hard, and I normally like firm mattresses.The hotel does have a decent location. Close to the mall and Ala Moana beach.

This hotel is ok if you want to visit a large mall. Waikiki is not that close and too far for kids to walk if you bring them. Other attractions will require transportation. The highlight of the hotel is that there is a Starbucks in the lobby.This is a very crowded hotel and the number of working elevators is not enough. Plan for extra time to go up and down the elevator. The pool is not very big but acceptable. The gym is not very big but better than most hotels. The wifi is VERY slow.The only place to do any business is in the Starbucks area if you can get a table. There is a small desk in the rooms that takes up half the small desk and their is NO chair. This hotel has put a small two foot box with leather on it and call it a chair. Pretty funny! This hotel is fine for vacation but do not try to complete any business here.

Nice hotel that is across the street from the mall and other attractions. We had a partial ocean view but could still see the ocean and marina. Saw the 4th of July fireworks from our room over the ocean and it was spectacular ! The staff was very helpful and the transportation was easy. We just had to walk a block or two to catch the trolley which took us where we needed or wanted to go. The hotel room was kind of small for my taste but it was tolerable . Overall I would recommend this place.

Recently stayed at the Ala Moana Hotel and I'm pleasantly surprised! This is a very popular hotel for Locals, Visitors as well as airline service industry guests (pilots and flight attendants). Located right next to our Famous Ala Moana Shopping Center, this is very convenient to shopping and close to Ala Moana Beach Park. There's a Starbucks right in the lobby which is a great place to relax and start off the day. Pro's:-Self Parking is available at 20$/day for guests-Valet Parking also available-Fine Dining Restaurant with Fabulous views located in the Hotel, (prime signature steak and seafood)-Cafe also located on property-Walking distance to Ala Moana Shopping Center-Walking distance to Ala Moana Beach Park-Located at the entrance to Waikiki-Recently renovated rooms that are comfortable and have amenities of refrigerator, safe, microwave, complimentary coffee in room.There are 2 towers in the hotel. -Hotel is also good to host meetings and banquets, and parties-Nightclub in the lobby (Rumours) that hosts private parties and is usually pretty busy on Friday/Saturday nights. CONs: -For visitors that want the experience of shopping/walking in waikiki, the walk to Waikiki is about 10 minutes from the hotel, or drive or UBER there.-At various times during the day the check in process might be slow if there's a lot of tour groups or airline personnel checking in. -This is NOT a 5 Star hotel but I think its a good value and pretty solid accommodations. As a local from Hawaii, I think this hotel is a lot better than it used to be and with the recent renovation i'm more inclined to stay here. TIP: The Signature Steak restaurant on the Top of the Hotel has an Excellent Happy Hour, check it out!

Sure it is not in the centre of Waikiki, but this hotel is perfectly located if you are attending a conference at the Honolulu Convention Centre, it is literally just a few minutes walk down the street. Easy to duck out of boring sessions for a quick spot of shopping in the huge Ala Moana Centre on the other side of this hotel! The lovely Ala Moana park and shorefront is also very close - a much more local-flavoured beach, great for people-watching, not very touristy. Waikiki Beach per se is just a 15 minute bus ride away (walk across the road to Ala Moana Blvd, catch Bus #19, 20, 42, there's a bus every 10 minutes, only $2.50 each way). This makes for a perfect base to combine business and leisure (great for partners and companions of folks attending conferences in the convention centre).The hotel itself is fairly standard for business hotels in the western world - good, strong free wifi, enough space to unpack, a big comfy bed, decent bathroom with lots of towels and basic toiletries (bring your own, it's the usual all-in-one conditioning shampoo again, yuk!), a microwave, bar fridge and filter coffee maker - but no kettle to boil water for a cup of tea (friends of ours went to walmart and bought their own!), no cutlery to stir your coffee or tea with and be warned, the cups are not really microwave-proof. The staff are all friendly and efficient (especially the cleaning staff, nothing is too hard for them, always smiling and accommodating). What impressed me most with this hotel though was its gym facilities, wow, this beats all other hotels I have ever been to. Excellent, well-maintained good quality equipment, weights, and enough treadmills, x-country trainers, stationary bikes etc, you never have to wait for your turn. Lots of room to do your own stuff too, including a separate space for floor exercises, complete with mats and fitballs. It's open from 5:00am to midnight too so one can fit in a workout anytime. We had a breakfast in the Plantation Cafe several times, at $16.50 per person, it is OK if you have a big appetite and can justifiably consume all the available food, but if you only need coffee and pastry, yoghurt and a bit of fruit to start your day, it is better value to just get some from nearby walmart or don quijote and keep these in your room fridge. The Signature Restaurant upstairs though is great for happy hour treats, really good value drinks and tapas and an excellent bartender to boot. Overall, I would stay in this hotel again, if I need to attend something in the Convention Centre (and someone else is paying for it!) or for an overnight stopover, longer stays will need a rethink.

My room was a very welcome site after this weary traveler walked in. The grounds, lobby and hallways were immaculate and inviting. Colors, decor, open flow to the design and the location of the rooms to accommodate the views of the location.The hotel gave me a "handicap" room, which was fine with me, so the photos will show some features most rooms will not have.I had a fridge, microwave, coffee maker, iron and board, safe, tv and free internet.Plenty of parking as the hotel is attached to a shared parking structure with the Ala Moana mall.
user_name:
annett j
Salt Lake City, Utah

review_body: I spent two weeks staying on this property for a conference at the convention center down the road so I got to know the place inside and out! This was a business trip, but I did bring my toddler, husband and mother (to watch the toddler) and so my thoughts about the hotel encompass both views - business and family. This isn't a family oriented hotel, but we made it work and the staff was incredibly helpful! I will say that the hotel rooms, no matter which you reserve, are incredibly small so if you have a lot of stuff or more than 2 people, be prepared to squeeze. Since we were staying such a long time, we were trying to keep costs down as much as possible so all of us shared a room. We started in a room with 2 double beds and ended up switching to a room with a king bed and pull out bed to accommodate us better. The front desk staff was AWESOME when it came to us making that change. If you can get an ocean or partial ocean view room, do it! If you are on the opposite side, you are currently going to get a construction site view room and a view of other buildings. Also, over the course of our 2 week stay, we utilized the valet service constantly and they did such a great job and were so friendly to us!!! PROS:Great staff - again, we stayed for 2 weeks so we had multiple interactions with housekeeping, front desk, bell service desk and valet team and they all were great!Clean hotelStarbucks in lobbyConvenience store on-siteClose to convention centerRooms include mini-fridge and microwaveCONS:Hotel restaurants - the Plantation Cafe is only open for breakfast and really not that great. There are 2 others, 1 is a dinner only, high end steak house and 1 is a lunch/dinner Chinese restaurant. If you need quick and convenient because you have limited time or you have little ones, you will definitely want to plan ahead as it is difficult to get something quick to eatSmall RoomsPool and pool area is pretty basic

I stayed at Ala Moana for two weeks yes two weeks...just loved the cleanliness, convenient to shopping, beach, must say great amenities. Let's not forget the great staff, I want to thank Wyllie we call her and Jan Williams for being so terrific, I was so pleased I had paid for my niece and family a room for 5 days as I wanted them to experience what we did.. We were in room 3415 my niece 3104 and my sister 1115 Spectacular views I'm actually trying to get a room 3 weeks from now, by me writing such great reviews, I hope they have room for me lolSince yall probably book it lol Anyway, BIG BIG KUDOS TO WYLLIE, JAN WILLIAMS FOR GOING ABOVE AND BEYOND OUR EXPECTATIONS.The staff up front check in was great as well Always reminds me of home with that Aloha Smile Living in Colorado Thank you again

Conveniently located, the Ala Moana Hotel is just off the beach path; about a five-minute walk to the beach and many restaurants and beach bars. We always had a very clean room, and a very friendly staff to work. Our ocean view room was not really much of a view, considering we saw the ocean through two large towers. Consider the city view for a much better price.

For the relatively low price low you can get here, you sure get a lot! Very roomy area with a mini refrigerator, big bathroom, nice-size balcony, even a small couch. Wifi worked great. The pool area is huge and clean. Good location with Ala Moana beach and park right across the street, the mall and foodcourt is right there in the parking lot. If you don't have a car, there are plenty of bus stops close by going in all directions (The Bus costs $2.50 per ride or a 4-day pass is $35).

If you like to spend your vacation shopping, then this is the hotel for you. Located right next to the largest mall in Hawaii, you'll find a variety of shops and restaurants to choose from. The hotel is just a short walk to Ala Moana Beach Park with Its white sand beach, jogging/walking paths, and picnic areas. It's a favorite among the local folks. If you prefer, it's a 30-minute walk to the heart of Waikiki.

Hotel rooms are beautiful and well made. The free wifi works perfectly. The reception personnel are very friendly. You can access any where from this location in a jiffy! The sky bridge to the adjacent shopping centre is lovely and very apt.

I stayed here years ago with my parents and really loved it. But it wasn't as amazing as I remembered on the inside. However, excellent location, near the outdoor shopping mall and across from a very safe and beautiful beach and park. We also discovered Don Quixote, a supreme grocery store where we could get the local favorites made fresh, like Ahi Poki, for an incredible affordable price!

It's a good hotel with clean rooms and friendly staff. Starbucks in the lobby certainly helps too.Close to the mall and a short stroll to Waikiki beach it provides access to all amenities.The hotel offers numerous tours from visiting Pearl Harbour to swimming with dolphins and sunset cruises.

I had a 36 hour stopover en route to LA and while I usually like to stay in Waikiki I know how close this hotel is to the shopping centre. The hotel itself is large and a little dated, but the location if you want to shop is perfect. It is a 30 second walk to Macy's and your room key even offers you a store discount there. I was given an "upgrade" on check-in and found that my room had a lovely balcony overlooking the Ala Moana Shopping Centre car park lol. The pool area is somewhat of an oasis in a busy area of town, but offers no food or beverage service. The highlight of my stay was the amazing happy hour at the Signature Lounge on the 36th floor. Fantastic view, fantastic bar food at half price and fantastic bar service at discounts.

The rooms are small, one coffee packet, no room service, no lunch available, no food or drinks at the pool. The Signature Bar is good, so far that's the only redeeming quality. On the plus side, I needed a bottle opener and they provided one.

In town on business. Hotel was clean, comfortable and had generally good amenities. The fitness center in particular was very well stocked, they had LifeFitness Cardio gear that my gym has at home. If you forget anything, there is a massive mall next door that you could get just about anything including any souvenir you could want. The Ala Moana park is a short distance away, and it appeared to have a nice beach. The pool was on the small side though. Service was friendly and helpful. Would stay here agin.

Within close vicinity to everything. Hotel staff extremely accommodating, they really make the hotel stand out. Clean and conveniently located - 15 min walk to Waikiki, 2 min walk to Ala Moana Beach Park, connected to the Ala Moana Centre, Starbucks in the lobby, convenience store also located within the hotel as well as three restaurants. Loved our stay here and will definitely return.

Very beautiful hotel but my Oceanview room was smaller than expected. My other co-workers had rooms in the other tower that were bigger and nicer views. The mall is practically attached to the hotel which was super convenient. And the Starbucks in the lobby was great.

I had to book and pay for a hotel room for three days for a business client travelling to Honolulu. Got a very good price on the internet. It was the best deal among comparable hotels. Ala Moana hotel is adjacent to the Ala Moana Shopping Center so that client had much to do during her spare time. She also liked to do a morning run and the Ala Moana Beach Park was very close by. She was able to get an upgrade at no extra charge and was very satisfied with her room. The hotel looked very clean and inviting. Guests needed to use their hotel keys to take the elevators to upper floors.We were there with a large conference an the six elevators were packed. Had to wait a short while to get an elevator. Probably it would not have been as crowded on an off-peak hour.

I always look forward to coming back! Good location. Nearby mall. Food court in the mall and many more restaurants on nearby streets. Only a few block to Waikiki by foot and a crosswalk away from the Ala Moana Beach Park.Costly at times during peak travel periods, but well worth it! Enjoy!

Have been to Honolunu for business trip of two weeks. Hotels rooms are very neat and clean they they are small as compared to other hotels I had visited. but good enough for one person. View from the balcony is very nice where you can see mountains and rainbows.Other side of the hotel has a very beautiful view of the ocean but of course it comes with a price.Hotel is well connected to both airports / business areas and tourist locations. Ala moana beach part is just 2 minutes walk from the hotel. Waikiki beach is about 20 minutes walk. This place has a connectivity through city bus as well. The main attraction is Ala Moana shopping complex; a huge one which is connected to the hotel building. Other stores like Walmart, Ross, Don Quoete are at walking distance as well. The hotel building itself has couple of good stores for souvenirs and daily needs.Fitness centre and swimming pool facilities are quite decent.The tour desk guys in hotel lobby are very co-operative and can plan a good sight seeing and island tour for you.Only thing the need to improve is at front desk.These guys are very slow.However, overall a very a pleasant experience to be in Ala moana Hotel and I would definitely recommend this place to everyone.

Ala Moana Hotel is just the perfect place to be when you just want to shop till you drop in Honolulu, Hawaii.With all great WiFi, well spaces rooms, easy access to nearby restaurants and also 5mins walk to the beach.This hotel as it all, however you will have to be patient when checking in as there will be a long que but you will be well served under 5mins before you know.
user_location: Port Moresby, National Capital, Papua New Guinea
user_name:
Joel K
Port Moresby, National Capital, Papua New Guinea

review_body: I was there for a conference, then added on three more days. It was super-quiet and a clean, comfortable room. I had a room with a partial ocean view and I could've sat on that balcony and looked at the ocean for hours. In fact, I did! I was on the 31st floor, so I didn't hear much street noise. Staff was helpful when I had questions.

Look at VRBO and you can find it. This was a wonderful place to stay. First of all, Holly is a gem. She communicates so well, so often, and you feel so taken care of. Her unit has just about everything you can imagine . I have stayed at other units at this property, but never again. Holly's place is the best. I almost hate to review it this well because it might make it more difficult to book! She stays in contact, refunds your deposit immediately. I am serious, you can't think of anything else besides your clothes and make-up that you would need. Even face cleanser is there. Laundry detergent, dish detergent, feminine hygiene, brushes, combs, shampoo, conditioners, bath scrubbies, salt, pepper, other condiments, all dishes and silverware, soaps, tons of towels, you think of it, it is there. I've never seen anything like it. She had welcoming chocolates and a note upon arrival. Super clean and totally up to date. Nothing shabby here. So all of you,this is a find. Just don't find it the next time I want to go!

Very disrespectful front desk staff members. Lied to me, and even the bell person noticed the front desk person's lie! Small and very noisy room, dirty towels and dirty bathroom. The new towels still had pubic hairs. The worst hotel I have stayed in Hawaii!

Nice non resort style hotel that's well located to the ALA Moana mall (Which is exceptional ) Clean rooms with 2 large comfy beds. Aircon Ok. Try for an end room that looks over the ocean. Although many rooms have pretty good views. The rooms have simple facilities but clean. Wifi is unsecured . It's all about location to the Ala Moana mall , Walmart and the beach/park. Gym is also pretty good. Pool is small but ok. Good night club under the hotel. Staff are friendly and fairly quick.

This hotel is located adjacent to the Ala Moana shopping centre which is accessible via the level 2 sky bridge. My wife and I were upgraded to a partial Ocean view Room with king bed. We found the bed was comfortable enough and rooms clean. A great location for us as we didnt have to lug our haul of goodies back to Waikiki on the bus. I would recommend if you are planning on doing a lot of shopping at the centre.

The room was quite small and noise from nearby building site during the day otherwise a good location and amenities. Very busy and lots of airline crew use this Hotel.Trolley bus to Waikiki five minutes walk away.Check in and out reasonable and staff polite.

Booked through one of the organizations that rent out condo/hotel rooms at the Ala Moana this time, primarily because there was a room on the 35th floor available. Previous experience has taught me that road noise can be pretty pronounced in this conveniently located hotel adjacent to the "largest outdoor shopping mall" in the US (world?). It is a little bit quieter, this high up, but an outdoor concert nearby kept me waking up until after midnight on a Thursday. It took a couple of days to figure out that an intermittent moaning-like sound I would hear (mostly during the day) were the nearby elevators.The stay was pleasurable, wifi reasonably reliable, but not having room service available, or daily room cleaning was something I needed to get used to. The $130 cleaning fee that gets tagged onto the roommate upon booking, is also a little steep in my opinion. I might just book through the hotel (Outrigger I believe) again next time and beg for a higher floor away from the elevator shafts.

For a 3-star hotel, this place is great. Real cups & glasses in the room, coffee service, microwave & frig. Alo Moana Center has lots of shopping & restaurants. Right on the edge of Waikiki & across from the lovely Ala Moana Beach Park. I highly recommend.

I have been coming here for years and it is still great. It is in a great location very close walking distance across a parking lot to Ala Moana Shopping Center. The staff and room were excellent. I highly recommend staying here.

This review is for a Waikiki Tower King Bedroom. The rooms are okay sized and feature a small lanai with two chairs. Beds are comfortable; my room did feature an oversized armchair in lieu of a couch which was comfortable as well. The air conditioning system worked good and relatively silent. The room is equipped with a fridge (noisy at times), a microwave and a coffee maker. Amenities include daily coffee & tea. Wifi was fast (15 Mbit down/2 Mbit up), free and easy to use. The TV got a good variety of channels. The bathroom was a bit on the small side, but big enough. Water pressure was excellent.The hotel is located to the west of Waikiki, directly adjacent to the Ala Moana Shopping Centre and Hawai'i Concention Centre.. While the Ala Moana Beach park is within walking distance, trips to Waikiki and its beaches require either a car or a short bus/taxi ride. There are a lot of shops and food options near the hotel (both in the massive Ala Moana Centre as well as outside). The lobby has a Starbucks outlet. The Ala Moana Hotel does not charge a resort fee (as many or most of the Waikiki Properties do) and charges only 20 USD/day for self-parking (which is less than many others charge). All in all, this hotel is a smart choice as it is conveniently situated and, compared to other hotels in Honolulu, well-priced. I would return anytime.

We got this hotel as part of a [package deal, so we didn't really know what to expect. We were pleasantly surprised! It is easy to find, it's "downtown," close to Waikiki beach (if yo like a very very crowded beach...we don't), the gentleman that checked us in was very friendly and very knowledgeable (his name is Andrew), the rooms have a microwave (not a great one though) and a small fridge and a coffee pot with all the fixings and ours had a nice view of a beach park (we could watch the surfers) and marina. It was clean, cleaned well every day and well stocked with the necessities. The service staff was very friendly and helpful! It costs $20 per day to park, an expense we hadn't planned on. They are "green friendly."

This property is well maintained and close to the Ala Moana shopping mall. It's a short walk from Ala Moana Park, which is a great place to go for a morning walk. The property, like most of the island has expensive and sometimes crowded parking. It's onsite restaurants are definitely worth skipping. But the Starbucks in the lobby is handy. If you're staying for business, it's not a bad location. But I wouldn't want to stay here as a tourist. There is a fantastic Sushi place behind the hotel. Great food and service. I highly recommend trying it.

We were looking for a nice hotel to stay at before our cruise and found this one online for $140 US. It turned out to be a great hotel and an excellent location. It is next to a large shopping mall that was great for killing a few hours before the cruise left. Rooms were clean and staff was friendly. Had a great breakfast in the restaurant located outside the main entrance. Would definitely stay there again.

Stayed for 1 night only, but was very happy with the hotel in regards to location. Easy check in and out. No long wait lines. Room was pretty clean. I'm a cleaner myself, so I notice minor things that maybe the average traveller would not. Best part of the stay was the ease of getting to Ala Moana shopping center (the reason I chose this particular hotel).

If you're going to the convention center, it's across the street. There is a very nice mall next to the hotel and Starbucks in the lobby. Not many choices for food and drink nearby. Large park with break-water beach also. For a tourist, it is a 25 minute (brisk) walk to Waikiki area, so unless the price is right, it's off the beaten path.

A colleague and I spent four nights here for a conference. We chose it because it was the closest to the convention center - almost right across the street. Aside from that, it's an odd location, right next to the Ala Moana Shopping Center. It was walking distance to Waikiki, but if we were going there on vacation, we'd stay somewhere in Waikiki proper. The room was clean and quiet (on a very high floor), with a view of downtown Honolulu and the mountains and a glimpse of the ocean.

This is more of a convention hotel located more in the downtown area and linked to the shopping centre. Not an ideal hotel to explore the area. Rooms are pleasant but noisy as the soundproofing is not very good and you get lots of noise at night from the street and music late at night. We stayed in a Junior Suite rented through an agent but operated by the hotel. The design and layout is a bit convoluted but comfortable with all the necessary amenities. Price is reasonable....

I stayed at 841 from Wednesday may 11 to the Friday may 13. The front desk don't greet you with aloha and they don't use guess name when they check you on or when they pow check you in. Even the people In house keeping. When you call them they don't use the guess name when they talk to you. Even the the housemen / runner they don't announce them selves when knocking And they don't even smile when you open the door. The only thing that was good was the maid service they cleaned the room so well that I'm willing to come back to this hotel even though it was not what I expected. My rate for you guys would be 5 out of 10.

Was finally upgraded to the newer tower. Only took 5 visits. You need to get a high floor otherwise the noise can be overwhelming. The addition of the Starbucks was excellent. Another choice for an easy breakfast. Rooms are smallish. Beds are ok. Overall I would say for a shirt business trip it is fine. I would not stay for an extended time.

I have been staying at the Ala Moana hotel for many years now. I visit at least once a month. The staff Andrew and Heidi at the front desk are great, friendly, great smile and professional welcome you to a spacious lobby. The two manager/supervisors Judi and Debbie always take care of our group and always accommodate all of our needs, so appreciated. The lobby has the largest Starbucks in Hawaii and is a great place to sit and relax while waiting for shuttles to excursions or to read the morning paper. They are staffed by hotel employees and I have watched them learn customers names and orders with a huge smile, they are all great but I always look to say good morning to Amanda, Danielle, Mayflower, Sheri and Michelle early in mornings. The rooms are simple, recently renovated with comfy beds, and great views. A small refrigerator and microwave for when you want to enjoy something in the room. Great balconies let you enjoy the sunrise or sunset. The other resorts locally may be directly on the beach but cost so much more with less personal service. There is an a store inside with hot/cold groceries, sandwiches, food, beverages, snacks, gifts...all you could want as well as several non hotel affiliated restaurants. I recommend The Signature steakhouse on the 36th floor, the happy hour has half price food drinks with a view that sets the Ala Moana apart. If you enjoy shopping the hotel is located adjacent to the largest and most high end Mall in Hawaii. Take the 2nd floor bridge into the mall to experience an over sized food court, great shopping and services without walking on the streets. Use your hotel room key for an additional 10% at Macy's. The hotel has all that I mentioned plus a gym, great pool, Rumors night club, business center and all directly across from Ala Moana park for an easy walk to the beach without needing a car.

Really nice lobby. They had a super long line at check in, so we took a drive & came back. Very friendly staff! Beautiful rooms. Parking was a little steep- $20/day. Close enough to walk to shopping or the beach. We'd stay here again for sure!

Nice clean rooms , most of all the location Great! next to Ala Moana shopping center. only prob the valet was full all weekend. we ladies love the valet service so little disappointed in that.the hotel guest were very friendly and helpful

Convenient to Waikiki and shopping without having to deal with Waikiki traffic congestion. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Ala Moana Shopping Center is a 5 minute walk away. Car and hotel package is a great deal.

We booked the hotel for 4 days, not realizing it was for a third party who owned the room as a condo basically renting it out to us for the time frame. I mention this because upon checking in we were told - if you have any issues during your stay, you must call this 800 number so they can take care of it... Turns out we needed to speak to them the minute we got to the room, because they gave us 2 full beds when we were confirmed for a King - but couldn't speak to anyone as their office was closed, and we'd traveled all day so we just wanted to go to bed (which was thankfully really comfy) so we just dealt with it for the stay.The location is in close proximity to pretty much everything we wanted to do - shopping at the mall literally next door, the less popular (and therefore more enjoyable) beach was walking distance and many, many restaurants to choose from - including a Starbucks in the lobby with great service!As for the amenities, there was a decent-sized gym (that we didn't use) and the pool we only ended up going to once - it was really nice but construction downstairs was too loud and therefore prevented an enjoyable time trying to relax.Lastly, the parking was our only real complaint - be prepared to pay $20/day just to leave your car there overnight, yes you can go in and out unlimited throughout the day but I guess I figured you'd only have to pay if you used the valet, but I was wrong...Overall, the pictures on the site are pretty accurate and you should enjoy your stay as long as you're prepared!

Nice clean well appointed room 29th floor in the Waikiki tower. Go high for the view and to get away from the noise of street level. Good breakfast buffet $16.00 and LOTS OF SHOPPING. The hotel adjoins the Ala Moana mall, 350+ stores.

I enjoyed a great stay here. The marketing team was awesome. I was automatically upgraded to an ADA room, which was amazing. It's close to everywhere. The convention centre, bus stops, shopping, supermarkets, etc.Only thing is the room doesn't provide a jug kettle, even though it has a microwave. It would be so much more convenient to have a jug kettle to boil tea with rather than doing it having to heat up the water with a glass. It also doesn't provide cutlery, i.e., fork and spoon or even a plate. It would be very helpful to have these provided, which would not have cost much for the hotel, yet makes such a big difference to your customers. Will definitely come back if I ever go to Hawaii again. Hopefully soon!

As part of the Outrigger chain of hotels, one would expect the Ala Moana Hotel to be expensive and feature-filled. On price, I found it to be quite reasonable. It was so reasonable that I even upgraded from the Kona Tower to the more desirable (for the views) Waikiki Tower for a nominal fee on check-in. As for features, I was not disappointed. My room was quite nice with a city view but I also had partial views of the mountain and ocean as well. There are nice shops in the lobby (including a Starbucks), the Ala Moana mall is next door and there's a fantastic, upscale restaurant on the 36th floor. The only thing that I missed was a fully stocked mini-bar. The staff, from valet to front desk to housekeeping were friendly and efficient. The one thing that may be a challenge for some is the location. It is not close to the Waikiki Beach strip and the neighborhood is a mix of spots frequented by locals, dives and even some adult entertainment. I found the neighborhood colorful and "spicy" but it may not be to everyone's liking.I highly recommend this property and would use it again.

We stayed two nights pre-cruise at Ala Moana by LSI in one of the condo rooms. The price was fantastic for this beautiful hotel. Our room had no real balcony, but sliding doors opened the room to a railing. We could look out on the harbor and could see Macy's at the shopping mall next door. We could see our ship peeking through two tall buildings the day she arrived. We walked to the mall and had dinner the first evening. We found Long's Drugs to have all the extra supplies we needed for our cruise. Beside the outside of Macy's we spotted a trail to a lovely park beside the yacht harbor.We ate at the hotel's Plantation Cafe for breakfast. It was a nice buffet but pricey especially if you select from the hot menu and the continental menu. We grabbed some breakfast sandwiches and juice from the hotel gift shop for our second morning. We also grabbed sandwiches for a quick and inexpensive lunch before an afternoon at the Polynesian Cultural Center. The Cultural Center bus picked up and let us off on one side of the hotel making for easy transport around the island. We had plenty of room in our room and were very comfortable. The room was even made up and cleaned after we returned from our excursion. That was a surprise because we had read on Trip Advisor that we would have to call to request maid service if we stayed in one of the privately owned condos. We booked for the price and were pleasantly surprised by the beauty and quality of this hotel.
user_name:
Kay S
Grand Prairie, Texas, United States

review_body: There is nothing that this hotel could have done to improve our stay. 5 nights. Valet was f-a-s-t, every time! The elevators were fast, too. The entire place was immaculate, no exceptions. Everything in the entire place was new or like-new. The attitude of all the staff was totally aloha. Everything was as described.Listen, we splurged on a 1br suite up on the 32nd floor, so...you know. But we've stayed in the "ordinary" rooms in the past too and it was no different except the size of the room, and this time we had a kitchen, which by the way pretty much paid for the difference, just by making our own breakfasts. The place is convenient to everything, especially the world-class Ala Moana Mall. But Ala Moana Beach Park, a hundred steps from the hotel entrance, is absolutely the finest place to spend a beach day in all of O'ahu! I am not sure we will ever go back to Waikiki Beach, even though it is only about a half-mile away.Pros run this place. But be careful I guess, I read the reviews of the brokered "units" that are privately owned condos. That one was worn out, that other one had a bug on the couch, whatever. Just book the Ala Moana Hotel by Outrigger, even if you book thru the booking sites, and you'll be very happy.Great kama'aina courtesy too. Shh.

I stay here every year for kawaii kon. I ordered the normal room one time when they ran out. The hotel upgraded my room with no charge. it's pretty affordable for a hotel in Hawaii. Ala Moana hotel is connected to the mall so if your looking to shop it's close. Also there's a beach close by but if you want to goto Waikiki. You can take a bus or walk which is about 15 or 20 minutes. All the main resturant is close by too if you know where to look.

Ideal location for the business traveller right next to the largest shopping centre in Hawaii, with a great choice of restaurants and central location for The Bus. Lots of other really good places for the business traveller to shop, Ross Dress For Less five minute walk away.Across the road is the Ala Moana Beach Park ideal area for the traveller to execise, great running or walking track around 4km, plus execise area and even better you can swim 800m non-stop, a full mile if you do a complete lap without having to combat waves.I have read some critical reviews complaining about the size of the rooms, it is true they are small but I'm only sleeping there not partying.Third stay here

The hotel is adjacent to the Ala Moana Shopping centre. Rooms are kept clean and free WiFi in every room,although it sometimes drops out for extended periods. Price was reasonable and below those hotels in Waikiki. Shuttle to Waikiki from the shopping centre so if you don't want to be right on the beach or in the middle of Waikiki, this is a good alternative.

If you need or want a hotel near the convention center this is a great place to stay. If you are on a quick in and out business trip it isn't bad either. But, if you are spending any more time in Oahu there are other locations that offer greater proximity to Waikiki.

Such a lovely room on the 32nd floor with a mountain and ocean view. The nighttime view was amazing. The room was very nice, housekeeping always responsive to our requests. The location is so convenient - can walk to shopping, restaurants, beach, etc. The in house restaurants are wonderful as well.

I have just completed a stay at the Ala Moana hotel and was rather underwhelmed. It did have its good points, relatively clean, friendly staff, very close to Ala Moana shopping centre, and it is close to several public bus routes.Unfortunately there were some not so good features. The wifi in the hotel rooms was problematic, devices would connect, but login page would never load so couldn't actually use the connection. And yes I did try surfing to a non https site to try to get it to load, no go. This was an issue on both Apple and Android devices. Was only able to access wifi by connecting to the Starbucks wifi in the lobby. The bed was not very comfortable and I woke with a sore back each morning. The "sky bridge" to the Ala Moana centre is actually a ramp from the second floor leading to one of the centre car parks. We needed a crib for my daughter, but what was supplied was rather rickety and with a very thin mattress, such that she tossed and turned most nights and didn't get any proper sleep. Also we had to specifically re-request the crib after noticing it's absence in our rooms despite having requested a crib at the time of booking.Personally I wouldn't stay there again, but would recommend it for anyone womis very into shopping.

A little noisy due to the hi traffic volume outside, but the air conditioning works well and the beds are comfortable and there is a nice pool and workout center. There are lots of airline crews and military staying at this hotel.

Stayed for the second time in 33rd floor suite (3326) which can be rented via Hawaii 5-0 vacation rentals. The hotel facilities can be used incl the pool. Lobby of hotel has Starbucks and some other small shops. Parking garage under the hotel. Reception very friendly. Hotel used by lots of airline crews. Location is central and Ala Moana shopping center next door. Overall great hotel. Less crowded than Waikiki hotels.

Staying at the Ala Moana Hotel is always very convenient. First of all, it's in a central location. Makes getting to places in Honolulu pretty quick. It's connected to our fabulous Ala Moana Shopping Center. Not only great shopping, but restaurants, bars and a food court. A block away from the hotel is the popular Ala Moana Beach Park.The hotel staff are friendly and efficient. The hotel is pretty large with two buildings.Our room was a partial ocean view. Enjoyed looking out at the beautiful ocean. Room was comfortable and clean. It had a coffee maker and mini fridge. A great place to stay for singles or families.

This is a unique hotel! It's the closest hotel to the Hawaii Convention Center and it has been remodeled recently. Rooms are comfortable and well appointed. It's also right next to the Ala Moana Shopping Center with tons of great shopping, and loads of food choices. Challenges--no connecting rooms whatsoever, and only one type of suite--a 1-bedroom suite.

Check in quick and painless, staff were very pleasant and answered any questions I had.The room was modern, spacious and very clean. The wifi worked well. The bed was also very comfortable and I had a good night's sleep.Great location with shops and transport plentiful in the area. Also a starbucks on ground level and some other useless shops.The only dissapointment is that I didn't get to stay longer.

I am currently sitting in this tiny, tiny cluttered room for the 5th consecutive night. Only one to go, thank God! I booked using a conference discount (attending the convention center just down the road) and although all the other delegates I knew were placed in the Waikiki tower, I was put in the Kona Tower. Waikiki Tower guests have balconies. Kona Tower guests have a sliding glass door and a fence. Seriously. The room is cluttered with a sofa bed I didn't ask for and don't need, a small queen size bed that's hard and has this awful rebounding bounce when your partner climbs in or out of it. Or rolls over. Or moves in any way. The bath is about four feet long, is crammed up against the toilet, which is almost under the vanity where the sink is.I did ask to be moved but they said they would charge an additional amount per night, even when I pointed out comparable rates on Expedia, and that other delegates had been housed in the superior wing. But my travel agent had paid up front, so I suppose they don't have to accommodate moves when they already have the money.As for position, it is near the convention centre and the Ala Moana shopping centre. But this is not close to Waikiki Beach, is not a particularly nice area to walk around in (brothels, strip clubs) and I would recommend staying further away and traveling down to the convention centre and mall, rather than staying close by. So disappointing to not walk around in the balmy evenings enjoying the tropical moonlight. Instead, I open my sliding glass door, lean on the pool fence, and gaze out at the car parking ramp- over the way is the ocean, which is nice. Shame about the sirens.

We only stayed one night at the end of our trip. The hotel is well located if you plan to shop a lot a the Ala Moana shopping center. It has a great beach nearby. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room were nice and clean. It just didn't really feel like we were in Hawaii anymore. It lacks some Hawaiian charm. This hotel could just have been anywhere in the world. Great for a short stay though and much cheaper than anywhere on Waikiki if you are on a budget.

First, the "standard" review stuff. This hotel was fine. It is definitely clean and the front desk staff was quite friendly and helpful. The elevators are fast. The wifi in our room was problematic. The rooms are SMALL, the bed comfort was "ok", and there's no breakfast included - nor free parking.Now the "rest of the review"STAY AWAY! BE CAREFUL! During the check in process, we were told that the room we "rented" was not owned, managed, or maintained by the hotel, but rather, a private management company. What that really means? Well, we were told that if there was "any" problem with the room, the hotel "would not be able to help" us. We had to call the private leasing company.I STRONGLY FEEL that this MAJOR MISREPRESENTATION of a hotel room boarders on fraud (although it technically isn't). and had I know this I would not have booked the room. SHAME on tripadvisor for offering us rooms AND BOOKING THEM FOR US (through Booking.com) that aren't managed by the property WITHOUT TELLING US.

We stayed here for 3 days and it was a pleasant stay. We found the front desk staff very unhelpful and almost left the hotel except for the fact that we got help from our travel agent to remedy our situation. The hotel itself was clean, rooms were clean and the Waikiki Tower had decent size rooms. We had a partial view of the water but nothing great. We were staring at a crane. It is walking distance from the Ala Moana center which is huge. There were trolleys going around Waikiki which stopped close to the hotel. The pool was average, decent gym and starbucks and a convenience store in the hotel. There was also a breakfast place in the hotel but we did not eat there. The concierge was very helpful and helped us book a few excursions. This was a very busy hotel with conventions. The beach was close by but not the most scenic beach you want to go to when you are in Hawaii. Overall, the hotel was fine, just nothing special.

I am in one of the hotel's nicer rooms--I paid extra for a view of the (distant) ocean with a little balcony. I appreciate the balcony! The room and bathroom are plenty large enough and clean. The bed's comfortable (although I could have used a little blanket--no blanket of any kind that I could find in the room or closet).Unfortunately, I need to spend time working while here. The room has a small round table and a long table (which holds the TV, phone, etc). Either of those tables could serve as a desk however the room's two chairs are stuffed and low. Even with 3 pillows on the chairs--the desk is up to the middle of my chest.Give me an office chair and I'll write a glowing review!The gyms is fine--I appreciate the roller, the gym balls, and the small weights as well as the quality cardio machines. The gym opens at 5am and the Starbucks in the lobby at 5:30 so most everything is in place but....not being able to work in my room is a big problem for me and would be a problem for most business travelers I imagine.

The Ala Moana was a lot nicer than I expected. It's in a good location that has plenty of shopping and places to eat on the property or near by. The rooms are a bit on the smaller side, but clean and updated room. However, it was just enough room for me. The gym had all of the typical equipment and clean. I was there for business, but if you're looking to relax by the pool with a tropical cocktail it's not happening. There isn't a bar in the pool area and drinks aren't allowed on the deck.

The hotel is located near downtown waikiki. This is not near the beach so if your plan is the beach you will need to cab, walk or bus. Bus runs often and is a good alternative or you can walk. Hotel is clean only negative is rooms are small. For business travel difficult to work in the room no desk space.

As locals, we have stayed at this hotel a few other times and enjoyed our stay, but this time we were unexpectedly upgraded to an ocean front suite! We like to stay here more than the Hilton Hawaiian Village for it's proximity to excellent shopping and restaurants. The breakfast buffet is so delicious and fresh with a better variety of items than many of the hotel buffets we've had, including HH. The staff is so accommodating and treat you as a true guest, with the aloha spirit.

Best hotel in term of location for visitors. Connected to Ala Moana Shopping Center, across the street from Ala Moana Beach Park, walking distance t o various restaurants in general Area. Rooms are OK, with improvements possible in bathrooms (could use hand held shower) better and quieter air conditioning and quieter room refrigerators. Rooms are clean , OK for price range. Hotel's main restaurant serves breakfast only, with Starbucks in Lobby and deluxe steakhouse at Penthouse level. Service from support staff (desk clerk, waiter/waitresses, valet, housekeeper, bellmen) ranged from good to very good. Hotel is favorite of local people traveling from outer islands.

After comparing rates online with Trip Advisor and the local rate on the hotel website, I booked a room for my granddaughter and myself. The rate on Trip Advisor was lower by about thirty dollars per night, Apparently there is a management company that rents out condo rooms in the hotel. I received a prompt response and receipt for my room.Trip Advisor was helpful with suggestions for activities.Upon checking into the room I was initially happy that the room had two full size beds instead of the advertised queen and sofa bed.To my utter horror upon closer inspection , towels were new and beds made, but there was an open bar of soap in the bathroom, melting items in the fridge, an empty water bottle and plastic wrappers on the night stand with a used plastic spoon and stains, and a wash cloth on the table near the sliding door.Housekeeping is apparently provided by the management group. Per instructions from the front desk and literature provided in the room, I left three phone messages. My stay was during the week, yet to date I have not received a return call.The Ala Moana Hotel staff were wonderful ! The hotel is located right across the parking lot for the Ala Moana shopping center. There are good restaurants located on property and close by, Starbucks in the lobby, sundry shop with assorted food and replacements for forgotten items, a nightclub, decent size pool.I enjoyed my stay but will be more careful checking out the management company before booking through a third party again! Upset that I had to go to the store to purchase cleaning supplies and having to sanitize a room that should have been properly cleaned.

Advantage of hotel is its proximity to ala moana shopping center & beach. Otherwise, not a good value due to small rooms and bare minimum F.F. & E. and decorations. Attitudes of front desk gets a minimum pass. Not warm and friendly like other hotels. Its free wifi was hard to sue, so I sue my own air card
user_name:
Matthew C
Seattle, Washington, United States
