It's free, but a huge pain to use. I had my laptop, which I could hardwire at the desk, and that was ok, but my iPhone and iPad were so frustrating. The WiFi kept dropping and disconnecting every 5-10 minutes, and every time you reconnect, you have to go to a screen and enter your email address. Between the two devices, I must have typed my email address 200 times over the 5 days. Not good.Overall this hotel wasn't terrible, but it also wasn't great. With so many choices in the Waikiki area, I wouldn't choose this one again next time.

Stayed here while my husband was attending convention. Great location for access to the convention center. Room not ready when we arrived. Even waiting for a room we did not get the king bed that we had requested. Concierge was useless. Springs popping in bed and side breaking down. There was a bug (I think it was a roach) that was circling the ceiling...asked the housekeeper to take care of it but that didn't happen. Bedspreads are very worn and dated. Old lotion spots on the bathroom counter that were never wiped off the whole time we were there. Equipment in the Fitness Center is nice. It would have been nice if the water fountains in the Fitness Center would have had cold water. You could buy cold water...

Excellent service at this hotel. I could not print the voucher and did not incur any problems. Actually, we were upgraded from a queen to a king without asking. Valet was very helpful in directing us on what to do and where to go. Very convenient location, next to Ala Moana shopping center. Thank you so much for your kind hospitality! We will return soon.

Absolutely loved the location of this hotel - right next to the Ala Moana shopping centre. Staff were friendly and helpful, the room was clean, modern and moderately sized - the bed was super comfy!!! We also loved that they had a separate activity desk to organise tours. We had a partial view of the ocean which was awesome. Make sure to also check out the rooftop pool if you stay here. Free & fast Wifi in the room. There's a bus stop right out front of the shopping centre too which can take you to most spots on the island or up to Waikiki beach, good if you don't want to hire a car.Tip - there are awesome places to eat in the shopping centre! Go and explore :)

I booked this hotel while attending a conference at the convention center down the street. I used booking.com, and the cheapest rooms were available through luxury suites international (LSI). This is a company that rents out private condos in the hotel. This was a horrible mistake. We arrived and were given the room we asked for (two full beds, ocean view). On the second day we decided to go for a swim, left all of our belongings (except room key) in the room and went down to the pool. After a swim we went back to the room to find that our room keys would not work. This was pretty annoying, but we decided it must just be a malfunction. So we went to the front desk and let them know our keys wouldnt work. They told us LSI made a mistake in booking and they had to give us a different room. Rather then slip a note under my door, send me an email, call me and leave a message, they decide the best solution is to lock us out of our room. Then to change rooms, we had to go back up to our old room escorted by a security guard who came in the room with us while we packed up. He then took us to our new room that was not two beds or ocean view. The hotel blamed LSI and when I called LSI, they blamed the Hotel. LSI was out of the rooms we booked, and the hotel couldn't give us a non-LSI room. I found everyone to be extremely rude and unhelpful during this annoying and embarrassing room change. At no point did one person even offer an apology. On top of all this, the hotel wasn't great on its own, its in a more run down neighborhood and the lobby smelled like mold. I do not recommend this hotel, however if you find you have little other options, absolutely do NOT book through LSI.

Wether living on the Big Island or the mainland when we have had the occasion to stay in Honolulu we have made it a point to stay at the Ala Moana Hotel. It is a good location near but not in Waikiki and easy to get to from the airport and the locations. Being right next to the Ala Moana Mall opens up dinning and shopping options as well.Upon our arrival we were greeted by a front desk clerk with no aloha, I’m glade this was not my first impression of the Aloha State. My wife said something to him and he never made eye contact with her or even acknowledged her. She just walked away I said we would like a quite room as we both needed sleep, his response was “you are on the 27th floor” and finished checking us in.We went up to our room which was across the hall from the elevator, we both thought oh great! As it turned out it has been a quite room with the exception of the first night when there was a party in the room next to us. I took two calls to the desk for Security before the got the message to turn it down.They seem to cater to the flight crews and groups and are less concerned about the independent traveler. The biggest problem we have noticed is that the front desk needs to practice Aloha. With more Aloha the star rating would be a lot higher.

The only complaint is you cannot automatic checkout. No room service. But huge shopping center next door. My reservation was jammed up spelling and the line was very very slow. The lady who checked me in was very elderly.

The Hotel was decent at best. The staff was friendly and very helpful so you won't have any issues there. The pool is on the third floor. There is no swim up bar and no TV to watch the game. Part of the pool is actually under construction. Don't go to the bar/restaurant in a t-shirt…the host/hostess won't let you in. They will give you a button up hawaiian shirt to put on if you want to sit at the bar and watch the game! Connected to a pretty nice mall and close to the marina but far from the beach!!

I have stayed at the Ala Moana several times. My September visit again confirms that this is the best. At check in, I had special requests. this was handled with efficiency. No problem for front desk. They were able to do exactly what I requested.When i arrived at my room, an employee from housekeeping knocked on door. apparently the previous guest had insisted that she had left something in the room. Although the item was something that no housekeeping staff would have kept, staff still followed through with the previous guest request to check the room.during my stay i had occasion to contact both front desk and housekeeping (no problems... just something i wanted). knowledgeable staff was able to answer my questions... none of that "i'll have to get back to you".the view requested was superb.

My stay at the Ala Moana Hotel was fabulous. We were upgraded to an ocean view room. The room was beautiful. The pool was lovely. It's close to Ala Moana shops, it's close to a beautiful beach park. And far enough from Waikiki to be able to visit it get away from and relax. Top choice

Stayed here with the family in June 2015. This is an excellent hotel that has been around for more than 20 years. However, the hotel has been renovated previously and well maintained. The rooms are decent in size although toilets are still a bit old style. The location is great just outside of the main Waikiki boardwalk and the Ala Moana Shopping Centre is attached to the hotel. There you can find various well-know brands like Polo, Banana Republic, Nordstrom's Department Store and many others! Our room had a nice view of the Waikiki beach in the distance.

This hotel was probably a gem in its time, however it is quickly becoming outdated. You could find better hotels in the location. I stay here often for work and the rooms are regularly dirty with stained sheets etc. If you are looking for shopping, this is a great location as it is connected to the Ala Moana Mall. If you want safety for walking around, I would not recommend it. I wandered out at night a few times and did not feel safe at all. There are HUGE homeless populations within a block or two. The price is right for the location so thats is what draws in the large crowds. Wifi is horrible.

If you come to Honolulu for shopping, Ala Moana is perfect, being right about the massive mall. However, if you are here for the culture, the beach, the holiday atmosphere then book somewhere closer to Waikiki (its a bit of a walk from this hotel). There is nothing special about this hotel that would make me want to return but if you do book, I recommend a room facing the ocean on an upper floor to get a view. I was initially put in a room at the back looking directly into another room and it took alot of effort to get it changed. There are many other better hotels in Honolulu.

The main reason we stay at this hotel is because it's right next to Ala Moana shopping center. I shopped there every day while my hubby went golfing plus it was nice dining there. On our first night, we were in a room next to the elevator that was running all night long. We're light sleepers so we asked to change room the next day so we upgraded to an ocean view suite. The suite made a big difference (no noise) and we truly enjoyed the remainder of our trip there. We even got to see the Friday night fireworks from our balcony. Loved the suite, spacious bathroom, great location and friendly staff from front desk to valet parking plus there's self-service laundry available.

Our plane broke so the Airline put us in a hotel overnight. I mean who can complain about spending a free night in Hawaii so I wont. If you like a nice room, city life, distant views around other hotels of the mountains or ocean then this is just your place. Good for conventions, wedding parties and down plane stayovers. Its near a shopping mall and you could grab a cab anywhere you wanted to go but its not a beach hotel experience we come to Hawaii to enjoy.

While the hotel is under renovation the location suited us as it was crazy busy at the Waikiki end of toen. The hotel has easy access to the Ala Moana Mall where all the great department store bargains can be found. The Trolley buses go right past the front door every 5-10 minutes. The beach is a short walk across the park.Oahu wasw very disappointing on this stay. Too noisy, Construction going on everywhere. They start very early in the morning because of the heat I presume.Didn't discover the restaraunt on the 36th floor till our last night at the hotel
user_name:
Gabrielle C
Narrabeen, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: We really enjoyed our stay, the rooms are excellent, hotel in a good location. The staff are very accommadating to our needs. Great resturant on site. Great view and close to the beach and other sites. We have stayed here on numerous occassions.

Lovely hotel, more business oriented. The pool area was nice but closed at 7pm. The staff was very friendly and showed the Aloha spirit. Our room was cozy. Just one bed, a reading chair, and two side chairs. The refrigerator, microwave, and coffee pot was appreciated.

Parking lot was full, went around 3 times, and was told to park across the street at the shopping center parking lot! Check in took an hour and ten minutes! No soap in room to take a shower! Asked to speak to the general manager, was brushed off to fill out guest survey card instead.

Our family has stayed yearly at the Ala Moana Hotel for years. Last Oct was the first time things were really bad. Couldn't accommodate our room request (they always reserved the same room for us every year before) then it took over 2hrs to get us in another acceptable room only to find out the rate we were being charged was higher than the rate I could have booked the room on line that day. The Manager was quite nice as he read my Trip Advisor rating and called and apologized and adjusted the rate. So here we go tomorrow we will check in to hopefully the room they guaranteed us and we will see if the tradition wil stay going to the Ala Moana Hotel or if we will need to start a new tradition at a new Hotel. Will keep you all updated Hoping for the best !

This hotel is really nice, its not as expensive as the Hilton and it over looks Ala Moana park and mall. Its in walking distance from the park and mall. Also, there are all sorts of things to do inside as well, there is a bar and the staff is really nice too.

Property is clean, modern, and safe. $20 per day for self-parking in their underground garage. Right next door to the Ala Moana Shopping mall and across the street from the Ala Moana Beach Park. Short 3 minute walk from an access ramp from the hotel to the mall on the Macy's 2nd level parking lot. You can walk from the Ala Moana beach park along the marina and scenic waterfront to Waikiki beach in about 30 minutes. There are good choices in the mall food court and available mall restaurants. The Mai Tai Bar on level 4 is one of my favorite happy hour spots.

Booked this place in last minute. Stayed for 2 nights. Great staff, near to the mall, nice pool, clean room, good wifi. I little bit away from the crowded Waikiki beach which we thought was good. It was easy to just take a uber there (much cheaper than taxi)

I stay here every year for a convention I attend. It's not only convenient to the Convention Center, but also to the Ala Moana Shopping center, the transit hub and the beach.The staff remembers me from year to year and always takes great care of me.Also, there has never been any problems with may service dog- a huge plus for me!

Attended a Security Industry Expo at this hotel. Location is great as it is adjacent to Ala Moana Shopping Center. The staff are very friendly and accommodating. Rates are very reasonable. A distance from Waikiki Beach, so either have a car or take the trolley.

Our 2 teen boys and my husband and I stayed in a diamond city view room with 2 double beds. It was a tight fit and the washroom was VERY small. Small sink, toilet and shower stall. The toilet had the front/rear wash let and dryer but the washroom always smelled badly.The hotel is beautiful and is the oldest in Waikiki. The history can be felt especially when sitting on the rocking chairs in the front or courtyard overlooking the banyan tree.Tons of stores and restaurants within walking distance and beach is directly out back. Very crowded beach and streets. Diamond head is very close by. You don't need a car rental if staying local as trolleys get you everywhere. If doing arranged tours they pick you up at hotel. You need a car to go to the north shore or along the coast.Daily resort fee charged for $30US gets you basic wifi and not much else. Don't see the value in the resort fee. Pool is small, crowded and smelly. Gym is nice.Beautiful and convenient but pricey and small rooms. May consider another property next time.Had late flight out but they could not accommodate late checkout and said there was a fee for it anyway....even for SPG gold members.

I chose this hotel because of its proximity to the Convention Center (3 minutes walk). I stayed for a total of 9 nights and am generally satisfied with the hotel. It is an older hotel and certainly not at par with top quality resort hotels in Southeast Asia. I have stayed in various Waikiki hotels before and this one is about average.It is only 10 minutes walk to the Ala Moana Beach and the Magic Island Lagoon, which are better swimming spots than Waikiki. If you prefer Waikiki, it is about 15 minutes walk, so also quite accessible. I understand its top-floor restaurant "Signature" is quite good, but I did not have a chance to try it, as I have been concentrating on Japanese food while in Hawaii. The prices, as far as Honolulu hotels go, are quite reasonable. I would recommend it if you are cost conscious.

Been here several times and always a great stay. The rooms and service are always outstanding. Front desk and maid service are great. The only fall back about this hotel is that there is always something type of event or party happening here at the hotel on the weekends. there is a parking fee and if the hotel is busy there is no valet service available, Lots of shopping and dining just 5 minute walk away.

Booked 2 rooms, wrote a message that i need connecting rooms, as we had small kidsHotel has no connecting rooms and didnt book us together. Only after 30 minutes did they find 2 rooms next to eachother, not a great startOne of the rooms had a leaking toilet smelled like pi..., had to move rooms next day, they did give us a suite, but was still a major hassleAs we are jewish and dont use electric doors on saturday, we asked the staff to open our room doors. I have traveled all over the world and was always helped with a smile. Takes 30 seconds... Here the staff made me feel horrible, manager said we will only do it once and gave major attitude... The entire staff was very uncaring to special needs, never been at a hotel with such rude staff!!!!!!!!!With such a attitude to religious needs and in general a smile was not to be found, I can only recommend stay somewere else

Stayed here multiple times in the past and this hotel gets older as the time goes. One of the towers is updated but still minimal. Location near mall provides plenty to do and pool is nice. Good happy hour upstairs 50% off. All in all average

I booked with this hotel a couple weeks back for a room for the day. My family and I were getting off a cruise at 8 am and couldn't get a flight home till 1130 pm. We needed a room to rest pre travel. When I phoned to book a room for the day the employee at outrigger said that would be possible only if I called the day before. I said since I'll be cruising it won't be possible so the employee told me I could book the night instead, which I did, and apparently she confirmed a guaranteed early check in. When I got to the hotel at 9 am there was no early check in guaranteed and there were no rooms till 3. I showed them my reservation and they said look it says preferred not guaranteed. The lady who booked told me it was confirmed. I was willing to pay 320 U.S. For a day stay but for 5 hrs with ridiculous service no way. After explaining what happened all I got from the staff is you should have gotten a name of who booked for you. Seriously such a big hotel people need to figure out how to do their jobs properly from the front line staff to the ones behind the scenes. I had to cancel my booking and found another place with the help of a great cab driver. People booking in advance watch out!

We spent 5 nights at the Ala Moana July 20-24. We chose it because of it's proximity to the Convention Center and we're not disappointed. From our first encounter at the reception desk to the last good bye from our houskeeper, everyone was polite accommodating and effecient. The Plantation Cafe has a breakfast cafe that provides an opportunity to start your day at your own speed whether it's a long relaxing meal or a quick dine and dash, there's a good selection and plenty of it. We had Ricky as our server both tI me sand he always made sure our coffee cups were full and when he noticed I liked my tea a little stronger brought me more tea bags. The gift shops have a good selection and friendly helpful staff.

Great, friendly staff. Valets were always prompt. Room was good but small. Room was always clean. Had a fridge and a microwave. Location near the mall is great. We had a good time and will return. Thanks.

We have been here 3 times in the last 7 years and clearly this visit was the worst. Our bathroom was not clean. There was something under the counter that may have been a woman's personal item. (did not want to touch) and the toilet seat was broken. As well as two of the dresser drawers and one of the lights switches by the bed was missing. For those who enjoy breakfast in bed note that there is no room service. Lobby and location to shopping,kid friendly beach and freeway access are the positives. Unfortunately, Ala Moana Park has many homeless people. We didn't have any troubles but it's just really sad to see.

The Ala Moana Hotel is in a great location for a place to stay while in Honolulu. You're just steps away from the Ala Moana Shopping mall which includes allot of great stores and restaurants. The Bus system for Honolulu literally centers around this location which allows you easy access to the rest of the island, which eliminates the need for a rental car. Walmart is within walking distance as well. I found is very easy to check in, didn't notice any long lines even when I checked out. Bathtubs were very deep and the remodeled room I was in was nice as well but small. The only downside was the noise, because of the location you can hear construction and traffic all the time but I think if you get a higher floor and maybe one that faces the mountains I think that would cut down on that.

Across the street from the beach and adjoining the Ala Moana Shopping Center. You can walk to the convention center, Neiman Marcus and one of the most beautiful beaches in the world. Rooms are always clean and as advertised.Local Lions Clubs and families hold important events here. Stayed here for five nights. Great view of Honolulu with a balcony. Have stayed here several times.

We went to hawaii for Halloween and it was everything I remembered it to be. This hotel is just steps away from the Ala Moana Mall, and minutes from Waikiki beach. the rooms were neat and very clean, and rooftop restaurant was simply wonderful. Actually, everything we ate during this trip was great. I can't wait to come back. Also, Rumors night club located inside near the lobby was nice with a great vibe.

This is a clean and tidy property, with great location for the Ala Moana shopping centre. What deserves review, however, is something different: the process required for (particularly) check in, and check out.We tried to check in around 3pm, and were faced with a line that snaked all the way through the foyer, and around the corner! It took one hour and five minutes to make it to the front desk.I am not sure if this is typical, or exceptional - but it is something which we would factor in deciding whether to return. Put simply, after a long flight, and airport processing, the last thing you want between you and the start of your holiday is another excruciating wait.The systems at the front desk appear to be paper based, and labour intensive. there are no options to skip the process (ie no online check in or express check out), so you are really left with a long wait. Frustratingly, the long line gives way to airline staff (who have a separate check in desk), and also front desk staff appear to be required to disappear after each guest is checked in to perform some functions in a back office.We were so concerned about the long waits we checked out an hour earlier than we had to - just to avoid missing our flight. In the end it took 15 minutes to check out - hardly unacceptable, but also way longer than most modern hotels.A suggestion to the hotel:When there are such long lines, have more concern for the guests waiting: can I suggest you offer complimentary water or juice to anyone in the long line? I think it would also be sensible for the hotel to have a staff member out in the foyer, assuring the people in line that they are in the right place, and that the hotel is working to process them as fast as possible.

We recently stayed here for 5 nights and it was the perfect place to stay if you like shopping at Ala Moana Shopping Centre. Just go down to level 2 and out the doors across the carpark and into Macey's! There is a good convenience shop in the lobby which is very well stocked. The rooms were tidy and clean. The pool was great and also had a well set out fitness centre, which we used. There is also 2 x laundry's, one on level 6 and the other on level 13 which didn't close until midnight so was perfect to wash after being out all day.

Reasons to like this hotel:- Proximity to Ala Moana and lots of good eats. - Right across from the park of same name. Great place for running, walking, and taking in the views. - Still close enough to to Waikiki. - Staff very friendly and attentive. - Rooms in great shape with great views.

I want to sincerely thank the friendly and professional staff, Jan, our housekeeper in rm 2330 You can choose Valet or self parking, of course we chose Valet, so convenient and we'll worthied with the professional an friendly staff. Big kudos to the attendants, porters, housekeeper.You want the Aloha Spirit, stay here. My sister and I met in Honolulu from different states, we truly had an experience, we'll never forget, also able to have such an enjoyable experience with family, as the staff treated them like guest! We made use of the pool, fitness center, steam room, restaurants, sundries (which I bought a beautiful shift dress for only $19.99) and to end our vacation, my sister and I had a massage downstairs....Ken was truly so kind a great Pricing was great! Easy access to the third largest shopping center in US minutes walk to the beach My parents are resting at Punch bowl cemetery and how ironic we had a clear view from our room, very relaxing to relax on the balcony So to the staff at Ala Moana Hotel Thank you so much for the greatest ALOHA Cindy in Colorado

I have stayed here a few times - the view over the ocean is fantastic - get a high level. The Ala-Moana shopping centre is right next door - walk to Ward Centre too. Short work to Waikiki or take the Bus just a few steps away. Service is good - clean rooms and great atmosphere

We stayed one night in the Kona Tower. It was a smaller room, but it served our needs at the time, these rooms have no balconies, and have a smaller bed. It can also get noisy early in the morning. We we're happy with the friendly staff at check in/check out. Another bonus is that this hotel is a5 minute walk away from the Ala Moana Shopping Center. Taxi service is readily available, and you feel a sense of safety with a security guard is visibly present, and that you need you hotel key to even use the elevator. We would definitely stay there again.

Our group of ten stayed here overnight on our way to Micronesia. Our plane arrived late so our rooms where ready when we checked in around 6ish. I was dreading the check in line that I had read about in the reviews but thankfully there was no line. Our room was very clean, full of info ( what to do ,where to eat, how to get a massage), water pressure was great, bathroom clean. It had a fridge, iron, teas, coffee, shampoo, lotion, and a bunch of other little pleasant perks. We were able to get plenty of sleep befor our very early flight. Checked out was quick ( but it was very early bc of flight) then midair our flight had to return bc of sensor issues. Back to the hotel we come. We were able to book rooms for the group fo one more night but this time we were there at 2:30 so only one room was ready. The lines were very long and the flight crew does get special attention. It is frustrating seeing so many flight crew walk right up and get a room before you. Not just one or two but like 12-15 people. Our one desk clerk even left us to check in the flight crew faster. A manager never called extra help for us just let us stand there and watched. We had to point it out before the guy came back to help everyone else. Which worked bad for us bc they wouldn't let us check into our room until exactly 3:00 so we sat there and watched 8 people get checked in early. Lol Guess we should have kept our mouths shut! Then he wouldnt check us in on the group card ( the rest of our group had checked in under the group card. We were the only two people who was made to wait) so we had to use our own card which later was charged even though at check out it was added to the group bill. Our room again was clean just like the 1st room. Our second stay confirmed a lot of the previous reviews. Hopefully these reviews don't fall on deaf ears and something is actually done about customers service & surely our inconvenient wait wasn't purposely done because of our asking to get someone to help the regular people staying at the hotel. I'm confident this hotel is capable of providing excellent service because our first night was just that...excellent. BUT our second time checking in was far from it.

United Airlines booked us a last minute overnight stay here when our flight to Saipan from Los Angeles was delayed. My 4 year old and I was tired and I was already irritated with United Airlines as it is so we were not expecting much from this hotel or any hotel for that matter. However upon our arrival, I was surprise that the hotel was actually pretty nice. The lobby was pretty big, clean and well lit. It's not fancy or classy but definitely, have a unique decor. They have a boat sitting inside the lobby which my son enjoyed. The staffs were also friendly and helpful. Upon our arrival, bellboy offered to carry our luggages and was swift about it. Check in was also fast so we got to our room and rested right away. Our room was also a surprise. It's spacious with 2 full size bed, clean and fully equipped. The mini kitchen corner (with microwave and mini fridge) would have been useful if we were staying more than a night. We had the city lights view with was cool esp. having been our first time in Honolulu. The next day, we had a chance to visit the surrounding area before heading to the airport for our flight to Saipan. There's a mall just right next door and few eateries. We did not pay for this hotel so I don't know how much the rate was but I would definitely stay here again someday. I plan to visit Honolulu with my family someday. Perhaps next year and will stay here for sure. I guess something came about right from all the hassle we had to go through with United Airlines at that time. This hotel somehow made up for United Airlines incompetence.

I stayed here one night while on a business trip. This hotel was a lot less expensive than I would spend if I was on vacation in Hawaii and so my rating takes into account the value. However, the mattress was firmer than I would like and the Hawaiian bedspread was like something from the 70s. The bathroom looked like it had been remodeled somewhat recently and the room was clean. My room faced the mall next door but you could still see the ocean too.

Despite of being rated a 3 star hotel, I would rate them as a 5. Check in was speedy, we asked for a 12pm instead of 3pm and got what we wanted. Room was ready, our service rep Iwalani Segovia was the most helpful, friendly and filled with aloha! Wish there were more of her in any hotel! Our 2 night stay was one of our best my wife and I experienced. Ala Moana Center was close walking distance via a ramp connected to the 2nd floor. Swimming pool on the 3rd floor was clean, not too crowded. Valet parking was fast and efficient, never took longer than 5 mins waiting for our ride. Staff was courteous and friendly. We stayed on the 20th floor oceanview suite with balcony which was very clean and not too far from the 6 elevators that serves the Waikiki Tower which I will alway recommend. Beautiful views of the sunset, beach overlooking the shopping center and Ala Wai Harbor areas. We would definitely visit there anytime, wish we didn't have to leave! But kudos to the staff, fast quick elevators to get you to your room. Aloha is alive and well at the Ala Moana Hotel...a 5 in our eyes!

Be Aware check in process takes forever. I have to pay for an upgraded room in order to get 2 beds. Which Samantha accommodated upon arrival without a smile. Glenn the bellman was very friendly and explained the room; he was already at the door waiting before we got to the room.Rooms aren't big. A bit crowded but ideal for 1-2 people only. Not a family resort at all. Beds are extremely uncomfortable (tío soft snd My back still hurts) and so does the bedding (literally sandpaper).We got an ocean view but since there are building right out front we face the marina and magic island slightly. It's a 3 star hotel period. Lower your expectations. They Focus on huge conventions /groups. You'd have to walk loooong to get to the beach. not fun with kids. If you are in Honolulu just stay at a beachfront resort unless you are here for something else

We spent 10 nights this trip at the Ala Moana Hotel, it is so good to be this close to the Mall and to Ward Centre. As The Bus also leaves from the Mall we used it as a base to go out to Kailua for a beach day and to Kahala Mall as well as downtown.We did use the pool and sun beds a lot this trip, lovely to spend a few hours in the afternoons just relaxing by the pool.There are so many good cheap places to eat nearby as well you are spoilt for choice.

stayed here in june for a staycation with my out of town cousinswas so surprised how well kept and nice the hotel iswe had aroom 2330 city and mountain view absolutley beautifulwith a view of punchbowl memorial where the two out of town sisters parents are laid to rest, that was nice, also the city and street views were nice you could see the parking and parts of ala moana shopping centerthe view at night was terrific, you could sit out on the balcony and enjoy the scenerythe sundry store prices were also good lots of varietiesmy cousin bought a dress for only 19.99its also a hotel for airline crewsthe gym is nice clean there is a steam and sauna roomand they give towels poolsidepool is a good size and I like the depththe valet is very on top of it along with the bellhops very attentive and quickone of the best features is that the hotel is right next to the ala moana shopping center in fact i believe its connected through the parking on the macys sidethere is also a laundry roomand the chinese restaurant is very goodthe houskeeping staff quick and curteous they do their job very wellI also would like to add they have in house reservationand there is a very nice lady name Jan who was so helpful and went out of her way to help with the reservationsthank you Jan again was very pleased with this hotel, even though Im a hyatt platinum the ala moana hotelnow has a new fanwill be telling locals try a staycation herealso the beach is within walking distance so is the bus line and waikiki just around the cornerthis location is awsome location location location

The hotel is in an excellent location, near to the ocean and right across the street from the Ala Moana mall. Inside it is nicely decorated with a couple of restaurants, a massage place, a fitness room and a few stores. The staff that we've worked with are very friendly and helpful. The room itself is nicely appointed with a toaster oven/microwave and a mini fridge, a small table and two chairs, and a balcony which had a partial ocean view and overlooked the pool. The bathroom is decently sized and there is plenty of hot water. There was a 40" or so sized TV in the room with plenty of channels. Wifi was free, but a tad slow.All in all, a pretty nice place to stay.

I stayed here for 1 week for business. The front desk staff was friendly. The room was clean and well appointed. Normally I stay in Sheratons or Westins and the rooms and facilities were on par. Great location right next to Ala Moana shopping mall and beach park. Waikiki is just a 5 - 10 minute walk with lots of restaraunts and bars nearby. The Signature Bar upstairs had a reasonably priced happy hour with amazing views of the city and ocean.

Ala Moana Hotel has the best location and friendliest staff I have met in a long time. We travelled there with a large group and we were in walking distance from everything we needed. Here are my likes and dislikes about the hotel.Liked: The Service - The ladies who worked at the front desk of the hotel were very nice and welcoming as we checked in. They explained everything to us and worked very professionally and with care. Although we were with a big group, it didn’t matter as we were treated with top service.The pool – Although the pool is very small, the attendant that was working that morning was so very friendly. Went to get some towels from him and he was very accommodating.Security – You need a key (room key) to use the elevators. It makes it more difficult for non-guests to get by. There are also security guards walking around making sure everything was okay. I felt safe at night being in the hotel.Clean rooms – Although I just got the basic room, it was well equipped with clean towels and the bathroom was immaculate. The room cleaners really go out of their way to make sure the room is tidy and kept well. After a long day being out, nothing was nicer than to come back to a clean room. Great job!Did not like:The parking – The parking is underneath the hotel and if you have a big car or van, it can be very hard to park it. There is a nightclub and banquet rooms in the hotels where big functions are held and they take up the entire guest parking. There should be guaranteed parking for guests as it gets frustrating trying to park your car when all you want to do is go up to your room after a long day.Overall:Our overall experience at the Ala Moana Hotel was good. The best thing about the Ala Moana Hotel is that the location is prime. Itʻs right outside of the Ala Moana shopping center; the biggest mall on Oahu. Itʻs also about a 5-minute walk from Ala Moana Beach park right across the street. The staff is friendly and I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends.

Still a great place to stay in Honolulu. Our Room on the 8th floor overlooking the pool was nice. Breakfast was great. Quiet and businesslike. Apparently a favorite hotel of flight crews and military personnel. The mall next door was convenient for restaurants and shopping. Ala Moana beach park was a 10 minute stroll , with a fine beach lagoon for swimming, seemed popular with the local folk. Proved to be a fine hotel then and now.

To start, they made us wait 1 1/2 hours past check-in time to get a room (check-in is 3pm, but they finally called me up for our room at 4:37) At first they told us that the room was not ready and they were working on it. Then the reception manager told us that our 7 day stay was too long and they couldn't find a room for that long. He said they were so unusually busy (come on this is Honolulu, it's summer and it's ALWAYS busy! That was code for: we're undermanned and are trying to reduce costs) In the end they gave us free breakfast coupons for our entire stay and upgraded our room from mountain view to ocean view. Not bad, but not what you're looking forward to after spending all it takes to come to paradise.Secondly, we are having connectivity problems in the room. We have to reestablish our link a lot. It works good while we're on, but often have to go through the setup over again.On a third point, I asked the Activities/Tours desk about the Sunset cruises and she said that she was filling-in and was very vague with details. 'Cost is between 40 and 80 dollars per person and pick up at the hotel was 4 o'clock or so.' Now how can I plan from that?And also, the vending machine on our floor ran out of water. And, wouldn't return my money. So, now I have to go to a different floor to get water, maybe... and I have to go to the front desk to be refunded.Overall, on the 3rd of a 6 day stay we're having a great time. Hawaii is Hawaii! But, the Ala Moana hotel is definitely not living up to its reputation. They do have a good location, connected to the Ala Moana Mall and the park and beach is just a short walk away. We are sleeping good, because it's pretty quiet and comfortable. The room is clean and pretty nice, but there have been too many little problems for our taste. Might stay here again, but will look for other places first. Not disgruntled, but not ecstatic.

On arrival, we could tell the hotel was very large, took a long long time to check in, didn't appear to be a lot of staff about.Our room was lovely, not very large but big enough for the two of us, balcony with table and chairs overlooking the pool and down towards the beach. Bathroom was a good size, good shower, no end of hot water and good water pressure. Room appeared to be clean, fresh towels appeared each day. Safe in the room was well used by both of us, easy to operate. There was also a kettle and microwave in the room, ice machine just down the corridor. The hotel has a very well stocked shop, almost like a convenience store, food and tourist items. There is also a jewellery shop. Linked to the hotel is the Ala Moana shopping centre, which has a wide verity of restaurants, there is a Chinese restaurant on the top floor of the hotel that we ate at our first night. There is a lovely all you can eat buffet at breakfast time just out the front door of the hotel, we ate here most mornings, a wide verity of items to choose from. The hotel staff were very helpful in organising day trips and advised of where to go and what to do.I would definitely stay here again if given the chance!

We stayed in a privately owned condo for a few nights and loved it! The room was spacious & well equipped with a microwave, fridge, plates, toaster, utensils, etc... It was convenient to Ala Moana Shopping Center & restaurants. So, that was a plus in staying at this hotel. As for the customer service, it was bad! The second we pulled up to valet our car, we were greeted with not a smile or hi, but a grouchy valet! The valets were that way each time we used them on our stay there. We felt like we should've just self parked our car since we weren't treated right! The guest service agent was grouchy, too! No smile, just a mean look on her face. She wasn't even helpful when we asked her questions. We had the same lady checking in and checking out. There was absolutely no aloha while it at this hotel, except for the housekeepers who always said hi while we passed them.

Staff couldn't care less about you unless you work for the airlines or are part of an event they are hosting. The rooms are small and not well appointed microwave won't pop popcorn, parking is overpriced. Bottom line you'll pay a lot and get little for it.

Our bookings were made on our behalf by a third party whilst everything was confirmed with them the Ala Moana Hotel were disinterested when checking in & unhelpful in confirming our booking. They did not wish to see our booking confirmation just simply. You will need to sort out your things. Constantly we had security at our door indicating our booking had expired despite having rang & attended the desk to sort everything out & being assured all was fine. Never once on entering or leaving the hotel were we greeted. The staff on the desk had no people skills quite frankly gazing at their computer screen & data entry was all they had. Absolutely terrible. Angela Roman

We stayed at a privately owned condo on the 35th floor for 3 nights. We really enjoyed our visit to the hotel, it was mainly for shopping so being attached to the shopping mall was very convenient. Our studio room was clean and well equipped and the view was nice. It had a microwave and mini fridge as well as silverware and dishes/ cups in the cupboards. Being so high up it was quiet at nights with the lanai door closed. Hotel staff were not overly friendly, just polite while doing their jobs. Check in and out was quite slow and frustrating. We had the buffet breakfast one morning which was a bit expensive for what was on offer. We liked the pool area and also found a well stocked superette on the ground floor for snacks and drinks. Overall we would return but maybe get a one room suite next time for a little more space.

Great hotel & great location & very clean rooms. The staff were all very friendly & helpful. We stayed in the Waikiki Tower. It is all mountain/city view. The rooms are well insulated. Hardly heard the neighbors. The gym was well equipped with weight machines, treadmills & bike machines.

Rooms in the Kona tower are small and have limited ocean view. The views are of the city and hillside. Stay in the other tower. Housekeeping said they can only give you 1 packet of coffee (1 cup) a day. Minimal amenities. Hotel line to check in with a few front desk personnel. Must check out as well. No hotel bill under the door. Restaurant for breakfast is pricey. Valet staff are courteous. Hike to get to ocean. Hike to get to heart of Waikiki. Attached to a mall but otherwise, just average.

PROS: Good priceGreat location to Waikiki and shoppingCONS: Hotel is very old, outdated and dirty. Service is very slow with long line to check in and check out (30 minute wait)-unacceptable!Breakfast restaurant buffet quality was very poor with a lot of processed food for the offering.

I got a pretty decent price for this hotel and was surprised that you could just walk to the Ala Moana Mall where there were decent food options and a small convenience store. Parking is pricey ($25/day), but it is a little away from Waikiki, however, it was easier to access other roads out of town so you can avoid Waikiki traffic. It is a busy hotel as many airline workers seem to stay here. Nice club downstairs if one is into dance. Staff were helpful in recommending tours/activities and the rooms were small but clean. It is closer to the downtown area and there was a nice farmers market in a parking lot within walking distance.

Spending just a weekend in Honolulu, coming from one of the neighbor islands, I didn't want to spend a fortune and I didn't need a fancy resort. But I wanted to be comfortable and safe, and I needed a convenient location. Enter Ala Moana. The staff is friendly and helpful, full of aloha spirit. The room was clean and comfortable, with a beautiful view of Waikiki. The only complaint I had was that the mattress was not very comfortable, so if you're a light sleeper that may be something you want to consider.

Arrived and thought it's a nice place; friendly staff, nice views, but that's where it ends. I've been here a week (2 weeks to go)...and found that it's not impressing me. People are still nice, but paying for amenities that either don't work or I have to pay extra on top of them is ridiculous. Shower-not draining properly, barely at all, I asked about it the first full day here, no response. "Wi-fi" in each room-There is, but it doesn't work or you can't connect. I tried for a week to connect, finally connected today by using someone else's signal. Laundry-give me a break! I'm here for 3 weeks and I'm supposed to pay $7 each time to run a wash? I can drive to the base and spend my gas and still pay less for the "convenience" of doing it here in these antiquated dirty machines, better yet, the last two hotels I stayed at downtown charged not even half and have better machines. Front desk service-not! 3 times I called the front desk from the phone in my room, to address the wi-fi, laundry, and shower issue-no answer after 12 rings...I even went down to see if they were busy each time; I then used my cell phone to call the front desk, got through right away, sitting right in front of them addressing my issues over my cell phone 'cause the "operator" didn't pick up...wth? If anyone from the staff would like to talk to me, I'm in room 711, and will be here til June 14th. I hope the next 2 weeks are better...

I ended up staying here due to a canceled flight. Its about 15 min by taxi from the airport. I was up on the upper floors which I recommend. The view was really nice from the balcony. Everything was clean and all the amenities were there. It was very quite but sometimes you can hear people in the hall. Its right on the marina. The pool was nice as well. If you get the marina/city/pool view it works nicely cause you can see if the pools crowed or not and go.

When we arrived a smoke alarm that was low in batteries was emitting a high pitched beeping sound right outside our room. We called the front desk and asked to have it fixed- it was loud. About half an hour it stopped. That night, in the middle of the night it started up again and woke us up. We were very tired. We called again and they removed it. It shouldn't have happened.

We were put here by the airlines when they cancelled our flight 7 hours. We were worried because we know what most airline hotels are like, but were pleasantly surprised. First of all, the desk staff were very nice considering they had about 200 displaced people. They were fast and friendly. Our room was very clean and we had a great view overlooking the marina and the city from our balcony. We went to the hotel restaurant for breakfast, which was packed, but again, they handled it pretty good. We also went to the pool and the attached shopping mall to eat lunch. It was very convenient. When we checked out, again the staff were very courteous in getting us a cab and sending us back to the airport.

This hotel was awful. I stayed there for five nights. Room was scruffy and shabby. Bathroom basin had a rim of age old grime on the edges due to being set into the worktop. Toiletries were basic to say the least. Miles from any decent restaurants the in-house eateries were pricey and menu choices varied. Service was good though. Reception staff were unhelpful. If you arrive here early morning, as I did, you have to sit around waiting for a vacant room. Staff do not care about this unless you nag them to do something. Nagging to get anything done was essential. Generally NOT value for money and poor accommodation

Ala Moana was a last minute decision since our initial booking with another hotel fell through. We were pleasantly surprised with how comfortable and clean the room was, although it is a bit on the small side. Bed was comfortable, bathroom clean and a good size, and all the usual amenities are provided. Being right next the Ala Moana shopping centre was a bonus, but it is a bit further from the beach than other hotels. So if you're wanting easy beach access maybe another hotel is for you.Service is mixed, on our initial arrival the gentleman who served us was not particularly polite, and didn't even tell us there were two sets of lifts resulting in us lugging all our bags only to find out it's the wrong 'tower'.Overall a very comfortable stay. Not in the heart of Waikiki but if you're a shopper you would enjoy this hotel. Do not expect great service though.

Shoppers paradise with access ramp from 2nd storey direct to Ala Moana centre. Nice tidy room and we booked one with a sea view on the 32nd story so we could check out the surf from our room, well worth the extra cost unless you just want a bed for the night. Nice pool with all day sun and plenty of loungers. Pool attendant Thomas was very friendly and gave us some good tips on sightseeing etc. It is a bit of a walk to the beach, about ten minutes, but not that far, also Ala Moana park across the road. Only real complaint was when we turned up at our room 15 mintes after check out due to find a security guard saying if we didn't get out now we would be charged extra, a simple phone call or note under the door would haveebeen enough

I'm currently staying in this hotel on a business trip and i am shocked by the incompetence and lack care from the staff. The wait time to check in is unacceptable (usually waiting in line for minimum 45 minutes) and the staff lacked knowledge of their internal systems. We've experienced a wave of issues with checking into our rooms. Overall the staff & management are very impersonal and unhelpful.There is no room service and the cafe attached to the hotel closes at 10AM!!There was no consideration for our special needs as we're a travelling entertainment group. I will never stay here again and would recommend people who are looking at this hotel reconsider. I would recommend the illikai (having stayed there before) which is only a block or two away (and closer to waikiki).
user_name:
Liam C
Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: We waited for more than 2 hours to check-in and not a single staff approached the guests to explain what is the problem why the line/wait is too long. After 3 days of stay, the problem of checking out still the same. We waited for an hour to check out.

huge place long walks. Chinese Restaurant first class great food. Mona tower no Hdcp bars at toilet small roomAdjacent to ala moana mall a huge mall many first class stores ABC store on ground level. Starbucks by Macy's Would stay again.

Staff was friendly, no bar by pool, no room service, Signature restaurant upstairs is very good & Great happy hour PUPU's and Drink prices, not part of hotel. Clean , small room. the only thing close to the hotel is the shopping center next door.

NO room service! And the adjacent cafe closes at 10AM! 10AM! We couldn't figure out the clock for the alarm or the coffee maker. The elevator requires a card key that is more of a nuisance than a security device. Our key cards were changed twice in one night and each time one did not work.We were there from Kauai due to a medical emergency and we required a wheel chair. They refused to let us use one or even rent one claiming they only had two. The website offered the room for $159 but the Dr.'s office reserved at $179 and they overcharged us at $203. Then refused to help us find a room elsewhere when they were unable to extend our stay.Never again and neither should you.

Great bell service! Very friendly greetings from staff who were great at opening doors and answering questions. Small rooms. Location was handy for the conference centre across the street. Free wifi in room but not in lobby. Convenience store on the main floor. Parking was $20/day in and out okay (easy self park). Mini fridge and microwave in room. Overall it was fine but would have been small for a stay that's more than a few nights. $10 cab into Waikiki.

The front desk staff, and manager are absolutely the worst. They show no concern at all for their guests' time, or money, and made no effort to rectify problems that they created. Almost all of the guests who checked in, or tried to do so waited for 80 minutes or more only to find many problems with lost reservations, wrong room assignments, unexplained downgrades, etc. No one ; staff, or management cared at all. They never apologised, were completely apathetic, and seemed annoyed that people wanted things sorted properly. Do yourself a favour, spend a bit more, and stay at a decent hotel with staff who understand the meaning of customer service.

I have been coming here for years. They have kept the hotel updated and it is a good hotel. The location is next to the Ala Moana Shopping Center which will keep you very busy. The hotel offers a restaurant, gift shops, convenience store etc. I highly recommend staying hee.

The staff is very well versed in customer service, one was a little perfunctory but all of the others were very good. The facility was clean, well-kept and quiet. The partial ocean views from the Waikiki Tower balcony were very nice, and the city lights at night were pleasant. The hotel is an easy walk to the Ala Moano Park, which is very busy in the early morning with walkers, joggers, swimmers, fisherman and tourists. The mall is next door and offers shopping and food, of which the Japanese food above the Shirokiya store (next to Macys) was a definite worthwhile adventure. . The room was pleasant, clean, and with a green option for housekeeping's changes. While a non-smoking facility, one of my neighbor smoked on the balcony while on the phone--that's the only negative in my experience with the hotel. The condominium owners we met were very pleasant as well. The Signature Steak and Seafood Restaurant on the 36th floor was a very good experience. We did not have reservations and were treated with great courtesy and respect. The Plantation Cafe for breakfast merely tipped in a medium. The staff was very friendly and courtesy but the food was buffet-style and unremarkable. The location is not in Waikiki and if you like long, good walks, it is fine. It is a short cab ride to get to Waikiki. Finally, the flight crews and military stay here, and are a targeted market for the hotel. I took that as a good thing because they are almost always good guests and neighbors in a hotel.

We stayed here pre AND post cruise. The rooms are priced low for a reason. UGH! The rooms are too small to accommodate two people with luggage for a cruise. Our room had one small "queen-sized" bed that had the most uncomfortable pillows and thin bedding. The room was probably one-third the size of our stateroom on the ship. Our room had a nice TV, microwave, coffee maker, and refrigerator - which was nice. The room had horrible lighting. The carpet and tiled-floors were filthy. The gym was nicer than the average hotel fitness centre but the pool was too small for a large hotel. Stay away if you're planning a longer stay or have luggage!

I always stay at this hotel (Waikiki tower) when visiting Oahu. Our room and bathroom are clean and they provided everything we need such as an ironing board, iron, coffee maker, and a mini refrigerator. We didn't care much for the view but we had an awesome city view that looks even better at night. But the best thing about it is that it is conveniently located right across the Ala Moana Shopping Center.

We were pleasantly surprised by this Hotel in Hawaii. The room was clean and we had a window with grill so it looked like a balcony and we were able to open the sliding door. It worked well for us. The service desk (Samantha) were helpful and even let us use the hospitality room to get ready for our long flight ... this was much appreciated. The Bell desk were very helpful holding our bags until our flight and when we came to book in our room was not ready but they looked after our bags until we returned to check in.We did not get a chance to try the other services of the Hotel but they looked really good especially the pool.Free Wifi was much appreciated.

I've stayed here twice. Conveniently located at the huge Ala Moana Shopping Center, which has every kind of restaurant and shops. Hotel is situation outside of the busy Waikiki and not far from the downtown Honolulu area. Stayed in a studio with one bedroom. My view was of the mountains and city, which I actually prefer. Lots of stuff to see. Well-managed and nearby city bus lines. Used their Laundromat. Many pilots and flight attendants. Good café downstairs and nightclub for dancing, too.

I was booked into this accommodation on a recent 5 day business trip.-Pros: -clean, modern-nice amenities such as a better than usual fitness room, pool, three restaurants including a dining room on the top floor, very well stocked convenience store (more like a grocery store including full liquor selection and the usual tourist paraphernalia)-close to the Ala Moana Park-free wi-fi-if you're into shopping it is connected via the second level and right next door to the Ala Moana shopping centre.-Cons (For me)-I was very disappointed in the check-in process. There were about 30 people waiting to get checked in and only two employees at the counter. It was about 45 minutes before I was served and with no apologies for the wait. This for me is inexcusable at a major and relatively pricey hotel.-The facility is large, sprawling and impersonal. It reminded me of convention centre type hotels elsewhere. Indeed, the honolulu convention centre is down the block. There were many large groups (tour groups, military groups, as well as airline personnel) so the hotel clearly caters to this kind of clientele. -Unbeknownst to me until check-in, the Ala Moana is actually a condominium/hotel and each room is privately owned. What this meant for me as a guest is that there is no housekeeping unless one calls the management company. I didn't like this.-The room is perfectly fine although with some maintenance issues. It is about as generic as you an get and there is nothing at all "Hawaiian" or personal about it. In my unit, the shower hook on the bathroom door had obviously been ripped off and the lamp by the bed attached to the wall was improperly secured and kept flipping upside down. The bed is comfortable and there is a little seating area. The 'kitchenette' consists of a microwave, mini fridge, coffee maker, mugs, glasses and wine glasses. No cutlery whatsoever, no wine opener, no dishes, no sink. I had a decent view of the hills and partial view of the ocean, as well as a not so nice view of the shopping mall parkade below. With the balcony open, there was quite a bit of traffic noise. The balcony is quite small with only a small table and two chairs. I also wished that there was a screen on the balcony.-Not the best choice if you're primary reason for visiting in the area is proximity to the beach. Since I am a walker this was no issue for me. Waikiki Beach is about a 20 minute walk. However, it is by no means on the beach and certainly not one of those beachfront hotels where one can readily go back and forth between one's room and the beach. A trip to the beach really does need to be planned. -Since I was on a business trip this suited my needs but if I was to visit again as a tourist, it certainly would not be my choice of accommodation.

last minute reservations, arrived and had to wait about an hour to check in, so many people in line and only three staff members to check in guests...the hotel room was extremely nice. two members of the hotel staff walked in on me to change shower curtain, unfortunately i was getting ready to go hit the beach so i was caught in the middle of changing clothes which made for quite an embarrassing moment. Otherwise its an awesome place to stay, love the fact I could walk directly into the ala moana shopping center from the 3rd floor..and just a few minutes walk from waikiki..

We have stayed at the Ala Moana many times and have never been disappointed. From the warm greetings at check in from the desk clerk to the helpful bell captain who helped us bring our bags out to our car when we were leaving we did not meet a single person who wasn't pleasant and helpful. The room was extremely comfortable and the microwave and fridge really are a nice alternative to eating out every single meal. I can not recommend it enough!! The location is perfect!! Just a short walk to the mall and a short walk to Waikiki. You get all the benefits of being able to walk to the beach without the hassle of Waikiki traffic. Nothing but good things to say about this hotel!! A real shining star was Jason the valet!! Super helpful and friendly!!!

I stayed here for three days just over two weeks ago. Didn't spend much time in the hotel but I must say it was very clean, staff were friendly and it is conveniently located right next to a mall and the Waikiki Beach shopping district. I stayed on the 31st floor from where the view of the city and ocean is really beautiful at night or day. The breakfast is great too with a wide buffet style selection.
user_name:
Ellsworth W
Freeport, Grand Bahama Island

review_body: Hawaii is just the place to forget about winter. The Ala Moana hotel is a clean, quiet and comfortable place to stay. It is not a beach front location, however Ala Moana park is a quick walk away and the hotel provides beach towels. Traffic is very heavy, we walk everywhere or take The Bus.Honolulu's bus schedules are good and prices reasonable.It beats paying 25-30 dollars a day for hotel parking. The hotel is next to the Ala Means shopping center, which has a great food court, many selections and moderate prices.l

My husband was losing his eye sight in right eye, had a emergency trip to Honolulu for eye surgery.Booked room for 4 nights. Due to having a second eye surgery and stay extended to 16 nights,with his surgery he was not allowed to fly home. Management helped get our rates more in line, which is wonderful as our insurance (HUMANA)is right now refusing to pay for our stay or transportation to get there. If you don't know the islands, well Honolulu is only island that does the retina surgery and flying is our only commercial transportation between islands. The staff was very pleasant, housekeeping was super good with working around our stay as well. I strongly recommend anyone to stay there, they were all very friendly and helpful when asking questions.

We liked this Hotel very much. Room was great,very quiet & the bed comfortable. Staff very friendly. The buffet breakfast was great value. On opposite corner to Ala Moana Shopping centre, which was just a very short walk.Would certainly recommend & would stay there again.

The staff at this hotel are always friendly and assistive, though one would expect this of all hotels in all of Hawaii as it is the culture. The property is always clean. The rooms are small, the beds are hard, the pillows uncomfortable, and the desk/working area is not ergonomic or ideal for long hours of working. The bathrooms are upgraded, closet space is ample. You have a combination microwave/oven in your room and a fridge. You are far enough away from traffic you will not be disturbed.The primary reason to stay at Ala Moana hotel is for the location. I pass through often on business and am not interested in the beach (though one can readily walk 10 minutes from the hotel to a very uncrowded beach), and I avoid Waikiki as much as humanly possible. The hotel is attached to the Ala Moana shopping center, and I do shop heavily when I pass through. The shopping center is open air and one of the best in the world for finding nearly anything you could imagine from groceries and the post office to high end designers. I can load up on items, and conveniently drop things off to my room, only to go back for more shopping. One can pass out Nordstrom and readily walk down the street also to Wal Mart and Sam's Club.I enjoy the walking I can acquire after many hours of flying -weather you walk the shopping center or to the beach. The shopping center has two locations also for picking up every major bus, and Oahu has excellent public transportation via the bus to anywhere on the island. One can also readily obtain a taxi from the hotel lobby. You are in a key location, away from heaps of tourists, and with ready public transportation.If you are looking for a beach resort, and a romantic room and destination, this hotel will not please you. If you are looking for a great price, at a key location, and can live without walking immediately onto a crowded beach, you'll be fine. If you plan on a few days of shopping, you might even consider staying here a few days, and then relocating to a beach resort.
user_name:
Frankie H
Pohnpei, Federated States of Micronesia

review_body: I have stayed here multiple times on business. The location is great, if you like shopping. The rooms are a good size with a microwave and mini fridge. However, in some rooms you can't adjust the thermostat so your room gets REALLY cold. Also, the beds aren't the greatest. All in all, this hotel is clean and comfortable with a decent fitness center.

On a recent business trip to Hawaii, I was booked at this hotel. I found the rooms the size of a postage stamp with no amenities. The room was clean and the maid was thorough each day. I did have a view of the ocean from the 13th floor. When I went to check in, reception had a difficult time finding my reservation. After much work on the part of Judy, my reservation was found. After checking in there was no one to take my luggage to my room. I had to do that myself. When I wanted to get a snack to eat in the early afternoon, there was nothing available in the hotel. I had to wait until the Signature Restaurant on the 36th floor opened for happy hour at 4:30. During happy hour, the drinks are expensive and the food at the bar is half price. But even that is not inexpensive. The only thing available for breakfast is the Plantation Cafe that serves a buffet from 6:30-10:30. The options are limited but taste good. The price is $16.50. There is no lunch served anywhere in the hotel. If one wants other food options it is a fairly long walk to get to Kalakaua Avenue where the restaurants and hotels are located. If one is interested in shopping that is essentially the same as what they have at home, then this is the place to stay. They have a huge shopping mall adjacent to the hotel that is anchored by Macy’s. If one wants souvenirs or Hawaiiana types of shopping, then this is not the place. I had a car the week that I was there and the valet service was very good. I wanted to go swimming on my free day and was told the beach was a 10 minute walk down by the harbor. What? No pool? I couldn’t find one and no one seemed to be able to tell me if there was one. If you are looking for cheap, then this is the place to stay. If you are looking for the Waikiki experience, then look elsewhere.

The Ala Moana Hotel in Honolulu, Hawaii is located next to the Ala Moana shopping mall. In fact there is direct access to the mall via a pedestrian ramp connecting the two properties.No!! The hotel is not in the Waikiki section of Honolulu, But it is a short walk - about 20 minutes to Waikiki. Or there are trollies and buses you can take.But on the other hand, you have direct access to the shopping mall, which claims to be the largest open-air mall in the world. There we found great shopping and dining. Some will argue that this beats the beach. But then it is easy to access the beach by crossing Ala Moana park across Ala Moana Blvd. a block away. Not a bad location for the hotel in Honolulu.Although the hotel was built in 1969, its age is not apparent. The hotel has been well maintained. It is actually quite modern, comfortable and relatively elegant, although, in our opinion, it is not luxurious. The hotel consists of two towers – the Kona Tower which is about 24 stories and the Waikiki Tower which is about 38 stories – which are connected at each floor.We stayed in the Kona Tower where we found our room to be a bit small but not too small to be uncomfortable – actually it was cozy. Our bath room was modern but typical “hotel” type and size.The front desk staff was fast, efficient, and friendly during check-in and check-out. And they had that “aloha” spirit which made us feel welcomed and appreciated.The hotel has a large, covered, looping, one-way driveway at the entrance. Thus, entering the property and returning to the street was easy which was nice when checking in and checking out - we could do this while not being on Atkinson Street, a very busy street out front. Also, the lobby is quite spacious and nicely decorated. And we found hotel security quite good as we needed out key cards to operate the elevators.As we didn’t have a car, we can’t report on parking at the hotel although, in that the quote a price for parking (we remember $20/night), we assume that parking facilities are available.It offers all the amenities one would expect in an upscale hotel – concierge and activity desk, dining, exercise facility, massage parlor, meeting room facilities, office work station area, gift shop, a great swimming pool, etc. Actually, the prices in the gift shop we found to be surprisingly reasonable where you can by a variety of typical gift shop items but also a nice selection of food items for a gift shop. We found the prices at the restaurant a bit pricey but the food was good.The room rates are reasonable when compared with quality accommodations in Honolulu, particularly in this area catering to shoppers in the Waikiki area. We are not saying that the rates are cheap. But cheap is not in the vocabulary in this part of Honolulu.We note that flight crews from many of the airlines stay here. This leaves us to conclude that the airline flight crews have a preference for the Ala Moana Hotel as it is approximately 7 miles from Honolulu International and in that many hotels are available much closer to the airport. We found this to be a bit interesting. We found that our stay was lots of fun here. But, how can one say otherwise – we are in Honolulu for crying out loud!!

Our stay was fantastic because of happy, helpful staff. The room on the other hand was just ok. Somewhat outdated and in need of some repairs and it was mostly clean. I say mostly because the coffee tasted like soap (probably cleaned the pot but wasn't rinsed) and the glassware all smelled strongly of windex. With no plastic on the cups or glasses I was not convinced they had been sanitized.

It had been 10 years since I stayed at this hotel. Prior to that we had stayed probably seven Christmases and new years in a row. This hotel has always been in a location that I preferred being outside the mad scramble of Waikiki. One thing that may not be made terribly clear to an outsider is that there are two towels to this hotel wangles 12 stories and the other 36. Change between the two is not possible. The hotel itself is pleasant if extremely impersonal. Arriving at reception one seals processed rather than welcomed. Indeed I felt I was just another person filling up yet another room. The room itself is quite small compact would be perhaps a fairer description. It lacks for nothing the bed is extremely comfortable and the air-conditioning is effective but not obtrusive. There was plenty of room for all my clothes which was good as I will be staying for 10 days. There is an extremely large and modern television set, a fridge ,a microwave and a coffee machine. The location is excellent and right across the road is and I'm on a park with excellent beach and the most marvellous viewing for sunsets. The room is serviced every day but it tends to be a bit sporadic in what is left. Some days you get a bath towel Sundays you have to call housekeeping and get one sent up. The same applies to the coffee and tea supplies, sometimes indeed the ice bucket gets a plastic bag other times it doesn't, and just other little details that seem to get overlooked. I know this is a hot climate but on two occasions I've found insects scuttling around the kitchen area of the room. When I reported it the lady on reception clearly didn't believe me and told somebody to come up because the guest thought that he had seen cockroaches. Indeed that is what I think they were but would not swear to it however I did kill one so it's not a figment of my imagination! All the planning and everything else works absolutely fine and was in very good state of repair. Although these sorts of hotels take a tremendous amount of hammering with people coming and going the general condition of the room in particular and the hotel in general is excellent. On the first night I arrived I was so exhausted after the trip out from the UK that I at in the signature restaurant on the top. It was quite perfect but extremely expensive but boasts a fantastic view of Waikiki. As the name suggests it is right next door to the Alamo wanna shopping centre which is interesting to see as it is full of ridiculous luxury shops catering purely to the Japanese market. The bed as I said is comfortable and I sleep very well and all in all enjoying my stay here. It's probably just me but I feel that I have come and gone in this establishment without anyone caring two hoots whether I was here or not. However please don't let this put you off I can recommend this hotel to anybody and it has so much to recommend it. Two of the heights of my day is enjoying the blue sky from my window while enjoying my coffee and the other is enjoying a gin and tonic watching the sunset. Fabulous. I would give this establishment comfortable four stars , but a little more warmth and welcome on the front desk, and attention to detail by the room service staff. I can recommend this hotel wholeheartedly.

spent 3 days there with my wife and 2 daughters. amazing. the hotel is great, and staff friendly. outside the hotel, you must go to the ala moana center. this is a mall and in the center of the walkway you have a pond filled up with enormous koi fish. it's wonderful. then we went for a walk on ala moana boulevard, and whoa!!! those type of orchid trees are just magnificent. i mean it's hawaii 5 0 ten times better, and on the beach the forest of surf board. i'll go back, that's for sure

Stayed at the Ala Moana Hotel for one night before we did the Pride of America Cruise. The reason l stayed here is that it was close to the Port. We had Mountain views and in Kona Tower 4. It was a great location. Walking distance to the Ala Moana Shopping Centre. Ala Moana Beach Park which was great for an evening walk. The hotel bed was very comfortable and the staff very friendly and helpful. The pool looked good with a life guard on standby but didn't use any of the facilities. Enjoyed the nights accommodation very much.

Had the opportunity to stay at the Ala Moana hotel while on Oahu for business. Accommodations for the most part were good. Room was very spacious. And you cannot beat the location. It is right next to the Ala Moana Center which has tons of shopping and food options. It is also very easy to get to various locations in Honolulu from this hotel.The drawbacks: There were a couple of things that I did not like about the hotel. The first is the size of the shower stall. It is an extremely tight fit (I'm not the smallest guy) and I repeatedly bumped my elbow on the handicap handrail. My second complaint is the business center. I needed to print up and then fax a 12 page document that was holding up a substantial financial deal. In order to print anything, I had to log onto the computers in the business center, which cost me around $15 for 5 minutes. That coupled with a price of 50 cents per page printed and no fax machine available to fax the document was very disappointing.

we stayed at Ala Moana Hotel the night before our Norwegian cruise. The hotel was close to the pier but also close enough to Waikiki that we took a couple of hours to walk around and have a great breakfast.

We stayed one night as a stop over on our way to Kauai. I chose the hotel for its proximity to the airport, and the mall nearby as we had a little spare time before our flight. The room was good, bed comfortable, staff friendly and helpful and the location was great!

The best thing about Ala Moana Hotel is it's location. Easy to get around Honolulu from this hotel and next door the Ala Moana Mall. The room seemed small but there was a small balcony. It had a microwave and mini fridge and coffee pot.

Very reasonable rates and I love the location. Just outside of the busy Waikiki area but still just a short walk. The staff was very pleasant and upgraded my room to a higher level with ocean view. I'll return!

We rented 3331 through VBRO for 9 nights. The price was great, we have used them and stayed in several other condos at this hotel before. This one was not great, it is need of repair. From lights burned out, fixtures that are broken no amenities, not enough towels. Just not a good unit! We love this location next to the Center and walking distance to anywhere. We will continue to stay here just not in this unit!

Very Polite concierge and customer service is awesome. i arrived before the check-in time and they allowed me to check-in early :-) Nice location as it is attached to the Ala Moana Center. Rooms are clean and well-maintained. No noisy neighbors. My stay was pleasant and will definitely check in again in this hotel.

The hotel was nice and clean, however for the price I would have expected nicer linens on the bed such as the nice comforters you find at the Sheraton. I stayed in the Kona tower and faced the parking structure. DO NOT stay on that side. Very noisy. Garbage collection is at 5am and extremely loud. Stay in the main tower if you can.
