Room has a coffee maker, microwave and little fridge which is very convenient. Hotel is adjacent to the Ala Moana Mall which is also very convenient - good shopping and restaurants (typical restaurant chains not local restaurants). Mall has a food court which was great for breakfast and lunch. Hotel not near the beach, there is a park beach nearby but a 15 min walk and no beach chairs on the beach. Its about a $10 taxi to Waikiki Beach or 20 mins by Trolley which is $2.

I stayed here for 5 nights and the experience was wonderful. After reading many of the reviews before arriving I became quite anxious as to what to expect, especially since I booked the Kona tower which is the shorter, older tower with "cozier" rooms. I arrived at the hotel about 1:30pm and went to check-in, wondering if they'd allow me to or not since I was early. They checked the system and showed my room was ready so they let me check in an hour and a half before 3pm check-in time! I had requested a room on a high floor (which I always do regardless) so they put me on the 11th floor of the 13 story tower. That's perfect for me. I typically ask for rooms on high floors and away from elevators because I prefer quiet -- unfortunately this room was literally across from the ice machine but people didn't seem to use it too much. The only other issue with noise is that you can hear the garbage trucks early in the morning, but keep in mind you are in the heart of a city so city noises are to be expected on occasion. Anyway, the room was very nice and clean, had a mountain view, desk area, couch, arm chair, closet space, microwave, refrigerator, fluffy towels. I walked to the nearby 7-11 and stocked up on some water and other snacks. I found nothing wrong with the room throughout my 5 night stay. I would definitely recommend choosing this hotel if you're on a budget as it's probably cheaper than the Waikiki hotels -- and Waikiki is only about a 15-20 minute walk away - which I walked to and from a few times. You can also walk to the Ala Moana park and beach for some swimming and sunsets. And of course the mall is right next to the hotel, so shopping and eating opportunities galore! Since part of my trip was for a conference I also got to experience the hotels facilities and food service for conferences - which was excellent as well. Thank you Ala Moana for making my first trip to Honolulu a wonderful and unforgettable experience. I look forward to coming back soon!

Great views. It is right next door to major shopping centre (Ala Moana Shopping Centre) and just a short bus ride to Waikiki Beach. Helpful staff. Clean rooms. The bed was comfortable. Air con was quiet. Enjoyed our stay.

I spent 6 hours browsing at Ala Moana Center  on my visit back to Honolulu. It's a must visit place. I noticed a line of seniors waiting for the entertainment on the stage so I waited too. It turned out to be the Royal Hawaiian Band that played wonderful nostalgic songs as well as Hawaiian songs. There were 2 singers that perform with the Band. In the afternoon, there were Hula dancers that performed. What fun entertaining surprise for a visit at the shopping center.

I stayed here for a conference; it was adequate. I appreciated the cleanliness, quick elevator, peek-a-boo view of the harbor, and close proximity to the mall, which is full of shops and restaurants. However, it's not where I would chose to stay for a vacation, given that it's not on the beach. If you don't mind a $12 taxi ride to Waikiki though, it could be a good option.

very nice and spacious hotel, enjoyed it a lot! close to the ala moana mall and ala moana park.A little far from waikiki beach but that's fine with me. parking is a little expensive. and I parked in the park during the day. I did street parking at night and did little walk back to hoteldefinitely would recommend to others.
user_name:
zhenyu w
Union City, California, United States

review_body: Been staying in this hotel every time I go to hawaii with my dad. The rooms are well maintained. Staffs is very friendly and helpful in every way that they can. Location wise its very good! It's connected at ala moana center. Waikiki is also walkable but it you dont like walking you can take the bus or just rude the trolley which is also good for tourist who likes sight seeing.Don Quijote, Ross and walmart is only 10-15mins walk away. good food can be found inside the hotel and lots of restaurant and fast food within the area.Beware that if you book via booking.com or agada. youre probably mot booking in ala moana but a condo unit in ala moana hotel. The ala moana is a condo hotel so it would be safer if you call the hotel through there direct contact number.

My colleagues and I coordinated a national conference at the AMH and we are so pleased with the service we have experienced! From booking, to setting up for the conference, and holding the actual conference.... the service of AMH was superb! And for us kamaaina who chose to stay at the AMH during the conference, Aunty Iva at the front desk was terrific!! Love her. I now want to make follow up reservations to watch the Magic Island fireworks from the AMH!

I've stayed here many times in the past. Our room 1230 was very dated with old bedspreads peeling wall paper, rust around the sink, musty tub with hair and sand upon checkin. Shower curtains needs to be changed. mold on the bottom. Due for a upgrade.we were there over the weekend of a lot of State High School championships. Loud music next door to us late at night and early in the morning. Lucky we were only in our room to go to bed.KOA at valet is the BEST!!!! He fills the role of GREET HELP AND THANK...always smiling with a awesome personality making sure we knew where we were going & always striking up a conversation. The crew at Valet is very friendly.

While the lobby isn't bad and the rooms were clean, prepare to be gouged! The beds also aren't comfortable at all. There were two co workers in my room with two beds. We called downstairs to ask for an extra packet of coffee for the in-room coffeemaker. We were told we'd need to come downstairs and pay $2.50 for that. I went downstairs to pay the $2.50 and told them I wanted a receipt for it since a group I was presenting to was paying for my room. It took the employee about 20 minutes to figure out how to print my receipt for the $2.50 ... and that's 20 minutes of her time and 20 minutes of my time over a packet of coffee. I asked to see manager and explained that there were two of us in the room and only one packet of coffee? He suggested that we could run it through twice. Needless to say, we decided we would take all of our get-togethers for drinks and meals outside of the hotel and that the only dollars they would get of ours would be the $2.50. They also advised that this is because each room is individually owned or condo units. Of course, it says "Alo Moana Hotels," so the person booking doesn't know this. Travel a great deal and this is the first time I've taken the time to review something. Manager not helpful. Oh, yeah, and after paying the $2.50 and taking 20 minutes of my time to do so, they didn't leave it in the room that day and I had to call downstairs again for it. I would not again stay at an Outrigger hotel, and particularly, this one.

If you want to pay too much for little sleep and scummy bedspreads, this is the hotel for you!Great location next to the Ala Moana Shopping Centre, but the hotel is feeling it's age, especially if you get in the Kona Tower. If you get a discounted rate with AA or Kama'aina, you get the Kona Tower.Construction started out our room at 3:00 am. The decor is very dated with old bedspreads, few pillows, old carpets.For the high price, not impressed. We have stayed many times because of the location and only as a stopover to another island. This was the worst visit due to the construction.

ok is the best hotel in honululu,because is wonderfull ,all is good in the best location near the big shopping center,with the best view to the city and the beach is near to everythin is perfect and lovely...

My study of Honolulu hotels was they are all old and unless they have been updated they can be quite nasty. This hotel had some renovation going on based on reviews. We did not get renovated room, but it was clean and comfortable and everything worked. It has a good location all the amenities we wanted. So, other than the high price I would have gave it five stars.

I really have no complaints about this hotel. I booked this trip to Honolulu rather spontaneously and was looking for a decently priced inclusive tour on Expedia. The Ala Moana was just in the right price range and close to where I wanted to go on the island. Their standard room was small, but had everything in it you need for a few days on Hawaii - really nice to have a microwave and fridge. My room rate came with a breakfast buffet voucher and their breakfast was decent, without being overly exciting or delicious. The fruit selection was probably the best feature. It was also a nice surprise that the breakfast room never seemed crowded, despite the hotel being completely booked over Presidents Day. The nearby Ala Moana Beach Park offers a very well kept sandy beach and great swimming areas. Take your camera and take pictures of the dozen or so wedding couples being there all the time for their wedding pictures..The worst part of the stay at the Ala Moana was their check in. I happened to arrive at exactly 3pm when their check in starts and there were huge lines. It took at least 30 minutes to get checked in and I see (shorter) lines at other times too.I would probably try another hotel next time, but would also settle for the Ala Moana if the price is right again.

We loved staying at this hotel, especially since it has a walking bridge on the second floor to the parking lot and then the mall next door. So if you've forgot something, no worries. You've got the ABC and Long's drugs as well as hundreds of other stores to do all of your shopping.The hotel staff was very helpful whenever I had a question. And the location was perfect for Waikiki beach in that it was only a 15-minute walk or a couple of minutes bus ride. It's 2 blocks from a 7-eleven and other "local" restaurants if you go away from the beach about 3 blocks and really get out of the touristy areas...My only complaint was that if you get a room in the back tower, you'll hear the garbage/service trucks in the morning, which made it difficult to get back to sleep after they came roaring through. But if you were to stay in the front, 36-story tower, I think that issue would be resolved. That was the reason I gave the hotel a 4 out of 5. If that's not an issue or you book a hotel in the front tower, 5 out of 5 for sure....Also what was great was we spent our last day taking the City/Pearl Harbor tour (leaving the hotel around 6:15 and returning around 5). Well, we had to check out, of course, because we returned too late. But the front desk person told us that when we return, we can use their hospitality room to shower and freshen up, which was a blessing in disguise since we had a red eye back to LAX.

This trip to Waikiki was not my best planned visit, on purpose. Instead of booking well in advance, I figured I would walk on the wild side of adventure and find new places to stay and review. My first hotel was the New Otani. It is a great beach hotel and under renovation but still nice. Then I moved out to the North Shore and stayed B&B style. Now, my last night in Hawaii I decided to try the Ala Moana. This is a big hotel. They upgraded me to an ocean king room (across from the ice machine and elevators - it happens). The room is big for Waikiki, every room has a balcony. My view was fabulous. The staffers were very nice and happy to chat about the islands. The parking is a little cheaper than many of the hotels around here and you can self-park if you like. The room had a fridge and microwave which might be handy for longer stays. The hotel is attached to the mall so shopping and restaurants abound. Across the street is a yacht club and park. From the mall there are trolly shuttles and The Bus. I have looked at this hotel before and the standard prices are usually a little high for me, but the sale price is usually a good deal - which played into why I stayed this time. Other than the expected noise from the elevators/vending/ice, the hotel is a great place to stay.

This is our second time staying here and love it! We're close enough to the beach, yet not too close to get all the people. Right next to the mall which is so convenient for shopping and restaurants. The rooms are clean and have everything we need. Valet parking an extra expense but well worth it since my husband is here working. We come to Hawaii yearly and will be staying here again.

The Ala Moana Shopping Center next door has everything you could possibly need. To keep from getting lost between hotel and mall, just remember the skybridge is outside Macy's, 2nd level, jewelry section.Several buses go past the mall, including Lines 19 and 20 which will get you downtown to Iolani Palace. That saves having to think about parking the car.We got a hotel + rental car package, about $1300 for six nights. Room with two full beds; Chevrolet Spark or equivalent from Alamo. That size car was fine for the two of us. The package didn't include hotel parking of $20/day, so you will have to pay for that separately while you're there.The bathroom showerhead is at a comfortable angle to lean over the tub and wash your hair. That can speed up getting ready if you want to shower the night before, then just wash your hair in the morning.I would definitely stay at the Ala Moana again.

Lovely hotel. Great location across from Ala Moana Beach park and the boat harbor. Employees are very friendly and accomodating. Only weird thing is no room service...? Why? Not sure. 3 restaurants and some stores. Right next door to the Giant Ala Moana shopping center. Safe and comfy.

Return visit to the Ala Moana but it has been a while. The first thing to note is that this hotel is not on the beach. It is a block from Ala Moana Blvd and then across from Ala Moana Park so to get to the water, you need to walk a little bit. It is, however right on the Ala Moana Shopping Center property if that is something you want to do. Upon arrival at 1pm they didn't have my room ready and said to come back at 3 to check in. I was a little upset about that as I felt they could have moved me to another similar room that they had ready. Anyway, the room is nice, and felt clean. One down side is the bathroom is very small. You can't sit on the toilet first and then try to close the door. The bed was comfortable. Also, there is a little fridge and microwave in the room which comes in handy. Another distracting item was the street noise. It was very loud at night and in the morning with the sliding door open if your room faces Diamondhead. Maybe ask for a room facing the shopping center to see if it is quieter.

as usual a great place to stay.away from Waikiki but not too far.of course its the best place to stay if you like to shop.alamoana mall has over 290 stores and its just a ramp away from the hotel.beach across the road is good too.swimming,picnics,weddings etc etc.

This would not be a destination hotel for me, but it was very nice. We did not arrive until 3 a.m., but staff was nice and efficient. The airline paid for the room, so I cannot speak to value. We had three hours to kill the day we checked out, so not enough time to see the area, but we meandered through the mall and had good coffee there. Totally acceptable for our purposes.

I had the pleasure to stay at the Ala Moana after missing a connection in Hawaii. I don't know if this would be the best location for a vacation trip where you wanted to spend a lot of time on Waikiki, as it is a short walk (but longer than other area hotels), but for the business traveler, it's a fine choice, and if you were using Oahu as a jumping off point to various other things on Oahu or even the neighboring islands, it's a good hotel. The breakfast buffet, while $17, is a great one with lots of choices.

Not too close to Waikiki, but walkable, and close to shopping, eatery and mall. The Waikiki tower is very clean and nice. The Ala Moana beach park is right across the hotel and is a very quiet, and very nice place to walk and to swim.

right next door to the Ala Moana Mall. Waking up early, I crossed the parking lot to find Starbucks open at 6am:). There is a nice gift shop in the lobby. Pool is nice, but very windy. No food or snack bar there...only a fancy Chinese restaurant on the same floor (3), which apparently brings in those looking for that. The pillows are awful and the beadspreads seem 50 years old...in bad need of an update on the beds and bedding. Nice big flat tv, microwave. Lots of city noise...not a vacay stay...i'm exhausted

property great, staff awesome....I checked in this hotel many times. one of the regular clerks frontdesk Heidi had the worst guest. I was at the next counter. I overheard everything. Mr. woobury is what I heard the manager call him. his wife was mouthing off in a very cocky way. He was mad because the room wasnt ready. I always go here I never experienced a scene like this before. I'm gonna say the visitors were from International(definetely not from here)they had an accent. I from the islands and you never treat people like that..you treat others how you wanted to be treated. the clerk heidi held her ground. I could see the manager getting a little steamed also. what can you do... If you going be Ugly ATTITUDE than stay home... I myself will continue to come here everytime I go to Oahu. Heidi at frontdesk is AWESOME.. I love Alamoana Hotel.

I would never stay at this hotel, or any other hotel run by Luxury Suites International again. The commercial arrangements between the hotel operator, the condominium owners and the marketing company make for a guests nightmare. The staff are incredibly rude, unhelpful and hide behind the marketing company and owners as their copout for every problem. The guest is caught in the middle and absolutely powerless to make anyone achieve any kind of sensible outcome.Never again.

I have stayed at the Ala Moana a few times. The service is always really good. The front desk, valet, mini store, everyone is always polite and helpful. The rooms are small and dated, with old fashion bed covers, but it's clean and a good value for business trips. Close to the mall and a good people watching food court next door.

This hotel was amazing. Felt like a first class hotel. Even though I stayed here for one night due to airplane issues. The Ala Moana hotel seems humble, first rate and charming. The bell service was fast even though the hotel was busy. The front staff were nice. My only thing though was the bed was kind of hard and the bedding seemed a little dated. That though can be overlooked by the location of the mall and the beach.

The Ala Moana Hotel is conveniently located near Honolulu's biggest mall. Connected by a parking lot ramp you have easy access to several stores and restaurants including Macy's, Starbucks, and many others. Plus when you stay here you get 10% off at Macy's. (Including: sale clearance, and regular price. Offer may change without notice) Overall The Ala Moana Hotel is a great value, however they should consider remodeling their main tower of rooms...

My husband and I recently stayed at this hotel and had the best server at the Plantation Cafe ever. Her name was Miyoko. She went above and beyond her job duties to serve us, and even toasted our french toast for us. She always kept our glasses full and ensured our needs was met. She had a very pleasant attitude, sociable, and showed the "spirit of Aloha." I can not say enough about this employee who definitely gave us a 5-star experience. While staying for the three nights at the hotel our room maid named Florida always provided us with a clean room, adequate toiletries, towels, and also ensured our needs was met. It made our experience a comfortable one which we both will never forget. I'm not sure if your hotel honors these type of 5 star employees, but I definitely believe they need to be recognized for their awesome service. If I had a choice to return to O'ahu again, I would stay at the Ala Moana Hotel!

I recently stayed at the Ala Moana as I was attending a conference which was at the hotel. The location is excellent if you plan to shop and it is walking distance to the beach (nice enough to visit, but not ideal for enjoying the beach). The beach area appears to be somewhat 'ghettoish.' Do not have expectations of finding restaurants open on public holidays as everything is closed. We walked for over an hour and a half on Old Years' night looking for something to eat, restaurants were closed. When I arrived at Ala Moana, I was advised that the hotel was fully booked and there is no option to change the room. Initially, I booked a room with two beds, I had a room with a queen (small) size bed. The next day, the staff at the front desk informed me that secret service and military people stayed there and they were fully booked so there were not many options to change. As well, they were expecting 100 people from Quantas. I agreed to pay an upgrade charge to change rooms and was given a room with a better view, but the carpets were stained and this room catered to people with disabilities. I was very disappointed. This is when I became sick. The following day, they assigned me a much nicer room, with two beds (my son was already paying at another hotel), it was difficult for him to cancel his reservations. So in essence, we double paid for accommodations. This hotel is over-priced and staff not very accommodating. North Shore was a beautiful drive, we stopped along the way and bought coconut water, fresh pineapple, papaya and Hawaiian shaved ice. Outside of the city, you can experience the authentic Hawaiian culture and the warmth of the local people. We ate at the Signature restaurant on Saturday night ($$$), the food and service was really good. I returned later in the week, was very disappointed both with the food and the service. Breakfast was not included with the room price of $175. Soap/shampoo/towels were not always replaced. Rooms were not cleaned properly everyday.This is an average over-priced hotel.

Stayed here 2 nights and found it to be the best value for money out of our entire trip. It is a great hotel if you are planning on being out most of the day and need a good comfortable place to come back to. It is also located right next to the Ala Moana shopping centre which makes it great for shopping. Parking is USD 20/day which is reasonable.The rooms are pretty spacious and comes with breakfast and free wifi in every room. Breakfast was basic but sufficient - they provide fresh fruits and different dishes everyday so nothing to complain about. It also has a pool and gym and is overall well maintained. Service was pretty good as we got extra pillows without much of a fuss or delay.

This hotel is in a great location for shopping. Hotel restaurant (Signatures) is very dear. There is both a Chinese and Japanese restaurant in the hotel itself. Cafe only open for breakfast, but was good value esp with senior ( over 55) discount. Do not book this hotel on a public holiday as everything is closed. Nothing is open in the near vicinity. Would need to grab a taxi to Waikiki. Did find a locals supermarket a few blocks away and was able to buy some basic food.Our room wasn't ready when we first arrived - early, and this was expected. After a couple of hours we were offered a queen room, rather than the booked king as still wasn't ready, which we took. Hmm. Not a queen size bed. Definitely a double. Not sure if American sizing is different to us, but certainly something to check. I'd be always going for a king where possible, just in case.Pool area was good. Clean but water very cold. Lots of loungers but NO umbrellas or shade of any sort.Staff was good but not particularly forthcoming with information.An ok hotel. Depends on what you are looking for and be aware of location.If you intend doing a lot of shopping at Ala Moana Shopping Centre, then it is perfect. Spend 2 days at the hotel. Do all your shopping then move to a Waikiki hotel. Also good as a stopover hotel if you intend flying to another island. Close to airport so will save on taxi charges.

We booked 2 nights here through Luxury Suites and we had a nice hotel room with a view of the Ocean. 22nd floor view gave us nice views of Honolulu and the location being right beside the Ala Moana Shopping Centre was nice.Staff was friendly and helpful and we didn't use any other amenities. I felt that it was overpriced but it suited our needs. Very clean and dated but was nice.

This is a decent hotel. Honolulu prices (with a conference discount, about $175 for a king size bed room). I was there for a conference. I think over priced for room. But isn't that any hotel? Waikiki is about $300 for same type of room.The room is small. Like many hotels. The "mountain view" is a mountain view. However, IF one looks down, you will find a gross street view. Busy street with a lot of parking lots. So, don't count on the mountain view. This hotel is a block away from the main Honolulu mall .So if you are there to shop, then you are in close proximity to it. The staff is friendly. The housekeeping is friendly and honest. I left a coat in my room and the housekeeping didn't steal it! :-) They returned it to a friend of mine who lives in Waikiki This hotel is on a main bus line. So you can take a $2.40 bus to downtown Waikiki if needed OR about a $10 cab ride. OR walk to Waikiki area for one (ish) miles. About 2 blocks from the marina Near by restaurants? NOT in the MALL Akasaka sushi (between two "clubs" AKA: strip clubs). AWESOME sushi! Delicious, affordable, yum yum yum.Station bar. Two blocks away. Low key bar. Small. Clean. Great service. AFFORDABLE! 678 BBQ (right next to station bar). Be prepared for the line of people. Cheeseburger Waikiki (great happy hour 3-6pm). About four blocks away. It's a chain so find the nearest one to the hotel. BEACH? Yes there is one across the street. It's NOT a ... "take your breath away beach"/ I want to swim in it, immediately" But it's near a park (that is a little ghetto). It is right next the the marina. There is a path for people to walk/run. See the sunset there vs. swim in the ocean there. RENT A CAR? Do NOT go through the hotel. It's a price increase. Rent a car AT LEAST one day prior to when you need it through an alternative location. We had to last minute rent same day. So RENT ONLINE and pick up AT LOCATION. It will save you $$$. We could have rented a car online for $45 but we were charged $65 at the enterprise. Another example, that SAME day rental for $65 through enterprise (don't go there... love to scam!) the hotel could get us one for a discount at $85. PLACES TO SEE? Don't like the Waikiki hustle? Go to the north shore: Haleiwi (about 45 minutes). Just go. Trust me. Go to Haleiwi Joes near the marina. Ask what to do. Friendly locals. They'll give you the best of the best. Awesome beaches. Great to watch the waves. Cool waterfall hikes and NOT in the CITY of Honolulu. Beautiful scene.

This hotel is right next to the Ala Moana Mall and even has an entrance from the 2nd floor of the hotel to the 3rd level of the parking lot at the Macy's end. It is only one block from the Ala Moana Beach Park entrance, close to "The Bus" transit center on both sides of the mall and half a block from the Convention Center. There are several restaurants inside the Hotel including a new one, Signature Prime Steak & Seafood ($$$$), on the 36th floor of the Hotel with great views. Yuzu, located on the mall side of the rear section "Kona Tower" of the hotel, is a little bit of a different type of Japanese restaurant with a different but tasty take on sushi and appertizers. The traditional Royal Garden Restaurant has Chinese cuisine for dinner and Dim Sum for lunch. Finally, for a breakfast buffet, there is the Plantation Cafe on the Convention Center side of the Waikiki Tower. Friday and Saturday Nights there is a nightclub called "Rumours" that opens up with an entrance in the lobby of the hotel. There is a large outdoor pool and tanning patio with about 40 - 50 tanning chairs located on the 3rd floor next to the Gym and across from the Royal Garden Restaurant. The Gym is outfitted with the latest in exercise equipment and has steam and sauna rooms.Overall, the Kona Tower rooms are smaller, about 250 sf, with only single queen beds, less expensive and the Kona Tower only goes up to the 13th floor. The Waikiki Tower is 36 stories tall and has better views and larger rooms, about 340 sf, but is more expensive. The Ala Moana Hotel is a totally non-smoking hotel and does not charge a resort fee like some other hotels. Great hotel outside of the congestion of Waikiki Beach and nice place to be for the New Years Holiday week.

The room and location was decent, but that's it. The rate was outrageous, and the hotel charged me for parking after giving me a parking voucher that was suppose to waive the fee. Bad Customer service

I stayed in the Ala Moana Hotel but I did book my hotel through a private condo rentals agency (courtesy of Priceline); I was in the smaller tower with no balcony. The room was small- but it was only me so it wasn't a problem. I had a nice bed with what turned out to be a pull out couch (I had no idea it was a pull out couch). There were laundry facilities on my floor which I used and were great. I had to contact the Private Condo Rentals Agency about the internet and not only did they help me with the internet but they suggested a few local attractions and really catered to what I liked (even suggesting fireworks on the beach across the road giving me the best location to go to to have the best view). The location was great- the adjoining parking lot was to the Ala Moana Mall; I checked out the mall- it was really expensive but nice to check out. I rented a car and was able to explore the island.I would definitely recommend this hotel; the price was perfect and the hotel was pretty close to all of the things I wanted to do/see.

I don't like the crowds in the main drag of Waikiki. Give me close proximity to the beach (check), shopping (check), clean hotel (check) and pleasant staff (check) and you have Ala Moana hotel. Not fancy, not expensive, not cheap. Been to a few places in and around Waikiki and you can do better and you can do worse. Ala Moana Hotel is favored by airline crews so that should be a tipoff that its a pretty good place. Nice thing is they have Rumors club which has some decent dancing during the week, and for guests I think its free (or we just wandered in without paying hehehehe). Honestly, some room views aren't great, but I don't spend alot of time looking out the window. They are renovating the swimming pool and they have a great steam room. Hottest that I've been in to be honest. The front desk folks are not real excitable, but they are helpful. And the best thing is the hotel is next to the Ala Moana Mall.

Let me preface this review by saying we booked a private condo here through a rentals website. We were in the smaller tower with no balcony. The room was small and somewhat dated. However, it was the best deal we could find for the week of New Year's. The location was prefect for us. The Ala Moana mall is across the parking lot and has tons of shopping & dining options (I suggest Mai Tai's on the 4th floor). The mall is supposedly the largest outdoor mall in the states and was incredible. The hotel is also near Ala Moana beech and bus routes to get you anywhere on the island. Waikiki is a 15 minute walk away or you can take the bus. The gift shop at Ala Moana is huge and had everything you need. I suggest skipping the breakfast at Plantations (overpriced & bland) and going to Eggs n Things on the other side of the mall. All of the staff at Ala Moana were great. I'd probably give it a higher rating if we were in the nice tower.

This hotel is located next to ala Moana shopping centre. And adjacent to convention centre and parks. It is near safe beaches and restaurants. I used it to stay before the honolulu marathon. It's easily accessable by taxi and shuttle. About 25 minutes by shuttle from airport.

This place is amazing! Brilliant location. Super friendly and efficient staff. Gym, pool, laundry, restaurants, gift shop, convenience store all on site. Ala Moana Shopping Centre is a carpark away! Free high speed WiFi!! Great bed and shower! All the TV channels needed for those relaxing times. Walking distance to anywhere you could want to go!! I'm definitely coming back here for my next trip to Oahu!

We selected this hotel based on price and that it was near the bus route -- and not far from Waikiki. We were surprised by how nice it was. May be an older hotel, but has been well maintained. We were upgraded to a suite both times we stayed there. (Before and after the Norwegian Cruise around the islands.) It even has a "bridge" from the 2nd floor of the hotel to the Ala Moana shopping center. We saw lots of air line flight crews in the lobby. Recommend!!!

I thought all cheap hotels in Waikiki area are OLD and 80's style interior but this Ala Moana hotel was wayyyy better than I thought. Most hotels in Honolulu are very old that I know.I love shopping and walking on the beach. The mall is connected to the hotel is plus. You can walk to the ala moana beach. I don't like Ala Moana Beach so we just drove to North shore, Kailua, Sandy beach and Makapuu.Hotel lobby and room....everything renovated.I didn't know the hotels charge a resort fee in HI. I was surprised the final bill was higher than I thought when I checked out. The paid parking every hotel even this hotel connected to the mall, we can't park at the mall over night.I'll stay here again when I visit to Honolulu.

When i travel, I stay in small, relatively inexpensive hotels. Last week my wife had eye surgery and KP.org put us up at the Ala Moana Hotel, hard by the eponymous (and enormous) mall, halfway between downtown HNL and Waikiki. The rack rate quoted for this hotel was $170 and on line they were offering a Kamaaina rate of 139. I guess I don't stay in city hotels very often and when i do I use a search engine like Hotwire or Expedia. There is no way I would pay that much for this hotel. But if you are the sort of person who would, let me relate to you our experience: The hotel is huge with two towers. We were in the Kona tower that ran to a dozen floors. the main tower is bigger. It was clean, check in was pretty fast and check out was handled with a phone call. There is a huge port cochere with a flock of bell people.  As we checked in there were a brace of JAL sterwardi competing for the reception. while there we noted that a large number of the guests were younger Japanese. If you are Japanese and under 25 (and have plenty of money) you may feel very comfortable here. The hotel is connected to the parking lot of the four story Ala Moana mall by a bridge. My wife did so well with her surgery that we had dinner with friends in a nicer chain restaurant, so this was convenient for us. if you like to shop, it might be convenient for you, too.  There was a microwave and refrigerator in our room and the TV worked great. If all this is what you look for on vacation, and you have plenty of money (or someone else is paying for it) The Ala Moana might be just the thing. jeff

I have travelled to Hawaii over 20 times. The last three years have all been business trips (6) with an extra 4 days added for R&R. We have stayed here 4 times. At $190 a night it is a good value. We like the close proximity to Conv. Ctr and great restaurants nearby. Only complaints are: 1. redo the old tile in the steam room. Been moldy for two years and breaking up. Fix the lights that gang down that are supposed to be flush. 2. Get the pool boy off his butt and give him a hose to clean the deck under the cabana areas where birds poop. This should be done daily. While he is at it all the chaise loungers should be cleaned daily too. Today I have watched him sit and not move for three hours.

Booked a deal thru Groupon purporting to be the Alamoana in Honolulu. Got there and the room we got was run by a private manager. There was no soap in our room. Alamoana refused to give us soap so we had to go buy our own. They gave us a 24 hour phone to call the manager but all we could do is leave a message. Unfortunately all was prepaid or we would have checked out and gone somewhere else. The third nite we returned to the room and my friends bed spread was gone from his bed. We called at 7:30pm -left a message. No response. Also unknown before we got here, any food/beverage other hotel charges CANNOT be charged to the room but yet the Alamoana insisted on scanning my credit card for "incedentals" and putting a $55 charge on my card. For what? They didn't help me.

I'd always liked the Ala Moana Hotel and went there frequently to pick up friends and have dim sum, but the last time I got a nasty surprise. I was late for lunch so I used the valet parking. When I was done an hour later I got my ticket validated at the restaurant. I gave the ticket to the valet who then told me I owed $25 (without tip). There was no sign and no verbal notification ahead of time, so this is either a new policy or a scam by the three valets. Interesting that my two friends who left right after were not charged at all. So what gives guys?

Perfectly located close to Waikiki but with convenient parking. Shopping at your doorstep the entire ALa Moana Shopping Center. Clean comfortable rooms at fair price.This is our hotel of choice when visiting Honolulu which we do regularly. This last time we had as small exhibit at the COnvention Center. We had two rolling bags to carry all our display. We walked to the convention center in 10 minutes and no hassle with parking. If you request the new tower the rooms are larger and more comfortable. However the Kona tower smaller rooms are still nicely appointed.

Our rooms were too small and the staff was not very accommodating to my family who preferred to use the staircase over the elevator for exercise and other personal reasons. I would have liked to put a rating down between poor and average. For some people, this hotel setting will work. I didn't find this hotel to be average, when compared to the cleanliness and decor of Choice Hotels which are not high end but are average - very clean, often have a pool and free breakfast. The lobby bathroom had an odour that bothered us too. Frankly, there are other hotels close by that allow you to walk the short distance to the mall. It wasn't worth it to stay here while on vacation so we switched over for a bit more money and lot more customer service.

We stayed at a private 1-bedroom unit (VRBO) on Fl #24 and it was amazing. It faced the ocean with a sunset each night. Clean and fully stocked with kitchen cookware/utensils. Lots of room for family of 4. Although it's a private rental, you still deal with hotel staff for check-in/out and standard hotel services and they were all great. Steps away from Ala Moana mall and parks/beaches. Dealing wiht the rental company, Maruyama Realty, was so easy and comfortable - They are trust-worthy! Highly recommend any Ocean View units for a great vacation!

This hotel is perfect for those that are interested in laying by the pool. Only a 10 minute walk to Waikiki! Judging by the people at the pool, I would say that this hotel attracts mainly convention, business and airline personnel. The pool area and fitness centre are very well maintained. The pool attendants are very friendly especially Thomas who shares his knowledge of the Island with the spirit of Aloha. Rooms in the Waikiki Tower are basic hotel rooms with bar fridge, microwave and coffee maker and a spacious lanai. There is a restaurant in the hotel that is only open for breakfast. The proximity to the Ala Moana shopping centre is very handy, and has an excellent food court with many options to choose from. On this most recent visit, there was a very large convention in town and there were often long wait times for the elevators. I look forward to my next vist.

Spent 10 nights at Ala Moana while attending a convention across the road. Perfect location. Loved the easy access to the huge shopping mall next door open til 9pm most nights (this is also the stop for the Waikiki Trolley and The Bus). We were excited to receive an upgrade to a suite, which when we visit Hawaii again will be our accomodation choice, the extra room would be worth the extra cost. Had a nice view of Magic Island, perfect to watch the sunset each day. Could see the fireworks from our balcony both Friday nights. Staff were really friendly. The gift/convenience store is excellent and the prices are really good.Loved the free Wi-fi as well, that worked perfectly during our stay.

The rooms were small with only one bed. Our room overlooked a noisy parking lot and we had no lanai at all!!! We asked for two beds and were given one. I rented two rooms and they both had only one double bed. The front desk staff were unwelcoming and seemed annoyed by our presence. Very dissatisfied!!!!!

Small but everything you need to enjoy your stay. Refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, and wonderful gift store to buy extras. Love the fact that your next door to huge shopping center and so close to the convention center that you can walk. Also close enough to walk a little further to beach. Also two elevators to accommodate all with very little waiting.

A nice, clean hotel with nice people working there but it is too far from the beach. Next to the mall and near the convention center, but who cares about that. Although they would like to help, don't expect any favors from the front desk.

This hotel is situated right next to the Ala Moana shopping centre and about a 10 minute walk to the beach. The rooms are modern, the beds very comfortable and we had a great view from the 12th floor. the first morning we had breakfast at the buffet downstairs which was ok. There is a walkway that takes you into the shopping centre which is very handy. We ate at the food court here quite a bit as it was very close to the hotel. There was free wifi in the room which I was very happy aboutThis hotel is situated next door to the Ala Moana shopping centre and about a 10 minute walk from the beach. The rooms are modern and we had a nice view of the water from the 8th floor. We had breakfast in the buffet downstairs which was ok but preferred to go next door to the food court in the shopping centre, there is a walkway that connects to the hotel which is very handy.There is free wifi in the rooms and the beds were very comfortable.We got a good deal for the room so I was very happy overall with this Hotel.

Rooms are comfortable & quiet with excellent temperature controls. Beds & pillows are comfy. Coffee maker, wi-fi, fridge & microwave a definate bonus. I was surprised to find, however, when I called front desk to see if I could get an extra coffee, they said they could do that, but would bill me $2.50 per packet! Housekeeping staff is wonderful and they keep rooms very tidy. Another bonus is the coin operated laundry rooms in the hotel. Self -parking under hotel with easy in & out was nice, and felt safe. (But it cost more for me to park than it cost to rent the car--common in Waikiki area).The best part about this hotel is location right next to Ala Moana shopping center. Hotel has no room service, but shopping center has dozens of food options, including a grocery store. All bus lines & trollies stop @ shopping center, also- making travel without a car very easy.

went to get my room and didn't know that my print out was only of the rates and I didn't get a confirmation #. SAMANTHA at the front desk was very accommodating and honored the rate that I had on my print out, imagine coming in from the airport and you had no place to stay! she was very pleasantm helpful and full of aloha. I haven't stayed at the Ala Moana for years... it is upgraded and the view can't be beat for the city views and the hustle and bustle. Perfect location, close to shopping and eating.

Very noisy rooms because of the street activity, very unkind employees at the reception, at the concierge, at the bell boys, at the cafe... I have never seen that in a hotel of this category. Super overrated. All the employees seem to hate their job and the customers. Awful experience!

If you are looking for service, don't come here. I am a Jewish Traveller and told the BELL DESK Firday night to come and knock on the door so they can press the Elevator button so I can come down and noyone showed up on satruday at the requested time.If you are a Jewish Traveler this Hotel is clearly not for you.Then I went down to the reception to ask for an hour late check out from Jane, down at the Reception: : I was told I would be charged half the price of the room!!! This is not a Hotel, I don't know what it is but it is not a Hotel.Poor Service, noyone listens, poor customer customer service, you get the feeling everyone wanting to rip you off at the first chance they get.I would rather give my money to another hotel here in Honolulu,I have heard rave reviews and splendid infos on the Hilton Hawaiian Village and teh Hawaiian Prince -too bad I followed my instinct and stayed in this dump. My fault.!!!Last time I am staying here-good bye and good riddance.MAYER SASSON / CANADA

This is my second visit to this hotel. This is far enough away from Waikiki so you are not really in the tourist area, which is a good thing. Most people who stay here seem to be on business. The staff on check in is great and efficient. The room was clean and had a fridge and microwave in it. It had a nice view of the ocean. There are on-site pay laundry.An overall good stay

October 28, 2014. My wife and I were in the process of traveling from Honolulu, Hawaii Airport to Newark, New Jersey via United Airlines. Our flight was schedule to depart at 8:30 pm that evening, but experienced mechanical problem with one of the planes flaps. Long story short, we were asked to exit the plane at 10:30pm because they could not fix the problem, and told to pickup our checked bag, and that they would provide us with vouchers for Taxi, Hotel, and a small amount for meals. We were taken to the Ala Moana Hotel, which appeared nice enough from first appearances. Our room was clean, and the bed was comfortable. But, there was nothing else! The room had a mini refrigerator which was completely empty, not even a bottle of water. As we had not eaten at all that evening because of the problems on the plane, and our extended waiting period on the plane, we were hungry. I called for room service, they did not have any! So I walked a couple of blocks to a Seven Eleven, where I picked up a sandwich and a couple bottles of water. So that had to suffice for that night. The next morning, we went to their restaurant at 10:10am for breakfast and were told that the restaurant had closed at 10:00am to accommodate a private party! They informed us that there was an Asian restaurant, but they were not open until 11:00am! I don't know about you, but we're not in the mood for Sushi for breakfast! Asked at the desk regarding this situation, and they were rather uncaring! Told us we could go to the Ala Moana Mall and find someplace to eat there. Again, not breakfast food. So, we packed up, and simply left for they airport to find something to eat there, and while away our time in the club until our flight departed at 7:10pm. So, very unhappy with this hotel! What major hotel doesn't have room service, and no restaurants open in the late morning hours? We will hopefully never have our flight cancelled again when leaving Hawaii, and if we do, hopefully we can obtain a voucher to a "real" full service hotel, because the Ala Moana in not!

Your website is awful. Tried to get a one bedroom and kept going back online. It does not want to sell me a room. Wanted a suite and to be close to Ala Moana Shopping Center but kept getting shut down by your website. I tried at least 7 times and will end up going to Prince down the street.

It is very well located with a skybridge the a huge open mall and food court. There is a convenience store in the lobby that is quite well stocked. A few comments, the tub did not drain when we took a shower, however, I'm sure they would have fixed it if we took the time to let maintenance in.We were there 8 nights. We spent $40 on bottled water because the water is nasty. There is no room service. I highly recommend buying some small coffee filters and ground coffee because the room has the world's smallest coffee pots and its good for about 1-1/2 cups coffee. My room mate and I cajoled the housekeepers to give us an extra pkt of coffee. They do have a low end microwave (it does not pop popcorn!) and I refrigerator in the room. We had a balcony room with an ocean view. The rooms were clean. I was happy when I accidentally spilled some water on the floor by the frig. When I cleaned it up, the cloth came up clean clean clean! There is no movie subscription channels so if you like TV, well, have things to do while the lengthy commercials have their way. Funky small pillows. No extra blankets in room, or robes. No room service. The front desk was unavailable to take my call for check out, after several futile attempts, we just left. Hopefully they will email a copy of my bill. Missing the small things like a magnified mirror in the bathroom. But, they were quick to respond to other requests like towel service etc. Buffet breakfast downstairs. I don't recommend it. It is quite expensive for someone like me who just wants some eggs and fruit. Their food was mediocre at best. Be sure to get your military discount. They do have the option to do the continental breakfast, separately, but my friend didn't think too highly of the pastries. You need to use your room key to go up in the elevator. Security purposes. Probably a good idea. Would I stay here again? Sure, why not. The beds were so, so. The wi-fi didn't work for me. It said I was connected on my phone, but nothing could download, etc. But all in all, it was a fine place, great location, close to shopping, trollies, park, water, and...a block or so from the convention center! Ta Dah!!!!!

After reading some of the reviews on here, I was on my guard when we arrived. We came for a convention and were extremely satisfied with everything we experienced here. The room was nice, spacious and comfortable. The buffet breakfast was very good and the food was hot if it was supposed to be hot. The staff was very warm and friendly. The location to the Convention Center was ideal, as well as the Ala Moana Shopping Center. We would definitely recommend it to friends, family and acquaintances, and would definitely stay here again. Although we came for a convention, it was also a vacation for us :) So I will list this as a couples sort of trip, because the convention we attended was not a business convention

It's a 12 cab ride to Waikiki, the best part is that it's connected to the largest mall on the island. I did some damage!!! And a lot of good options. The room was decent sized and housekeeping was great. They also give you a courtesy room to shower and change if you have a late flight. I don't mind staying at this hotel again.

SO far, Expedia has charged me an extra $50 for the same room as the hotel website - be careful when booking on tripadvisor that you click the proper link.I just spent 15 minutes trying to request 2 queen size beds with their online chat person Drew. THIS is not boding well - as I told my travel companion and fellow board member, we will bite the bullet and stay at the Hilton Hawaiian Village both directions on our travels off-island. Pray this improves before we get to the hotel tonight!!!

the Ala Moana had both good and bad pointsgood lobby was nice, check in efficient, rooms clean, beds acceptable, towels decent and soap good enough to use but not good enough to want to take some home, pool was small but clean, gym equipment acceptable. I was there for a convention and they extended the convention rate through the weekendbad I am a Sabbath observer and used the hotel as it was near a synagogue i was going to use for prayers. The hotel did move my room to a lower floor (the convention had filled the hotel; and when i checked in there were no lower floors available) as i was on 17 and climbing 17 floors is a little tough. However when i asked them where the stairwell was they told me I can only use the stairwell until the 3rd floor. There was stairwell down to 1 but that opened into the back and needed a guard to let me in or out. when i replied that i had been told that they had street access they told me they stopped that and the only way i could get stair access from three to one was if i hired a guard privately.I have traveled around the world at anywhere form 2 to 5 star hotels, some had accessible stairwells some needed a door unlocked. I have never been told i need to hire my own guard and never been accommodated. I do not know how much a guard cost but i ended up leaving 3 nights early as i did not want to bother the Rabbi from the synagogue and after 4 days at a conference did not want to go hotel shopping.I am sorry they were so unaccommodating as other aspects of the hotel were pleasant. If and when i go back to Hawaii I will not be staying here. I will look for a Hotel that is willing to go a little bit extra to accommodate the needs of the clients. As an aside i found that I could get out on the third floor by going through the pool area, ergo the only accommodation they would have had to make was to have a guard walk me from the first to the third floor Friday night and Saturday afternoon and how much time would that have taken. Less time than if the guard had to go use the bathroom!
user_name:
Nachum K
Staten Island, New York

review_body: I've stayed at the Ala Moana Hotel a few times and have tried a couple different categories.This place is definitely best suited for business travelers, conventioners, locals, and folks that come to Oahu primarily for shopping. Its a huuuuuge property. Over 1,000 rooms so the service can be a bit cold-- turn & burn. Staff is by no way at fault though: There's just no possibility they can deliver the quintessential Hawaiian experience--that "aloha" at such a big place. Lots of flight attendants stay here too. They were kind of a downer when we encountered them in the lobby. Couldn't tell which airline. You probably won't get to know anyone except maybe your housekeeper, concierge, folks at the restaurant. Front desk was always busy-- no time to chat. The lines were a bit long, but checkin and checkout interactions efficient. Completely forgettable though, and I couldn't tell you anyone's names. Rooms are clean, functional, small. They all have microwaves, even the little units. This is actually rare for Honolulu hotels. The Kona tower rooms can only accommodate 2 people. Its EXTREME close quarters. I almost died when I walked in... but its what I booked! Definitely should have checked square footage but was too taken by the price tag. Dad and I stayed together in this one and it was not comfortable. Maybe it'd be ok for a couple that gets along well. Only book this if you're travelling alone, or on a tight budget, or both.Comparatively, the one-bedroom suites: much better with room to stretch out. Good to have a living area. However its still very basic and feels small for the price. Furniture, wallpaper, flooring: clean and maintained but underwhelming in design, and outdated, slightly worn. The small suites here remind me of the big studios at the Ilima Hotel in Waikiki--similar minimalist décor. Speaking of the Ilima... parking is free, and even their studios feature a full kitchen (I don't know of any other Honolulu hotels with free parking) Ala Moana is 20/25 a night self park or valet. Alternatively If you can find a one-bedroom at the Embassy Suites or Aqua Luana for around the same price, its a no-brainer to take the latter option. Rooms are upgraded and sleek with modern Hawaiiana style. Smaller properties too, so staff are caring and attentive. What sets the Ala Moana Hotel apart is its location: Right at the doorstep of the huge Ala Moana mall, and five-minute walk to Hawaii Convention Center. About a mile away is Ward shopping area and movie theater. In my opinion the best part is that Magic Island and Ala Moana beach park is right across the street. Compared to Waikiki beaches, is definitely less crowded, with larger stretches of sand and nice picnic areas. Its tons quieter, and better in most ways but less "manicured" compared to Waikiki's tropical landscaping and granite-paved walkways. Keep in mind this area has no rental kiosks for umbrellas/chairs or beachboys to give surf lessons. Don Quijote is the best for walking distance groceries. Walmart and Sam's Club also nearby. Rumours nightclub is downstairs, and Pearl nightclub is just across the mall, if that's your thing. Leaps and bounds better than any Waikiki clubs. If you're more low-key and into dives, there are good options both here and in Waikiki. Dining options are also comparable. If you're really roughing it and taking city buses, all major lines stop here. If you're vacationing though...don't do it. Its miserable to go more than a few miles in any direction. The concierge can recommend tours/activities, and the best ways to experience Hawaii and its culture. One small room feature I liked: breezy cotton robes. Its is too hot for bathrobes here, so even higher end properties don't seem to offer them: this is the perfect alternative that I wish more places had. Good job Ala Moana. The small extras make a difference.Wouldn't be my first choice, but I'd stay again and recommend, especially if they have rates that will hold up to the other hotels.

The hotel lobby was quite nice on entering the hotel. The staff was friendly nice and prompt with the large group that we showed up with. The room was below average. While the room was clean and serviced well the linens on the bed and in the bathroom were old and dingy although they were clean they desperatly need to be updated for the price of the hotel. The bed was rather uncomfortable for my taste. This hotel is located in the Ala Moana shopping center which is about a 10 minute walk from Waikiki. While there are plenty of places to eat and shop around the hotel there is no good beach access close to the hotel. Overall, the hotel was adequate for the brief overnight stay that I had there, but any longer than that and I would have preferred something closer to Waikiki and with updated more comfortable linens.

The hotel has always been a favorite of ours. Staying here yearly for our anniversary. In the past we had no problem getting the same room as we reserve well in advance. This trip was a nightmare. Arrived only to find out that we were not going to be given our requested room, the manager offered to upgrade us to a suite. Said better room and view. What a joke. We are usually in a Ocean View on the 35 floor room. The upgraded suite was on the 7th floor overlooking the shopping center parking lot. Finally a very nice receptionist allowed us to look at some different rooms and finally ended up in a ocean view room but with two beds. So add insult to injury when I was browsing on line thinking of having a daughter come spend a day or two with us. I discovered the same room I had booked 2 months ago for $209 was now $169 a night and when I asked the front desk said they could not give us the better rate. Not sure after all these years if we will do this again. Too bad to break what was a good tradition. We have 3 more days here but won't have daughter join us after what has happened.

We arrived with a large group at 7.30am and weren't able to check in until 2pm. There were families with babies and even they could not check in any earlier. It was hot outside so we spent most of the time at the Ala Moana Mall, walking around in a jetlagged daze. Once we got up to the room we were able to see that it was nice. We only stayed for one night and left at 4am. The staff at the desk at that unseemly hour were lovely. I'd recommend the hotel for it's proximity to the mall and beach.

I stayed at the Ala Moana Hotel for a business conference. The hotel truly served its purpose as a host site for a business conference but I wouldn’t stay here as a tourist. I had the basic queen room with a partial ocean view. Honestly, I don’t think any of the rooms have a true ocean view. There are a collection of tall hotel rooms that are between us and the ocean. My room had a sliding door, which I assumed would be a balcony but instead you open the sliding door and it’s just a rail. I know there are rooms with ACTUAL balconies, I just didn’t get one.The room is really small, not just square footage but also height. The ceilings are strangely very low. I’m about 5’7 and I could touch the ceiling in the bathroom. And I’m not talking about on my tip-toes either. Standing normally, I lift my head up and my fingers touch the ceiling. This was more problematic in the shower. The shower is slightly elevated. I kept hitting my hand on the ceiling every time I lifted my arm to wash my armpit.The bed was comfy and if it wasn’t for the jetlag, I would have slept pretty well every night. Each room has a microwave and a mini-fridge. The mini-fridge came in handy for storing water and soda. The rooms have a large widescreen TV with basic cable however I found it hard to find things to watch on TV and ended up watching Netflix on my laptop. The complimentary internet in the rooms was great. I never had connectivity issues and even with streaming online, the speed was normal.The conference rooms were very spacious and well set up. I’m not sure if the hotel was the ones that provided all the catered food, but if so, all meals were delicious and well plated.The hotel is right next door to the Ala Moana Shopping Center and the second floor of the hotel has a walking bridge that you can use to cross to the mall.

good location right in the shopping center, can get through the hotel passage very handy. room size is fair with ocean view. outback steak house and red lobster just 5 mins walking distance, you can enjoy both seafood and meats, California pizza kitchen is another good choice for lunch.also offer discount for airline staff.

We stayed here while attending a meeting at the Hawaii Convention Center, which is virtually across the street. Incredible convenience. In the other direction, a few blocks from a state park, the harbor, and the ocean. Adjacent to the very upscale Ala Moana Center. You couldn't be better situated. The hotel itself was clean, classy, and attractive. There are 3 restaurants, an all-purpose store, and a club in the building. The rooms are well kept and spacious with dozens of TV channels. The staff is very friendly and efficient. Room rates are competitive. Previous negative reviews of this hotel on this site must have been planted by idiots. This hotel was great!!!

I have stayed at this hotel for 3-4 nights. The room and the shower room were not large. The toilet made such a noisy sound when pressing the lever. Breakfast was so so.. The best thing of this hotel was the location which was closed to big mall, good restaurants, department stores, bus stations and trolley station. Justin Baisac who worked at front desk was really helpful. I was glad meeting him at his night shift. He explained me how to catch buses to the north shore and print out useful information from the computer. I followed his advice to take bus number 52 to north shore and change to bus number 55 back to the hotel. We enjoyed this round island trip a lot. Bus fare was only 2.50 dollar for each way.

We got into Honolulu early in the morning and knew we couldn't check in but wanted to drop our bags. Check in desk said no problem and no need to worry about check in later. We got back late at night. They mentioned that we didn't have a crib but had a pull out. Our "baby" is 21, and we were alone! Dragged our bags up to our room and found a crib, a used napkin on the bed, used soap and garbage in the bathroom. Someone was sent to investigate but didn't know why he was there. The front desk told us to drag our stuff back down and gave us another room which was on a lower floor, no problem we thought, and no mention that it was on a public floor, adjacent to the parking garage and entrance for Macys! So back done we go with everything and they give us another room. Mention was made that it had 2 beds. This room is fine, but we are waiting to see of they will charge us more when the bill comes tomorrow. I'll continue this if there are more problems...
user_name:
LaurenL450
Oak Park, Illinois, United States

review_body: The front desk ladies were ruthless at check in, would not explain these hidden fees they were charging my card with, without my consent, and told me they were not the ones to complain to about problems with the fees. So I demanded a manager and they said he was not in and that I would have to leave my name, a phone number, room number and my concern. So I did, and never heard anything back. (I'm sure he never got my message) and asked again at check-out for a manager and once again, they took my name and number and ignored all my concerns. I am a frequent visitor to Oahu & I will never recommend someone to this place or stay here myself, EVER again.

The Hotel is clean and nice but it is really nothing exceptional. The service is good and staff friendly. I had a nice balcony that had a nice view of the ocean in which I could enjoy my morning coffee. It is next to the Ala Moana Mall a very large shopping complex with many dining options. The pool is rather small which may disappoint some.

I have stayed at the Ala Moana on numerous occasions. Mostly for business but now I find I choose it when I come on vacation with my family. Great location next to the Ala Moana Shopping Center which has great shopping and food choices. We enjoy the quieter end of Honolulu and the convenience of the Ala Moana. Rooms are clean and comfortable but I would always recommend spending the little bit extra for the Waikiki Tower. WiFi is great in the rooms and they have recently changed to Cable TV which adds so many more channel choices. Always have a great stay here and I can't understand the negative reviews. When we have had an issue with anything it has always been fixed promptly. Mahalo Ala Moana Hotel.

I found the Ala Moana to be a very nice hotel. It has recently been remodeled. Be aware that when you get to Hawaii you should be prepared for the life style of leisure. This may account for slower check in and check out. The hotel is about a 25 minute walk from Waikiki and is right next to the Ala Moana shopping center. While the location does not have the convenience of being near the beach hotels.....it does offer a much quieter rest. Local bus transportation is readily available.

Zero star hotel. not even 1. I'm a musician, traveling around the world. Visited this hotel for the business and experienced the worst service in the world. Women in the front desk are terrible as other people reviewed here, they don't communicate with people even in a normal way with common sense. One day, I found that I had lost my room key. I was sure that was around the lobby so I called them from out of the hotel and requested to void my key since the key was in an envelope with my room#. The answer of the front desk was "We cannot. Come back to the hotel, bye." WOW!? Called them again and requested the manager and they connected to manager's voicemail. WOW (2nd time) Called them again and asked if they'd pay all my staff if somebody breaks into my room and steal and mentioned them I was ready to call 911 now. Finally voided my key. How come it took so long for this simple thing?Next day, I enjoyed some beautiful beach sun and walk and went back to the hotel for business meeting of 1.5 hour later. Then my room key didn't work.... I returned to front desk and asked a woman with doing nothing in the "airline clue only desk". I said this is super urgent because I'm leaving in 1.5h and explained the situation she said "wait in the regular line." "WOW(3rd)" then I explained the situation AGAIN and she said "YOU need to leave NOW because your departure day is today on our computer." "That's not true, my other business members are all in the hotel and we are leaving tomorrow." "NO, you have to leave today because our computer blah blah" I was like WOW! (4th) What is really wrong is this hotel.... and said "Call manager." He came, confirmed that was their mistake, issued my key again. I went back to my room, the key didn't work AGAIN. Back to the front desk, "The key doesn't work. Can you call the manager again?" and the same rude lady sighed and said "WAIT (with frustrated and annoyed face with glaring at me)" How could you just say "wait" with the face to the customer in this situation. I won't forget her name..They reissued my key but there was only 10 min left so I had no time for shower. They didn't even give me any drink or breakfast ticket as the apology (of course I didn't request that but other hotels do give some voucher if any terrible thing like this happen. That is normal.) Other members in my business group were also experiencing full of this kind of terrible service. I highly recommend avoiding this hotel if you don't want to ruin your beautiful Hawaii trip. Don't waste your time in the beautiful island.

Not being acknowledged despite being the only one in line and still having to wait for over 5 minutes to check in did not leave a good first impression. (There were 4 Guest Service Attendants behind the counter, but they would not make eye contact. Maybe if they ignore me long enough I will go away or someone else will help me check in.) The room was well kept and clean but the bathroom was very small. You need to scoot by the toilet to close the door and the tub small. If you are over 5 feet tall you will have to bend down to wash your hair because the shower head is so low. Check out was another wait, again despite no one in line.

Stayed there for a night before heading home. The hotel is located next to the famous mall and I am sure that this is the best place for the shoppaholics. We took the higher floor room overlooking both sea and mountain side. The view is great. The room is clean and compact. There is the microwave, too.The service is fine and it looks they are very used to handling people from all over the world.I think this is very practical hotel.

The check in is slow if you are used to a Hiltons style hotel. The staff are friendly. Not so much the valets. The room I'm in has a nice view of both the ocean and the mountains. It is neat well equipped with a microwave, refrigerator and a little pantry. The Internet does not seem to work on smartphones but does great on tablets and laptops. There is a large screen TV with many channels also.Be aware that there was an expose on the maid service and how they cleaned up. It's on YouTube. That being said bring your own coffee cup and hide your toothbrush. The beach is a close walk as is Waikiki and Ala Moana shopping center which is under construction. Be warned: As you walk out the building at night don't go left. Loads of hookers druggies type. Many stripper bars on the backside of the building too.

It's not the fault of the hotel that they had a huge convention staying at their property, but it WAS their fault that they did not at all adequately staff for what seemed like a significant increase in guests. I waited for 20 minutes in line with a lobby overflowing with guests and bags at the Bell Check, only to learn that the room was not yet ready because of the convention. So I used the lobby restroom (overflowing garbage, rolls of toilet paper loose in the stall, dirty) and then grabbed some food across the street at the Ala Moana Center. I returned over an hour later to stand in line again, this time for 32 minutes (I timed it). There were using only four of 7 available computers. When I finally got to the desk, the representative was curt, barely looked me in the eye, and acted inconvenienced by my presence. I've not even stayed here one night yet, but in order to turn this experience around, the hotel is going to have to knock my socks off in service moving forward. And, based on the line and what I saw of the staff thus far, I'm not even sure I'll be able to ask a simple question at the front desk without having to wait again.
user_name:
Melissa P
Tacoma, Washington, United States

review_body: The Ala Moana at first blush is pleasant and nice. Great, courteous doormen arrive you and direct you to reception, through a massive lobby. But the rooms are showing their age. The bathroom was out of date, and had peeling chrome on the mirror. The shower was too low to wash my hair under unless I bent over. I used my wash cloth on the first morning, and the maid never provided another. The coffee maker was basic, and under a shelf that made it hard to fill. The bed was small. Cable TV was good. In the lobby there are tour desks and gift shops. Breakfast was expensive and uninspired. Parking at $16/day was about average for a city hotel. But all in all I wouldn't stay here again, unless they really spruce it up with a full makeover. And then they'll charge more (and for a hotel not directly on the beach). I'd try elsewhere next time.

Much better options closer to the water, tiny rooms, pool was dreadful. We only stayed here because US Airways delayed us overnight and paid for us to stay here. Difficult to cross over to nearby Ala Moana beach park walking, the traffic is loud and lights take forever.

Just stayed at Ala Moana hotel this past weekend. Front desk clerks were very friendly and helpful. Got an upgrade from kona tower to Waikiki tower. View wasn't that great but it was ok. Rated 4 star because this was a first trip with gf's ever and we didn't really know if we should tip the valet every time we drop off and pick up the car. But we just felt like they were waiting for it. Everything was clean. Very convenient for shopping needs! ;)

Very clean and secure hotel. Had a few quirks about the hotel key in the elevator. But They quickly helped and rekey my card. I had a wonderful view of Waikiki and Ala Moana Beach. And the Large shopping center is right next door. And hip Night club right downstairs of the hotel. I enjoyed my stay there,

On my vacation to a wahoo I had the misfortune of staying at the Alamo want to hotel. I was really looking forward to spending some time enjoying the pool side area and getting some sunshine. A group of about 20 people came up to the pool several of them got in the pool in their clothing and the rest make it began to make a lot of loud noises and wave their arms overhead. It appeared to be some sort of religious ceremony. This went on for a good 15 to 20 minutes at which point most of the other guests got up and left. Myself and my friend stayed however we called the front desk and security to ask if they could please come and do something, as this behavior was not only loud rude and disruptive but borderline offensive. One of the women in this group approach myself and my friend and ask us what our problem was. when I explained that they were being loud and disruptive she proceeded to call myself and my friends names tell us that we were the devil that we were going to hell that we would never be saved and never be blessed. I got up and went to call the front desk again while this woman continue to be right my friend. After five calls we still have seen no sign of security and that's when one of the men in the group came over and said in a very menacing way if you have a problem you talk to me. At this point I went back inside for a fifth time and called and asked to speak with the manager. Someone named Darrell said that he would send security up and I explained to him that security was already there and doing absolutely nothing. I left the pool area at this point to go see Darryl myself downstairs at the front desk. When I got there they told me you're going upstairs to the pool deck. When I arrived back to the pool deck the group of people were now surrounding him and waving their hands in the air and apparently praying over him. Then one of the women became over and addressed me. She called me a liar and said that none of the unkind things that her party had done had happened. She continued to tell me that I was troubled that I was a troublemaker that I was the cause of the issue and I was the one upsetting all the hotel guests. Meanwhile the manager and the security guard stood by doing and saying absolutely nothing. I was at this point I dissolved in tears. All I wanted to do was enjoy the pool and get some sunshine and relax on my vacation. That has been totally taken away from me. If I could leave and go home right now I would. Unfortunately my flight is not until tomorrow. It's very unfortunate that the management here is so incompetent. I am a travel agent and I will never ever book this hotel again. My friend I was with works the one of the airlines who has a contract to stay here regularly and she plans to write a letter to the management at her airline company to make them aware of the situation as well. The manager has not contacted me or my friend to offer any sort of an apology whatsoever. Do yourself a favor and stay at one of the other fabulous hotels in the area.

We booked an unit through a private management company. As I learned, these are individual condo units, and some are managed by hotels and some are by private management companies. If you can shop for a good price, it is a good bargain - great location, close to shopping and the airport, restaurants. We were lucky enough to find an unit, run by a good management company, and a good enough condition. We had a kitchen and a dining area, and was self-sufficient for a long-term stay. Don't expect to get a lot of services from the hotel. You have to be self-sufficient.
user_name:
hohoho300
New York City, New York

review_body: Let's start with what this hotel has in its favor. If you are looking for a hotel close to the Convention Center or Ala Moana Shopping Center, or to save a few bucks from what you would pay closer to Waikiki Beach, then this hotel might work for you. No complaints with the rooms (although smaller than average) or staff. The biggest plus for me was the sauna and steam bath in the fitness center.Apart from being close to the Convention Center and shopping mall, this hotel is not close to much else of interest unless you are interested in having an "oriental massage" at one of the "relaxation spas" at the end of the block. The walk to Waikiki Beach is about 20-30 minutes.What could be improved? Let's start with the elevator key cards. It had been two years since I had last been to Ala Moana and it is still a problem. Had to have my key cards replaced twice. Apparently, the hotel does not think there is a problem since there has not been any improvement in that time. What else?
