This hotel is fantastic if you just want a few days shopping at Ala Moana before carrying onto another island. There is a walkway that goes from the hotel to the Ala Moana shopping centre where you find all the shops and many restaurants that you could want. This hotel is about 10 minutes walk up the road to the Waikiki beach at Hilton Hawaiian village. We found our stay very pleasant here and would not hesitate to use it again.

Was pleasantly surprised with all the renovations done. Went for conference so it was super convenient. Didn't need a car since everything we needed, food, shopping, was a quick walk to Ala Moana Center. Rooms were nice and quiet. Stayed in the main tower and we'd do that again.

For those who like to shop and be centrally located, this works. The one disappointment was having to pay for our boarding passes. Most hotels that I have been in provide a business center which will allow for guests to print out their boarding passes. Parking is a challenge and expensive.

Basic amenities.Thin walls , I could hear the guy next door snoring .Get a high room away from the street club/noise.Ive stayed here a number of times and the TV/remote 1/2 the time doesn't work well ( if at all) Good location next to shopping mall. Staff are friendly but not really interested. Sometimes long queues at the reception.....check out early.Short walk across busy roads to the beach. Easy walk. Best is the top floor bar , check it out in happy hour.

My wife and I stayed at the Ala Moana Hotel for two nights while on a visit to Honolulu from the Big Island. We choose it because if had a convenient location that was not in the tourist ghetto of Waikiki Beach and because it offered rooms at a price that was only marginally higher than places we knew we that we would find too down market.The room we were given was clean but small. It's best feature was the deep bath tub. Unfortunately, there was a constant hum perhaps from the HVAC system that trouble our first night's sleep and never really faded into the background. Mostly what disconcerted us was the absence of real friendliness from the staff whose job involved direct contact with guests. Though nobody was rude, almost everybody seemed trained to operate efficiently rather than warmly. The only exception was the bar tender at the Signature Restaurant on the top floor. He probably hadn't read the memos from management.I understand that Honolulu is a big city, and that the Ala Moana serves as more of a business hotel than a tourist venue, but come on, Hawai'i and aloha go hand in hand.

This is decent, clean hotel with nice rooms. The location next to the Ala Moana Center is great for shopping and the Convention Center is just a block away. It is heavily used by flight crews. The hotel has a cold feel although its common spaces are very open. The major problem for those arriving from the mainland on evening flights is that on weekdays, all the food and the bar was closed by 10pm. There is really nothing right by it for meals. The Waikiki strip center is about 1.5 miles away. We used it as a base of operations to tour the island for three days. It worked well. If we were concentrating on Waikiki we would stay at a more centrally located hotel as we did last time. The breakfast buffet was good better than the Royal Kona not as special as the Westin on Maui.

this is a great location right next to Ala Moana Shoppin Center with all the dining and shopping optionsalso just steps away to ALA M0ana Beach Park and Magic Island so nice to walk over and enjoy the beachrooms can be on small side and the Kona? tower not the best of viewsbut still this is a decent alternatoive to the congestion of Waikiki

Started very early this morning, sand blasting so loud that even my Bose speaker can't cover the noise! Keeps going till almost 5:00 then a little later music starts up from downstairs till midnight. Unless you're hard of hearing I don't recommend you stay here. At least till the construction stops, they are also building a condo unit near by.

It was in a good spot. Next to a big mall with a lot of good restaurants and a couple of bars. My initial reception was cold but I will give them the benefit of the doubt as maybe one person was just having a bad night. Besides the Japanese tourists this hotel lacked any typical Hawaiian feel. The gift shop was good. Avoid the signature steak house. It is a pompous atmosphere. Yuza was good. Breakfast was good but a little expensive. I will go back for a future business trip because of the location. But not a vacation spot by any means.

Good rates, the room was a little small for 4 but we were ok. no spa bath in pool area and the pool closed early both nights we stayed. happy hour in restaurants was good value. free Wi-Fi in rooms was a bonus.large hotel but staff were friendly.

Awaiting a recent Hawaiian Cruise, we stayed one night at the Ala Moana Hotel in Honolulu, which I chose because it was close to the Pier we would be leaving from and attached by a walk way to Ala Moana Shopping Center. This made it convenient to walk to the shopping center to do any last minute shopping or enjoy a quick meal before leaving. The room we stayed in was very small but well maintained. This hotel is possibly best for business travelers who will be spending very little time in their room or in Honolulu.For these reasons, however, I would not recommend this hotel especially if you are planning on spending any time in Honolulu: 1. The hotel staff was very unfriendly, even rude at the front desk and in the restaurants. The only pleasant staff member we met was the concierge who willingly lent me assistance in preparing our luggage for the cruise.2. The television in our room had a horrendous, fuzzy picture even though it appeared to be a newer model HD. It had to warm up for several minutes before the picture was semi-clear enough to watch.3. The restaurants in the hotel were not willing or accommodating to prepare meals for take to our room after a very long, tiring day traveling. In particular, the staff at the asian restaurant were quite rude responding to our request. 4. There was no where in the hotel, (other than the small in room coffee maker) to buy coffee in the morning. My husband had to walk to Ala Moana Shopping Center for coffee, which had cooled significantly by the time he returned to the room.5. There were no restaurants in the hotel that could accommodate lunch prior to leaving for the cruise.

Spent 5 days at this hotel in Oahu. Price much less than resorts hotel a few minutes walk away from this hotel, but this hotel is not a resort hotel. Room was clean and although not large, they are roomy. Room had small balcony with view of the sea. Ask for room on high floor to get away from street noise. Hotel next to large shopping mall and buses to the rest of Honolulu and the rest of the island. Staff was helpful and courteous. One block away from Hawaii convention center. Pool area is funcional but not memorable. I would recommend this hotel for business travelers and for people who spend more time away from the hotel ejoying Oahus other destinations, than for people who use the hotel as the destination.

I am more of a low key Windward Oahu dweller, but, must admit... it's fun in Waikiki. I've stayed at Ala Moana twice in the past 8 months and both times as a result of US Airways overbooking a flight or underbooking a flight crew.It's been free for me so I don't think about how much I paid only to hear jackhammering at the Ala Moana Center parking lot, or how old and worn the bed spread is. I've had two very different rooms on each stay. In July 2013 was tucked away in a room with a view of another tall building and a parking lot. Unimpressive really. This time I'm in a corner unit with a balcony and a king bed. The view is beautiful and I can even glimpse a sliver ocean and diamond head. This makes up for the fact that I found a half consumed ice cream shake (not mine) in the refrigerator and felt compelled to sweep up all the hair (also not mine) in the bathroom before using it. Keeping my sense of humor.My delay has me here for two days this time so I'm able to enjoy the pool and exercise room and look around at the shops. A very nice experience and I'm grateful not to be stuck at the airport for 48 hours.

My wife and I traveled to Oahu for a quick 1 night getaway. Booked a package through Panda Travel and opted for this hotel. This was the first time I have stayed in the Kona Tower, and it wasnt bad at all. Nothing fancy, and the bathroom was very small. All in all however, it was decent enough to sleep in. The only complaint was that you could hear everything going on in the hallways, doors slamming, people getting on and off the elevator, and people talking as they passed. Not the best thing for the end to a romantic night.

I enjoyed this hotel due to its location and simplistic rooms. Rooms came with great amenities that helped us with our week long stay (microwave & refrigerator). Staff was friendly and helpful whenever they were called upon. Luckily this was a great way to rebound from a previous bad experience with a different hotel. Parking was quick and easy. Highly recommended!If you stay here be sure to walk down to the Ala Moana Park to watch the sunset. You get great views of Honolulu, Waikiki, and Diamond Head.

High Rise hotel next to the mall where you can shop until you drop. We stayed here because our flight was delayed. The front desk was swamped with passengers from our flight the day we were supposed to take off to head home to JFK which was closed from a winter storm. We ended up with a beautiful corner room on the 7th floor with a balcony overlooking the mall parking lot, and the Ala Wai Boat Harbor and ocean beyond. The postage stamp room served our needs for one night. The comfortable bed took up most of the room. We laughed at the HUGE tv on the dresser. Sliders opened onto a generous lanai with city, harbor, ocean views and city sounds.The room had a safe, small noisy refrigerator and microwave. The huge bathroom had plenty of counters and a deep tub. All in all an elegant hotel close to the convention center and mall with easy access to Waikiki.

I stay at the Ala Moana every year for a week to holiday and relax. Sure the decor is looking a little dated but it is all about location and tradition for me. This week there is a conference in town so the hotel is very busy. However, what I was not warned about is the noise from the Ala Moana Mall parking lot resurfacing work. There are about 5 jack hammers operating from 9:00-5:00 everyday and boy do they make some noise. Makes it really unpleasant to spend any time out on the deck of this ocean view suite. Granted, you really don't want to spend a lot of time in your room, however paying top dollar without any warning of what is going on makes it extremely challenging to enjoy the week stay here. For those who have reservations at this property, it doesn't look like this jack hammering will be ending anytime soon.

We have been staying at the Ala Moana for 5-6 years, usually for a long weekend in February, and have usually found it to be clean, friendly and convenient. It is close enough to the bustle of Waikiki to get there in a comfortable walk, but far enough to avoid the crowds. Being adjacent to the Ala Moana Mall is a tremendous plus with all its shops and restaurants. There is a significant difference in the room size, views and atmosphere in the two hotel towers. Stay in the Waikiki Tower in preference to the Kona Tower.

We haven't even checked in yet, after getting married in Honolulu in January and traveling the States for a month, we were looking at a nice relaxing stay close to the shops. Perfect location and lobby looks great. On a really hot day we are trying to check in. First lady was lovely and said to come back as room wasn't ready. Fair enough. We come back a few hours later to get told. Check in is at 3. Asked to use the pool as it is really hot and got told no. Bell desk rolled their eyes at me when I asked to check bags in and didn't speak a word to us. I don't even want to check in now. Dissapointed.

Reservations were difficult as we were four people. they could ot accommodate four people, and we were charged $259.00 per day for a room that had two double beds without enough floor space to hold four bags.Nice lanai though.Service: abrupt, thoughtless and edgy from valet station, to other staff. Decor: nice lobbyInternet: worst service I have ever had, with rude provider, totally wouldn't talk with me, kept scolding me, saying I had to answer his questions, and not any other ones or he would close out the ticket. He refused to hear what was wrong, and was arrogant beyond any service I have ever had. when running, the service was quite slow.Something is wrong with the hotel. I stayed there before and it was lovely in all ways. Has this hotel been sold? Thinking of selling itself? Choose elsewhere if it matters.

I've stayed at the Ala Moana Hotel many times during the 40 years we've lived in Hawaii, mostly for convention travel. This most recent renovation makes the rooms and bathrooms much more comfortable. Our room was clean. We overlooked the pool and had a sliver of a view of the nearby marina and ocean. And the meeting rooms remain wonderful for smaller gatherings. The hotel is located adjacent to Ala Moana Shopping Center and is barely a block away from the Hawaii Convention Center, for larger conventions. Within easy walking distance are other shopping centers such as Ward Center. In the other direction is Waikiki and straight down the road is Ala Moana Beach Park. Ala Moana Shopping Center is a major bus terminal making more distant locations within easy reach.Lines can be long at the reception desk, but they move quickly. More problematic are lines for the elevators.

The rooms were dirty. Changed rooms & the only thing changed was more outside light. My roommate looked at 6 others and they were all the same. The carpet & bedding were a disgrace. We changed hotels.

When we checked in, I asked for a room near the elevator because I had injured my ankle the previous weekend. I was using a cane it should have been seen as a reasonable request. We were told that the hotel was sold out so unless I made the request when I called in the reservation ( before I injured my ankle) my request couldn't be considered. I was checking in at 1:30 pm. , plenty of time to move rooms around. So, we are sent off the find elevators that are a LONG way from the lobby and a long walk to our room. Not happy but try to make do. We were told the hotel was right next to the Ala Moana Mall. Just walk out the 2nd floor and thru Macys and you're there. Nope. 2nd floor hike thru banquet hall area with no benches. Reach the doors... Oh, you have to walk down a long ramp and across a large parking lot in the hot sun to get to Macys. No where to sit. If only the lady who checked us in had been understanding. Once we get back to the room I am done for the day. We are stuck in a small room overlooking a junky rooftop with a TV that you can't hear. The mini frig is louder than it.

Recently stayed at Ala Moana for 1 night for business. Not enough staff at the check in at 3pm. The line was long and slow. The room for small but cleaned. Bed was soft in the middle. TV picture was of poor quality. Decided to watch netflix via free wifi. The broadband is slow. Only buffet is available for breakfast. Used the bell desk to keep my luggage. Wow, what poor attitude. overall, for the price of close to $200, I can get a better hotel elsewhere. NOT WHAT I EXPECTED,

Spent 6 days whilst visiting Hawaii on business. I had the accommodation and meetings at the same venue. Service was very professional. service too was good. Good central location in the city of Honolulu.

Our plane arrived at 6.30am and we arrived at the hotel just after 7.00am. We had not slept a wink for almost 24hrs and were feeling like zombies. I requested an early check in and was willing to pay extra, yet I was firmly told that check in was at 3.00pm. Forced to wander the streets, we went to the Ala Moana Shopping Centre which was next door.We had the 35th floor room with stunning views of the ocean, partially blocked by a tall building. The room had 2 double beds which seemed to be on the smaller side. Coming from Australia, where the standard in-room tea/coffee service is excellent compared to the Ala Moana. The room had a microwave, a coffee maker, 1 satchet of Kona coffee (for the coffee machine), 2 instant coffee sachets, 2 tea bags, 2 creamers, 2 sugars & 2 coffee mugs & 2 plastic straw stirrers (which we found much later). There were no spoons, saucers, wine glasses or kettle. If you want tea, you had to microwave your water, and you if you wanted a second cuppa, you had to reuse your tea bag, unless you pinch partner's tea bag.Good points: Free wifi was excellent and fast, but you had to sign in every day. Free local papers but you had to go down to the lobby early, otherwise it's all gone. Walkway on 2nd floor linked directly to the Ala Moana Shopping Centre Car park and straight to Macy's. The Pink Trolley goes straight to Waikiki. Quiet and stunning views to ocean and mountain. Near Walmart and Eggs n Things (about 10 mins walk)

This hotel is less than 2.5 miles from downtown Honolulu. The room was spotless, bed was comfortable, coffee maker in the room, flat screen TV and free wifi. The lobby is large and bright with lots of seating. Check in was fast and efficient. The hotel is across the street from the Ala Moana Beach Park, a wonderful park and perfect place for a morning walk or run. Only compliant was my room was on the side of the trash dumpsters so trash trucks came early and made a lot of noise. I did not try the pool or any other hotel facilities, this was a business trip and for that purpose, it was perfect.

I stayed for 2 nights before a longer stay in Waikiki and Maui specifically so that I could shop!! I wasn't disappointed. The hotel is perfectly located for the ala moana centre, the Ward centre and Walmart. I had never been to Walmart before and so walked over to have a look and ended up buying souvenirs, snacks and even scrubs for my husband. The Ward centre is also fantastic for shopping, not very touristy but great clothes and shoes and hawaiian stuff much cheaper than Waikiki. Now to the hotel, had a corner room with lanai and great view. There was a king bed, a microwave, coffee maker, large sink and then the bathroom. Bed was comfortable, bathroom was fine, coffee maker and microwave were not clean which was a little disappointing. Room was quiet, otherwise clean and I was happy. I ate at the Pineapple Room in Macy's (excellent), YuZu in the hotel (brilliant) and the Royal Garden in the hotel (don't bother). I liked the feel of the hotel which was more business like than ultra touristy like Waikiki tends to be. I would return to the Ala Moana, in fact I did because I first stayed here in 1977!!

If you want to shop at Ala Moana and the ward centre then this is the ideal location. The rooms are not big but when you are only there to sleep it is fine. It was also lovely and quiet in the room. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Service on check in was speedy and friendly as it was on check out. I used the gym and the pool most mornings, the gym wasn't too crowded and I usually had the pool to myself. The pool surround is very fine sharp gravel though so you really need foot cover till entering the water. Great walkway access to ala moana centre on level 2 which we used daily. It was so good to be able to go and drop shopping bags off in our room and then return for more shopping.Also very centrally located for lots of great little restaurants in the surrounding streets.We enjoyed our stay down this end of Waikiki as previously we had stayed right down the other end near the zoo. We only ventured into Waikiki twice this trip, instead we explored the ala moana area, the ward centres and downtown.

Stayed here for 6 nights with wife and 2 year old. Rented room 2326 to get the 1 bedroom suite. On the plus side location is great. Super access to beach and shopping. On the downside: 1. Pool is dated. Ground surface around the pool is unacceptable. Walking in it hurts. Water felt colder than the ocean. The toddler was uninpressed. 2. Room not ready with crib on arrival. Noise from hall easily wakes up jet lagged toddler from 5am. Activating emergency warning system at 1sm for no reason also upsetting. 3. Kitchenette was useless because of no utensils, plates, cups, zip. Not sure why they install dishwasher. 4. Easy to meet other guests in the lift because we all have the same trouble with our cards. Had higher hopes based on reviews and expectation of cake for money.

We booked our room at the Ala Moana Hotel through VRBO so we got it for a really good price. The staff was wonderful. We had a late check-in which I had let them know ahead of time and they really accommodated us. When we got there I realized I had brought the wrong key for our suitcase and it was now 2;00 a.m. and all we wanted to do was sleep! I called the front desk and they put us through to someone else who immediately sent someone up to our room with the biggest bolt cutters for our tiny lock. Less than 5 mins! Staff was always friendly and helpful no matter what we asked or who we spoke to. location of the hotel is handy next door to the shopping centre where you can easily walk to get food or eat out. I would definitely recommend this hotel. No view from our room but we didn't spend a lot of time there. Our room was spotless and if that's any indication of the other rooms, excellent!

As locals here in Hawaii, we always stay here when visiting from the neighbor island n have always enjoyed our stay. Great location w walkway right to Ala Moana shopping center and always great service. Would definitely recommend it.

Let's face it, we all want a good room with a nice view that comes with a bargain price. Well, Ala Moana Hotel comes close to it. Just ask for the higher tower. I have to luck to be booked on the 33rd floor on room 3317. Very spacious and can accomodate more than 4 adults since the unit comes with a sofa bed. My wife and I love to shop and taste some local cuisines or a quickie lunch, so we hang around the Ala Moana mall which is adjacent to the hotel. The mall have high end retailers, a big international food court and a grocery market too. Mai Tai is nice to for happy hour just to rest your feet for a couple of hours while having a cocktail libation. For the young at heart, a disco bar is located a the lobby of the hotel, it's only available Friday and Saturday for the public. We have a nice vacay with my wife. She's happy shopping and I was well satisfied hitting golf balls and the beach.

When we went to Hawaii we had a double booking issue, which in no way was the hotels fault, but this was not our original hotel we were supposed to be staying in. I did like that is was connected to the outdoor mall which was very nice. The room was tiny for four people and our view wasn't horrible. The pool was kind of sad, but clean. I wouldn't recommend the breakfast buffet they offer, the room needs updated, and there is nothing special about the food. The club there was for older people from what I could see. The staff wasn't bad to us, it was all just average. No noise complaints.

All the photos promoting this place show the main hotel tower but if you book the Kona Tower you will be ushered around the back to the bad hotel where rooms are tiny, beds are horrendous and balconies are a sliding door with a railing. When i booked this hotel i expected to be in the main hotel and paying $250 per night I was shocked at what i actually got. I would not recommend this hotel even though it is next to Ala Moana.

This hotel was recommended by organizers of a conference I was attending, for its convenience to the conference venue, but it is a reasonable alternate to some higher priced Waikiki hotels. (We were not at the main Convention Center, but that was literally five minutes away, so this hotel would be an excellent choice for anyone attending an event there.) The service was wonderful; my hairdryer didn't work and Housekeeping brought up a new one within 5 minutes of my call and made sure that it worked. Same thing when I came in and the clock was flashing 12:00 and I couldn't set it (but why do hotels furnish rooms with clocks that are impossible to set? I couldn't set the alarm either!). And the front desk staff are friendly and helpful, both when checking in and out, and when I intially had a problem connecting to the Internet; there is wireless in the rooms and also the typical connections.The rooms are small, but you're not sitting in your room in Honolulu, and the small fridge and microwave are useful, especially as the hotel cafe served only a buffet breakfast, so I stocked up on yogurt and fruit from the local ABC shop. There is a convenient food court in the Ala Moana Shopping Center next door, and an easy second-floor passage from the hotel. The pool hours were limited to 8 a.m. to sunset, so no early morning swim, which was a disappointment, but again, it's an easy walk to the Ala Moana beach, which is preferable to the pool if you have time. A friend raved about the massage she got at the first floor center; they will also come to your room.If you are planning to spend most of your time at Waikiki, then this is not the hotel for you, unless you want to do the 20-25 minute walk every day (I did not try to find the shuttle stop, but of course you could buy the Waikiki Shuttle pass as another alternative, and there is the "pink" $2 shuttle). But the bus stop was convenient for my treks to the Art Museum and the Iolani Palace, though at non-rush hour times, you may wait 10-15 minutes for a bus. You can also buy bus passes at the ABC and 7-11 stores. For anyone with an interest in shopping, this hotel can't be beat, as the Ala Moana shopping center has it all; don't miss the Japanese department store, Shirokiya, right outside of Macy's, which has lovely gift items (some with Japanese Cute, though the smart phone covers were the best I've seen anywhere) and a terrific bakery for those breakfast and sweets items! All in all, this hotel really worked for my week in Honolulu, which was half vacation and half business.

Have stayed here with family at least 3 times (week to 10 days each) to visit relatives. Pro's - 1) Location is right next to Ala Moana Center, so perfect if you want to go shopping the day after Christmas (also good if someone in your party wants to go shopping while you relax at hotel). 2) Good selection of food in the mall from chain restaurants Center to Asia sit down places, and a very big food court, don't forget to try Shirokiya top floor for bento lunch food. There's an ABC store and Foodland in the mall as well as high end stores. In the hotel complex itself, there's a good Chinese restaurant with dim sum, a top floor steak place and a typical coffee house 3) You can walk or drive across Ala Moana Boulevard to Ala Moana beach park, which is huge and where you can dip into the ocean, paddleboard or go for walk or jog, 4) Nice public spaces including a huge ground floor reception area where you can relax, or work, or read if you have jet lag, 5) free internet, 6) I thought service was good, rooms were clean. 7) nice sized pool with lounge area and well equipped fitness center. 8) big underground parking lot for additional 20 dollar a night. 9) Convention Center is just up the blockCon's - 1) not that close to waikiki and other tourist amenities, it's walkable but not right at your front door, 2) it's a big hotel so a little impersonal and can get pretty crowded on checking in, 3) it's got a lot of events going on, so there's always people coming in and going out; 4) good jumping off point, but not that Hawaiian in atmosphere - not sure I would recommend this for someone in Hawaii for the first time, 5) If nobody in your party wants to go shopping, then you might want to try someplace else.

We were visiting for a week and this hotel was a great bargain. The room over looked the mountains and had a small balcony. It was clean and quiet. The only drawback was that there was no room service. Breakfast was served downstairs in a lovely cafe that was a very good bargain. Good food and coffee. The concierge was extremely helpful. The mall next door has quite a few good chain restaurants and lots of shopping opportunities. The lobby was big with plenty of room for our family to meet up and plan the next move. Waikiki is a drive away but the mall is on the trolley stop so one could get there without a car. We would definetely stay here again.

This hotel is conveniently located if you are in town for business - or if you are a kamaaina wanting to do a 'staycation.'Ala Moana park is just a block away. Ala Moana mall is 2-3 minutes walk. And there are plenty of the restaurants and bars within 5 minutes walk.The rooms are smallish - but they are clean.This hotel offers best value when the rates are $100-$150.Btw, we once booked a high floor sweet here (1 BR) and had a great time.

I was booked here after my airline's flight was cancelled. The check-in was long (the plane was full, therefore there were a lot of us needing accommodations) and I felt the front desk ladies felt irritated and because we were mostly locals, I felt that I was being treated as a non-tourist, second rate service. The room I was given was very good and the accommodations and the location of the hotel is very convenient for weary traveller like me who was travelling alone.I was given a voucher for breakfast and lunch. I breakfast buffet was so-so and I felt that the choice for the $15 voucher was very limited, so I had to add additional to avail of the hot entrees. The Royal Garden where I used my lunch voucher was top notch. Very good service compared to breakfast.Front desk service needs to improve, a little bit more of aloha, care and concern should be shown, I was disappointed with that. I have used this hotel in the past and this is the first time I felt that they have made me feel unwelcome (get it over with kind service).

This hotel was great for a family holiday in 2006. Seven years later, in 2013, it's just as good for a two-nighter business trip.Can’t beat the location for me ---- yes, it’s not a beach hotel, but it’s well linked to both Waikiki and downtown Honolulu by bus routes. The Ala Moana beach is a relatively short walk away (10 minutes or less). And it’s actually linked to the Ala Moana shopping center by a pedestrian bridge, making it super-convenient to go shopping, eat at the food court or other restaurants (there’s even a Jollibee outlet for home-sick Filipinos), or dash off to buy last-minute provisions. One warning --- the short bus ride to Waikiki beach was lengthened considerably by traffic jams at 4 pm, tempting me to try walking the rest of the way. Hailing a taxi for the airport was fast and convenient too. I expected the hotel to show much wear and tear in 2013 compared to 2006 (when we were one of the first to try their newly renovated rooms). Surprisingly, the rooms still look fresh and new, not at all “tired” or slightly scruffy. The blue-green-gray aquatic décor was pleasant and very soothing. (Surprised to see that Ala Moana still uses those old-fashioned floral bed covers that most other hotels have junked long ago --- but in this case, the covers look cool and tasteful rather than chintzy.)I stayed in a 9th floor room in the Kona Tower (really just a wing attached to the high-rise main tower) which was a bit on the small side but very well organized, with a comfy queen size bed, a good-sized writing desk/dresser, a couch (yes, an actual sofa) positioned by the window, a relaxing armchair in one corner, and a very useful cupboard supply area that includes a microwave oven, a big-enough fridge (with no mini-bar items inside, thank goodness!), a coffee brewer (with free Kona coffee on hand) and lots of cabinets to store food and other stuff. I give the Ala Moana a happy “5” rating in the area of storage space ---- by the bed, in the desk, beside the closets and in the cupboard area ---- perfect for a long-staying guest.One big warning ---- there’s no room service. I had to go down to buy some plastic spoons at one of the convenience/souvenir stores just off the lobby for my nighttime snack, but then at worst there’s always Ala Moana Center right beside the hotel. (But stock up for midnight snacks, for those insomniac business travellers out there.) I wish I was informed about this upon check-in. Then again, there’s a pizza delivery ad displayed in the room (didn’t get to try it though).Notable items:--- Good view of the sea, the Ala Moana beach park and the mall rooftop, even from the 9th floor.--- Room is bright --- great lighting all around. Congratulations. However, you have to switch the lights on or off individually, no master controls.--- Pillows were small and insufficiently supportive, just serviceable.--- The flat screen TV is bigger now (in 2006 it was a small affair attached to the wall), and channel selection is OK, but I found the remote control a bit clunky.--- Internet was free --- and fast.--- Too many signs and placards lying around on the desk and tables ---- typical for a U.S. hotel. (But then with so many cabinets, it’s easy to hide them.)--- Ala Moana still uses those atrocious hangars (the ones that are actually attached to the closet rod, very impractical).--- Don’t expect a robe or slippers or free bottled water. (The tap water must be potable.) When I needed more towels or amenities, the housekeeping staff was eager and willing to provide them.--- The bathroom is OK overall. I like the curving shower curtain rod (there’s a combined tub and shower) giving you more elbow room, but the shower control is hard to figure out. There seemed to be only one direction, which gave me cold water until it suddenly switched to hot (and wasn’t that consistent overall). --- If you have two or more big suitcases, it would be hard to fit them into the room. I understand that rooms in the main tower are bigger? (My family stayed in the main tower in 2006, but I recall the room was the same size, though we were much higher up and the view was breathtaking.)--- You only get one phone, positioned on the desk. No second phone beside the bed.--- The staff was uniformly friendly and warm throughout my stay --- front desk, concierge, security, managers.--- Didn’t try the hotel’s restaurants, so can’t comment on them.One difference between Kona Tower vs. main tower: The Kona rooms have no balconies, while the main tower rooms have small glass-walled balconies that allow you to enjoy the superior views.If you’re staying until early evening to catch a midnight flight back to Asia, the hotel charges a full additional one-night rate, not even a half-day rate. (Ala Moana was willing to allow a 2-hour late check out privilege for no fee, though.) That was disappointing, but at least it was explained properly and professionally to me.All in all, a solid “4” rating for a solid hotel experience. Won’t mind bringing back the family for another holiday stay at the Ala Moana (got to get a bigger room, though).

My wife and I stayed at the Ala Moana for two nights in late November. This was not our first trip to Hawaii, nor our first stay at the Ala Moana. It is a beautiful facility, but not very close to Waikiki Beach. Service was very good, and it is quite convenient to the convention center and Ala Moana Mall. Breakfast in Plantation Restaurant is greatly improved over our last stay. The bar/restaurant on the top floor features a piano bar and half priced drinks during happy hour. Loud, but a hopping place. Our room was tiny, but adequate if only sleeping in it. We were attending a meeting at the hotel, so had little choice but to stay there. In reality, it could be much better than it is, but still a great value.

I stayed there November 23-24. Everyone was real nice and had great guest service. I liked the location since you could easily walk to ala moana mall and ward center was a few blocks away. The ala moana beach was right across the street as well. I looked at the reviews and noticed people mentioned the cleanliness. The room we had was just fine only thing that stood out to me was in the shower the drain cover was pulled out. I would of thought they would fix that before we got into the room but it didn't affect the shower.Also the tv was a little static but I was able to manage with it. Other than that I was really happy how I booked a room with mountain view but instead I got ocean view which was fine because I initially wanted that but it was more expensive if I booked it that way. He hotel is a little pricey but it comes with convience and I like that!

We have stayed here several times. A simple walk to the Ala Moana shopping center. Convenient to medical facilities in Honolulu. A short walk to Ward Center. Near Convention Center. Simple taxi or transit ride to Waikiki. Hotel staff is pleasant and rooms ultra clean. Rooms are nicely appointed. Close to restaurants of all sorts from food courts to fine dining. Nice pool on 3rd floor deck. A short walk to Ala Moana Beach Park. Free WiFi in lobby and rooms.

This hotel is ideal for those who want to be near the Convention Center (2 blocks, but there is a sky bridge on the second floor to the parking lot) and the Ala Moana Shopping Center (roughly one block), but not if you want to walk right out on the beach at Waikiki. To get to a beach you must walk 2-3 blocks. This is a large modern hotel with all the amenities, though frankly I think it's petty that they only give you one packet of coffee (no choice between regular or decaf) and charge you if you want more. Must be a theft problem, but it's annoying. I was also surprised that no one (no one) at reception smiled at anyone during the 15 minutes I had to wait to register--long by my standards. The wait on elevators can be very annoying when there are crowds--they don't all seem to operate at the same time.Otherwise, a great hotel. The breakfast is a large buffet and they give a 10% senior discount off the $16.95 rate. The lobby is large and there are several shops, including one that was having end of season discounts.
user_name:
cfuller603
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I love this hotel! It is next to the largest shopping mall on Oahu and the Hawaii Convention Center. It is also within walking distance to Ala Moana Park with its great beach and jogging paths. The hotel is about 3 miles to the heart of Waikiki. Although it is over 40 years old, the hotel is modern and clean and the staff is friendly and helpful.

The registration desk was very efficient and friendly. Quick check in and the room was wonderful - lots of amenities available. The breakfast buffet is fantastic - lots of variety and local fresh fruits are so ONO !!!

This is my favorite hotel in Honolulu. Our room had a view of Ala Moana Beach. The room is clean, furnished in the style of ikea, has a microwave and a small refrigerator. It is not fancy but I love that it is next to Ala Moana Mall and across the street from the large Ala Moana Beach/Park. It is easy to drive from the hotel to anywhere on the island. It does not feel touristy, although there were a couple of busloads of tourist groups that came in during our stay. Housekeeping was great--we would go out early to sightsee and be back by noon and the room would be cleaned. After being at so many hotels where we'd return by noon or even later, like 3, to a unclean room, this was very, very nice. The concierge was also very helpful in getting us reservations at a top restaurant at the last minute.

My husband and I stayed at Ala Moana Hotel for our wedding in Hawaii. We also flew to a few other countries afterwards. Ala Moana was by far the best hotel on this trip as everything was above what we expected. Rooms were large and clean with great ocean view, it was convenient for shopping and dining. All services were excellent, especially housekeeping, always friendly and reliable. I also want to say a special thank you to Lee Kamae at reception for her patience in organising our rooms as we had lots of relatives checking in different times. She was very quick at responding to my emails and was very understanding throughout our interactions with her. We would definitely go back to Ala Moana hotel for future stays.

My flight home was cancelled by Jet star who had to put me up in this hotel for 19 hours and I would never have considered staying here in the past (14th visit to Hawaii). Anyway I loved it. The rooms are very new looking (renovated 5 yrs ago), they are very spacious, nice little kitchette and large bathroom. I was in the Waikiki tower. Lovely balcony but not a nice view from my room. Pillows needed updating. Big screen tv. Great working A/C. Very quiet rooms, I was at the very end of corridor. Fantastic large sizepool which is salt water and 9 feet deep and I spent 4 hours here it was amazing, heaps of sun and not obstructed. They have a very good sized well equipped fitness centre as well. There are 2 restaurants in the hotel. The hotel is connected to the 3rd largest mall in US so very very convenient. There is a fantastic choice of two beaches opposite the hotel which are not over populated by tourists more for locals and very quiet, about a 10 min walk. The staff were very helpful and friendly. I would definitely stay here again if my budget would allow as it seems a bit pricey for a 3 star. I was over joyed to have the opportunity of experiencing this property and its facilities.

Very Tired Hotel. The only thing the location had going for it was that it was close to the convention center. The room was barely acceptable with a view of a construction crane. The furniture as well as the bedspread should have been replaced years ago. Carpet had a stain on it. There were no restaurants or even a coffee shop in the hotel. Actually no services at all. The staff was lackluster. And to top it all off we had to wait in line for over 30 minutes to check out along with the rest of the guests who were part of our convention as well as guests from a cruise ship who were checking in. Our bill was not delivered to our room on the last night and the "interactive" TV was not even close to being "active" so no checking out on the TV. Would highly recommend you look elsewhere for Waikiki accommodations. There are plenty of beautiful hotels on this lovely island. This is not one of them.

We stayed at Ala Moana Hotel on Nov. 2 because we were going to the 4th Annual Pacific Rim Jazz Festival held at the Hawaii Convention Center down 1 block across the street. The hotel was featured as offering a special "Kamaaina" (local resident) room rate especially for the jazz festival. The rate was about $167/night.We called the morning of check in, and asked if we could check in a little earlier, because the jazz festival doors opened at 3 p.m., and check in at the hotel was also 3 p.m. We were told no, even after explaining that the whole reason we booked at the hotel was because of the hotel's promotion for the jazz festival. That was strike #1.We asked the front desk person about parking options for Kamaaiana's, and whether Ala Moana shopping center was an option. Instead of simply and politely saying no option at the shopping center, she rudely replied the hotel parking is $20 and "I don't know anything about parking at the shopping center, call them." Strike #2.We opted for a "diamond head room" supposedly larger and with a view. We were on the "diamond head" side of the hotel, but the room was facing opposite of Diamond Head, with a "fantastic" view of the....parking lot! It was actually depressing to look out and see the parking lot and the other hotel wing. The room was somewhat small, and walls were paper-thin. We could hear a baby crying, although it was not coming from any of the rooms next door. That tells you how thin the walls are. My wife and I wanted a room with a king size bed, but were given two double beds...much too small for two people in one bed. Also, there was no facial tissue in the room. Strike #3.The good: close proximity to Hawaii Convention CenterThe bad: customer service at front desk; rooms are very small; no decent views from room; room amenities are lacking.We've stayed at countless other Waikiki hotels and have never experienced anything this bad.

I actually rate the overall Hotel a 3, no more because it's old and there is nothing special that sets them apart from any other Hotel in the area. My 1 rating is because they have the worst management and customer service I have had to deal with in Honolulu. I have had an issue on two separate occasions and unfortunately dealt with the same supervisor on duty, each time was a Sunday morning. He has nothing more than an unhelpful, not my problem, too bad attitude that has forced me to lead all my visiting friends and relatives to other Hotels. I only get stuck staying there because of business reasons, definitely not my choice. I live here and would never choose to stay there or recommend this Hotel to anyone I know. Staff is not that friendly and the Sunday manager is absolutely worthless!

We had 2 days here on our way to LA in a room facing Ala Moana Mall and it was okayOn our way back home we decided to spent 3 days again but what a disappointmentwe had a mountain view but the noise of the big rubbish bins being collected at 5am woke usup. The bed was not comfortable and the pillows used by date had expired long ago.The skirting around the bed was ripped and dirty. The rooms are very small and the size of the bathroom too small. The TV did not work and had to ask for someone to fix itthe remote needed new batteries. The coffee maker did not heat probably so you had to finish it off in the microwave. The iron was so badly pitted it pulled the fabric of my blouseand ironing board badly stained when receptionist was informed the attitude was more orless the iron will be replaced no sorry or comment on the state of my blouse. However inwriting this we did find the late afternoon evening staff delightful.Next time although the location is greAt will look at somewhere in Waikiki next time.A plus is they really do have fast internetDidn't think it good value for money when comparing to other hotels we have stayed At.Can't comment on breakfast or spa as didn't use these.There is the $2 tram which provides great transport to Waikiki and Ala Moana Mall so if youwanted to visit the Mall and stay in Waikiki this is a good form of transport.Careful with shuttle drivers as we were ripped off when we arrived $63 dollar return mostare $48 or $36 and never charge what they advertise . $12 per person seems to get a good shuttle and driver.

Room had old bedspread. Stains on the floor and TV remote did not work. Areas was wonderful. The mall adjacent to hotel was awesome, however, young female hotel staff were cold and not very helpful. Male staff went out of their way to be helpful.

The staff was very friendly and the hotel itself is nice. There is a popular club (Rumours) in the hotel that I never got an opportunity to go to, but I heard it was a local hotspot. The rooms were nice, but the view of the ocean is obstructed by buildings and overlooking parking lots of the mall. The fact that it was right next to the mall was a huge plus for shopping and restaurants, but it's a pretty far walk into Waikiki. I wish it was closer to the beach and the shops on the Waikiki strip. I think you could find a hotel in the heart of Waikiki (even on the water or across the street) for about the same price or less. However, if you find a good deal...go for it!
user_name:
Erica K V
Upper Arlington, Ohio

review_body: Stayed there for 5 nights for business. Yes the mall was handy for coffee and food court. Walked to car rental location and taxi a couple if times to Wakiki.Excellent customer service at front desk and concierge. I thought room size was satisfactory and had partial ocean view without paying extra and nice balcony. I would definitely stay there again.

Not a bad, no frills place to spend a couple of days for business, the nearby (walking distance) Convention Center, and adjacent Ala Moana Shopping Center. Rooms are clean and range from suites with kitchens to average size rooms. Free wifi, (terrible Lions) coffee, and tea. The walls are a little bit thin, and if you're a light sleeper noises from neighboring rooms and street noise from below (there must be a fire station nearby) will not be conducive to uninterrupted sleep. I've tried the breakfast buffet restaurant at the entrance of the hotel on various occasions, but would not recommend it. Better to walk over to Ala Moana and go to Starbucks. There's a "fancy" restaurant on the top floor with high prices ($50 and up) which I haven't tried.

Have stayed several times on multiple day stays here and service has always been consistently good and staff friendly. Normally have stayed in deluxe rooms which are spacious for one person, and views are okay. Have stayed in single rooms which are very very small in comparison, but not a big deal for business travellers I guess. Gym and pool facilities are great. Access to nearby Waikiki beaches are a short walk away and the Ala Moana mall is a quick 5 minutes walk away.

The first words I heard when checking in was: Your identification. There was no greeting, no smile, no eye contact, just words with no emotion. I was informed that check in was at 3pm and to come back then. When I returned, a different front desk person was surprised I was not given a room. Half of the hotel staff were friendly the other half made you feel unwelcome. After that, I avoided the front desk at all costs. The attendant by the pool was very friendly and welcoming. The location of the hotel was okay. Next time, I would probably prefer to be closer to Waikiki. Self parking was $20 per day and was convenient and parking spots were readily available. I would go for the Waikiki Tower which has a lanai. It took about 15 minutes to walk to where the Modern Hotel is, the start of where I consider the beginning or end of Waikiki Beach.

The rooms are indeed small. Staff is friendly. Lobby large and spacious. But taxis park and idle there so it is a loud and noisy place.My "view" was of the Ala Moana parking lot, but I didn't mind too much as I was only staying one night on business. I did believe I left my iPhone in the room and, calling back to retrieve it, I was told it wasn't there. This is unfortunate because there are a limited number of places it could be (hallway or the room), and I did tip housekeeping generously. I cannot be certain of this but just be careful.I did appreciate its walking proximity to the mall, which I have always enjoyed.

Stayed two nights while on business. An adequate hotel in good location for shopping. Room smallish, but clean and well kept. View was not to sea, but allowed for understanding growth in this city.Chinese eatery poor, Japanese eatery surprisingly good.Staff at front desk helpful. No morning paper unless one ate at breakfast resteraunt.

My family and I stayed at the Ala Moana Hotel in late September 2013 and found the hotel to meet all of our short stay needs. The hotel staff were friendly, polite and willing to help with any questions or directions that we had. We found that if you treat everyone with the respect that you require, then there will be no problems. The hotel room presented was clean and fresh. The bathroom for the four of us was not a problem. We very much liked the short walk over to the shopping centre which was amazing. First hit Starbucks for a coffee hit and then off shopping for 5 hours. Got some great bargains and met some awesome people. So well done on the hotel and the stay, we appreciate your efforts to make our time there trouble free

Not a bad location next to the Ala Moana mall for easy access to all kinds of food and shopping. Rooms can be a bit small but very manageable. New modern design and avoids the hassle of dealing with Waikiki. Good quiet area that's walkable to some nearby local shops (Don Quixote, anyone?) and Ala Moana beach.

Even the high-floor, ocean-view rooms are largely blocked by intervening tall buildings, but the newer Waikiki Tower is clean, courteous, private (after recent renovation), and it's very accessible to Ala Moana Center for shopping (the only choice in this locality), and better than Waikiki for Downtown access. If you have a car, then the $20 per day parking (one-level) is cheap by local standards. A high-floor city-view room may be the best choice in terms of value for money.The restaurants in the hotel are not good (the Japanese Yuzu is especially disappointing). Hotel shop has everything you'd need. Concierge is staffed by Expedia "local experts), which is probably a plus.Ala Moana Beach may be better than Waikiki for families and small children, and it is used by local swimmers. There is little surf near in. The hotel pool area is very large, often uncrowded and gets more sun than, say, the Marriott Waikiki Beach Hotel pool areas. However, there is no drink service.Clientele are often convention-related and some airline staff. The hotel is a little too expensive to get many Asian group tours, despite its size. Mainly US and Japanese.

I stayed in this hotel many years ago and was not impressed. They have completely refurbished this property and it is very nice. My room was smallish with a comfortable queen size bed, quality linens and updated appointments such as a flat screen tv, microwave, coffee maker and refrigerator. The new iron and board were handy in getting my uniform squared. Both the room and the bathroom were immaculate. The location is right at the mall with an array of dining options. I recommend Assiagio's italian cuisine - the best! My room was quiet and the elevators are more than adequate in number such that I never had to wait for a car. The staff were personable and always eager to help. Check-in and out were very smooth. I highly recommend this hotel.

This is one of my fave places to stay when our condo is rented! The location is great! Ala Moana Shopping Cntr. is an easy stroll! The Trolly to get Waikiki or Ward Cntr is close by. Parking does have a fee if you rent a car, but it IS easy in and out, and easy to get anywhere from this location! Ala Moana Beach park is close enough to walk. The only downside is the lack of room service, but there is a coffee maker and a fridge in every room, so bringing a snack and keeping it for later is easy! I found the room comfortable and clean. Queen bed was fine for me, perhaps for a small family (3 people) it might be cramped. I have already booked another stay, as the condo is rented and the Waikiki hotel I like has raised their rates too much for a two week stay! The room rate was great, parking fee slightly lower, only thing missing is room service. No worries!

attending an event at the Honolulu convention center, this hotel was the closest one.plus close to the shopping mall. I would skip buffet breakfast and find it somewhere else in the shopping center they need to upgrade the rooms , it's very old and it shows.

This hotel is adjacent to the Ala Moana Shopping Center which has any store imaginable. There are many great restarants nearby as well as bus stops for easy travel to Waikiki. The staff was very helpful in selecting the right excursions and directions to restaurants and places to visit. The hotel room was very clean and quiet.
user_name:
Pamela C
Big Flats, New York

review_body: I stayed here on business (with a conference in the nearby convention center). For service, the front desk was okay. Checking in was painful because I was with a wave of people checking in. At one point, they had about 5 - 6 people behind the front desk and all of them were doing something (I assume finishing their last transaction), but there was a line full of people, and no one called anyone up for a minute or so. Just odd, wasn't the best first impression.The rooms were tiny, tiny. I think I had a queen bed, but regardless of the size it was very awkward in the room. There was only a narrow path between the foot of my bed and the dresser. Probably not a big deal if I was there on vacation, but I had a couple of boxes delivered to me so at one point in my stay, the room was pretty cramped and it was awkward moving the boxes around in the room with such little floorspace.I paid $119 per night, think it was part of the conference deal, so the pricing wasn't bad. It is connected to the Ala Moana mall, which is convenient. The nice surprise of the hotel was a pretty comprehensive gym. I think it had 4 treadmills, 2 or 3 bikes, a couple of other cardio machines, and full suite for free weights and nautilus machines.Also I had an event catered by the hotel, with pupus and drinks. Overall, the catering department was fantastic and food and drinks were perfect for my event.On vacation, I probably would not stay here. But for business, it was acceptable.

This was my first time to Hawaii as a civilian - so it was quite a different experience than my trip in 2000 when I slept on a cot in a hut. So anything other than that should be a move in the right direction. However, right away I realized that Honolulu was not going to be the same as traveling to somewhere in the continental US and I better readjust my expectations. Everyone moves a little slower, so check-in was not super speedy - not like your typical business oriented Marriott. They even used the old school credit card machines that make an imprint with the carbon paper. On my way to the room I noticed a nice series of shops, which I found later to be quite pleasant with no high pressure sales, just lots of smiles and “good vibes”. My room was tiny with a view of a roof a parking lot and some mountains way behind them - but for $125 a night, I didn't think I should complain. The bed was quite comfortable, the a/c worked well and I appreciated the fridge, microwave and coffee pot even if the space was cramped. The tv seemed possessed by gremlins and only worked intermittently – but I didn’t come to Hawaii to watch the boob-tube, right? Breakfast was served at the Plantation restaurant with a 20% discount for the guests. Excellent fruit choices, plenty of juices to choose from and the service was really pleasant, but again, they operate on a non-continental time scale. I also had dinner at the Japanese restaurant off the hotel lounge. Excellent food, dubious service – we were a large group, but the restaurant was not filled to capacity, but they did run out of menus and servers - despite that it was a great meal at an affordable price – I feel bad to complain that they weren’t faster – I didn’t have anything to go to afterwards, so why complain? The gym was nice, close to the pool and the hotel was not far from a series of public beaches. I did not get to spend much time at the beach and although they were nice and visited by a lot of people, I am sure there are much nicer beaches to be found on the island. Overall I had a nice stay, the hotel is within easy walking distance to the convention center, shopping and the beach – what more could you want on a business trip?

Booked for ten days, five minutes into our stay we were on Hotel.com looking for something else. If all you came to Hawaii for was to go to the convention center then I guess this would work for you. My room overlooked a nudie bar and parking lot. Staff was nice, other than that the room was small, the bed hard as a rock and there were stains all over the floor.

Having stayed here many times in the past, I appreciate the location of the Ala Moana. It's not in crazy Waikiki, yet close to everything I want to do while in Honolulu.Staff is overall friendly, rooms adequate, however, the two things that BUG me are the high valet parking fees ($25/day) and the cost to use the Business Center. In my opinion, use of computers and printers should be complimentary like the better hotels in Chicago and LA. Rooms are less expensive in the Kona Tower and we still had oceanview.

This room is nice on a high floor. You have an unobstructed view of the beach park and the sun setting. The suite has a king bed, a stove top, two microwaves and two mini refrigerators. The living room has a pull out sofa bed and lots of cabinet space. What would be nice is if the cabinets were at least partially stocked with kitchen wares and dishes.

I was summoned for Jury Duty on Oahu and needed to stay overnight. The court put me up in this hotel. It was decent and conveniently located. Very small room, but very clean. I guess it was all I needed for an over-nighter.

If it's shopping or the beach that's on your "to do" list, Ala Moana Hotel is the place to stay.Walk through the parking lot on the second floor and you're at Ala Moana Shopping Center. Hop across the street and you'll be at Ala Moana beach park. Catch the complementary trolley to visit the rest of Waikiki. Accommodations are modern and clean.

This hotel, like many in that area is very nice. The staff is very friendly and helpful. However the room is a little small, we had a one queen with a pull out sofa. When the sofa is pulled out it is very hard to move around to get to the balcony etc. This hotel is attached to the Ala Moana Mall - great mall for shopping.

Most of the upper rooms have good views of the ocean or the mountains. The hotel is close to Ala Moana park which has a beautiful beach without the big crowds on Waikiki beach. There is a large mall next to the hotel with several nice eating places.The pool and workout room are clean and never crowded. My room had a small refrigerator and combination microwave/heating oven. The staff is helpful and pleasant, they seem to enjoy working there.

Our stay in the Waikiki Tower was great and Waikiki was only a short distance away. Plenty of trolleys available as well as immaculate sidewalks to use back and forth. The staff at the hotel were exceptionally courteous and helpful. The walkway from the hotel to a huge mall was great - a mall that was filled with shops, restaurants, and easy access to trolleys to Waikiki shopping/Pearl Harbor/downtown Honolulu. Overall our stay was very pleasant, affordable, and close to everything!
user_name:
Ladd298
North Carolina Coast, North Carolina

review_body: Stayed for 5 nights and got an upgrade at check-in to a suite in the Waikiki tower. Roomy and a great view of the ocean, marina and park area across the street. Downtown is lit up beautifully at night. The connected mall has everything you may need and something's you don't. Short walk to Waikiki area. Twenty dollar a night parking is worth it if you want to drive yourself around. Parking is underneath the hotel and accessible from the lobby by stairway or elevator.

Our "mountain view" room was actually a view of an office high-rise, and if you looked kind of to the side you could see the mountains. Close to the mall for a short walk, so that was nice. Close to lots of other things, so we could walk or easily drive somewhere. This part of Honolulu reminds me a lot of Miami - it's really just a floating city. I'd rather we had stayed anywhere but in Honolulu itself. Oh, and our room was incredibly tiny. The best thing about it? Where it's located.

A decent place to stay if you totally want to shop and relax most of your trip. A bit pricey with not much to offer other than a skywalk to the shopping center or the beautiful view which is reason it's pricey! Pool is too small for big hotel, no real design to it, pool security rude. I invited my young nieces to swim an after using a floater for an hour as well as other Japanese guest, we were told not to use it, yet they sell these floaters in the Lamont's store on the first floor.. Maybe they shouldn't sell them downstairs, but I thought the pool guy could've been a little more pleasant!! The massage downstairs is anything but that. I made an appointment thinking its a spa environment only to find out its just your everyday home type massage with a fancy advertisement! Not what I expected I cancel my appointment, they tried to tell me there is a 24 hrs cancellation policy which they never told me, being it was only a matter of 30mins from the time of reservation and cancellation, the therapist was late, and yet they want me to pay for their time (not sure time the therapist showed up, we left) but not for the waste of my time waiting, then they planned to charge my hotel room but left a sneaky message that the room was charged even without the massage, either way, I settled with the owner, yet only to find out from her receptionist it was never charged liked they said. The owner was workable and understanding and my daughter and I got a massage to avoid charges and no service! I wouldn't recommend it, big disappointment if your used to spa massages. The rooms are small for the price I paid, my friend got a cheaper hotel in Waikiki next to the international market place and shoppings, exec, for a $100 cheaper and yet they're room was bigger and nicer with everything right outside there hotel door.My room did not have a microwave that I discovered after buying frozen pizza that's its a toaster type warmer that looks like a microwave! Disappointed... For paying the big bucks for the Waikiki towers.. You would need to go to the cheaper towers to do laundry, inconvenience!! I stayed at the Ala Moana in my past trips and they used to have a laundromat but I guess they phased it out same as room service!!! So if you get hungry late at night, lol they have a pamphlet that suggest pizza delivery no later than 1am! No courtesy envelopes, stationary, pens. Well although I made it a pleasant and it was okay, the lobby is nice and very spacious, it's best features.., I would suggest finding a cheaper hotel in Waikiki with the beaches, stores, activities, etc. within walking distance from everything instead of paying parking space irregardless if your a guest at the hotel! so unless you just want to mall shop for most of your trip the Ala Moana is the place for you! For seniors the discounts only apply to the Kona towers the one with no balcony, guess they're worried the seniors will fall off them! Either you give seniors a discount or not, leave the option open for them to choose which tower!

The hotel is a great value for kamaaina. Has several ammenities. The room was clean and comfortable, with a microwave, fridge, and coffee maker. Staff was helpful and friendly. Although, you are not right on the beach, it is a short walk through the park to a wonderful spot and several rooms have views of the ocean. There is a walkway to Ala Moana Shopping Center which has every store imaginable and a great food court for a quick bite. Picking up water, other drinks is easy at the store in the lobby. Good restaurants in the hotel as well.

Stayed recently 1 night before and after a cruise. Hotel is adjacent to the large Ala Moana Shopping Center and is a couple of blocks up from Waikiki. Stayed in both the Kona and Waikiki Towers of which the Waikiki was more roomy and more expensive. Both were comfortable. On site parking was $20 per night. All in all a good choice for a non right on the beach stay!

I've just come from staying at this establishment and I would really recommend staying elsewhere. 1. The booking was under the name "luxury suites" and we were never told that this was in the ala moana hotel so we drove around for half an hour to find the place. Walked in and they said it was in there establishment. Ok....2. The valets there are terrible and didn't even come to the car - it seemed I was a bother when he finally came around to tell me where to go. There were 4 valets and the three times I saw them (when I was coming in and out of the hotel) they were just standing around talking to each other also ignoring the other cars. FYI parking is $20 self and $25 valet.3. It's dirty - see the photos. Also there was a stash of linen under the bed (see photo also).4. It's expensive - breakfast isn't included. The breakfast is around $12.50 continental, $16.50 hot. People also hang around you for tips. The lady at the restaurant stood next to me while I paid waiting for her tip. 4. The staff are rude - very rude. The lady that checked me in was shocked that I came to her desk and said that she needs to go on a break. Ok so what do you want me to do? Anyway she served me wasn't happy about it. Everybody that I met that worked there was rude. Good point:Nice view. Do with this what you wish - but I would really suggest staying elsewhere.

Had a bad feeling as soon as I pulled up, however upon entering the lobby I thought "this might not be so bad". Front desk staff was fairly friendly, but seemed not to happy to be there. Upon arrival to my room I was disappointed. The rooms seemed no better then a Motel. Outdated furnishings, completely outdated comforters that seemed dirty etc (make sure to remove these and put in the corner while you sleep!). The room did not seem clean, and the beds were not at all comfortable. I would not stay here again, even for 1/2 the price. The area around the hotel seemed very scary at night. While I was walking back to the hotel from dinner, there was a cop on the corner who I talked to. He said this area is one of the highest crime areas and to be careful. Would not stay here again on my own.

Although the hotel is a great value comparately, you do not miss out on service or ammenities. The room was clean and comfortable, with a microwave, fridge, and coffee maker. Staff was helpful and very friendly. Although, you are not right on the beach, it is a short walk through the park to a wonderful spot. There is a walkway to Ala Moana Shopping Center which has every store imaginable and a great food court for a quick bite. Picking up water, other drinks and snacks at the Longs Drug store is a money saver. The Convention center and a number of good restaurants are within an easy walking distance. It is a lot less hectic than a number of the other chain hotels. Also, the restaurants in the hotel are better values than those in the other large resort hotels with the exception of the breakfast buffet (I would avoid that and go elsewhere). If you rent a car, self parking is convenient and reasonable as hotels go.We had none of the issues mentioned in a few of the other reviews, and I would absolutely stay there again.

Stayed here many times in past and WAS a good value; however the service has NOT kept up with the times and changing economy, it has gone WAY down:1. Pool guy (Thomas) was away from his station and I had to wait 5 minutes t get towels; as he was not there when I left, I took my towel receipt (it was sticking out of an OPEN file box) on top of his counter; and then he came running over and yelled at me-he's got some attitude...2. They OVER charged me on my bill by 10%, I caught it and talked to the alleged mgr. Darrel Kidani, he said they will credit it by "next week" (this was on Wed. at 9am) he was not willing or able to put in a credit request to my Bank and sooner....Just what you want to hear while on vacation: We charged an extra 10% for NO VALUE...3. Tried to catch the news, but the TV does NOT work for more than ~30minutes, then shuts off. I had 2 maintenance guys here in 2 days:Last one said: "the system is so old, it is antiquated, You must reboot it several times an hour." Unfortunately the cable modem is way out of the way and difficult to reach=under the desk and then to the right behind the back of the desk/dresser.

Like the location as I prefer not to stay in Waikiki. Nice that I can walk over to the shopping mall for good coffee and groceries. Lots of airline crew and military personnel staying here, so I thought it would be decent enough. It was okay but nothing special. Room was clean enough, but maid service forgets the details.

Nice, spacious and clean rooms. Gigantic lobby, though this hotel felt more like a cold, business hotel than a warm Hawaiian greeting that we received at other hotels.Location great for Ala Moana Center and Convention center.

Nice hotel, friendly helpful staff with the exception of the pool attendant who tried to charge me $2 for a towel and got very unpleasant when I said I didn't bring money with me to the pool. I was about to go back to my room to get some money when he begrudgingly gave me a towel. A lot of the staff tell you you can't charge things to your room , which is contrary to most other places I've stayed :-(

Good location across the street from Ala Moana Beach park where the waves are calm and easy to swim. The hotel is also attached by a parking lot to Ala Moana shopping center where an abundance of restaurants, stores, bars and clubs are just a moment away. Good happy hour at the upstairs restaurant with a spectacular view of city and ocean. A must do when staying at the hotel. The rooms were a bit small but since we were not in our room very much, it met our needs. Medium size pool on the 3rd floor for those who want a change from the beach. It was a nice stay ans we would stay here again.

I would like to say that I stayed at this hotel only because it was recommended as part of a conference I was attending. I was a little skeptical because of the pictures, but went against that feeling. I wish I hadn't - it was pretty dismal. Basically, I would describe it as a large comfort inn - complete with the gross bed covers. It did not feel clean - several of my towels had stains. The first room I was given on the 4th floor literally looked INTO a parking lot. I was moved to the 13th floor and still looked OVER the parking lot, but had a view of the mountains - VERY far off in the distance. The whole place was cheesy - cheesy souvenir shop in the ground floor, HORRID, cheesy breakfast place outside - nothing about it would make me stay there. The little shop in the lobby had stained carpets. The only reason I didn't give it a terrible rating was because my husband said that parking was easy. He played golf several days and said it was easy to get onto the main highways from our location. However, if you want to go to the beach, you have to walk over this HUGE highway. It was doable - we did it every day, but you are about a 10 - 15 minute walk to Waikiki. However, there are hotels about 5-8 minutes away (the Hilton) for one, that would have been MUCH preferable to stay at. We asked the concierge for recommendations for dinner and she gave us some cheesy tour group restaurant - not even worth talking to her if you want anything decent.
user_name:
nyctribecatraveler
New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel has pretty small rooms. Clean, quiet, a mini fridge and overall nice. However, the best thing going for it is that it's connected across the parking lot from the Ala Moana mall--a very upscale mall. The largest outdoor mall in the world. There are good restaurants (chains and specialized), Neiman Marcus, Macy's, boutiques, and lots of small local gift store like Sand People (LOVE that store). It's easy to drive to Waikiki (or walk for that matter) and it's close to Ross, and many other restaurants. The price is always good and it's a nice place to stay.

I find the hotel conveniently situated between Waikiki Beach and shopping area called Ala Moana Shopping Center. In fact, we would stroll in the evening or early in the morning going to and from the beach and simply enjoyed the sceneries and ate in specialty restaurants in between. We also enjoyed our shopping in the nearby arcades. Hotel is also clean and well maintained. We got a room with a good view of the city and the mountain. Overall, stay was comfortable and price reasonable.

Stayed here for 5 nights while attending a friend's family reunion. Great location. Convenient to the airport, Northshore, Kailua, and Waikiki. Great walking over to the Ala Moana Mall. Will definitely come back here again when on Oahu.

Hotel is located a block from the Convention Center and backs up on the Ala Moana Shopping Center. This makes it easy to catch a bus, cab, get around, get snacks for the room, and grab something to eat quickly (Try the Foodland Court on the bottom level of the mall for great sushi, prepacked salads, and snacks). Pool closes at dusk (bummer), Beach is a short walk away. Rooms are clean. Get a room on the ocean side for a great view with a balcony. Not really a vacation hotel...but works well if you are working in paradise.

This hotel has a perfect location if you are visiting Honolulu. Our entire family stayed in this hotel for anywhere from 7-14 days for a wedding and we probably booked at least 20 rooms for family and guests. Hotel is in walking distance to the Ala Moana Mall. It has lots of shopping and variety of restaurants. Anchor stores are Macys, Nordstrom and Neiman Marcus.Plenty of places to eat around the hotel, local restaurants are the best. Every staff is friendly and very helpful. The hotel has a nice decor and clean. It also has its own fine dining restaurants and a buffet/ cafe. The only thing I can say negative is that the hotel pool closes too early, about 5 pm. The gym has no antebacterial wipes for the equipments, also no towels or water available for guests. Overall, this hotel is rated excellent.

Compared to the prices for the resort hotels, this is a fine place to stay. i found the rooms to be clean and well maintained. The view of the harbor was nice and the location (near the Ala Moana Shopping Plaza and the Convention Center) was terrific. If you are looking for the beach and resort amenities, this is not the place for you. Maid service was very late in the day. Staff was friendly and helpful. Not much street noise.

My daughter and I recently stayed at the Ala Moana Hotel in Honolulu and had a fabulous time! the staff were very friendly and hospitable, the two beds room very comfortable and the service was excellent. it is steps away from the convention center where the American Psychological Asssociation Convention was being held, and barely a five minute walk. We would come back to our room in between sessions and relax. We were somewhat concerned that it was only three stars, and were very pleasantly surprised that although they are three star we received five star courtesy and service. Thank you! Dr. Kalyani Gopal

We stayed at the Ala Moana Hotel for a week and would stay there again. It is convenient to the shopping center, with department stores, a grocery store, a bookstore, a food court and luxury specialty shops. On the other side is the convention center and the intersection of two major streets, one leading into Waikiki and the other leading off to downtown Honolulu a few miles away. The hotel was clean and nicely appointed. This is not a luxury setting, with thick, cushy towels. The towels do the job with no problem, but are what you might find at home. There is a nice Chinese restaurant in the hotel, where we had lunch not once but twice. There is also a Japanese bar like restaurant toward the back and a standard Western coffee shop. We asked to stay in the Waikiki tower, which we heard is more recently renovated. Very nice, quiet for the most part and a keyed elevator for guests. The beach is a couple of blocks away, but not so far as to be impractical.
