Again, a nice, good basic hotel, away from the bustle of Waikiki, and near the more local attractions of shopping and a beach park. We will stay here when we next need a hotel in Honolulu.

The Ala Moana is a large hotel right on the end of Waikiki and connected to the Ala Moana shopping center. I stay here on occasion for business (when I can't get a Hilton or Marriott brand) and it is an okay place. It has small, but clean rooms and is priced well for Honolulu. The location is great for shopping (if you like shopping) and is right across from a large beach park that is great for walking/running/beach. If you are looking for decent accommodations without any frills, this is a fine hotel.

This was our second leg of our Hawaiian trip. The lobby was amazing , but the rooms were awful!! It was not very clean and the sheets did not look fresh!! The rooms were not sound proof and you could hear conversations from inside. Everytime someone opened / closed a door I woke up!!Chairs in the lobby were uncomfortable!! Location was great though!

First of all most units owned and operated by LSI out of Las Vegas. Carpets, beds and chairs need to be replaced. Very uncomfortable bed, carpet dirty and worn. Maid service very late in the day,view of harbor was nice, pool nice on 3rd floor. Parking $20 per day,very crowded at times. Convenient to Airport, taking the trolley was fun to Waikiki, but very crowded.

I live here in Honolulu, but stay here occasionally for class reunions, weekend staycations, etc. My employer has all of its out-of-town job interviewees booked here, and the mainland folk love the central location. We can pick up our interviewees without battling the crazy gridlock of Waikiki. I need to emphasize that if you are dreaming of the white sands of Waikiki beach outside your front door, please stay at a hotel in Waikiki. This hotel is a 15-min stroll from Waikiki, and is a block away from the very lovely and spacious Ala Moana beach park, great for swimming and family gatherings. It can get crowded on weekends & summer, but is less crowded than Waikiki. If you, like me, are not a water person, you must check out the largest outdoor shopping mall in the world, Ala Moana Shopping Center, which this hotel is physically connected to.

This was our first time staying at this hotel in this area. The hotel room was clean, nice view. The exercise room was always busy but the equipment and size of the room was decent. The lounge in the hotel lobby was never open while we were there and the there is an upscale bar/night club that is open a couple days a week with dress restrictions so if you want a drink or a snack your looking at walking 10-15 minutes into the Ala Moana Shopping Centre. The hotel room price was reasonable which makes the stay worth while but unless you want to walk and shop/eat at the mall, your best to book something closer to Waikiki beach. We also found that on the back side of the hotel facing the mall the music from the open air mall would keep us awake until 1:00 am. The chinese restaurant on the 3rd floor is average which speaks to about what you will experience. If your shopping around for a good deal and the rooms at this hotel are your best price then you won't be disappointed but then your stay won't be over the top!

We stayed here for three nights. Our suite was in the Waikki tower and was a corner suit. We had amazing views of the beautiful beach and the city lights.We loved staying next door to the Ala Moana shopping centre/mall. The staff at reception were terrific, especially the lovely lady who handled our reservation upon arrival. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

I stay here quite frequently for work. It is a nice enough hotel, pool, wifi in the room, etc. But the rooms can be quite small and if you are in the Kona tower rather than the Waikiki tower you have no balcony. The hotel is really close to Ala Moana mall so if you like shopping till you're dropping then this place is great. No free breakfast and the breakfast restaurant downstairs is quite expensive. I usually eat at IHOP or Denny's instead. The staff are friendly enough although it is quite irritating when the maids constantly ask to clean the room even after you have told them twice. I put up my do not distrurb sign and was left a snarky little note after 3 days of no maid service. Fine if you want to be close to the shopping mall but it is about a 15 min walk to Waikiki proper.

We stayed at the Ala Moana for 5 nights on a recent trip to Honolulu. The accommodation was booked on the internet and advertised as the Luxury Suites at the Ala Moana. The rooms were clean and modern but not exactly luxury. After travelling all night we arrived at the hotel at 9am and check in was at 3pm. We asked if there was a possibility of getting into our room a little earlier but discovered that the hotel is separate from Luxury Suites and apart from handing us our room key when it was time to check in the reception didn't really have any more responsibility for our room. We were given phone numbers to call to find out about an earlier check in but one was a fax number and the other was an office in Las Vegas with an answering machine. At 3pm when we got our key we were given instructions on what to do if there was a problem with the room. Once again more phone numbers to report any issues immediately. So we had one glass, no bottle opener and the TV didn't work plus a number of other issues. In the end we didn't bother. If you are staying at this hotel, make sure you book the hotel and not the Luxury Suites or you'll get very limited service.As for the hotel itself, the location was good with a number of meal options and a night club. We had a meal at the Signature restaurant on level 36 and loved the meal and the views and the cocktails.

Ala Moana Hotel is a great location for those hungry for an awesome food-court and vast shopping at the very close, attached actually, Ala Moana Shopping Center. I visit on business and it is an affordable option with clean, quiet rooms and a helpful staff. The pool is nice, and the pool area is large enough to find privacy or action depending on your game. I stayed for four nights with no problems. Town center is a bit of a walk from here.
user_name:
Marcus D
Naalehu, Hawaii, United States

review_body: We stayed at the Ala Moana for about 12 nights and would it choose again on a future trip to Honolulu. It's not Waikiki beach, but that can be a plus rather than a minus, if you're not big on beach going! You can walk to Ala Moana beach, but it's not very close, for example you have to cross a major multi-lane road. We were in Honolulu primarily for reunion events and general sightseeing rather than beachtime. The room was small by mainland standards, but 'partial ocean view' does provide some view of Ala Moana Park... and it had good strong airconditioning. It was relatively hot when we were in Honolulu! It was clean and well-maintained. The two (coin op) laundry rooms for guests were extremely helpful. We liked the Plantation Café for breakfast very much; they serve a good buffet and have friendly staff. While there is a fee for hotel parking, at least you have in-and-out privileges. The nearby shopping center provides many meal options as well as shopping.

food was awesome.guess drinks cost that much nowadays .... security must be an issue as friend in room had to come down to get us and use an elevator key to get us up. safe for everyone.parking at the adjacent shopping center..... right price, naturally.

This one experience ruined a very pleasant stay at Ala Moana Hotel. It is true that it takes only one bad thing to ruin your entire perception of something, and only one bad employee can bring down a hotel's reputation. First of all, let me say that we were very happy with our room, everything was clean, bed was comfortable, we had a great view of the mountains on the 35th floor. It was adjacent to the Ala Moana Mall which was convenient, and away from the touristy chaos of Waikiki. I was ready to write a glowing review and had plans to come back for more. The one bad thing that happened was at the hotel restaurant for breakfast buffet, the Plantation Cafe. We used the buffet only twice during our stay because we had to be out early sometimes and had no time for breakfast. The food was the usual served for breakfast with hot and cold choices, fruits, bread. The first time we used it was ok, but the second time we ate there, a dishonest employee tampered with my credit card receipt to add his/her tip and changed the total. This is criminal. Let me say that I often tip in cash because I believe our server should be the one to get it, I seldom add the tip to the credit card total. So the reason I caught this was because I always check my purchases online to see my statements and compare with my receipts (I know, OC, I was a victim of identity theft before and am more careful now), and there it was, they added to the tip/gratuity and added up the new total. It was a small amount, $7, 20% of the total plus tax (but really this was a buffet and not sit-down) but the point is they tampered, and I already tipped in cash. There was only 2 of us who ate at $16/pax. Again I go back to the point, they tampered with the receipt! Ala Moana is a nice hotel. It's a pity that this happened. They have dishonest people. Who doesn't? Lesson learned: encircle your total and put a check mark beside it before signing. (I should've done that)

The hotel room was lovely, clean and well maintained. The furniture including the bed was comfortable and we had a balcony on our 31st floor room with beautiful views of the beach and Yacht club. Located right next to the Ala Moana Shopping Centre (over 400 shops with plenty of bargains to be had) meant that my wife did not have too far to carry her days shopping and there are plenty of places to eat, day or night. Located only a 5 minute walks to a lovely, quite beach meant that there was plenty of time to relax on the beach or fish off the water bank. The local tram car stop that takes you to other parts of Waikiki was located at the Ala Moana Shopping Centre making it easy to get to busier parts of Waikiki, only 10 minutes away by tram car. The hotel location is quite despite the shopping centre next door and the pool and gym were very good. The hotel also has some lovely restaurants and a small but very convenient grocery shop where you could get the essentials like, alcohol. The hotel staff are excellent and very knowledgeable. All in all a very pleasant place to stay and I would recommend it.

Terrible experience. Unfriendly staff, room with stained carpet and faucet that didn't work correctly. Entire hotel had a musty smell. Did not feel welcomed. Noisy, surrounding area was scary lots of homeless. About a 15 min walk to beach but no beach amenities available (chairs, umbrellas, etc). Hotel website does a nice job painting a glowing place but don't be fooled. Spend a little more and go elsewhere! We actually checked out two days early and went to another hotel, says a lot .

We stayed here one night. Very nice hotel good location. Not right on the beach, but probably a 5-10 minute walk. Connected to the best mall I have ever been to. The building is part condo, part hotel. There is a convenince store located in the building, opens at 7am. Good place to buy snacks. Breakfast at the Plantation Cafe was good ( $16.95 for adults, 9.95 for kids, free for 3 and under). The room was nice. We had a King Size bed. Nice couch, table and chair. We had a balcony over looking the pool. Clean. Microwave, Minifridge, flat screen tv. We couldn't get the tv to work and called down to the front desk and a guy came up with in 5 minutes of us calling ( the cord to the tv was unplugged , we actually checked the wall plug, which was fine). Very nice and helpful staff. I would rec'd!!!

We were only in Honolulu for 2 nights to visit Pearl Harbor and wanted something clean and safe at a decent price (beach hotels are very expensive). It was basically clean and safe and next to the mall. You could tell it had been recently remodeled, but it had the smallest rooms ever. The beds were not comfortable, The sofa bed opened to within 2 inches of the walls, bed and chair so you couldn't even walk around it. The sofa bed mattress was horribly uncomfortable and did not have any bedding on it - or in the room. The pool on the deck looked nice. The breakfast restaurant was way overpriced, but the buffet was okay. The people at the reception desk were rude. People in our party found a large roach in the main restaurant. They pointed it out to the waiter, but did not stay to eat. They did have extra security on the elevators so that only guests could access the upper floors, which was a nice feature. It had that odd feeling that it was a big busy hotel, but there really didn't seem to be many people around.

Nice hotel located near the fishing piers. Clean, wifi in rooms is awesome and free. Wifi in the main areas - not so good which is a bit of a change from most hotels. The bed and the pillows were very comfortable. Housekeeping did a good job each day and they were friendly and pleasant.

We did a lot of research in booking this hotel for our final Hawaii. night. Our departing flight was at 0700. We wanted shuttle service to and from airport with no hassle. It turned out to be just the opposite. No shuttle from airport unless purchased from outside carrier. Due to our early departure no shuttle in AM either. We had to take cab. I don't mind paying, if I know that is what I have to do, but don't include in your included options, when its not. The lobby is lovely. It is close to Ala Moana Mall, so lots of shopping. Trolley runs from mall around city, so easy for sight seeing. The staff were not helpful at all. We had four bags, I had new broken arm, and not one bell person or staff member offered to help us.

I "pricelined" this hotel (2 rooms) for my family for 2 nights while visiting Pearl Harbor. We were on our way to Maui after this. The hotel had some very unfriendly people working at the desk and the hotel was at best a convention hotel. The room(s) we were given were so far away from the elevator; plus finding which bank of elevators to take was a task unto itself. The rooms were very very small with practically no view; and my room's window was on top of the roof; I felt very insecure knowing someone can just walk on the roof and into my room. The up side of the hotel was that the garage to the mall was connected somehow to the hotel which made it easy to get to. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.....

I recently attended a conference held at this hotel; my husband and I had an ocean view room on the 31st floor . While it does not have immediate beach access, the view of the yacht harbor and Ala Moana Park is spectacular. It is convenient to the Ala Moana Center, which has anything anyone would want to buy from food to Cartier. Our room had a refrigerator and microwave so the Foodland grocery store was very convenient (there is also a market with some foods, spirits and excellent prices on souvenir items in the lobby between the main lobby and the Kona lobby). Our room (two double beds) was quite spacious for two and spotless. The room was cleaned promptly each day. We loved the lanai and had coffee there each morning and drinks in the evening. We had booked our own tours over the internet prior to our visit, but there is a travel desk which can provide assistance. Most tours pick up at the Ala Moana just outside the Kona lobby. I highly recommend the Ala Moana Hotel if being close to the beach is not important. We didn't have time to spend on the beach! Too much to see on our first trip to Hawaii!

This hotel was almost like a "no-brainer" choice for someone who is visiting Hawaii for the first time -- even the free ballpen given by Delta Air has the hotel name on it! They say this is the choice for airline crew to stay in.When I came in with 2 very heavy luggage NO ONE HELPED ME.The person at the front desk, seemed too unhappy or bored to actually try to find a room for me. I went up to my room with no help from anyone.The room was ok because it was clean, but it looked very dated.The hotel has a bridge way that connects it to the Ala Moana Mall. It was raining when I got there... and when I walked from the hotel to the mall, the floors were way too slippery that of course, I slipped!!! It has been 2 weeks now and I still feel the pain on my knees. I hope they change the flooring they used -- the floor seems to be made of stone cladding made for walls and not floors! The buffet breakfast did not have a lot of choices! It was very reminiscent of the FREE breakfast buffet in provincial hotels in the Philippines... definitely not worth $18!

My 18-year-old daughter was booked into this hotel by a third party for a work-related event. When she went to check in -- thousands of miles from home and on her first solo trip -- she was denied the room reserved for her without securing the room with a $1,000 deposit. The adult in charge of the event was not there yet and the hotel staff was abusive and unkind and refused to talk to me or my husband on the phone unless we faxed them our credit card number. Our daughter -- a brave, poised young college athlete -- was so upset and scared she became physically ill. Really. We're thousands of miles and a few time zones away and they won't talk to us without our Visa number? SERIOUSLY UNPROFESSIONAL! I am furious beyond words at this point -- and my daughter is sitting in the lobby crying. I have advised her to vomit in the lobby and tell them to call her parents if they don't like it. Who knows, maybe they'll act like adults and talk to us without our credit card number.

We stayed on the 27th floor - small room but clean, had a lanai, refrigerator and microwave. Staff was always friendly unlike some others' experiences. This is not a convenient hotel if you want beach access, however the shopping mall is nearby.

We stayed 2 nights (11/29 & 30/2012) here before going on the NCL cruise! As soon as we arrived at the desk we were upgraded to a room with a balcony! Every hotel employee was extremely helpful, courteous, & very pleasant (always smiling)! Upon checking out Sat. AM, for a small fee they held our luggage while we took a city bus to Waikiki (before boarding the ship)! Loved the convenience of having the Ala Moana Mall right behind the hotel - great food court there, & city buses running all over from there, too! Did I forget to mention - the front entrance & the grand lobby of the Ala Moana hotel are just BEAUTIFUL!!!

WE stayed here for just 1 night before a NCL cruise.We were dropped off at the end of the road and had to drag our bags up the ramp to the entrance. The checking was ok but finding our room was difficult due to a lack of signage! The room was small and tired with a small bed but huge old telly. There was nowhere to eat on site although the Ala Moana centre was only a short, but hot walk away. We had breakfast the following morning in the on site café. This was ok foodwise but the area was scruffy and the staff very "short" with us..asking how we were going to pay before we had even sat down..and then somehow "accusing " me of having a cooked breakfast.!It was what we asked for and payed for.

I was here for a 3-day conference at the Convention Center, which was just a short walk away. The room was very clean, the bed was very comfortable, the wi-fi worked a treat, and the microwave was handy. However, the room is small, but OK for one person; two people in the room might be problem. Reception was always helpful and the Expedia desk in the foyer was useful for booking bus tours to Pearl Harbor and island tours. If you like shopping then this is the place for you. A short walk thru the car park brings you to Macy's and another 290 shops. There is a very good food mall in the shopping center, and some other restaurants. It is a good 20 minute walk to Waikiki where there are more shops and better restaurants. The Ala Moana beach is across from the shopping center, and is a great beach.

This hotel seems like a decent place. Our stay was clouded by a cockroach we found in our room. We were only staying one night so I didn't bother making a scene about it. The reviews here are mixed, and there is a good reason why.

This was just a regular stay for me. Nothing special. No upgrades, no frills. Just a good clean room. View of the parking lot. The tv in the room was super small! I've never seen such a small flat screen! The lanai was nice. I liked the fact that we were able to order pizza from a local company through some advertisement in the room. The pizza was delicious and delivery was convenient without the extra room service charge. I think the hotel offers free entrance to their nightclub downstairs if you're a guest but we didn't go. The hotel connects directly with the Ala Moana Mall so we were able to walk through to the eating area Shirokiya.The trip was bid on priceline so it was about $100 and it was decent for the price. We did have an extra parking charge so factor that into your cost.

Pro.. Staff very nice, friendly helpful.. Addressed issues promptly.Cons.. Pool area closes at 6pm!!! WHAT?? In Hawaii?? Even the pools in Omaha are open till 10 at night or so. Steam room did not work. Small room, older part of building. For what we paid, thought we would get the brand new high rise tower.. Did not look very full at night. I think I will keep looking next time for a better value. Again.. The Staff was outstanding!!!

The Ala Moana is connected to the largest outdoor mall in the US. It came in handy since it seems one of our bags was stolen at the airport.We stayed there for two nights before departing on the Pride of America. Upgraded our room at check in. The rooms was clean - nothing spectacular. At least they had a coffee maker in the room.Parking was quoted at $20.00 per night, but was actually $25.00.One note of warning - they have a Chinese restaurant in the hotel - avoid at all costs. It was horrible - and I mean horrible.The cafe for breakfast was expensive, and only offers a full buffet or continental breakfast which is part of the larger offerings. Make sure you don't "take food from the middle". I took oatmeal and was charged for a full buffet. Wish they had explained the system. The next morning they discounted our breakfast because of the confusion from the day before.This is a corporate hotel - not on the beach, but worked for us.

Nice hotel. Functional. Above mall so there's plenty of great shopping close by. Rooms are clean and have quiet air con. I did hear noise through the walls though...baby crying. I would stay again. Amenities such as shampoo are not luxury and sheets are low quality. Otherwise it's safe and does the job

I stayed at the Ala Moana Hotel for two nights over the Memorial Day weekend. I was a little disappointed. From the outside the hotel looks very good and the lobby looks posh. When I got to my room, it was very small and it smelled musty. I got a room in a smaller building behind the main building. No balcony and a view of the seedy side of town. The service was awful. The concierge seemed irritated that I had to ask for directions to the elevator. Buyer beware.

Stayed for a week over the Memorial Day weekend to visit family in the area and this hotel was perfect. Well-located (right by the Ala Moana Shopping Center with stores and restaurants galore). Short distance to Don Quijote (a wonderful store selling everything from groceries at the best prices to clothes, camping gear, etc) and also to Ala Moana Beach Park (safe and shallow beach plus they do a Buddhist lantern floating ceremony here on Memorial Day that is a huge televised event in Honolulu). With a great sauna+steam room and good fitness center and a sunny pool, I was on the 4th floor (Kona/mountain view room) so just down the hall from all those amenities. At a senior rate of only $129 a night, it was a bargain for Hawaii prices so I was pleasantly surprised to find the room so nicely appointed and furnished (as a single person the room size was fine and I preferred not having a balcony). No annoying mini-bar but instead a nice sized fridge, microwave, coffee-maker, room safe, iron and ironing board, etc. The room was always cleaned and serviced very well and there was never any noise problems from the hall or other rooms. AC was noiseless and easily controlled at the thermostat.I was walking or riding with relatives so the parking wasn't an issue for me and the local bus service is plentiful and cheap (can get a 4 day unlimited pass for $25) and easily accessed from here. Front desk and bell staff were very helpful (at check-out they printed out my boarding passes for my flight for me since they don't have free computers/printers to use yourself). Shuttle service to the airport is very reasonable ($11 one way).Definitely I would stay again at that price.
user_name:
Ian D
St. Helena Island, SC

review_body: Apart from the not too friendly hotel staff, the hotel had everything you'd expect from a 4 star hotel. The pillows were way too thick though. My neck felt out of place. Also the pool was only open until 6pm (???).Location was good. You could walk to the Hilton beachfront pier in about 10-15 minutes (where a lot of boat tours start).The hotel is also connected by a footbridge to the Ala Moana Shopping complex which has lots and lots of shops and therefore LOADS of people visit. Cab to the airport will set you back around $35-45.Cab to Hanauma bay will set you back about $50 (inc. tip)

Since this is next to a huge shopping centre, as you can imagine it is great fro shopping and access to food and drinks. Also even during the week there is a bar with a live band and good value cocktails. 10 - 15 minutes walk to Waikiki; but its nice also as you can walk around the coast and along the beach.

This hotel like any other has its pros and cons.... Pros are its an ideal location, right next to the largest shopping mall in Hawaii, actually just a few minutes walk and you are there. The staff is friendly and it's close to hundreds of shops and restaurants. No rental car is needed as you will also be able to utilize the bus service which is also steps away. The cost is somewhat reasonable for the room itself, also Alamoana Beach is a short distance away as well.  cons... We stayed at the Kona Tower and the room is very small there, there is no balcony, and everything seems tight . There is a window to look out of but no real spectacular view or anything. There is a bathtub with shower, but not recommended for an elderly coupleBecause the tub is high and they may injure them self getting in and out. Also there is self parking, but it adds about $20 per day to your stay there, all in all I would probably not stay here again because total cost to value even at the Kamaaina rate was too high. If you plan to just use the room to sleep and shower and will be gone for most of the day and won't rent a car, it may be worth your while. Otherwise not that great of a place to stay.

We have stayed several times at the Ala Moana Hotel, have found it reasonable in price, conveniently situated and clean. The room has a fridge, microwave, free Internet access, and coffee/tea maker w/coffee provided. Check in and check out can be slow if they're busy, so take express checkout. The $25 daily parking is a bit much but all the hotels appear to charge similarly. This hotel is right next to the big mall so there's lots of shopping and good eating near by.

At one time this hotel acutally had a personality. Locals stayed there, we played there, ate there, listened to local entertainment, hung out at Nicolas upstairs and went to Rumors on occasions. But I dont think that the hotel has been doing too well of late. It has become a dumping ground for the airlines to keep its staff for over nighters. The lobby no longer has ANY life to it, zero! The beds still have the same bedspread from the 70s it had before. Colorful but UGLY, scared to even sit on them not knowing if they have ever been washed. My pet peeve is always coffee. Why even bother if you cant even get it half right? The put the coffee pot under a shelf that prevents you from opening the top of it, so you have to pull it out but there is no where to put it! Dumb!!! Lions coffee is undrinkable and powered cream with only three sugar packs in the room? Not enough to hide the bitterness of this cheap garbage. No drinking water in the room, ahhhh but there is a refrigerator! Too bad I had to unplug it because I couldn't sleep over the noise it made....The staff reflects this hotels personality, boring, been here too long and don't care if you like it or not. View of the Ala Moana shopping center was all I could see, even though I was told that it had a partial ocean view. I made a point of asking them for nice view. Considering that the hotel was pretty much empty, I would say that there was no effort made to accommodate this request! The only good redeeming quality I could find was the access to the shopping center and the Chinese restaurant on the fourth floor. That review will be forthcoming!

My husband and i stayed here recently as a stopover back to Australia from the US, which makes it our third stay here. First time was about 4 years ago. Stayed in the Kona tower. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Staff were pleasant to deal with. We've kept coming back to the Ala Moana because we've been fairly satisfied with the service and the rooms each time. We don't really like the Waikiki area that much but really like shopping at the Ala Moana Shopping Center so this hotel suits us fine. Also as many of the buses stop at or near the Shopping Center, its fairly convenient to get around the city and surrounds if you don't have a car and don't mind catching the bus. Hotel seems to be reasonably well kept, they were putting down new carpet in the public areas during our stay. Room size is about average, compared to all the other hotels we've stayed at on this US trip which are roughly around the same price.

Due to a mechanical problem with our plane, we were forced to spend an extra night in Honolulu. The airline put us up at the Ala Moana and it was fine. It is right next to the mall with lots of places to eat right next door. I usually stay in places that are a bit more luxurious, but for a one night layover is was fine. My room was clean and quiet and I had a nice view of the water. My only complaints are that they use bedspreads on the beds, which always grosses me out. It's hard to believe that any hotel still puts bedspreads on the beds when they have been proven to harbor so many disgusting things. They also don't have plastic/sanitary cups to drink from and that bothered me as well. This isn't a luxury hotel, but if you are looking for a decent place to stay and you don't mind not being on the beach, this hotel is fine.

Just spent 1 night but this hotel has gone downhill. Very convenient location next to Ala Moana Shopping Center but partial ocean view room I had was very dated and in need of upgrading. Staff was very cold, not like it used to be. Entire public area badly in need of upgrading also. Coffee shop used to have great breakfasts, now only buffet service and food was not good. Service in coffee shop though was excellent.

Stayed in the Kona Towers for a business trip. The hotel and the room are clean with rooms being on the smaller side. Great location to one of the largest outdoor malls in the country and a few minutes away from the Ala Moana park,My disappointment is with the lack of customer service from the front desk. During my stay, the trash trucks were emptying the trash bins at 5am in the morning. Imagine hearing the obnoxious sounds of the reverse horns and bins being moved around.Upon check out, I voiced my disappointment to the front desk clerk and he didn't do anything to remedy the matter. I then asked to speak with the front desk manager. Ron Sugihara, guest services manager came out and offered nothing other than that the hotel has talked to the city about this repeated issue and that if I had a future stay, maybe the hotel could do something next time. So much for the aloha spirit.If you're staying at the Kona Towers at the Ala Moana bring ear plugs or be prepared for a lack of customer service.

A clean, neat, value for money, somewhat luxurious and close to everything. This is what i was looking for . Yes, if you are fine with $$$$ , you can find better place in front of beach. I like to rent car , go around town, explore the area, so being in front of beach to walk out in shorts from my room was not my priority on this trip. Depends on what you are looking for, this is at edge of Waikiki beach area and right at the shopping complex. Waikiki beach area is walk able from here or couple of bus stops if you don't like to move. Although Waikiki is a perfect combination of nice-hotel + beach + shopping, this is not such a great beach (if i compare with Caribbean hotels or other Honolulu beaches). There are really beautiful beaches around Honolulu and i would spend my time out there instead of Waikiki beach. If you are beach lover like me, plan on spending whole day at each of other other beaches. I stayed at the second tower, its bit older, but was well renovated. The room was clean, nicely decorated, it does not feel new / shiny , but was NOT leaking or broken/bad. There is a dance floor/club right here if you are into it, but I wasn't thrilled to go dancing at Honolulu, either due to crowd or bad season, it did not have fun vibes. I hated to pay for parking - $20/day, which i'm not used to, but it seems the norm in Honolulu. You CAN find free overnight parking around this area, i rented a convertible, so I chose the paid parking and sleep peacefully :), besides it is very convenient if you are in and out during day. The breakfast at cafe downstairs is good, or if you are an explorer like me, there are other places near by in Waikiki area for similar price, but you need a car / bike or walk to Waikiki beach early morning and have breakfast. This is good place for family, friends or solo traveler.

A good clean hotel with friendly staff. The main tower is more ideal as you don't have to walk to the other end to rooms on the Aloha Tower. Great for shopping and any other business as it is on the edge of the big Ala Moana Shopping Center. Across the road is the beautiful Ala Moana Park for walking, exercise or gazing. Waikiki is a cool 10 minute walk. Great location.The hotel has been kept up and everything works well with many elevators too.

Close to everything,good service w/clean rooms.bathrooms alittle small but functional.parking is little expensive but pretty much the going rates for most Oahu hotels.ala moana shopping in walking distance,everything u need is there.if you're into clubing,Rumours is right on the property till the wee hours of the morning

Overall summary: a good hotel which I recommend, but with a little extra effort it could be great.We spent 4 nights at the hotel after arriving in Honolulu early that morning via a cruise from Sydney, Australia.We arrived early and not unexpectedly, our room wasn't available and given we had been allocated a room with an ocean view on the 32nd floor (as we had requested), the friendly receptionist recommended we wait until the room was available about 3pm. We were happy to leave our bags in storage and go exploring. Reception had only one person on duty at 11am so it was slow checking in but she was very helpful and friendly. The person who was on duty when we returned for our key that afternoon was less so and while she was efficient, she was not at all friendly and didn't smile once.Location : excellent with a connecting bridge to the huge Ala Moana shopping centre next door. We were there 4 days but didn't see half of the shopping centre I suspect.The room: large, very clean, with an iron and ironing board. Appeared to have been renovated in the last couple of years. Pleasant décor with a balcony, small table and 2 chairs with views of the marina and ocean to the left of a building and the ocean park to the right of the same building. A pity about the tall building splitting the view, but it was nevertheless gorgeous sitting on the balcony watching the ocean.There was a fridge in the room, but no mini bar which didn't bother us at all. What was very odd though was that the room had a small microwave oven but not so much as a spoon in the room to stir a cup of coffee, let alone plates and utensils to use with the oven. There was a small coffee maker with 2 large white mugs and a packet of coffee. There was also an ice machine on each floor which suited us fine. There was also a soft drink vending machine next to the ice machine on each floor selling Pepsi products. So if you are a Coke drinker, get it outside the hotel. There was no room service in the hotel that I could discern from the hotel services directory in the room. Again this didn't really bother us.The bed: very comfortable, as were the pillows.Bathroom: small but functional and very clean. Forget about using the hair dryer though if you have long or thick hair. It was hopeless. If you are coming from a country which uses different electric current, either take a hair dryer that has a dual current or buy one locally.Pool: sparkling clean but the surrounds weren't anything to write home about. It wasn't a very inviting environment and the pebblecrete was disintegrating underfoot to the extent that it was impossible to walk on it barefoot without considerable pain. A proper sweep is in order to remove the myriad of loose pebblecrete all over the ground. The pool area would also have benefited from some shade - either trees or umbrellas. There was a pool attendant and the pool also had a device to lower disabled people into the water. While we were there maintenance staff came to check it was in working order. Aircon: being an older hotel, the aircon unit was in the room. It was a little noisy, but not so much that it interrupted our sleep or detracted from our overall visit.Checkout: efficient, but again, not friendly. The receptionist didn't even bother to ask if we had enjoyed our stay.

I stayed at the Ala Moana for 1 week while in Honolulu for surgery. It was so nice to be able to walk right over to the Ala Moana Center to shop and eat. The room was a nice size. The bed was hard and somewhat uncomfortable but everything else was great. It was also nice to have a microwave and refridgerator. The employees were very friendly and accomadating. I already have my next reservations made to stay here again in June.

This is my favorite hotel in Honolulu. I used to live there so when I visit I prefer to stay out of Waikiki because it's too touristy for me. The location of the Ala Moana Hotel is great--right in the heart of Honolulu, right next door to the biggest mall, and very close to Waikiki and the beach. You can reserve a room directly through Outrigger or through a private owner and we have done both. The gym is immaculate and more than adequate and never crowded. The same goes with the pool. The rooms are also immaculate and very comfortable. Bathrooms are generously sized and well lighted which is great for beauty junkies like me. There are many banks of elevators and they get you up to your room quickly with little to no wait. I prefer to stay in the newer Waikiki tower rather than the Kona tower. Resort fees for access to the gym and pool are mandatory so keep in mind that this adds to your room rate. Parking is an additional $20 per day and I've never had a problem finding parking. I will always choose this hotel when visiting Honolulu. It has everything I could ask for.

This hotel delivers the "Bang for the Buck". The location is unbeatable, since it sits right within the perimeters of the the famous Ala Moana shopping center. There you can not only shop till you drop but also catch several "Trollies" that bring you everywhere. The rooms are up to spec and super clean. On the third floor happens to be the best Chinese restaurant of the island, The Royal Garden. If you like Japanese style lunch or breakfast, walk over to Shirakuya in the mall, where you have a huge variety of all kinds of foods from sushi to tempura.

There at the end of last summer. Room no. 3510,(I think),a corner room, with views of the ocean and the city, Ala Moana Park and Beach. Clean hotel, great value, a good and inexpensive Chinese restaurant on sight. Across from the harbor, muni buses and near downtown Honolulu. A goodvalue, and borders Ala Moana Shopping Center. If you wish to devoid yourself of the Waiki'ki madness, you will appreciate this property. Bus stop around the corner gives you access to the entire island and the airport.

Lobby was big and beautiful! We got delayed overnight by AA. The only thing that was terrible was it was late like 1am and there was ONLY 2 staff/ check in. There was babies and young children waiting 2 HOURS to CHECK IN!!! We had to wait at least an hr b4 leaving the airport to receive our new flight info. and another hour in half on the plane NOT COOL.. The food was fine. Very comfortable beds and Clean!! Beautiful view but NOT Beach Side. I liked the bathrooms :)

Here for a business trip, the hotel is nicely located slightly off the beach but easy to walk to all local shops and bus stops and of coarse the Ala Moana shopping centre itself was great during my down time!Staff are very friendly and the concierge was an incredible help to me with a wealth of knowledge about what to see and do and where to eat etc.Rooms where basic but you you hardly spend time in them anyway!

Stayed here for a few days for a training seminar. This is a basic no frills value hotel - room size good, beds ok, no real eatery on premises, limited gift shop hours, adequate pool and fitness room. Location was perfect for this business trip because my wife was not bored having direct access to the large Ala Moana Mall across the hotels parking lot and also the beach area across the street. Surrounding area also very short walk to nice fairly inexpensive places to eat (option from mall food court).

Stayed here for two nights for a meeting elsewhere. The lobby is a large resort-style space with Hawaiian music playing. So you get the vacation vibe immediately even if your there for a meeting. Room was medium size with flat panel HD TV. The bed was great but not quite the pillowtop Hyatt, Hilton, Sheraton quality. Lots of channels, many languages. Any ocean view is distant between buildings. There is a bridge from the hotel to the Ala Moana Shopping Center. Breakfast is served buffet style in an attached restaurant, no ala carte. Steep price for a buffet and for some reason the hot items were lukewarm. Lukewarm eggs are not too appealing to me. And, NO FREE COFFEE in the lobby. It comes from a self-serve pump jug outside the breakfast restaurant, but you have to pay.

The Ala Moana Hotel is located adjacent to the Ala Moana Shopping Center and very close to Ala Moana Park. The rooms are not super luxury, yet they are very comfortable. With all of the attractions on Oahu, most room time is spent sleeping anyway. The front desk staff are very friendly and and welcoming. There is a nice pool and a very well equipped fitness center. I usually stay there when my job requires an overnight stay on Oahu. The rates are very fairly priced. I also appreciate the many dining options nearby.

Was just there last Friday night and got an "Ocean View" suite. I expected a really nice experiance. Well don't expect anything except an OK room. No amenites, resturants, or even a nice gift shop. Even the on premise bar only operates a couple of nights a week. The "breakfast only" Cafe was a very simple, bland buffet (no menu at all, basic black coffee) that was "ok" but overpriced. Want anything well out you go in the mall or down the street. I could even be ok with that, BUT, there was a full on Rock and Roll Concert right next to the hotel that ran from 9:00pm until almost 1:00am. With no sound proofing in the rooms the band might as well have been playing in our just Ok 19th floor $400 per night suite. THEN after being kept up until the wee hours of the morning by the concert our really nice ocean view room (that actually looks over the mall parking lot to the ocean a few blocks away) was a front row seat to watching hundreds of people and cars hang out in the parking lot and have a GREAT (and loud) after party until well after 3:00am. SO if you are 21-25 and are looking for a happening, overpriced party experiance then head on over to the Ala Moana "hotel". If you are heading to Honolulu for a bit or business, and maybe some shopping, or a nice weekend with the WIFE then stay away. There are much better places and better values.

This is a great location for business travellers yet a stones throw from the Ala Moana Patk beach which the locals frequent.Lots of places to eat both around the hotel and in the adjacent mall or a short walk/cab/bus down to Waikiki for all the usual chains. Long long lines at most Waikiki restaurants however, between 4.30 and 8.30 expect minimum 30-45 waits for tables at popular places.Rooms are either King or Twin and adequate inside. As with most local hotels there is a fridge & a microwave too. Some of the Waikiki tower rooms have great sea views over the Marina but the noise from Atkinson Ave can marr this somewhat. The view over the mall car park is not so flash, but quieter and the sunsets better. However with building work planned for mud may 2013 onwards, this may change.Pool & Gym are more than adequate.Very busy reception, but courteous & knowledgable.Good a/c with minimum noise levels.Nice table & chairs for relaxing on the lanai.This is also a timeshare property too.
user_name:
GoFlyNZ
Royal Tunbridge Wells, United Kingdom

review_body: Ala Moana Hotel is one of my favorites if I am doing business on Oahu. It is close to most everything by car and has a pedestrian walkway to the beautiful Ala Moana Shopping Center. The rooms are not large but adequate. The amenities and the coffee maker are very appreciated. The restaurant is nice - a bit expensive but there are lots of options nearby that are less expensive. Hotel staff and restaurant personnel are friendly and efficient.

My flight was cancelled so the airline provided free accommodations at this hotel. The hotel was rather clean and the room were recently remodeled. It had a feeling of a large convention hotel but yet I felt very safe. Hawaii's largest shopping mall is located adjacent to the hotel and is connected by a pedestrian ramp from the second floor. Ala Moana Beach Park is also just a short 5 minute walk from the hotel. The Hawaii Convention Center is also just a 3 minute walk. Overall, this is a great hotel for families or the business traveler.

Living on an outer island in the state of Hawaii, coming to O'ahu can be daunting. It has the greatest density of population, on a rather small space. This hotel is attached to the shopping center of the same name. I am aware of women coming here to shop at the holiday season, since there are stores in the mall not found on the other islands. Staying next door is a great convenience.The room is small. There is a coffee maker, small refridge, and microwave. Nice slate floor when you come in which continues into the bath. Large mirror just off the bath, across from the kitchen area. Not sure if that would be useful since you can't get much distance from the mirror.Supposedly the love seat is a sleeper-sofa. Didn't need it, so I have no idea if it is comfy. If that is used, there is absolutely no room between the rest of the room and the sliding door to the outside world. There's no lanai to exit to via this sliding door. Just a city/mountain view (see attached photo). Which also means sunrise into your room. FYI - there is no screen on the slider. One of the nice things about Hawaii is the minimal bugs we have here. The bathroom had a white with gray streak marble counter top. Unfortunate choice, because the finish has gotten destroyed in a few places by lotions and other fluids spilled on it. The nickel finish handles of the tap are uncomfortable and do not seem to turn on / off in the usual manner. The faucet dripped significantly. Reported that when I checked out. The check out time is not noted on the back of the door (noon). Small pillows on the bed. Another pillow option is tucked in the closet. Issues - the artwork in the room consisted of three pieces. The glass covering the Nautilus shell image had dots of some sort of dried fluid on it. The largest piece had a nice hand print on it. The corner of one of the cushions on the loveseat was torn and there were coffee (?) stains on the bottom of the sofa. The desk had a glass cover but the finish on the wood under it was water damaged. The very large TV had a connectivity problem with the cable, which was easily fixed by twisting the coax connection a little tighter. The main bank of six elevators did not go to the floor my room was on. There was a bit of a stroll to get around to the three which accessed the floor. Was this a good value - close to $200 for this room? Doesn't feel like it. Would I stay here again, no, I'd find another one to explore hotel options in Honolulu.

Well, it started off okay. The lobby appeared nice and they gave us a free upgrade to a suite on check in. We were there for a one day seminar being held IN the hotel. We have just a short flight to/from Honolulu from Maui, but decided to stay the night for fun (nightmare). The proximity to the mall was convenient. The "upgraded room" was what I would consider a very typical standard room at most hotels. I will say the view was VERY nice. The bad news....we got into bed at around 11:00 PM and when I looked behind me, there was a bed bug on the wall next to the headboard!!! Ewww....We called the front desk, they apologized, had security come up, verify if was a bed bug, take an incident report, move us and put us into a standard crammed room as that is what was available because of a busy weekend. Couldn't get that bug crawling on me feeling to go away and couldn't sleep after that. Worried about my items being infested, taking them home, etc. Finally, when we went to check out the next morning....the manager gave us a $30.00 discount!!!! Seriously??? I attempted to show pictures of the bug, but nobody wanted to see them when I offered (manager and staff). What kind of customer service allows you to complain about bed bugs, be inconvenienced by moving you to another room at 11:00 PM, not getting a good night's sleep and then gives you a $30.00 discount on a close to $300.00 hotel bill for ONE NIGHT? What a joke. That room should have been comped. I will NEVER EVER stay at this hotel again. All they had to do at the front desk was apologize and say "Mrs, your stay is all taken care of" and I most likely would not even have written this review. BUT...because of their misguided attempt at customer service, here it is. I paid for BED BUGS and a subsequent horrible night's sleep???? Seriously???? No comped room? Minimum of 50% off my bill at the least? Or hell, even free breakfast?? I am still in complete disbelief.

Nice property with many amenities. After many stays in Waikiki, my husband and I selected this one for the great price and to try a different location for a weeklong vacation. The property is geared for conventions and business travellers, but as a couple we found it perfectly suitable. The staff were friendly and accomodating. The hotel has two towers, so there is a bit of walking within. Also, there is pool, fitness centre, restaurants and nightclub. The rooms have been updated and are very clean. We found the bathroom small, but adequate. The Kona tower does not have balconies, only sliders with railings, so consider this if important. Our room had nice ocean views past the shopping centre, but was not too noisy at all. The location is great if you want to shop and eat at the Ala Moana Centre. The beach at Ala Moana Park is nice and about a 10 minute walk. Waikiki is about 20 minutes, so most of the city life is there. We found it nice to walk everywhere, and ventured into the Honolulu side as well. Might not be the best choice if you have small children or can't walk too far, unless you want alternate transportation. For a very reasonable price, found this to be a great choice for a quick getaway.

We arrived in Honolulu a couple of days before my husband's conference so we needed somewhere else to stay for those 2 days. We chose Ala Moana because it was affordable and offered free WiFi. The room are small but still larger than the ones I have experienced in Europe. The bathroom is a decent size and quite nice with a marble vanity. The room included a refrigerator and a microwave which was quite convenient. The bed was way too soft for us but I know some people like a really soft bed. Unfortunately, the pool closed at sundown not at 10 or 11 like other hotels so we couldn't swim after dinner (already closed at 8:00). We ate a Yuzu our first night which was fine and not horribly overpriced like other hotel restaurants.

We stayed here the last two nights we were in Hawaii, purely for the convenience of shopping before flying home.The room was small, but had beautiful views of the water and the city.Unfortunately, like most of the other hotels we stayed at in Hawaii, we could hear everything from the corridors.

The Ala Moana Hotel has both traditional hotel rooms and a few condominium suites complete with a separate bedroom and living area with a kitchen. The kitchen has all the necessary appliances, a two burner stove, mini fridge, microwave, dishwasher, cookware and dinnerware. There are large patio doors and a balcony with a beautiful view. Unit #2726 is managed by Alii Rentals and they have been a great company to work with. I highly recommend this hotel for its convenience value and overall ambiance.

Tagged along on my wifes business trip, stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. The hotel is big, and the room that we stayed in was the smallest i have ever seen, I dont know what size bed they say are in the rooms but it was a double, and hard as a rock. My wife did not eat any meals in the hotel and I only ate breakfast on the second morning, it was pretty bad. The hotel is within walking distance to a beach, and the mall next door is fantastic, lots of great stores and some good places to eat up on the 2nd and 4th floors. Our room was clean and seemed to be well taken care of, the hotel is busy and seems to have tourists, business people and alot of airline people at it, for business it would be ok, would not want to stay here for vacation.

We stayed 7 nights in a 25th floor ocean view room with our kids, ages 7 and 5. We had a rental car, which cost $20/day to park in the hotel, and took day trips to different beaches around the island. The hotel is located next to the huge Ala Moana Mall, and near the calm waters of the Ala Moana beach. The best thing about the hotel is the cleanliness of all the public spaces and hallways; I never saw dirt or debris anywhere, and it's a high volume hotel with action all the time. However, the downside is that if you are toting kids around, there are no real hotel grounds to wander through, and the pool is a standard rectangular pool with depth from 3 ft to 8 ft. We took advantage of the in-and-out parking, and the free Ala Moana beach parking, to drive the kids and all our beach gear for the less than 2 minutes it takes to get to a family-friendly beach.Our room had a microwave and a good sized mini-fridge, so we were able to save some money by having breakfast each morning on the lanai in the room.

I stayed at the hotel for more than a decade but this stay was the last time I stayed there. At the check-in they gave rooms for early check-in for peoplr who paid the regular rate not the reduced rate or for people who were willing to pay an extra of 40 Dollars per night on top what they have paid already. At 3:40 p.m. they finally had a room for me. This room was the smallest room I ever got at a hotel in my life (business travel for more than 35 years). To open the drapes you had to go sideways between the bed and the desk/chair. It was the last room on that floor. Besides the room was a staircase used pretty often which you could judge by the loud bangs of the staircase doors. And the room was above the trash collection area. Between 5:15 and 5:30 am I got an unwanted wakeup call every day from the trash trucks which emptied the hotel's metal trash containers. Sleeping in that room was not easy because the fridge made loud noises and several times the sound of dripping water which was so loud that I woke up from that noise several times. The bath was not clean. There were hairs in several places and spots on the tiles which seemed to be drops of a male body fluid.

I must say that the best of this hotel is the service they give at the "tourist information". They will arrange the best prices, find you what fits you most, give you directions and call a dozen people if they have to make your perfect holiday.The hotel also has shops where you can by from a soda to shirts, evreything is quite cheap compared to the shops around.

Just spent 24 hours at this property. I arrived very early and requested early check-in. The guy at the counter was very friendly. I asked if it would be possible for an upgraded room for a fee, so that I could rest after an all night flight. He went to check with his Manager and returned with an $80 upgrade, which I rejected. Second time around, he came back with a $40 fee, which I accepted, making it a $200 per night room!The pluses for this room, were a refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker , and literally adjoining the largest shopping center in Hawaii.The minuses, a very small room, which really should not have had a kingsize bed. Certainly if there was more than one bag, you would not be able to open it. There was one of the small luggage racks available, which did not accommodate my book style suitcase, so I shared the bed with my suitcase! The breakfast cafe only had a fixed menu which was the buffet @ $12.50 for continental or $16.50 for a full menu.

Stayed 5 nights attending a conference. Stayed in the cheaper rooms on the older section over looking an office block. Very basic 2-star small room. Clearly quite old. The third star for this place probably comes from the facilitating elsewhere in the hotel. Convenient to the huge shopping centre next door, but not so convenient to the beach. The room was clean and everything functioned fine, and in the end it was satisfactory. But I wouldn't stay again and would pay a bit more something a bit better. If you expect a good quality 2-star room, and like shopping, you will be satisfied. Otherwise might be better value elsewhere.

The Ala Moana Hotel is right next to the Ala Moana shopping center. Great for shopping and restaurants. Staff is friendly and the room are nice. Smaller sized room but includes a small refrigerator and microwave. Don't bring lots of luggage because there is little walk around room. There is no room service but there is a coffee shop downstairs, a Japanese restaurant and Chinese restaurant.

I was there for business..The room is very small- Furniture is outdated and would not sit on the furniture without putting a towel down first. The bed is hard and very small- If you are over 5'7 your feet will hang over.... The walls are very thin and you can hear your next door neighbor. This Hotel doesnt have a restaurant- so if you want to get something to eat you can go to the Mall- which is accessible thru the 2nd floor- You go down a ramp and thru the Mall Parking Lot to get into Macy's. Just remember the Mall closes at 9pm on weekdays and Saturday and closes at 7pm on Sunday. The Mall is packed on the weekends. The gym is very nice. But if you are going on Vacation- look for somewhere else. You can catch the bus for 2.50 to Waikiki- which is very easy. Seems this hotel caters to long term rentals and Business travelers. It does have a night club- Rumors-which is only open on the weekends, and a 5.00 cover charge for Hotel guest. Check in was easy, but we check in late at night.

I spent three LONG nights here for a conference. Although the hotel claims to be updated, my bed and linens were circa 1984. It was virtually impossible to get comfortable, made worse by the fact that street noise was overwhelming. The hotel also does not have room service or a (decent) restaurant (they do have a restaurant that caters to the Japanese market and a fairly decent breakfast buffet), so getting a simple bite to eat requires a walk to the mall. For the same price, business travelers have much nicer options all over Honolulu. Vacations should avoid it like the plague.

Spent two brief nights at this hotel. It was clean and comfortable but I gave it only 3 stars due to the remarkably slow check-in process and the fact that our door lock stopped working and it took several hours to fix. When card activated locks run out of battery, they enter an unlocked state by default, which is what happened to my room. It was eventually fixed, but my room was vulnerable for those hours. This hotel is conveniently located near the Ala Moana Shopping Center and relatively close to Waikiki Beach. There is also an all-night night club in the building so just a heads up that you should try to request a room far away from that.

I stayed at the Ala Moana hotel back in November. I went out there as a birthday present to myself. As I arrived at the Hotel I pulled my own bag out of the trunk of the taxi as the two Doormen watched and talked to eachother. Was never even greeted just a simple glance. I myself am A doorman/Concierge at a pristine hotel in San Francisco, CA where this would not be tolerated. Then I checked into my room which was like the size of a closet. I went back to the front desk and asked for a different room and she joked and said I booked through a third party website therefore they gave me the cheap room. (not funny).Then they charged me 29.00 per night for a room upgrade which wasnt an upgrade it was the same room only two beds which I was traveling alone and didnt need two beds. Then I walked into the chinese restaurant there and they turned me away cause they said everything was reserved. Even though it was half empty. Then to top it off I booked a shuttle back to the airport that never arrived. I asked the doorman to check if it was coming because they booked it and I wasnt aware which company they used. I paid in advance to the bellman the night before and Im guessing he pocketed my money. Then I flagged my own taxi to the airport. My vacation was a disaster because of my hotel experience. Then I even left two days early and they refused to refund the last two nights of my stay.

The Ala Moana was adequate. (I was on a business trip. If you're considering it for a vacation, don't). The room was really small, and the furniture was Walmart-style. The desk chair was, unbelieveably, a straight-backed kitchen chair.What must be understood is that the hotel has been converted to condos, some of which are rented out as hotel rooms. So, you're not really staying in a hotel--you're staying in an apartment building. I began to appreciate this when I went looking for a beer one afternoon. The hotel bar is gone. Plus, I never found a place to have breakfast in the morning, apart from the mall.When I checked in, I was "upgraded" to a "partial ocean view." The view consisted of a long look over the roof of the hotel's lower level. Then, a longer view of the deck of the parking structure of the Ala Moana mall. Then, 'way in the distance, what may have been the ocean.Speaking of the mall, most of the reviewers note that the hotel is "right next to" the Ala Moana mall. That's really overselling it. You go down to the second floor, then walk a distance to a ramp which dumps you onto the deck of the mall parking structure, then you walk a long way to the door to Macy's (which is at one far end of the mall.)I had no problem with the front desk staff, or with the cleanliness of the hotel. Parking cost $20 per day, which is expected in a big city, but annoying nonetheless.

When my boyfriend and I checked in we were given a room upgrade from the city view to a city view with partcial sea view - very nice! We had our own balcony and even a seperate sitting room with kitchenette. The bed was comfy but we requested softer pilows after our first night. The check-in staff could have been more friendly - they seemed a bit cold. The little grocery store on the ground floor was very handy. We spent 9 hours shopping at the Ala Moana shopping centre on one day, so it was super handy that the hotel is so close. Overall it was good quality for the price we paid - we'd stay again.

This hotel is a short walk to Ala Moana beach park and the mall is right next door. The rooms are small, but in decent shape. The biggest draw back, in my opinion, is the noise from other rooms. The walls are so thin I could hear the phone conversation from the adjacent room. I could also hear people from across the hall and a few doors down when they started talking and laughing at 7 a.m. on Saturday morning. I won't go back.

The rooms com with a frig and microwave, but are quite small. The walls are pretty thin - I could hear someone snoring next door. The advantage is that it is next to the Ala Moan mall, which has great stores and restaurants. It is about a half hour walk from Wikiki Beach and other incredible stores. My favorite shopping location was actually the International Market. The pool is pretty small but there is a great ocean breeze and with some of the most beautiful beaches in the world, I suggest the beach over the pool. If you have a car, there are some excellent seafood restaurants on Pier 38 (I think). Uncle's is great and Nico's is also excellent. The best place to by souvenirs is the swap meet out at the stadium. It is a great walk and the vendors have mostly everything, except chocolate candy, that you could aak for. The vendors are friendly and willing to negotiate.

Good location and right next to a fabulous mall. Bit away from Waikiki, but easy to get there by walking and other transportation is easily available. The staff is welcoming and friendly and always accommodating. Great hotel for business travelers.

I had received a 2 night complimentary stay at this hotel. We'd just been staying elsewhere in Waikiki, and in comparison, these rooms are TINY. We were up on a higher floor, which was great for the views, but not a highlight when you can't see the beach.We'd saved our 'shopping days' at the Ala Moana shopping centre for the 2 nights we were staying here (We're Canadian, and shopping when in the US is a must!) The hotel is connected to the mall - how easy is that? We loved the Japanese Shirokiya for food. Definitely a business type hotel that leaves you missing out on the 'I'm in Waikiki!' feeling. It worked out well for us as we'd done the beachfront Waikiki hotel for the first 5 nights. I'd recommend this place for a short stay, but not for a 1 week stay.

For years, when traveling to Honolulu, I have stayed at the Pagoda Hotel. It is inexpensive, compared to other properties, well run and nice. It is a favorite of local families, traveling on a budget. At last, the opportunity to stay at the Ala Moana Hotel. There is the main tower of the hotel, presumably more desirable, and then the back tower, accessed around the back side of the main lobby. That was where my nearly $200/night landed me. Unlike the review by Ksmui, I did not receive an upgrade. The room was small, and not recently updated at all. The lanai/patio was literally non-existent; only a railing with a sign reading, "do not hang towels from railing". The railing separated the room from the rooftop and the view was overlooking the Ala Moana Shopping Center parking lot. Granted, I could see the ocean, not easily but it was possible. The staff was quite competent and we received especially good service at the front desk. Readers may note that this is my first, "less than stellar" review. I had high hopes of the Ala Moana and they were not met. However, I am willing to try again, focusing on a room in the main tower. Aloha.

After reading the reviews I was a little skeptical but I was travelling alone for business in the Schofield area and wanted easy access to the highway. I have stayed in Honolulu, Waikiki and Ko Olina previously for same but this was my first solo trip. The Ala Moana hotel was easy to get to from the airport with my rental car and GPS. Valet was quick; NOT AT ALL FRIENDLY, but parking prices were as expected at $25/nt. The lobby was fine, no long waits, no pushy time share sales and it did not look deserted as I had read previously. I was told on check in that if I had room key issues (I had read lots about this as well) to use the phone on each floor to have it rectified but I had no such issues. It took 3 swipes for my card to work in the elevator (every time) but was fine otherwise. Room 2607 in the Waikiki Tower was a very large corner room with a kitchen (inexplicably no utensils) a separate bedroom and 2 lanais (1 a walk out with table and chairs) overlooking the ocean and the mall below. The room was clean, I had coffee every day (I did not have to pay $1) and bathroom amenities were okay (if you use condiditioner you will need to bring it but I had read this previously and brought some). The internet was fine, I had the choice of hard-wired or wifi which was a nice surprise. The convenience store in the lobby was good for water, snacks etc. at reasonable prices. Access to the mall was easy, just across the 2nd level parking lot to Macy's. The food court was great and I brought alot of meals back to my room. I also bought my breakfast and lunch at the food court as there are no restaurants closeby where I was working. I did walk to Waikiki one night at dusk and it took about 20 minutes to get to the main strip along a fairly well lit route. I took a cab back to the hotel for less than $10. This hotel was perfect for my needs and my huge room was decently priced at $199/nt but If I was going on a family vacation I'd probably choose to stay closer to the beach.

I recently stayed at the Ala Moana Hotel because of a conference held there. The hotel lobby was clean and spacious and staff was semi-friendly but not very warm or welcoming. The rooms we stayed in were TINY and smelled strongly of mildew, but seemed to be clean other than the smell. Room had a coffee maker and mini fridge which was nice. Rooms all had a sliding door with a railed in bottom half allowing for the wonderful breeze to flow through the room (helping with the smell). The hotel is right next to the Ala Moana Shopping Center which was great if you want to go to a mall. There was a great bar "Mai Tai Bar" outdoors with live entertainment which we spent a lot of time at because of the ease of location. The hotel is a bit of a walk from Waikiki so if you plan on spending a lot of time in that area, you should look for a different hotel. If you walk around the Ala Moana hotel at night, beware... it's a sketchy area.

Have stayed here a few times. Great location! had trouble with Internet in the past but looks like it works great now! Can walk to wikiki in a few minutes. Hotel staff has always been courteous. Ala moana is connected with a mall so great restaurants and shops are only a short walk away. I am a flight attendant and look forward to coming here because it is easy to experience Hawaii in a short amount of time.

We stayed here from March 3-6, 2013. Found it to be clean and everyone helpful and friendly. Several nice little gift shops in the lobby level. Great access to the mall. We found the parking garage in the hotel and bit unorganized and clumsy to get in and out, as they don't seem to know what their own parking sticker/pass means. We had trouble with our rooms cards and elevator the first time or two, but after that it all worked fine,,, so perhaps that was user error! The swimming pool is not heated and it was very cold as other have stated. We had a mountain view room on the 35th floor (36 total floors) The room was very clean but somewhat small. If you are traveling to Hawaii / Oahu for the first time, stay at Turtle Bay or JW Marriott as we found food to be a problem! We could walk to the beach, just a two blocks away, very easily. No worries about that. The trolly is $2 and runs right to the hotel and mall. The hotel is right in the downtown district, and it's like any downtown district - ie Chicago/new york... lots of sirens and buses and people walking. The location was great for business. Perhaps not the best choice for a family with kids. There is no hot tub, sigh. And yes, breakfast there was just ok,,, after twice eating there we looked for other places to eat.

Not the most desired location, but it is very clean and very updated rooms. Service was average. Updated furniture. The can ride from the hotel to Waikiki is less than 20 dollars. Close to the beach and it is attached to the mall. Very convenient for shopping.

Have stayed her quite a bit for business...Seem to get upgraded on all my visits....It's clean, the prices always seem to be on par with other hotels. I really like that it is attached to the mall. If you want to be in the heart of Waikiki than this is not the place....bit of a walk or a bus, trolley or taxi away. I like that the rooms have a coffee maker, a microwave and refrigerator. i like that most of the rooms have a separate couch and small table to either eat or work. Staff is friendly. Overall basic good reasonably priced hotel...however, not a resort by any means.

I stayed here for 4 nights on a tour with Road Scholar. I was pleasantly surprised with the quality of the hotel (after several horrific hotel stays with this group). The room was beautiful, contemporary and clean with a perfect view of the city lights and harbor. I know that the cost of the Hotel is a bargain for the quality but part of that is because it's not near the tourist area. If you add in the cost of cab fair you might be better off spending a little more and staying in the Waikiki area if you are on vacation. All in all I really did enjoy my stay at the Ala Moana.

Travel is all about expectations. We are not luxury hotel denizens, but we do like somewhere that goes beyond the basics, or we would stay at the YMCA. Well, the Honolulu YMCA is right across the street from the Ala Moana, and is probably just as nice. Near the registration desk the Ala Moana proudly displays its awards for "best value". I view this similarly to "most improved" or "best attendance" awards -- sops for the also-rans.The Ala Moana is not close to the beach, not close to Waikiki, not close to bars and (non-mall) restaurants, and not that close to pretty much anything except a giant shopping mall that separates it from the ocean, a liquor store, and a couple of strip bars. So the location (for anyone except mall-dwellers) is mediocre at best.Add to this that the hotel has no bar, an extremely basic pool area (too cold and windswept to use during our visit), and one of the worst hotel restaurants I've ever been to, and you have ... "thanks for participating". The breakfast restaurant (not open for lunch) serves a fruit-and-steam-tray buffet for $20 -- that's it. If you want a smoothie, a fried egg, or something else, you're out of luck.Our room was clean, and we did not have trouble with rude staff in the way others have reported. The equipment worked, though the WiFi was somewhat iffy and gave my laptop a nasty virus. The rooms each have a minuscule balcony/lanai, but most of them are going to overlook either the shopping mall or the YMCA -- very few views of the ocean are available. And you won't want to leave the door open for the tropical air, because the hotel is on some sort of police/fire/ambulance route, and there were sirens blaring more or less constantly.I didn't come to Honolulu thinking of staying in a concrete-lined urban hellscape, but you'll need to traverse a mammoth multi-level parking lot and cross several major roads at busy intersections and walk extensively to get a sight of the beach and the sea. The Ala Moana seems very popular with Japanese tourists who don't seem to mind flying all the way to Hawaii to shop in the mall at the same stores you'll find in Tokyo.For me, Hawaii is not about being the "best value". Better to spend a bit more money and get someplace with even a trace of style and convenience.

If your looking for a place just to lay your head this place is not bad. Good news it's next to mall so if you like shopping it's a plus. Not to far of a walk from the beach and other local attractions. The hotel has a pretty decent gym too.

I stayed here for five nights. Our hotel room was clean and had everything we needed. Although, the hotel is not located right next to the beach, the location is very convenient, especially if you are vacationing within a limited budget. Parking is a bit of an issue in the Waikiki-Honolulu area, so having unlimited in and out access at the hotel for $20/day is definitely a bonus.  There is a walkway/bridge that allows you to walk to the ala moana mall from the second floor of the hotel. We found this especially convenient. We often just grabbed a bento box from Shirokiya for lunch, or something from the grocery store-Food land, which is also in the mall.  Another tip-for inexpensive souvenirs is Walmart, which is within walking distance of the hotel, and Longs Drugs (inside the mall).  I have no complaints about the hotel. If you're looking to go the beach every day, you may want to try to find a hotel closer to the beach. However, if you are going to site-see all over Oahu, this is a very good location to have as your home-base.

The hotel was a great place to stay. It was right next to mall and had very convenient parking in the basement. The only "problem" is that the hotel is further away from the main Waikiki beach. This meant that we either had to walk for 30 mins to get to downtown or drive and worry about the hassle of finding a parking spot. If you have ever been to Honolulu before you know that the driving there is not the easiest.We thought the hotel service and the room was great. It was clean and the staff was very helpful. The laundry service also worked great.

We enjoyed our stay in two separate rooms, the first in the Waikiki Tower, the second two nights in the Kona Tower. Both were fine, but the Waikiki Tower room was larger and more comfortable with a better view and full balcony. The "room card" was somewhat confusing, at first, and seemed to limit access only to general access floors and our rooms on either the 30th or the 11th floor, somewhat unhandy if we had wanted to visit friends on other floors, but perhaps best for safety, which was not a problem from our point of view. Breakfast in the small first-floor restaurant was very pleasant. The Concierge was very helpful with reservations and recommendations and the easy proximity to the Ala Moana Shopping Center was very nice. It is easy to recommend it.

My family and I stayed here in Feb. 2013 and we found it to be perfect for our needs. The hotel is large and modern.
