Rooms are average size and have a refrigerator, microwave, and in room coffee maker. It was very quiet and pleasant. I enjoyed an amazing in-room massage because I had a terrible migraine. The massage therapists are also available in their spa downstairs. The pool is nothing remarkable, but satisfactory. We were not there to hang out by the pool in any case. There is a fitness center and sauna(I didn't personally use) but I saw several guests using it. What I found convenient for our early morning tour departures was the sundry shop in the lobby which was very well stocked and not too pricey as one might expect for a hotel store. I was able to get fresh cut up fruit, milk, cereal, granola bars, snacks etc. our tours would sometimes leave before the hotel restaurant was open, so it was a real life saver. There is a dunkin doughnuts across the street for coffee if you like. The hotel also has several restaurants on property. The hotel is very large, we honestly didn't see it all. It is right next door to the world's largest outdoor shopping mall Ala Moana center. You can see the ocean from most rooms. The hotel is not on the beach, but very close if you want to go. We are from Miami Beach, so honestly, laying on the beach was not a priority. We wanted to see more historically significant sites and unique areas like volcanoes and black sand beaches... It is a short walk to the Waikiki area which is nice, but a lot of traffic and noise. Reminds me a bit of south beach. What I liked about the location of Ala Moana was that is was more of a local neighborhood, not too touristy. We were in walking distance of some really nice local restaurants where we were the only tourists. I recommend staying here if you are low key type of person or family and like to be near everything, but not necessarily right in the thick of it. It is not the Ritz Carlton, more like a Marriott. One more local tip I was given, if you want to buy souvenirs and coffee, nuts, etc. to take back you have to go to Don Quixote. It would be a cross between a Costco and Target shop. There is one really close to the hotel, ask directions. They have all the things you would want, but really good prices.

The location is great, very close to the Ala Moana Shopping center and many buses stops there. The several gift shops and dining options are good. The room is quiet and clean. Service is good too. We are overall very satisfied staying there.
user_name:
Zhen S
Cambridge, Massachusetts, United States

review_body: Stayed here for a conference in February. Located literally a 2 min walk from the Hawaii Convention Centre, with an exit onto the Ala Moana Mall. Other amenities were also close-by: Walmart 15min, Ala Moana park with a great view of fireworks 10min, Waikiki beach - 10-15min.The hotel was clean and quiet. The staff were friendly, but the service lines were long. This was probably the longest check-out I have ever had to go through. It would have been nice to have a printer in the lobby somewhere to allow guests to print boarding passes. Thankfully the lady at the service desk offered to print it for me, after my patient wait in line. If you are blessed with patience as a virtue, you will find this hotel to be a good bargain by Hawaii standards.

My room in Kona Tower was modern and peaceful, just right for ONE person. Maybe the hotel has bigger rooms for families? The concierge was indifferent, but the front desk staff was very helpful. The location is perfect, close to a Korean neighborhood and an upscale TJ Maxx, close to but not in Waikiki.

Hotel is about 20 minute walk from the main tourist area of wakiki. Across the road from the huge ala Moana shopping complex where you also catch the Trolley system to get around H onolulu. Service is great at the hotel, they can't do enough for you

A beautiful hotel with great service. Unfortunately, our room was in the old section and was extremely small with no view other then Macy's at the Ala Moana mall. I would imagine rooms in the newer section are larger. The shopping center was fun if you aren't used to this type of mall!

I wanted a budget hotel but with a good location. There isn't much that is cheap in Honolulu, but this is a nice compromise. My Kona Tower, mountain view room on the 12th floor came with a microwave, quiet fridge, lots of storage space and a room safe. Strangely no utensils or plates. The location is great, about a 12 minute walk to the edge of Wakiki beach or Ala Moana Beach Park. The mall that is located right next door has a grocery store and a great food fair. The hotel also has a pool and a store. The pool water is very cold, it closes at 6:30 (sunset) and I couldn't find a pool bar. As I was travelling alone I was hoping that the pool would fill my evenings, so this was a disappointment. I still found ways to enjoy the evening though. The sauna doesn't have a shower, you will have to shower in your room and decide to dry off and redress or to drip water all the way down to it. The concierge is actually a 'expeidia local expert' there was one there for the first week and then a different one each day after that. The first one was very reluctant to provide any free advice on local sites or transportation. She was wrong about bus stops and couldn't give a number for the city bus even though it turned out to be on the maps she was handing out. The Ala Moana mall, next door, is a major city bus transportation point. You can get on a bus there to go into town, or around the island. This was very convienient. Mostly I walked to the sites along Wakiki as it was easy to find interesting shops, restruants and such. The Hilton is near by where there is an awesome free firework show on Friday evenings. I was pleased with the Ala Moana Hotel's policy on towels and sheets (the guest chooses whether they want new ones or not) and I was glad to see no plastic bags in the garbage cans (yes they were clean, I put food waste in them yet each day they were cleaned).Here comes the shame-shame: Ala Moana Hotel - you hotels need to take up the torch on recyling. Why no containers to put empty bottles in? Why no bento boxes made of compostable materials? Why no seperate containers for greens? Us tourists will leave a lot of garbage behind for Hawaii to try and bury, it's time to make this harder for us to do.

Stayed here for 3 nights dislike how small the room is as well as how tiny the bathroom is I agree with one review you need to closed the bathroom door to sit down good. We asked for a king size but got a double instead, went to take a shower no hot water OMG WTH UGH......

We got a very good deal...a 5 night package from Vancouver through Westjet & stayed here in January 2013. The hotel was clean and very well sited. Next to a huge shopping centre and good restaurants (Japanese/Korean & others), it is within a short bus ride to Waikiki, Chinatown and the Nordstrom Rack at the Ward Center. If you prefer to stay away from crowds in Waikiki, this is the ideal place to be.The service is very good & staff are very helpful. There are pick ups for snorkelling tours to Hananuma Bay right in front of the hotel. Rooms tend to be smaller in the Kona tower but we were given an Oceanview room on the top floor. The view is magnificent and it is worth paying a little extra for "Oceanview". We rented a car for the day and drove all around Oahu....

Luckily, I was here on business. The hotel is located behind the Ala Moana Shopping Center. It is a 30 minute walk to the main Wakiki area and 10 minute walk from Ala Moana beach park. The only thing this hotel has going for it is generally inexpensive rooms. This is where most of the airline staff stays during layovers.The lobby feels like a convention hotel, large with a lot of separate seating/congregating areas. For the size of the hotel though, the check-in area is way too small. I got lucky and check-in during a lull in the action. Over the next 3 days, I saw an hour plus line during check-in. The worst part of the hotel though was the bell/valet staff. This is why I can't recommend the hotel. On 3 separate occasions, I walked by the bell/valet staff complaining to each other about work and using some nice, colorful language. If this is the way the staff thinks they can act in front of customers, I can only imagine what else gets past the management staff. The rooms are small but comfortable. The bath amenities are pretty basic (cheap shampoo, lotion, and soap only). There were some stains on the chairs. I don't understand how housekeeping can't figure out a way to remove these stained items, replace them with some reserve stock then replace the original after it is cleaned. There is nothing worse than seeing stains on chairs/ sofas in a hotel room. For business, the hotel's Internet is pretty fast and reliable. It's location is also much more convenient than most of the other Kalakaua and Kuhio hotels. Those are the only good points I can offer for the hotel.

After our flight was cancelled 2 days in a row we got vouchers from the airline for this hotel. First of all, as soon as Andrew at the front desk saw my voucher his attitude changed completely, was very rude to us and refused to check us in even though it was very close to check in time. I told him we were very tired, had been at the airport for hours since 3am, and he just kept saying that check in time was at 3pm, very very rude. So we went to the shopping center to have something to eat and when we came back we were finally able to check in and found out several of the other passengers from the same flight had been able to check in earlier. Apparently Andrew just did not feel like doing it for us. So the first night we were put in a room the size of a postal stamp, so small we were bumping into each other, mildew in the bathtub, and a very old, ratty looking comforter on the bed, they really need to throw those away and upgrade the rooms. The second night we were able to get a much better room in the Kona Tower, bigger, nicer view but still the same old ratty comforter, and, by the way, the beds are hard. It's amazing how much they charge for these rooms, spend a bit more and stay at a much nicer place. Another thing, no hot tub at this hotel, for being such a huge hotel and for what they charge they should really have one. We will never stay at this hotel ever again.

This hotel is beautiful but it is a party hotel. The club on the main floorcan be heard all the way to the 7th floor.The rooms are extremly small for what you are paying per night. And there is never any quiet.All hours of the night you hear load music. Loud enough to viberate the sliding door.The staff at the front desk are rude. They do not explain. And if you do not knoe something they look at you as though you are an idiot.The small store opposite the checkin, when you walk in. She says nothing but follows right behind you thru the whole store as if she is a parrot on your shoulder. Really sad!
user_name:
Grace H
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The room was small, especially for two people and the bathroom was tiny. Had to close the door of the bathroom to sit comfortably on the toilet. We asked for a room with a partial view and the view was mostly of the parking roof for the nearby mall, and a small view of the ocean in the distance. The food in the main cafe was adequate, but nothing special. The people at the front desk were helpful. This hotel was recommended because it was close to the Convention Center and it was just a short walk to the center. It is not a hotel I would go back to.

I live in Hawaii and, on virtually every trip to Oahu, I stay at this hotel. I do so because it is an easy walk from the hotel over a bridge to Ala Moana shopping center. I appreciate the ability to shop and then deposit my shopping bags into my hotel room rather than leave them in a car which can be robbed.. That is THE selling point. The employees are, by and large, very courteous and helpful; however, the rooms leave something to be desired. The hotel could be upgraded but is basically a condo hotel. Actually, the thing that drives me absolutely nuts when I stay at this hotel is the hotel card key. It is of horrible quality. You need to use your card key to get to your floor in the elevator. You also need your card key to get into your hotel room. The keys are horrible in quality and, on most occasions, you are trying time and time again in the elevator to be able to press the key for your floor. I have actually been in an elevator with three other hotel guests, all of us trying unsuccessfully to get our card keys to work in order to get to our respective floors in the hotel. I have put this information in those cards that you leave for the hotel upon your departure, but to no avail. Having said all of this, I will still stay at this hotel because it is right next to the shopping center. But, there are comparable and nicer hotels at the same price range.

I stayed at the hotel for four nights. The Convention Center is right next door, it takes less than five minutes to walk there (great location for people who have conference there). The receptionists are very nice and provide great descriptions as to where to go and what to visit. The rooms are clean and confortable. There is a nice gym and two restaurants inside the hotel so that you can enjoy a meal if you are tired and don't want to go out. Overall, it was a great experience to stay in this hotel and I am looking forward to visit again.

We stayed here for one night when our flight was delayed. Front desk was very nice and helpful. We really liked the rooms, good size, nice decor. Location is good if you want to be close to the mall but a bit far from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki (which some would like!). We didn't find too many restaurants within easy walking distance. Plantation Cafe was just ok for breakfast.

After two days of nasty smoke drifting in my window I finally identified two seperate guests rooms where people were smoking, the hotel is meant to be non-smoking. I found a couple pills of (later identified) Ritalin at the elevators. My inlaws squashed a roach in their room. Additionally the hotel has major staffing issues- the front desk was often unable to answer calls (as I tried to get help on smokers and roaches) because they were so poorly staffed. It took us 35 minutes to get checked in. The third day I finally complained. The guest services manager was professional and nice but overworked, he offered a number of perks, such as free valet and breakfast. The next day I went to use the valet- but was informed I would need a special slip from the front desk and it looked to be a 30 minute wait. Comical and ridiculous. So I saw the manager that evening and said I would after all take him up on the breakfast, as I had declined it previously (pregnant wife, first kid, trying to be healthier) He had to check his log to remember what my issues were. Amazing because that would mean he'd had so many complaints he couldn't recall mine, which to me seemed egregious and remarkable. He said he could cover one breakfast but not another for my inlaws (he relented after I reminded him about the cockroach which appearently didn't warrant a note in the log)The manner with which he disregarded the Ritalin in the hallway (a schedule 2 drug) makes me suspect drugs aren't uncommon- I won't even start with the seedy characters attending the hotel's night club, 'Rumors'.Shady and gross, spend the extra 40$ a night and save yourself the icky feelings.

Arrived to one very long queue at check in and two people at the desk. Each person took at least 10 minutes to book in so we left to get dinner and came back to another long queue. Half an hour plus to just check in.We had requested two beds, and although they didn't have that available they said we had a pull out couch ( with a very poor saggy mattress) and the bed, yet when getting to the room there was no linen for the old couch despite them knowing in advance we needed two beds.Had a long flight of nearly 9 hours to get here and it sure doesn't feel like a great place to holiday.Very small room. Will see if it improves.

Stayed at this place in Nov 2012. Nice clean rooms. Hotel is next to Ala Moana mall- really good for some shopping. I rented a car but didn't really need it as hotel is on bus routes. Parking costs $20 per day. Nice pool and exersise rooms.

Everything was better than I expected.Perfect location, very helpful and friendly staff. Attached to the Ala Moana Mall. So convenient. Minutes from Waikiki. Our housekeeper Herminia provided us with the very best level of service. Her attenion to detail was incredible. She kept our room very clean and tidy. Highly recommend this hotel.I now understand why most flight crews stay here. We stayed in the Waikiki tower and we got free Wifi but the login is a little fussy.You have to enter your email address every time you log in. Very minor issue.

I stayed 5 days in October as it was close to my conference. If you are a on a budget it is reasonably priced and connected to the Ala Moana shopping complex. As it was my first time to Honolulu I wished I would have stayed closer to Waikkii. I took the bus to/from the beach (easy and cheap) daily as shopping didn't interest me. I did venture across the street to the local park on the beach one night to watch a sunset but after dark I found it scary and do not recommend it. I loved the fact after checkout time you can keep your bags stored in the hotel lobby all day so you can see sight's without toting luggage around. Staff was pleasant but the front desk was always very busy so be prepared for a wait checking in. The hotel was fairly clean, elevators didn't always work and a very TINY bathroom. My room was a partial city/ocean view with a balcony.

I arrived at the hotel around midnight, exhausted, and needed to wake up at 5:30am for a snorkel trip. Exiting the elevator to the lobby, I stepped into a thumping club scene. It seems the hotel is home to one of Honolulu's best clubs "Rumours." That's great, but tired and scrubbed out me was not prepared nor in the mood to be greeted by club rats.The party continues in the rooms upstairs. Drunks were yelling and running through the halls even as I was heading out to my sunrise snorkel. I didn't sleep a minute and the next night wasn't any better.You also have to pay $20 a day to park at the hotel. I was only there for the weekend so I didn't bother looking for alternatives.You're in the heart of the city and right next door to a huge shopping mall so the "views" are less that picture worthy. But if you're looking to shop and party, this is the hotel for you. If you want a more relaxing vacation, stay somewhere further north like Kapolei.

We stayed here for 2 nights because we wanted to be near the ocean without paying the ritzy prices of Waikiki. Check-in was smooth and our room was clean, comfy, and quiet. As with most hotels, “ocean view” doesn’t guarantee you’ll see anything more than a sliver of water, but this hotel is a 5 minute walk to the mall, another 5 minutes to the beach, and a cheap bus ride to Waikiki. And the free wifi was definitely a nice perk.Skip the Garden Restaurant if you stay here. The dim sum (Chinese) cuisine is very mediocre and most of the staff didn’t speak English. There are plenty of good restaurants within walking distance of the hotel.This place is great if you don’t need luxury but still want to stay at a respectable hotel. And a special thanks to Malia at the concierge desk. She was very friendly and super helpful in planning our weekend activities.

We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and it was nearly half the cost of the other big names while providing fantastic rooms. The service was impeccable and it's conveniently one of the first pickup locations on practically all tours or tourist activities that provide transportation. It's attached to the Ala Moana Shopping center next door so you can walk across the ramp for your morning Starbucks ;). I would definitely consider this place in the future.

If you have a few days in Hawaii, there for business or family matters and not really doing the big tourist Hawaii thing, then this hotel is an ideal location with very reasonable prices.I had been to the Ala Moana hotel in the past, to dine, dance, or have drinks (way back in the day I even worked at the night club there, Rumours) so when I returned to Honolulu to attend a wedding there in early December, I was very comfortable staying at this hotel. First I had a rate of 119 per night (AAA) discount. Jean, the front receptionist upgraded the room to accomodate two adults. There was a lanai that opened up with a partial view of the water had to lean over) and then there was the city view of the night lights. Nothing spectacular with the room but way above my expectations for 100 a night. The bed was scrupmtious! I really slept well there and I have a very nice tempurpic at home.THere was an empty mini refrigerator and a coffee pot for use. The room was so quiet-loved that! You can walk to Waikiki-it is close enough. Also close to the bus lines if you needed (to get the UH). What I would like to go is eat at the local restaurants all within walking distance. Korean, Japanese, Chinese, and even fast food -Zippys!!!- at the mall. Ala Moana beach park is across the street but it is a bit of a walk there and not safe at night. If you like to walk like I do (an walk off all the yummy local food) then you can do an early morning or sunset stroll to the the beach. Ala Moana is a great beach for families with young children or those who are not super strong swimmers). There is a pool there but we didn't use it. you need groceries, Don Quixote near by as well as a Wal Mart for getting inexpensive items, like water, shampoo, macadamia nuts to take home. If you like to shop, which I do when I am on vacation, the mall is right across the way. Had my make up done at Sephora, bought my son a suit and Macy's, got a hair cut and was ready to have a blast at the wedding. I will be going back to the Ala Moana Hotel to visit the city and then may be hopping to an outer island for that more tropical Hawaiian vacation .

My choice for staying here because I knew I was only going sleep here while scuba diving every day, all day. For that purpose it was acceptable; cheaper than average and close to necessities.The rooms are smaller than average, but clean and acceptable.The lobby is a little sad, and the vacant stores are a little depressing. If you don't stay in the Kona Tower you probably won't notice them.Free quality internet is a great plus. I suspect almost every room has their own wifi router, connection quality is excellent.The mall next door is good if you're into shopping.The Waiki pink line trolley (open bus) stops right outside, which is great for getting in and out of the Waikiki. It's a $2 one-way exact cash fair.The Kona tower rooms are not good if you're looking for a romantic Hawaiian get-away. I cannot comment on the other tower.

The staff at the hotel (all except the Plantation Cafe) was wonderful, cheerful and delightful. The rooms require a keycard to get to, which is good and bad, as it was annoying to have to race to they keycard. We requested an ocean view room, and got a room on the 30th floor with a partial ocean view. The hotel was nice overall, but the room was a bit small, and the location wasn't the greatest. It was nice to be close to the convention center, but there wasn't much places to eat breakfast around (other then the overpriced Plantation Cafe, and the mall full of chain-restaurants) Also behind the convention center wasn't the nicest area. The concierge, bell staff, and front desk were extremely helpful, and the room was clean.

Very nice property; room was comfortable, roomy enough for one - bathroom was good size. Microwave and small fridge in room for longer stays. Access to mall restaurants and food court is good; only 10 minutes to Waikiki. Overall, better than average.

The Ala Moana turned out to be a good choice for our family. We rented a car, so there was really no issue about location (although the parking garage smelled of raw sewage). It was safe and quiet and perhaps a bit less crazy than Waikiki. Room was reasonably sized and the staff was friendly, but slow. The Internet wasn't working the first day and they gave me a number to the service provider. When they didn't fix the problem, the staff's attitude was that it wasn't their problem. When I explained that it was there Internet provider and that it really was their problem, they took care of it.

Thia was our first time in HI and we weren't sure of the hotels, we booked through Hotwire (would not do again) we had to upgrade through the hotel, but in the end we were very happy with our accommodations. The staff was friendly and eager to help, booking adventures and things like that. My only complaint was there was no coffee shop where you could order off a menu, only a cafe that had a continental breakfast or buffet (which we don't like to eat) and was only open in the morning and they would not give you an extra coffee for the room so that you could have more than a cup.
user_name:
Polly M
Acton, California, United States

review_body: I stayed here for 3 nights in January during a long weekend. The hotel itself is big with 30+ floors and i was put in the waikiki tower 29th floor. The room is not that big, but it got everything you need in a hotel room. Not extremely fancy. Not extremely clean. Everything is just so average, i dont think it worths $200/night or maybe this is a very low price for an average hotel in hawaii?The location requires you to drive. It is only closed to the mall. if walking to the beach, it is nearly 30 minutes. You would not want to walk back to hotel from the beach after all the water activities. it is better to rent a car or stay near the beach.One day evening I forgot my key and I been waiting in line for the reception for 1 hour!! yes 1 hour for a missing key!! The line didnt get shorter. there's only 3 receptionst working. 1 of them works really fast trying to get everyone a room, but 1 of the old lady there just standing in front of the computer and typing, not helping at all! this is so ridiculuous, maybe everyone in the hotel was checkin at the same time. I probably will go back again if the rate is lower.

The best deal in Honolulu! I've stayed at this hotel over a two dozen times and not been disappointed. The location is execllent for public transportation for work and pleasure trips. The closest hotel to the Hawaii Convention Center and the Ala Moana Center. The hotel is stylish, clean and the staff is excellent. Just got a generous complimentary upgrade to a one-bedroom ocean view suite on this trip.

We had read previous reviews & were concerned that we were going to be in substandard property.We found the Ala Moana Hotel wonderful. The staff were helpfull,the room clean& quiet, the shower hot &strong. The only noise was from emergency vehicles [you will hear these from any hotel]. The location was perfect:adjacent to the Ala Moana Shopping Center,a 5 minute walk to Sams Club &Wallmart [ they are in the same building].We will stay here again on our next trip.

Rooms were basic but reasonably priced (average $225.00 per room per night). There is a 290 store shopping centre right at the back door and it is a very short walk to the main hub and beach of Waikiki. The staff kept very much in the background and did not engage, however, the concierge was very good value. There is an in house night club which was so-so but better than nothing and it was too far a walk to the nearest pub, so it's either pay for $10.00 beers or catch a taxi to an Irish Pub, which defeats the purpose of the cheaper beers. All in all, tho, I would recommend this place to ppl interested in spending less on their accommodation and more on tours and sight seeing! All the shuttle bus services and all the tour buses stop at the door, so very handy to everything. The pool is not heated and waaaay too cold to swim in, although us Aussies are used to warm water, so other countries may be fine..The shower had to be turned on full speed to get any warmth, which seemed to be an enormous waste of water to me...There wasn't anything I HATED about the place and I'd probably consider going there again, but if it's a luxury Hawaiian holiday you're after, tho, go elsewhere.

Great hotel, location, staff, service, and location... You name it and this is where you should be..... I have enjoyed every second of my vacation/ birthday getaway from 01/07/13 to 01/14/13...Room# 2708They say, "ever job isnt for everyone".Well I'm here to tell you that this hotel has staffed itself with the right person in every position.... Now I can't speak on and don't know what others went through to have negative reviews, but I can say thishas been a marvelous experience I will cherish to remember for a life time.... Thx Ala Moana,  Johnny E Sampson

Title pretty much says it all. One room with smallish barely double bed...maybe enough for tiny miniature people, but not for anyone over 5'4". Not enough room to put suitcase on floor by bed and get into bed, not enough room for two average fit people to walk by each other sideways to get to bathroom. Noisy noisy garbage trucks every morning at 5:30...charming. Plus, concierge unhappy about having his crossword interrupted by a guest wanting to know about Pearl Harbor. Bellman and everyone at bell desk less than amiable despite efforts to crack a smile. Couldn't pay me to go back here.

I stayed there for attendding my friends wedding in Hawaii with my mom.The place is fantastic to go to the shopping center. It takes about 5 min from room to store.However for my mom, she was first time to Hawaii and I did not plan any sightseeing so that she felt bored a bit cause the Hotel is not so tropical taste... even though she enjoyed the trip with me!And we stayed on July 4th, so we could watch the fire works to celebrate independent day from our room.It was also nice things there.

We went to Honolulu for 11 nights from mid-December 2012. it was our sixth trip. When we checked in, we took the option given to us of paying an extra $20 (+tax) per night for an upgrade to a 30th floor balcony room in the Waikki tower of the Ala Moana hotel. The view of the mountains was great, the lobby large and spacious, and the Ala Moana shopping centre only a five minute walk away. However, the constant noise of sirens (day and night) made it difficult to relax and our sleep was often interrupted. The 'cold' water in the hand basin was constantly warm to hot. The temperature of the shower water could not be adjusted. We often had to endure very hot or cold showers, with the temperature changing at will from one extreme to the next. TV reception was grainy and the remote control difficult to use. Free Internet in the room was great, but we experienced several long periods where it cut out. When we arrived the toilet was not flushing properly and my husband noticed that a pipe in the cistern was not connected. Meanwhile, the room was tiny, with the king size bed pretty much occupying the entire room. A queen size bed would have been a better fit, but we were told that all rooms come with either a king size bed or two doubles. There was no mirror in the room and the two chairs had stains on them.On day three we went to the reception desk and advised them of the plumbing issues. We were told that we did not know how to use the shower and that someone would come to assist us, but no one ever came. When checking out we raised the matter again and the same reception person said she had booked a manager to see us. She asked if we would like to review the matter at that time with a manager but we made it clear that at checkout this no long pager mattered.The large lobby had a stage but there was never any music even though it was the Christmas period. The noise from the night club was loud and univiting, and there were no Christmas activities or dinners at this hotel apart from a few Christmas trees. It was like a vacant parking lot in need of care and attention.Despite the great view, we will never return to this hotel. The so called upgrade was a mockery as the room was noisy, had poor plumbing, was very small, and had poor television reception and interruption to the Internet.

Rooms are average, but the location is great and the price is a good value. I stayed here for 18 nights on four different business trips between January through May. For me the biggest factor was price, and this was very reasonable relative to other options in the area. The rooms are small and ok. Internet works well. There is a tiny "balcony" to which the door can only be cracked open a small amount. I set my running shoes out there to dry. Sound insulation is not great; could often hear people in the surrounding rooms. The fitness center is fairly large and has good quality equipment. The great thing about this hotel is the location--within walking distance of the Ala Moana Mall (which is huge), and the Ala Moana Park with is a wonderful place to run each morning. I never ate in the hotel because there are so many, many good food options all within walking distance.

The Ala Moana is a well-run, business-like hotel at the edge of the Waikiki area of Honolulu and right next to the huge Ala Moana Shopping Center. The shopping center means free parking (though not overnight), a number of useful and convenient stores (including a Barnes and Noble) and many inexpensive places to get good food within easy walking distance. From the hotel, it’s just a few minutes walk to Waikiki itself (just across the canal) and maybe 10 minutes to get well “into” the Waikiki shopping area. We chose the Ala Moana, frankly, for its location and the fact that it provides clean, modern accommodations with things we wanted (free wifi, in-room microwave and fridge, and other nice touches) without costing the full Waikiki freight. Also, a great plus in my view, there were no mandatory “resort fees” and other irritating grabs of the sort that we’d experienced or heard about in some of the Waikiki hotels. The staff we dealt with was efficient and hyper-friendly, but without being cloying or artificial. We’ll go back again.The only thing I’d do differently next time is not bother to pay $20 a day extra for an “ocean view” room. See photo.

After we got bumped from our flight last night our Airline gave us a room here. Upon arriving and walking into the lobby there is loud club music blaring through the lobby from their club that is open until 3:30am. The lady that checked us in did not have the capability to smile. Every hotel I have stayed at you get a greeting with a smile... "Welcome to..." Not here. She quietly checked me in. As my family of 5 gets on the elevator 2 very drunk ladies jump on and obnoxiously punch in several wrong floors on the way up that seem to be humorous to them. Our rooms are clean but seem very dated. There is a flat screen television in the room. The bed was comfortable. All night long there were sirens heard outside. Not sure if that means its a bad area or their is a police station close by. Plenty if other hotels to pick, if its your choice pick something better.

The hotel staff were very professional, the room was well taken care of and clean and the elevator staff was nice. On the down side the pool was not heated and, surprisingly to me, was desperately needed despite being in Hawaii. And the pool had these very sharp rocks that made it incredibly painful to walk on with bare feet. Sorry, pools are important to our vacations and it just didn't cut it. Other than that I was pleased with the hotel.

I am a travel nanny so I have a tendency to rate a hotel based on experience rather than price since I don't pay for the lodging. The airlines gave us this hotel when we lost our flight and had to stay an extra day. I know they have just completed some serious renovations so all I can think of is the other reviewers were put in a different area of the hotel. We were on the 34th floor and the view was great. The hotel was well maintained, our rooms were beautiful. I had a king size bed and the parents had beds with two queens. The rooms are not huge but still a decent size for Honolulu. Yes, it is away from the madness of Waikiki Beach but it's a quick bus ride down or nice walk. Since we had spend 3 days there on our way to SF, we didn't mind being at the other quiet end of Honolulu. It is next to the huge mall if that is your thing. It was extremely quiet, staff was very friendly and prompt to serve. The breakfast was a buffet and a very nice variety of hot and cold items. We had airplane vouchers but the expense was still reasonable at about $16 each for adults. Waiter kept the coffee going.It really is a beautiful hotel in a section more reserved for adults. If you want the excitement of Waikiki there are buses going down there or you can arrange excursions with the concierge in the hotel. The only reason I can think of for the other lukewarm reviews is that came before or during renovations because what I saw was a very classy hotel. No, it may not be the Ritz and it has a more Zen feel, but I liked that. Maybe because in Waikiki I was stuck at Aston Beach Circle hotel which was small and well, not much to be said about it except location was good for Waikiki.I didn't think the size was any smaller than other hotel room in the area that wasn't a suite.So if you like being away from Waikiki just a bit, still a good walk or quick bus ride, then this was a nice alternative.

We stayed here en route to Kauai and The Big Island. It's in a good location but not great. The rooms were clean but not perfect. We got our exercise in by walking about 1.5 miles to downtown Waikiki each day, but I don't mind the walk. I would suggest this for active couples / families that don't need luxury.

Very nice hotel. Rooms a little on the small side. Conveniently located next to the Ala Moana shopping center. A bit of a walk down to Waikiki. You can ride the shuttle, but it doesn't always seem to work out very well for us, but the walk did us good. I am not real keen on the beach in front of the hotel, and there are a bit of homeless people around out in front of the mall, so you I would recommend heading into Waikiki and going to the beach there. There are some strip some strip clubs on the backside of the hotel.

After a harrowing flight experience with our plane taking off, flying for 30 minutes, almost falling out of the sky, then returning to Honolulu (thanks, American Airlines!), I was put up for the night in the Ala Moana by the airline. Front desk staff was incredibly prompt and friendly-- particularly given the swarm of disgruntled flight passengers crowding the lobby. My room was clean and comfortable, but basic and dated. In fact, the hallway was some sort of 80s hell with Saved By The Bell meets The Shining carpeting, but that's neither here nor there. The best feature of the room? A nice balcony that opened up to downtown Waikiki, which was lovely to watch twinkle in the night sky. The downside of the balcony? Apparently Snoop Dogg was staying near me, given the amount of pot smoke that came billowing in the moment I opened my balcony door (this, of course, isn't the hotel's fault). The free breakfast we got from the airline, down at the Ala Moana's restaurant was. . . well, it was freaking terrible. I know I shouldn't be complaining about anything that was free, but I had to wait 20+ minutes to be seated, the food was cold and dry, and the wait staff was about as grumpy as anybody could be. Blech.When I say I wouldn't stay here, that's because I'm a bit of a travel snob-- Waikiki isn't my thing, nor are most super busy touristy areas. I stayed over at a rented house in Waimanalo, so I can't imagine choosing to stay someplace like the Ala Moana in the metropolitan part of the island. That said, if you're looking for a clean, fairly priced place in Waikiki that's maybe a bit outdated, then the Ala Moana is probably the right place for you. It's not beach front, but it's close enough.

Ala Moana Hotel is clean and inexpensive (for Honolulu). There was nothing wrong with the room or any of the facilities. Parking under the hotel is $20 a day and very convenient. I also like this location because the hotel is right beside the Ala Moana Shopping Center and just 5 minutes walk from Ala Moana Beach. I like this beach far better than Waikiki. It's more local and there are no vendors. The shopping center caters to locals as well as tourists. You'll walk less and buy more here than in Waikiki. Friday night yacht races start from the yacht club and it is a killer place to watch the sunset or the Friday night fireworks at the nearby Hilton. I stayed 5 nights and felt at home the whole time.

Right in the middle of Honolulu, this is a very large hotel but even though it is old, is well kept. Staff was very friendly. Room was adequate. Kind of loud but then again anywhere in Honolulu is going to be loud, especially if you keep your door/window open at night. Great location next to Ala Moana shopping center!

This hotel is a great value for Honolulu. The rooms very clean and comfortable. The hotel is located right next the mall which makes it very convient to shopping and restaurants. It's also just a half block walk to the beach and marina.

This hotel is short walk to the shopping center and a short walk to bus transfer stations. The hotel is older but there is ongoing upgrades. A coffee shop serves buffet breakfast and closed for lunch and dinner. The rooms have been in my experience clean. Other hotels are less expensive but none are as convenient to shopping and transportation.
user_name:
James P
Island of Hawaii, Hawaii

review_body: Great location next to the mall and a short walk to the beach and park. Good size rooms that come with big flat screen, microwave, refrigerator, coffee pot, ironing board and even a safe. Best of all FREE wifi and its fairly fast!!!! Also Ethernet cable if you prefer. I live a hotel that doesn't nickel and dime you for everything. They also have a nice workout area and the pool is nice with lots of room to sit around in the in and shade. Thank you I enjoyed my stay.

The staff is terrible. They are exemplary when it comes to poor customer service with their laziness, disinterest and rudeness towards clients. The hotel itself is located next to the Ala Moana shopping center which is nice, but as you try to find your way around, you notice its also surrounded by "massage" parlours. You're not at the beach. I didn't get the room I had reserved, the internet didn't work and the sound proofing was poor. Finally, the maids do not clean the rooms properly. Its quite shocking. You can get much better for the same price in Honolulu. Don't let them spoil your time in Hawaii.

The primary reason why I loved this hotel was its proximity to the Ala Moana Shopping Mall as well as other local shops -- including a Walmart. Our room was always clean and we had an AMAZING view of the city from our balcony. I could literally see Diamond Head every morning. The staff was always pleasant especially when we asked for a room change. We booked a king suite and received a double upon check in. After we called in for a room change, someone immediately walked up and gave us a new room key. Great service!Also, if you're staying at this hotel, do yourself a favor and walk to the Ala Moana beach and eat by the local shops outside of Walmart. The beach area is where all the locals go and is not crowded at all. And if you have ever tried to get food around the Waikiki area, its pretty hard to find a good meal without waiting. My boyfriend and I tried a lot of local fare near the hotel and it was pretty reasonably priced. One favorite of mine -- Raging Crab (think Boiling Crab or Joe's Crab Shack). It was a hop skip and walk away.We did make the trek to Waikiki Beach but be advised, do not try to walk there at night like we did. It was a bit scary. One other con --- parking is $20 a night. We weren't pleased to pay it but it was convenient and safe. I'm glad no one broke into our rental.I would definitely stay at the Ala Moana the next time I come to Honolulu!

This hotel is located very close to Ala Moana shopping center, walking distance to wall-mart and about 25 minutes walk to Waikiki beach. A nice and uncrowded beach nearby. A room is clean and sound. Staff are very prompt and friendly. Very good value for short stay

Horrible service! Said the computers were done and then they checked in a bunch of pilots and stewardesses. The only saving grace for this hotel is the proximity to the mall. I only booked this hotel for a layover between long flights. If you want a cheap hotel with no frills and none of the traditional Hawaiian courtesy then the Ala Moana is the perfect place.

The front desk staff were nice and professional, their friendliness appeared genuine and they were very helpful. The location of the hotel makes me smile, next to a fantastic mall!, public transportation, and a beach. I stayed here because of the proximity to the Hawai'i Convention Center. The room was adequate; the tub was a bit high to step over (of course, my legs are short, being almost 163 cm tall), but ideal for a soak (who has the time to soak with all those shops next door!!!). Good gym. The breakfast buffet at the adjoining (breakfast only)restaurant was good - good food, good service. In-house, in-room dining was limited. The in-hotel shops were attractive, especially the convenient store (which I frequented for snacks and last minute gifts!). I would stay here again and I would definitely recommend this Hotel.

Kona Tower rooms are tiny with no lanai. Queen (1 bed) rooms have a sofa and chair which makes them tolerable. These rooms are so small that it was difficult for two of us to move around. King bed rooms have no sofa or comfortable chair as the bed takes up most of the space. The Waikiki Tower may be more spacious with better views. Many airline crews stay here. Clean, decent bedding, iron and board, safe, microwave, refrig, coffee maker. Pool deck was spacious but no spa or bar. Workout room okay. Ask for a room with a view and you will see a bit of the ocean but mostly Macy's parking lot. The opposite views are of the city. Convenient to Ala Moana shopping center if this is your thing. No free shuttle to Waikiki but you can get the pink Waikiki shuttle for $2 each way if you want to get to the action on Waikiki Beach. You can do so much better for the price, unless you get a really good deal here and can tolerate the tiny room. Why would anyone vacation here unless you are shopping?

Been staying here for years. I prefer staying here than the madding crowds of Waikiki. The staff is ok, sometimes the lines at the front desk are a bit long during the day. My rooms always have microwave, fridge, coffee maker. Rooms and common areas clean. Good hotel gym, pool is adequate.I've never eaten in the hotel as their are scores of restaurants in the area.The Ala Moana park and beach are across the street. Magic Island is my favorite place in town to watch the sunset.

Recently we stayed at the Ala Moana Hotel. The hotel is nice however the rooms are very small. They offered an ironing board and iron and I was wondering where I would be able t put it up and still be able to move around it. Simply impossible. It was nice having a mini fridge and coffee maker in the room. This trip was for our 25th wedding anniversary and there were no complimentary upgrade or anything for that matter. A bit of a disappointment. The anniversary dinner we went to The Hau Tree and it was lovely with a complimentary dessert. It was a nice trip as Waikiki is always nice to visit.

Hotel is clean stayed in mountain view room Waikiki tower gorgeous view friendly people shops down stairs open till 11pm no room service but ala moana centre is just across so plenty food everywhere loved my stay here perfect for someone that loves shopping

Stayed here several times on business. Acceptable at most levels, not exceptional in any level I can think of. Rooms are dated, but have mini fridges that are not common to some higher rated hotels. Bedsheets are clean but the bedspreads are old, ratty and ugly. I always strip the bedspread off and use an extra blanket. They have upgraded the TVs to flatscreen HDTVs which are nice, but the remote controls seem to have difficulties communicating with the TVs. Wireless internet is free which is nice. Each room has a "Lanai" with two chairs and a small table, which are fun to hang out on but can be pretty noisy.Rooms with the best views are of the harbor, and other high rises lining Waikiki facing east. However all rooms can be pretty noisy with traffic noise, especially from sirens and loud Harley Motorcycles echoing through the concrete canyons.The Ala Moana Mall is adjacent to the hotel which is great for shopping and choices of restaurants and bars. Anchor stores include Macy's, Sears and Neiman Marcus, plus a huge Apple store, Old Navy, ABC store, supermarket, and a huge food court. There are numerous super high end retailers that cater to the Japanese tourists too. Upper floor of the mall has a great selection of restaurants and bars, with a pretty good night life vibe. A Mai Tai bar is centrally located with an open air setting and live entertainment.On the other side of the hotel is the convention center, and many conventioneers tend to stay at this hotel. There is also a small "red light district" adjacent as well that has strip bars and massage parlors, but I personally have never felt threatened, but I don't typically walk around late at night.The Ala Moana has a breakfast buffet, a Chinese and a Japanese restaurant, a night club (Rumours), an ABC type convenience store and some souvenir shops. I have only been to the convenience store so I cannot comment on the other venues. The pool area is an enigma. They have laid down a very rough (and very painful for bare feet) gravel surface to the pool area. Also, the pool itself is very cold, which is odd considering how it sets out in the Hawaiian heat each day. If you bring any alcohol to the pool you will be asked to leave. This is a bizarre rule considering how almost every other hotel in Waikiki has an actual bar AT the pool!To summarize, the hotel is acceptable and is close to great shopping and restaurants. This is NOT a hotel I would choose if I were on a beach centered vacation. It is a pretty long walk to the beach. The hotel is fine for a business related stay.

We chose this hotel because of it's nearness to the Ala Moana shopping center and other attractions in the area. We stayed in the Kona Tower. The room was small and a bit dated but relatively clean. It had a small refrigerator, and air conditioner worked well. We paid a $20.00 fee for a single night's parking. Not cheap for the accommodations, but overall, it met our needs.

Good area. Near the beaches and just across the parking lot from the huge ala moana mall. Rooms are small and kind of dirty. I'm staying on the kona tower side. The room has a microwave and a small fridge, which is nice. AC works well. Parking for guests is $20 a day. The receptionist was very nice.

When booking a room for my husband and I, I spent literally hours looking at different properties. I had never been to Hawaii before and it had been several years since my husband had been there so I had no idea where to stay. I knew we wanted to be near Waikiki but didn't want to spend a fortune. I finally settled on the Ala Moana Hotel because it was within walking distance to Waikiki and had a mall right next door but was not overly priced. We were pleasantly surprised when we got to our room and it had a microwave, coffee maker and refridgerator. It was also a pick-up and drop-off point for all the tours that we were going to book, which was an added bonus. The rooms were clean and well stocked with linens and the maid service was thorough when requested and since we were on the 6th floor, we slept with the sliding patio door open and even left it open during the day when we were gone with no worries of break-ins. Would I stay here again? You bet!

I booked this as a package deal and read the reviews etc. The rooms are very well priced even though I was placed in the rear of the hotel, being on holiday by myself, I couldn't care less. As long as the rooms are clean and have everything which you need, which they certainly did. The pool is clean and quiet, as is the hotel reception. The location is great for the shopping mall and lunch. The only minor points would be the distance to the beach, the information/activities desk could be a little more enthusiastic, though are very knowledgeable! I would look at staying here again, though not if the rooms were any more expensive, I'd happily pay more and look elsewhere..

The Ala Moana is a classic hotel right in the heart of the strip in downtown Honolulu, next to the Ala Moana Shopping Center. I bid on a room on Priceline and got a small suite for a great price. I was on the 29th floor so the view was fantastic and I was above the hustle and bustle down below. The staff was friendly, polite, and efficient. My room was spotless. There was a King Bed and a sitting area with a chair and a love seat. On the deck, I had a table and 2 chairs. This wasn't a designer hotel, but a very old school downtown property that has been reasonably updated. Excellent value and I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

I stayed at the Ala Moana during a work conference and loved it. Perfect location by the beach (not as crowded as wakiki) and running path, and also beside a giant mall! The hotel is quiet at night and has a fridge and microwave which is really handy on vacation. It was also pretty cheap for being in Hawaii! I do love hotels with free breakfast, but this one was ok without.. The gym is nice, but why bother when there is a park literally across the street where you can run along the Ocean? Lots of food around at the food court at the mall and also if you walk away from the beach there is a Don quioto (local grocery store) which is perfect for stocking up on souvenirs!!

We stayed at the Ala Moana Hotel twice in the month of August, 2012. The first time was for a get together with friends and the second time was for a staycation since our daughter was in town. Both times we enjoyed our stay at the hotel. The first visit, the view was facing the pool area and very nice! The room was clean and comfortable. Checking in was fast and the desk people were very pleasant, not rude like other people have posted. I don't know what hotel they were in but the staff at the Ala Moana were great. Although there were not too many dining options other than the Royal Kitchen and another restaurant, we walked to the Ala Moana Shopping Center...no problem. The breakfast buffet that is offered is very good. Overall, the Ala Moana Hotel is a good place to stay at even for local people like us.

We stayed here for four nights on our recent Oahu trip and enjoyed our stay very much. We first arrived to discover that they had booked a room with two beds instead of a big king. The front desk happily moved us in to a new room on the spot at no charge. We also got a gorgeous view of the ocean and Ala Moana Beach Park (from the 27th floor)! It was amazing to sit out on the balcony to watch the sunset in the evenings and to relax outside in the calm mornings. On-site self-parking was provided for about $20/day. The lots tends to get full but they had staff on hand to help you out at all hours.I think the big perk of this hotel is that you can take the escalator/elevator to the 2nd floor and just walk across the sky bridge to Ala Moana Center. This is a HUGE mall with enough shopping and food options to take care of you for a week. Very, very nice to have this available to you next door. Great for shopping, eating, grabbing coffee, or just picking up last minute items (water, sunscreen, etc.) at the ABC Store.The concierge service was excellent here. In particular, a gentleman named Brent was extremely polite and helpful. We booked quite a few events at the last minute, and he scrambled making phone calls and setting us up for everything from luau's to Pearl Harbor tours to just getting driving directions to a nice restaurant and a map. Don't lose this guy, Ala Moana Hotel! He's top notch :) We'd definitely stay again!

My partner and I travelled to Hawaii for a week to attend a friend's vow renewal to her husband and also to have a vacation.We chose to stay at the Ala Moana Hotel even after numerous attempts by travel agents to stay in Waikiki and in a resort.Our reasoning for staying at the Ala Moana was because of its location and also because it is classed as a corporate style hotel. My partner and I do not like to stay in resorts or family orientated accommodation when we go on holiday because we do not like children. We feel that there is nothing worse on a holiday that having to contend with children in our hotel.Our priority in Hawaii asise from the vow-renewal was shopping, site-seeing and more shopping and this is exactly what we accomplished.The Ala Moana provided a perfect base for us. The hotel is located next to the Ala Moana Shopping Centre and has a foot-bridge from the hotel that connects to the Macy's Carpark - so access to the shopping centre was easy.The hotel was clean, the staff were polite, accommodating and helpful (not that we needed much help).I would strongly suggest staying at the Ala Moana Hotel if you were either travelling solo or with someone else and not wanting to have to worry about children.As I mentioned, the hotel is a corporate hotel, so there is 1 restaurant for dinner, an Asian style restaurant which we didn't utilize becuase we wanted to try the numerous restaurants in Waikiki or the restaurants at the Shopping Centre. There is a breakfast only restaurant which is convenienent if you want to stay at the hotel, but again, we didn't use this either.We stayed the the Kona Tower of the hotel under recommendation by other reviewers on Trip Advisor and by our Travel Agent. We booked a partial ocean view room, but when I opened the curtain, I could see the ocean quite clearly. Yes, we overlooked the Macy's Carpark, but the ocean was in clear view.The only thing that I thought that could be changed/added is they have tea/coffee making facilites, but no teaspoons to stir your tea/coffee and dessert spoons should be added to the room because the gift shop sells pints of ice-cream, but with no spoons - that is a bit difficult to eat.I did enquire at reception about spoons to use, but they explained that don't have any mental spoons but could offer me a plastic spoon. I felt that since I wanted to eat ice-cream, plastic spoons would not be the best option at the hard ice-cream would break it.If you are looking to book accommodation in Hawaii - the Ala Moana Hotel is just outside of Waikiki, approx 1.5kms, so if you are wanting to stay right in the heart of it, this hotel might not be for you. Everytime we wanted to go into Waikiki, we took a trolly that left from the shopping centre and it only cost US$2 per person each way and that was about a 10/15 minute trip into Waikiki or if you are feeling energetic, you could walk.

This is our first trip to Hawaii. Once we entered the hotel, we were very happy after seeing the service at reception. Then the hotel room is found to be very nice. Room service is good. Only one problem is that the hotel don't supply mineral water. We were in problem, when we call to hotel room service around 10 pm and found that they don't provide mineral water. Otherwise we were happy about other service. Overall we enjoyed staying at this hotel.Thanks;)
user_name:
Lopamudra B
San Juan, null, Puerto Rico

review_body: I am a Hawaii resident so when they told me the rate would be double that of last year I was shocked. I was staying for business. Our tv was not operational until 9:00pm the second night and at that , the maintenance man said only a few channels would not be fuzzy. The front desk staff were very rude, not good ambassadors of Aloha!! I was so disappointed. Will look for different lodging on my next stay.

This was our first hotel in Hawaii when we toured the islands for our honeymoon. I think the location really affects this review because we weren't fans of Oahu. The hotel was fine, it's in the city and next to a huge mall. Check-in takes a little while but the staff was friendly. Rooms are fairly small so I don't think more than two people would be comfortable. It is within walking distance of Wakiki Beach and tons of shopping, so if shopping is your goal, this hotel will do just fine.

first time staying here, chose this hotel as it was very close to the Ala Moana mall and as we had no transportation. Room wasnt like the pics we viewed when booking online, a lot smaller, also thought there would be 2 beds but turned out to be just the one. Our room was supposed to be ready on check in, no towels on arrival but replenished when requested. Check in could have been a lot quicker had more staff been available, it was almost like checking in to a Las Vegas hotel on a weekend ! long lines and and equally long wait ! Close to shopping, food and entertainment options in the mall. Not as full on as the Waikiki area, and away from the action of the city night life. Didnt see spa or have breakfast, or utilise concierge so cant comment on them. Comfortable overall for the short time stayed.

A little disappointed because they would not honor the Kama'aina rate even though it was on the website. They also charged $40 more per night than the rate on the internet. Location is wonderful and I have been going there since the early 80's; unfortunately they have done little to upgrade the property since then. The Valet Parking staff are great and showed more aloha than the Front Desk staff. Not sure if I will stay there again.

I have stayed at the Ala Moana Hotel dozens of times over the past 25 years. I much prefer the location of this hotel to those in downtown Waikiki because of the crowds of wall to wall people on the streets and beach there. The hotel rooms have a clean, modern and fresh appearance, although they are not especially roomy. The staff is pleasant. The kitchenette is priceless. And as mentioned the location next the mall and near Magic Island is great. There are countless food choices near by, the shopping is world-class and there is a nice family beach is just a 10 minute walk away. My only improvement would be a comforter instead of the bedspread and central air instead of a wall unit. I don't think you would be disappointed with this choice. But, please rent a car and see the quiet, peaceful side of the island while you are here. Aloha!

The Concierge books through Enterprise but adds a 100% 48 h cancellation policy! (Just get a car for the whole trip b/c you need it. We kept adding days on short notice.) Book with 1221 Kapiolani Blvd directly because unlike the Concierge's locations, they pick you up! Also, Waikkiki tower w/ city view rocks! Housekeeping is stellar.

This is my second time staying in this hotel. I stayed at the Kona Tower both times because I opted for Kama'aina rates and the experience had been good. The room was really well-kept and well-equipped. What I like most about this hotel though is that it is so close to Ala Moana Shopping Center as they are connected through AMSC's parking lot via Skybridge and it's within walking distance to Waikiki and Ward Center. The location just can't be any better!

I had an overnight stay at Ala Moana between a meeting and my flight to the mainland. I wanted to meet family and shop during my short stay and with Ala Moana shopping out the back door of the hotel, the location is a breeze. After reading reviews I requested the Waikiki Tower for about $30 more than the un-renovated tower. I requested an early check-in and arrived before noon. There wasn't a room ready but I left my bag with the hotel and was able to get a key to my room at 2pm. They gave me a partial ocean view even though I reserved a city view which was very nice. The room is well equipped and includes free wi-fi (really, a must these days!). Wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Location is really a 15minute walk to a beach park. Also a 5 minute walk from Ala Moana Hotel.They have a nightclub and a pretty good restaurant in the lobby. Will stay next time I am in Oahu.There is the usual ironing board/hair dryer/coffee maker. The lanai is somewhat small but reasonable for Oahu.

I requested a Queen size bed for me & my wife and it was confirmed when my reservation was made. I use a CPAP to sleep and the noise can be troublesome on a small bed. When I reported to the check-in desk, I don't know why but the clerk made me stand at the counter for about 15 minutes as she was focused on the computer. Then, she asked me if I would like two double beds instead and I said no. Later, she told me if I could wait for about 15 minutes and we'll have a room. I assumed after 15 more minutes it would be a Queen size bed which we reserved so I agreed. We we entered the room, there was no Queen size bed. If time was needed for a Queen size bed, the receptionist could have told me and I would have gone shopping and returned later. The receptionist quietly worked the computer over a prolonged period and fail to sense the customer's need to know what is happening. There was no explanation for the delay or apology. The final insult was not getting what we reserved after standing captively and uninformed at the counter.

We recently spent 3 nights at the Ala Moana for a women's conference nearby. The room was comfortable and included a fridge, microwave and coffee maker. Beds were very comfortable, service fine. The lanai was small, but we had one! We had no view, but then we didn't pay for one. We had an exceptional rate.Because of the storage space for food and utensils, I think you could do very well for a more extended stay with a few groceries laid in for breakfasts and/or lunches. The proximity to the Ala Moana Mall is an obvious plus, as was the direct above street level connection. It was also handy being just a block away from the Convention Centre I wouldn't want to be driving in the area - not pleasant!

I was in Honolulu for a convention taking place at the Honolulu Convention center - this was the closest hotel to the convention center so I booked it. I was skeptical at first since the rate was only $150 + Tax but boy was I happy with this place! We (took the hubby along for a little vaca) booked a partial ocean view room but got a parking lot view in stead with the slight view of the ocean behind the buildings but once again with that rate I wasn't going to complain. The room was small but good enough for two people. The Ala Moana shopping center was right next door so we did a lot of our dining at the food court there which has varieties of food from all around the world. Of course the shopping center is the perfect place to pick up cheap souvenirs to bring home!!! There's a 7-eleven close to this place, as well as various family restaurants within walking distance. You can also hop on a trolley from the Ala Moana center for $2 which takes you around the city. I would definitely recommend this place, if you're looking for inexpensive but decent stay while in this beautiful city!

Stayed overnight for business. I loved the fact that there was a bridge across to the huge shopping mall. That also meant that there were plenty of restaurants close by to choose from. The hotel has an impressive lobby, with spacious lounge areas, super-fast elevators, very comfortable beds, spacious room, microwave etc. Free in-room wifi internet is also a welcome bonus. Good, effective air conditioning. Bathroom spacious, over bath shower a little dated. Super little balcony overlooking the pool area with sea views. Reception staff friendly and informative. Very handy shops on the premises for sundries, drinks, snacks and gifts, open 7 am till 11 pm.As previous reviewers have said, would benefit from updating but I have seen much, much worse. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

We stayed at the Ala Moana for 4 nights. Husband was there on business and I tagged along. 34the floor room had fridge and microwave which is always nice. View was only so-so. Had to look between high rise hotels to get a glimpse of the ocean. Had a great view of the YMCA pool, though. Frequent sirens and street noise was kind of a drag when we wanted to leave the lanai door open. Room was mostly clean. There was quite a bit of dirt built up in the corners in the bathroom and some broken glass and dirt behind the door to our room. Housekeeping staff did vacuum up the stuff behind the door when I brought it to their attention. Noticed paint splatters on the walls and floor in the bathroom which turns out was probably toothpaste from a previous guest that I scrubbed up with a wash cloth. That was a turn off. And they will need to get something sharp to get the dust and dirt out of the corners. I wished I'd had a screwdriver with me... Other than that, room was clean enough, comfortable and the bed was fine. Had the "cold" breakfast in the coffee shop. I feel like it was pricey, but it is Hawaii and everything is pricey food wise! Front desk staff that I dealt with were all very nice. They helped me figure out buses to get me to some of the sites I wanted to see. We must have been in the "new" tower, I overheard people talking about the Kona Tower and that it wasn't as nice. Within walking distance to the beach, but the closest one was kind of rocky. We walked about 15 minutes to Waikiki where the sand was better. Adjacent to the Ala Moana Shopping Center. In room info said pool closed at 6:30 - that would not do if we'd had our kids with us. We might stay here again if it was all that was available.

We are from Kauai and stay at the Ala Moana Hotel frequently. We love the convenience of walking to Ala Moana Shopping Center. But I have to say the rooms need updating. We stayed here 2 weeks in a row. The first week we stayed for 2 nights. The refrigerator was so loud, I had to constantly shake or bang on it to get it to stop making such a loud sound. The next week we stayed 3 nights. This time the air conditioner was loud, which makes it difficult to fall asleep. Makes me seriously weigh convenience vs. comfort.

I arrived on an early red-eye flight from the South Pacific and ended up sitting in the lobby for 5 hours waiting for a room--often told that there were no rooms ready but watching a steady stream of people check in before me. No explanation offered. The room was clean, and fine (had a fridge/microwave), though the view was of a parking deck and the bed/pillows were really lumpy and uncomfortable. I would not stay here again. I booked via priceline, so beware if you include this region of Honolulu in your bid--you'll probably get this hotel. If you do book via priceline, this hotel will not give you a receipt for your stay, which makes documentation for reimbursements and deductions a headache.

for a 2 nights stay it was goodclean rooms and bathroom, tidy but small rooms, nice view from the balcony. Close to the beach and marina we could see them from our rooms. park and the large shopping centre and 10 min away from Waikiki.small pool tho and the breakfast was not so good but its close to the shops so breakfast lunch and dinner was easy!

This was our first trip to Hawaii. We picked this hotel, because of its close proximity to the airport and Pearl Harbor. It's also close to the beach, shopping, and close but not too close to Waikiki. The room was just average, and there was a puddle of water on the floor when we walked in, because someone had apparently turned off the refrigerator, and it had defrosted on the floor. However, we called down to ask someone to come take a look at it in case it was broken, and we didn't expect anyone to come anytime soon. However, a man came up within 10 minutes of our call to the front desk, and he handled it right away and very nicely. The room was clean and the staff was friendly. We had a little trouble finding our room, as the second set of elevators was located in a different place than the main set. Our view was of another hotel and a parking lot, but we thought that the price was acceptable for such a view. The Ala Moana beach park was beautiful, and we spent a Sunday evening at sunset over there and were virtually alone. It was perfect. We also had close places to eat and hang out. We would stay there again for a couple nights. We noticed that a lot of airline employees stay there, as it is a good "utility" hotel. All the amenities in a beautiful setting...

I've previously stayed at this hotel but this time was disappointed. I didn't realize there were 2 towers. I'd recommend travelers avoid the Kona Tower. It's approximately 12 stories high. It's touted as having a city/mountain view. My view was the Mall's parking lot. The room was approximately 1/2 the size of the rooms in the main tower (30+ floors). Very disappointed with the accommodations. If you use Choice Points (the Ala Moana is a Choice Property, part of it's Ascend Properties) at this Outrigger location, you're destined to be placed in the less desirable tower. That's right, you cough up a bunch of points and get "downgraded" in an Ascend location...ironical. The rooms seem to have older equipment too. Air conditioner was loud. It worked well, but was loud.

I wanted a location near Waikiki but far enough away from the crowd. This is the first time I stayed at the Ala Moana. The room was average, pool was nice, gym was nice, and hotel staff were great. The location is by the Ala Moana Park which offers a grat place to picnic, exercise and enjoy the views. Being close to the Ala Moana shopping mall was a bonus. Great stores, restaraunts (Mai Tai Bar), and food court for a variety of food. I would stay there again.

Can not be beaten for location to Ala Moana Mall. Short walk down the ramp and straight into Macys. Room was clean and provided necessarys for the two nights we stayed. No early check in here (for us) as busy place. Free wifi, nice pool area with full sun and some shaded areas available. Impressive lobby area for a hotel at a great price. Would definately return to this hotel!!!!

I stayed here for seven nights. Be sure to stay in the Waikiki Tower. My queen room was large and had a balcony with a table and a couple of chairs on it as well as a fridge, microwave and flat screen TV. This hotel is located next to Hawaii's largest shopping mall which also contains a major transportation center which allows you to travel all over easily by public transportation. I found the check-in process to be quick and professional and the room to be very, very quiet and I found the housekeeping staff to be excellent and attentive to replenishing supplies properly (which is not the case in some places). This is a good, reasonably priced choice for Honolulu. I would stay here again.

I have stayed at Ala Moana Hotel in the past and was happy to return. I like the proximity to both the Ala Moana Shopping Center and to Ala Moana Park. We did dine at the restaurant on the 3rd floor. It is a Chinese Restaurant that was excellent and was filled primarily with locals. The swimming pool was well kept and clean as well.

My husband & I booked 3 nights here while I was to have surgery in Honolulu. When we got to our room in the Kona Tower the beds were positively horrible. Cheap and old!! And the room was extremely small. We called the front desk and for an additional $30 ($199/night) we got a "better" room in the Waikiki Tower, it was larger and the beds a little more comfortable. It was also disappointing that there were limited options for eating and drinking at the hotel. We did not feel safe walking around at night and even though the hotel is adjacent to the Ala Moana shopping center, it takes quite a bit of effort to get there. Bottom line: would probably not stay here again. Must note, the front desk staff were very pleasant and accomodating, especially Iwalani

The rooms are small but okay - a bit dated. The location is far enough away from the beach area that you will need a car or have to take a shuttle. It has the atmosphere of an airport terminal. The only good thing about the hotel is that you can get an ocean view at a reasonable price. The staff is hit or miss. Some of the employees were nice, but the check-in clerk was about as unhelpful as it's possible to get. The most worst staff person: the woman at the "Expedia activity desk". One day I asked for general directions to a Manoa Valley and she replied: "We have tour packages that go there." I asked again for directions, not for a tour, and she gave the same reply. This is total bush league. They should rename the desk, "the tour sales desk -- no free info given." If you want a romantic lace to stay, this is not the place for you. But if you are looking for a basic no-frills hotel at a reasonable price, then it's okay.
user_name:
Bon-Voyage-747
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Just spent two weeks there. Had no problem getting a boarding pass from the front desk. I was told to obtain it a slower time. People most helpful. Bathroom a little small. Cleaning was late, but most cooerative. Everyplace is a set of compermises. My wife LOVED it, she hates everyplace. Close to Walmart and 24hr Wallgreens 1 city block.

This hotel has extraordinarily small rooms that weren't particularly clean. The morning after our first night we awoke with bug bites on our legs and faces--my eyes were swollen shut. We alerted the front desk immediately. They moved us out of our room and placed in a room next to the ice machine which was EXTREMELY noisy. They moved us once more to the room furthest from the elevator--at least it was quiet. We were offered medical attention but refused as we know what to do for bug bites. The next morning there was a very large moth on the wall of the room. We wondered what was going on that there were bugs in the hotel! We were given a voucher for a free breakfast which was nice, but my eyes were swollen for the entire week and a free breakfast hardly seemed a good compensation! The bathroom was so small that if you forgot to close the door before sitting on the toilet you couldn't close the door at all. There were no fans in the bathroom so it became very steamed up after two showers and the air conditioning seemed to only have one setting--"high"! I guess we've been spoiled by staying at the Hawaii Prince Hotel nearly every time we're in Hawaii and since the Ala Moana was more expensive we expected the same type of accommodations and rooms. Once the valets realized we were "self-service" they never made any further attempts to help us get into or out of the car, despite my limited vision. We booked a "partial ocean view" and that was taken literally--PARTIAL! We had a view of the Ala Moana Shopping Mall parking lot with a little tiny sliver of ocean view--not something we expected particularly from the photos on their website. It was a disappointing experience and we choose not to book this hotel in the future. Hopefully no one else will ever experience the bug bites!

My wife and I spent a very nice weekend at the Ala Moana.The room was very clean. The view was good.The desk staff was excellent.
