The breakfast was good.It's a no smoking hotel which was super nice.One of my favorite things was the parking. Self park is $20, valet with unlimited in and out was $25. The parking guys kept me car waiting at the front for me so I didn't have to wait each time for them to get it. It was well worth the extra $5 and I of course give them a tip too.I'd visit again.

I was here for 6 nights on business. The photos that other travelers have taken are pretty current.Room was clean, bed was comfortable. It was pretty quiet.The pool is open only until 6:30 pm. If you plan to swim after a long day at work, forget about it.The hotel caters to businesses----you will see flight crews checking in and out of the hotel at all hours. There is no lounge to just sit and have a drink, but there are some eating establishments within the hotel. There are also some very good gift stores and a convenience shop located in the bottom level.A walking bridge from the second floor goes directly to the shopping center-----There is a Macy's, Nordstrom, and a huge variety of restaurants located in the shopping center. There is also a food court. You can also walk to Ala Moana park----on weekends it is full of families, runners, and tourists. I didn't swim, but there were plenty of people who were.The location is close to the business district via Ala Moana. The staff was friendly and helpful. While the hotel does not have a "resort" feel, it is a good value in a decent location with easy access to most everything you would want to do in Honolulu.

Great Hotel, located in the heart of Oahu, this Hotel has rooms which are pleasing to the eyes. Conveniently located beside Ala Moana Center where Shopping and Dining is fabulous, this Hotel is just a few minutes walk away from Waikiki Beach. The Hotel was recently remodeled as it is with the rooms which are very pleasing to the eyes. The only downside of this hotel are the staff handling the front desk. In my 10 years of checking in and out of this Hotel I would say that only a handful are even pleasant enough to smile and help you out with your concerns. Over all this Hotel is an excellent choice if you are on vacation in Oahu Hawaii.

My flight was rerouted so Delta gave me a voucher to this hotel. It was a delightful experience from start to finish. Not at all what I expected from an airline voucher. I would actually consider staying here if I were to come back for vacation. 5 minute walk to a beach. Located right near shopping such as Macy's (the room key also serves as a 10% off coupon to Macy's). The rooms are nice and light and clean. Mine had a balcony, 2 double beds, two chairs and a desk with chair. Updated television, microwave, coffee maker and refrigerator. Room was quiet as well. The bathroom is nice with body lotion and a shampoo/conditioner combo. The views are amazing from the room. The breakfast was $16.95 and was pretty good. Lots of fresh fruit. The staff was extremely nice and helpful.

I stayed here on a business trip for 3 nights. The hotel is located within walking distance to the convention center and the beach. My room was king that included a nice desk, sofa and chair. There was also a mini fridge and microwave. The layout was set up in a way that I would have been comfortable here for an extended trip. The room was clean and spacious. I was not lucky enough to get a room facing the ocean, but it looked like those rooms would have a very nice view. I was on the opposite side of the 24-25 story (cant remember for sure) tower, where the views were less appealling. The mountain in the distance was good but if you looked straight down it was business' that consisted of mostely strip clubs and massage parlors. I would stay here again because of the cleanliness, cost, and location.

We stayed at the Ala Moana Hotel and it is the perfect place for people who want to spend a lot of time at the Ala Moana Shopping Center. The remodel is nice and the hotel feels fresh. We did have a fire alarm during the day and of course nobody responded except HFD.Perhaps the most bazaar service failure is the lack of free boarding pass printing. They have business center with paid computers, but no ability to get your boarding pass for free. On the plus side, the Assistant Manager got us our boarding passes, but this is the first hotel, luxury or otherwise where they didn't provide free boarding passes. Its not the cost but the principal.

The room was very nice, well appointed and on the 30th floor with a fantastic view. The room has a small couch, easy chair and nice writing desk. The laini had two chairs and a small table to dine on in the room. There is no room service in the hotel and the restraunt that is open in the morning for breakfast only serves a buffet for $16.95. I wanted a bowl of oatmeal and they don't serve it without paying for the buffet. If you aren't a big eater plan to stock the room with breakfast items. There is a microwave and refer in the room.The staff was exceptional.

Our flight was canceled last August 12 and the airline booked us to Ala Moana Hotel. Upon arrival at the hotel, we loaded our cart with 7 luggages. Then the attendant gave me a blue ticket, He explained it is a ticket for him to bring our luggages to our room. I said thank you but my brother can push the cart to our room and gave him back the blue ticket. After check in, we proceeded to the elevator and as the door was closing, here comes the same attendant, suddenly reached for the cart and removed it from the elevator. That caught us by surprise. when we asked why he took our cart, he said the cart cannot go to the elevator with us. Thinking the luggage might be for the other elevator, I told him I will go with our luggages. I was trying to stop him from leaving the elevator door because I was still inside the elevator, My sister was desperately trying to reach for her purse laying on top of the luggages. She kept on telling him "give me my purse please, I want my purse" her hand stretched out trying to reached for it and the attendant did not hand it to her while the elevator door kept on closing on her hand and so she sustained some bruising. In the commotion, the elevator door closed and I was not able to get out to be with our luggage. We waited at our room door on the third floor, and the attendant took quite long to reach the area. We were so worried. When he finally showed up, I asked him why he took our cart if we clearly told him we can do it ourselves. He said it is for our safety. I asked what safety? and he said we might hit our head to the cart. Sarcastically I said to him. it must be a Hawaiian procedure and he replied, yes it is. This attendant has an attitude the whole time. Very disrespectful.Inside our room, quite a disappointment, so small, carpet not so clean looking. There is no conditioner and no body wash, A big hotel with no conditioner? Unbelievable. The only nice thing about the hotel was when I woke up the next day, the view from our balcony took my breath away...beautiful!
user_name:
Nida T
Waldorf, Maryland, United States

review_body: I have to say people working there are not friendly. My mother is Japanese and she thought one of them was one too so she asked something in Japanese but the crew looked frustrated and spoke back "English!".Three of us stayed there and only two cups were prepared even we paid for three.

Major plus: it's not in Waikiki but close enough that if you wanted to be a part of the Waikiki experience you could without any trouble. The shopping center, beaches, outstanding restaurants are all near by. We requested the Waikiki Tower, paid a little more but the view from the balcony was worth it. Room was standard - clean, comfortable, fresh. Microwave oven, frig, coffee maker, sofa. Bathroom provided the standard essentials. Wifi was free but enormously slow. Breakfast buffet at $17 per person wasn't bad -- gave us a senior discount (15%) for being over 55 so only paid about $14.50 and ate enough to last the day. Front desk crew was not at all enthusiastic about working with the public but you only have to deal with them long enough to check in/out. Don't expect any of that "aloha spirit" stuff.

The Ala Moana Hotel is very convenient, within walking distance of the Hawaii Convention Center & just a short stroll from the Ala Moana Shopping Center. The room was clean & came equipped with a small refrigerator, iron & ironing board, coffee maker & blow dryer. It also had free WI-FI. I highly recommend this hotel..decent price, clean room & great location.

We stayed here for our honeymoon. Great location. Walking distance to the beach. Next door to the flea market and lots of restaurants near by. The hotel has a chinese restaurant on the main floor. The rooms are clean and boutique styled.

The spirit of aloha was absent in this hotel. We've had warmer welcomes in less pricey hotels. The best thing about it was that it was clean and that it was close to the transport hub, shopping centre and the beach park. The WiFi was also free and reliable. The kitchenette had a convection microwave but not much else except for a few glasses. Some basic cutlery and crockery would have improved the experience considerably. All in all, a disappointing experience. I think we'll stay somewhere else next time.

Stayed with my family for 1 night on route to another island. The room smelled very musty and likely was full of mould. I did not make a big deal about it as we arrived late and were leaving early the next morning. Upon check out I mentioned that I was not pleased with the condition of the room and the response I got was that the hotel was totally booked as if to suggest I was lucky to have gotten a room. If you are foolish enough to stay here bring your own cleaning supplies. I am not one to complain but you should know what you are getting into. I wish I did!

IT is adjacent to Ala Moana Mall. The food court has a number of great choices that are reasonably priced. Additionally, it across the street from the Ala Moana Beach which was nice; not so crowded. There is a grocery store on the first floor of the mall which had great buys. The fitness center is nice. The equipment is new. The steam room and sauna worked well. The hotel is close to the convention center and it is easy to arrange transportation. Parking garage was crowed; difficult to find a spot. It was clean. It is not the newest property in the area but great location and afforded us an opportunity to see many sights. The staff was professional.

I booked and paid for 2 rooms in Dec, 2011, to be in Oahu with my son and his wife for the 70th anniversay of Pearl Harbor. Luckily I paid with my AmEx card because we ended up booking elsewhere for safety reasons. My son called to alert me when checking in that he had observed 4 different homeless men from the park across the street urinating on the front of the hotel. The view from his room was of an alleyway with massage parlors etc. "Mom, you will not feel safe here." We checked into another hotel and sent photos and a letter to the hotel and to AmEx who refunded my money due to "no response" from Luxury Hotels headquarters in Las Vegas. When I called them initially from Oahu, the receptionist stated "you can leave but you will not get your money back".

The Ala Moana can be complemented on its work out facility and the proximity to the Mall and convention center. The hotel is an experience of commercialism at its finest. The grand lobby is devoid of any ambiance.The rooms lack what is commonly provided at even most Holiday Inns. The pillows and bedding is old, worn out and lumpy, One coffee bag with powder milk for compliment. Cheap shampoo without conditioner.

1) Try the hotel breakfast buffett...they give you 20% off and it is very convenient with a lot of food choices2) We also parked on the street in the meters and saved $20 parking each night (parking was usually free after 6pm and before 7am, then $.25 every 20 minutes).3) Eat at Shokodu, which is right next door and probably one of the best Japanese/Korean sushi restaurants in Honolulu.Overall, my wife and I (both in upper 20's) loved staying here. It was a solid choice and the hotel has a great value (we paid $129/night), good enough location, and our room was clean and had a nice view of the city/mountains. Here's my suggestion...if you want to stay in downtown Honolulu somewhere close to Waikiki and do not want to search a lot of hotels and read a ton of reviews, then book your room here and you can spend your time doing more important things.ps - I also think they opened a club in the lower level for Friday ans Saturday nights (I never heard music in our room)

We came back to Honolulu after staying on Maui and the Big Island and just needed an overnight hotel before flying home. We did not like this hotel as being very average and I would not stay here again. The only good point was its location next to the main mall in Honolulu. The bedrooms were very small and the bathrooms even smaller. The pool area on the third floor was only of use for an overnight stay.It is a large volume type hotel with the feeling of guests being packed in to the minimum space possible at lowest cost.It is not ideal hotel for a family holiday stay and the location is 20 mins walk from the middle of Waikiki.

From the time my wife and I stepped up to the front desk at 11:15 pm on July 9 and throughout our stay, everyone has been very friendly and helpful in every way. The girl at the front desk was very sweet and helpful, and she had only been on the job a very short time (maybe a week or less), but she was fabulously friendly and wonderful as you would expect people to be here in paradise. The bell hops are extremely friendly and helpful (we chose to park the car with the valet our entire trip since parking can be a hassle after driving all day - and it is well worth the money too!). The Plantation Restaurant, htough plain to some, was a great experience for us as we had the breakfast our first morning here and will likely have it a few more times during our two week stay. The guava juice is wonderful and I recommend it to anyone! The room was smaller but well appointed and maid service did a fine job of cleaning it every day (we didn't come to Hawaii to stay in a room - we came to see the culture and be everywhere we can the whole time we are here, so a place to sleep this nice is great for us). If you come to Hawaii letting all of life go and just concentrate on being happy and dropping all the baggage you had on the mainland, you will love being here. It has been a peaceful experience for us and I will more than likely stay at the Ala Moana again in the future. I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

For the price I paid to stay here, I will definitely be choosing another place next time. My main reason for choosing to stay at Ala Moana hotel was its adjacent location to the shopping center. And I think, because of that reason alone, the hotel does nothing to keep their place welcoming or well-maintained at all! Maybe it was just me cause I was so happy to return to Hawaii , but everyone I encountered who was a staff there sure wasn't in an upbeat mode and it showed. They didn't have to be, but hey, its Hawaii...where's that beautiful Hawaiian smile to greet a freshly arrived tourist? Nada. Every person working there seemed like they were dying to go home, especially the reception. And like I mention frequently in my reviews, I go very much for the feel of the place and this place sure had a dull, lifeless feel to it. It wasn't good energy to me. And btw, the rooms are awfully small -- I thought I was in Manhattan by mistake!

Located next to the Ala Moana Shopping Center. It is one of the oldest and best open air malls in the world. Their food court is the best in the world, hands down. The hotel has a walkway to the mall.The rooms are pleasant and clean. Service is good, but for an occasional slip, such as waiting too long for a transaction. Otherwise I would have rate it 5*.

The Ala Moana hotel was initially built with the intention that many of the rooms would be sold as condos. That being said, the hotel doesn't offer all of the amenities you might find closer to Waikiki. That is what I like about it, but I think there are better places to stay if you want the vacation feel. My recommendation would be to make sure you get a room with a kitchenette. There is a Safeway close by. Grab some groceries and treat your room like a condo. The hotel is connected to the Ala Moana shopping center which has a huge food court and the best shopping O'ahu has to offer. You're also close to residential areas so it's a great chance to get a taste of real life on the island. You're far enough from the chaos of Waikiki that you really don't feel like a tourist. Just across the street is a beautiful beach park, again - lots of locals! It's a great place to go for a run or lay in the sun.

Rm 1308 is an end room overlooking Ala Moana Beach and Ala Moana Shopping Mall. Nice King bed, bigger bathroom than their usual lower kamaiiana room. Internet service is on/off. I used my own Mifi instead. There is a microwave, little frig and and a bar sink. No room service which would have been a great convenience since i stayed here after a surgical procedure. Hotel receptionist said all the prices are up due to RimPac Exercises. Too pricey at this time of the year.

Just across from the Ala Moana mall which is a great open air shopping centre. A nice place to wander around. The hotel itself isn't that great, but it is ok. It is out of Waikiki, on the airport side, which makes it a good location for a short stay. It is also just near the bus station if you would like to get around by the efficient public transport system, rather than driving or paying for tours. We arrived after a long flight well before check-in time, but the foyer had plenty of comfortable lounges. We were also allowed into the room early.

The room was nice and spacy and the bed although hard was normal hotel qaulity. We had the city side of the hotel so the view was just of the busy roads and buildings but it was still nice. Our biggest complaint was it was a full kitchen with two fridges and two mircrowaves and not a single plastic utensils. You would think they would be nice and put some things in it. also we had a family of 5 and we had one coffee pouch that made one cup of coffee and nothing to stir the sugar in it with. one shampoo and one soap. really don't they see a family of five and maybe go up and stock a little more??? I realize people still ammenities so they do as minimal as possible but this was a high end hotel and sharing one soap with 5 people sucked. Complaining don't do no good they just say fill a card and it gets sent to management which don't help since we only did one day. The fold out couch was unbearable, sagged in the middle so they fell together in the middle and it was like sleeping on metal springs. They actually opted to sleep on the floor with bugs and hard as bricks to avoid the pain of sleeping on the couch which we paid good money for. I will say I was impressed that we lost an item in the room and they were extremely nice in putting it somewhere safe so we could come back for it. It wasn't expensive but it was very precious to us. so 1/2 was good and 1/2 would make me never come back. My suggestion check your fold out couch before you do anything so you can ask for roll aways...if they have them.

We were bummed from our flight so the airlines put us up. I was a bit concerned where we would be. Pleasently suprised. I am glad I already had a feel for Waikiki. My review maybe a bit more positive since we stayed for "freeish" but the room was a nice size, clean, good bath, and had a nice balcony over looking the harbor and water. We had a late check out so having the guest room to clean up before our flight was awesome. The mall next door is great and we were excited to experience the beach at this end of Waikiki. The pool area didn't seem inviting, but that was just from our balcony view. If I went to Waikiki again and this was in my price range I would stay again. Staff was excellent and rooms were fine.

My stay in this hotel was very disappointing...I've stayed in this hotel before so I know what to expect...small room, outdated...but liveable/stayble. Well, this time around my room was just dirty --- sheets were dirty and the toilet was dirty. I was really disappointed.

The room we stayed in (Kona Tower) seemed a little shabby and had some issues that we had to contact the front desk about. From our arrival at the hotel late at night after an exhausting 18 hours of air travel and waiting, we found the reception desk staff extremely friendly and helpful. The bellmen were very courteous and friendly as well. We were hungry but it was 10 at night, so we had to wait until 6:30 the next morning to have the breakfast buffet. It was rather plain for the price, but we enjoyed ourselves because the man who poured coffee was so friendly and treated us as if he had known us for a long time. The gym and pool enabled us to keep in shape for the week we were there. Being able to walk to Ala Moana Center to sample various ethnic dishes in the food court was a lot of fun. For me, friendly faces and prompt service trump any deficiencies in a hotel room. We went on several tours that involved shuttle buses and vans, and believe me friendly service and courtesy are NOT universal in Hawaii. I would love to spend a week at Ala Moana Hotel again in the future.

3rd stay in this hotel for more than 4 days at a time, the good thing was it had room internet and was next to the mall, and had AC....laundry available on other floors but I had to go at odd hours every time to get an available dryer and washer. Bathroom was dirty and moldy though for my standards, I went out and bought clorox wipes and some bleach to clean the tub myself because my kids wanted to take a bath. It's ok here, wish it was cheaper though. I also feel safer in this hotel (it's away from all the homeless/transients).

Enjoyed my stay at hotel. Had a great view of ocean. Convenient to just walk over to shopping center. Very impressed with staff. So friendly and helpful. Room very clean. Have stayed her several times during the years and have always been very satisfied.

The staff was helpful, friendly. If you like shopping without taking a taxi or driving this is the best place to stay. I would recommend Ala Moana to everyone. With an all day of shopping, it was great to come back to a very clean room and beds made up. Thank you to all the staff for making my stay wonderful. See you again soon.
great location in Honolulu, near the beach and right next door to the largest mall in the islands. The doorman and clerks were all friendly and I would definately request room 1918 again.

I stayed in Jan. 2012 and had a good time. The room was the same as depicted in all of the pictures on Trip Advisor. Our tv was bigger and the room had dishes, glasses and coffee cups. I booked through the owner of the room who was very nice and I would stay in that condo again. Enjoyed location since it was quieter than crowded Waikiki area. Easy walk to Ala Moana Shopping mall and Ala Moana beach and near the Bus stop. We did not need service while there so cannot answer.

Stayed at this hotel with my family for our second visit to Honolulu in early May. Upon arrival at the airport, we just took one of the airport shuttle services. No need for reservations, just look for their staff in yellow hawaiian shirts and they'll take care of the rest. The rate is currently at USD12.00 one way of USD20.00 round trip, per person. The trip to the hotel took just less than an hour and is conveniently located beside the large mall, Ala Moana Center. The lobby was spacious with lots of seating area. The check-in staff graciously gave us a room despite arriving at around 10 in the morning. Our room was located on the 8th floor fronting the hotel. It barely had a view of the sea but had a good view of the swimming pool. It had two double beds, spacious bathroom, free WiFi, flat screen TV, refrigerator, microwave, etc. I know is an old hotel but was satisfied with their renovations/upgrades. It is a very popular hotel and can be very crowded on weekends. It is also the preferred hotel of many airline crews. Getting food/drinks/personal necessities is not a problem since there is a convenience store at the ground floor inside the hotel. There is also a 7-11 a few minutes away for other late night/early morning cravings. The nearest beach is at the Ala Moana park which is a few minutes walk from the front of the hotel and is less-crowded than in Waikiki. If you want to go to the Waikiki Beach area, you can take the local bus from the Ala Moana Center for USD2.50 per adult (i think it is half for kids), or take the Waikiki Trolley for USD2.00 per person, or take the Taxi for about USD10.00. The room rates are high but if shopping is your thing, this hotel is the most convenient and the sales tax in Hawaii is only 4.7%. We hope to be back soon!
Very nice, clean hotel right next to a shopping center and very close to the touristy areas. The room was spacious and all else was very nice. Free WiFi also.

We stayed 2 nights at Ala Moana Hotel which is linked by skybridge to Ala Moana Center. This is really the only reason we picked this hotel. We didnt care the rest. Bed and Toilet are decent. It served our purpose. Check-in Staff is not in a hurry to check you in. The key to my room I had didnt work for 4 times. Called security but took him a long time to come. He did apologise when i finally saw him after getting my 5th key. I didnt think it was funny to be laughed at by the check-in staff as I QUEUE each time to get new key and it took me 40 mins just to get into my room.....which is really another room because I refused to try a new key (5th time) on the original room. The lift is another problem....we had to slot our key into the lift to get to our floor. It suits us well and you would feel safe becos of the security BUT the key DOES not work all the time so you often find yourself in a lift full of people all struggling with our keys to slot into the lift just to get to our floor! It was Hilarious....

The room was almost the size of a typical household washroom. Within this tiny room there was one bed, one couch, one work table and chair, two night stands, and a sofa chair. So, the only easy way to reach any on these furniture was to jump from one to the next, since there was no walkable floor space left in the room. The front desk staff lack basic training in hospitality manners. However, the location is something that is attractive, for someone going there for a conference at the convention center.

This hotel has been around for years, i.e. the 1960s. It's been remodeled several times, and yet it still has an "old" hotel feel. Rooms in the Kona Tower are a bit dingy and dark. Bathrooms are small. They have tried to make it more guest friendly with microwaves and refrigerators. Overall, it's a big impersonal 36-story hotel, Lots of flight crews overnight there. Also, it's off the beaten path from Waikiki, that is unless, you like shopping at the mall next door. One night was enough, there are plenty better places around to stay.

We had to make a quick trip to Hawaii, and the airport hotels we would have stayed in were booked, as were many others. We chose the Ala Moana because it had decent reviews on TripAdvisor and reasonable rates.Since we took their lowest rate, we didn't end up with an ocean facing penthouse view - instead, we ended up in the Kona Tower (the short one) on the fourth floor. The room was small with a queen bed, but it also had a work desk, microwave, decent-sized refrigerator, and coffee maker. The room was clean, and housekeeping did a good job of keeping it that way. It did have sliding doors to the outside, but the "balcony" was just a barrier to keep you from falling out the door. That was fine with us as we did take their cheapest rate. (The main tower rooms had balconies with chairs and a table - but you'll pay more.) The hotel has a walkway on the second floor to the Ala Moana mall (biggest in Hawaii) if shopping is your thing, and the Ala Moana Beach Park is just a block away. Breakfast is a bit pricey at the cafe, but with a bit of snooping you can find other options. We paid to self-park, and never had a problem finding a parking spot in the garage, but we did see that cars that arrived late on Saturday night were parked in no parking areas. (The desk had told me that if they didn't have parking, that I was to leave my keys with the gate attendant and they would park it.) We will be staying there on our next trip.

The only reason I stay here 1) got a deal price on Priceline 2) closes to bus/ala moana shopping mall.Stayed at Kona tower, no view facing parking lot. In fact it doesn't bother me cuz it's only for sleep.1st night stayed, there is a ice maker machine (huge) at thf entrance where my room is . So noisy first night didn't sleep at all. Spoke to the manager, changed to a different room. Since we go out everyday in am not back to hotel until night time. When I ready for bed the 2nd night, I heard the same noise from the ice making machine again. I opened the door and saw the room only moved away 2 room further away from the ice machine. I called the manager that night, and explained the concen.He says he has no control of the noise for ice machine, But willing to move to another at end of hall. W finally settled in the 3rd time.I spoke to a different manage today as if I can extend the check ou time until 3pm due to some delay in flight ,rather than 12 o'clock standard time. He says he has to charge me 60+tax for the hour I stay( 12- 5pm). I say to him I only need until 4pm and its not fair to charge this amount if u only stay for 4 more hours. His explaintion is that each room in ala moana hotel is ownedBy individual owner, if you don't move out 1pm the room won't eSold and the hotel will have to pay .The reason I got mad/upset is that he keeps saying this Hotel is different from others is that it's owned by private owner and he has to sell the room or else the hotel will pay to the owner. I understand it's a business but he just charging expensive amount from the customer and not even cares my basic needs.anyway, I have to agree from previous reviewer, this is not what you wana hen you choos s hotel. Poo-worst customer service. Will never stay here again.

We chose the hotel for the location, near shopping and near the ala moana beach park which is lovely. But everything that could went wrong, the faucet broke and water sprayed all over the bathroom. I did call to have it fixed and then I needed to call to have it cleaned up! Later that day , upon returning from dinner the lights were not working. I called the desk and somebody came to fix it, he was there 30 minutes until 10:30 and we really wanted to go to sleep. When I mentioned this at the desk in the morning , they gave us $20 discount, big deal! They did not seem to apologetic and I think it really ruined the stay! We will probably try another place next time. It is just too impersonal, and without much aloha!

There are only two reasons to stay in Honolulu or Waikiki: (a) you love horrible traffic, tourist traps and hordes of people; or (b) you are there for a conference and have no choice. I fell into the latter category. The Ala Moana Hotel is fine for a conference hotel, no complaints about anything, but nothing special. Very average. You can check out towels by the pool to take the beach (about a 10 minute walk). We stayed in the Waikiki Tower and had a microwave, coffee maker and good size mini-fridge that was empty (not filled with overpriced snacks and booze). The hotel is adjacent to the Ala Moana Shopping Center and it is easy to stop by the grocery store or food court for breakfast, lunch or snack items. Bring some plastic cutlery from home. It is also easy to catch the bus to just about anywhere you want to go. The bus website (www.thebus.org) is great as it gives you the stop number to let you know you are waiting at the right place! $2.50 for adult or get a 4-day pass for $25. Warning – the buses can get pretty full. We took the bus to Pearl Harbor (a must see), Waikiki and Diamond Head Crater. On Wednesdays from 4-7pm is a farmer’s market at the Blaisdell Center on Ward Street. About a 20-25 minute walk or catch a bus. If you walk, take Kapiolani Street, it has nice shade trees for most of the way. Great oven fired pizza, fresh bread, ginger tea, other food items, fresh fruit and veggies. Pan flute players. Check out the ticket booth while at Blaisdell to see what shows are in town. There is also a farmer’s market in the Ala Moana Center 2nd level parking area by Sears on Saturdays from 8-12. This one had a great selection for exotic fruit including rambutans, sapote, mangosteins and some stuff I have never seen before. There is also a big farmer’s market by the Crater on Saturdays, but did not have time to visit that one.

We were on the 31st floor in an oceanfront room, which was dated and the bed wasn't great, but if you're in Honolulu to shop, you can't beat the location! I thought it was good value for money for what it was.

The hotel is located near a large shopping center and has a nice conference center. The hotel itself is just average. The bathroom was disappointing. The tub and sink counter caulk was discolored(?mold). Hotel front desk was unwilling to provide a courtesy check out of 1 hour delay. Price is good. Hotel restaurant is a bit pricey.

The room was very small with a parking lot view. Bed is horrible, definitely not a $200 hotel per night, maybe if you pay $90 it will be a fair price, and this is not a hotel anymore it is a condominium / hotel so each room has an different owner, witch mean the quality of the rooms are very low. The kona tower rooms are horrible and if you have 2 bag you will not fit because it is super small, very old and smely, the wakiki tower room are a bit bigger but still as crapy as the other tower. This hotel is way over price and over rated, dont let the whole hawaii fever fool you. We got the breakfast buffet in the hotel, let me warn you not to waste your money, it was by far the worst breakfast I have ever had. Everything was cold, for french toast they gave you bread to put into a toaster.The hotel was pricey and a big disappointment, I would not return

Stayed here for a couple of nights - great location as it is just across the Ala Moana Mall. Clean, comfortable, quiet. A little busy at the lobby reception with lots of tour groups lining up, but will definitely stay here again on my next trip to HNL.

We arrived on Easter Sunday and were glad that the excellent sushi restaurant on the Lobby level was open. The next day we wandered over to the Ala Moana Shopping Mall before our flight to the outer islands. It is barely 20 minutes to the airport, our room was clean and quiet.

Our first time in Hawaii, visiting family. I thought it was a good location, still near all the action but far enough away from the craziness that can sometimes take place in Waikiki Beach. No hassles checking in or out. Our room was clean, there was a safe, mini fridge, coffee maker, and microwave, along with an iron, ironing board, and TV. the bathroom didn't show any signs of wear and tear (usually my first warning sign) and we had a room on the 32nd floor with an amazing view of the ocean and Diamond Head along with downtown views of Honolulu. This hotel is about a 5 minute walk to Ala Moana Beach Park, still a lovely beach but not as busy as Waikiki (although the sand is a bit rockier). Still, only about a 20 minute walk to the Waikiki Beach area. Right beside Ala Moana Shopping Center, which has all the shopping you will ever need.

There was hardly enough room to walk around the queen bed and the patio was only 5 inches deep. Seriously, we could not get a foot onto the patio. Basically it was a window door. The information we got when we checked in was that hotel guests are able to go to Rumors without paying an entrance fee. When our two beautiful and dressed to dance daughters got to Rumors at 9pm they said that rule didn't apply anymore. They went somewhere else and had a blast. We checked out after the first night even though we planned to stay for four nights. The front desk must be used to it because they didn't even ask why or care.

I was at this hotel for the proximity to the convention center. Although a good beach is only a five minute walk away. The room (ocean view, high rise) was very nice. But checkin is a bit of a hassle. I waited in line for 30 minutes to check-in, it was taking an average of 10-15 minutes per person to get registered. It took me even longer and my room was cancelled part way through the stay, despite having it all settled at checkin. It was finally resolved, but took five phone calls and waiting in line another 20 minutes to key keys refreshed. I tried to find coffee or a drink during the day (between noon and six pm) but nothing is open. As other reviewers have noted, it is only a five minute walk to the Ala Moana center, where you can find plenty of options for food and drink (at about a tenth of the price of the hotel stuff).

The room was very small with a parking lot view. We got the breakfast buffet in the hotel, let me warn you not to waste your money, it was by far the worst breakfast I have ever had. Everything was cold, for french toast they gave you bread to put into a toaster.The hotel was pricey and a big disappointment, I would not return

This hotel is located VERY close to the exhibition hall and the huge mall - also called Ala Moana. This is NOT where you go for beach, ambience, or Hawaiian feel. But the prices are pretty good and you are still close to Waikiki.

Rooms were very nice, Basic. But clean and in good repair. No room service. No cocktail lounges. The pool closes early, and no poolside bar. But...Ala Moana shopping center is attached. and the beach is 2 blocks away. Quiet inside at night. But noisy outside, Pressure washers at 5am in the parking structure down below. Close 'lanai' door. Can here the live band comming from Mai Tai bar, at the mall...LOUD at 12am.

It would have been good to know in advance the size of the USD$140 per night room. We upgraded - and extra $60 plus tax. Knowing the true cost of the room it would be good to shop around and see what else is available for $200 per night. That is my only grumble - unless you count the fact that the pillows are big and chunky, but that's not particular to the Ala Moana as I find most hotel pillows super uncomfortable for sleeping.The room we ended up in was great. On a much higher floor so none of the traffic noise others have commented on.The hotel was clean. The maids were helpful and did a great job.The staff were friendly and gave us good tips on local places to eat.The wifi works only in the lobby and around the pool area. The free internet in your room only works if you have a computer to plug in - so no good for your ipad or smart phone.No room service - which was fine. The Ala Moana Shopping mall next door has a great food hall, not to mention brilliant shopping. All in all good value for money I think.

I stayed out here for a business trip although I had the choice of staying in Waikiki. If you want to do some shopping, the ala moana mall is a stones throw away from here. Waikiki you can just walk to or take the bus into. The real winner is that you don't pay an arm and leg for food, gifts, and groceries because you can walk to several locations around the hotel for good eats. Walmart, don Quixote, and the mall are the places to eat and buy gifts. The beach is across the street!

My Husband and I stayed at this property from March 26-29th and scored the big game deal for our stay. The room cost us $38 a night and a 3 night stay was only $129 !! When we booked it we did not expect to find ourselves booked into a large room on the 27th floor with an ocean view and king bed!! The location was perfect for walking and taking in local attractions and we loved the Ala Moana beach park for walking and the great beaches! We had great service and the pool was a welcome place to enjoy late afternoons after a full day sightseeing before heading out to watch the sunset and have dinner! It was an amazing deal and a great place to stay even if we had to pay regular price!

i booked one of the vacation rental units at ala moana hotel through a local agent. even with the cleaning fee etc., i paid about $800 in total for a seven-night stay in an ocean-view studio and was highly satisfied with what I got for that price.the unit i stayed in came with everything I needed--fridge, microwave and all sorts of tableware. the room was clean and cozy for one person. having to make the bed and to take the trash myself was not at all a problem; in fact, i liked the sense of privacy. although some of the frontdesk staff seemed rather unenthusiastic, I was impressed with the security staff when some neighbors of mine started to play loud music after midnight. they came right away and solved the problem. needless to say, the location is perfect for shopping. a stroll to magic island, ala moana beach park and/or the marina is pleasant too. I would return to ala moana hotel, but not for the price advertised on the hotel's or other websites.

My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights over Saint Patrick's day. As locals, we did not want to fuss with driving back and forth and wanted to enjoy the parade, the night life and some friends in down town. We had never stayed there but it was nice. The facility feels like a mainland hotel with a Hawaiian flair. It was clean and the rooms were well appointed. There is a night club attached which is good for the 40-50 crowd and walking distance to the islands finest strip clubs.

Hotel ran a Super Bowl special on rates after the big game. Rates were way to good to pass up, only $39.00 night. Check in was fast and friendly. Actually the entire staff during our entire stay were exceptional. The room itself was nice enough, if I had a complaint it would be the rooms are a tad small with the two beds only a full size. The lanai was nice, we were on the 31st floor and our view was excellent, My only other complaint would be the pool temperature. We brought two kids with us and they would barely stay in the pool because it was so cold. After getting in myself I would have to agree. It could have definitely been warmer. No hot tub to get warm! The location of the hotel is great if you want to be away from the craziness of Waikiki. Awesome location if you want to spend your time shopping at the Ala Moana Center. Overall we had an excellent stay and would stay again.

I stayed here on a 3 night stopover which was purely for shopping. I was on my own so the room was sufficient but would not have liked to have to share this room with my partner. I stayed in the Kona tower the room overlooked a carpark. The room was very old and tired, the pillows were old and lumpy however it did have a fridge and microwave. I thought the coffee maker was going to blow up. Staff were pleasant but didn't go out of their way to help. The hotel was right next to the shopping centre but not close to the Waikiki beach strip. Ok but would not stay again. I think you could do a lot better for your money in this area.

I stayed here on my way to my current ship. The rooms are excellent, the service is excellent, but the most appealing attribute was its fantastic location being just a short walk to Waikiki Beach and even shorter (just through the parking lot) to Ala Moana Shopping Centre.Although I only stayed here for one night, I was treated with the utmost respect and friendliness.

This hotel is above value, very nice room and has been upgraded recently. The staff all are very helpful. The location is just outside of Waikiki (avoid the crowd) and it is next a very nice mall. The parking lot is huge and we can always find parking. The beach park is very close by and full of locals hanging out at the weekend. You never have to wait long for the elevator.We got a ocean view room and it is a awesome deal. The room is very clean and bright. It has a small refrigerator and Microwave. It also has a safe (free to use). Parking is $25/night.

The Ala Moana is a comfortable hotel with good enough amenities and nice views. Not at all a bad locale for a business trip or, I suppose, retail therapy as you can walk to the Ala Moana Center. The brunch, however, was less than mediocre and so I would encourage you, if you stay here, to check out the great food options at the Ala Moana Center. These will be less expensive and vastly better.

My stay was way better than expectations. Room was modern and clean with a nice soaking tub in the bathroom. Location was perfect for me - right next to a mall with a great choice of dining, from food court to up scale. Same with the shopping. Easy walk to beach and Waikiki, as well as easy bus ride back and forth - and to popular tourist sites. I really enjoyed sitting on the balcony, looking at the ocean and city lights. With pool, sauna and steam room, I had a very relaxing visit.

I wish I could have stayed at a more luxurious hotel on the beach...yeh right for about 3 times more per night, but for a really decent hotel room at a great price, this is a good choice. We did have a partial ocean view and night lights of Waikik which was really nice. The hotel employees were ALL very accommodating, friendly, and super NICE! Andrew at the front desk was especially nice and bell person Dean. A few really nice shops in the hotel too. Some of my favorite gifts I purchased were at the gift shop in the corner on the lobby level. Sorry I cannot remember the name of the shop, but the shop owner had some really lovely things like exquisite scarves, lovely teacups and teapots, jewelry; also she makes the most gorgeous faux florals for your hair and also faux floral leis - one-of-a-kind absolutely stunning and beautiful!

Spent a week in Honolulu on business and due to a pre-negotiated contract, had to stay at this hotel. It's not billed as a resort, so don't expect all the amentities you'd get at some of the places in Waikiki. The public areas are very nice. The lobby includes a tour desk, several shops, a business center (you have to pay to use the internet, copier, printer). Right outside the door is a restaurant open for breakfast only from 0630-1030. Your options are a hot buffet, cold buffet, or both. Kind of pricey, but I guess the hotel figures business travelers will be reimbursed. My room was 2002 in the Waikiki tower. Not fancy and kind of small, but since I worked all day, it wasn't a big deal. The room included a king size bed, a nice balcony with chairs, a small sofa, chair and table, a desk with a hard wire internet connection (no wi-fi), a large flat screen TV, a fridge, a microwave, closet, and small bathroom. Housekeeping is okay; one day during the week had to call the front desk since my room wasn't made up when I returned. They are also skimpy on the amount of towels you get and also the coffee. You get only one 4-cup package per day. From the 2nd floor, you can cross over to the Ala Moana Mall. On the 3rd floor, is the large pool (very nice) and a large fitness center. Towels are provided. Parking is either by valet or self-park in the garage nearby. Self parking is $20 per day. Overall good location - the beach is across the street and the Mall allows shopping and several food options.

First timer in the Ala Moana (Waikiki area) and this hotel was awesome. The staff was great, and the room was clean with a great view. I stayed int he Kona Tower, partial oceanview and the view from the lanai was spectacular. The room is small, but it's clean and have all the amenities needed.

We booked this hotel from Toronto and we were very pleased, great location we were able to walk to restaurants and shopping without any problem. Close to the cruise ship pier for us to board our ship. The staff on the front desk is not well trained.

I got the hotel on Priceline for $134. The location was very central. The place looked grand from the outside, but the room was very small. It was somewhat old and needed a facelift. We got in late at night and left early in the morning so it served it's purpose. I would have disappointed if I had booked for more than 1 night. There were no restaurants/coffee shops in the hotel. We asked about somewhere close to get a bite to eat and there was only a 7 Eleven down the street. Parking was expensive. Our kids took the car and parked at a meter on the street. We were only there about 8 hours total.

This was my 2nd time at this hotel and this time did not disappoint . Everything from check-in to check out was smooth.I was coming from another Hawaiian island for a 2 night stay. I had booked online at outrigger,com and got a good rate for the mountain tower room. I knew I would be arriving very early in the morning,and had hoped a room would be available . My flight landed around 8am and I used a shuttle service to get me to the hotel. Around 9 am i went to the front desk ,where only 1 other person was in line and was immediately greeted. I gave them my information and asked if my room was available. Well, it was not, But then i asked if any upgradeable room was and they found me one for slightly more per night,But was in the diamond tower Partial ocean view.. I check in and went up to find that it was a good room..Was handicapped accessible but a great view with balcony was good.The fridge was cold,cable worked fine, bathroom big and Queen bed ok..Nice chair and couch were available also.I used the store downstairs to buy refreshments at reasonable prices. I also used the Atm which is in a safe spot . Had breakfast at the buffet in which you had to go outside to access. The buffet was good but selection was smaller than i had anticipated. Very good with warm food and cold food. Price was reasonable also.The location is great. Across road from Ala Moana State park and the Huge mall had a connecting walkway which i used several time..I will definitely stay here again...

When we booked our room through BookIt! we were verbally guaranteed a King Sized bed and an ocean view in the Waikiki Tower. When we checked in we were notified that we booked a room in the condotel portion of the hotel and none of the hotel services would be offered. That included additional towels or sundries which were fine, but it also included any issue resolution. When we arrived at the room we were in the Waikiki Tower, we did have an ocean peek view, but we had two double beds instead of the King Bed promised. When we called down to the front desk of the hotel to address the issue the front desk staff rudely told us that they won’t help us and we needed to call the 866 number provided. It was 3:00 p.m. in Hawaii, and the 866 number is Pacific Time and the offices were closed. We remained on hold for an emergency agent who agreed to change our room for our second night, but since they were sold out was unable to help us for our first night. She also informed us that there is NO guarantee on a bed preference which means the operator that sold us the room lied to us. The room we were moved to was in the Waikiki tower, had a king size bed, but no view. I will not recommend using BookIt again, not because the customer service was bad, but because they were untruthful in their sale of the room and did not disclose that we were purchasing a condotel room and not a hotel room. In additional to that, the hotel staff was rude and unhelpful when they realize that you booked a condotel room. Those in our group who booked directly with the hotel did not have this type of experience.

My family and I recently enjoyed our spring break here at home... staycation in Waikiki with our stay at the Ala Moana Hotel for 4 nights. We were one of the lucky ones that benefited from their Superbowl Special at $37 per night. Normal rate during this time would've been around $150 per night. It's perfect for locals and visitors simply because it's centrally located and connected to Ala Moana Shopping Center for lots of food and shopping options... a huge plus in my book. Accommodations were very nice after it's recent renovation... nice, modern decor. The beach is a just a short walk away with a pool on the premises too. Although the pool is not heated and it's windy on the pool deck, taking a dip in the pool after tanning under the scorching Hawaii sun was quite refreshing. We had a nice, relaxing spring break there and would return again.

We wanted a hotel that was fairly central which would save us from having to hire a car, this was ideal, right next door to a large shopping Mall where we found a couple of good restaurants we could walk to for dinner. We walked to Waikiki, 10-15mins maximum, you could also take the bus for $2.50 each way per person, both to Waikiki or to downtown Honolu, got a shuttle service to the airport for $17 a couple. The only drawback is the rooms aren't that big but we stayed there for 4 days and would again as we were out exploring most of the time

We stayed for a week and chose the Kona tower. No need to pay extra for the view.. when we expected to be gone alot, after all we didn't come for the room. The room was on the small side but we got a microwave and fridge plus a couch which could make into a bed. A desk, arm chair and bed completed the room.. basic but clean. It was very convenient to shopping, bus routes and a small walk to Waikiki. We didn't use the beaches in Waikiki or even shop there.. way over priced! In fact the beaches are better in the North. We were pleased with the staff and used the hospitality room free of charge which was wonderful! Great pool area with a garden lanai for guest use. It was off season so the cost was about $129 per night .. well worth the price!

I was in Honolulu on business and didn't really have a choice where to stay. This was a quirky hotel, my bathroom was bigger than my room! I had a nice balcony room overlooking the ocean but if you looked straight down you have a nice view of the mall and Macy's. The area around the hotel is somewhat sketchy but I never felt threatened. If you are working at the convention center, this is a great hotel as it is only two blocks away. One downfall is that you have to put your key in the elevator slot about 20 times before it works.

I found the staff very rude. Housekeeping ladies were nice, but that is as far as it went. Front desk agents were very rude, as far as cutting me off while I was speaking to say " what exactly did you need". My cell phone was stolen from my purse right out in the common area, and the staff was utterly unconcerned. Especially the lady at the bellhop desk. She was perhaps the rudest of all. There were alarm sirens going off in the hotel, which we were told was a false alarm when we asked, when actually it was a fire on the 3rd floor. The ladies in the gift shop, and the expedia lady in the lobby were also kind and helpful.....however, they don't work for the hotel. My husband is native Hawaiian and of all his family and friends over there that I have met, I was expecting great hospitality on this one trip hr didn't come along on. I wanted to show my friend a great Hawaiian experience, and doubt she will even return...no aloha , no mahalo.. No please or even you're welcome. Rude rude rude. We live in a tourist based town also, but know to be nice to who visits our town.
user_name:
Amber C
Lincoln City, Oregon, United States

review_body: The hotel was pretty much average. We paid 700 for 2 nights. I kind of feel we could have gotten a bit more for the buck if we had stayed somewhere else (meaning a bigger room better accomidations ect). Overall though the hotel was pretty nice the view was amazing and also being located next to the biggest mall in the islands was extremely nice.

Loved The Stay Here! Room is nice, just a little small, but doesn't really matter if you aren't spending much time in it. The view was great from the 11th floor, room is clean and has a microwave, fridge and coffee maker. Housekeeping services were great too. Location is Duh-Bomb. Right at Ala Moana shopping center, short walk to Waikiki center and short walk to beach and park...good exercise! Price is right and will come back here again!

Very convenient, especially if you don't mind a 15 or 20 minute walk to the beach. The staff was courteous and helpful, especially the valets. The adjoining shopping mall has everything you could need, including many restaurants. Although we didn't use it, the hotel has a nice feature for travelers flying out late in the evening. They offered us a "hospitality room" to come back and use for showering and/or changing clothes prior to heading for the airport. The room was nice and offered a great view of the Waikiki area. We would stay there again.

The Ala Moana Hotel is so convenient! It has been renovated and I found it to be quiet and clean. I was happy to have a coffee maker and a fridge in my room. My room was clean and quiet. I stayed in the Kona tower - elevators are toasted the back of the hotel.There are a few restaurants in the hotel but no problem! There is a walkway that is connected the largest shopping center with everything that might need. Longs Drugs for your toiletries, snacks for your room, lots of great eateries- you have to try the local cuisine! If you are lucky you might even catch some free entertainment at the center stage.I personally grab snacks for my room and a nice take out meal from the many eateries, food court or Shirokiya (Japanese dept. Store with fresh food- it's next to Macy's on the way back to the hotel) drop off my snacks in the room, then walk across the street to the Ala Moana beach park and find a nice place to sit and eat my meal and watch the sun set. Can't get any better..!

Hotel has 2 towers-Waikiki and Kona tower. Waikiki Tower rooms seem to be a little larger although rooms are not big. Stay on a higher floor or it could be noisy. Excellent location for shopping at Ala Moana Center (just walk out the 2nd floor exit to center). Also across from Ala Moana Beach Park which is nice for a run or picnic. Hotel is about 4 short blocks from the hub-bub of Waikiki and about 8 blocks to downtown Honolulu, fairly EZ access to free ways too. Valet Parking at $25 is high and not included in the room. No great restaurant in hotel but for business I like the central location verses being in Waikiki where you have to contend with traffic. Oh, one other thing-you get free internet service with your room, but it doesn't work for an IPAD - had to do that in the lobby.

I stayed there back in January. the hotel / condos / time share is nice. while it's not close to the beach and it will be a walk to get there... the Mall next to it is connected to the hotel which is nice. Having the Mall next to the hotel is great if your a business traveler because you have plenty of options on where to dine at. The Staff was very friendly and the room where average and acquitted. see the attached pics for view from my room. The only bad thing that I can say about my stay there was the Hotel charges you $20 a night to park your vehicle in their downstairs parking lot... I feel if they are charging you for the room then it should also include free parking. The other bad thing is they charge you .75 cents for local calls...c'mon now...

Stayed in the Waikiki tower for 6 nights on the 24 th floor with a view of Harbour and ocean from nice lanai The room was decent size with a king size bed,microwave, coffee maker and dorm fridge. Bathroom was small. Easy access to shopping and dining at the shopping center. Pool was fine but a 10 minute walk to beach park. Catch public bus #8 into all parts of Waikiki. Probably not the best choice for first time visitors because of location away from Waikiki beach.

We went to Oahu for the week-end and spent 2 nights at the hotel. The rooms are tiny and over furnished and the bed is so so small (full size only).The positive side are the amenities : coffee maker, microwave, safety box and small fridge inside the room. Could not sleep because of the noise from people walking in the middle of the night. The front desk not so welcoming. Did not greet us and when I called the front desk, the lady was laughing and talking to a friend while answering the phone.Expensive ($120 per night) for what you get.

We had an unexpected stay at the Ala Moan Hotel because we were bumped from our flight home so Delta put us up here one night. It turned out to be a pleasant surprise. Reception wasn't overly enthusiastic, but the girl warmed up once we pried her out of her shell. Not sure how long it has been since the hotel got a major facelift, but it looks very nice and clean with a bright and airy feel. Had a room on the 28th floor with a fabulous view over the city and to the oceanfront. Every room seems to have a balcony. Ours was ample in size with a table and 2 chairs. The room was on the small size, but certainly acceptable for 2 people. There were 2 double beds, comfortable (although the pillows were on the thick side which I find a tad bit uncomfy, but that's my personal preference). There was a wall a/c unit, but we did not use it. There was not much hall noise although you could hear the occasional door open/shut. The bathroom was very bright and clean. It came with a blow dryer in a drawer with a note to let you know it was stashed away. Soap and shampoo were also provided in the usual sample size. The shower/tub was clean and the water pressure was fine.A med size refrigerator that can store plenty of items is under a counter, along with a microwave and coffee maker. A small closet had a ironing board/iron. There was a cable in the room to connect with your laptop since the wifi only works in the lobby. The front desk will provide you with the password for the wifi. The Plantation Restaurant located outside at the entrance to the hotel is where we ate breakfast. We only ate there because we had meal vouchers, otherwise it is a very expensive b'fast. The continental b'fast is $13; that gets you fruit, yogurt, cereals, and breads. The fruit and yogurt "bar" were the only thing of note for me on the continental bar. The full buffet will cost another 5 bucks bringing it up to $18. For that you get hot items like eggs, bacon, etc. There was no outdoor or open air dining that we were aware of, and the air conditioned interior was torturous for early morning. We could not wait to get out of the dining room because we were so uncomfortable with the freezing temps. The elevators were very fast and we never had to wait long for one. From the second floor we could easily access walking over to the Ala Moana Mall. We looked at the fitness room, but did not use it. There were loads of equipment choices, a sauna, and steam room. The pool was on the small size, but the area looked fine. We saw it at night and it was roped off since it was closed. We had dinner at Yuzu, a Japanese restaurant tucked away in a back corner of the hotel. It was delicious.Overall our one night stay was a pleasant experience.
The rooms are acceptable. The location is good for the Convention Center but not near Waikiki. The price was appropriate.
We were lucky and got a room in the Waikiki Tower with a great view over the Marina. I LOVED being able to get out of the lift and literally roll into the mall!

booked Ala Moana Hotel through Luxury Intl Suites, what a mistake...needed janitor to get elevator to work and key to get into room, noisy room Friday/Saturday nights as night club sound/music vibrates through walls, we where on the seventh floor, dirty carpet, small bed, said queen size probably a double, marginal mattress, patio door broken would not lock so much for security, bathroom shower tub with rust stains, dirty soap bar holder, towels worn out, no in room safe, air conditioner barely operational, pool deck loose material, pool not heated, housekeeping two children tasked with cleaning the room!!

This place is a nightmare!! booking was made through Luxury Suites (not so luxurious at all- it turns out the Ala Moana don't even own the room I booked, shame on you Agoda!!) which means that housekeeping went home at 4pm every day and Ala Moana staff refused to help me with anything that went wrong!! Firstly, my booking was not found for 2 hours, bed was full of hair and sheets were stained with large yellow marks. I had to make a phone call to luxury suiteds every time I needed something but after 4pm - good luck getting it!! Spoke to a service attend with LS to complain about hair and he basically told me to "get over it, it's not that bad, it wont kill you it's just a little hair". How rude! I had to sleep in the filth for the first night and got bed bug bites - still have the rash - disgusting!!Furthermore, there was no safe in the room and there were hairballs behind the door and dead flies in the closet as soon as I got there - absolutley disgusting!!!To top this all off, the location is so far from everything, felt like I was in the Bronx, not Hawaii - especially for a solo traveller at night - I felt very unsafe returning to the hotel alone.Rooms were tiny and Ala Moana staff were of the rudest people I met in all of Hawaii!In the end I complained to the VIP manager of Luxury suites and happily refunded the first night - still have the horror story though. Stay away from Ala Moana.

We have stayed here two times and feel it is a very nice hotel, especially for the price. Clean comfortable and good location. We liked it far better than the Waikiki Marriott and it was much less expensive.

As a Travel Consultant and owner of Blue Compass Global Travel, I scheduled an on site inspection for the Ala Moana Holel. I met with the Sales Manager and toured the property.The hotel is an Outrigger property, and it lives up to the exceptional customer service the the Outrigger properties are known for. The rooms are clean and the overall property is well maintained. The staff and personnel were very friendly. If you want to workout, they have new gym equipment. And if you want to going shopping, the Ala Moana Mall is right next door.

The Ala Moana Hotel is perfect for the budget conscious traveler that likes shopping. Our room was adequate and clean which is pretty much all I ask for since when we are in Honolulu we just need a place to sleep at night. The thing that compelled me to write my first review here was the great customer service I received from Heide at the front desk. It's the little things that make a difference, and her attitude and helpfulness changed my day which was getting off to a bad start to a terrific one. It's not just the place it's the people! Thanks for a great stay.

The Ala Moana is a reasonably priced hotel in a convenient location for people interested in spending time in Waikiki and engage in retail therapy at the near-by mall (although generally the prices at the mall are quite high). The rooms are clean and comfortable. The staff is polite, if somewhat overworked. The Plantation Cafe is nearby, but I cannot recommend its breakfast buffet which tends to include a good deal of food of indifferent quality. Request a room high up in the tower if you want to get away from the street noise.

Stayed here for a week w/colleagues while working for our client. It's a large & very busy hotel that is not only used for flight crews, but also apparently the hotel of choice for those coming & going on the cruise ships-could not believe the mountain of luggage piled behind the bell stand. This also explains why our rooms were not available when we arrived. There are no connecting rooms in this hotel & no wi-fi in the rooms, only wired internet-this proved to be problematic when trying to work in the evenings. Was pleasantly surprised by the bathroom-though small, it was nicely done w/a large marble counter & under mount sink. This is the first hotel where towels hung on the towel rack in the bathroom were actually NOT replaced every day, which I truly appreciated. The guestroom pictures on the hotel website show very small wall-mounted tvs, but those have been replaced w/large flat panel models sitting on the desks. Beds are not the greatest (I'm a hotel bed snob, I'll admit!) but they are not the worst I've slept on-getting rid of the ugly old green flowered bedspread for the duration helped, as did bringing my own pillow. We were on the 23rd floor overlooking the marina, Diamond Head (or at least a slice of it that could be seen between 2 buildings!) & the mountains to our left, so no complaints there. The Plantation Cafe is only open for breakfast & that is buffet only. While it's a pretty extensive buffet w/different hot egg choices every day, it was still a bit pricey at $16/person. As others have pointed out, the hotel is connected by walk-way to the Ala Moana hotel & there are numerous food options there for dinner. No bill under the door on the day of check-out which meant a stop at the front desk-fortunately, it was early enough that there was no one else down there. Depending on your individual needs, the hotel may suite perfectly, however, we are heading back in 3 days to spend nearly 2 weeks w/the same client & have asked to stay elsewhere primarily because of the lack of connecting rooms & no wi-fi in the rooms issue.
My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay in a condo at the Ala Moana Hotel. The room,view,and atmosphere were superb. We would highly recommend it. SWe would stay there again,John Raynor

We stayed one week and the hotel proved to be a reasonable choice. The rooms are small, but clean; people are nice. The breakfast (not included in our rate, admittedly quite a low one for the city and the place) had some awful (potatoes) and some excellent (omelettes) stuff, and all the rest of the food ranged everywhere in between. It's not a 5-star hotel but definitely above motels. The location is great, close to rental cars and the bus system. A definitive plus is to be out of the Waikiki area, one of the worst tourist traps I've ever seen and the last place in the island to visit: the park in front of the hotel is orders of magnitude more beautiful than the cramped, noisy and filthy Waikiki beach. Overall, a good choice.

The Ala Moana hotel is located right next door to the Ala Moana shopping center (which is fantastic!). That said, that is the only advantage to this hotel. Our room was consistently dirty, the room attendant barely cleaned anything and didn't change any sheets or towels, and the rooms were pretty small. The bed was uncomfortable as well. We did have a sliding door in the room, but no balcony, and our view overlooked a parking lot. I would not stay here again. Next time, I'll go for a hotel on Waikiki.

After unexpectedly having to come to Honolulu for a night, we made a reservation at the Ala Moana. From the minute I walked Into the room I was disappointed. The room size was dormitory like at best. The "blanket" was thin and just felt dirty. With the suitcase still in my hand I called house keeping to inquire about a down blanket to which I was told there were none. After an exhausting day, I crammed myself I to the ti y bathroom only to once again contact housekeeping to ask for conditioner. Once again- I was told there was none to be found.Really? To pay this much money and for the hotel to not have a basic ame ity such as conditioner is unacceptable. If I were staying at a motel, that may fly. To charge what they do, and rate themselves as they do and have,ess than the basics? Not cool.

Hawaii is not the paradise one might think. We had are car broke into the Ala Moana shopping center parking lot. I know people take the info they receive from Trip Adviser with a grain of salt. BUT please check out the Honolulu police crime map on goggle that will tell you everything.I hope you have a better trip then we did

The room was very small and I felt like I was in a dormitory. The queen bed was more like a full and the pillows were flat like pancakes. For $138/day for the room, $25/day valet parking or $20/day self parking (self parking upon availability). I definitely overpaid. The woman at the front desk was snotty and rude. Rushed the check-in process. It surprised us because we are Kama'aina (locals). It appears the Aloha spirit was nonexistent with this person in particular. But I guess we all have our bad days. I would not recommend staying there. There are many other options.

I stayed in this hotel for the second & hopefully last time. This was my 2nd trip to HNL to run the marathon, and unfortunately, this hotel is the closest to the start line. So, unless you want to wake up @ 2:30 a.m. to take a shuttle, or walk a county mile to get to the start line, this was the best option. After my last marathon experience @ this hotel I thought I would be smart & check in Friday to hopefully avoid any issues. This didn't work out well either. We had a late flight over from the mainland, so by the time we arrived at the hotel all I wanted to do was crawl into my bed & go to sleep! Check in went pretty quickly & I was given my keys & up the elevator we went. I had booked & paid for an "oceanview" room, and when I got to the room it was on a very low floor, at the end of the hall directly over the night club with a view of a building & alley! This was the "oceanview" room I had paid for? By this time it is 11:30 p.m. We toted our luggage back downstairs & waited in line AGAIN! I pulled out my confirmaiton sheet which clearly showed an "oceanveiw" room. The CSR went back into a room for several minutes & came back out. She asked if I would consider a city view suite instead! I explained as calmly as I could that I had booked & paid for an "oceanview", and the main reason was because these rooms were on higher floors away from noise. She went back into her room again & after another several minutes finally came out & agreed to give me the "oceanview" room that I had paid for! Considering I had to be in bed @ 7 p.m. Saturday night to get up @ 3 a.m. for the Marathon on Sunday, it was pretty important that I get to bed at a decent time Friday night. Needless to say, after the hour + I spent dealing wiht the room issue, I finally unlocked the key to my room @ 12:20 a.m.! Two stays at this hotel & two bad experiences. Additionally, we found this hotel to be very overpriced for what you get. We paid the same for an oceanview room a stones throw from the beach down by the zoo. Much quieter location, way closer to the beach, & a much nicer hotel as well.

This hotel is located next to the shopping center. As you enter the lobby it is very inviting. They totaly cater to the Japanese & white people. If you are a local resident you may feel out of place. The rooms are small but comfortable. It had a queen size bed, love seat, chair, desk, microwave was a plus, mini fridge & a small bathroom. Parking is a nightmare $25 to Valet & $20 per day self park. I'm glad I was there for 2 days. The nehghbors were noisy.

We stayed here for business at the convention center. The hotel was only adequate because we didn't have to spend much time there. We would not book this hotel again.Pros:Very close to convention centerFriendly check in and bell staffAdjoined to shopping mall parking lot if you are wanting to shopCons:Tiny beds (smaller than doubles)Very cheap mattressesOld bed linensPool is very small, cold and pool area isn't pretty at allFriend found bed bug (saw the picture) although after much checking, there were not any in our room

I stayed at the Ala Moana Hotel for New Years Eve & it was a pleasant experience. The Hotel is very large- over 1000 rooms divided into two towers. The Kona & Waikiki . I was in the Waikiki tower which had the larger rooms. I will say however the room was not very large but very clean with a nice balcony view. The hotel is connected to the Ala Moana shopping mall which is very convenient. Many airline personal stay at this hotel as I saw several flight attendants & Pilots there. The room was clean, quiet & modern. Although as stated previously it was small. The bus stops are convenient to the hotel also. I did not rent a car so I can't speak for the Parking. My one big complaint was the checkout line was very long so I had to use the express checkout. You fill out a form & drop the keys into a box. I was thankful they had this as my ride was waiting & there was no way to wait in that line. All in all it is a nice hotel with very few quirks. My biggest thing was the room size. However the overall stay was nice,

Stayed here for business and overall rating is "okay" but not much else. The hotel is within walking distance of the convention center, so if you need to be there early in the morning it can be quite convenient. On the other hand there are no real restaurants, bars or coffee shops near by. It is a bit of a desolate area. The one close facility is a very nice open air mall which is also just beside the hotel. You'll have to go here for anything from a quick coffee (no coffee shop or continuously serving restaurant in the hotel) to a sandwich to a drink at the end of the day. The hotel says that it has a poolside bar - that's not true. They've closed the poolside bar and do not allow any alcohol on the poolside deck. There is a bar downstairs in the hotel but it was closed during the week - only open on Friday and Saturday as far as I can recall. We came back on Monday night at 10 pm looking to have a beer to close out the night and since the hotel bar was closed we had no other options. A few other things - if you have an ipad or mac air - i.e. a device without an ethernet port, you will not be able to connect to the internet in your room. there is no wifi throughout the hotel - only on the first three floors. the business center is also a total scam - $0.25 a minute for internet, $0.40/page to print or fax. believe me, it adds up pretty fast. for the price that you pay for the hotel, you'd think that they could provide free internet access and at least let you print your boarding pass for free. Finally, cleanliness - I rated it as poor because there was a short and curly hair in my sheets when I checked in and the mirror had clearly not been cleaned for at least a few guests before me. Not cool. There was also apparently a bedbug found in one of the rooms - that said, I checked carefully and did not see any signs of bedbugs in my room and I understand that management was dealing with the issue. In sum, if you absolutely need to be near the convention center this hotel is fine but nothing special. Otherwise, find somewhere better in Honolulu (or better yet - go to a different island. Honolulu was a huge disappointment.).
user_name:
JEPCda
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: This is an ok hotel. Location nearer to the airport and Ala Moana Shopping Mall.Unfortunately the hotel rooms have really loud slamming doors. Every time someone goes in/out of the room the door slams hard. The slamming started about 6am each morning.Flights for the mainland leave early and other guests were really noisy as they left. This isn't the hotel's fault but they could easily put signs up and down the hallway with something like "Quiet Zone - Guests Sleeping".

We were there for this year's Honolulu Marathon... my wife's second marathon! We asked the hotel for a late checkout, beyond 12:00, but they refused.
