Concerned about getting back in time to check out of the room, I made the mistake of putting our luggage in the trunk of our rental car which was parked at the hotel garage. When we got back to the car after the marathon, all of our luggage had been stolen! The garage is open to anybody walking through off the street... bad for security! Bottom line, do not assume your belongings are safe in your car parked at the hotel. We hope this review will save someone from going through the nightmare we did!

We stayed in a 1 bedroom condo in this hotel in Nov. 2011 for 10 days. Got it through VRBO. On 20th floor with full ocean views. Great size, great amenities and fantastic location. Loved being just on the edge of Waikiki without being in the middle of the madness. And the Ala Moana Beach Park is a short walk away and lovely and peaceful. Rented a car 2 separate days to see the island but did not need it otherwise (therefore no expensive parking fees!) The Aloha Bus was really awesome for 2 days. Go to Groupon and other coupon sites before your trip to get deals on recreation and meals. We loved the Island Magic Catamaran Snorkel trip. Walked to this ship in 20 minutes from the Ala Moana hotel. Swam with turtles for about an hour plus diver brought up an octopus to touch! Then dolphins surrounded our boat as we sailed away - amazing! Great trip with 2 boys aged 9 and 11. Think they would have been bored on Maui or other more secluded Hawaiian Island.

Three day stay. Poorest value ever received compared to any previous stay in a hotelor motel. Badly overproced for small room, [with "view" of a rooftop] really dingy bathroom, and fixtures befitting a flop-house.Beautiful lobby, but with terrible room, who cares?On our last morning in Honolulu, we looked at a hotel right next door, bigger room, nicerroom, and about 1/2 the price Repeat: POOR value.
user_name:
LBernstein702
Las Vegas, Nevada, United States

review_body: My sister and I stayed in private unit through Hawaii 50. Somewhat small but great lanai with wonderful views. Very convenient to Walmart, Ala Moana Mall, and city transportation. Unit 3211 clean, perfect for 2 people. Easy walk to beach. Service was great. If you have to go on a budget I would recommend this room. If you can afford to stay closer to Waikiki Beach I think it would be worth the extra money.
user_name:
Gina S
Lawrenceville, Illinois, United States

review_body: I came to surprise my parents and was staying in Waikiki, when a friend of mine told me that I could get a Kama'aina rate for $99. Sounded pretty good and the property had been remodeled so I thought, why not try something different. I looked at the different rooms on their website and decided on a city/mountain view in the Waikiki Tower. I was able to check in early, 12:30, and was given room 1727. The room was much smaller than the one I had at the Ilima. There was a small fridge, microwave, and coffee machine, but only coffee mugs and a couple of glasses. I thought this was a little odd considering you had what you needed to make a small meal or snack, but nothing to eat it with or on. Luckily the mall is close by and I bought a small bowl and Chinese soup spoon. I didn't care for the configurations in the room. The t.v. was on the desk, and I guess someone stole the actual remote because there was this other hook-up and I couldn't use the timer. It sits on the desk, so if I used my computer, I had to sit right next to the t.v. The closet was also very small, so not much storage there. These were my issues with the room.However, the view from the lanai was great! It was much noisier than the Ilima, but it felt much more modern. I never used the AC because there was a great breeze blowing, and one night I even left the sliding door open. The bed was comfy and I liked the long hallway from the door to the room. I didn't really hear anyone, except when people would let their doors slam shut, which I feel is such a rude thing to do. The gym was nicely laid out and adequate. I liked being close to Ala Moana Park! I walked/jogged there every morning. Parking was $20 but at least I was guaranteed a spot every night I came in. The staff was great! Everyone I encountered was courteous and friendly. I did sit in the lobby one day just to observe the other guests. It's my opinion that some really felt entitled, so it's no wonder they may feel indifferent to the property. I liked walking over to the mall. There are quite a few stores and shops within walking distance. As you can see from the pictures, it's a decent room and the property is centrally located. This is the first time I've stayed somewhere outside of Waikiki and I'm glad I did. Some of those issues I mentioned aside, I would consider staying here again, perhaps staying in a larger room with an ocean view. I think the best thing anyone can do is ask what exactly they want out of their trip and do the research. I was torn between 3 and 4 stars, but I did enjoy my stay, so I bumped it up.

The interesting thing about this hotel is that the staff is very nice, the hotel is very presentable. It is located very conveniently to Ala Moana Beach and Ala Moana Shopping Mall, although it would be easy to find a better hotel and take the $2 shuttle trolley to shopping.There are several floors of privately owned condo/apartments. There apparently is some rub between the hotel and the private owners.Alcohol is prohibited in public spaces, forbidden in the pool area, although the rules do not indicate that. The rules state "no outside beverages allowed", this is supposed to say "NO ALCOHOL ALLOWED". I would advocate staying at another location if you want to relax with cocktails and friends in a pool resort environment.The exercise room and steam and sauna rooms are quite modern and very nice. There is a store in the hotel that is pretty well stocked with most necessities.A large grocery store is only two blocks away.Walmart is 5 blocks away.I won't be staying here again.

West jet put up 120 plus passengers after canceling flight dec.23rd, 2011. First room very, very small and smelled like old cigar smoke, stale, dirty carpet, hot, air conditioner not working. Advised front desk not acceptable, after much discussion they provided a slightly larger room, stinks like urine in room, air conditioner works really well blowing warm air, pillows stink like last person that slept on them, carpet is filthy . Thank you west jet. Never ever again will I stay at this dump or fly west jet again. Horrible treatment and worse room. Thanks for the great Christmas memory that I will never forget. P.h.

Just an average room. Clean. Soaps and shampoos below average, bring your own. Nice gym for a hotel. Next to a very nice mall. Here on a work trip, so it's fine, but don't book your dream Hawaiian vacation here. Too far from the ocean, far from a resort feel.

My teenage daughter and I stayed here last week for 4 nights. We chose this hotel solely for ONE reason - its proximity to the Ala Moana Shopping Mall, and as such - it was adequate. I really can't see any other reason to pick this hotel, as there are much nicer ones closer to Waikiki. Seeing as the Mall was the reason for choosing the hotel, we stayed in the Kona Tower, whose rooms are cheaper than the Waikiki Tower. Room was very small, outlook was not great, but we didn't have high expectations to begin with.Good: Location near the Mall; bathrooms seem new-ish, good fridge and microwave; 2 self serve laundromats (if a little pricy compared to other hotels we stayed at during our trip)Bad: Attitude of staff (never ever got a greeting from any of the bellhops or front doormen); long queues to check in and out; bad plumbing in bathroom (have seen this in other reviews) - the bath does not drain so it's kind of gross showering in your own dirty water that is accumulating and not going down the plug hole; housekeeping is lackadaisical at best (one day our bathroom got wiped down but bed was never made!); not all the gym equipment was working.Having said all that - we had a great time there..... Just as long as you know from the outset to expect a 2-3 star hotel - you won't be disappointed!

If the only reason you are going to Hawaii is to shop in an over-priced and overcrowded mall, this hotel might be okay for you. The lobby area is nice enough but the rooms are small and can have the most terrible outlook onto a dirty car garage. If you book the most expensive rooms in the hotel, you will have a better experience, but if you book on priceline, or request a standard room, you will definitely feel you are in a 2 star hotel. The pool is small and the beds are not that comfortable.On arriving, I had to immediately upgrade at an additional expense just to get something half decent.

Stayed here during the APEC, and while their rooms were not that big, the front desk and hotel staff was on their A-game. I have no complaints about the staff from the front desk to the parking attendant. We were able to get a late(r) check out, get beach towels after hours, put our bags on baggage hold, package our artwork we bought into flat portfolios, the list goes on and on. At every turn the staff here had everything we needed; our check in and check out was seamless and the staff was more than willing to help. The location here is superb - right next to the Ala Moana Center which has everything and anything you could possibly need. There are also restaurants nearby open late where you can get a bite to eat easily. The hotel is also walking distance from Waikiki so everything is at your fingertips - literally! Highly recommend.

This hotel has so many ready-made guests--tour groups and airline personnel--that it counts on the tour guides and airline travel arrangers to accommodate those guests, but if you are on your own just wanting some r&r, don't count on the front desk people to show you any "Aloha spirit." They don't smile; they don't greet you; they treat you like just another one of the multitudes. 1) I asked for a quiet room, and was given one right across from the elevators. 2) Although I had made a reservation for three nights, they gave me an elevator card key (Yes, you cannot get to your floor without a card key that a guest needs to slip into the elevator panel.) that functioned for one night. Then I had to go back to the front desk the next day to get another elevator card key when I was questioned by the front desk person about my identity, whether I had extended my original reservation (no!), and a few other questions as if I didn't belong at the hotel as a guest. 3) During the second night at around 3 a.m. an EXTREMELY LOUD ALARM went off in the room. I tried unplugging the clock radio thinking that the alarm was inadvertently set (It was not.) I went around the room looking for the origin of the sound, saw a flashing light on the telephone panel which by this point looked and sounded like it was going to explode, and starting pressing buttons, and finding got the telephone to remain quiet. I phoned the front desk to ask if there had been a false alarm, talked to the manager about being awakened by the LOUD ALARM, and all he did was to say "Sorry." A better hotel would have at least given me a complimentary breakfast or drink for the lack of sleep that night.The only good thing about this hotel is that it's close to the shopping center and has ample parking. I'm not sure if that would bring me back to this hotel.

My friend and I stayed here for 2 nights for 2 solid shopping days at the Ala Moana Shopping Center after the Maui trip. I highly recommend this hotel to the people who love shoping like us. The buses are easy to catch if you want to go to other places around the city. But if you are more keen to city sightseeing and experiencing the resort sort of things, you should not consider this hotel. My friend and I booked a standard room with a queen bed and a sofa bed. The room is just right for a couple but is little too small for my friend and I (and we are small), especially when the sofa bed is unfolded. I wouldn't recommend this room for the couple who are travelling with kid(s).

We've stayed here on several occasions when driving back to the Windward side wasn't a good idea (after one too many bottles of wine at BYOB dinners). You can't beat the $119 per night rate for a room that's walking distance to Ala Moana Shopping Center and just on the outskirts of Waikiki with clean rooms that have in-room safes, refrigerators (for saving doggie bags at said BYOB dinners), coffee makers and complimentary cabled internet. We'll be back at the next BYOB dinner.

it's been a few years since i've been back but i knew i wanted Ala Moana hotel. I was there for the Apec meeting last week. I looked up my old posting to see what room i stayed in. When i checked-in i asked to see if 3221 was available and it was. First thing i notice is that they went away from the modern bed spreads of the tan/ white theme to the more tropical bed spread. No big deal. Then, to my surprise the mircowave was still there. The other couple we were traveling with didn't have a microwave in their room so i wasn't going to say anything. The best thing that didn't change was the view. I paid for the ocean view but being that the room is so high, i get the mountain view and city view w/ the top part of diamond head also. Also, as nice as it is to sit on the deck, i enjoyed lying on the bed and seeing the ocean. That is an extreme plus. House cleaning was fast and accommodating when asking for more towels. Even the pool attendant told us to take the towels with us to the beach and just exchange them everyday. Definitely going to stay here next year when i go back oh forgot to mention the wife went to the mall alot. Being that the hotel is connected to it, is a big plus

Located near a beach and next door to the huge Ala Moana Shopping Center for shopping and dining, one can't beat the location of this hotel. The rooms are clean and comfy but, sadly, not sound-proof enough. I found it difficult to sleep when the television is on in the next room. Also, the WiFi which was available only in the lobby, 2nd and 3rd floors and the pool, did not work well. I had to go to Starbucks or Barnes and Noble at Ala Moana to receive and send email. The hotel charges for the use of computers ($0.30/minute) and printers in the lobby. On our second night, we were disturbed in our sleep by security asking for identification. I demanded to see the manager for an explanation. Due to a clerical error, my name was registered in the wrong room. I said my key card would not have fit if I were in the wrong room. As a gesture of apology, they upgraded me to a room with a nice view and authorized a late checkout. Much appreciated but the television next door was still audible. So bring some ear plugs.

After staying in Waikiki on the beach it was a bit of a shock to be moved to here. Our room was very small with no balcony & looked onto another building. The bed was a double. The room 646 was clean & the bathroom was nice. The facilities at this hotel are very limited there is no bar & you are not allowed "labels" by the pool. Pool area is large & they have a good size gym. The chinese restaurant won't seat couples so you have to eat in your room. Right next door to shopping centre but the walk to the beach/Waikiki would get a bit tiresome after a few days. If you are after the beach I wouldn't stay here.

I recently stayed in this unit for three nights and what a pleasant suprise. The unit was immacuate and I wanted for nothing while I was there. The view was not great but I was not in Hawaii to stay in the room afterall. The main thing was the owner of the unit stayed in constant contact me as I had some issues regarding the booking and had to travel on my own due to a family illness. Chris was understanding and went above and beyond to ensure I was pleased. The pool area was clean and well kept and the public areas overall were clean and well maintained. The bell and valet staff also added a personal touch and the concierge added that extra touch of personal service. All the front office staff were friendly and accomodating as well. I would highly recommend this unit as a great starting point for Honolulu.

Nothing really special about this hotel. Rooms are small and restaurants in hotel are so-so. Plantation Restaurant in Hotel is ok for breakfast, but you will drop $20.00 on the buffet with tax and tip. Prices in hotel are typically high. Wal-Mart is 10 minute walk and has trinkets at about half the price of other places. Food at Blazin Steaks on Atkinson Blvd is great, with a good variety and nice staff (walk out of the front hotel entrance, turn left, and walk 1 1/2 blocks on the left). 7-11 is next to Blazin Steaks. Mall is located beside hotel with a walkway off 2nd level (near pool). Mall has a lot of stores, but is configured oddly Easy to get lost, and is not the typical mall configuration. 4th level has Ruby Tuesdays, Bubba Gump's, Outback, Macaroni Grill, and a few other nice restaurants./

Twelve (12) day stay (20OCT11-02NOV11). Was very impressed with this hotel. Stayed in Waikiki Tower. Room was clean and very adequate. Used the valet parking two nights and ate the delicious breakfast buffet at the Plantation Restaurant 8 mornings. Staff was very pleasant from front desk, maids, security and bellman. My son misplaced his DS 3D and it had been found and turned in to security. Once we identified it we received it from security. The BEST vacation we have ever had and alot of it was because of the GREAT Hotel. We never experienced any problems and all our needs were met and exceeded our expectations.
user_name:
Teresa C
Indianapolis, Indiana, United States

review_body: We waited forever for check-in; toilet had a HUGE hairball in it (obviously it had not been cleaned!) and the waste basket had stuff from the previous resident...we changed rooms - that room had dirty towels...."What else came with the room?" was our thought for the rest of the stay. No appropriate apology from customer service or in response to the exit questionaire paperwork. Perhaps they threw it away?

This is a great location with a great view of the ocean. The Ala Moana shopping centre is next door with over 260 stores. Close walking distance to the overcrowded Waikiki BeachWe would sure stay here again. Do not get a small room on the side of the building. Get i suites on the southwest end of the building near Maceys

If you are looking to visit Honolulu on a budget, but don't want to stuck in a dump, the Ala Moana will not disappoint.I had a room in the Kona Tower. It was an efficient size room, similar to something you may find in Europe. It is furnished in a contemporary style, has a nice work desk, and sufficient Internet speed.I was here on business and the location was perfect for that purpose. No, it is not on the beach or very close to the beach for that matter, but you can get there from here. One tip: When the front desk tells you your room in in the Kona tower, and directs you to the Kona Elevators, you can ignore them. Take the Waikiki Tower elevators and then take two lefts out of the elevator lobby on your floor. it will save you a long walk with your luggage.I rank the hotel somewhere between a Quality Inn and a Marriott.

My wife and I stayed at the large, 2-bedroom/2.5 bath suite for 8 days in October 2011 with our toddler and our nanny. We made our reservations via VRBO: easy and no problems. We were attending a conference at the Hawaii Conference center, less than a block away. Our toddler and nanny went daily to the Ala Moana beach, one of the most kid-friendly beaches on Oahu; with toddler in tow, it was about a 10 min. walk to the beach: one block, across an intersection, and then park the rest of the way. There is a causeway on the second floor of Ala Moana Hotel to the massive mall next door; extremely easy to access. The mall has a huge food court, many other food services, and a full grocery store. We took out a couple of nights and cooked in a couple of nights. The suite's kitchen has plenty of supplies for cooking, including pots and pans and dishes. The suite was very roomy, with plenty of area to spread out. The views from the 33rd floor are amazing: at night, we left the drapes open to admire the night lights. The hotel's pool was well kept and safe. The fitness center had plenty of space, tons of machines, and a full set of dumb bells: was never busy. Overall, an excellent facility that I would highly recommend.

We go to Honolulu twice a year and we always stay in the Ala Moana Hotel. It is the best location. It is near the convention center, you can walk a couple of blocks past the Ala Wai canal and walk to Waikiki. If you have 24 Hour Fitness membership they are 2 blocks away. The hotel also has a gym that is used a lot. The Ala Moana shopping mall is next to the hotel with every shop you could ever want to go to. If you are using the public transportation, there are many buses that stop at the mall.

We went back to this hotel as I had stayed there many times before. When booking I unfortunately managed to book "Ala Moana by LSI". That is an owner's condo organised by Luxury Suites International. The room was in the "service tower" it was very small and lacke basic amenities. The hotel staff were rude and ambivalent toward us when they knew that we with LSI and we were denied some of the bsic facilities one would expect in any hotel. Any problems with the room and you need to call a mainland US number but only during limited hours. There was no indication of any local support for guest. I suggest that Ala Moana by LSI is an inferior product - beware.

Demographics of reviewer: 55-year-old male; health-care professional; intercontinental travels with spouse monthly for business/pleasure. The hotel's location is one of the best in Honolulu: about a mile's walk to Waikiki beach; a third of a mile to Ala Moana Park; a block away from the Hawaii Convention Center; connected by skybridge to the Ala Moana Mall containing 300 shops and restaurants. The hotel has 2 adjoining towers: the 13-storey Kona Tower where we were billeted, and the 32-storey Waikiki Tower which is striking. The driveway is grand, and can accomodate a couple of dozen cars at any time. Underground parking is more than adequate, and costs $20/overnight for hotel guests (unlimited entry/exit using swipe card). Smart hotel guests park at the Mall parking for free, and walk a hundred feet across the Skybridge to the hotel. The lobby is spacious and elegant, but there should be more staff at the front desk during peak hours. The bellman was professional but not friendly, a trend my wife and I noted throughout our 5-day stay in this hotel. It was our first stay in a Honolulu hotel, and I found a perceptible difference between staff attitude in Ala Moana, and that of hotels in the continental US. I would characterize it as a lack of pride in the facility that they work in. There are 3 elevators in Kona, and 6 in Waikiki, all high-speed, quiet, efficient, and requiring room card access to the residential floors. The longest wait is probably less than 15 seconds. Corridors are airconditioned, wide, clean, and well-lit. Our room was a standard: quite small at 28 sq.m.; view of downtown and mountains; queen bed; smallest TV I've seen in a hotel room (17"); small, decent bathroom with tub; wide desk; couch and armchair; internet is plug-in, as WiFi available only in lobby and common areas.The upside --- safe, fridge, microwave toaster, which are amenities rapidly disappearing from most hotels. No mini-bar. Coin-op laundry on 6th and 13th floors of Kona Tower; not sure about locations in Waikiki Tower. Fitness Center has a complete set of weights machines, at the expense of more space for treadmills of which there are only 4, thus, treadmills are always at a premium. Third-floor pool is about 20 meters long, lightly-salted water, and good for short laps only. Sundeck area is quite large. Hours for fitness center are 5am to 10pm, and pool are 8am to 6pm. Both are accessible by room card key. Three restaurants in the hotel, none of which we tried due to the preponderance of good eating places within walking distance. The tour desk deserves a comment. During peak hours, two staffers would be woefully inadequate (15mins/customer, with about 5 customers in each of 2 lines --- the wait is more than an hour). Though our tour desk staffer seemed to work hard and was very nice, she did try to hard-sell the Pearl Harbor tour to the point of incredulity --- no choice but a 6:30am tour bus pick-up for an 11:15am tour; otherwise, "you'll miss the 3100 maximum daily tickets handed out, since there are 5000/day who request for tickets". This sounded totally ridiculous, so we opted to pick up a rental the next morning, had a leisurely breakfast, left the hotel at 8am, arrived at Pearl Harbor 30 mins after, went straight to the counter (No lines!!!) and got 2 free tickets to the 11:15am tour, and had a much better day than if we had taken the bus tour that would start at 6:30am and would pick up passengers from several more hotels.

Shop-a-holic's delight :) walking distance to Hawaii's LARGEST mall. The ac vent drops on the bed nearest the bathroom so if you're traveling with someone else and don’t wish to wake up with a stuffy nose choose the bed closest to the balcony

The Ala Moana Hotel is in a central location just down from Wakiki but not crowded. We had a wonderful experience. The staff was friendly and professional. The rooms were clean and had a nice decor. Great hotel at a great price. We'll definitely be back!!

We chose to stay at the Ala Moana Hotel because of the proximity to the airport and the price. I had reserved a mountain view room with a single king size bed. Once we got up to our room after a very long flight we discovered that it had two full size beds instead of the king. Since it was dark we cound't see the view until the next morning which ended up being a view of the mall parking lot and building next door. In fairness, we didn't complain because we were only going to be sleeping there but it would have been nice to have them tell us that they couldn't honor our requests when we checked in. In addition, as a security measure, they make you use your room key card in the elevators and while we understood the purpose to this, it didn't always work well and you would stand there and have to swipe the card a number of times before it registered. Not only did this happen to us but we noticed it happening to a number of other guests as well. On a positive note, it was convenient and the mall was right next door for meals. The room could have been a bit cleaner but it was adequate for our needs.

I booked it through hotwire. Close to Waikiki. Parking not included, 20$ a night or 25$ for valet. Not included!! Tiny room, no extras, basic arrangements, clean and new, close to amenities.... Long wait for the desk.....

I stayed here for 3 nights and was not really impressed by the rooms. They are small and the 1 cloth chair in the room looked a little grungy to me. I put a towel over it so I wouldn't have to look at it and that was that. The view out my window was nice, I got to see the ocean and the tops of yachts from the yacht club across the street (LOL). I didn't pay as much as I have paid on previous trips to the island so I knew in advance not to expect the "Royal Treatment". It was a place to lay my head while I waited on the sun to come up. I couldn't imagine being there with my kids, but for the price it was a good deal. I did find one thing that I would check on before I stayed. Whether they are doing reairs on the mall next door. I had to listen to a jackhammer all during the day and night if I was in my room. They were repairing the Macy's parking lot and it was non stop the whole time I was there. The trolley picks up right in front of the mall next door. For $2.00 each way. You can catch the Pink or the Red trolley straight to Wakiki Beach. Directly across the street from the hotel is a park that looked a little "no, no " to me on my previous trips, but hidden in there is actually a childrens beach park. The look may deter you, but it is actually a cool little place to hang out.

I stayed here for three nights and it's quite an average hotel. It's huge and has a lot of guests. Many airline crews stay here too. I had a room in the Kona tower and it had one queen bed and a sofa pullout, which when set up, the room is nothing but bed. The rooms in that tower are tiny and a little worn. The sliding glass door opens but there is no balcony. The walls are incredibly thin and you can hear people's conversations from the hallway. The valet parking is $25/day which is typical of Waikiki. If I absolutely had to, I would stay here again, but I would request the Waikiki Tower. The breakfast cafe was ok at best. They offer a continental breakfast for about $10 and a hot buffet for about $15.

We are traveling as two families with six adults and three childrens. We booked two "hotel suites" at the Ala Moana, seemingly through a travel agent in Honolulu. Turns out they are privately owned condominium units managed by a property rental company but there was no way to know that until we got here. The problem is the hotel staff is unresponsive. When we need anything, they say "sorry, not our units." We have the use of all the same facilities but it's like we are second class citizens. Extremely frustrating and unprofessional. They should know that this reflects badly on their hotel. Terrible street noise. Mediocre beds.

Had a good stay here on the way between RMI and Fiji. Luckily I had the chance to be here for a few days. This gave me time to explore the town and to enjoy the place. There is a shapping centre nearby and that was good fo me so that I could have a look at the local shops. The rooms I stayed were both nice and quite. It was good to have that stay in a clean place and somewhere where there was lots to see and do locally. I would like to stay there again. The staff were helpful and allowed me to early check-in when my staff made a mistake on my arrival time.

My family has been staying at the Ala Moana for twenty years. (We travel back and forth from the mainland to islands in the central Pacific ocean often.) Many of our colleagues have stayed here for years as well. I read most of the negative reviews, and although we continue to stay at the Ala Moana for reasons of our own, I actually agree with most of the negative comments. Parking is an issue if you have a rental car. Views can be bad. Amenities are limited. Pool leaves something to be desired. Front desk staff is "hit and miss" as far as friendliness goes. However, we stay at the Ala Moana hotel because we like to be able to walk to the Ala Moana mall to eat and shop (there's a 2nd level catwalk from the hotel to the mall). Also, the Ala Moana beach park, the Ala Wai Yacht Basin, and the Wal-mart and Sam's Club are all in walking distance. I DO NOT feel that the area is unsafe. I have walked from the hotel to the Wal-mart many times by myself. There are many homeless folks living in the Ala Moana beach park, but in our experience, they are harmless, and have never begged from us, or attempted to panhandle. I would agree that for tourists who want the total "aloha" experience, the Ala Moana might fall short.

In fairness, I need to point out that I only ended up at the Ala Moana as a result of a canceled Alaska Airlines flight, and as such, arrived at 3:00 in the morning. The Good: The staff was called upon to accommodate approximately 200 guests in the middle of the night after an Alaska flight to Seattle was recalled to Honolulu, then experienced another issue upon take-off and the flight was then canceled.  Given the circumstances, I was impressed by their friendliness and customer service at the check-in desk.  Also, the valets in front were friendly and accommodating when we left.  The staff seems very competent. The Bad: After a horrible night of no sleep, a series of bad things happened at this hotel.  First, because of paper-thin walls, we were awakened around 6:00 am by a neighboring room’s alarm, in the form of a very loud radio.  Second, at approximately 8:30 am, a janitor inexplicably knocked on our door, requesting he be allowed to come in the room and clean the windows.  When we declined, he was very miffed.  And finally, around 9:30 am, the hotel’s emergency sirens went off, informing us that we were to evacuate immediately, as an emergency had been detected in the hotel.  This went on for about 5 minutes, as we frantically tried to throw on our clothes and get out of the room.  Then, another voice came on via the intercom system and informed us that this was a drill only, for hotel employees, and that only staff was required to respond.  It would have been nice to have informed us of that *before* the alarm bells were sounded. The Ugly: The rooms at this hotel are seriously tired.  While it seemed somewhat clean, the carpets in the room were stained and there was mold in the bathroom. Bottom Line: This hotel seems to be geared towards business and convention travel.  Its location is far from Waikiki or any of the sites that a vacation traveler would want to visit in Honolulu.

I called customer service and I was advised during check in $150 would be charged to my account and I could change payment method during check out. When you check in you would be charged the entire amount of stay and a little more... You might not get the bed size of your choice even if that's what you reserved for if they don't have the availability available. There is no room service. rooms are worth it in the low hundred dollar range but not the $200 range.

Beautiful hotel but a long walk to the Waikiki area. Not on the beach. Across the park from Ala Moana Park which has a great beach area and the Alamoana mall. The staff here was accommodating. Unfortunately the pool area closes extremely early (7pm). We wanted to sit out with our family around the pool but security told us to leave. Parking space is available at the hotel but it is espensive and can get very crazy if a special event is going on in the area. We were there July 4th and they put our car in an area that wasn't in a space. We couldn't have got out if we tried. The room was small but beautiful. Once a week they have live music in the lobby which was wonderful. Great place if you are on a budget that won't let you stay directly on the beach in Waikiki or Kolina.

The hotel mentioned above is very clean and the service requirement was great,we actually rented a room through Albi rentals for six days and we stayed on the 32nd floor,which is the cheaper way to go for a tight budget.The view was spectacular and the shopping centre close by is very handy,with a food court etc, all in all we had a very lovely stay at this hotel and would say it is a great place to stay.

The hotel was clean and well kept, but the services available were a disappointment. Pool closed promptly at 7pm, and guests were not allowed near the pool area after that time. We really wanted to sit by the pool and watch the beautiful sunset. Hotel restaurant was only open for breakfast. Hotel bar only open Th-Fri-Sat after 9pm. We felt rather exiled. Service staff was formal and distant. We will not be back.

As the title reveals, if you stay in the Ala Moana hotel you are risking having items go "missing." I called the housekeeping staff director and he didn't care. Never even called me back. Then I reported it to management and they didn't care either. The manager didn't even come out to talk to me or anything. The receptionist simply said, "Oh, Sorry!." So, I filed an in house hotel report, which clearly is going to go nowhere. So, beware of this hotel! I would never recommend it to anyone!

Stayed for 11 days at Ala Moana on vacation in glorious Hawaii. Double room was spacious with two queen size beds, table and 2 chairs and long desk, balcony w/table and chairs, frig, microwave and coffee maker. Front desk staff, housekeeping, and garage staff were delightful, helpful, and friendly. Hotel is adjacent to Ala Moana shopping mall and about 3 blocks from ocean/Ala Moana state park (which has beautiful views of Diamond Head). Took about 15 minutes to walk to Hilton and start of Waikiki beach. Parking was $20. a night and easy in and out. This is a busy hotel with lots of foot traffic. Only downside was the main concierge - a tall blonde - with the personality of a condescending prison guard. Each time I asked her a question e.g., for directions, a reservation, (standard concierge stuff) she was rude, rude, rude. Lord knows why she's in that job as it makes the hotel and Hawaii look bad. Otherwise, this was a great place to stay.

This hotel was a great base for us to experience Waikiki without the noise. Hotel is clean, safe and friendly. Travel desk is helpful and not pushy and all good tour companies will pick up from hotel. Only comment would be that it would be nice to be able to swim in the pool past the dusk closing time but I'm sure the management have a good reason for this.

The price was good ($100 a night), but I think there are better choices! Look on a map and see where this hotel is located. A little too far to enjoy the Waikiki area and beaches. It is connected to the ala moana mall, convenient if you want to shop, but there are SO MANY other, better things to do!!!! There are lots of hotels right on Kalakaua -or a few blocks behind- that are just a short walk from the bars/restaurants, shops and beaches of gorgeous Waikiki!!Also, I thought the staff was rude. The hotel is 2 different towers and there are 2 different elevators...You must get on the right one or you will never find your room!! The check-in staff does not tell you this and you are left to drag your luggage around and figure it out yourself! I felt this was terribly inconsiderate!

We come here every year for our family reunion and our company party so we usually get a room for the weekend. The customer service is always so helpful and friendly, and I only see smiling faces when I deal with them in person. I find the rooms to always be nice and clean. The decor is simple, nothing too fancy, but still new and always so tidy. The pool is your typical pool. They provided towels there which was convenient. The room was fully prepped with extra towels, and blankets as I requested. The beds and linens are comfortable and we slept with ease. It was worth the money spent and we will definitely come back here soon!

Nothing thrilling to report here since this was not a typical Hawaii Hotel. I say this because:1. it was not on the beach (you have to walk about half a mile).2, my view was of the city not the water.3. The mall that is next to it is bland, confusing, and has nothing memorable in it. 4. I paid $145 a night for what was a small room.5. There is an Adult XXX strip joint located right next door...fun for the whole family I suppose. 6. for all the east coaster, there is nothing to do at 3 am while you lay in bed jet lagged...at least have a 24hr coffee shop downstairs.7. the flat screen TV in the room is extremely small...approx 17 inches in diameter. Seriously I have seen 52 inch TVs in some hotel rooms....17 is just pathetic.8. the 4 doormen hang out with each other and never helped with my bags, greeted me, or escorted me through the door. there are some good things about the place:1. it was clean2. it was quiet3. the cleaning ladies were nice4. the room had a safe in it.So all it all, it was an average stay. Good if you are here for a business trip...not too good if you want to stay here for a family vacation or a beach vacation.

I love this hotel. I will be sure to continue to stay there when I am in the area. The rooms are very clean, the view is amazing, and just sitting on the balcony completes every vacation.Eric and DebbieHonolulu, HI

We booked this hotel and air package through their site and we had a very good deal for 7 nights hotel stay and round trip flight from chicago. The location is perfect if you want to keep some distance away from the busy area of Waikiki hotels. It is conveniently located near the Ala Moana shopping center, walking distance. And, you'll just cross the street to go to the bus station in order to go different tourist spots. Also, there is a nice public beach within walking distance, the Ala Moana Beach Park.

We usually stay here when visiting Oahu for business or vacation from a neighboring island. We like the location near the convention center for business and mall for shopping. In the past, stays at the Kona and Waikiki Towers have been reasonably comfortable, clean and convenient. This weekend visit (Waikiki Tower) we noticed a definite decline in convenience, service and cleanliness. Long wait to check in and out (understaffed at peak times). Front desk staff a mixed bag of helpfulness and attitude. Room was not well cleaned, e.g. cushions on chairs badly stained, chunks of dried food visible between chair cushions and chairs, carpets stained and dirty…Parking was a hassle! We paid in advance $20 per day for self-parking in the underground lot, but each night the lot was full (over-sold) and we were instructed to “drive around a couple times” to confirm this and then park out on the street at a meter by Ala Moana Shopping Center. I don’t remember this from previous visits albeit during the week, so to me this latter issue of overselling the parking lot seemed new and just poor management/customer service.

The main attraction of this hotel is it's closeness to the Ala moana mall. There was a handy skybridge that bypasses the confusing lower carpark and leads you through Macy's. Front desk was a bit slow, could do with some extra staff during the busy times but they were excellent in helping us get a room higher up. Hardly any wait for the elevators as they are fast and more than adequate for the size of the hotel. The room was excellent with a lovely large bed and plenty of storage space. The pool was quite nice with plenty of deck chairs for sun bathing. Though we didn't use the gym, it appeared very well stocked with good quality equipment. Overall, I would recommend this hotel if you wanted to stay away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki but still wanted some good options for dining as Ala Moana mall has a plethora of wonderful restaurants and a decent food court. Also we found the upper levels to be very quiet and relaxing.
Good location, cute small rooms, and good service. Beds could be changed to be more comfortable and better bedding is in order. Very nice reception staff.

I stayed on the 34th floor - my room had a balcony with an amazing view of the boats during the day and the lights at night - the room and bathroom were immaculate and comfortable. Hotel is well located and staff were pleasant. Good value for money.

I live on a neighbor island and visit Honolulu for business and pleasure. This time I was there for business and stayed at the Ala Moana Hotel as the meetings were at the Honolulu Convention Center. Rooms were clean. Check in was efficient, and it was relatively quiet. The room I stayed in was in the Kona Tower and was recently updated. Internet was via a wired connection, no WiFi in the room.Only couple minor flaws - check-in personnel could be a bit more friendly. Its not going to hurt to smile once in a while. It seems that there was some repair going on in the hallway at 10 o'clock at night - drilling and hammering. Seems to me that maintainance could be done at a more appropriate time.For the vacation traveller, bear in mind that this hotel is only one block away from the convention center so if there is a big convention, this hotel is going to be packed.

The Ala Moana was an excellent location for a girls shopping trip. A short walk from the Ala Moana shopping centre we could return to our room with our purchases before returning in the afternoon! Found the food court at the shopping centre great value. Would definately consider staying here again.

The Ala Moana has individually owned rooms that are "rented" hotel-style. You wouldn't know, it acts like a hotel. The front desk staff were very nice and helpful. The area is typical Honolulu, nice views of the ocean between the other highrises, right next to a huge shopping center, with discount coupons for Macy's given at checkin (in Japanese!), close to the convention center, but otherwise a little seedy. The exercise room is large, next to a nice pool above the street with a view of the neighborhood. There is a dance club in the building for the 40+ crowd. Its nothing "special" but generally clean and acceptable.

The gym was my favorite! It was clean and I was able to watch the news on both the stationary bike and treadmill. The rooms were average. The first night I checked in there weren't any washcloths in my room. I would rate housekeeping service poor. The location is unbeatable! Everything you need is within walking distance. I love the gym and I loved the location. I would definitely stay there again!

The room was really nice and quaint. It felt really clean and well taken care of. The main issue was the noise in the hallway. First of all when you look at the door, there are some pretty sizeable gaps between the door and the outer wall.. so that probably contributed to the noise. We usually don't use the A/C but turned it on just to drown out the noise of people talking early in the morning in the hall. Also, the outside noise was pretty loud too. We were in the Kona tower and there was a bar next door.. so that was another noise factor. The hotel is nice if only they could drown out the noise better.

I stayed in the cheaper of the hotel which was very clean but very loud at night. I did get quiet time from 12AM-4AM but that was it for sleep time. The walls are paper thin and one can hear the TV in the other rooms on either side with ease. Shopping is close I recommend the food court at the Mall. In all 3 of 5 Stars from Rock on Aloha. Wait, after complaining tot eh manager he did comp me parking for the 3-days at $20.00/day which is a total scam anyway. I never pay parking as a Hotel guest. So 3.6 of 5 Stars for the comp. My advice is complain early and they will upgrade you for free, but be nice when you complain or they will know you have no aloha spirit and then send you to Pele for Haole scraps.

Although they could staff their front desk with more people on a Sunday morning for check-outs, I enjoyed my stay at this hotel. Have always loved its proximity to the Ala Moana Shopping Center. The valet guys are always friendly and quick.

Really, if you want a place to stay near the beach and do some shopping, this is the hotel to be at. My husband and I are always here when we fly to Oahu. the price is right, the mall is there, what else can you ask for? It's close to everything else in town. We never ever get hassled. The front desk are always helpful and gracious. i love it. I wish I could own a piece of it so I don't have to make reservations, but that's another story. Great stay overall!

This is an old hotel that's been partially updated, but still has a lazy islands feel in spite of its gigantic size. The retro lobby is graced by an antique Polynesian canoe. Checking in will try your patience - expect at least a half hour wait in a long line. The outdoor pool is big and beautiful but closes early - we were told because that's the deal that they made with the tenants of the condo tower. The breakfast is cafeteria caliber. There are other restaurants including a well-rated Chinese one but we didn't try them. The main selling point is the hotel's fantastic location. It's a few blocks from the beach with ocean views from most or all rooms, adjacent to the don't-miss open-air multilevel Ala Moana shopping center with hundreds of shops and restaurants (and a post office, a branch of City Hall with its own art gallery, and a stage with ongoing entertainment,) and walking distance to the Convention Center. Public transportation is great and there are taxis always waiting at the front for more distant rides. No need to rent a car unless you want to go to the North side of the island. Our bed was comfortable and the elevators were fast. There's a coin-op laundry and you can get coins at the front desk. There was a plumbing problem and although Maintenance came to fix it pretty rapidly, the guy was unsuccessful and we had to switch rooms late at night - not too pleasant. I think we should have been comped a night due to that trouble. But all in all it was a decent stay and if I were going to a convention, I'd stay there again.

This hotel is located at the south end of Ala Moana Shopping Center. There are three levels of shops including Nordstrom, Macys and Neiman Marcus. I spend all day with my girlfriend shopping and then had dinner at one of the restaurants in the Mall. We fly over from Maui on a regular basis, grab a cab into the hotel ($30), and shop/eat/relax. This hotel is comfortable, newly remodeled, has a great breakfast buffet and a fun nightclub. Good place to spend a Friday afternoon or Saturday evening.

I am a business traveler who spends more than half a year, every year, in hotels rooms all over the world. I have been in some hotels that were quite a bit more expensive and some that were cheaper in price. I can easily say I have had no more pleasant an experience than I got at the Ala Moana hotel. All the staff, from house keeping to janitor, to front desk people all had one thing in common. That is they all seem to genuinely make your stay the best experience of a lifetime. Everyone tried to mkae you feel welcome and smiled and spoke to you when they saw you. The room was very clean and kept that way by the staff. The food in the restaurant was hot and fresh always. I would stay here again and again. I could only wish that the other hotels I will be staying in in other cities would be half as nice as this one. Way to go ALA MOANA.

Very nice and clean room. Also convenient as it's just a walk away from the beach and the shopping center where we ate most of our meals. One of our high school reunion activities included going to the Rumours night club right in the hotel, so it was great not having designate a driver. Parking in the hotel itself is a bit tight.

I've purposely delayed writing this review because I wanted to put our stay in perspective. In hindsight it doesn't get much better. Maybe it was the season -- it was busy, not everyone was as polite as they could have been but that still doesn't excuse the staff's attitude.In approaching the reception desk we were summarily dismissed by the first clerk - who was filing her nails. "Can't you see I'm busy?" She said.In approaching a second desk clerk we were greated to our dream Hawaii vacation with "What do you want?"Once were checked in we went to the restaurant downstairs where we had reservations for dinner. After waiting 45 minutes and being told it might be another hour before we could be seated we went to a restaurant on an upper floor HOPING to get a meal. At least there we were seated. The waiter was pleasant; he asked for our drink orders, returned with our drinks and took our order. An hour later we asked to get our food to go. A half hour later we actually got it.That set the mood for the week. Tickets to a show that we were to pick up at the concierge desk "disappeared." Housekeeping staff "were too busy" to change the linens after three days. On and on.The two high points:The first was a lone concierge employee who went above and beyond to arrange to get our cell phone back after it was misplaced on a shuttle van. To her I will always be grateful.The second came the night before checking out - on New Years Eve - when we approached the restaurant on an upper floor for dinner. Upon seeing my daughter, the host moved us from a table near the kitchen to a table at the window so that my daughter could watch the fireworks on the harbor. The food was delicious and the evening was memorable. The room was comfortable (though, again, the housekeeping staff seemed to busy to make beds or change linens). The view was spectacular.

The room assigned to us is small but clean. The hotel staff are very helpful and friiendly. This hotel is conveniently located with a walkway to a large mall. The only drawback is the weak wifi access. I keep losing the wifi connection which resulted to the hacking of my email. There are souvenir shops inside the hotel that are open till midnite so walk around and discover extraordinary items that are reasonably priced.

We stayed in the Kona Tower, which is the lower, older tower. We got a room with 2 queen beds on the 10th floor. Room was clean and nicely decorated, beds were comfortable, and it was a good size room with a desk and chair. There was free wired internet in the room, and it worked great, but no wifi. TV was very small, but that wasn't important to us. Our view was of a parking lot and back of a building, but that wasn't important to us, either. You can get rooms with views if you pay more, but we chose not to. Best part of the hotel is the location, right across from Ala Moana park and beach and next to the Ala Moana mall. There's a supermarket, drug store, Starbucks, and food court at the mall for all your necessities. They have a parking garage for $20 self park and $25 valet, and access in/out is easy. That may seem steep, but that's about the going rate in Waikiki. This hotel is not in the middle of Waikiki, if that's what you're looking for, it's on the western edge, but all that hub bub is still close by. And by the way, the employees we met were very nice and helpful. Our stay was enjoyable and I would stay again
We had a great staycation at the hotel. Our oceanview room was excellent for the fireworks celebration on the 4th of July. We had a wonderful experience. We look forward to staying here again soon!

Had our house tented which required a 3 nite stay at a local hotel. Unexpected surprise when our room was upgraded to a balcony room with a microwave! Had to pay $20 a nite for parking...on the other hand, internet access was free so it was still less than other Waikiki hotels we checked. Great location...connected to the shopping center and all the reasonably priced food one could want. Safe, clean and reasonably priced property. Would definitely stay at the Ala Moana hotel again.

We were loyal patrons of another hotel which has recently gone "south" so decided to try the Ala Moana hotel. You can't beat the convenience, the staff is friendly and most accommodating, and NOT in crazy Waikiki. We like the Plantation Cafe's breakfast buffet. We have stayed there a couple of times in the last couple of months and our stay was consistent. The only drawback is the price of parking. If you valet, the cost is $25 per day while self-parking is only $5 less at $20 per day, a little steep to us.

We booked this hotel specifically for it's location. We needed a hotel for a 1-night pre-cruise hotel stay. The Ala Moana Hotel was conveniently located near the Ala Moana Center (for shopping/dining) and an easy walk from the beautifual Ala Moana Beach Park. We had a partial ocean view room in the Waikiki Tower with a nice King Size bed and a balcony where we could look out to the ocean. The room was decorated nicely and offered a small fridge, microwave and coffee maker. Hi-speed internet was included - which is always a plus! Definitely spend the extra few dollars on the Waikiki tower as the rooms in the Kona tower are much smaller with double beds instead of King beds.The front desk staff was very friendly and we did not use their other facilities, but we would definitely recommend the hotel and stay here again.

Impressive is all I can say. I am a care giver for my parents and this was really their trip, they hate hotels, but when they stepped into the Ala Moana Hotel on June 27th, they were swept away. First by the Ambiance of the Hotel, the Simplicity and the Service. The convenience of all the shops, restaurants, even the third floor where the pool is, was breath taking. The Quietness of the hotel, including the way service is performed, I give this Hotel a AAAA+, it is that OUTSTANDING! From check in to everything that followed. Our room was "Spectacular" that is what made this trip so Memorable, my parents didn't want to leave the room, they were so excited! The view one all of will never forget. When returning, and that is a Promise, I had to make to my parents the day we left. We would like to request the same Suite. My mother who is rarely excited had tears when we had to leave, this is when I made a promise to her that I'll bring them back. So please when I do book again, Please try to accomodate me with the Suite that we stayed in, it would mean so much to my parents. I will definitely tell as many of my friends and family about your Hotel and make sure they book a stay. Ala Moana Hotel We Thank You for making our trip not only a pleasurable one, but a "Memorable" one as well.

I got a great deal at the "kamaaina" (resident) rate. I was up there strictly for a shopping trip and chose Ala Moana hotel because it connects to the Ala Moana Shopping Center. Since I don't drive on Oahu, it was perfect for catching The Bus which was located the next street down. The Bus also drops and picks up directly in front of the hotel as well as various trolleys, airport shuttles and tour buses.  I was pleasantly surprised to be upgraded to the recently renovated Waikiki Tower and our room was very nice and modern. It had an apartment sized fridge and microwave which was very convenient as we could pick up food from Foodland on the first floor of Ala Moana Shopping Center and warm it up for our late night munchies. There was even a nice balcony overlooking the ocean. We were on the 9th floor and I have no complaints about anything with the hotel. You need your key to use the elevator from the 6th floors and up, and on the second floor which has the pool and ramp to the shopping center there was a homeless person there in the lounge area each day, that was the only down side. Otherwise, I was completely satisfied with the hotel. I've seen other reviews that the tv was too small, etc. Yes, it was a 15" flatscreen, but we never watched tv the whole time we were there so I didn't care. I would definitely stay there again!
Would definitely stay at Ala Moana again. Staff and accomodations were great.

We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. We had booked a partial view room and they certainly delivered. Lovely view of the gorgeous ocean from my room. The hotel is not on the beachfront but only a block or two away. The Ala Moana shopping centre is accessible from the hotel and is where all the locals shop.Fantastic shopping centre for large department stores like Macy's etc and also incredible restaurants, cinemas, food shops, Post office etc etc. The Waikiki trolley's also leave from here, so you can get to visit all of the Island in these fabulous open-air busses. Waikiki is amazing. The hotel rooms were clean and of good size. Also able to open sliding door in room to allow the beautiful cooling sea breezes. The reception and staff in general were extremely efficient and very friendly. Wonderful stay..would definitely come back to stay longer. The airport bus drops you at the door. Great service.

My husband and I have stayed at the Ala Moana on two occasions; first, when we got married (while he attended a conference at the hotel), and again this month for our 10th anniversary. We have a sentimental attachment to the place, but I also love its location. It is on the route for tour companies that pick up from Waikiki hotels, but it is not directly in the heart of Waikiki. I know that might be a negative for some, but we really like being a little removed from the beach/tourist action. The room is comfortable, and the hotel's location (adjacent to the mall) provides some inexpensive dining options, which can be hard to come by in Honolulu. It's not luxurious or in a swanky part of town, but that's not a priority for us. Ala Moana a quality hotel for a reasonable price (also hard to come by in Honolulu). The staff didn't exude warm fuzziness, but I have found them to be both friendly and helpful. When we reported trouble with our A/C, the receptionist jumped right on the problem and it was fixed by the time we got back from that's day's touring. One thing I missed this time that I recall from our last visit was a concierge desk. Between the reception desk and the bell desk, we were able to get whatever information we needed, but the lack of a concierge did create some initial confusion when we weren't sure where to go to ask our question.

This hotel is the best to stay at if a person has business in Honolulu. It is very well located to all means of transportation. It is close to shopping at Ala Moana and Ward Parkway Centre. Rooms are comfortable and have not had one with a bad location. We do not spend a lot of time in the room, so as long at it is clean, comfortable and everything works we are happy. This is NOT the place to go for a wedding memomory!. Pay the extra and go to Outrigger on the Reef.

We stayed here for business. If you have a meeting or convention at this hotel, you don't really have a choice as to where you stay. But, if you are going for pleasure, I would not recommend staying here. The hotel is not on the beach. It is in a seedy area of town, with several strip bars, a check-cashing place, and several homeless people less than a block from the hotel. It is over a mile walk to all the restaurants and shops in Waikiki. Yes, there is a mall next door. But, don't you all have malls back home. Who goes to Hawaii to go to the mall? There is not even a bar at the hotel. Plus, the pool is no bigger than one you'd find in your average neighborhood. Yes, you are in Hawaii, and if you must stay here on business, you'll have a good time. But, if you have the option of picking where you stay, stay somewhere else.

The main reason we stay here is to be next door, literally, to the Ala Moana shopping center. My wife loves shopping there when we visit family on Oahu so it's obviously convenient. On the plus side, the room was clean and we got a decent (not great) deal with their kama'aina rate. But the room was the smallest we've been given in all our stays there. The bed was a double, not even a queen, with only a single mushy pillow each. The television is basically a 12" flat-screen monitor with a remote equipped with nearly dead batteries. There is no wireless Internet access--so forget smartphone wi-fi access--but there is a wired ethernet cable connection. However the connector had a broken clip. There was a microwave and small refrigerator, but no facial tissue in the bathroom. And we got a spectacular view of their mezzanine rooftop.On our last visit, we were rudely and abruptly awoken in the wee morning hours by the sound of a security guard unlocking our door, attempting to open it only to have it slammed shut by the hinge lock on the door that we always use. When I opened the door, the guard just stared at us looking bewildered. When we asked him what he wanted, he asked us if we were "with the Jewish party." When we told him we were not, he simply turned and walked away. No explanation. No apology. When we reported this to the front desk on checking out that morning, they didn't apologize either and brushed it off saying something about how the guard probably made a mistake. Probably? Is it customary for their security people to unlock and open doors in the middle of the night without knocking and identifying themselves first?That particular incident I have to believe was unique. Even so, how the guard behaved and the nonchalant behavior of the front desk is troubling.I can't say that we'd never stay here again but we'll probably at least consider other hotels next time.

This is the first time I've been to Honolulu, so my take on the situation is that the convention center was built in a more run down section of town (a half mile from waikiki beach, more or less) and so it was a chance for the town planner to try to bring some business to that area. This hotel is the closest to the convention center, and the rates are very reasonable. It has an air about it of trying to be "the spot" 20 years ago, but today it's a huge hotel lobby without much excitement. Although the "Rumors" bar always seemed to be busy with private parties. Service was excellent, except the pool policy was silly, with having to sign out towels and having the pool guy watch over you like a hawk. The pool bar was, it seems, permanently closed.The rooms were small, the TVs were small, but it was quiet and clean. The local beach was quite a walk, but quiet and still, really nice. If you plan on being at the convention center or insist on swimming in the Ala Moana Park beach area, I wouldn't hesitate to recommend. If you want Honolulu action, then stay closer to Waikiki beach.

3.5 stars? I am a FREQUENT traveler. I'd give this "business grade, centrally located, valet "sometimes, self-park maybe," RUDE staff, worse management hotel a 2. This is our last day in HI and every single interaction we have had has been 5 star-or better. The "Aloha Spirit" is amazing, however, I am shocked to see other tripadvisor travelers giving this hotel a positive review. While I understand that each travelers experience is different, the specs of the hotel are not. It advertises flat screen tv...this is laughable-my home computer screen is the same size-NO exaggeration. Valet "ran out of space," self park is double parked -which is fine-except that if you have to leave before 8 there isn't a parking attendant to get your car out---problematic at the very least-especially if trying to catch an early flight.While the room is clean, it is sub par at best. The linens are motel grade. The 15 inch tv is stuck at an awkward angle, and the noise from the intersection 21 floors below is disruptive-did I mention no WiFi?!BTW-we were moved to an upgraded room. I honest to goodness can not imagine what our original room would have been like! After complaining to the valet manager regarding the valet experience, he was rude and reactive. While I was irrate, I was completely manageable. His sarcasm and lack of consideration made me furious. I know this review sounds a bit harsh, but in our first hour here has been laughable and disappointing. I rely heavly on tripadvisor to make travel decisions, this is the first time I've been burned...bad.

Location is a handy, straight shot from HNL Airport & for traveling to PunchBowl for Memorial Day Ceremony, nice walking distant to the Lantern Lighting Ceremony at the Park [drawing 40,000 this year!], visiting friends in Kaneohe, shopping at Ala Moana Shopping Center & local favorite dining & shopping spots for a three-day GetAway from Kona on the Big Island. Great R&R time by the 3rd-floor pool. Staff was efficient and courteous from arrival to departure & all encounters in between. Quite impressed for the cleanliness/price/location & will definitely be returning.

We had been looking forward to our honeymoon in Hawaii for months, it had been somewhere I had dreamt of going simce I was very young. After a 19hr door to door journey we were so excited to have arrived in our destination - very impressed with shuttle bus from airport to resorts.On arrival to our Hotel we were greet with a grumpy receptionist who really didin't appear to have any interest in our reason for being there, when we arrived at our room (un-aided as help with bags was not offered) we were a little disappointed with the size of our room which would have been forgiven had it been in anyway luxurious, we opened the sliding doors to find not our partial ocean view we had booked but an extremely busy street below and multi storey carpark opposite, it was late we were tired so decided to battle the receptionist again the next morning. On doing this we were told that our agent had not booked the correct room and if we wanted an ocean view room we would have to call back to the UK (which has a 19hour time difference) to get them to call the Hotel to authorise the upgrade, we thought this was mean on the Hotels part considering they knew we were on Honeymoon and had travelled an extremely long distance, NOT helpful or apologetic at all.Appeared to be a very quiet hotel, no welcoming bar, never found the restaurant, attached to huge shopping centre (NOT a plus) bedroom was over back entrance to hotel so woken at 5am every morning by deliveries/bin men, staff rude, not close to the beach, 1hours walk to centre of Honolulu, pool dirty, and hotel located on what seemed like to busiest junction in the entire universe. NOT suitable for relaxing holiday or honeymoon AT ALL I do however believe this is down to agent we went with but thats another story altogether.Extremely disappointed a chidhood dream and honeymoon ruined.

After traveling for 27 hours from Rome, to arrive at this familiar hotel, which always meets all of ones needs, was truely arriving into the luxury of aloha. I stay here often and always enjoy the amenities, the wonderful beds and the warm reception. C from Hilo, HI.

There is only one reason to stay here, and that is the proximity to the convention center, a quick walk. While it is a perfectly adequate-ordinary hotel, it is truly nothing special - and a little bit of special is nice when you come all the way to Hawaii. The room's TV is tiny. The hotel lounge bar is closed, so there is nowhere to get a drink and relax at the end of the day. The on-site Chinese restaurant isn't very good, and there is no other restaurant on site. There is no room service. The cafe is only open for breakfast (which was good). You need to walk to the shopping mall next door for restaurants or anything else - the neighborhood has no night life or charm. Going to the beach is a 10 minute hike (NOT "just across the street"), and the beach park is undergoing construction. I visited a friend at her hotel on Waikiki beach: beachside restaurant and bar with quiet music playing, access to the water, great views, lovely garden, nice walks on recently renovated city streets and shopping/dining - and decided the Ala Moana hotel's proximity to the convention center wasn't worth the minuses. Ala Moana hotel is clean, professional and reasonably priced (nice touches: small fridge and coffee maker in room, free internet and accessible outlets, little store with drink/snacks) - but very ordinary. If you do stay here, there is terrific city bus service around the corner at the shopping mall which goes to Pearl Harbor and many of the city's historic sites; ask the hotel staff what routes to take.

My partner and I traveled here for four days -- I was on vacation; he was at his conference. We thought this hotel was perfect. For him obviously -- right across from the Honolulu Convention Center. But for me as well. I honestly liked the fact that it was not right on Waikiki in the midst of all that traffic and craziness. When I wanted to access the beach, it was an easy and pretty walk. But in the evening, it was quiet and removed from the zoo that can be Waikiki.The hotel is quite large, and the views from the upper floors are spectacular. Elevators come quickly for such a large place. The staff was terrifically helpful, and they have an Expedia tour office on site to set up other tours (such as Pearl Harbor or a day on the Big Island). I was very happy with this choice.

The first room I was given had something on the bathroom wall in front of the toilet that looked like streaks of smeared feces. I called the front desk and asked for another room. In the interim, there was also a bug crawling in the bed. I called the front desk again. Someone came up immediately and checked the bathroom. He used his finger to touch the smears on the wall, and told me that it was not feces. Then, without washing his hands, he searched the bed for the bug. He found the bug hidden under the sheets and removed it, while declaring that it was not a bedbug. Shortly after he left, the assistant housekeeping manager came w/ a housekeeper. He inspected the bathroom wall and declared that he did not see feces. Then he and the housekeeper stripped the bed and declared that they could not find the bug. I told him that the other person from housekeeping already removed the bug and wiped the bathroom wall; he appeared annoyed when I told him that I did not know the name of the other gentleman who arrived before they did. A little while later the front desk called me and informed me that they would "give" me another room even though the manager found no evidence of feces or a bug in the bed, in a tone like they were doing me a favor. The other room was only slightly better-the sheets always had dirt somewhere on them, and I removed all of the linens at bedtime, with the exception of a fitted sheet. The faucet in the kitchenette did not work. Rather than complain about the new room, I decided they're all probably similar in quality, and to never stay at this place again, or recommend it to anyone.

Stayed 6 nights at the Ala Moana Hotel in Honolulu. It's a nice enough hotel that doesn't live up to it's potential. The staff is friendly and laid-back. Rooms are quiet and fairly spacious and have either an ocean view or a city/mountain view with private balconies. There's free in-room wired internet service and an on-site restaurant that's only open for breakfast and lunch. Microwave and small refrigerator in rooms. In-room coffee maker with very good coffee.The lobby has a bar that was never opened during the 6 days we were there. The hotel is a block from the Honolulu Convention Center and about a half mile walk to a very quiet beach and park. Waikiki beach is about a mile or so away. That'sw where the action is.If you're a conventioneer, it's the right spot to be. But if you're looking for the beach scene and a little more liveliness, try another hotel.

Stayed for 6 days as a solo traveler for a convention. Located one block from the Hawaii Convention Center and one block from Ala Moana Beach park and across the parking deck from the Macy's end of Ala Moana Shopping Center, this hotel met all of my needs for attending the conference while maintaining a healthy diet and workout routine. I walked to my meetings and to the Ala Moana Shopping Center daily for lunch of delicious poke (at Banggaa Banggaa) or grilled fish and vegetables, and occasionally absolutely fabulous chocolate cake for dessert (at La Palm D'Or). I ran in the Ala Moana Park every morning- 2.75 miles around the perimeter- beautiful scenery, friendly encounters with locals engaged in their own fitness routine- walking, running, surfing and rowing. I shopped for fresh fruit, milk and breakfast cereal at Foodland at Ala Moana Center and kept breakfast, tea and some healthy snacks in my room. I averaged about $10 daily for breakfast, snacks, and lunch together. When I ate out for dinner, I was able to keep the leftovers in my refrigerator for the next day's meal. I worked out in the fitness center which has unusually good fitness equipment for a hotel. The view from my window in the Waikiki Tower (35th floor) featured the high rise yacht club condominiums, but when seated on the lanai, I had a beautiful view of Ala Moana Beach Park and the yacht harbor.If I were in Hawaii on vacation, I would probably stay elsewhere, but for a business trip centered on activities at the Convention Center, this was absolutely perfect. If I enjoyed shopping for leisure, I might choose this hotel for vacation, too, since the Ala Moana Center has terrific shopping and restaurants- all a short walk away.The room was clean and well furnished, though not luxurious- a good value. The small refrigerator and microwave were made my stay much more homelike (and affordable).

Needed one day to get away and decided to choose this hotel. Staff was very friendly, even upon checking out. The hotel stays busy 24/7 but was still very quiet which made sleeping more comfortable. Room was very spacious considering we had a standard room. We stayed in 943 which seemed like a journey to get to until we realized there are two elevators within the hotel. There was not much of a view but iuy served our needs so was of no concern. Had breakfast the next morning at the Plantation Cafe, the food was really good but you can get the same thing for less if you know the area.Overall it was a great stay, even if it was for only one night. We will definitely be back for a longer stay soon!
$109 Kaamaina (Local) rate was a good deal for this hotel. You have to turn sideways to fit between the foot of the bed and the dresser. Nicely rennovated though.

After staying at this hotel 2 weeks ago, I have to disagree with some previous posts. You are in a very busy city with hotel rooms typically being smaller than in other cities- I have stayed in some very small rooms in NYC, DC, San Jose, etc...it's the limited space.. I felt the hotel was very nice.. rooms were nice but yes, small for 3 of us... location was good.. trolley to Waikiki was very convenient and affordable.. We had a nice view of the ocean and the marina- ANY hotel you stay in is going to have some views that are not ideal.. unless you are staying in an all oceanfront resort, not everyone is going to get the better view.. For the value and where we were staying, I think this was a good choic..

Every year my husband and our son go to the Kwaii Kon thats held every year. Ala Moana Hotel is the most convenient for us.This year we decided to upgrade to a partial ocean view room and wasn't disappointed one bit. This time we were on the side of the Convention Center with a room closer to the ocean. It was absolutely a beautiful view and helped us to relax and enjoy the balcony every chance we had.Being on a higher floor made things even more relaxing since it was quieter.We'll be back again next year and here's to hoping the employee's are just a courteous as they are every year we come and we'll be able to get a beautiful room just like this year.

It was horrible. Hotel security woke us up a 3 am saying 'noise complaint' when everyone was sleeping. It was next door making all the noise, you could hear it from the hall way. Also maids skip our room all three days we were there. I had to run to the store to get tolet paper because the hotel refused to give it to me. No clean towels after we called three times for them. I'm never staying there ever again.

Good location next to Ala Moana Shopping Centre, major bus stop and convention centre 2 minutes walking distance. 10 minutes’ walk to Waikiki. Free internet. The hotel itself is about 10 minutes’ walk from the beach. This is a hotel for business predominantly for those attending the convention centre so it does not have good ocean views nor as luxurious or romantic as the Hilton Hawaiian. If shopping for high end clothing or jewellery e.g. Cartier or Bvlgari suggest buying this at the airport as at least 10% cheaper compared to rest of Hawaii.
Spacious room, clean, friendly staff. Located near beach and shopping mall!

I chose this hotel for a recent trip to Honolulu primarily based on its proximity to the convention center (2 blocks) and was pleased with it overall. My room in the Kona Tower was not spacious but certainly not the smallest I've ever had. There was room for a double bed, a large desk/dresser, and a chair.
