After our fourth night, in the morning, we discovered food on the driver’s seat. After our fifth night, in the morning, we suspected a difference in the odometer and had the odd sensation that someone was making the car his home. On the sixth night, we wrote the mileage down. In the morning, we discovered a difference of 2 miles. The hotel’s overflow parking lot is only two blocks away if the car was parked there. We reported the mileage discrepancy to the hotel’s assistant manager. He apologized and said that he “will look into the matter”. Thereupon, we switched from valet parking to self-parking. We have not heard from the assistant manager in four months.

The Chinese restaurant was good, apart from the fact that hardly anyone speaks English. Pool ok. Best was the bellboy service. Check in was weak. Housekeeping especially in the bathroom also showed weaknesses.Room service is not existent except from outside.The internet is a bit tricky to get it to work but then it is find in speed. What I also didn't like is that there is plenty of parking available in the attached shopping mall and you are asked to pay $ 15 for self parking and $ 20 for valet parking.Main issue was the rate policy, you can book this condo at a better rate through 3rd parties like hotels.com etc. rather than direct. In other words they send away the customer to pay some 10, 20, 30 % commission if not more... Not consumer friendly at all as you end up paying more dealing direct with the hotel.The location for tourism is not so good as the beach is a bit of a walk, the attached shopping mall however is of course an advantage.

I booked online direct with the hotel. Got a rate of $119/night for a non-balcony room in the older tower. Upon check in, we upgraded for only $10 more per night to be in a room with a balcony, in the newer tower, higher floor and earlier check in. What a deal. What a view! Room was clean, a/c worked well. Self parking $15 or valet $20 per night. Go for the self parking. There's a convenient elevator from the lobby direct to the garage below.We usually stay in Waikiki but loved being close to Ala Moana Center.

First off the location is conveniently located to the Ala Moana Mall, many restaurants and shopping including a Wal-Mart which is great for stocking up on snacks and beverages. The closest beach is across the street but it's a good walk so it's better to drive. The Ala Moana Beach is not ideal because of all the rocks. You definitely need aqua shoes for this particular beach. The front desk staff was friendly and we were able to book a spacious one bedroom suite on the spot for 10 nights (our original reservations to a privately owned suite were cancelled unbeknownst to us but that's another story of it's own). There is a $15/day charge for self parking in their underground garage. Parking was extremely difficult and filled up fast. If you got back to the hotel after 7pm the legitimate parking spots were often taken up and many cars ended up making their own parking spots. Upon arrival to the room we found a huge dead cockroach in the bedroom. That was an immediate turn off and it got me nervous thinking of there were other creepy crawlers that would manifest. Luckily we didn't experience or see any roaches or bed bugs throughout the rest of our stay. The one bedroom suite was surprisingly bigger than what we expected. The decor is contemporary and updated. There was a firm king size bed in the master and a double sofa sleeper in the living room. The mattress to the sofa sleeper was awful! The springs were felt on every square inch of the mattress and it was thin and downright uncomfortable. There was a small kitchenette suitable for cooking but the kitchen is not stocked with any pots/pans or cooking utensils so it was pointless. Who goes on a vacation 2400 miles from their home and packs cooking supplies in their suitcase? There are 2 mini refrigerators which was nice as well as a convection oven and a microwave oven to reheat leftovers. There is no room service in the hotel. The air conditioning worked excellent and there were 2 separate controls for the A/C for the living room and master bedroom. The bathroom was spacious. I was extremely disappointed with swimming pool. It's not heated and even in the peak of the hot summer season the pool water was extremely cold. For some reason there is always a cold breeze/trade winds blowing in the pool deck making it even more cold. The most shallow part of the pool is 3 feet and really not suitable for young children. They have extremely strict pool rules and will only allow arm bands and vests for the kids. Noodle sticks, other floatation devices and toys are not allowed. The pool deck is the worst. It's made of rock gravel and hurts when you walk on it. The loose gravel rocks also get into the pool so beware when you walk and step painfully on them. This entire pool needs to be upgraded. Our children were extremely disappointed that the pool wasn't more kid friendly. The worst experience was when my husband's finger got shocked and burned when the hair dryer plug sparked a fire. After administering first aid from our room with ice, water, antibiotic ointment and a bandaid we called the front desk to report the incident and they sent someone to give us a replacement hair dryer. The switch to the replacement hair dryer seemed faulty so we had to have another one sent up. The next morning my husband reported the incident to the guest relations manager and all he did was take notes, offer my husband ice and a bandaid and asked if he wanted to file a report with security. My husband declined the ice and bandaid because the incident occurred the night before. When he asked what filing a report to the security would do he did not get an answer so he declined to file a report. The management failed to send someone to our room to check the faulty hair dryer and bathroom outlet. No one ever contacted my husband to follow up on his injury. Thank goodness the hotel bathroom did not go up in flames and injure our 3 young children. So much for customer service and satisfaction. After this experience I'll be looking for another hotel next time we visit Oahu.

The location worked out great, however I thought the hotel would be better for the rate they charge. The rate seems high even kaamaina or government rate when there is not much availability to justify what the hotel offers. There is no room service. The rooms were really small with small televisions. We were supposed to have a king bed, but it was more like a queen, very small. The parking was expensive and hard to find available parking. The pool was cold, really small, crowded and not good for small children. That was very disappointing, since we really wanted to use the swimming pool. It was hard to get the air conditioner adjusted properly - either it was too cold or would get too warm. Since I am a local resident from another island I know we could have stayed at a nicer place with better accomodations overall for the price that we paid there. I would not stay again or recommend to anyone else.

On top of the $150 a night, they charge $15 for self parking.  There were only 3 people working at reception, so the line was long.  The rooms were neat and nice, but very small.  The pillows and bed were too firm for me.  The location is great for shopping or taking kids to the beach across the street if you don't mind the walk.  The hotel is nicer than a few other similarly priced rooms in honolulu, but lacks in size.  Any noise in the corridors carries easily through the door into the rooms.  My Key would not let me into my room, 3 calls and 30 minutes later security finally let me in.  Swimming pool is very small and cold, not recommended.

We had to extend our stay one night and the hotel we were in was full. We got there way before check in but the front desk found a room for us within one hour. Our room was lovely with a view of the ocean. The staff at the Ala Moana are very helpful and pleasant. If a traveler wants to shop, it is right there at the Ala Moana Shopping center. I imagine locals from the outer islands when coming to Oahu to shop, would want to stay here. When we come to Oahu in the future, we plan to stay a few days at a Waikiki hotel and a few days at the Ala Moana.

The first room I was given had not been cleaned and was quite filthy. I didn't even want to touch the phone to call the main desk from the room because there was all kinds of disgusting debris on it. The second room was much nicer but it wasn't the first impression I was looking for. Housekeeping was always quite late in the day - I think my room was the last one to be cleaned at around 5pm. The pool was quite nice and never too busy and the room was comfortable. I probably wouldn't return to this hotel but overall it was a decent stay.

We had a nice room overlooking the pool and with a view of the ocean. Decor was great, everything worked, it was clean, bathtub was a little small. Great if you are into shopping-there is a walkway from the 2nd floor to Ala Moana Shopping Center. There are several restaurants in the shopping center. Breakfast buffet in the hotel was fine. Parts of the hotel are "condos" which are privately owned. This is fairly common in Hawaii-but it is a different ambiance from a full service hotel. Lobby is rather stark.

We booked this room as a cheap "last night stay" to get a better deal on our flight. It served its purpose, but I wouldn't stay here for a long period of time, especially with teens along. The beds were small (doubles) and not too comfortable, and our room smelled musty. The storage was good, and the bathroom was very nice. However, the hair dryer and iron had obviously seen better days. They were very old and it looked like the hair dryer had been broken and simply reassembled, poorly. We didn't have a problem with parking, but we checked in early and never moved our car. Good security, you need a room card to access your room floor, but I assume this is because it has so many entrance points, including the parking lot and the skywalk to the mall. The location was convenient if you like to shop, as it is adjacent to the Ala Moana mall, and a 3 to 4 block walk to beginning of Waikiki.

The main issue was the expensive insufficient parking - the tiny lot was always crammed full, and we're relatively certain their staff scratched the side of our rental car on one of the occasions when the parking lot was full and they took our keys to double park it themselves. The tiny lot was so full that it's surprising they don't scratch everyone's car. We know we didn't scratch it, but the rental car company was mad when they noticed it on our return, so we immediately called the hotel. They first punted and said it wasn't them, since they outsource their parking to some other company, but when I pointed out that I had paid them $45 for 3 nights of parking, they said they would be in touch about a police report. We still haven't heard from them, four days after I called them about this.Other problems:-I got in late at night and there was no food to be had - all the restaurants listed on the website and in the elevator seem to be temporarily closed. We had to order in pizza.-Toiletries did not include conditioner, just shampoo.-Internet was only wired and they couldn't provide a splitter for the ethernet cable - what are you supposed to do if you have two people who have work to do on two different computers?Overall, the place was clean, little porch was nice, and the location convenient. But I'm pissed about the car.

Booked this hotel with otel.com and paid in advance for 2 rooms. But the hotel lost our booking and made us wait for 5 hours. I was traveling with an 85-year old with a heart condition. After a long transatlantic flight, you just want to rest and not have to wait for your room which you already paid for in advance! with I had to call otel.com several times so they can sort out the mess with the reservations. Terrible customer service from both otel.com AND Ala Moana.

We live in Hawaii, so we are pretty familiar with what to expect in a hotel here. A friend warned me that the parking was a mess and I thought "How bad can parking be?" Well, I found out!!! It is SO inconvenient, that we didn't want to leave the hotel after we parked. The lot was usually FULL so we had to double-park or were told to park across the street (and still pay the $15 hotel parking fee!) And don't get duped into thinking that the hotel is conveniently connected to the Ala Moana shopping mall - it is not! As for the room - it was so small that there wasn't enough room to pass between the bed and the desk when someone was sitting at the desk!! I had prepaid for 3 nights and the receptionist forgot to take a credit card impression when we checked in, so on the second night they DISABLED our room key and had the security guard escort us to the front desk when we tried to get into our room!!! I got a fairly good rate booking through an online service, but I would gladly have paid more for a pleasant stay. The room was clean, but I will never stay at this hotel again.

We stayed in their Kona Tower Lower Level room with one queen bed. Room is extremely small, but extremely clean and storage very efficient! If you need a king bed, make sure u book the right type of room! Skywalk directly to Ala Moana mall via Macy's parking lot, and hotel is about a few mins drive to the main area of Waikiki. If you want the beach experience, this hotel is not for u, there are plenty of cheaper, but not as clean properties that is much closer to the beach area, but if you dont mind dealing with having to drive and find parking in Waikiki, this hotel is excellent for the price!**Beware of the hotel parking. They only have a limited number of space below the hotel and we encountered problems Thursday and Friday night when we returned around 11pm being told to fend for ourselves because its full, even though we had pre-paid parking! They eventually told us to park at the First Hawaiian Bank lot two blocks away after us having to circle for 30mins! Parking lot attendants is not part of the hotel, so pull to the front and ask the valet if you encounter problems parking instead of dealing with these rude people.

My husband and I spent 11 nights at this hotel with our two teenage children aged 17 and 16. We were a bit concerned after reading all the reviews but we had a lovely time with no troubles at all.Although there was a large lineup to book in and get keys, the line moved quickly and the staff were pleasant.The hotel is a $30 taxi ride from the Int. airport.We had a king bed and sofa bed in our room because another of our children was booked to come but he became sick and wasn't able to travel. Had we needed this sofa it would have been too cramped in the room but presented no problem when it wasn't needed. Our two children were in a two double bed room next door as the hotel doesn't have interconnecting rooms but they did accommodate us by being side by side.There was no noise in the corridors and we were there over the July 4th weekend.The hotel offers shampoo but no conditioner.The one jug in the room can also be used as a coffee maker with the sachets of coffee provided.The 2 laundries offer powder at the price of $1.25, the large washing machines at the price of $2.00 and the driers at a cost of $2.50 for a 36 minute cycle.The hotel has a skybridge walkway to the Ala Moana shopping centre which takes about a 3minute walk to get there, and the Ala Moana beach park is situated at the end of the carpark on the same level 2 skybridge, down the steps and across the road which takes about 6 mins. It is a fantastically huge swimming area with no waves and great amenities provided.The pool on level 3 is a good size and towels are provide, even allowing guests to take them over to the beach and return the same day or next morning.There are a number of convenience/gifts shops on the lobby level.We tipped the housekeeping $3 per room per night and gave an Aussie present per room per night, and the housekeepers were happy with that.Before shopping at Macys go to level 4 with photo ID and pick up your 10% discount card which lasts one month. Some of the cosmetics are not available for this discount.The Ala Moana shopping centre opens from 9-9pm most days but closes at 6pm on Sundays.Waikiki Beach is about a 20 minute walk from the hotel, but buses and trolleys go there frequently, leaving from across the beach park.There are two banks around the corner from the hotel.Sts Peter and Paul Catholic Church is just a quick walk of 2 short blocks and it offers Saturday afternoon Reconciliation from 3.30-4.30pm, and Saturday evening Mass at 5pm with beautiful singing. And numerous Masses are held on Sunday mornings.The Ward Cinema complex is a 12-15 minute walk away, and take your own mug because they offer free softdrinks from the dispensers. Several films show at the same time over 15 cinemas.Walmart is also a short walk away and offers everything.Taxis are permamently stationed at the entrance to the hotel so there is never any waiting. The bellhop counter has a scale in case you want to weigh your luggage, and the daily newspaper is provided free from this counter if you are early enough to get it but it is only 75c anyway.I hope this helps anyone who is considering the hotel, I put in the things that I would have liked to know from a family point of view. Thanks for reading.

Stayed here with a friend for 4th of July weekend. A couple things went wrong with this hotel:1) No parking was available. We were forced to park at the mall since the entire parking lot was full. When we spoke with the manager, he gave us an "excuse" about how they e-mailed everyone saying parking isn't guaranteed. Although I did not receive an e-mail, he still could not guarantee a parking stall and ultimately ended up not helping us out at all.2) Hotel staff are rude, unfriendly, and unhelpful. While standing in line to check-in, the staff couldn't even manage the line since people were constantly cutting in front of others. When we were finally helped, the receptionist breezed through our check-in so quickly, she failed to inform us of some important information about our stay... like where the Kona Tower elevators were, for instance.I would not recommend staying at this hotel. Being a local here on Oahu, this was the worst experience I have had. Trust me when I say this, there was so many other hotels you can find with much better service and accommodations for an equal or lesser rate.

I last stayed in this hotel in 1969 while on R&R from Vietnam as I have done other islands ever since. So, with a business trip right in Honolulu neccesitating a stay over I thought, why not! It was certainly fun in 1969! I must admit I approached it with some trepidation since it is now an "old" hotel but was pleasantly and happily surprised to discover it is still nice, clean, and good value for the money, and the breakfast buffet is realy - really good! The valet parking was $15 a day but a bargain considering the fee everywhere else. And having the Ala Moana shopping center right next door and available by skybridge was great, did all of the requisite gift shopping in an hour and never had to move the car.

The hotel and rooms are clean and well kept, everything in the hotel was in good condition. Valet Parking was $20/day which may seem like a lot but most hotels in Waikiki self parking is $24/day (Ala Moana is just a 5-10 minute walk to Waikiki). My only issue with the hotel is we reserved 2 double beds and Ocean View, but got a King Size bed and the Ocean View room is in the corner and "felt" small and they put us on the 6th floor which barely has any view at all. We had an 11 year old with us so one King Size bed was not going to work. When we went back to the front desk the women was put off that we wanted to change our room. She reluctantly found us a room with 2 double beds on the 18th floor, and so I was relieved that it worked out but then when we got to the room it was a partial ocean view, I could have gone back and complained but it was 4th of July weekend the hotel was packed, so I let it go, although I think they should have reduced our rate.

Looking forward to our next visit. Had 2 teenage girls visiting from Minnesota and they loved the pool. the exercise room, the closeness of shopping at Ala Moana Shopping Center and the easy access to Magic Island and the beach.

Although the television was extremly small and hard to see from the bed, I enjoyed myself, My teenage children loved walking over to Ala Moana shopping center, and working out in the hotel gym. I was able to take advantage of the free admission to Rumors night club and met up with some friends, only thing that I found very upsetting was when the younger growd under 30 were rude calling my friends old people, that's when I was embarresed for myself and friends.

Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights . Booked through Expedia .com . We were given a small room , supposedly a superior room. The carpet was filthy,\and badly stained, the toilet had not been flushed and the TV failed to work. We went and complained and were given another room in the other tower. A bit cleaner but still very small. The reservation staff were very rude and we had to pay extra for a supposed upgrade!!!!! Never stay there again!

We were in Honolulu for a family wedding. Ala Moana hotel is a good location. Our room was nothing special and our view was a parking lot. Room was clean, a bit small but okay. The only greeting we received in the 5 days was a call about checking out the time share there. Staff at front desk were not friendly and bell person was not able to help with directions to sites. We would probably not stay there again although it was so close to Ala Moana Mall which made restaurants and shopping convenient.

We stayed at this hotel for one week and were very pleased with the quality and comfort. We stayed in the Kona Tower which are the smaller room with a baby and we were fine. The room was update and very clean and we were so happy with everything. Do not hesitate to stay here......very close to large shopping mall and beach. We would definitely stay here again.

Super-close to the Hawaii Convention Center (perfect for business) and Ala Moana center is a convenient place to get food, a drink, or do some shopping. Ala Moana park is nice and Waikiki beach is an easy walk. My conference hotel was the Hilton where I've stayed before, but the price here was about half. Plus, the Hilton tries to suck you in at every turn with very expensive food and drink. Here, you can simply walk to the attached mall and find a wide variety of food at reasonable prices. Rooms here are smaller than Hilton but are comfortable and surprisingly stylish for the price. Exercising at Ala Moana park and shopping at Ala Moana center made me feel a bit more like I was mixed in with locals than in previous trips to Honolulu.

Looks nice on the outside, but the inside lacks the style and quality of similar priced hotels in the city.This hotel's main issue is their service. After arriving in Honolulu and driving to the Ala Moana hotel, I was the ONLY customer in line. There were honestly three agents behind the check-in desk just talking to each other like I didn't exist. After one of them glanced at me, she turned up her nose and walked behind a translucent wall behind the counter to enter a back room. Eventually after a couple more minutes of ignorance, one of the remaining reception agents (ladies) called "Next in line," like there was anybody else in line. Upon checking in, the receptions agents DO NOT greet you with a smile or even an "Aloha." They rudely place papers and pens on their counter space for you to smile.Knowing this was a recently renovated hotel, I had high hopes for the rooms at least. The rooms were dark and small. I was told this hotel was "cheap" and it definitely looked CHEAP. The beds were not comfortable and there were few hotel amenities available compared to other hotels down the road of similar price that I've stayed at before.Yes, it is only a minute's walk away from the main mall but that's probably all this hotel has going for it.I definitely will try to AVOID staying at this hotel if at all possible.

The hotel is not located on the main strip of Waikiki Beach, which can be a good or bad thing depending on whether you want to be at the center of all the action. It is, however, conveniently located right beside a very nice mall called the Ala Moana Center, which offers great shopping and a nice food court so you don't have to look far for a place to eat. Rooms are alright -- a little small but most likely you will be spending most of your time outdoors on tour or at the beach/mall so it doesn't really matter much. Cleanliness is okay, although I did notice a small cockroach in the bathroom one night. Service is generally ok, but it seems like the staff just does the bare minimum to be polite. There was, however, one very rude attendant at the front desk named Melissa. The night before our flight was to leave Hawaii, we just wanted to ask her how long it would take to get to the airport if we left at 7 in the morning (and if it would be cheaper to take the shuttle or a taxi for a party of 4). We also wanted to inquire about how crowded the airport usually gets in the morning so we could estimate the best time for us to leave the hotel to get to the airport. Melissa rudely rebuffed us and told us to call the airport ourselves to ask how crowded it usually gets in the morning. She also at first did not want to call the taxi company to ask how much their rate would be -- just lazily giving us a grossly inaccurate estimate ($40 per head, when it turned out to be actually $40 total for the four of us when I pressed her to call). Now these are questions that normally any front desk would be able and willing to answer for guests at the blink of an eye, but all Melissa would say is: "I don't know these things, I never leave this island." Good thing her colleague who passed by noticed how upset I was getting and gave me all the information I needed very courteously. Overall though, value for money is okay as we paid only $108 per night for twin sharing. As mentioned earlier, service could just use improvement, and rude staff should be weeded out (especially in such a service-oriented industry).

The hotel is great if you want to be close to the Ala Moana Shopping Center. It's not a hotel to stay in if you want to lounge by the pool.Reported that the TV would not stay off, unless it was disconnected. A clue should have been that the TV was unpluged when we arrived. We could not watch any movies, since it would not allow us to select English on the Menu. When it was reported, no compensation was given, which I thought was unfair since we are the type that stay out all day and come back at nigh to relax and watch a movie at night.Only stay there for the location.

Let me preface this review by saying that my family and I have stayed at this hotel many, many, many times over the past 20 years. Unfortunately, the last 3 or 4 stays (taken in sometime in the past 2 years) have been very frustrating for us. Once the hotel made online booking available, the excellent service that we used to get went downhill!!! Booking online is supposed to be a convenience, as long as you don't have any "special requests" or use a special rate. We booked online and got the $89 Kamaaina rate for the Kona Tower. The one thing that the website fails to mention is that if you request 2 double beds with that rate, you won't get them because the Kona Tower doesn't have them and the hotel will switch your rooms, but for a higher rate. Also, we were told that "requests" made on the website aren't always honored. When I suggested that they take the requests off of the website, the front desk clerk told me that I should make that suggestion to the hotel because my voice would probably be better heard than theirs...talk about passing the buck and not being real helpful!! Don't get me wrong, if I hadn't had this exact same problem the last 3 or 4 times I went there, I would be raving about this hotel, it's super convenient, very comfortable and the $89 Kamaaina rate is the best I've found in the Waikiki area, but.......if you need something other then a queen size bed with a pull-out couch, it's SO NOT WORTH IT!!!
View was great, location was good, room was clean and staff was very nice. BUT I'd never stay there again because there is no room service. Also the bathroom was not great for $149/night.

After the renovations a few years ago, I absolutely LOVED this hotel, even though the pool wasn't anything great. This time around, ugh, I was so disappointed. We checked in and noticed old food in our refrigerator. There was also a brown dried up liquid substance all over the bathroom doorknob. The bed skirts had stains on them and we had 2 different beds as if one was from before the renovations, and the other was from after...actually half of it was, because the top looked new and the box spring was old. The carpet had stains and the room was just overall not as clean as I expected/remembered. They also changed their bedding from a nice contemporary look, to old thin ugly hawaiian print cheapy bedspreads...it would've even looked better WITHOUT any bedspread. What a shame that they didn't upkeep their renovations and it seems to be going downhill. Now where do I stay??? Ala Moana was my favorite for great rooms at great prices.

This is my second time I've stayed at the Ala Moana Hotel for extended 2 week business trips. I was looking for a hotel that offered a gym, self laundry, microwaves, and refrigerators in the room. This hotel offers all of this and is adjacent to the Ala Moana Mall where one can walk to the grocery store, restaurant, or stores. This hotel is perfect for the business traveler where they want to be away from the noise of the vactioners but in walking distance to Waikiki Beach for evenings.

The first thing that really surprised me in this hotel was the absence of room service. It took of about 24 hours to realise that I could actually buy food downstairs at the shop inside the hotel, as well as go to the vast shopping complex next door. Still, when one needs food inside the room for a last minute nibble, this can be annoying. I changed rooms very early on, as my budget room was very small and claustrophobic. The upgrade was worth it, even without a sea view. The big disappointment was the tourism desk, which was always occupied by a different person, which meant that from one day to the next, one could be given different options and not find any given the day before. This location is not for ecologically conscious people, but then again, nothing in Hawaii is anyhow.

As a frequent traveler to HNL from Maui, I find the AMH a quality and a value. Parking is off the concentrated grid of Waikiki and convenient access from or to all directions.There are plenty of restaurants in the area within walking distance. The Chinese Restaurant in the hotel may seem a tourist trap, but it's top notch! (I am a Chef Educator) Rooms are compact but furnished with just the right amount of amenities...you won't be in your room much anyway. Don't expect a lot of frills but its clean and convenient.On the Maukua-side, traffic is noisy with garbage trucks pulling up in the morning. So, if you are on vacation book a ocean-side room.

I was able to get a room during the Honolulu triathlon being held within walking distance to the hotel.... What a fabulous treat..... no car parking hassles in the morning. Turned in bike and walked to hotel to begin my rest in a quiet, and very clean environment. Bike friendly.... I'm getting my reservations in early for next year....

Once again a great value and a quality stay. Top notch staff is always friendly and ready to accomodate. The rooms are clean and quiet and well appointed. Treat yourself and pay a little extra for the ocean side view room. The close proximity to the Ala Moana mall is a real plus and offers plenty of great eating, shopping and entertainment (not to mention a excellant exercise track for the early morning walk). Be sure to stop by Bubba Gumps for a cold beer and a bucket of garlic shrimp but go early enough to enjoy the daytime view from the bar.

This was the second time I stayed in this hotel. My first stay there seemed entertaining. The club and lobby bar were both opened in the evening. This time around, I stayed for 3 days. Arrived on a Sunday and departed on a Wednesday. This time it was kinda boring. The lobby bar only opens on Thursday and the club opening on weekends. The restaurant in the lobby only opens for breakfast. It would be nice if they opened for lunch and dinner. The front desk service was average. When I checked-in, the front desk clerk who looked like a supervisor (wearing a different type of uniform) was a little on the upset side. It would be nice if you greeted and smiled. Maybe it was because I looked local. hahaha. Little did she know my purpose. I commend the housekeeper that was on the 15th floor. She was very nice and did a wonderful job. The room was ok, wish they didn't give me the handicap room. They could of saved it for one who may of needed it. All in all, my stay was good. Will come back again. Hopefully they have more entertainment and things to do in the hotel. Good way to keep the guest in the property and maybe spend more money. Just a thought.

I was offered a very good price on rooms through the organization I was speaking for and wound up getting my room for $10 less per night. The room was all I needed and was quite comfortable. I was able to enjoy the Hawaiian music program on Thursday night in the Pakele Lounge and it was free! My room wasn't huge but I didn't need any more space than I had. The bed was very comfortable and I had a multipurpose microwave and a mini-refrigerator. I look forward to returning and the Ala Moana is on the top of my list for places to stay.

Have stayed here many times, but staff has been instructed by management not to give free upgrades even if rooms are available. Hotel is focusing too much on the bottom dollar and not guest ultimate satisfaction.

My wife and I recently spent 9 days at the Ala Moana Hotel during late April and early May. The lobby and room were immaculately maintained, the staff were all pleasant and helpful, and the location is awesome. Will never stay anywhere else when visiting Honolulu.

It is quite nice hotel. There is some distance to Waikiki Beach so when u expect a night life it is not good hotel for u. There is a nice lady from Expedia down in the lobby - when u can book all island activities such as Helicopter Tours, Island Circle, Polynesia Show with a pick up from the hotel.Rooms are clean and nice - with everything you need. There is a shopping Center close to the hotel with various shops and food corner. In the hotel there is two restaurants - Chineese and Japaneese one. Overall it is nice quiet hotel for a couple of nights.
Hotel was nice and clean but lacked amenities of competition

The rooms were nice and clean. The only setback was that when we got into the elevator, we were unaware that we needed to use our room card to get to our destined floor. We pressed the floor number several times and consequently assumed the elevator to be broken. We then got off to board another elevator only to be met with the same problem. Fortunately, another guest at the hotel happened along and showed us what to do. We checked in at about 9:00 pm and the children were quite tired and cranky. If he hadn't shown up, it would have been an unnecessary walk back to the front desk. It's been ages since we stayed at the Ala Moana, or any hotel for that matter, so this was a new experience for us. It would have been nice if the Front Desk Clerk had gone over the details with us. At any rate, thanks for the opportunity to share our experience.

I enjoyed my visit at the Outrigger Ala Moana Hotel, and wished I could have stayed longer. The room was clean, and the bed was nice. The staff was very helpful and friendly. It was a nice location next to the shopping center, and also near some friends that I was visiting. The air condition was good. It was also near a Walmart/Sams Club, Walgreens, Longs Drug Store, Sears, and Macys. A grocery store, Foodland, and a post office are also in the shopping mall, as were some of the above mentioned stores, so the location was great. Thanks again for the nice stay at your hotel.

I was in Hawaii on a budget and was staying at a cheaper and much less inviting hotel and decided to treat myself for the last night of my stay and stay at the Ala Moana. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. The room was very clean and the bed was like sleeping on air. I had a view of the ocean is was very nice. The entire hotel is very nicely decorated and clean. The mall is right next door which was a plus. The only downside is location- it is quite a hike from the beach. If this hadn't been my last night in Hawaii and I hadnt already done all my sightseeing this really would have been a problem. But it worked for me and will work for you too if you dont want to be around all the hustle and bustle of Wakiki Beach.

11/23 -11/30/2009. We enjoyed our stay at the Ala Moana. Staff showed much patience with the large group of us! Our room was a surprise to us, with a partial ocean/marina view. Room well furnished. Within walking distance to Ala Moana Shopping Center. Refrigerator/microwave. Elevators were slow, but again a very large group attending international convention stayed at the hotel. Concierge was very nice. Daily breakfast was delicious. I would definitely recommend this hotel unless you desire to stay oceanfront at Waikiki Beach! If ever in Honolulu again, this would be our hotel of choice!

Forced by a medical emergency it was required to locate a hotel on short notice. A reasonable rate was also a priority. Everything came together to save us with their support at time of registration through a period of day-by-day extension of occupancy. Thank you so much for all you did!

Don't believe the website as the hotel looks nice until you get there. Checked in to very unfriendly staff, a valet that gave me directions "up the escalator" - only the escalator in front of us was clearly broken and taped off with yellow construction tape. The public space is in dire need of some attention. The "ocean view" is really a view of the mall's parking lot with a peekaboo of the water so don't expect much. I will say the room was very small but clean and thankfully I was only there less than 12 hours. For $100 in Hawaii, you need to set the bar low and then you won't be disappointed.

I had asked for a 2:00pm check in and the room was ready. The room was recently refurbished and included a flat screen TV on the wall for easy viewing from the bed. A refrigerator and microwave were also included. The room was nicely decorated and the bed was comfortable. I walked to the Ala Moana Shopping Center and caught the Pink trolly for a $2:00 fare to the heart of Waikiki. Was able to then take a city bus for $2.25 out to the Ward Center. Very easy to get around. No need to rent a car and deal with the traffic. The bell desk made a reservation for me for the airport shuttle to pick me up. $10.00. one way. However, if you don't have a lot of luggage you can take the airport bus #20 for $2.25 to the airport. Since then I returned to work and I have told so many people about my wonderful experience at the Ala Moana Hotel. Great Place!

My three day conference was held at the Ala Moana Hotel and due to the expense of traveling from Kauai I choose to stay at the hotel for the simplicity of it all. The food served for continential breakfast had an abundance of fruits and pastry all delicious and the lunches were simply fantastic! The room was very clean and neat, LOVE the room amenities of the hair dryer, coffee maker, microwave, refrigerator, iron and ironing board. My last stay at a Honolulu airport room did not have amenities and was just as expensive as my room rate at the Ala Moana Hotel. Really like the location next to the Ala Moana Shopping Center where I did my shopping and eating. Sorry didn't get to check out any restaurants at the Ala Moana Hotel they were all too pricy for me. All the staff was friendly and helpful! Loved it all!!! Will stay there again.

Hotel staff did not relay to Wackenhut security guards that we were not checking out on date planned. Front desk knew, maid knew, so why send security to barge into room? Teenage daughter was taking nap and cell phone rings, she wakes up to see two security guard standing in the room watching her sleep! Said they were doing routine checks to see if people had checked out, maybe the luggage at the door should have gave them a clue. Questioned daughter even after she identified herself as a minor. When the security guard was asked later why did you stay in the room after you saw the sleeping girl - reply was I called for backup - another MALE guard. Very frightening

There have been two people who have been helpful and friendly: the woman who checked me in and the woman who runs a gift store. the counter help are MISERABLE. you see, i am somehow not staying in one of the hotel's maintained rooms. apparently private people hold some of the rooms and if you book through an agent instead of the hotel, you are OUT OF LUCK when it comes to having ANY service. what i mean is I will be here for 4 nights and will not get fresh towels, have my sheets changed or bed made, get new shampoo, etc. those things i could live with, but I drink coffee in the mornings and one little flimsy bag is not enough, so i have 4 in my room at checkin, one for each morning, ostensibly. well, I need twice that, nicely ask the front desk, in person, who PULLS UP MY ROOM NUMBER.. have you ever heard of that ? over COFFEE? and then the woman has the audacity to politely tell me that they do not accomodate those rooms because of the private owner thing. This hotel SUCKS> i would never ever ever stay here again...i mean, you cannot throw me a dime bag's worth of coffee? gimme a break. work on SERVICE>...that is the only thing you could possibly have going for you, considering the distance from the strip and the loudness of the streets around this hotel. I would NOT recommend it. oh, also, you have to PAY for the business center. get real.

I am finally getting around to write this review. I traveled to Honolulu to participate in the Honolulu Marathon on 12/13/09. I booked a room at the AMH for the night before as it was only a short walking distance to the start line. I called the hotel around 2:00 p.m. that day to confirm my room & ask about ammenities, such as mirco/fridge, etc. I was advised check in was at 4:00 p.m. and they were not allowing any early check in so not to arrive until after 4:00 p.m. My husband & I finished our shopping & arrived at the hotel around 4:15 with my dinner in hand to take up to my room. I about died when I saw there was a line the entire length of the lobby with a MINIMUM of 100 people....all trying to check in.....seroiusly! Worst yet, they were not even fully staffed & there were three check out counters not even being used. I was so angry. The last thing I wanted to do 12 hours before running 26 miles was stand on my feet for 2 hours. Thank goodness my wonderful husband stood in line for me while I waited in a chair in the lobby, however most people weren't that lucky. My husband made many friends during his 1 + hour stint in line, and everyone he spoke with was there for the marathon. This hotel is the closest to the start line, so obviously a very popular choice. The hotel knew how many people were set to check in that day. The marathon has been running for 25+ years, so this wasn't their first rodeo. So, my question is WHY wasn't this more organized? Why didn't they have every available station open? Why didn't they at least let people check in early & leave their bags if there room wasn't ready? When I FINALLY arrived in my room, my dinner was cold, so thank goodness for the one plus of the room.....the microwave. I had paid for an oceanview room, which I didn't even get to use. My husband & I had plans to sit on our balcony & enjoy our dinner. By the time we got to the room the sun had gone down, it was getting dark, and it was an hour before bedtime! I seriously hope the AMH does something to improve this situation for next years race, or they will likely lose a lot of return participants.

We found this ideal for our overnight stop and would have no hesitation in staying longer next time we visit Hawaii. Staff were very attentive and responsive to our requests. Quality of fittings were excellent One suggestion - make sure your Keycard works. A minor problem immediately rectifiedWe found all 3 Outriggers excellent - Beachcomber, Royal Kahan (Maui) and would defintely use them again

Ala Moana Hotel is centrally located and a great value. Amenities were outstanding, as was cleanliness-better, in fact, than the Hilton Village in which we stayed earlier in the week. The front desk was friendly and helpful. (They let me check in several hours early, and check out late in the afternoon, allowing for a pre-flight freshen-up). THe bedding was superb. Just an outstanding value.
The hotel met our needs. Room was clean and had a fridge and microwave. Not a high end hotel (ie the Ritz Carlton), but it was good for the price.

This was our first and likely last visit to the Ala Moana Hotel. We chose this hotel because of the location. Staff was indifferent, and details were missed such as such as no sugar or coffee stirrers left in the room with the coffee. Several of the restaurants in the hotel appeared to have been closed for quite some time. The pool and fitness center were nice, although we were surprised to be told the pool closed at 6 pm when the door stated hours were until 10 pm. Compared with other Outrigger properties we've stayed at in Hawaii, this is a poor value.
This is the first time I stayed at the Ala Moana and I found it very convenient to all the downtown amenities. Pleasant stay.

Always stay at the condominium near Waikiki, but is important by shopping this time; because was aimed, decided on this hotel. Like Luke Hana who hated Roy of Maui Island, it was the room which was splendid in the 35th floor of the rank up. However, almost schedule was cancellation for a tsunami warning for 28 days. Probably I may not look at deserted Ala Moana Shopping Center twice.I stayed at the Alamo hole district for the first time, but thought that I was very convenient than I thought.I intend to do it here on the next time.

I meant to do this sooner. We arrived in Honolulu on the 6th for a week. My poor hubby was sick for 4 of the 7 days :( Other then that we had a great time. Our balcony had a view of the pool,city,and a glimpse of the ocean. It was our 2yr olds favorite location,he loved watching the busses&planes zooming by.The room had a large comfy bed,small fridge,and tv. We would definitely stay at this hotel again,next time though I wouldn't mind upgrading so our toddler could have his own room.The location was great,the huge shopping center is next door,the beach is only a 5minute walk across the road,and there is a wonderful jogging pathway that goes through the Ala Moana park.

I love this hotel for many reasons. If you're a tourist though, it may not be for you. That's sort of what I love most about it. As a regular visitor to the Island, I feel more like a local than a tourist. I love staying at the Ala Moana because it's close to everything, but doesn't feel like Waikiki. The hotel lacks certain creature comforts like great bath products and room service, but it feels like home to me. All the rooms have a fridge and a microwave, so I usually hit the grocery store and eat healthily. The partial ocean views in the Waikiki tower have a stunning view, especially if you can get above the 15th floor. Also, great meeting space in the hotel for business. Perfect for business or leisure if you're mellow. If you want night life and in-room dining, hit Waikiki.

We booked a romantic package, but were given two twin beds; I don't get the rationale. We were told that the hotel was oversold and didn't have queen bed available. Check in process was long and the attitude poor.Otherwise, the room rate is reasonable and the room is clean. I recommend this place for a no-frills experience.Honolulu has deteriorated, go elsewhere for a weekend get-away.
I went to this hotel several times for my job. The bed and pillow are really nice. This hotel is very closed by AlaMoana shopping center. The breakfast is good.

My friend and I live on the big island and last minute we went to Honolulu on 2/19. Ala Moana hotel had the best deal...so we thought we scored. Upon arrival, valet and bellman (Marvin) were beyond nice and professional. They were, unfortunately the nicest part of the hotel that I experienced. GSA told us we were upgraded to a "bigger" room than what we initially got, I really don't care...we just need a safe and clean place to crash. I guess it is a GOOD thing for Ala Moana Hotel to have us because both of us are housekeeping managers and we found numerous things "unacceptable." Room 639: 1. Shower liner looks yellow and stinks 2. Plenty long hair around the toilet 3. Bath mat was ripped 4. Sheets had visible stain right by pillow 5. hair was visible below the top sheet 6. remote didn't work 7. CD player couldn't play CD 8. pill container left "outside" of waste basket. We called Engineering and Housekeeping to replace remote and cd player...then just when we thought it was over, opened the sofabed and NO SHEETS on! I called the MOD (name:Koji or Goji?) to stop by for me to show every discrepancy, his response was: NO, I CAN'T COME...I WILL CALL YOU BACK. When he called back, he still wouldn't come up and sent Asst HSKP Mgr instead. Asst HSKP Mgr offered us to room move and told me "if you need the sofabed to be made in new room, be sure to call us!"...I told him to ensure it happens as we speak because if I call again then I would just check out. After room move, we received no follow up phone call and no response heard! I never imagined this reputable hotel would have this type of ridiculous houskeeping standards. Since I heard nothing from their management, I will not go back and none of my friends will, either!

The rooms are dirty and smaller than a walk-in closet. The service is as bad as it can get. The workers don't care if you think this is a bad place to stay. Too expensive for what you get. Go stay at the Hilton Hawaiian Village.

When we first checked in my wife didn't have our credit card that we made the reservation with on line. The front desk attendent requested to see it, but I had it. So the front desk attendent asked for some other form of payment to pay for the parking. So my wife presented our debit card, and the entire room and parking amount was put on hold on our debit card. This was a problem for us because this was our spending money. This was just the beginning. We also didn't receive the services we paid for in regards to parking. Instead of parking in the parking structure, we had to park a couple of blocks away and walk back to the hotel. This was the first and last time I stay at this hotel!

Appreciated the great attitude, efficiency and helpfulness of all staff from the front desk, to bellboy to housekeeping to parking attendants. Even with the long lines to check in and out on a 3-day holiday, the staff kept the line moving steadily. Parking can be a squeeze: even with the paid $15/nite fee we got blocked in one night and had to park across the street in another lot the second night. Too many cars for the hotel's small underground lot, but the security is good down there. This is a good hotel for the value, and terriffic proximity to Ala Moana shopping center. Nice fitness center too, but bring your own headphones for the TVs on the cardio machines. Sauna and steam room are nice touches too.

We waited in a very long line to check in for our room. It took one hour to get through the line. It would have taken less time if the hotel had more people working the front desk. It was very frustrating to see three empty computer stations while waiting. The line wasn't any shorter when we got to the front.They told us we had a free upgrade. I don't know what the upgrade was as the room was the same. But the view was worse. I know this because I've stayed at the hotel many times before.Paying $15 for parking a night to me means we'll have parking in the hotel. Instead, when we returned to the hotel both evenings we were told to park at a bank three blocks away. It was very annoying to see them let a few cars into the parking lot while we walking back to the hotel from the bank. The parking attendant turned around and saw us watching him and just shrugged and said, "Oh, I just noticed there was a few empty spots inside."The location of the Ala Moana is good and the price is great. However, I do not want to stay at this hotel again.

Booked for $99. Got a room in the Kona Tower (doesn't have a great view). Room was immaculate and modern (a little on the small side), with tv, microwave, refrigerator, and best of all, FREE INTERNET (wired). Pros - across the street from Ala Moana Center, near Don Quijote Shopping Center, clean, good value, free internetCons - pool closes at 6, no room service, limited restaurants on-site.

The hotel is conveniently located with easy access to The Bus coming from the airport and going to Waikiki. It has a skywalk over to the Ala Moana Shopping Center with plenty of restaurants and shopping. It is just a shop walk to the park and a family friendly beach.My room was clean but the carpet definitely needed cleaning or replacing. The walls and the door had no soundproofing and every time someone walked up or down the hall, everyone heard every step and conversation. The refrigerator allowed us to enjoy a morning start of fresh juice and fruit that we purchased at a local store. They only gave us enough coffee for each of us to have one cup every morning.The biggest problem was with the concierges desk. One morning I waited 45 minutes before I left (unassisted) and went to another hotel to ask one question. The line never moved and nobody offered assistance to all of us waiting. Another day, I was given incorrect information about airport buses/shuttles which caused me to have to pay $30 at the last minute for a taxi to the airport and almost caused me to miss my flight!

I decided to stay in Ala Moana Hotel because of its location. You can walk to Ala Moana Mall via the sky bridge. You have different restaurants to choose ranging from high end (Alan Wong) to fast food ( food court). Several coffee shops to choose so you can just pick up a quick coffee in the morning. Front staff are friendly. Room is small (I have one queen bed), but relatively clean. Carpet is a bit old. It is a good price for the room especially I was hardly in the room until sleep time anyway.

We Stayed 4 nights at the Ala Moana (our second stay here). We chose to stay here because it was so convenient. We didn't need to rent a car because the mall with a fantastic food court was half a block away. All of the island buses also stop at the edge of the mall parking lot.  With the money we saved on the car rental, we opted for an ocean view room in the Kona tower. (We stayed in the Waikiki tower the last time). There is a big difference between the two towers. Both are spotless and tastefully decorated. The Waikiki tower has much larger rooms is on a busy street, and costs more. The Kona tower is quieter and cheaper, but the rooms are really crowded. and can only hold ne bed. Both were good.

Normally, I would have been happy with this hotel as it is a good price, but I chose it to be close to my doctor and the hospital and used it as my post-operation recovery base. Unfortunately, I expected a hotel of this quality to have room service so I would not have to leave my room to get food. They closed their room service some time ago apparently. Too bad.

This hotel is i the center of it all. It is attached to Hawaii's largest mall via a second floor ramp that puts you on the parking deck of Macy's at the Ala Moana Center. The mall just expanded and added a Nordstrom. Across the street is the Ala Moana Beach Park, with several beaches, tennis courts, walking/jogging trails and the Waikiki Marina.The Waikiki tower has ocean, city and mountain views depending on which way you look out the lanai. The Kona tower has mountain on one side and ocean on the other. The hotel is very clean, with great maids, there are four restaurants on different floors. Rumors on the first floor is very a very popular night club.The location is has everything and Waikiki is a short walk over the Ala Wai Canal. There are a multitude of great restaurants behind the hotel and Ala Moana Center that are less expensive than those in Waikiki.

I am always leery of booking hotels at low prices but I based my stay from the recommendations & reviews from various websites. This hotel is the real deal, the service was great, and even though they raised their valet parking from $15 to $27, they honored the old price because I printed off the hotel info from Expedia (Apparently the $ parking includes the valet tips, bonus for me cause I am cheap). The room was clean, small tubs are mentioned but honestly the shower was great for the type of weather there. All shopping and restaurants were within minutes and a short walk to the beach. We spent New Years here and there were no noise complaints. I would rebook at this hotel if I ever returned.

My wife and I spent the night at the Ala Moana as a convenience so that we wouldn't have to drive all the way home to Kapolei after midnight. We never stayed there before and though we have spent nights at other hotels in the Waikiki area, we never thought to try out this hotel. We were pleasantly surprized that this hotel was so very accomodating to the Kamaaina (local residents) and we could not have asked for friendlier people at the front desk. Rooms were spacious, with all the essentials you would expect from a high end hotel at a very reasonable price. Although we know that it's "as available", they offered us a late check out at no extra cost. Now that's what I call really making us feel special. The extra special perk was that Ala Moana Center is right outside the back entrance and we enjoyed the extra time to shop and dine without even driving elsewhere. We will certainly stay at the hotel again and will recommend it to all of our friends. Mahalo to the staff at this hotel for making our overnighter a very nice experience.

I have stayed at the Ala Moana Hotel three times during the past year, 24 nights in total, in the least expensive rooms (ranging from $109 to $129 per night plus taxes). The rooms have been fully adequate for my needs as a sole traveler; if my wife comes along on a future trip, I will reserve a larger room. The rooms that I stayed in were clean, well maintained and well-appointed. The hotel staff have been courteous, helpful and friendly on all occasions. With three restaurants on the premises, several others across the street in the Ala Moana Center, and numerous others within a few mnutes drive, I was not wanting for food or drink. Indeed, having breakfast in the Plantation Cafe, with its choce of hot or cold buffet is a fine way to start the day off. My appointments invariably take me downtown, which this hotel is closer to than any in Waikiki. And if I want to go for a walk, there is nearby Ala Moana Park. All told, this hotel is just right for me. Whenever I make my next trip from the East Coast to Honolulu, I will book my reservation there without any hesitation, looking forward to "Welcome Back" when I arrive.

I reserved a room for one night since we were having my company party in the hotel and found it to be much more convenient to stay in the same hotel. Well, I booked for a room at the cheapest rate possible which would have put us in the Kona Tower with the City View. To our amazement, we received a FREE upgrade to the Waikiki Tower with a nice King-sized bed and ocean view. We really appreciated being given that great deal and were sad that we had only booked the room for one night as we just loved being there! Thanks Ala Moana Hotel Staff! We look forward to staying in your hotel again!

Loved the hotel, clean, modern, and close to Ala Moana Mall/actually connected to the 2nd floor. Very cool for the shoppers and dining interest. Internet a plus!Also nice walking distance to everything. When we arrived we checked in at the counter (as we would at any hotel )and headed to the first elevator we came to. Got in t e elevator and noticed that there was not a 5th floor. Weird? We got off on the 6th floor and called the front desk. They stated that we have to get on another set of elevators and then go down an floor then we would be on the 6th floor. Confusing esp when we were tired from travel and were not explained this as the front desk. Note if your on the 5th floor remember that there is another elevator to get to it, not the main elevator. When we wanted to go the connection floor to Ala Moana mall, there is NO indication of how to get there, no signs and it is very confusing. Signs in the hall of the 2nd floor would be very helpful.I stayed in a room across from the Ice machine and it was VERY loud. Avoid this is you want to sleep. It is amazing how late people need ice. Not to mention the humming and crashing sound from the machine. Alot of this would have been avoided if someone had told us.

Beautifully furnished, comfortable room w/ microwave/convection oven, under counter fridge, flat screen t.v., great staff (especiallyJulie at reception_), convenient to mall and many restaurants made up for lack of 24 hr. coffee shop, great views from balcony. And super clean!!!

We liked the Ala Moana and would recommend it. We stayed two nights on the beginning and end of a vacation to other islands. We got the very reasonable Kama'aina rate because a family member lives in Hawaii.The hotel served as our base for touring the rest of Oahu. We liked that it was away from the noise and bustle of Waikiki Beach.The hotel is next to the huge Ala Moana Shopping Center, which had convenient, reasonably priced eating options. (We didn't go to Hawaii to shop.)A curious problem: The hot water faucets were installed backwards in the two rooms we stayed in. Guests had twisted the faucets so hard the wrong way that the faucets were loose. We had to hold the fixture with one hand and turn the knob with the other. How could they invest so much money in a hotel and hire a plumber who does not know how to install fixtures?

This was once a full service hotel, but since it's "condotel" conversion a few years back, it has steadily shed all but the barest of amenities. No room service. No bar. Crappy little TVs with fuzzy picture in the rooms. Noisy air conditioners. The computers in the "business center" don't work. About the only thing this hotel has going for it is its location, right across from the Ala Moana Shopping Center. Avoid the "Plantation Cafe" on the ground floor.

We've stayed here many times (we live on a neighbor island) and chose it this time so we could skip a car rental (parking at the hotel is expensive and rentals were exorbitent). This location is perfect for shopping, and that was our main purpose this trip. We got kamaaina (resident) rates but upgraded so we would have two beds, not a bed and sofabed. But the beds were really really small, as was the room itself. We didn't have enough shampoo for three...it would be nice to have conditioner...skimpy on towels. One drawback here is the lack of choice for breakfast. One of our family members can't do much walking and we didn't have a car (plus parking is very hard to find), so we were stuck with the hotel cafe. Not very good food, expensive, but very nice server.Biggest complaint: the lobby bathroom (women's) smelled bad and the smell pervaded about half the lobby. Not pleasant and not what I'd expect at the Ala Moana.

Arrived about 8.30 am. Caught the Robert Hawaii bus (which is just so easy with no booking,) for $9 each way, or pay $15 for return trip.We book for 2 nights in the hotel. No early check- in, but were able to leave it with the bell hop service. Went out across the side street, to catch the pink trolley at the Ala Moana shopping centre,( facing the seaside) only $2 per person for 1 round trip, they stops at all the main shopping centers in Waikiki. So had a fair good view and ideas of where to and what to do later. Long line for checking in about 3.30 pm. We had the Kona city/ mountain view room, 11th floor. Room size were ok, double bed and a sofa. A flat screen TV. Clean bathroom.Quick room service, when complained about the roomsafe not working. I would come back to stay again. As it very convenience.

I stayed at this place over the Xmas Holidays with some friends.This hotel is 5-7 mins drive to the Wakiki area. ($8-10 cab ride). In a kinda shady area of town. this hotel is literally next to the shopping mall but however there is some strip clubs and a run down karaoke bar on the other side of the street. From the outside and hotel lobby it looks nice but the rooms is a different story.We ended up in a room with a king size bed and a sofa on the 34th floor facing the mountains . we requested the beach view but none were available. the view is nice but it feels your getting a view San Francisco rather than a beach city. I recommend you take a mid level floor facoing the beach because ON the top floor you are hearing the hotel's CENTRAL AC running all day and night. VERY NOISY!!my friend ened up sleeping on the sofa bed., as He was pulling out the bed he noticed a EARWIG or COCKROACH coming out of it. housekeeping does a bad job cleaning the place. In the drawers we found the previous occupants Clothing , baby diapers and PERSONAL LUBE...... I repeat PERSONAL LUBE!! very disgusting!! the room does not have a fiull kitchen only a fridge and microwave.This hotel caters mainly to Japanese tourist. I rarely saw some americans at this hotel. the hotel's parking lot is always full and charges 15$ per night. i had to make 3 circlesaround the lot to find a spot.Club Rumours sucks as you find mainly crusty middle age cougars at this club. i would recommend staying at one of the hotels on the Waikiki strip instead.
Staff and facilities met our expectations. It was awesome

This is the one and ONLY hotel we stay at when we visit Oahu. We take weekend trips there every 3 months or so and the value is perfect! Clean, convenient, and great service all the time. This time, the only part we didn't like was the woman at the "Bell Hop" desk. She gave no "Hello" or eye contact and was pretty rude. All we wanted was to leave our luggage there for about an hour while we did some Ala Moana shopping (our flight was at 7 pm but check out is at noon). Other than that, we had a great trip and a great stay there!
Great hotel, centrally located, rooms in Kona Tower good size. Front desk staff very friendly and helpful.I will stay again.
Hotel is upscale but not resort quality. Very freindly staff with quick response to needs. Right next to Ala Moana shopping center.
I always stay at the Ala Moana because of the location to shopping, beach and other areas. The hotel is clean, nice, well run and the employees are very helpfull.

The outside of the hotel is nice and the loby and reception area is very sleek and nice... unfortunatley, the rooms didnt measure up. I am traveling with three other girls and getting ready is a nightmare. First of all, there was like one mirror in the room besides the one in the bathroom and it is located it the most inconvenient place, right by the door in this tiny littl space, not to helpful when everyone needs a mirror at the same time. Second, they have the smallest tv iv'e ever seen in a hotel room, and its located in the corner so its hard so see when your in bed.Third, the beds arent the best and the pillows are so fat that I woke up with a headache. Also, only one elevator worked on the second floor and there was a huge group waiting to go too there rooms. It took us 15 minutes to get from the lobby to floor 13! One thing that is nice is that the hotel is super close to the mall so thats awesome. They have a nice food court there so you can do all your eating in one place...except on thanksgiving apperently. So other than that mall, there is really no place to eat...and that sucks if you have no car. We never did find a place to get some quick food so we went to bed hungry. :) Other than that the hotel is so so, and the staff is ok. But, I would not go back.
Rooms are small, restaurants are rubbish, pool area is boring, front desk staff are hopeless, miles away fromthe beach - but - good value and close to mall.

Nicely conenient to the mall but a bit of a hike to the beach. Staff very friendly and accomodating but room was small and tub and sink had several hairs when I arrived. Most restaurants closed and no bar at the pool but pool area was nice. Very good fitness centre.
Very good experience in 5 night stay. Good location beside a mall. Clean bed and room. If renting a car, it is convinient to shopping, beach, ....

A friend/colleague of mine and I went to Oahu on an overnight trip for a workshop we were attending. The hotel we normally stay at (Hawaii Prince Hotel) was sold out and so we chose to stay at the Ala Moana because of their $99 per night special. The location was great for us because we did want to do some shopping at the Ala Moana Shopping Center after our workshops. However, upon check-in (which was a rather late 4pm), our room was not ready and the front office agent refused to upgrade us to another category, so after some deliberation with another agent, they found us a room they thought was suitable for the rate we were paying. We got to the room and was shocked at how tiny the room was. There was barely any room to walk between the desk and the bed. The TV was kinda mounted up and was also very tiny. My friend and I were not planning on sleeping together and the room had only one bed and a sofa bed, so we had housekeeping come up and make up the sofa bed for us. Once the sofa bed was opened up, there was practically zero room to move around in that room. The air conditioner was the old fashioned kind (not central air) and I guess they keep it turned off while no one is occupying the room, so the room was hot and stale smelling when we first arrived and when we turned it on, it was a bit on the noisy side. The trash can in the room is so tiny that we filled it up within the first half hour we were there and I guess some of the other guests felt the same because we saw small bags of trash in the hallways outside people's rooms. We also found a headband in the room that did not belong to either of us, so I don't think the room was thoroughly cleaned. I have worked in the hotel/resort industry for quite some time and I have to say that I was not impressed by this hotel at all, in fact, I am surprised that they are considered a three and half star hotel. One thing I did like though was the fact that there are microwaves in the rooms. One thing is for sure though, I highly doubt we will stay at this hotel again. Oh, and I almost forgot, parking was expensive too.

My family and I travel to Oahu several times a year and we like to stay at the Ala Moana Hotel for several reasons. The hotel employees (front desk, housekeeping, valet, etc.) are the greatest. They take care of us kamaaina's! The location is convenient because it's next to the shopping center and there are a lot of eateries nearby. The one big complaint we have are the saggy beds. This last visit in November sent us both back home with aching backs. My wife ended up having to see the chiropractor.

Only 1 restaurant in hotel. No lounge or bar at the pool.Had to take taxi to eateries and Waikiki. Beach wa a good walk across main thoroughfare.Hotel was clean and employees very accomodating. Beach room had nice view. Would not stay again on next trip.

We spent one night at this hotel on a long layover on our way home from our wedding trip. We arrived at the hotel at 6.30am and were lucky enough to be given access to our room right away. The room was on the small side, but was more than adequate for us. We spent some time lying out on the pool deck, where there are plenty of sunbeds. The pool is small, but its all you need to cool off after laying out for a while. The hotel is connected to the shopping centre which was good for shopping at restaurants too. There are bus stops within a couple of minutes walk from the hotel. Its about a 30 minute walk to the heart of Waikiki if you don’t want to take the bus. The hotel stored our bags for us after our checkout time and we were given use of a room to shower before we headed to the airport. It was just a regular room which we were given access to for 30 minutes. Great after being by the pool all day soaking up the last of the hot sun! I would recommend this hotel and would stay there again, but not for an extended stay.

I had a partial ocean view room in the Kona tower. The lobby and the rooms had been renovated with spa-like blue paint and brushed metal fixtures. Unfortunately, I didn't realize when the room description said "one bed" the one bed in the room would be a double rather than a queen or a king sized bed. I was disappointed, but I couldn't argue with the price. It was a good location close to Waikiki without being in Waikiki. Plenty of restaurant options in the mall.

This is an OK hotel, but from my experience, there are better choices in Honolulu. I booked a room because I was attending a conference at the convention center just down the street. The room was clean, but the price was high, room was small, TV had a very small screen and the remote worked intermittently. We had free internet in the room, but when I needed to print out my boarding passes, I had to use the business center computer at $.30 per minute and $1.00 per page printed. Even then it didn't work. There was a big note saying printing might be slow, but after waiting 10 minutes, the boarding passes still hadn't printed. That is totally ridiculous. Overall, the atmosphere at the hotel was dismal and the staff was unresponsive and unhelpful. I got the feeling everyone was doing only what was absolutely essential and nothing more. We had stayed at another hotel for the first 4 days of the trip with a bigger room, smaller price tag, and helpful, friendly, smiling staff. I would go back there again, but probably not to the Ala Moana.

This is our third time on the island but first time at this property. This hotel is a nice hotel, very close (walking distance) to the convention center and right next door to the huge shopping center Ala Moana Shopping center. The hotel has two towers. It is imperative to stay in the newer one which is the Wakiki Tower. The rooms in this tower are very modern and had all amenities including a wet bar with fridge, sink, coffee maker, etc. We paid for an ocean view but I have to say the property is about two blocks from the beach and while ocean view was nice it was not necessary. The Ala Moana Beach Park is huge and is a beautiful beach but is a a few blocks. Nice pool area and gym. Steam room not great but sauna nice. What we did enjoy was the close proximity to the many restaurants and shops located in the shopping center. Plus parking the rental car in the shopping center parking lot rather than paying for the valet was well worth the savings. While we would not stay here if staying for an extended period of time, it was perfect for its proximity to convention center and shopping.

I stayed here for a conference. Rooms were good and clean.My issue was with the front-desk service. I had issues with my Internet connection. Being as this was a work conference (Ala Moana advertises itself as a conference hotel), having Internet was essential. I went to the front desk to ask them for help, and they were indifferent and unhelpful. They told me to use the internet in the lobby (costing me $10 / day extra and the inconvenience!!) Then they said to call the technical number upstairs. I went back upstairs -- no technical phone # to be found, and front desk had the # all along. Overall, I found their attitude indifferent and unhelpful. I travel a lot, and have had internet issues before, it's always been handled promptly and politely. I don't think I was an isolated incidence, the line at the front desk was long and it seemed that people were having issues rather than checking in/out. Other work colleagues paid cheaper and said their internet access was fine.The room and location for a conference was good though. You're not next to the beaches.

This hotel is definitely dated and needs a remodel. The rooms in the Kona Tower are quite small but they are clean. The hotel location is ideal next to Ala Moana Center and Beach Park; however, parking is expensive. It is a good alternative to the expensive hotels in Waikiki. However, be aware that the walls are thin and you will hear your neighbors. Lastly, there is free high speed internet in the rooms but it is not wireless.

Stayed for a weekend night, with great kamaaina rates. Definitely one of the better hotels in honolulu, and the location has name recognition. The hotel was recently updated, with modern furnishings. No drippy AC units or rusty faucets here!

The rooms were nice but very few (if any) creature comforts. For some reason, the small televisions did not work well and the volume was non-adjustable? There was no room service, nor was there a mini bar (with snacks) in the room.The only restaurant was Japaneese, good but not 5 nights in a row, and the bar and B-fast area had VERY limited hours!Also, there is almost ZERO restaurants within walking distance to the hotel, except for a mall with "mall food" next door.The beach is also quite a hike so I recommend just staying in Waikiki since that is where everything seems to be..The one positive is that The Ala Moana is very close to the convention center but I have never been to a city where your only lunch options during a convention is the 7-11 or the Hard Rock cafe.

If we hadn't have gotten our hotel for free through the World for $1 promotion, my review probably would've slightly slanted more to the negative.If you're in search of a hotel, this is one of many. The parking is expensive. The hotel lobby gets kind of loud on the weekend in the evenings. They have a nightclub called Rumors where the cops are called pretty frequently. The hotel's location is very convenient to the mall which is a quick walk to for breakfast. And I'd either get a breakfast add-on to your stay or do a walk over to the mall because the store inside the hotel is a little outrageous with their prices, too. Walmart is a quick 2-minute drive from the hotel. We walked to Ala Moana Park with a great beach for the youngsters. The water was very warm and calm. My 3-year old son had an allergy (very unusual) to the detergent used to clean the sheets. He got hives which we remedied with a visit to urgent care and a call to housekeeping.
